review_body: This is a fine, modern, luxury hotel in a location that offers panoramic views and easy access to major attractions in Athens. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the housekeeping services are absolutely outstanding (we never had to ask for towels!), the Wi-Fi is fast, and the food and service in the restaurants is excellent (we had at least breakfast, lunch, and dinner on the property).Now for the caveats. First, the website makes it appear as though the Acropolis is closer than it actually is, so the view isn't quite as stunning as you might think. Second, the rooftop pool area is rather small, and therefore inadequate for a hotel of this size. Good luck finding a spot--I wound up reading my book seated at a hightop table (not comfortable). Third, everything is incredibly expensive. We needed to grab a quick lunch at the "casual" restaurant off the lobby due to our schedule, and it cost about $100 for a burger, a grilled chicken sandwich, and a salad. That's among the more expensive lunches we've ever had. I'm sure we'd pay the same at the Ritz Carlton in New York, but yikes! Similarly, think twice before grabbing a bottled water from the mini-bar in your room. Also, our visit was during a summer heatwave in Athens, and I was surprised that the hotel experienced regular blackouts during our stay. This is not entirely in the hotel's control of course, though I would have expected a facility of this size and quality to have backup generators that would supply uninterrupted power. At one point we lost power for so long that the water stopped working in our room, and since the elevators were not operational we wound up having to walk down eight flights of stairs to get on with our activities. I also found that our rooms was not particularly quiet; despite being on the eighth floor I could hear sirens and cars horns from the streets below well into the night.All that being said, this is a quality hotel, and I would certainly consider staying here again when I return to Athens. Some of the caveats above are simply par for the course in a metropolitan hotel; I mention them purely in the interest of full disclosure.

review_body: Stayed here one night when in town on business. It's a nice, full service hotel with all you'd expect of a five-star joint. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms were large, clean and comfortable. The air conditioning was nice and cold! Facilities were good, and I had most of what I needed in the room. The bathroom was also large and clean. I noticed that my toilet wasn't fixed to the floor properly, which was a bit of a worry, but otherwise all was fine. Breakfast was okay too.The only issue I had with the hotel itself was that the lifts were quite slow and small, and the hotel location is a bit outside the main area of town. It's a good 20--30 min walk to town, including a walk along a busy highway. It is a quick taxi ride back though, about 10 EUR, so not too bad. This is compensated by a great rooftop bar, where you'll get views of the Acropolis, so that's pretty nice!Not a bad spot!

review_body: When we were looking for a place for wedding party in last December we had had only one thing on our minds: to offer unforgettable quality moments to our guests -family and friends- who would come and celebrate with us our unique moment. We couldn't afford to give a fortune but we didn't want to choose a cheap place just to minimize the cost and maximize our profit from collected gifts.With this in mind we saw many hotels. We had looked premises near the city because we cared about the guest's convenience and safety: it's stupid to expect from people to have fun and drink on the one hand and to drive back safely long distances on the other hand.Divani Caravel's qualified person -Giota- was very friendly and helpful from the first time. We called her and arranged a meeting at the venue, on the last floor. You should visit this place, it has a unique view of all the town,including Acropolis and Hymettus.We had discussed with Giota about our needs, about the place, music, number of guest, menu etc. We finally were excited. We agreed and at the They were very understandable all the time. In the second meeting we clarified all the details abut the event.On the day of the wedding party everything was perfect. They showed professionalism and great experience. Decoration was as agreed, everything clean, personnel was friendly and polite during the night.Maitre d'hotel -great man and professional- came to our room (free offer from Hotel to wedding couple) and introduce us to the hall, and helped us cutting the wedding cake. After that, the party began!Positive:- Location. No guest will get tired or in danger with long distances.- unbelievable in quality and variety of the food and sweets: our guests loved it and hotel had left it available all the time of the party! It's a five star restaurant offering unforgettable taste combinations. Try it. Moreover their wine is really good!- Shocking view of Athens and Acropolis lighted.- Polite and professional personnel, even when they were tired after hours of service.- Free suite for the night after the wedding as a gift form the hotel- Everything as agreed. (This is the most important from my point of view. They did everything as they had promised, which is quite rare in wedding party's industry)Negative:- I would prefer a bit larger area and dance floor. But nothing important. In conclusion: If you're looking for a place for quality and unforgettable wedding party, Divani Caravel is your place. It will may cost you more than other places but i guarantee that the difference is really HUGE!This review is a bit late (wedding was late in December) but 100% honest and fair for the hotel. Every time me, my wife or a friend of us are thinking the night of wedding party we bring back nice thoughts and great feelings. Many of them exist because of the hotel's unique services. And this is priceless....

review_body: Interestingly enough that manager responses to average and negative reviews universally start with “we never had such a complain before...”It’s rather concerning.Hotel is old and outdated (70-th-80th), hallways are smelly (likely because they mixing smoking and non-smoking rooms on the same floor), staff seems very busy and distant. Room was very clean, equipped with everything you might need.Nice bedding. Good view of the city.We where given a smoking room (honest mistake frankly) but front clerk didn’t even apologized, she made a “surprise” impression, and immediately tried to remind my wife that she made a reservation for one person instead of two (there is no difference in price).Weird.Overall, make a 3-star impression.I wouldn’t stay in this place again.

review_body: Caravel is one of the three Divani hotels in Athens and the one I enjoy the most as it offers modern rooms in a quite edge of Athens centre for a reasonable price for its upscale category.The rooms are large and well equipped, the service very very freindly and efficient, conference facilities and cafe and dining options are also satisfactory.The central Athens airport is just 30 mins by taxi, the nearest metro station ("Evangelismos") is 10 mins walk away though.There planty of nice cafes, tavernas and even gourmet restaurant very close by.I would also recommend a visit to the Byzantine museum of Athens and Benaki museum (see separate reviews) - that are just 8-10 mins walk from this hotel.

review_body: Actually our findings were better than average, however there wasn’t a section for ‘good’. The hotel itself is very nice and opulent in many ways. The room is clean, bright and well appointed. The breakfast is well provided for, fresh and the service attentive. The pool is lovely and actually a nice escape from the city below with outstanding views.So overall, quite good- only negatives for us would be the location, really not central enough from the quality restaurants and action. You need a taxi each time you want to go out. The drinks by the pool are overly expensive - 28 e for two drinks, however I guess that view must come at a cost. The music was repetitive and boring if you were there too long. Being such a busy hotel, providing for conferences, it was disappointing to see people’s used food dishes etc sit outside in the corridors for over 24 hours. Lastly I was surprised that I couldn’t access an iron for my clothes, I would have thought this was pretty standard at this level of hotel. So overall, quite nice, just some minor areas that could be improved.

review_body: We arrived very tired at 10 am after flying all night from Toronto on Transat and were happy to find out that our room was ready and we could freshen up before we ventured out. That made all the difference in our day as tired travelers. The staff was very polite and welcoming. Our room was a standard room, very clean and comfortable. Although we could have taken the shuttle or a bus to the tourist areas we used cabs to save time. It was only a 5 euro cab ride to Syntagma Square which we thought was very reasonable.After a tiring day (up for 30 hours!) we had dinner at the rooftop bar to enjoy the view of the Acropolis. The food was very good, reasonably priced for a hotel and the service was prompt and friendly. Breakfast which was included was the very best out of all of our two week stay in Greece-Mykonos and Santorini.I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Athens.

review_body: We stayed at a great little boutique hotel, Estia Boutique, for three days and then at Divani Caravel, a so-called "world class, five-star" hotel for two days. While we sat in the lobby of Divani Caravel for four hours waiting for our room to be assigned (a whole other terrible experience in itself) we watched the two women at the front reception desk (older blonde and older redhead) abuse customer after customer, in two cases actually shouting at the people. It was clear that they felt that they needed to "put customers in their place" right from the start. If you get through them successfully, what you will find is a massive hotel which is based on huge numbers of customers, not customer service. If you like huge, anonymous, "business hotels", Divani Caravel is probably as good as the others, other than the receptionists (we have never experienced anything like them anywhere we have ever been). But we know where we would go--no competition--we would pick Estia Boutique one hundred times out of one hundred.

review_body: This hotel was booked for us after an unexpected hospital stay (my Mum) meant we had to stay in Athens and close to the hospital. I cannot rate it highly enough. We were upgraded to a suite, which has made my Mum's recuperation so much easier, the room is well equipped with a large balcony, Illy coffee machine, good wardrobe space, comfortable chairs and beds, sofa, dining table. We could not have asked for more. The staff were very understanding of our situation. We've had room service which was delicious, and served to make you feel special. There are good restaurants nearby, and a supermarket within walking distance. It feels a safe area with lots of tree lined streets, and for us the big bonus within walking distance of Evangelismos hospital. Pool area is lovely, clean, nice bar area, iced water provided. Didnt try the gym or spa.

review_body: This is about my third and last stay at this place. The typical hotel of a dated era, where the rooms don’t match the nice lobby. There are a couple of things that really bother me. If not for those it might be worthy another point for a middle of the road, one night stand. The good..Nice rooftop pool and view. Convenient area with plenty of eateries and shopping nearby. The not so goodMold in the air conditioners. You can smell it, see it and feel it. (See attached pictures below) Management doesn’t seem to think it’s important to fix this. If you care about your health, skip reading any further and check out another hotel option. Not the best at housekeeping; re-used pillow covers and the occasional Unchanged sheets. Yes I have a black light And goggles I carry with me. With that also a good sniffer. There is always a difference in the smell and feel of washed, bleached sheets and used ones. Dirty sheets don’t feel as stiff and smell like B.O. Dirty bottom of mini fridge. It’s the details that reveal just how well kept a room is, and how thorough rooms are serviced. Here the main objective seems to be turning the room over to the next guest. Paneling and oak/veneer everywhere. No carpet, which is a plus but defeats the purpose of hygiene when you have to inhale moldy air particles. Non secure WiFi. Low pressure showers. Very slippery tile (when wet) I can overlook everything except for cleanliness and moldy air conditioners.... and no, it’s not just a single event. I’ve experienced this, during every stay. There is a restaurant in the lobby area, which I decided not to visit. If there are hygiene issues in one area, You’ve lost my trust to ingest anything here. Safe travels

review_body: We stayed here over Easter weekend, before the rooftop bar and spa were open. The view over Athens and the Parthenon is spectacular; it would be nice to stay when all was working. Nonetheless, the staff was always friendly and helpful. They treated us to a special Easter basket!Our room was spacious, comfortable, and beautifully decorated. Our only complaint was the door lock, a bit tricky to use, and the high step-in tub/shower. Breakfast was delicious (fabulous fresh fruit, yoghurt, and orange juice; good eggs) but a challenge to figure out where to find things.The decor overall is outstanding: do look for the quill "painting" in the lobby and fresh flowers on most tables. The location is terrific for walking or getting to sights (they run a shuttle to Syntagma square) or easy 5 euro taxi ride.

This was quite a high step and might prove difficult for people with mobility problems. The shower wasn't brilliant with little pressure and the hot water took ages to come through.The breakfast had plenty of choice and was presented and cooked well.

review_body: To be fair, I have stayed at Divani Caravel several times and it used to be one of my favourite options in the past, both for business as well as for leisure. We have even had one of our conferences there some time ago. Overall it has been my first option in the area over the past 5 years.The reception staff is always very attentive and polite. In many cases they would upgrade my room to a nicer one at the same price. This has always been appreciated. Their breakfast is very good and I appreciate the fact that their gym facilities are now free of charge and quite good, compared to the past when one had to pay an extra fee for using them. The room service is excellent and always timely.Again: to be fair I have to say that my last stay to Divani Caravel was canceled due to family illness, so this review is not about "my stay", but my overall experience + my experience while dealing with this cancelation. While the booking I have made was non-refundable, and I totally understand the risks and what it means as I have traveling quite extensively and at least once per month over the past 10 years due to my job, the Divani Caravel reservations office was completely rigid and strict with their policy. It is very understandable that a very last-minute cancelation may damage the hotel, but a 1-week notice may not be that disastrous! Especially for a 5-star hotel like Divani Caravel in the center of Athens!Hence, the reservation staff should be completely ashamed of the way they handle these cases! To be fair to other hotels both in Athens but elsewhere that handle such cases in a much more professional and understanding manner, I cannot give this hotel more than a single star rating this time.But to recap: this is an excellent hotel to stay! But please pray that nothing will happen to you even a week in advance while having taken a non-refundable deal. Then be prepared to pay for it! Otherwise, I would recommend considering alternative hotels in the neighbourhood that are more understanding of such situations! Which is what I am planning to do for now on as well as all the employees in my organisation.

review_body: I was staying in the Divani Caravel hotel on business in November. I ate twice in the Ju Ju Bar Restaurant. I can say with conviction it is the best hotel restaurant i have eaten in in quite some time. I was looked after by George Apostolides, Maitre D, and his attentive staff. Chef Savvas Lihanidis served me up a fabulous meal. I enjoyed a basket of freshly baked greek bread served with butter flaked with gold.... yes this told me a superb dining experience was in store. I enjoyed a fabulous crab with chilli and truffle oil starter, the flavours were simply sublime, complimenting each other. I enjoyed a deliciously medium cooked signature house burger for my mains with an accompaniment of freshly made salted crisps as we call them here in ireland. George a knowlegeable Maitre D recommended a lovely wine to accompany the meal. all in all, if you are in Athens and have cause to stay in this fabulous hotel, I can recommend enjoying a meal and service in the Ju Ju bar and restaurant. Thanks George and team. John

review_body: The Divani Caravel is a fine hotel for those looking to explore the city a bit.Location: It's located in a nicer, upscale part of town, but it's not really walking distance to the historic parts. While you can see the Acropolis from the rooftop pool, it's still about an hour walk to the Acropolis from the hotel, or around 20 minutes by taxi. There are several good restaurants nearby, but you will want to head west a bit toward the city center to explore better options.Rooms: The rooms are fine, about what I expect from an international Marriott-type hotel. Nothing exceptional, but nothing horrific to write about here, either.Pool: It's not very large, and on nice days expect it to get crowded up there. Seats can be at a premium. There's also a rooftop bar, but like all food and drink options in a hotel, it's quite overpriced for what you get.Food: The breakfast option is plentiful and has options for most dietary types. Much like the rooms, it was comparable to what you'd find in an international Marriott. I did not eat at the restaurant for dinner as there are several fine options within walking distance of the hotel.

review_body: I had hesitated to try gain this hotel. I was there before 2000 and remained with some images of an old fashion hotel. The surprise was complete. Renovated, clean and a real 5 star. Plus the location which is perfect for a city break or more. Plus the services. Not to forget the wifi working well beyond expectation. And the good breakfast, my personal test for all hotels.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The major reason that I have made a review is that I was extremely well looked after by the Reception staff, in particular, Aggeliki ("Angela"). I was running the Athens marathon during my stay and she provided me with flexibility on my room and checkout arrangements. Without her making efforts to see that I had my room available when I finished running, I would have had timing issues in getting back to the airport - so, BIG THANKS to her - and other reception staff for their kindness and professionalism .Room lovely and clean, great location close to all amenities .Even one of the Porters helped me to my transfer (car) when i left, joked about my sore (running) legs and said "see you for next year's marathon" - he was a top man !
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks in August. Located just a few minutes from the main downtown area,on a bus route,it was very convenient-only about 4 euros by cab to the best shopping in Central Athens.The staff was very friendly and efficient-even helped us with our planned excursions by contacting tour companies and arranging transportation. Our room was immaculate with daily maid service and fresh linens whenever we wanted.For us, the absolute highlight was the rooftop pool. After a long, hot day as busy tourists, it was a real treat to go up to the pool to relax and be able to see the Acropolis in the distance!
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was just fine. So pricey but basic amenities not available. E.g.: they don't have an electric kettle, they don't have an iron (you need to pay to get your shirt ironed), they don't even have a comb!! Can you believe that!! Even on requesting, they said they don't have these. Not expected out of such a huge hotel.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good clean hotel in a very good area of Athen, close to restaurant, parks and local attractions. Good views of the Acropolis from the rooftop swimming pool and lounge. The service is very good although our stayed was short we enjoyed the hospitality
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights before a cruise. Anticipated a very nice hotel based upon reviews. Our experience was (except for very nice food at breakfast) that the hotel was a typical 3 star European hotel with small rooms, a difficult shower, and overrun with tour groups. Breakfast service with other tour groups (much bigger than ours) was a nightmare! the facilities reminded me of a 1980s' Holiday Inn.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are spacious. There is coffee and tea in the rooms. The breakfast has fresh food such as fruits and vegetables. The view is nothing to write home about. The staff is congenial. For the price it was really good.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were delighted to find such a lovely hotel with wonderful services. Swimming in the rooftop pool, I felt the life of luxury while admiring the sights of Athen's landmarks - the Acropolis, Mount Lycabettus, and Philopappos Hill.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a nice stay at this hotel. It has a lovely pool on the roof with a roof bar and has fab views across Athens to the Acropolis. There are some restaurants just a walk around the corner from the hotel, the old town is around a 30 minute walk. The breakfast was nice with a good selection of options and the staff were very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at this hotel Beds very comfortableStaff was always very helpfulDecor of the hotel was very niceThe hotel is located in a very good area which is very safe and close to everything.
hotelName:
0    Divani Caravel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 30 min walk from the monastaraky square. The hotel offer free garage (very tight and hard to park there, but still not impossible). Nice breakfast and ok standard in the room. Meet the price expectation
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in the beginning of our Greece vacation The rooms are fairly large and beds firm and large. It is clean and has nice bathrooms. We asked for a room high up in the hotel and got the top floor/ 7th so it was fairly quiet, not much street noise. The staff is very helpful and accommodating and the breakfast is good, but not included in the room price. The hotel is located in an area that is in poor condition and houses many refugees. We did not have any problems at all but you need to be a bit street smart and choose what route you take. We did walk around a lot, into the city center takes 25-30 minutes and that is OKSuggest that you don’t walk around on your own after dark, take a taxi, it is cheap
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 nights at the Centrotel in Athens in June 2019. Overall, it was a very positive experience and I would highly recommend the hotel to other travelers.The positives:-Communication with the hotel prior to my arrival had been very positive-The airport pick up was smooth-Upon arrival I received a free upgrade to a bigger room-I dealt with 3 different people at reception over my stay and my experience with all 3 was very positive. They were all helpful, courteous and knowledgeable. They all spoke excellent English-Breakfast was included in my package. Breakfast wasn't amazing but it was good enough. There was not that much variety but what was there, was good.-The hotel is located in between Larissa and Victoria stations which is very convenient. It's about a 30 minute walk to Acropolis from the hotel if you don't want to take public transportThe negatives:-The room was functional and good. The bathroom and shower were excellent. I only found the bed a bit too hard and low-Other reviewers already mentioned the area the hotel is in. There are definitely some shady characters around the area, especially at night. They never bothered me but I can definitely imagine that the area wouldn't be for everyone, e.g. a single, female traveler.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: BEST experience in Athens & very reasonable! Staff was outstanding esp Fani at Reception. stayed there more than a month, enjoying amazing service & helpful care. couldn't recommend more warmly!! THANK YOU to all at Centrotel. i wish all my experiences were so wonderful!! ... a traveller from Canada
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my wife for 4 nights while sightseeing in Athens. Pleasantly surprised with the quality of the rooms, and communal areas; restaurant and lounge. Staff were particularly helpful. The area whilst convenient for two metro stations; Larissa and Victoria, is a little run down. However would stay again if in Athens.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great city break in Athens based here. Room was clean and spacious, friendly and helpful reception staff. Breakfast had a good selection and worth the extra cost.Very easy to get into central Athens. We preferred to turn left out of the hotel to get to the metro (Larissa station - red line 4 stops to Syntagma square/ 5 stops to Akropolis) as it was much less busy and more pleasant - although the Victoria stop is slightly closer (turn right) it was jam packed and definitely felt more focussed on watching belongings etc. Felt safe walking to and from the metro and surrounding area. Good bakery on same street (turn left and opposite) with lots of tempting cakes to choose from. We usually came back after exploring in the day to change and get the metro back for an evening meal - easy to buy tickets with different amounts of journeys on them (2, 5? Etc). Loved Athens and would stay again.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so nice, so affordable, and in a great location. The staff are so friendly and helpful, and want you to feel at home. We stayed in a double room, and it was very clean and comfortable. We loved the balcony, which had a beautiful view of the area. Also, our room had a really nice bathtub with jets which was very relaxing. The room was spacious with good storage, and was always clean.The breakfast was not included, and it was acceptable though not our favorite. It had a good selection of food, and cost 7.5 euros. But there is so much great affordable food in the city so it’s not necessary. The area is not in the tourist center so restaurants and bars are super cheap and it is also very easy to walk or take a train into the center - about a 20 minute walk. We highly recommend this hotel, and if we come back to Athens we will stay here again. Also a special thank you to Fanny for her great help at the front desk!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel and a great price for when we visited. Our 4th floor bedroom was spotlessly clean, had a balcony with table and chairs and the staff were friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was great, with cereals, yoghurt, honey, eggs and bacon, croissants, pastries etc. We were very impressed and would recommend. We ariv at 22.00 but walked out to nearby Victoria Sq for supper.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay and pretty cheap.people there are very kind and they tell you all you must know about the city.go there. don't esitate. and more you have a super position.very close to Acropoly and the best place in the city to eat, and discover the unknow part of Athens, with graffity and people all around.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just made true one of my youth dreams and visited Athens, World's Capital of Culture. I spent my sejour at Centrotel. This hotel is well positioned, 5 minutes from Viktoria underground station. Breakfast is basic, the room is excellent(though the matress wad hard) and the staff is very helpfull and diligent. Absolutely worth the price(200 euros for six nights!)
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice, clean and cosy hotel in the centre of Athens close to st. Larisis metro and Atticis station makes getting around very easy .Friendly staff, nice comfy room with free parking and wifi A lot of coffee shops, super markets and a few tavernas near by.Also close to main roads to get in and out of the city We highly recommend it Great value for the money !!!!!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Centrotel for two nights in early October. We were on our honeymoon and the hotel upgraded our room at no extra charge. The room was great and very clean. Nice bathrooms. As other reviewers have said the area is maybe not the best, but its within walking distance to the Acropolis and ultimately we never felt unsafe walking around even later into the evening.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The standard of the hotel furnishings was high. The room was very spacious and of very good standard. The staff were very personal and helpful. Simella, in particular was lovely. The breakfast was of good standard and ample. Location is a 5 minute walk to metro and few stops from the centre of town. The possible negative is the local area which is residential has quite a few obvious social issues. I felt safe though. The hotel was excellent value for around $100 aud in September.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a week in this lovely hotel & it was a joy. The staff on reception were unfailingly pleasant and helpful, as was the lovely lady who ran the very efficient breakfast room each morning. We were given a spacious room with a comfortable bed, fridge, safe & coffee table. The bathroom was large & beautifully tiled & there was a whirlpool bath which was a delight after a day in the sun exploring the fabulous but dusty archeological sites. The room had a generous sized balcony furnished with 2 chairs & a table & overlooking a residential street. Ok, the location is not the best part of Athens, being a 10 minute walk from Victoria Metro station. It has a large immigrant population & is obviously a poor area but never once did we feel unsafe or threatened, unlike on the Metro when we were actually pickpocketed. (We would recommend using Larrissa Metro station where possible as opposed to Victoria when staying at the Centrotel as it was quieter & therefore less of a magnet for thieves.) Breakfast was good with omelettes & bacon, fresh orange juice, hams & cheeses, yoghurt, honey, fresh bread etc. We were disappointed not to have tea making facilities in our room but within 10 minutes of asking at reception a kettle was brought up free of charge. It really was excellent service. The room was immaculately clean as was every area of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this very reasonably priced 2☆ hotel to anyone visiting Athens. I would have been just as impressed if it had been graded a 4☆.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We used this hotel as a place to lay our heads for the night before the ferry the following morning. We came here relatively late at night from the airport (blue line, change at Monastiraki for the green line to Victoria). Area was okay - I mean it's not Monastiraki, but it's okay for a night to stick you head down! Yes, lot's of refugees etc. nearby, but like anywhere, be street-wise. No problems - seriously.Hotel staff were nice and friendly. Room was okay for the money (£50). Bed was a little stiff, but hey hum.All in all - happy! Oh - it's a walk from the main Athens rail station as well to Corinth. Also on the same line to go to Piraeus for ferries.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quiet, rooms are nicely appointed (and A/C), George at the front desk was super helpful with questions about restaurants & nightlife, and the location is great - in 5 minutes you can walk to both the main railway station and the Victoria metro station, around which there's a number of local/non-touristy places to eat. I imagine staying around Monastiraki might be marginally more convenient, but it only takes about 15 minutes total (walking + metro) to get there from Centrotel, and the accommodations are very comfortable. Service was first-rate and the breakfast buffet (extra charge) was solid.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good customer service, especially the Gentleman working there deserve an applause. Everything we asked was provided in a very friendly and quick manner. Compliments to this place and the people working there. About the location in the beginning it looked a bit intimidating because of the men on the streets, however it is safe during the day or night. And the graffiti is all over Athens not only in that area. Public transportation is near by quit good communication even to the airport.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with wife and children. What an amazing place. Staff are so helpful. Made our stay wonderful. Rooms are so clean and comfortable. Food is excellent. Just the loveliest place to stay. Would recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good things about this hotel is it is super close to the train station, we took the train at all hours of the day and night and where safe walking to and from each time. We got fantastic room service, we actually didn’t realize how much we where ordering (the sandwich comes with fries). They took a bit long it would have been faster to go out and eat but we where so tired. The staff are super friendly!Bad things- uncomfortable bed, they are a bit stiff. We thought all rooms come with a Balcony and tub but they are a bit extra, we where a bit disappointed about that.The power went out so we had to take the stairs up and then realized there was so air conditioning when it went out, took a few hours to come back on. After that, the power seem to come and go randomly which was kinda weird but it would work after.If I where to visit Athens again I would stay at this hotel but a room with a balcony and tub.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a pleasing week at this hotel, the building is nice and new, staff is polite and friendly, very professional. They gave us a big double room with balcony, a super spatious bathroom with bathtube, AC and all comforts. Accurate daily cleanings. Comfortable bed and simple but nice room decor (the little lights on the roof were so nice and romantic). The reception is open also at night and the nearby area is not noisy at all so we slept very well. The area around is not the coolest or more elegant and is quite crowded at night, but we felt safe all the time and honestly we liked the location: a bit outside the turistic area, but 1-2 minutes walking from the Victoria metro station (2 stops and you are in the heart of Athens); taxis are also availble if you prefer. We choose the option without breakfast so we cannot give our opinion on that. The price was more than onest for the service we received. We surely recommend to stay here while in Athens!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, location is not the greatest and initially can intimidate a guest. Its a run down neighborhood inhabited with low income peaceful immigrants. But its quite safe even at night and a short walk from from Victoria Metro station. Once you get familiar with your surrounding, you will quite comfortable. Here you will find more non-greek restaurants to choose from with competitive prices. Probably the best value in Athens. Staff is very helpful and rooms are well appointed but nothing fancy. I enjoyed the balcony. No complaints
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a great stay at Centrotel. It's modern, clean and well maintained. We had a double bed and balcony room on the 4th floor. Decent size and plenty of storage, lovely bathroom too with whirlpool bath tub - which you could only use between certain hours which was strange but up till 10pm. The shower was a hose one connected to the bath taps which was okay but the hook for it was too low down unless you're short, and with full pressure from the tap it would spray in a different direction to how you wanted it, but this was a minor gripe. It had two sliding doors out to the balcony to block out noise and light which it did very well, actually the room was pitch black with both closed even at the brightest part of the day! The bed was oddly low to the ground and mattress quite firm.Free Wifi with good connection.Aircon.Underground Car park but I wouldn't advise driving in central Athens and the roads around the hotel are narrow and many parked cars both sides.Despite the relatively run down area the location is good, metro stops 5-10min walk left (Larissa Station) or right (Victoria) out of the front door, a 5 day long metro ticket can be bought for 5 Euro per person and will get you to most places quickly - 10-15mins to the Acropoli / Syntagma central stops (trains run every 5mins too!) and conveniently. The same ticket can be used on all other public transport too, trams and buses, we used the tram to ride along the coast to visit the beaches and Glyfada. We actually never needed to use a taxi. We walked back at all sorts of times, including close to midnight and didn't feel unsafe, although there are a few people lingering around at all hours and some paths dimly lit which might bother some people. Our bus excursions didn't pickup from this hotel - probably due to the narrow street, however they did pickup outside Hotel Oscar a 5min walk away on a much wider road.Staff were polite, friendly and accommodating - when we asked for extra pillow withing minutes someone knocked on the door with them. We didn't eat the €7.5 pp breakfast and opted for eating local Koulouri (Greek Sesame Bread rings) or croissants that were very cheap at around €1-€2 each.Would happily recommend and stay there again.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I lived in Athens as a student but hadn’t been back the last ten years. This hotel was perfect for napping after a long-haul flight, and as a base for short trips in the capital city. 1. Service: 10/10. Friendly and efficient staff. All of them! Very rare! 10/102. Breakfast: 9/10. Authentic spinach pie! Lovely olives. Greek yoghurt and honey! Decent muesli! Good omelette. Tasty little sausages. Big thumbs up. 3. Price to quality is excellent. 10/10. Very reasonable prices. 4. Interior design: 9/10. For a mid-price place, it is very good looking. Walnut wood panels in lift/elevator; and pretty paintings going Into dining room. The bathrooms look great. 5. Bedroom is very comfortable. 8.5/10. Sleep quality very good. The window shutters seem top of the range and very effective for security and keeping the room dark. Cute balconies with nice urban views. Sound proofing is good. The shower does not attach well to the wall. 6. Location is debatable but I liked it. 7/10. Viktoria metro station is 8 minutes walk. on the same line as Piraeus port, making it easy to catch the ferry to the islands. If you want fashionable cafes and bakeries they are close to the metro station. Admittedly the streets nearer the hotel have become a hanging out place for middle eastern migrants. I never felt threatened at all. 6b. One benefit of the location is the excellent and cheap local Halal restaurants (Kabul, turn right out of hotel and you’ll see it on left hand side after 3 minutes walk. Fantastic chicken stew). And the area is great for people watching, compassion-building and a spot of photo-journalism.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens & SantoriniOn my travel experience to Athens & Santorini, here are my simple point-wise Guide:Athens for 2.5 days:1. Land in Airport, take X95 Bus to Syntagma Square (The main hub in the city housing the Parliament) - Bus ticket per person is 6Euro. 2. We had taken Centrotel Hotel near Victoria Station- a decent one with well connectivity and near an Bangladeshi restaurant called Bijoy3. Take Athena Card for 5days & 9 Euro per person. This is convenient and cheap. With this you can travel in Athens, excluding Airport, by Metro, Tram, Bus. 4. See Acropolis, Museum, Syntagma Square Parade(on every Sunday) and other Historic sites. Don't forget to visit the Old Parliament and spend time there! It's very near to Syntagma. 5. Be a little cautious, there are petty pick pocketers. 6. We stayed for 2.5days and then went to Venice. Santorini for 1day:1. Oia is the Scenic place with Blue & White House- Hold many film shootings.2. There is lack of public transport to all places... Take a car for a day for 30 Euro (excluding petrol- which costs another 15 Euro). This is the cheapest and most convenient way to travel.3. You have to buy water - It is costly - Starting from 2 Euro.4. Generally 1 day is enough - you may take 2 days for leisure.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked into the Centrotel for approximately 4 hours. While the lobby and staff were very nice, the location and rooms were a bit disappointing. It was not close to anything and the balcony looked over a run down building and multiple cars with flat tires. I did not feel comfortable here especially as a solo traveler and had to find a new hotel for the remainder of my stay in Athens.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located close to Victoria metro station making easy access to Athens centre. Spacious room with balcony, very clean, staff very helpful and friendly. The bed was a bit on the hard side but the room was very quiet. We thought it was good value for Athens. We didn’t find the area at all intimidating ( as some people have commented) and never felt threatened or uneasy. It does have a visible immigrant population, they use the streets and public areas to socialise which is not unusual in city areas where people live predominantly in flats. But there were also plenty of Greek people around using the bars and shops. Athens centre and the metro were more of a problem because of the pickpockets. Would definitely stay here again if we returned to Athens.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet located in a strategic position for Athens downtown . Friendly staff. Recommended for business visit too. Clean and good ratio quality price . Book in advance for better price . Rooms first floor .
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights. It is a very nice hotel, with friendly staff and high class rooms. All the towels were cleaned every day, they desk staff always asked what room we were from as we went our for the day, so they could get them sorted. It was a very short walk from the nearest Metro station and once you study the routes it's a simple journey. We bought a 3 day City Tour bus ticket to get us around. There are lots of close by shops and restaurants. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was really ideal, walking distance from the Victoria train station and Omnia square. The location itself is a nice mix of tourist and residential. The room weas nice and the shower really spacious. my only comment is that the bed was low to the floor and the mattress a bit firm for my liking, however i would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Centrotel for 4 nights. Unfortunately, it is not the best suburb of Athens, however it was the light in the middle of dark alleys. The entrance looked beautiful, the staff was very nice and if there was a problem they solved it immedietly (We asked for an additional blanket and a few minutes later someone delivered it right to the hotelroom door). The staff is very nice by the way! We also booked the breakfast on the last day of our stay which was great as well. They hat joghurt, fruits, bacon and eggs, cereals, sweet croissants. All in all it was enough for everyone to start into the day. I would highly recommend the hotel for a city trip, they got all you need and everything is very clean and tidy.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s only a 5euro drive to the Acropolis and anything you may want to see!! I don’t love the idea of walking around at night in this particular neighborhood, but feel incredibly safe inside! Air conditioning hasn’t been amazing. But besides that the service is wonderful, the people are amazing.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got a clean, spacious double room. There are semi-controls for the central heating vents but easily got the temperature right by turning the heating off and opening the sliding balcony doors for a short period. These have blackout screens and curtains and kept out light and noise for a good night’s sleep. WiFi strength and speed were good enough for streaming. I did not have breakfast here. Short walk from Athens central train station (attached to Larissa Metro) and Victoria Square Metro. The room I got and the hotel lobby are easily 4-star standard. Staff were lovely whom I spoke to in English. The area can come across as a slum with a lively community in the day. When I arrived late at night, the street the Hotel is on was largely deserted apart from a few people who looked like they were heading home and there was also a friendly dog walker. You will not encounter any more graffiti here than most of Athens but there are more empty or derelict properties. I got some curious stares during the day as a male traveller but I wouldn’t say the area was unsafe as long as one is street smart. If you travel solo or as a timid couple and don’t think you can handle feeling a bit vulnerable walking back to your hotel then I suggest you look elsewhere. Otherwise great find!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay very much.The value for money is amazing. We received a free upgrade from the very friendly and helpful staff!The rooms are spacious and very clean. The hotel is not located in the best neighbourhood but it is close to the metro. Acropolis is about 35 minutes by foot.If you don’t mind a hotel that is a bit out of the way then this is a great choice. Looking at price/value this has been one of the best places I’ve stayed in a while.Only con is that the walls are a bit thin. Lucklily our neighbours were quiet after 11 o’clock otherwise this would definitely disturb your night.The bubble Baths in the room are a nice addition.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 2 rooms in this hotel. We was told that the area is not so safe, wherever you want to go you need a taxi.The location was not the best in deed...hotel however looks really nice from outside especially in the evening. Receptionist man was helpful and very kind and explained everything about the hotel we needed to know up on arrival..Rooms are ok, clean and spacious. for the money we paid i cant complain.. i would Not come back here but if you are looking a low budget hotel, its not so bad.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in this Hotel twice and I will return here the next time I am in town. You wont find anything better for that price in the heart of this city! It is definetely value for money for a new and very clean hotel with free Parking. The hotel is located between two Metro stations (5min distance) wich makes it perfectly easy to get everywhere for tourists and every kind of traveller. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Both times I went there they gave us a bigger room that the one we had booked. I love this Hotel!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a gem of a hotel. Beautifully decorated, with large spacious rooms. Staff were friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was nice. Location isn't the best, though we didn't have any problem, even at night time. The metro is within walking distance as is the Museum of Archaeology. Victoria square is very close to the hotel and there are a number of restaurants in the square, otherwise not too many restaurants around the hotel.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel. Rooms clean. Staff friendly and helpful. It is a bit out of town but the neighbourhood is fine. Easy access to the 2 metro stations Victoria and Larissa. Had breakfast once in out 3 night stay was ok. But with so much to access in Athens we are out the other mornings. For the price would recommend. Athens is a fab place to visit.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 2nd time here and nothing changed, great helpful staff and short walk to station for 15 minute ride to center of Athens which you pay a lot more for and much smaller hotels. Rooms were comfortable and had a small balcony, highly recommend.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The area around Centrotel seems very residential. If you are expecting glamour in Greece, think again. Walking from the station to the hotel, you will definitely see stray cats, hard rubbish, graffiti and a lack of street lights. Do not be alarmed, this scenery is common around Athens. We never felt unsafe walking around as we stuck to walking the main streets and walked with a basic awareness of our surroundings. Centrotel is located about 20minutes walk from Central Athens and only 5 minutes to two different Metro lines (Victoria and Larissa Stations). Service was impeccable. All staff we came across spoke English and were extremely helpful. Check in was easy and smooth. We got to our room to find a clean and very spacey room. When we first tried to turn the air con on, it wouldn't work so I called reception to ask how to turn it on and she was polite in telling us that the Windows all need to be closed in order for it to work. Simply enough, it was fine after that. Being Mid August, it was heaven coming back to a cool room after a day of walking and melting in the 38+ degree heat! We booked a basic room with only a shower but this was definitely more than enough. We had plenty of space either side of the bed, plus a closet, desk, small TV and the bathroom had ample space and a large shower. I also loved the ceiling lights which were story of arranged like colour changing star lights (not sure how to describe!). It was very cool!A few other things to mention; the black out windows were also amazing for sleeping in. No light whatsoever would come into the room. The fridge in the room also came with two free bottles of water (Not supposed to drink tap water or use it for brushing your teeth). And I also bought a large 1 or 1.5L bottle of water from reception). Lots of mirrors around the room which was nice to get make up done or check outfits. Full bars of wifi in our room as well.Overly, we would happily stay again and recommend to others. A great hotel at a bargain price!Oh and a bonus tip: there is an amazing restaurant at Larissa Station called The Station Grill. Delicious, local and super cheap!!!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We are thrilled that we booked this hotel. As people have noted this is not downtown. However it is a very short walk to the metro or a cheap cab ride to the major attractions. I very much disagree with negative reviews about the neighborhood. Near theMetro station, there are a variety of restaurants and cafes.The hotel itself is very well kept. The rooms are quite large by Greek standards. The amenities are very modern including the fantastic bath tub.The staff are friendly and knowledgeable If in Athens and looking for some luxury (without the price tag) this is the hotel for you
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not in the center but well communicate by metro or taxi, room are modern and confortable, including therapy shower. The wifi works perfect in the room and staff at the reception is quite helpful. Definitely a recommended place.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in Athens. The location around the hotel don't look that great, but I thought it was very safe. Walked around in the night with no problem and people who lived around there were very nice. The hotel is clean and very comfortable and the bathroom was nice too.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Centrotel Hotel for four days and it was fantastic. The hotel interiors are very clean, modern and comfortable. The location was perfect for us, very close to Victoria Metro station which is two stops away from Monastiraki Station Square which is excellent for restaurants, views of the acropolis and the famous flea markets. We were able to get from the airport to the hotel no problems via the metro at the cost of €10. You can also purchase a metro ticket for the city for 5 days at €9 each which was also perfect for us. Due to our early flight home we preferred to book a taxi back to the airport which the hotel was more than happy to arrange for us (taxi was €42 fixed price). They also provide breakfast for €7 euros if you are hungry in the morning. The staff were super helpful recommending local restaurants on the first night as we arrived late, providing us with a map and advice on how to get around the city. I can't fault them.I was a little apprehensive about the reviews regarding the neighbourhood but I would say there is nothing to worry about. Yes there are some migrants walking around but it is like that all over Athens not just at the hotel, even in the main tourist attractions there were migrants walking around and begging. So don't let this stop you booking this gem of a hotel.I definitely would stay again and also try out the jet stream baths in your room they were awesome.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights. We got an upgraded room (that was words of staff but don't know if it was real or just our room). The room was very big. Bathroom too. The room was very well soundproofed. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was just normal (instead of others comments I don't think it is super). Basic plates : orange juice, greek yogourt, croissant, breads, cake, few jams, peach, eggs and bacon, coffee and tea. That's all. I think so the price is a bit expensive, but it is vacation after all ! Anyway, the hotel is at a good location : 5min by feet from victoria station (green line) and 15min by feet from Larissa station (red line or regular trains)
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, two children (late teen-early twenties), and I fit in a family suite and were very comfortable. The hotel was clean, staff was friendly, and no issues with amenities. The area is not the best, but since we were a bigger group, we did not seem to have any issues. We also went out at decent hours and stayed on the main streets.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great couple of nights on our before and after trip to Kalambaka. The hotel was walking distance to main central train station as well as the Victoria line, so was easy to get around. The breakfast was fantastic, and wifi accessible in the rooms. The only "complaint" would be the really hard beds! Not so hard that we couldn't sleep but probably the hardest bed I've slept in. Quiet neighbourhood as well. The woman at the front desk was really helpful and approachable and gave us great tips on places to check out besides the typical touristy areas.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very good value hotel outside the centre in a poor district. We found it safe in the day and early evening. It is close to two metro stations for easy access to the airport and Piraeus. The metro is a cheap standard fare. There are adequate eating places in nearby Victoria Sq. There is no evening restaurant at the hotel. The hotel itself is very good with refreshing jacuzzi baths in the rooms. Breakfast was fine for setting one up for the day. If you want a clean modern hotel with easy access to food and transport then I would recommend this hotel unreservedly for a city break.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a very nice entrance with a feature flooring. Lounge room at front and dining area near the back. The breakfast was very nice, with full cooked, continental fare. Beautiful Greek yoghurt to accompany cereal, fruit. Room service is available. The room was large and nice. Bathroom was very nice and well appointed with toiletries. A deck with table and chairs. Door sliders also had sound blocking feature as street below could possibly be noisy. The suburb is not good and we were warned by cab driver to not walk outside at night. We felt quite safe to walk to metro which was close by during the day. Fully recommend The Centrotel.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly helpful staff, good price changing from day to day, free safe garage, quiet street in a more or less residential area with small commerce around, recently renewed hotel and rooms with balcony,, small but convenient bathroom with bubble bathtub, good free wifi and conveniently placed AC outlets for recharging and notebooks, charming garden for average but inexpensive breakfast, refrigerator with water bottles, grocery nearby, very recommendable hotel !!!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with huge and comfortable rooms. It has a small and cosy garden at the back to drink coffee. The location is close to a metro station. The staff was very kind to recommend us restaurant for our group and were also extremely helpful when assisting us in sending a forgotten luggage back to our home country. They also upgraded for free two guys of our group into a suite.I totally recommend Centrotel!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got a room with a jacuzzi and a balcony. There is a blackout door and a glass door to the balcony. I slept in in the morning and thought it was still dark outside. it had been light for three hours. The breakfast was good and well worth the 8 Euros. The room is clean, modern, well designed, and well thought out. I recommend it for anyone. it is located about four blocks from two different metro stations. The staff has been quite professional and answered all of my questions. I'll come back.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the hotel on two occasions. First time, we got a room with a jacuzzi and it was such a nice feeling to have a long an leisurely massage in the tub of water. The shower gels smelt of almond and the smell lingered after the bath. The dome above the bed has starlike lights. The hotel is not in the central business district, but has few nice and value for money eating places nearby. Language is issue, spoken or understood by only few. I left my Iphone in the breakfast table and forgot all about it. I did not even remember where I lost it and gave up hope of ever finding it. To my surprise, my tentative query on the phone evoked a positive response as the owner had take the phone from the outside table and kept it in safe-keeping.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last weekend we choose de Centrotel because of her location! Just 350 meters from metrostation of Victoria Square! You can drink a freddo espresso in one of of cafés at square and take your metro! Within 5 minutes you reach Monastiraki Square! The rooms are spacious and comfortable! And jacuzzi in every room! ;-) The breakfast they serve is typical Greek and that's the way we love it!
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed a few nights while in route to Santorini . Nice place. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Walking distance to the National Archaeological Museum. There is graffiti everywhere. This can give the impression that you are in a bad area. However, I did not feel unsafe walking the area late night. Apparently, graffiti has become a major issue in the area over the last few years. I did not eat breakfast there because of other commitments. I accidentally booked a double room for my bestie and myself. The staff honored my request for a twin room and charged me the same rate. The double is perfect for a couple. The twin room was larger with a huge Jacuzzi tub.
hotelName:
1    Centrotel Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Herodion. Could not have asked for a better location. Wonderful breakfast, nice roof top restaurant and bar. The staff was outstanding. Decent value for the money. Totally recommend.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just over a block away from the Acropolis Museum and a great rooftop bar. Seemed to be in vogue for lots of younger British business trippers. The breakfast was really tasty and nutritious and quite quite varied
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed three nights. The room was small. But their breakfast and service was excellent. Their staff were very helpful and pleasant. Besides this hotel is a walk away from the Acropolis and next to the new museum. Cant be better
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We used this hotel for an overnight stop-over coming from Crete. It is located more or less directly beside the Acropolis museum and only a few 100 meters away from the main Acropolis site entrance. Easy walking distance to the Plaka, the old city with its shops and restaurants. Immaculately kept hotel, very clean, nice reasonably sized room, good breakfast. Extremely friendly and helpful staff at reception. A special plus is the roof garden overlooking the Acropolis. The bar serves interesting unusual variations on cocktails and mixers well worth trying.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Picked this hotel purely because it was modern with a good view of the acropolis. Rooms were clean but VERY small, staff were friendly upon check in and assisted with tours and bags to the room. The disappointing part of our stay was the breakfast buffet or lack there of, there wasn’t much choice and the restaurant on the roof. We ate at this restaurant our first night - staff were extremely rude and the food was the worst we had in three weeks of travelling.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this place by far is its location. The Acropolis is a short walk. Other attractions such as the Plaka shopping district, the Temple of Zeus, and Herod's Arch are walking distance as well. In addition, the rooftop restaurant, while a bit overpriced, has a nice view of the Acropolis at night. The breakfast buffet is varied and very tasty. The staff were very friendly and efficient. The room, however, could use some updating. While the bathroom had obviously been renovated, the room itself was quite small and the decor and furniture need improvement. Overall this is a great place for the value.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there one night before joining a cruise. The facade of the hotel is nothing to get excited about and hides a delightfully modern hotel with an attentive staff. The location is fantastic, only a five minute walk to the acropolis museum. Morning breakfast was included and abundant.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second stay at the Herodion Hotel for a total of 7 nights. The staff have always been very helpful. Early in our trip planning we wanted to purchase tickets for the Odeon of Herodes Atticus theater, through email the staff were able to help us coordinate the purchase of tickets. (Highly recommend visitors look into attending an event. There are concerts, comedy, symphonies etc.)While we have only stayed in the center of Athens a few times, I do not imagine you could find a better location. The steps to the Acropolis and the Odeon Theater are a 5 minute stroll from the Herodion. Plaka, Monastiraki, and Syntagma Square are all very, very close. No need to rent a car while at the Herodion.The rooms are very clean and housekeeping checks to make sure the room has all you need in the afternoon. We booked a balcony room this trip. The balcony was beautiful but the view was not. Across the street was an apartment building that didn’t provide much of view. During our next stay we will book a different room view.Finally, the rooftop bar/lounge/restaurant. The view of the Acropolis is breathtaking. We have enjoyed dinner, cocktails and tapas on the rooftop. The pictures on the hotel website are the views you will enjoy. Also, the New Acropolis Museum, one short block away, is beautiful to see at night from the rooftop. Overall, our stays at the Herodion Hotel have been wonderful. We will continue to make this our home base when in Athens.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was fine due to its proximity to historic sites in Athens. The rooftop bar, open at 5 pm, was fantastic with stunning views of the Parthenon and its lighted Museum. The rooms are small with no views, but if you want convenience to downtown shopping, parks and historical sites it's ideal. No restaurant, but there are plenty within a block or two.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the best location you can think of when in athens keeping acrpolis in mind. you don't need a car to browse the whole area of acropolis but browse all on foot. the hotel's 5th floor terrace has a direct view of the acropolis. take a coffee and enjoy an evening there. excellent services everywhere. starting from the reception to the restaurants. all are very very warm and caring. very high quality food at the restaurant. loved the moussaka. i had the best time staying at this hotel. enjoyed my daily browse on foot ending the day at this warm ambiance.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not much from the outside, but once you get past the front desk, you are treated to comfortable relaxing areas - perfect break from a busy holiday. Downstairs is the garden atrium and bar area with plump sofas, chess boards and stylish decor. Upstairs is the Wellness Area to relax amidst vines and lavender and also the jacuzzis. On the top floor, enjoy the rooftop drinks and dinner with an amazing view of the Acropolis. Thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is situated one block from the Acropolis and the Museum. Staff was very friendly and greeted us warmly upon arrival. Room was very clean and the bath very spacious. Breakfast provided a number of options to please all. Highly recommend. Must check out the roof top restaurant and bar.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Herodion for 2 nights before a cruise - I had a fabulous time walking everywhere - but my favorite time was dinner in my last night on the rooftop at the A Point restaurant- absolutely delicious food as you slowly see the lights come up in the Acropolis. Service was amazing. I was alone but was treated as a queen - food and wines were awesome and I loved it. Highly recommend for solos.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was within walking distance to the Acropolis, museum, Plaka, and other attractions. We walked most of the time to restaurants, shopping, and the attractions. The Herodian has a great breakfast each morning and comfortable rooms.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated 500 m from Acropolis, with a view. The roof top restaurant creates tasty and innovative feasts, for the eye and for the mouth. Could not find a better option when in Athens for pleasure!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were all friendly and accommodating and communicated by email overseas, room was clean and affordable, jacuzzi and restaurant on roof overlooking Parthenon! Acropolis super close as well...a few minutes to walk! Fantastic experience!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mom and I stayed at the Herodion for one night on our first trip to Athens and we could not have asked for a better experience. They made dinner reservations, exchanged money, and called taxis for us. The view from the rooftop lounge is unbeatable and there are two jacuzzis with views of the Acropolis as well. The Acropolis itself and the Acropolis museum are less than a 5 minute walk away and other attractions are nearby as well. We would absolutely stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens was the 1st stop for our Greek holiday. We chose the Herodian over more expensive luxurious hotels due to location. We loved our stay, could not of had a better location, easy to walk everywhere we wanted to go, especially the big ticket “ancient” attractions, and certainly no shortage of great food options. Very pleasant staff, clean rooms, great shower. While our room didn’t have a view of the Acropolis, the roof top bar/restaurant did. Some great cocktails, sensational food as well. (Not the place to go in a hurry - like most places in Greece). Really the only downside to this hotel was space in the room. Bed was comfortable, marble bathroom, just small with no storage. We didn’t unpack as really no drawers or cupboard space and none in the bathroom. This is a small price to pay for everything else it has going for it. We were very happy and glad to save the extra $1000 for a “nicer” room in a different hotel (4 nights).
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I picked the Herodion Hotel based on its view of the Acropolis, and of course, TripAdvisor's ratings - we were not disappointed with either. The view of the Acropolis from our balcony was breathtaking, especially at night with it lite. The junior suite was spacious, with a large bedroom, w/king sized bed, facing the Acropolis. The sitting room was nice, with couch, chairs and a wall mounted TV (also one in the bedroom). The bathroom was adequately sized (though counter space is limited), the shower was large. The rooms, halls, and lobby were all very clean. The included breakfast was good, with a variety of fruits, eggs, meats, traditional Greek foods, etc. The front desk staff was most accommodating, as were all staff that we encountered. The lounge, just off the lobby, is especially nice, with good seating, an excellent bar, and numerous games and other activities to amuse. The hotel is only 400 m. from the Acropolis Museum, yet quiet and serene. This should be your pick when in Athens.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely first class hotel in just the right spot in the city with gorgeous views of the Acropolis. Front desk staff were friendly, very helpful and professional. Spoke English well. Great rooftop restaurant/bar, top shelf food. Reservations needed. If no reservation the bar/lounge area is a romantic spot for drinks/appetizers with amazing views of the Acropolis lit up at night and you can eat dinner right there, as well. Get the cheese dumplings. Don't resist the churro raspberry/white chocolate dessert! Hot tub on the roof with Acropolis views is the perfect ending to a day spent walking around the ruins and the city.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the perfect spot - Right next to the Acropolis museum and minutes from the Acropolis. The room was very comfortable and the breakfast delicious. You can't beat the roof deck view either!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel! Perfect in so many ways - great location, great roof top bar/restaurant, great views and a hot tub after a long day of travel! It's also very close to the Acropolis Museum and the "We Bike Athens" office where we enjoyed an tour on electric bikes! The views at night from our balcony were incredible!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Heridion is everything you need in a hotel, location, hospitality, friendliness and reflects the city it is in.Although the rooms are very small, they have everything you need. The hotel is right next to the street that the Acropolis Museum is in and close to the plaka and the main pedestrian thoroughfare around the bottom of the Acropolis. You are close to everything but not amongst the bustle so it is perfect.I would get up and run every morning and as Athens is a late starting city, I would often be jogging around the Acropolis with just a few other runners and a few dogs and cats for company. It was magical. No bustle and plenty of stunning sites as you made your way through the route.I would highly recommend the hotel's roof top restaurant. The food was amongst the best we had in Greece and the view of the Acropolis as the sun went down was worth being there alone. A wide variety of interesting Greek wines could also be sampled. Service could have been a touch friendlier but with that view, a minor thing.This will be my new "go to" hotel in Athens. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was the best part , staff at the reception were very courteous . The room was nice . Staying so close to Acropolis allowed us to catch a trip to the top with a lot of ease . They also offered us a complimentary glass of wine because of renovation going on would have caused disturbances which was a nice gesture. Breakfast was nice too .
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location is great for walking to or getting to local attractions. The Acropolis Museum which is a must see is right next door. If you like doing a city bus tour like Hop on Hop off, the bus pickup and drop off is a block away. Hotel service was friendly. Only exception was ordering drinks in the lounge. Ordered a martini which seemed to be an issue with the staff. Dont know why. Rooms are small like usual European hotels. Breakfast buffet was okay/average. I wouldn't say great.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice clean hotel with great views and an easy walk to the Acropolis and Plaka. Comfortable, basic room with large shower. Nice patio upstairs with bar and view and hot tubs and good restaurant. Breakfast fresh with many homemade options.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel (for Europe). I use the qualifier; "for Europe" since the standard room with a European king size bed is incredibly small which is not uncommon in Europe. But standing at the sink I couldn’t end over to brush my teeth since I would bump against the shower wall. And sitting on the toilet I could rest my chin on the sink. Even the elevator holds a maximum of only 4 people uncomfortably close together.But other than the cramped quarters, this place is top notch in every other way. The breakfast is outstanding in quality and selection. There are two Jacuzzis on the fourth floor with lounge chairs and a view of the Acropolis. The outside 5’th floor restaurant has excellent food at a reasonable price with a view of the Acropolis. All of the personnel are very friendly and helpful. The location is within a reasonable walking distance of the Acropolis and the trendy, tourist Plaka area.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an excellent short stay here, before heading on to the island of Andros. It is a very comfortable hotel with a good restaurant and friendly staff. It is perfectly located to explore central Athens being literally just below the Acropolis, which can be viewed from the rooftop bar/restaurant.. Although close to the Acropolis it is in a quieter area from the main tourist route. There is a comprehensive choice of breakfasts, which we enjoyed.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a week here on my first trip to Greece. The location is unparalleled in a quiet neighborhood at the base of the Acropolis and within walking distance of just about everything in downtown Athens worth visiting. Staff were amazing. The lobby restaurant served great meals, although I did prefer the restaurant right across the street which is also run by the hotel. Rooms were okay but a bit on the small side for me, typical though of European establishments. I was in an Acropolis view room which very much lent to the atmosphere of being in Greece specially lying in bed at night looking out the window at the Parthenon bathed in lights.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
