review_body: The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating, arranging airport pickup for us. The room was nice. The best thing about this hotel was the included breakfast. We travelled for 2 weeks staying at 7 different hotels and this one had the best breakfast by far. We were able to save quite a bit of money on meals by taking advantage of it every day.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started our 7 wk holiday with 3 night's at the Herodion. Great location, 10mins walk from the Acropolis & the Plaka shopping area, & right next to the Acropolis Museum. The staff were very helpful & kindly shifted our room after our first night's stay, as the one we'd booked was a little tight for space with 2 large suitcases & our carry-on luggage.We booked months in advance through our travel agent and feel we got a great rate, that included a really good buffet breakfast. We also had a very nice meal in their restaurant on our last night.Based on our stay I'd rate the Herodion a solid 4.8 / 5.Dean & Michelle, NZ
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First visit. Greeting was warm, staff professional and friendly. Offered good recommendations on local cuisine. Room very nice and clean. Dined in rooftop restaurant, which has an incredible view of Acropolis which is literally across the street. Breakfast buffet was outstanding. Wide variety of favorites, plus some new dishes. Had a choloate moose that was amazing. Located across the street from a wonderful coffee shop. Five minutes to the Acropolis, and a joining Plaka neighbor, with shops and restaurants. Overall, exceeded our expectations. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a large group, this year 19 of us, who make annual visits to major European cities. This year we chose Athens and stayed at the Herodion for 6 nights. The downstairs common area is lovely with plenty of room around the bar and an excellent dining room serving superbly prepared food. The rooftop bar sits right under the Acropolis. Can't beat the view. The location of the hotel is perfect for walking to all the sites from the Acropolis to Hadrian's Library to the ancient Olympic stadium. Fantastic restaurants are just around the corner from the hotel. Best of all is the friendly and helpful staff ready to assist guests in making reservations, giving directions and just serving all needs. Top notch small hotel with class. Would not stay anywhere else in Athens.Glenn H.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice size room and lovely bath, but the best thing was the view. We had a balcony room with a view of the Acropolis. We were a short walk to the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum. The Plaka was also a very short walk away. We couldn't have asked for more.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Herodion 3 nights. The room was nice and clean, staff friendly and the breakfast was good. The location is great. Couldn’t be better. The jacuzzis at the rooftop were also nice with a great view over Acropolis. We were not bothered by noice from the other rooms at all! All in all a great stay! /Sari & Torkel
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 5th time staying at the Herodion as part of an educational tour group.You know the hotel has to be good when you see the same staff and they say, welcome back!Returned to hotel after a long hydrofoil ride from Santorini. My luggage had been placed in my room and was asked if I'd like room service for an evening meal. Opted to visit the restaurant. Told the staff I was in a bit of a rush as I was hungry and wanted to get some sleep. Within ten minutes I was presented with a delightful local salad and beer. Couldn't beat the price.More importantly...it was a rough hydrofoil ride. We asked if they could send up tea and toast to two members of our party who became sea sick. Not a problem! They treat you the way you'd want to be treated.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pleasantly greeted at reception then shown to our room - as requested on a high floor - with an Acropolis view as paid for. Spacious bedroom, although limited hanging space - guess most visitors come for just a few days. We were the same but had larger bags as we were moving on elsewhere. Large shower in a modestly sized but modern bathroom. Good selection of toiletries provided. Mini bar in room rather than a small fridge which many travellers now prefer. Free safe, good a/c. Really comfortable bed and no noise from street.Excellent breakfast buffet - choice and quality. We didn't try the hot tub, amd were a little disappointed we weren't notified in advance that the rooftop could not accessed.We ate in the Atrium restaurant one night - lovely food, imaginatively presented, and we thought very fair value for money.Staff throughout were helpful, polite and smiling. Great hotel for a good price in the centre of a capital city. We would definitelyreturn.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rare hotel nowadays where the excellence of all services and food is enhanced by a genuine and kind hotel team spirit. Best hotel to have a quiet and high quality stay in central Athens. The interior design is refined.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were two couples travelling together to Greece for the first time. Athens was our first stop for 3 nights. We were very pleased with the Herodion. The hotel is in a great location, the staff are very friendly. The rooms are small but efficient. The bathrooms are also small but beautifully decorated - loved the marble! The bed is quite firm but comfortable. Some rooms have little balconies, some have Juliet balconies. There are many options for restaurants nearby and of course the hotel is very close to the Acropolis and some rooms have views. If your room doesn't, you can go up to the roof where the hot tubs are for some great views. The hotel includes a nice buffet breakfast with something for everyone - lots of options and all yummy. We also tried the hotel restaurant one evening and once for afternoon drinks. Excellent service!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel will really go the extra mile to meet your every need! After staying here for 5 nights I had to go to another hotel for a conference for 3 nights. I then flew out on the Saturday night. I couldn't organise late check out at the new conference hotel, so returned to the Herodion to request their help. Not only did they let me leave my bags there, I also got a warm shower and towel before my flight.They really do everything to just be nice and helpful people. Thanks so so much!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideal for site seeing and bus tours. Loads of restaurants close by. Hotel staff very friendly and room very clean if not large (but who visits somewhere to sit in a hotel room). Restaurant and breakfast ok
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in the district of Makrygianni. Friendly staff and great rooftop views of the Acropolis lit up at night. Comfortable rooms with a good breakfast and a very quiet and relaxing lobby to have a drink in after a long day traipsing around.Within walking distance to The Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum. lots of quality eateries/shops etc close to the hotel in Makrygianni .
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location , near metro and tourist area while next to a up and coming local scene ( direction north of hotel) .Breakfast so so and Roof bar was under renovation which was disappointing and they did NOT disclose on their website - misleading !!!Otherwise ok!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of six members arrived at the Hotel Herodion Hotel in the middle of the night and we were given a good welcome and shown to our rooms. We stayed for two nights and had a wonderful breakfast each morning. Staff were very helpful and polite. One member of staff came round guests and asked if we would like anything else to eat before closing the buffet. The rooms and bathrooms were large and well laid out. Plenty toiletries in the bathroom. Very close to the Acropolis, shops and take-away places.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend & I stayed here for four nights mid March and had an enjoyable stay. We were given a warm welcome by reception & shown to our room which had twin beds with a good size en-suite. Although not the biggest room in a city hotel we only slept & showered there so it was more than adequate. The breakfast each day was plentiful with Greek, continental & cooked items to choose from along with tea coffee juices & hot water. We did test out the hot tub but it was a breezy cloudy day so not an ideal time to try! The roof bar was being refurbished over winter but the lounge bar was lovely & cosy with squashy sofas & an open fire on chillier evenings - they make a good Pornstar Martini cocktail too ;-) The hotel itself is a few minutes walk from Acropolis subway station and it’s very easy to walk to all of the main attractions from here with lots of shops & restaurants nearby. Would we stay here again - yes definitely!
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This friendly, well run hotel is a perfect place to stay when visiting the archaeological sites. Breakfast is good and varied and the rooms, although rather small, are quiet and very well equipped. The standard of cleanliness throughout the hotel is very high and the bathrooms are perfect. We had a large, sunny balcony which we enjoyed using. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in hotel herodion for 4 nights, the location is very good , but rooms are too small, housekeeping was very weak, breakfast was good, blankets were very old and rough that we couldn’t use it at all, next time I will not go to this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect place to stay for a short trip to Athens. The restaurant on the rooftop was great and the view unparalleled. Room was clean and people friendly. I would stay again and have recommended to others.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prime location and very helpful staff. Acropolis just above the hotel, calm area and metro station nearby. Visited the hitel already twice and recommending for all culture lovers seeking comfortable option.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time! Very helpful staff. We did not want to leave. Cozy bar. Great location. Easy to get to all the important spots. The staff helped us with renting a car last minute. I would definitely come back next time I'm in Athens.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Upon check-in there’s additional payment of €3/night for hotel tax.2. We paid for deluxe room with view but The room we had is small and the bed is very uncomfortable. We don’t sleep well. And the view is the street. the division on each room is not concrete so you can hear other people talking in the other room. The tv is only 24 inches, so you need to get near to tv for you to watch. The toilet is small and they’re very stingy on toilet papers. 3. There’s 2 jacuzzi in 4th floor and operated by getting card in the front desk and according to them it last 30 mins but when we used it, it only last 15 mins and you need to call them on telephone to bring new card. 4. The breakfast is terrible. Very few variety of meal. And the orange juice is not fresh. There’s a lot of oranges in the street and they can’t make fresh orange juice, that’s crazy. 5. The restaurant is not good. Less variety of food and no Greek food. That’s ridiculous we’re in Greece and no Greek food!6. The elevator is tiny. It only fit for 3-4 persons.Overall we’re not happy in this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: our room was a "standard" double - warm and comfortable, with a large king size bed. No wonderful view, but it was quiet - no street noise or nightlife to disturb your sleep. Bathroom had a walk in shower with overhead waterfall shower head. No bathtub. Kettle for coffee or tea was useful. There was a filled mini-bar with a complete supply of water, soda, beer, various spirits and even a small champagne/fizzy wine. Unfortunately this early in the Spring the air-conditioning was set on Winter settings - only giving heat, no cold air - despite the weather being warmer than most British summers. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very clean and comfortable and the breakfast was delicious but the two outstanding characteristics of the Herodion are the location and the reception staff. It is quite close to the Acropolis and the New Acropolis Museum as well as numerous restaurants and a metro station. Although it was difficult to get waited on in the bar, the staff at reception were always cheerful, friendly, and ready to answer questions and offer helpful suggestions. I would stay here again with no hesitation.
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a really lovely hotel right in the middle of Athens and perfectly located for all the historic sites. The hotel staff are really welcoming. We had a standard double which was very comfortable and serviced daily to a high standard. Breakfast has a huge variety to choose from and would cater for all tastes. We also ate in the restaurant on the first night and the food is of very good quality and reasonably priced. We particularly liked the lounge area where the seating is very comfortable and there was a real log fire.Would highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
2    Herodion Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well situated within walking distance to great restaurants, market, shopping, and sites!Be sure to go to the rooftop bar/restaurant that overlooks the Acropolis! You can also view a glorious sunset from there too.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great. Close to all attractions.Roof top bar is nice with great views especially at night. Bar service on the other hand is lacking. Waited so long for waitress then had to call her over for more drinks...second round took so long we left. Not sure what it is with the service but they could make so much more money if the would put in a little effort.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights, this hotel is conveniently located, hospitable staff, excellent view from our room and the dining room has a beautiful view of the Acropolis! The service and food was wonderful. The room was nice, large bed, clean and roomy.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Booked for 3 nights and thought it was great value, it is in an excellent location near the Plaka area, and so close to the Acropolis. The roof top bar had been refurbished recently and was incredible and the staff up there were excellent especially the older Gentleman that worked the Bar and the Breakfast area. The views over the Acropolis and Athens were stunning and an absolute highlight of the property. There was a lot of graffiti in the street and first impressions was that the property looked old and run down however once inside it was modern and very well presented (we found this to be similar in most places in Athens) while this location was excellent. The reception was OK and the staff were friendly but didn’t go out of their way to help. we needed a taxi booked for an early morning trip to the port to catch a ferry and we told them that we needed a large taxi to accommodate all the luggage for 4 people and all that turned up was a rather small taxi. Rooms were on the small side but very clean and beds were large and comfortable. The bathroom was good, shower was Ok and a reasonable size. The breakfast was included and had so much choice and was very fresh and tasty and served in a lovely breakfast room. I can highly recommend this property and was very please with our stay
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights. Although expensive, but all of the hotels were, it is in an excellent location near the Plaka area, and so close to the Acropolis. The room top bar had been refurbished recently and was amazing. The views over the Acropolis and Athens were stunning. It looked a little run down outside in the street with lots of graffiti, but we found this all over Athens, and this location was one of the better ones. The reception was good and all staff were friendly. Rooms were small but very clean and beds were large and comfortable. The bathroom was tiny, shower wasn’t brilliant with a dated shower curtain, and the shower gel/shampoo etc was cheap. The breakfast was included and had so much choice and was very fresh and tasty, served in a lovely breakfast room. All in all a good choice. Close to Syntagma metro for the 40 minute trip to the Airport.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 15 minute walk to the Acropolis and lovely view from the rooftop restaurant/bar so well worth having dinner here in the evening - need to reserve a table . Staff - as you expect in Greece - are very friendly and helpful. The room was very tight and the 2x3 metre mirror opposite the bed - which presumably is to give a sense of depth - is just weird... could create the same effect without going full length. Air con is centrally controlled so very warm in the morning. Still good option for a short stay in Athens right in the heart of the Plaka
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights here, and arrived at midnight to the roof-top bar whose view of the illuminated Acropolis is breath-taking.Room 609 was far too noisy with air-conditioning and electrical noise allowing me about 2 hours sleep. We easily moved to a good, quiet room, 204.Breakfast was fine: scrambled eggs, great bread, cereals, dried and fresh fruit, cakes, but I was annoyed about the croissants which seemed to have become hard through micro-waving. No doubt I was spoilt by Hotel de Charme in Laveno, Italy. The coffee set-up was also disappointing.We soon realised this hotel's location is the big plus point - 15 mins walk to the Acropolis and Museum, Odeon Herodes, so close to Syntagma Square, hop-on buses and metro back to airport, and on the edge of the Plaka district, a minute from the cathedral.Staff on reception and on the roof-top were always pleasant.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, friendly staff. Rooms were very clean, on the small side, but that is Greece for you. We stayed in a standard double room, double bed, bathroom with shower and toilet, wardrobe with safe, tv, telephone, tea, coffee and kettle also a small bar fridge. We stayed here on our arrival in Greece, then the day before we left for home. Breakfast was very good, cold meats and cheese, cereals, sweet cakes, bacon, eggs etc, tea coffee, juices. Very friendly service by all the staff. The hotel was not far from Parliament, Apollo and the Acropolis, short walk to each of these.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice when you first walk in, although when we saw our rooms it was a little disappointing. There was a door to look outside but no balcony, it is almost like a tease. The air conditioning sucked so much! I would turn it up all the way and after hours of the A/C on the room was still hot and muggy and it seems I’m not the only guest that had this problem. The next thing I would let future guest know is that the “complimentary breakfast” wasn’t so good, the sausage was nasty, bacon was nearly raw (not crispy at all) and the eggs were so soft and mushy it was gross. Basically anything that was not a croissant was pretty disappointing. There was no pool nor hot tub instead they have a lounge on the roof which is very nice, although I would rather have a small pool on the roof along with a bar that would be more exciting. The best part about this hotel was the location in relation to the shops and the hotel service. The front desk guys work around the clock and were super helpful. Because of the pros and cons I have listed I would rate this hotel a 3 out of 5 stars.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we were 2 friends sharing a room on the 3rd floor - a room with a small balcony.it was quiet, and the balcony was a treat.the room is adequate size for 2 good friends to share.the batheroom room is not sealed so take that in consideration.the service was very welcoming and helpful andthe jewel in the crown is the roof-top restaurant with the perfecr Acropolis roof - great for drinks and dinner - please reaserve.the location is amazing - so it totaly worth the money.the only flaw was that the room was'nt cleaned seriously so we complained and it was fixed immidiately.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were referred to this hotel by another hotelier when he could not meet our request for twin beds in our rooms. The hotel worked hard to get us into our rooms, having just got off a long international flight. To wait for our rooms, we were directly to the rooftop terrace where Alex did a magnificent job hosting us. The ambiance was wonderful, the views incredible and the food amazing. We were directed to a table on a beautiful patio and enjoyed incredible, fresh pizzas. Our trip to Greece began here and it was a great start. The rooms were beautiful and the staff could not have been more helpful. Anything from helping us with local connections, to printing out vouchers -- the staff at this hotel really aimed to please. The hotel is also ideally located. Highly recommend this property!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been staying in this hotel for 20 years, almost in every trip to Athens. Location right in the centre of Plaka and a short distance to Syntagma, which makes using the metro everywhere so easy. Rooms & breakfast are excellent as usual, but the service really is special, consistently good and always ready to help. The rooftop bar was already great, but the recent renovation made it even better... definitely worth a stop & a drink, even if you are not staying at Central.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, the rooftop bar is nice and the breakfast was better than expected. My main complaint is that the air conditioner was not sufficient to cool the room. We mentioned it on the 2nd day of our stay, when we returned late we realized that nothing had been done. We were too tired to change rooms. Opening the window was not an option as we were above some exhaust from a kitchen and the room would stink. Had we been comfortable at night I would have no complaint. AC definitely needs to be upgraded.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We weren't actually staying here but definately worth a trip for its rooftop bar - amazing acropolis views, especially at night when the lights are on. A really good cocktail menu to accompany the views! Enough said!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice modern hotel with a delicious buffet breakfast. Short walk to all the points of interest in Athens. Beautiful view of Acropolis from a roof top bar. Rooms are a little small but very large beds. We got an amazing price when we booked ahead. Not sure I would pay full price but was a great place to stay.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfection location and was close to everything we wanted to see. The rooftop bar was a great spot to sit and have a cocktail and watch the sunset over the Acropolis. There was so much on offer for breakfast, plentiful and delicious. Our room overlooked the Acropolis which was pretty special. The staff were friendly and always went out of their way to help. Would definitely stay there again. Oh and so reasonably priced too!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is the key to this hotel, it is located in a very central spot about halfway between Monastraki and Syntagma. It is close to metro trains shopping, eating & some of the ancient sights like the Agora. You can if you have a decent pair of legs walk to the Acropolis in about 20 minutes. The hotel has lovely public areas and an amazing roof top bar & restaurant with superb views of the Acropolis & Parthenon on an evening. The room was smallish & the shower really poor but you overlook this because of the location.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A 5 minute walk to the Plaka, 2 mins to the main shopping street with restaurants everywhere plus 15 minutes up to the Acropolis. 5 star location. Roof top restaurant & bar with uninterrupted views of the Acropolis. Good breakfast, helpful staff. We had a room on the 6th floor with a balcony. The bed was comfortable & bathroom good also. If we return to Athens the CHA would be hard to beat for our needs.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Hotel is in a great location, close to everything, can walk to all locations2. Rooms too small3. Shower too small4. Breakfast has a great variety5. Breakfast staff are fantastic and efficient, staff in general are great6. getting here from the Airport we used Welcome Pickups, they were awesome, you can take a taxi $40- 60 Euros, or a train to Syntagma Square train station.7. Getting around you either walk to your destination which is really easy or use the Metro.8. Rooftop bar reopened the week we were there, very nice with beautiful views, unfortunately they have a very rude manager that verbally attacked my wife for taking pictures while we were having dinner, at the time there were only 3 other people in the whole of the rooftop, how unprofessional, because of his rudeness we will not return to this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We payed 128/per night for this hotel and i regret it.Its in a very good location but thats not enough for such a high rating! I have been to much better hotels with half the price in Athens Center. Very small rooms with a really old air conditioning.No stand for the shower, you need to use your hand and hold it! Smelly halls...Its nothing like the photos, they could of been much better but they arent! The stuff are very friendly.Breakfast is 6/10Too much better options around the area that are much cheaper! For sure not a 4star hotel...
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently visited the hotel with my mom. Every hotel has pros and cons and this hotel too had somePros: 1. Good location2. Beds were comfortableCons:1. Corridors are dirty and smelly2. Rooms are very small3. Bathrooms are very small4. Shampoos/conditioners very bad quality5. Moisturizer is bad and smellyI won’t stay here again!!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, under 10 min walk to Acropolis metro, Syntagma Square, Monastiraki metro, Psiri. In the Plaka neighborhood.Very clean, small rooms, nice updated bathrooms.Beautiful rooftop terrace with Acropolis view perfect for sunset or evening dining.Fairly priced for great location
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right, here it goes. Very unsure with how to rate this hotel whether to put it down as a 3 or 4 stars, so I’ve opted for 4 stars.We turned up to the hotel and the outside it’s opposite a busy food market which is lovely, a nicer sight to see every morning. But the location of the hotel is excellent, a 15-20 minute walk from the acropolis and Plaka and a 5 minute walk from Monastiraki. But the area where it’s located is where all the immigrants live. I’m far from a snob but it’s dirty, dark and full of men leering around, it made me and my family very uneasy walking back here at night, so keep an eye on your pockets.The lobby is nothing spectacular but sometimes simple is better, we went to check in and the man was rather rude behind reception as he didn’t understand much English, but we spoke to a younger lady and she spoke good English and was more friendly. The lifts are tiny, there’s only two of them and could only fit two people in with suitcases and even that’s a tight squeeze.The rooms are very clean, rather modern and spacious. I love that they had air corn and provided toiletries (soap, shampoo, shower gel). The downside to the rooms was that when we book a double room, we expect a double bed and not two single beds pushed together. They have a roof top terrace with tables and chairs, sun beds and a bar. We a splendid view. The view of the acropolis is amazing and you also have a beautiful view of the rest of the city. It’s also open until late (midnight).The breakfast was ample, nothing amazing but it had everything you needed to fill your stomach for a long day ahead of you. A mix between hot food and continental and coffee and juice. The tables are very limited so if you have breakfast try and go as early or as late as you can to ensure you have a space.Overall, the hotel was quite nice. So it’s lovely hotel with clean rooms, a good breakfast and perfect location. It’s worth the money.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very lovely hotel. Very well located with walking distance to most attractions as well as shops and restaurants. Room was lovely and size was good. Breakfast was lovely with a wide variety of things. The only thing I did not like was the room with the bathroom door being sandblasted and not fulled closed like a normal door. The lift is small but there is another life in the side which is much bigger. The rooftop was still closed for renovations which was sad but I heard great views.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a quiet location in the centre of old Athens within a 10 minute walk of the acropolis and two metro stations. We had a view of the Acropolis from our window on the fifth floor and the terrace bar upstairs has a great view as well, although they weren’t particularly welcoming when we went to look when we first arrived. It’s a shame they don’t offer guests a complimentary glass of wine up there to encourage patronage. Instead there is complimentary liqueur in the small clean rooms with good mattresses and hot shower. Reception staff were efficient but not overly friendly. Breakfast was on the lower floor in a big well decorated modern restaurant area, however the food was average. If I could have given 3 1/2 I would have but it’s definitely not s 4 in my opinion.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here the first week of May. It’s a short 7 minute walk to Syntagma metro station on a quiet side street. The area may look seedy on first glance, but it is 100% safe! The hotel room is very basic and small, but that is all we needed as we were out and about all day. The location of the hotel allowed for us to take a break in the room at times before journeying off to explore during the day.You are less than 5 minutes walk from many quality restaurants and shops. Breakfast was very good with many options. Room was very clean during the stay and thermostat was able to be adjusted easily for comfort. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean Hotel which would suit both the business traveller and tourist alike. Room was bright and modern, and our room overlooked the Acropolis, although no balcony, it was easy to see and admire. Breakfast was comprehensive with cooked option such as bacon , eggs, baked beans etc. as well as cold meats and cheeses. There was also yoghurt with honey, cereals and fresh fruit. If you had breakfast, you wouldn't have to eat until dinner. The attractions of the Plaka district are a short walk away, namely restaurants and the touristy shops as well as the Flea markets.Syntagma square was also a short walk away, with many buses having a stop there, including the X96 to the airport, which was 6 euros, whereas the Subway to the airport was 10 Euros.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked in for 6 nights accommodation. Room was clean and tidy but a little small. Had 2 suitcases but could only keep one open due to the room size.Amenities were fine and had a large dining room for breakfast l. There was much variety and should cater for most people’s needs.Staff were very courteous and happy to help answer and questions we had.Unfortunately the roof top was being renovated whist we were there and didn’t have a chance to experience the views. I believe it was opening the night after we left. I expect the views would be spectacular.All in all a pleasant stay and would recommend to couples as Location is great with easy access to public transport, shopping etc.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice and clean, the rooms are on the small side, but the bed was comfortable. The bathrooms in the rooms offer very little privacy (no lockable door, only a swinging glass door to cover the bathroom). The location was perfect, at the center of Athens, right next to lots of restaurants, shops and all the major sights. The breakfast was great and had lots of choices, and the staff was super friendly. Unfortunately the terrace was closed during our stay, but there's so much else around that it was fine. I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 2 nights based on Athens travel agent recommendation. Location is excellent. Reception area is nice enough, rooms are clean, but hallways are gross (stained, crumbling), and rooms are so basic (nothing on the walls) and need updating. I expect 3 star hotels to be basic, but not dirty and broken. Glass bathroom "door" doesn't allow for any privacy. A/C in one of our rooms was very noisy. Safes in both rooms did not work.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night by default because Expedia had a mix up with our reservation at another hotel (which we were supposed to stay at). Upon arrival, check-in was smooth, quick and efficient. Lobby looked new. Location was good - walking distance to major attractions. The rooftop was also closed for renovations at this time. Elevator was super slow (and stopped working at one point). Our room was quite small and the space was not functional, but the room was clean. The bathroom also had a damp/mildewy smell. Wifi in the hotel room was weak - could only access it in the lobby. Given we were only there for 1 night after a long travel day (and leaving early at 6AM the next day), it was okay to catch some shut eye.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was in a great location we were able to walk to some shops and places to eat. Breakfast each morning was great,had a good variety of food. Only negative was the rooftop bar was closed for remodeling but the hotel attendant sent us to the M Bar down the street and we were able to enjoy dessert and drinks while watching the sunset and the Acropolis light up at night. Would book again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is within walking distance to the Acropolis and staff was friendly to help us with our room accommodation. Rooms are basic, but comfortable with air conditioning. The WiFi was fast, although we didn't always have the best reception from our room. The breakfast buffet had a lot of options. Would recommend this place if you're looking to get the most out of seeing the central Athens area by foot.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my mother for three nights in September 2018. After arriving in the early hours of the morning we were thankful that the hotel had an area where we could rest until our room was ready. We were also able to make use of the buffet breakfast that morning during our wait, something that we did each morning during our stay because it was delicious! A great amount of choice & always stocked well. We were then notified at about 9am that our room was ready, well before the usual 2pm check-in time & we were so thankful to the staff for making this happen. The room itself was basic but neat & clean. The beds were a little hard, but the room had a view of The Acropolis so what more could we ask for! One small complaint about the room was that it overlooked a school. This meant that there were loud bells that went off multiple times a day, but this was a minor issue for us (who comes to Greece to spend all day in their room anyway!) The hotel itself is perfectly located, walking distance to all attractions & in a safe area. The rooftop terrace was definitely our highlight though. It had an unforgettable view of The Acropolis & was the perfect place for a drink & some food whilst admiring the sunset. It was a little expensive but worth it for at least one special night! All in all we would definitely return, a great hotel to base yourself while you explore this magnificent city!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel really is central! It is right next to the cathedral and only a short walk to the Acropolis, Ancient Agora, Roman Agora and other sites. And Syntagma Square and Parliament and the National Gardens are an even shorter walk the other way. It's in an really attractive part of the city called Plaka and there are many interesting shops in Apollonos Road itself and many restaurants nearby.The hotel itself is lovely, though it's a shame that the terrace bar was being renovated, and my room was very quiet. There is lots of choice for breakfast.The staff were very helpful and could not have done more to help when I unfortunately lost my wallet.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There’s no insulation at all ... it’s very difficult to get asleep with all those noises, 1. the TV from the next rooms2. The furniture from the upper floor3. You can even hear the toilet pipe from the upper floor.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a revised booking, after my initial hotel choice appeared to be in an “iffier” part of town. I am so glad. The location was superb - walking distance to just about anywhere you want to go. Breakfast was frankly the best included I’ve ever had at ANY hotel. Clean, safe, only complaint is that the rooftop terrace as under renovations during our stay, but that’s Mother Nature’s fault, not Central’s. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just 5 min walk from parliament. Clean and comfortable rooms..breakfast options were good and varied.. walking distance also from multiple restaurants and inner centre of Athens. 15 min walk from Acropolis entrance.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is excellent: clean, modern facilities and convenient. The room was quiet, very comfortable and clean, bathroom was great. And well-equipped. Location was excellent, central to all major tourist sites. Staff very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions. I would definitely stay here again if I’m back in Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked this hotel on reading many reviews on trip advisor and I had no regrets. A 5min walk away from syntagma square and close to all attractions. Very close to Acropolis. Beautiful view from the room. Rooms were small but very well maintained and clean. Breakfast spread was also good. The best is the location
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the most central place to find, very comfortable and cozy hotel, very luxurious breakfast, spacious rooms, roof with balcony overlooking the Acropolis, walking distance to the city center from any direction is about 10 minutes, Comfortably, on the eighth floor there is an amazing view of Athens and the Acropolis !!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel in Athens for 4 days in the middle of February. The neighborhood is quaint and offers views of the Acropolis from the rear of the hotel. Unfortunately the roof bar/restaurant was under construction during our visit - scheduled to be finished in mid March so upcoming visitors will be the first to enjoy the renovations. The hotel is truly centrally located - we were able to walk to all subway lines within 10 minutes. There are multiple restaurants in the local neighborhood and the Plaka/Flea Market area are within a 10 minute walk as well. An additional 20 eateries lie within and/or near the Flea Market. Regarding the hotel, we stayed in a Superior Double Room on the 4th floor. The room checked off all the boxes - clean, comfy bed, and relatively quiet on the back side of the motel. I say relatively because their is a grade/middle school on the back side of the hotel - the sound of ringing school bells is heard throughout the day as students move between classes and recesses (and on Saturday too -- apparently they go to school on the weekends in Greece). Some will be shocked by the overall size of the room - it is cozy but typical for European standards...meaning their is not a lot of extra space in the room - and the bathroom was a bit tight for my liking but manageable for the brief period of time spent in the location on a daily basis. The breakfast buffet was wonderful - new/different warm dishes daily. I was expecting the European standard of yogurt, cheese, breads, and various cereal grains -- so this was a wonderful bonus! Staff are exceedingly polite and helpful. Our room was cleaned daily and we were impressed with the housekeeping services. We would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was on a short holiday to Athens and stayed here as a central base so could seem the most of the city. It is an excellent location- in walking distance to the Acropolis, main shoping and tourist area an the the main square of the city and metro station . We have a fantastic night view of the Acropolis from the rooftop bar open I think until 11pm. One can take a taxi from the airport at Euro 55 but it is easier to take the very efficient and new metro (euro 10) and a short 7 min walk. from Syntagma Square. There are also buses but it also depends on time of travel . The hotel rooms are very spacious but my room faced inside and saw only some pipes . The room has a good bath , internet and a comfortable bed. The sofa was a bit sunk in possibly by overuse but ok. A nice work table and spacious. The elevator/ lift is VERY small and can accomodate only 3 persons at a time . This is the only negative I saw in the hotel - as it is frequently busty and you need to wait unless yo prefer to climb up by the stairs. Breakfast is on the mezzanine floor and a good spread of hot and cold stuff including eggs to order. But with such lovely variety of greek food as options - you may also want to walk around the area in Plaka and find nice bakeries and small shops if you want explore. I walked through the area right upto to the Acropolis a pleasant 20 minute walk (with a climb) and saw the Acropolis museum ( sunday free) and the Acropolis the high point of my visit. Reception at the Hotel is helpful and directs well on places to see. It was a good base to come back to as the hotel is a central base for travelling everywhere .
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for just one night as the hotel is pretty central and was not too expensive. The room and bathroom were very small and there was some noise from the local bars/restaurants. The breakfast selection was good but the 'hot' food, as in all hotels, was only just warm.I would recommend this hotel for a short stay as long as the price is reasonable.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was centrally located and that's the extend of it.we had 3 rooms and 6 og us. With my 87 and 81 year old parents my mother being in a wheelchair it was hard to manouver in the hotel. the Customer service was horrible, front desk personnel all of them had attitudes,we felt like you were bothering them by asking for directions and restaurants recommendations. The rooms were ok, nice views of the Acropolis from the room and the rooftop. WE WILL NOT COME BACK. We rather take our business elsewhere. Also the bottom level had construction being done and the noise started early in the morning.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel. My room was very nice with a view of the Acropolis. The staff at the front desk were unfailingly helpful and friendly. If I return to Athens, which I hope to do, I will stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently traveled to Athens with my sister and her kids. We spent two nights at this hotel and were very happy. The rooms are a bit small by American standards, but typical of usual European hotels. But, the room and the bathroom were both clean and comfortable. The included breakfast was also very nice. The first morning we left early to enjoy a tour and the front desk provided bag breakfasts for us. The rooftop bar had an outstanding view of the Acropolis. The location in central Athens was great and a myriad of restaurants and shops were a very short walk away.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was adequate, though the double consisted of two pushed-together twin beds. Staff varied in their degree of helpfulness; some of them are a bit cool. Breakfast staff efficient but, again, cool. Breakfast spread quite abundant, and breakfast space rather pleasant. It was cold and rainy during our stay, so we did not visit the rooftop, unfortunately. This is a pretty big hotel, and the elevator is woefully inadequate (holds two small people, without luggage, at a time). It is clear that guests were smoking in their rooms (despite "no smoking" signs) without consequence. But here's the biggie: FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, PUT A REAL DOOR ON THE BATHROOM. There is a sort of swinging, non-latching foggy-glass partition that doesn't even go all the way to the floor. Fine if you're with someone you've been married to for 30 years, but even then, perhaps a little too intimate, if you catch my drift. The bathroom itself is fairly nice, but it needs to be an actually separate room!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: great location, clean, good breakfast, efficient in booking taxi to airportCons: staff can improve in service. Unsmiling, quite curt, and stick to rigid rules, e.g. cannot bottled water to breakfast even though it is empty, reception asked us to email reservation to clarify subsequent stay a few days later instead of helping.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to this hotel with friends on vacation. The rooms were great - a decent size and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a rooftop bar with a lovely views of the Acropolis, perfect for to watch the sunset. The location is great for sightseeing.There is a good choice at breakfast was great. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for one night and found the hotel to be comfortable and well situated. We took the train in from the airport, very easy to do and much less than a taxi. Train station is a 5 minute walk away. The location was very good with many restaurants, shops and sites all within an easy walking distance. The staff were very courteous and friendly, we had asked for a room facing the Acropolis and that is what we got. The view of course was fantastic because of this. We also got to hotel early and they allowed us to check-in with no problems. We booked a Superior double room and it was a fair size, clean and bright with lots of mirrors to make it appear bigger than it was. The bathroom was small but clean and the shower had plenty of hot water. The room was very quiet, no noise issues at all. The only complaint was the elevator, it was the smallest that we’ve seen in our travels, I’m a little claustrophobic so I took the stairs.We had an early flight to Santorini so we didn’t experience the breakfast. We informed the front desk about this the night before and they were kind enough to pack a breakfast for us to go , much appreciated. We tried booking the hotel on the way back but unfortunately there were no rooms available. We stayed at another nearby hotel and it wasn’t anywhere close to what we had experienced at the Central. Overall we were happy to have booked this hotel, we felt we received good value and would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot believe this small wonderful hotel is not higher rated. From entering the hotel with first class reception area who happily offer all advice to the cleanliness is superb. Breakfast is lovely - cakes delicious. We will be back.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is probably the best hotel we got for a reasonably low price:- location - perfect. 5-15 minutes from everything.- breakfast: really really great. especially for the regular European breakfast. it's defently not continental. meat, cheese, eggs, vegetables, fruits and many more.- rooftop bar: best view in town. in your own hotel.- rooms clean, fine size, with everything you need. quiet, great shower, fridge, coffee and tea set, tv.....- very nice and kind staff.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love the location of the hotel. It allows us to admire and take pictures from the rooftop of the hotel, soaking in the breathtaking view of the Acropolis. At the same time, it is 500 metres away from the train station which is not too bad if we lug our luggage from the airport station to the nearest station, Sytagma.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved Athens and the location of this hotel is super for getting about by foot and train. There is a thriving street and square just 50 meters away with loads of little bars and places to eat. Be warned that the area away from this street felt a little edgy so only walk to the hotel down this street if you are on your own. The hotel was good for 3 stars. Bedrooms cool, spacious for a city hotel and great value. Staff were helpful and welcoming. Lovely and quiet at night and the view from the rooftop is lovely. We took a glass of wine up and had the whole rooftop to ourselves with the historial veiw!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted something central so we could see what we came to see and not spend a lot of time securing transportation. Central Hotel is walking distance to everything. Rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed. Service was excellent. Breakfast was plentiful! We'd stay here again in Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent night here on way to Tirana,chosen originally due to being within 5 minutes walk of Syntagma Square where both metro(10 euros) and express bus(6 euros) to airport leave from at regular intervals.Close to shops and bars/restaurants and also 15 minute walk to Parthenon.Actual hotel was very clean with decent size twin room,free wifi,good choice tv channels and a good shower in bathroom.Breakfast offered wide choice of hot and cold food and bonus was the rooftop bar which had a fantastic view of Parthenon.The staff were very helpful and all spoke good english.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot imagine that there is a better place to stay in Athens, than this lovely hotel. It has a perfect location-only five miutes walk from Syntagma metro which runs directly from the airport, close to the beautiful area of Plaka and walkable to all the must see sites. Our room had a wonderful view of the Acropolis and was very comfortable, with plenty of storage. It was great to have tea making facilities and a fridge as it meant we could nip back during the afternoon for a rest and a 'cuppa'. The rooftop terrace is gorgeous and we had a delicious meal there one night. Breakfast is also delicious and there is plenty of choice. The staff are friendly and helpful. This hotel is perfect for a visit to Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel

review_body: Pros Awesome views from the barGreat and helpful staffGreat breakfast everything was freshYummy drinks on the rooftop barIt has parking!Easy walk to everywhere in townConsBeds are a bit hard ok a lot hard
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel

review_body: The Central Athens Hotel is perfectly located near the Acropolis, the bustling area of Plaka, and Syntagma Square. We were able to walk to all the sites we wanted to see.Although the room was small, it was exceptionally clean and had a great view of Athens.The rooftop bar can’t be missed. The view is sensational!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an excellent choice for my family. The check-in was quick and the staff so kind.We had 3 rooms. They were not fancy but did the job. Very clean and beds were great. Bathroom was fine. The best part of this hotel is the LOCATION. It is "Central" to walk to almost anything you want to see. You must go to the rooftop. This hotel is very close to the Acropolis. It's a beautiful view during the day but at night, simply astonishing. The rooftop offers food and drinks and was very very good. The staff was excellent. My dream has always been to see Athens and my dream came true. I would stay here again. They offered a free breakfast buffet which was good. Since we left so early in the morning, the provided each of us with a sack lunch when we checked out. What a surprise. Thank you everyone for making our stay so nice.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I checked in, they said I had two reservations. They claimed I had made a second reservation through Trip Advisor that I never made. I have since contacted Trip Advisor, and they have no record of said reservation. I explained to the day manager that I only had one reservation. (Why would I need two?) He said he couldn't do anything and that I had to PAY FOR TWO RESERVATIONS! Not only did he not try to help me AT ALL, he was very RUDE. Since Trip Advisor is not responsible, I am now trying to work with my bank to get the charge off my credit card, but I'm not sure if I will be successful. This hotel may be in a good location, but their ETHICS and treatment of guests are NOT WORTH IT.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Central Athens for 3 nights from Sept 22 - 25. We were greeted with a delicious liqueur and Greek Delights. The room had a small balcony ledge where we could open the double doors and have a beautiful view of the Acropolis. The room was very modern and immaculate. The bathroom was small but functional. The only think I didn't love was the bathroom door was a more like a folding closet door lacking a bit of a privacy.The Central Athens is within walking distance to EVERYTHING: Acropolis, Plaka, Monistraki, Syntagma, Thissio, shopping, restaurants. The roof top bar is spectacular and the nighttime view of the Acropolis is stunning.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only had one night to spend in Central Athens and selected this hotel. It is in a great location to restaurants, shopping and offers a splendid view of the Acropolis! The room was small (compared to the US), but very modern and clean. The price was very reasonable. They arranged airport pickup for us and our driver (holding a card with our name) was wonderful! He was very informative during our drive. It was like a personal tour of Athens! We had to depart at 5am the next morning and the hotel prepared a nice bag of food for breakfast "to go"! We shared it with our driver because they packed enough for several people! How nice!The view from the rooftop bar at night was PERFECT! We very much enjoyed our short stay at Central Athens Hotel.Highly recommend.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly in the mix of Athens. A short 15min walk to the Acropolis and 5mins to restaurants/shopping! The rooftop is is AMAZING, a must see at night. Room cleanliness could be better, as the bathroom was musty from poor ventilation. You pay for location, not room quality.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel name says it all: a centrally located hotel in the Plaka district of Athens. Three other couples and ourselves stayed for three days and all agreed it met our travel needs. We could walk to most any place we wanted to see.This is important because traffic in Athens is heavy and the streets are narrow and not well marked. The rooms were small and clean with comfortable beds.The hotel staff was helpful and were ready to answer our questions The daily breakfast was generous and had Greek and American choices. The views from the roof top bar looked great but because of high winds and rain, we were not able to spend much time there .I recommend this great hotel for its location, breakfast and comfort.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best location! You can combine EVERYTHING! Sightseeing, leisure, great food either Greek or international, shopping! This hotel is the right choice for your accommodation and your convenience!!! All the places you want to visit like Monastiraki, Plaka, Parthenonas are just nearby. The famous shopping area located in the center, Ermou and Mitripoleos street just a breath away. Some steps further up is the Syntagma square, Kolonaki, Voukourestiou. All the streets nearby are full of cozy cafes, restaurants, bars. A city that never sleeps! Hotel Staff was very helpful and polite! Amenities of the hotel were enough, room and beds comfortable, the hotel was clean and well reserved! Strongly recommended!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only spent one night here but as soon as we arrived we were very happy with our experience. First off, our room was ready early which was such a nice treat after being on a flight for 10 hours. We were also very surprised to find that our room had a view of the Acropolis which we were definitely not expecting. The location is perfect for exploring the major sites in Athens by foot with lots of restaurants and shops close-by. The rooftop bar is a definite must, we watched the sunset while enjoying drinks here and it was just wonderful. One thing to note is that there is only one elevator and it is very small so we usually took the stairs to avoid waiting forever. Aside from that, I would definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, walking distance to the Plaka district and the Acropolis. Breakfast was good, was traveling with Gluten Free guest and their selection was great also. Rooms were clean and a good size. Great view from the rooftop bar. Overall nice and pleasant stay.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't stay here on our recent visit*, but the rooftop bar is always where we start our evenings. We've always been lucky to get a table with an amazing view, but try to arrive before the sunset to pick your spot. Order an appetizer and a glass of wine, then watch the Acropolis magically light up in slow motion as the twilight fades. You're high above the noise of the city with box seats for the dramatic light show. *We stayed in the hotel several years ago and I remember the rooms being very tidy and efficient with a wonderful breakfast.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time here and it was awesome again, front desk helped undo a double booking with Expedia, much appreciated, 40 Euros from the Airport but metro station, 4 blocks away. Watch out for the tourist food hawks they will try to pull you in.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central hotel is in a thin building wedged in between two broader ones. It’s one of those hotels where everything is micro and stylish, and lots of mirrors are needed to give the illusion of extra space. Upon arrival,we took a teeny-tiny elevator that has a maximum capacity of three teeny-tiny people up to our room. We were delighted to find that if we looked out our window at just the right angle we could actually see a teeny-tiny sliver of the Parthenon. In the teeny-tiny bathroom there was a teeny-tiny shower. There was a teeny-tiny square of hand soap and two teeny-tiny tubes of body gel, but not even one teeny-tiny washcloth. In the bedroom there was a teeny-tiny 20” tv screen and there was also a spotty, teeny-tiny WiFi signal. At least two or three times a day, we heard a teeny-tiny bell letting us know that someone was stuck in the teeny-tiny elevator. It all made me wish I had paid more attention at home when I was watching teeny Tiny House Nation on my huge ginormous flat-screen tv. But The next morning we took the teeny-tiny elevator to the huge ginormous free buffet breakfast (cereal, eggs, yogurt, pastries, and much more, all very nicely prepared) and then went up to the huge ginormous rooftop garden where we had a huge ginormous view of the acropolis just a teeny-tiny distance away. And the staff was helpful and even provided a boxed breakfast for us for our early morning departure on our last day, and the location was great, so in the end we decided it didn’t all matter that much, since in coming to Athens we always planned to spend most of our time in the huge ginormous city and only a teeny-tiny amount of time in our teeny-tiny hotel.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ProCentrally located: 5 min walk to Syntagma Square, 15 min to Acropolis, 10 min to Monastiraki Square5 min to shopping belt Ermou StPlenty of reasonably priced food outlet aroundNice breakfast spreadExcellent view of Acropolis from the rooftop barProvides packed breakfast if checking out earlyQuiet away from trafficConRoom toilet slightly smallMain lobby smells of cigarette smokeLift very small (standard for many hotels in Athens) and only one liftHelpful English speaking staff at receptionOverall a pleasant stay
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I loved this little place right outside of the Acropolis. It is a short walk everywhere and has a wonderful rooftop bar! It was our honeymoon and they even gave us a small present. I highly recommend!!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in late August for one night when we returned from Meteora and before our departure to the Islands. The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Plaka and in walking distance to the Acropolis. The rooms are remodeled and are very clean and comfortable though a bit too small. This was not an issue for us as we only stayed here for one night. We had to leave at 6AM so we did not get to try the hotel's breakfast but the receptionists were so nice and had the kitchen employees pack for us sandwiches, pastries, and juices. We LOVED the rooftop bar. The view of the acropolis from the rooftop is lovely and it was very convenient to relax at the bar before walking to dinner. There are hundreds of cool restaurants and bars just around the hotel. We found the receptionists attitude and service to be superb. We definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again if and when visiting Athens again
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister, daughter and I stayed here one night while in Athens to see the Acropolis. The positive points are the rooftop bar with a lovely view of the Acropolis, clean room, the nice breakfast & most of the staff. The negatives were the gentleman behind the front desk when we checked in. I don’t know his name but he was very unfriendly and when we asked questions, he gave the impression we were bothering him. We checked in around lunchtime on a Tuesday. Also, the elevator is, well, ridiculously small. Hopefully no one ever gets stuck in that elevator! The room was quite small and the beds were very hard. Glad we were only there for one night. The location is good but didn’t feel like we were in a very nice area of Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel to be in a good location for getting around Athens. Walking distance to so much! The rooms were enough for us space wise and had a side view to the Acropolis. We had a little issue with our room the first night where the air did not work. We were given two fans to get us through the night and were told they would have a technician come out in the morning. If that didn't fix it they would move us to another room. We survived the first night once we got fans! The next morning we were moved to another room right next to the first one. The air was much better! I find it interesting that the next night someone else was in our "broken" room. Maybe they got it fixed. I hope! I think a good thing that travelers should know is that this hotel does not provide washcloths. That was a little shock to us. We were able to buy some natural sponges on our outings to the shops. The rooftop bar has amazing views of the Acropolis. Great spot for pictures. Espcially in the evening with the sun setting.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for site seeing. All of the main attractions in walking distance.Room was clean and comfortable.Breakfast was pretty good, reasonable selection. Would be better if it had baked beans for the cooked breakfast but they rarely do in Europe.P.s. Would recommend a day/half day trip to Sounion. Public bus is 12.50 EUR return (pay on board). Go to the nearest corner of Syntagma square and turn right a little, bus stop and kiosk with the bus times just there.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here two nights so we could have one full day in Athens after returning from Santorini and before heading back to the US. The good points: great location, friendly staff, good price compared to other hotels in the area, breakfast included, nice balcony, free wifi. The bad points: the lobby smelled badly of smoke, uncomfortable bed. Fortunately our room and the breakfast area did not smell like smoke. The room was very basic and was a little outdated. It was ok and I don't regret staying here. It's a good place to stay if you want to not spend a lot.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The week previous, we had paid more to stay at the awful Athens Cypria hotel a few streets away- please read my review. We then went off to the islands and came back to Athens Central for one night and we were very happy with this hotel. They kindly minded our luggage while we were gone for free. (We just took little backpacks to the islands).Central was clean and although our room was small, it was very adequate for our needs. We were on the 1st floor so could walk up the stairs (elevator very, very slow). Our room had a balcony, which was its saving grace as it made the small room seem a bit more spacious when the doors were open. It was nice to sit on the balcony and watch Athens wake up in the morning. Internet in room was slow.Rooftop bar had a lovely view of the Pantheon. There is also an unheated jacuzzi which I imagine would be nice to come back to in the hot summer months.Breakfast was plentiful and suited us fine.The location is fabulous. We walked from the train station easily. Close by for shopping, eating and drinking. We happened upon some very cool bars in courtyards close to the hotel.Staff were welcoming and efficient. All in all a most positive experience.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a quick stay in the city of Athens. It was close to the Acropolis and all the delicious little taverns around. We walked everywhere and didn’t have a problem. The room is small but it is cozy and we had a nice view of the Acropolis. The rooftop had delicious drinks and the reception staff was friendly .
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, clean, good location, walking distance to the main attractions, and fantastic roof top view with good breakfast. A good breakfast, friendly staff. Only small complain was the Internet speed, which is something that can be improved.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel

review_body: This hotel worked well for our one night, two day stay in Athens as it is close to everything (Temple of Zeus, Olympic Stadium, Acropolis, etc). It is also located in the Plaka area which had many restaurants and shops. The room itself was very basic but clean and comfortable. The view from our room and the rooftop terrace was gorgeous.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night on a short stay in Athens it was very central and the room was very clean. The hotel staff were really nice and helpful. We enjoyed our stay at central Athens. The bar on the rooftop has a good view of the city.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Athens for the first time. We found it to be centrally located to the Plaka which is nice considering this is where all the shopping and restaurants are located. Short walking distance to most major sightseeing or bus tours. The views from the hotel room leave some to be desired while the rooftop patio is great for sunsets and views of the Acropolis during the day or night. While the elevator and rooms are small we found the hotel to be clean and adequate keeping in mind we were there to see the city and not hang out in our room. Staff was all very nice and spoke English.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel

review_body: I wanted to give this hotel a 3 stars, as the rooms were small, elevator can only hold 3 people all squeezed up, and they had 1 English channel on tv. AND jacuzzi was coldBUT The service was great, staff at the reception took great care of us. Hotel was clean. The restaurant on the rooftop had great cocktails and a fantastic view. Breakfast in the morning was good too.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central Athens Hotel is conveniently located in the Plaka and a short walking distance from Monastiraki and Psyri. The rooms are a decent size and the roof top view of the Acropolis is breathtaking. The staff was very nice and even sent us with a breakfast to go when we had an early fight out of Athens. I would definitely stay here again if I’m back in Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights , I was disappointed in our room, it was not that it was small,that it was dark no light , also on ground floor we could not even look out window as there was a small courtyard outside our window where people smoked, and the smell of smoke came in because they left the slide door open into hall, I was more disappointed as when I asked could we be moved and told no that's a standard you paid for.....but I realised later there are many standard ones if I was 1 night I would not care but 4 nights was a lot, good job the roof top terrace was fantastic , the two nights we went there we could not get seats but the lovely Gianni managed to get some outside the second night .we were very happy for that. All in all a great location , central to all of Plaka , easy to walk around. Would go again but not in room 101 .breakfast very good too and room bed clean and comfy
hotelName:

review_body: Value for money and great location right next to plaka and all the bars and restaurants but also the main train station. Rooms are small but ours was new and comfortable. staff are excellent and common areas are newly renovated.

review_body: This hotels name is most apt, as the hotel is very central in Plaka, easy walking distance to many major attractions, many bars and restaurantsThe check in was fast and efficient (katarinna was excellent), as was the transition to the room. The rooms are smallish but comfortable, the bathrooms with basic amenities were adequate and the beds comfortable.The roof top bar is a major attraction with amazing views of the Acropolis, even if you need to ignore the poor table recommendation from the Maitre de with attitude, as we did.The breakfast is also a major drawcard, really delicious with lots of healthy options.
