review_body: The Wyndham Grand Hotel in Athens was centrally located, nicely appointed with a very attentive staff. The Breakfast was good and plentiful. Good restaurants nearby and Mironi Restaurant across the Street was delicious food served by attentive staff in a charming dining area at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel mainly due to its proximity to where I was working, but it's a easy walk to Monsiraki Square and beyond to the other tourist areas. There is also a metro station very close, which is good if you're getting the train to/from the airport.First impressions were very good, my room was a very good size, nothing to complain about at all there.The breakfast is on the top floor where there is an amazing view over Athens. There are lots of cold options as well as cooked. Again, no complaints with the breakfast.The gym is very small, just two treadmills, an elliptical machine and a bike. There also isn't much space for weights or stretching etc. It was also very warm, even very early in the morning. The AC didn't seem to do much either. Not a deal breaker but something to be aware of if you want to use the gym.Overall a very nice stay and I'd happily return.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent several nights at the Wyndham, and I was very pleased. I had one of the newer and renovated rooms. Keep in mind they are very small, but every inch is well thought out and planned. There is a place for everything. The bathroom is also small, so if you are a large person you may have a problem with this hotel. But I believe that the average human will love it. It’s also in a good location and you can walk to lots of places including shopping in many restaurants. It’s pretty close to the train station also, and there is the subway right below. I spent several nights at the Wyndham, and I was very pleased. I had one of the newer and renovated rooms. Keep in mind they are very small, but every inch is well thought out and planned. There is a place for everything. The bathroom is also small, so if you are a large person you may have a problem with this hotel. But I believe that the average human will love it. It’s also in a good location and you can walk to lots of places including shopping and many restaurants. It’s pretty close to the train station also, and there is the subway right below
hotelName:

review_body: The breakfast had an extensive verity of foods and options from which to choose. The staff was attentive, friendly and helpful to those on special diets. They were accommodating and willing to look into the ingredients in the food to guarantee things were gluten-free. There was an attractive view from the dining room.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I walked in and I already felt relaxed. Spyeiolaila was very accommodating and was able to fit me in. When she started massaging me I felt very relaxed. When there was too much pressure, she lessened the pressure. I was so relaxed that I fell asleep during the facial.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a night. We took the metro from the airport and the hotel was very close to the hotel. We then went to Acropolis by metro which again was convenient because the hotel was so close to the station. The lovely girl at guest relations was very helpful too.Would 100 per cent recommend the restaurant right across the road from the hotel 'Alexander the Great'. The owner is extremely helpful and friendly and the food is divine!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I recently stayed at the Wyndham Grand for about 4 days. The hotel is quite nice, with great amenities and a fantastic restaurant on the top floor with 360 degree views and a pool. One particularly nice experiance was dinner. The views of the Acropolis are breathtaking, and the Above Team takes great care of you. Konstantinos, the Above Manager, is very attentive and has a great knowledge of the city and its history, which he is happy to share if you are interested. Moreover, he has an extensive knowledge of wines native to Greece and made a great recommendation for a light white wine to complement our delicious meal. Thank you Konstantinos and Georgia, and really the whole Above Team for such a memorable dinning experiance. We will certainly recommend it to any of our friends traveling to Athens.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Wyndham Grand for three nights with my family. We found a five stars hotel in Athens' city center with all its services and four stars rates. Enjoy your breakfast on the rooftop with a 360° view on the capital, surrounded by its white until the blue of the sea, with the shade of Aegina at the horizon. Look at the Acropolis, right in front of you, and at the Lycabettus, on your left. You can also relax and enjoy the sun at the swimming pool.No suggestion, maybe only one: both rooms and bathrooms are large but, maybe, the pavement's inclination into the shower should be increased. If you got close showers (something normal for a family) water tends getting out and spreads into the bathroom.This five stars hotel has its best at the reception. Indeed, if the front office is any hotel's business card and what the guest will remember as first, Wyndham Grand has its own strenght in it. I am talking about all the receptionists and the staff at the entrance, but with a special mention for Angie, that completely demonstrated how carefully, professionally and nicely you can receive your guests. The Wyndham scored having and her smile as the first thing you see coming in. The last of my five points is only for her! Thank you Angie!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel in the center of Athens. Room is very comfortable & the hotel staffs are very helpful. Roof top restaurant is one of the best part for the hotel. We may have the morning & night view of the Parthenon Temple.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens

review_body: This was our second trip to Athens. The hotel was very comfortable with lots of amenities. We particularly liked the rooftop lounge that had amazing views of the city. The breakfast package included a lot of variety of food to choose from. The location was close to the Acropolis and shopping area. All could be reached within walking distance.
hotelName:

review_body: Excellent hotel and service - spent 3 days on June 2019 and had an outstanding experience. The hotel is all new, clean and very nice and the Above restaurant is superb. The team was very helpful at all time and it felt very good to stay at the Wyndham Grand Athens. highly recommend this hotel. Special thanks to Mr. KONSTANTINOS from the Above restaurant for an outstanding service!

review_body: A life-saving oasis in an incredibly hot city. Me and my family of five spent a lot of time on the 9th-floor rooftop pool. Hope to return. Anna at reception was very helpful, and helped arrange transportation to the airport.

review_body: The hotel has a very nice room. On the roof top there is a restaurant where the breakfast is served and it has a beautiful view of the Parthenon. The service is perfect and the food also very good. The price is fair for the quality.

review_body: This is the best hotel I have ever been!The staff is amazing and very helpful,especially Anna and Eirina!The rooms are amazing with view at Acropolis and I want to mention the breathtaking view on the 9th floor!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The staff were absolutely lovely and helpful. Very close to the center of Athens and right next to the metro station. Thoroughly recommend staying here.Lovely people.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked our hotel through British Airways Holidays for a one week stay in Athens. Arrived at hotel and were immediately upgraded, an unexpected surprise. Staff at check-in, professional and helpful. Our room 816 was immaculate, large and spacious with city views and all of the amenities expected of a 5 star hotel. The rooftop bar, terrace and restaurant have spectacular views over the Acropolis and Lycabettus. The rooftop also has a beautiful swimming pool which although not large is perfect for a swim after a days sightseeing and an added bonus for city hotel. Restaurant and bar provide high quality food with service to match as does room service ( beware the club sandwich, which is delicious but huge) This hotel also has a excellent spa, which we would highly recommend. The hotel is located next to the metro (which is reasonable and easy to use) taxi rank outside, which will take you to Plaka and monastriraki districts (both worth a visit) for less than 5 euros. This is a hotel we would highly recommend and are looking forward to our return visit.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the place, we had a great time over there. Personel is friendly and very attentive tomour needs.Area is a bit out there but very easy to go around with the metro.A couple of nice restaurants in the neighborhood.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You must not miss having a treatment in the spa of the hotel because of the kindness and the expertise of the therapists , they will make you feel so relaxing and you will enjoy it . I recommend you the therapist Marina .
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay at the Hotel for a long weekend, met with a smile. Every one was super friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great.Has a spa facility Aegeo Spa i had the most amazing experience.When I do go back, i will book with them again.Thanks to all who made my stay so amazing.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have logged many miles and hotel stays for work and vacations and typically I ignore reviews that are this level of negative, but I write this as a seasoned traveler. I realize an experience like this won't happen to most, but know that by making a reservation at the Wyndham Grand Athens...it could happen to you. I would give a negative number as a rating if I could.I made a reservation for a junior suite, which by the pictures had extra room for a crib as my wife and I were traveling with our son who is 1.5 years old. In my reservation I noted that we would be arriving late in the evening and as noted, we made it to the hotel at 11:30pm. Having just traveled 4700 miles, the three of us were so relieved to arrive and rest. Instead of greeting us with room keys we were met by a front desk clerk who told us that as of 2 hours prior to our arrival, the water in our room stopped working. They were trying to fix it but were unable to. I have thought about this in the 24 hours since, as I write this review. So a single room in a "five star" hotel has an issue with plumbing that there is no water service to the room? And they can't fix it? It is hard for me to understand how that happens. Bottom line there was no room for us. I will say they made a reservation for us at a nearby "comparable" hotel (ended up having to switch rooms there bc it was anything but comparable). In the moment I was so exhausted I hardly had the energy to point out how absurd the situation was. An excuse that there is no running water in the room sounds more ridiculous the more I think about it. In the moment that evening I just wanted to get my family showered and in bed so I just went with it, not much else to do. The excuse that there was no running water is downright unbelievable. After telling people about what happened, their immediate response was, the water was fine, they probably gave your room away. I had come to this conclusion myself and this just confirmed it. No running water in a single room is ludicrous and unimaginable.They did provide a taxi at no cost but in my opinion that was totally missing the point. This was beyond an inconveniece. It was a poor excuse and unacceptable management. In the end we had a horrible experience at the Wyndham Grand Athens (and we didn't even stay there!) and an unacceptable stay at the other hotel. A hotel employee actually ended up entering our room in the morning as we slept, walked past a crib with a sleeping child and into the bedroom my wife and I were sleeping in. If I didn't live these events I would not believe it.Thank you if you have read this far!!! Wyndham Grand Athens management I hope you have too and I eagerly look forward to your response, in which I'm sure you will repeat your absurd excuse that the water mysteriously stopped working. I know this review is a total outlier. I take these extremely negative reviews for hotels with a grain of salt when doing online research for myself. I get that most people will have a better experience, I just wanted to let people know this type of thing can happen. Thanks for reading. I hope your stay in Athens starts better than ours!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights. Actually, we were looking for a place close to the Acropolis but followed the overwhelming positive reviews of this property. It’s a standard and practical hotel. We found a nice square a few minutes off (great restaurant called Egg of the Rooster and a bar called Blue Parrot). But you do need to be aware that it is not the best area to walk through even though my husband was more put off than I was. You will find the usual graffiti, some needles lying around (no panic, please! ) but the square is brilliant! So be aware of your surroundings but do it! Would also recommend the metro or taxi to Plaka versus walking - we had an encounter with a pick-pocketer when walking back on the morning at around 11am, no big deal but it’s there. Fine during the day, at night a ‘no-no’. For the hotel, service could be better. Housekeeping at 6pm, roof top terrace is nice but strangely angled. Service here is slow albeit very friendly.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, great view and staff, poor air conditioning in room. Thank goodness we were there in May and able to open windows wide. Hotel engineers were well rehearsed on how to handle the “no air conditioning issue”. I would not book this hotel in the summer. Otherwise, good experience.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel as it is well reviewed and conveniently located. I can only assume the flattering reviews come from those who did not have a room on the busy main street.Nicely appointed room, comfortable bed, but this counts for little if the noise of stop/start traffic constantly disturbs sleep. The rest of the hotel is as you would expect for a 4*+ hotel.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel has 1. Great location close to the Metro and not too far from the center2. Staff that has experience and very friendly.3. Rooms are specious and comfortable4. Bathrooms are clean and up to standards
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is very clean, Rooms are very specious ,coffee machine in the room , Staff is very friendly, Professional reception Close to the Metro, A recovering neighborhood the requires extra attention at night , Excellent place for conferences and meetings venues
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service and stay at this beautiful hotel was impeccable! Upon our arrival in Athens, we caught a taxi from the airport (our driver was very professional and courteous, he offered wonderful information about the area and provided information about places where we could tour). Check-in at the front desk was wonderful (we checked-in along with another couple we were traveling with, Alexandria, assisted us with our check-in, while the other couple was assisted by another associate)! Our rooms were very comfortable and clean! We actually could view the Acropolis from our room, it was such a beautiful view, night and day! Our first evening, we ate at Alexander the Great, right across the street from the hotel (just about everything is within walking distance of the Wyndham), we had a wonderful time and meal! After our meal, we returned to our hotel for cocktails. The second evening we dined at the hotel, where we received wonderful service, our server as well as the manager were very professional and made us feel so welcomed and appreciated as we dined! The meal was delicious, so was the view of the Acropolis! The ended the evening with a wonderful night cap, suggested by the manager, it WAS WONDERFUL! The best "bang" for our buck was the Hop-On, Hop-Off tour with the Blue Line! We paid $15 each for the tour, that included a walking tour of the city! OH MY GOODNESS, the walking tour was such a treat, I do believe I fell in love with Athens during our walking tour! Two tips: you do not need to drive in this area, just catch the taxi/walk (I'm not sure about certain areas at night, however, we felt safe/comfortable throughout the day). Please do not engage the street vendors/pan-handlers, unless you have true intentions of buying from them/giving them coin. Of the four places we visited during our European trip (Germany, Paris, Athens, and Burgundy), Athens was my favorite, it was just something so spiritual/uplifting about this place.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Wyndham Grand on three occasions recently, and we were pleasantly surprised. We rented a junior suite, on the 8th floor, on all three stays. The rooms were all beautiful, huge suites (at least by European standards), with stunning views of the Acropolis. The dining room, on the 9th floor, was beautifully appointed, with very good food. Breakfasts (included) tended to be crowded, but not excessively so. The dining room had the same great views. The staff were superb-- very friendly, and competent. After our first visit they remembered us, greeting us with "welcome backs", and that's always pleasing. We picked this hotel because they advertise that they provide "affordable luxury", and they mean it. If it were in San Francisco, this place would sell its rooms for four times the prices they charge. It's a bargain, and the next time we're in Athens we'll certainly stay there again. The only negative is the surrounding neighborhood is very run down, and I wouldn't walk far at night. But taxis are plentiful and not expensive, so walking is not a necessity. The fish restaurant just across the street is quite good and inexpensive. Walking there is not a problem, but I wouldn't venture much further on foot.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body:
I stayed there at 18 if April and I forgot some laundry and a phone charger. Unfortunately they didn't call me to inform me and when I found out and call them they told me that they will check and call back to me. They never call me back so I call them again. They told me they are sorry and they will check again and call me back as they find. We arrange that I will pass to pick them and when I did I had to wait more than 30 minutes to find them so I had to live without them. The customer service is kind and polite but terrible.
*As I arrange with the front desk I came back 7 hours later to pick them up from the front desk as I had agreed but unfortunately they were misplaced!! The stuff is very polite and they offer to send them to me via courier with out any charge. They need for sure to revise their procedures.Finnaly I receive my items I had forgot by my shirt is totally destroyed.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am operations director of our company, and I can say that I go around the world often, I really appreciated the sense of listening and the smile of staff at this hotel, in particular Miss Ntourou ANNA , my clients are often at the hotel and are always happy and happy when they are dealing with Miss Ntourou ANNA , the availability and flexibility of the sales Madame Vasilopoulou and remarkable, she is always available to organize our various changes. i feel in my little switzerland whenever i visit cotee hotel, all works like a Swiss watch. thank you Anne for your dedication and quality of service, thank you Alexandra for your Swiss Made attitude. %
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent two nights at the Wyndham Grand on a visit to Athens. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was large, with all the necessities such as shower gel, shampoo, and bar soap. The hotel is centrally located with a view of the Acropolis, which is especially beautiful at night from the ninth floor bar and lounge. I had two breakfasts and one dinner, all buffet style, which contained a variety of delicious dishes to cater to the broad range of guests. The staff is conscientious and cordial.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was luxurious, and the rooftop views were stunning. The rooftop pool had very limited hours: 11:00-18:30, and it was not heated. Also, on the 7th floor, we could hear people in the gym dropping weights. Thankfully we never heard it at night. Also, there is some noise from the cars on the street. Overall, it was a great choice. The area gets sketchy a couple blocks south of the hotel, but we certainly felt safe right around it, and the train was so close. Also, Alexander the Great Restaurant is right outside the front door!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel recently for a total of 6 days. I must say, the staff, from front door, to front desk, to concierge and of course restaurant were incredible! Super friendly and helpful at all time. I had to check in twice, because I was traveling to Santorini, which unfortunately that trip got cancelled due to bad weather. I travel few times a year; we all visit different locations around the world, but this is the first time in my travel life that I have remembered most people that greeted me at this hotel, and that is all because of their kindness and excellent customer service:1. Angela Toto: the lead supervisor at customer service: always polite, helpful (and she meant it) and tried her best to accommodate my hotel requests.2. Aggeliki: in Customer Relations: this girl spent more than an hour of her time to help me call different places to get my refund when my trip to Santorini got cancelled. True kindness! Thank you a million! ٌYou are an angel!3. Dimitrius, front door staff: always smiling and polite and so courteous and caring. 4. Alexandra, Christina and Despina5. The gentleman as part of front door staff, his name I can not recall, start with K! Polite and helpful.6. Alexandros in restaurant: sweet person with great customer service.7. Constanstinos, restaurant manager: great guy, with quality character that made the visit to the awesome restaurant so memorable! The hotel location is very good, close to subway and easy access. Well maintained, decent and clean. My first room was really good. Per my request, they managed to give me a better room. The second time I checked in, the room was ok, but small. They tried but due to high occupancy, it was not doable to get me a better one. The breakfast was fantastic! Great variety and quality. Service was amazing (especially that I did not receive such a good experience when I was in Milan last year). The restaurant (both for breakfast and at night) has an amazing view of Acropolis and Parthenon. On 9th floor with a swimming pool that unfortunately was closed due to colder weather. The dinner was great with great ambient music and breathtaking view of Parthenon.If I go back to Greece and Athens (which is very likely), I will stay at this hotel again for sure, and I hope most amazing people that I met here will be there in next visit!Thank you all so very much to make my trip memory so memorable! Love you all.Reza S.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a fabulous location, easy access to the metro and there’s a city tours bus stop just across the road. The staff are friendly and helpful, the room is ok and there was a lovely bottle of wine and fruit on arrival. The views are amazing from the rooftop restaurant. All in all a very pleasant stay in an amazing city!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looks almost new and modern. The rooms and staff are ok.I stayed 5 nights and the breakfast is the same every morning. I didn’t like the breakfast and the food in general. I even tried the room service and the burger has the same breakfast potatoes as during the breakfast. The breakfast has a good variety but they are using some olive oil or something and everything tastes the same. They have no egg station and all the prepaid omelets, fried eggs etc are semi warm or even cold. On the regular menu there is no Greek food just a Greek salad, chicken leg, pork, burger, pasta very boring menu. I went to the roof top bar in the evening and wanted cheese plate and a glass of wine. They have no cheese plate or anything similar just cheese and ham sandwich. At the lobby bar they make no coctails. I had issues with the room cleaning but this was rectified by the hotel. There is the red light district right in the next building. This is in a bit dangerous area and had some problems with the immigrants outside. Lots of drug addicts and needles everywhere when you go to the side next street. Some hassle with the taxis as well since they are refusing sometimes to put the meter on. The taxi station is front of the main entrance. Be careful with the shower floor since it can get really slippery when wet. It is just a plastic flooring.There is no supermarkets nothing close by no shopping only low end bad restaurants. I can not recommend this due its very bad location!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying in this Hotel every visit to Athens,Big rooms, friendly staff, best Acropolis view on the roof, huge breakfast & only 10 minutes & 5 euro to get to the center by taxi ,dining on the roof also at night is really something else.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a very nice hotel two minutes to the metro station. The staff are very kind. Great hotel and rooms, spacious bathroom, very comfy beds, pillows, duvet, good roof garden bar, convenient location, good value for money. Would recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in - as i had prepaid, did not ask if I wanted a credit card authorization, resulting in me having to pay cash and go back down again, queue to arrange an authorisationI asked 3 times for my curtain to be fixed so that light did not wake me in the mornings - eventually I tracked down the room cleaning service myself to correct.DO NOT stay in summer I had to request for my AC to be tuned on daily and it does not get cold - mildly cool. Same with the fridge - you will not make use of the bar fridge as everything is luke warmCleanliness leaves a lot to be desired - my coffee machine was not cleaned until I requested. My bathroom vanity was not cleaned for 3 days.The spa is a converted hotel room - TINY - and not private at all every conversation can be heard when you are receiving treatments.WiFi connectivity is good and the hotel is close to public transport and the hop on, hop off bus station. Taxis are easily available directly outside the hotel.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed here while traveling back from visiting greek islands, the hotel is average. Check in was chaotic although the staff was pleasant. The hotel could certainly use uplift as the bathrooms etc was old. i think for the price you pay here it wasn't worth it.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great, busy hotel and location, - nearly to busy in the morning, in the breakfast restaurant. A lot of guests, a lot of waiters, a lot of brakfast-noice: cleaning tables, refill the buffets, refill with plates, coffee-/tea pots and cutlery a.s.o. - slow down a little! The staff in reception and concierges are very friendly and helpful explaining how and where to go to special places in the city we asked for.Huge room with beautiful view to the Acropolis, everything nice and clean. Very good value.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel and spacious rooms. Staff was very friendly, helpful and especially kind with our little son - making for an even better experience during our stay. On the downside, the pool under maintenance and a strangely behaving elevator. Also, some neighboring streets did not feel too safe so better take the metro to/from there.Would highly recommend for your stay in Athens!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a gorgeous executive suite on the 6th floor. It's called an "Acropolis View" room. Know that the Acropolis is about a mile away, so it's a distant view. Nonetheless, when the Parthenon is lit up at night it is wonderful. The included breakfast buffet is served in a patio restaurant with an amazing view of Athens facing the ocean. We were astonished every morning at the view and enjoyed great food. The neighborhood is mixed. Not a place to go shopping or out to eat, but only a 15-minute walk from the Plaka marketplace, Mostraki market, and 30 min to walk to the Parthenon. Don't miss the Acropolis Museum.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the reception there are two ladies Alexandra and Maria are the kindest and very professional.Alexandra was very helpful,always with a smile and she treated us from her heart with kindness . The front office manager Mr.Spuros also was kind and professional. .Secondly the bellmAN Nikos he helped us upon our check in and each we wanted to go out.The room was very nice,clean and we had a very nice view from our room.We had the best holidays in Athens and we will come again for sure!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my birthday and we decided to stay in hotel with spa. Unfortunately it was the only looks like in the city and has a spa. Rooms are very small for two people, we had great view of Acropolis (I mean not sure why it is great:)). First day with a good mood we went walking to the city... oh noo.. it was sooo upsetting.. neighborhood was a disaster.. they offer forbitten stuff while u walking.. I was super scared.. now about spa, it is just a hotel room changed to .. something similar to spa.. we asked couple massage with full treatments and all of it for three hours actually.. one girl was super tired, the place is tiny..no again. Pool is outdoor but not a season. Breakfast was ok with nice view. So we always needed to take a taxi cause I never felt relaxed in this place to walk. They upgraded us, and they’ve done everything ontime for my birthday, I guess my partner asked. I stayed for New Year’s Eve in another hotel actually, so I don’t think I’ll come back to this hotel, just cause of location. But the staff was very very polite and helpful!!! Thanks to them!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in February 2019. The staff was very friendly when we arrived and we received a coupon for a free 15 minute massage in the spa. We booked the massage and the ladies from the spa were so friendly!! They really took their time and made us feel very comfortable, even if they knowed we were not going to pay extra for a longer massage. The sauna was also very nice! Our room was very good and this was by far the best hotel bed I've ever slept in! The bathroom was clean with a very large (rain) shower. The breakfast was one of the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had with lots of Greek specialities, which was very nice! The breakfast room was located at the very top of the hotel, with an incredible view of the Acropolis!! The hotel is located in a shady neighbourhood, but taxi's and Ubers are very cheap (4 euros to city center) and the metro is located 100 meters outside of the hotel. We always felt safe, but would not recommend to walk there alone at night. In summary: SUPER HOTEL!! Would definitely come back here next time we visit Athens!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 5 night stay in Athens got off to a great start thanks in no small part to the warm welcome we received from the check-in desk. All the staff throughout our entire stay were lovely, without being irritatingly sycophantic as can sometimes happen. They were down to earth but wanted us to have the best stay possible for our wedding anniversary. To that end, they made sure we had a stunning view from our room - none other than the Acropolis itself. I would strongly recommend the Wyndham Grand to anyone. The area of the city itself is not the most scenic, but it's easy to imagine this hotel spurring a regeneration/gentrification of the local area. Transport links are fantastic (right next door to the Metro) and the breakfast caters to all tastes.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, lovely staff. Everything works smoothly.Best thing is the rooftop restaurant and bar. Easy walking distance (20 minutes) of all the main sites. Good local restaurants. Would recommend this hotel highly
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Big hotel near the old town. This is about 2.5 kms Acropolis which is a must see place in Athens. The staff was very welcoming and enthusiastic. Though this is my first time booking with this group of hotels they have upgraded me to a better room. I didn’t have breakfast there so I am not sure how it is. I liked the room. When I gave my feedback in the hotels.com that the room is noisy they immediately contacted me and offered to change it to a quieter room. Which is very much appreciated. Station near the hotel has no elevator or escalator. There are so many stairs. As I took trains (there is no direct train or bus) from the airport I felt it difficult to exit the station with 2 bags. If you are planning to take public transport from the airport then better to take train to the nearest station with elevator and then taxi. If you are planning to take taxi then you have no problem as they can send you a ride if you request one. I slipped in my bathroom. The surface is very smooth and slippery so plz be careful.Overall it is was a good stay.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing stay! I travel every week to a different country for business, and this stay was one of the most memorable! When I arrived with my colleague, we were greeted by very friendly staff, who with a genuine smile greeted us and made us feel welcome. The receptionist - Izabela (hope I spell the names right) was very kind and warm and made the check-in quick and pleasant. The room itself was very nice, spacious, clean and well equipped - my favorite so far in Athens hotels. Then we went to a pool bar at the top of the hotel - first thing I noticed was the beautiful view of the Acropolis, but that was not the most amazing part. The staff in the bar/restaurant was extraordinary and I have never received better service. The drinks were prepared by a very friendly bartender named Alexandros - who made sure, genuinely that we enjoyed them. Then, a manager of the bar himself came to introduce himself and make sure we are happy and taken care of properly - the man named Constantinos has personally greeted us every night we visited the bar (and we did not go to any other), and most importantly made us feel like we can feel at home there. Our last night of the stay we enjoyed a very cool party in the bar, although would be better if there was more staff, since the bar was quite popular. I will definitely come back to this hotel!
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights as part of a conference tour. Well placed in the center of the city. with easy access to all places. Check in was quick and easy. Very polite staff. Breakfast was a great spread. Rooms were comfortable, It was around Christmas time, so there were many Christmas related activities going on. Check out was also quick over all a pleasant stay
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Wyndham Grand hotel is very nice although the area not pretty.Nice rooms, nice food, nice staff. At least from the top floor restaurant you have a very nice view to the Acropolis/ Parthenon. The meeting rooms are awful: in -1 floor without windows.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is easy to reach with public traffic from the airport. Room is small and basic. Room temperature was 25 degrees Celsius and although asked for fixing it two times it never was fixed. Breakfast not special and the coffee comes out of a machine. Terrible liquid! In 2019 this is not acceptable anymore.Staff more than friendly. Hotel is situated in a bad part of the city, especially after sun down. It’s recommendable to take the metro of you would like to go to the center.Their line : “affordable luxury” is a lie. Price was oke for a three star hotel.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 12 days and it was great. Thank you all but specially to Angie and Alexandra from reception and to Kiriakos from hotel entrance. He was the only one with we can german spoken. I will recommend this hotel and for sure we will stay here by next trip in Athens.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a really superb hotel , nice decoration and very helpful staff . Next to Metro Station very convenient to go everywhere in the city . The Gym is tiny but well equipped! The Acropolis view to from the Above Roof Top Restaurant it’s breathtaking !
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We can easy recommend Wyndham grand Athens hotel. They made us feel welcome, and the service was always excellent. The room, junior suite, had a very nice view to Acropolis, and the size was perfect for a family of 3. Spacious, clean and clever solutions for our needs. And the bar/ restaurant at the top is a really nice place to relax and get an overview of the city and Acropolis. For breakfast they offer a very good selection and service.
hotelName:
4    Wyndham Grand Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Areos is a quite typical city hotel. The good thing is that they don`t have any obvious weakness or problems. The staff really good and customer friendly, the interior of the room also very well, in particular, I like the bathroom. WiFi works well. So, I can recommend this place as good value for money. On another hand, there are some subjects to further improvement: 1. The breakfast is really modest. 2. in spite of the booking with free cancellation and payment at the property, the hotel charged my card for the 1 day immediately after booking confirmation. It is only the third time in my life when the hotel acts in such a manner. Then they say that they just validated the card - apparently standard EUR1 transaction doesn`t seem them as a sufficient for such purpose. 3. my request for the silent room was ignored. I was provided by the room on the 2 floor with the windows on the street.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed a few days in Athens and enjoyed the food and the sights as well as another comparable priced hotel. Sadly, this hotel leaves a lot wanting. While the staff are friendly and the rooms and bathroom in particular are very nice, the location is not nice at all, you couldn’t have the curtains open without been overlooked, and the breakfast was by far the worst we have had. There was little cutlery and or mugs to use, all the tables were covered in used plates that had not been cleared, and the food was reminiscent of a bad school meal rather than a hotel. I would recommend looking elsewhere.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Areos is a first rate hotel. I can hardly believe it has only three stars. I have stayed in much inferior four star hotels. There are so many good things to say about it but what made it outstanding was the staff. Usually I prepare thoroughly before going on a trip to a new place - guidebooks, websites and so on - but on this occasion I did not and so asked for information and suggestions form the reception staff. They were extremely helpful , giving recommendations for restaurants nearby and how to get around the city and how to get to the beaches. When we left they booked us a taxi to a station on the line to the airport so that we would not have to change. They always had time for our questions and were exceptionally professional and friendly. They all spoke very good English.Our room was a "small double" but it was much larger than rooms in many hotels we have stayed in. It was perfectly clean, the bed was comfortable and although it was on the road side of the building we were not disturbed by traffic at all. There were plenty of lights so reading at night was not a problem. There was a fridge with a couple of bottles of water provided. The bathroom was a decent size and had a good shower. It had a large wash basin and a plug that worked - not something that can be assumed in Southern Europe. There was no safe in the room reception was happy to keep some important documents for us.The hotel is not in the busiest tourist area and so by walking round the area we got a feel for the "real" Athens. The nearest metro station is Victoria which is a ten minute walk away. Breakfast in the hotel was adequate but not outstanding - the only thing about the Areos that I would categorise as merely "good". Curiously there was no fresh milk, only yoghurt for the cereal and German-style cartons of processed milk for the coffee. Perhaps this is a Greek thing.I did not realy enjoy my 4 day trip to Athens but this had nothing to do with the hotel. I can only recommend that visitors take extra care of their belongings, especially on the metro from the airport. I had my wallet stolen from the front pocket of my trousers (where I thought it would be perfectly safe) when changing trains. It seems that this is a frequent occurrence. I would suggest that you keep your cards, documents and cash separate from each other. Theives seem to be interested only in cash and mobile phones. If you hold your backpacks in front of your body rather than on your back it may make it harder for theives to get at any of the contents. The Hotel Areos was a very good hotel and I would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great find. Quite cheap for Athens but really good facilities. A quiet, comfortable room, helpful staff and very good breakfast. We wished we had booked it for longer. We were catching the bus to Cape Sounio the next morning and this was ideally placed for the bus stop.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Our room was clean, comfortable and the two balconies - one on either side gave a spacious feel and provided a clear view across to the Lycabettus Hill It is conveniently located close to the main bus terminal and National Archaeological Museum, however be aware it is located outside the main tourist area. Staff were very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Areos is 3* hotel located near the centar of Athens. This is small beautiful hotel with good rooms, extra clean and big enaugh for stay. Near hotel is everythig you want to visit, 5 to 20 mins walk.What I am thanks for is that we have late flight and dear recepcionist tell us we can stay in room until we must go on airplane without pay anythig. Thank you Areos❤
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a few yards from the Radisson Blu, this little hotel is a gem of a place. While the rooms are small, no amenities or facilities are missing. Great service, welcoming friendly receptionist. Outstanding breakfast. Can strongly recommend to those on a budget yet looking for all comforts.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb hotel! Location is very convenient and staff very friendly. Amazing breakfast included in the price of the room and rooms super clean. Frank at reception made our stay a 10/10! Epharistou polli! :)
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Hotel was very clean, staff were very friendly. Hotel is in very good location. Breakfast was simple, but everything you needed. You get maximum for what you paid for.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel. Friendly staff who gave us some great recommends about places to go and eat. Check out Atitamos restaurant nearby. Nice bar for a drink and easy traveling into city centre. Couldn't recommend more.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute hotel with friendly staff and sufficient breakfast. Rooms were quite small, but with nice bathroom. The location was not that pleasant, and a little far from the historic center by foot. Transportation was easy, bus stop and train station within 5 minutes walking.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Athens for business and we booked the hotel last minute. The price is normal, the location is great cause it’s close to metro station Victoria and for the night close to kolonaki. The rooms were decent but out of date. The breakfast was ok but it could be much better.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights. Room was clean and spacious.Breakfast had good selection. Staff were helpfull too when needed information from them,The only issue i was not too pleased about is the area around the premises. Did not feel it was so safe to walk around in the evening so we used to take a taxi downtown for 5 euro each way. Would recommend Areos and revisted any time.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a few days at the Areos Hotel this past September. The hotel is up to date, very clean, rooms are modern with all the amenities, and the breakfast was outstanding (nice variety of continental and Greek items -- especially the Greek yogurt with honey and fresh fruit!). But the person who outdid himself for us was the manager Francisco. He is a ray of sunshine and someone who will do anything to make your stay enjoyable. Francisco assisted us in every way possible, from scheduling cabs to suggestions on what sites to see. We hope to return just to see him again! Thank you for making everything superb for us, Francisco!!
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Areos hotel is approximately 3 minute walk from the Victoria underground station, located in a side street about 50m from the Radisson park hotel and opposite a pleasant park and recreation area. We had a warm welcome at reception and were swiftly given our room key, the room was clean and well laid out, bathroom was clean with enough towels, shampoo etc. It turned out to be quite well located for our exploration needs. Just like most of Athens there is a large amount of graffiti in the area, but everyone we spoke to was friendly, the hotel has a small bar and coffee shop located on the ground floor, breakfast is also served on the ground floor. Hotel has friendly and helpful staff, would certainly stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After arriving here from another part of Athens, we were very relieved to have found this hotel and had everything we were looking for not to mention amazing front staff at the desk.Bedroom was very clean and comfortable and the breakfast was great.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most comfy beds in our 15 night journey through Greece. The staff was very accommodating and helpful and the breakfast was excellent. They even made us some coffee and cake before our very early morning taxi pick up. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Complimentary breakfast is great and location is good. Only complaint is that the large bed was composed of 2 smaller mattresses that they put together to make 1 large bed. Everything is else is excellent.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice welcoming staff. Clean room on 4th floor with balcony but sadly, ants started appearing in the washroom and then the room itself. I HATE ANTS! I have no idea if this is throughout the hotel, will let you know once I have spoken with management.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:Comfortable bedFull sized showerGood breakfast buffetGeorge at the front desk had several good suggestions for restaurants Cons:Neighbourhood feels very sketchy at nightNo room safe - which unfortunately meant that I was carrying all of my remaining cash when I was hit by a pick pocket on the Metro at the nearby Victoria stationFan runs all the time when the bathroom light is on
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is fine although when our driver picked us up the first thing he said was “oh your hotel is where the anarchists occupy buildings” lol. But if you stay away from certain areas you don’t feel unsafe. The check in itself was lackluster. The front desk didn’t tell us anything about the hotel or area except what time the bfast was. It would’ve been nice to be given a little info about the area. The bed is two twin beds put together, which inevitably leads to a crevice. The pillows are fine. There was no safe in our room or coffee /tea machine. And there was no shower just a tub with a handle spray so you kind of awkwardly have to shower with one hand. The breakfast is a highlight and the guy overnight - 6am shift was the only front desk person that ever acknowledged us leaving or even smiled us. Overall, not a bad hotel you get what you pay for and I prob wouldn’t stay here again. But it may fit other people’s needs.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable, if small, rooms with a balcony and a small kitchenette in the entranceway (no cooking implements though, so not sure if you're supposed to use it!). Rooms are very clean and the shower cubicle is nice and roomy with plenty of hot water and a great shower head. It is within 200m of the National Archeological Museum (well worth a visit) and walking distance to some very nice restaurants (the reception staff recommended a really nice place within reach). Breakfast is included and there is an excellent little espresso bar right next door - very good coffee. Wi-fi is free and connection is good. There is a Metro station close by and it is a short taxi ride to a Metro station that goes directly to the airport. The staff were very helpful, the hotel is in a reasonably nice area of Athens (of which there are not many, unless you want to pay top dollar, in Syntagma for instance). I stayed one night on the way back from the Sporades and found it more than acceptable.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited greece this summer wanted a place that was'nt far from all attractions, This hotel was perfect position, The subway was not far a 10 minute walk away also the staff was Knowledgeable and curtious. breakfast was good and also the bartender filippos was also of great help besides making great drinks, also the room was always clean and in perfect order. what else to say that i reccomend this place to anyone who is looking for quality and cost.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly located near the Hop On Hop Off stop near the Archaeological Museum. Friendly staff, neat and clean little place with free breakfast buffet Best Western style. Nice bar/lounge. Priced fairly as well. Good value
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Partner and I stayed five nights in July 2018.Pros:- It is not exactly in "city center" but consider to be in the center. It takes 20 minutes on foot to reach Monastiraki square, straight ahead walking.- The hotel is clean and the room was convenient.- The area and the hotel was safe. Actually we had not a feeling of unsafely during the our Athens trip.- The price and the services are match. Do not expect a luxury.- Breakfast was good and worth it.- Front desk was helpfulI recommend this hotel. Enjoy your trip to Athens!
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came back to this hotel for a second time didn’t disappoint they rolled out the red carpet for me I had one the nicest rooms or ever been in Frank Lopez is a true champion Harris the best George the best Steffani the best all of the employeesThank you for your great service truly amazing
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfect. EAsy to get to via train line, the staff that work there are so accommodating. Not only did they agree to recieve a drivers license fromHome I had sent over (I forgot to bring) but the day we checked out it was before breakfast time and they had arranged a little breakfast for us. Rooms are clean and no issues with shower etc. their local recommendations for dinner and food were top notch. highly recommend this hotel!!
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in athen with my husband for 1 day and we booked this hotel. And i must say, i was impressed.THE STAFFS WERE SUPER FRIENDLY :First of all, i came to the hotel early and i asked whether i can get an early checkin (most hotel that i stayed in europe asked for extra fees to do an early check in) since my luggage was broken somehow during the flight and i couldnt get around with a broken luggage, and the staff was so helpful, he gave me a free early check in and an upgrade for our room.THE ROOMThe room was nice with a mini balcony and the view was great too. The room was not that spacious but it was enough for us, the bath room was spacious and clean. The water worked really well. And they provided towel and toiletries too. THE BREAKFASTquite of options, juice are good, bread and pastry were nice. THE SERVICEVery helpful staffs and friendly. They lend me a phone to make a local phone call to my airline to settle my flights for free. Oh my god this hotel is really nice and one of a kind. Overall i highly recommend to stay in this hotel if you ever visit athens. Near this hotel ther’a a station for HOHO bus, so travel-wise it wont be difficult for you to travel aeound the cityEnjo athenAnd thank you Areos hotelPutri
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night before heading to Santorini. It is super clean, friendly staff, short walk to the Metro. Breakfast was very good. The evening front desk gentleman nailed it perfectly with a restaurant recommendation that was about a ten minute walk. Will recommend to friends coming to Greece in spring 2019
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel within easy walking distance of Parthenon and the National Archaeological Museum of Athens. It's also just a short ride from the center of town and Syntagma Square.The rooms vary in size, mine being one of the smaller, but very comfortable rooms. While some overlook the Parthenon my view was a lot that had an old building and overgrown lot. I intended to only spend time sleeping so the view was of no concern. The room was very clean, great air conditioning, and more than comfortable. The hotel provided needed amenities including shower caps, shampoo, hair conditioner, lotion, Greek olive oil soap, a small sewing kit, and other necessities. There was a nice sized flat screen television which had a USB port that I used for charging my phone and table. The bed was firm, but not uncomfortably so. I couldn't hear any noise from other rooms or outside, a plus for sure.A a healthy and tasty continental breakfast is provided, including Greek yogurt, eggs, various breads - both sweet and plain, fruits and of course juices, coffee and tea.I would recommend this hotel and definitely consider staying again.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Areos Hotel is a small hotel that delivers a lot of value, and most of all they deliver a level of service well above the cost of the room. First class..... while the rooms are a little small by USA standard, they are very comfortable and fill any needs for folks traveling to Athens. The breakfast is way more that USA standards !!!! Great start to the day of sightseeing. Very easily located, if you buy the City Sightseeing bus tour $18Euro the stop is around the corner at the museum and that will take you to all the sights in Athens for the day...or taxi - very cheap too ... again a great stay, and would highly recommend (and i am very picky, so this is a great value - just disregard the graffiti as this is part of a free culture in the area)
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is amazing! Our room was not ready when we arrived, but it was not a problem, the receptionist kept our luggage and advised us to explore. When we got to the room, it was spotless and it was kept like that throughout our stay.I appreciate the hard work of the room attendants. Special thanks to them, as they are often overlooked. Of course, the rest of the staff was great, starting with both receptionist and on to the breakfast girls. Plenty to choose from the breakfast selection. Thank you again, and if we will ever visit Athens again we will definitely stay at Areos!
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful, lovely and extremely helpful staff who truly go above and beyond every expectation. Breakfast 5 stars, Staff 5 stars, Cleanliness 5 stars, Atmosphere 5 stars. Fantastic value for money!They made us feel at home and apart of the family! I actually have most of them added to facebook now so I can stay friends.I can not rate them or praise them highly enough. I stayed for 5 days/nights with a group of friends and I will definitely go back when I return in the future.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 6 travelling for a Martial Arts Convention / Competition.The hotel was nice, clean and well located for our trip.The stand out of the stay was the staff who did everything they could to make our stay great !We could not speak highly enough of the following staff:Geogre and especially Dimitris who worked in the bar, Harris on the Front desk and Stefania and Evi who looked after us at breakfast in particular.Thank you so much, and we will be sure to stay again if we find ourselves in Greece again !
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from Victoria metro station. It is about thirty minutes walk from the main attractions of the Acropolis. The hotel is comfortable, clean and staff are friendly and accommodating. The reception is open for 24 hours and will help you with ordering taxis or providing directions. Breakfast is served from 7.30am until 10.30am is has a good range of food - Bread, pastries, ham, cheese and bacon. The bar is open until midnight and offers a good range of spirits, soft drinks and cocktails. I definitely recommend the Mojito!!!. A great base to explore Athens with a great range of nearby restaurants. I would stay at Areos again if I visit Athens.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed in a lot of hotels, and I’ve come to realize that the entire star system doesn’t mean all that much. Hotels are given points based on things like whether or not it has a restaurant, which really means nothing about the quality of the hotel itself. I’ve stayed in two star hotels that have been quite nice. At the same time, I’ve stayed in four star hotels that were run down and disappointing. This place is rated three stars, but I’d say it’s quite a bit nicer than that. Everything was clean and modern, with new fixtures and a very spacious shower. I read one review where someone complained about the lack of slippers being provided, and...really? You need someone to tuck you in at night too?I think my only real suggestion would be that they should get a little art for the rooms, as the walls look somewhat bare. It is in Athens after all, so there’s no shortage of photos of ancient art and sites they could hang up. Also, the people at the front desk were all extremely helpful and seemed genuinely interested in how I was doing and how they could help, especially a nice fellow with a British accent. As for the location...well, here’s the thing. This is a couple of blocks away from the Archaeological museum, and is maybe 20-30 minutes walk from the main tourist area. I had no problems walking there at all. I saw families, and didn’t feel unsafe. But if you’re from the US and this is your first trip out of the country, Athens can be rather intimidating. The urban planning is poor or nonexistent, meaning the majority of the buildings were cheaply constructed to satisfy a massive influx of people several decades ago. They’re now feeling the effects of time, and many look dilapidated. The infrastructure is crumbling, meaning you’re going to see dirty and broken sidewalks pretty much everywhere. It’s also noisy, and smells of exhaust. So yes, it was noisy outside the window of the hotel, but it didn’t bother me. I’m sure it’s going to be like that most anywhere in town. And the graffiti...oh, the graffiti. In the US, graffiti means “bad neighborhood.” In Athens, I think it’s just part of the culture, because it’s everywhere. Athens is not bad. Athens is not dangerous or unsafe. And in no way am I trying to say this hotel is in a bad area, because it isn’t. There’s a Radisson right next door, and even in the ritzy areas of town, you’re going to find really high-end shops on the ground floor of buildings that look quite run down. And if you don’t want to walk down to the Acropolis and shopping areas, there’s other ways of getting there. The metro stop is about five minutes away, although I found the metro to be very crowded, no matter the time of day. You can also hop in a cab very easily, and like everything in Athens, they’re cheap. I don’t think it every cost me more than five euros to get anywhere I wanted to go. Just know that unlike most people I encountered in Athens, many of the cab drivers barely speak English — and if you’re like me, your pronunciation of Greek is very poor. So, maybe be prepared when you get in with a picture on your phone of where you want to go, or just lean in the window first and see how good their English is, or if they can understand where you want to go. Anyway, that was probably more information than any of you wanted, but I felt the need to counteract some of the reviews I’ve read that state this hotel is in a bad area of town, because it isn’t. Like any big city, keep an eye out for your belongings — but I’d say you’re far more likely to get pickpocketed in the Plaka or Monastiraki Square areas than you would around the Areos Hotel. Long story short, I’d highly recommend this place. It’s a very nice hotel, and the staff is excellent. Athens is a city everyone should see, and this is a great place to hang your hat.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have just stayed at the Areos Hotel for a three night weekend break. The hotel was perfect for us, good location (near a train station and within 30 minute walk to all major attractions) the breakfast every morning was lovely and the room had everything we needed. It was on the small side but we didn’t spend much time in the room so we weren’t bothered. The staff were very friendly and gave us some good advice on what to do and how to avoid queues. I would definitely recommend staying here for a short stay in Athens.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just spent a couple of nights at the Areos, my 3rd time in two years, and twice this winter. If you prefer a budget hotel that is small and intimate, with impeccable service, this is the place for you. Perfect value for money. It is not smack in the center of Athens, but not too far either. My favorite restaurant in the area is Rozalia, - perfect Greek food at a very reasonable price.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was very quiet. The bed was comfortable. The hotel was spotless. Very nicely decorated . Very large walk in shower room. TV good. Staff were very nice, helpful and understanding. The breakfast was good. Self service. Cold and hot. This hotel is 5 minutes away from the Architecture Museo.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is down a side street but within easy walking distance to the station and hop on hop off bus. We had booked a triple room which just had an extra bed in a normal room so it was a bit cramped but we just needed to somewhere to sleep so wasn’t any bother. It was very clean and the bathroom was supplied with all the toiletries you could need and replaced as they were used. Breakfast had a good selection so anyone could find something they liked.George at the from desk was very helpful with giving directions. If you go into the city center be careful of pick pockets, one of our party had her phone stolen from her bag as we were walking along and only knew because someone had seen the thief! Needless to say we didn’t get it back.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small boutique hotel is a total MUST for all travellers who don’t want to spend a fortune, without sacrificing quality.Small, compact, design, friendly, central, clean, smile, breakfast, quality, are some of the key words connected to this hotel.Excellent rooms, with the most comfortable beds I’ve try the last few months. And Extremely clean!Located very central, near the national archaeological museum, and opposite of one of the main parks of the capital.All the young people working at Areos Hotel, are so friendly and always ready to assist you with any enquiry you may have.Overall, my 2 days sleep over at Areos Hotel, was a great, pleasant & more than value for money experience.This small hospitality jewel boutique hotel provides ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ services, with the budget of 3.FULLY RECOMMENDED 9,5/10
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a really lovely 5 nights stay here on our first visit to Athens.Our room was perfect, fresh bright & spotless, with very comfy bed & excellent shower. There was a fridge & small cooker but I couldn't see the point of it as there were no pots or plates or anything else that you could use.It would have been nice to have a kettle or microwave instead.Breakfast was lovely with great variety and served until 10.30.Staff were so friendly & helpful with excellent English.Great price hotel & easy to get into the city with the metro & buses nearby & nice to walk also. This hotel was a great choice.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, modern hotel with lovely staff. Rooms aren't huge but they're big enough. Breakfast isn't amazing but it's decent and there is plenty to fill you up for the day. Overall a great place for the price and the most important things are taken care of - cleanliness, functionality and friendly staff.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I rated this hotel as excellent because it is true to how it is represented. This hotel is a gem. It is not in a super-touristy part of town (meaning the market bazaar-type places), but only 2 stops on the metro from Monistiraki Station where all of that is located; however, it is only a few blocks from the Archaeological Museum and a few other attractions. Harry, and the other hotel staff, were super-friendly and helpful with suggestions on places to eat, transportation, etc. The room, itself, was fabulous. Unlike other places, you get a separate card to put in the slot for you electricity so, while we were still conscientious, we were able to leave our air conditioning on low during the day to keep the room cool if we went out. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was AMAZING. The water pressure was great and the shower is HUGE. It has an overhead rainbath shower head, hand held and faucet option. The hot water is VERY hot, so be cautious. In the room, there is a blackout panel you can pull if you would like to sleep in. There is also a small kitchenette with a hot top, sink and mini-fridge. I will caution, if you are not used to street noise or are bothered by it, you may wish to request the quietest room available. We were in 203, which faced a fairly busy street.Also, if room-service is big to you, the food items available are limited. We stayed the last two nights of our trip here and were not disappointed. We got some really good sleep and headed to the airport refreshed. I did not add photos as the ones already on Tripadvisor and on Google are accurate. Thanks to Harry and staff - hope we see you again someday!
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recommend Areos hotel whole-heartedly. Of course, the location is excellent and the cleanliness wonderful - both things that are very important to us, and are important for every hotel.However, the factor that makes this hotel stand above the rest as a wonderful place to stay is first and foremost THE EXCELLENT STAFF.We can't stress enough how each and every member of the staff that we met were kind, thoughtful and helpful.Most of our interactions were with the wonderful Frank and Harris from the front desk and there was no end to their good will and knowledge. It is a pleasure to meet such good people in general, and especially when you travel. They always offered their assistance and advice freely and in the most pleasant way. As we were travelling with children it was heart warming to see how the whole staff of the hotel treated them with warmth and good humor. We would also like to thank the two young ladies and the young gentleman who served breakfast, who were extremely nice and kind.I cannot think of a better hotel to stay in when you visit Athens – it really is the whole package. And when you meet good hearted people in your travels it makes the trip that much more special.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights here.Staff very pleasant, courteous and attentive.Room good size woth great bathroomHad small balcony on quiet side (over looking wasteland). Front bedrooms over road which can be busy at times and noisy. Only downside to room - air con inadequate and did not keep the room cool. In 30c + heat - this was a must.Breakfast tasty and adequate with plenty of choice.Would recommend.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 7 nights in this hotel and we say that it is a hotel suitable for a long stay. The servise very friendly and the room was clean and comfy. The bathroom was perfect. Room was small but perfectly fine for two people. Breakfast was normal but the same menu each day. The hotel is pretty quiet at night which was also a plus. The room had a good AC thanks to which you can live through every hot night in Athens.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in the upper floor suite. It is a very spacious apartment with a seating area facing Lykabettus Hill. Bedroom is comfortable, very bright and has glass windows-doors on both sides. There are also a large terrace and even additional balcony from bedroom which we did not use due to some chilly weather in April. But we enjoyed our inside seating area with a view while having afternoon tea with sweets from local bakeries. Long corridor leads to a spacious bathroom. Honestly, I think that the spa-bath design is too unnecessary fancy and I did not figure out how to use it except as a shower. It was slightly uncomfortable for me to get it and out because of very high bath tub and narrow glass door access. Nevertheless, shower head was wonderful and water pressure was excellent. Needless to say all was very clean.Hotel personal is young, friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was good. WiFi worked well. We were not disturbed by street noise to notice it or to comment about it. We found hotel location as totally safe. Walk to metro station was easy and short; and one time we walked down to Monastiraki without transportation. Archaeological museum is really close to the hotel; and it turned a bonus for us as we went to this museum twice during our short stay. Archaeological Museum collection is so marvelous and rich and grand that one visit is not enough.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Great staff. Love my Greek peeps. Harris, British George, frank Lopez, stefania, Dimitri, sweaty hands, Mr George, Vanessa, Calypso, maids amazing, rooms great. Loved my stay there. Thank you
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Areos Hotel in late May, we honestly did not know what to expect as we knew this wasn't a chain but it fit our budget well. We were so pleasantly surprised by the service, from start to finish. The staff was incredibly accommodating. Our first room was ok, a little outdated but we did love the fact that slippers were included, A/C and location was essential. We realized we would not be staying in the hotel the entire time as the city of Athens awaited us so we weren't hung up on it. The location was KEY. It is literally in the heart of everything. We walked to all places and never felt scared or uncomfortable. The Victoria metro station was about 5-10 minute walk away which was exactly what we needed to get around everywhere. As we traveled to different islands and would be coming back to stay at Areos hotel, the concierge held our large pieces of luggage until our return, which was CRUCIAL for us. Here is the real gem of the hotel: The front desk concierge Harris, he is an essential asset to the hotel. His recommendations for food, places to visit, bakeries to stop by, were key in making our stay comfortable and efficient. Being from NYC, we're particular about our food choices, but his recommendations were spot on!Harris took great care of us and when we returned he kindly upgraded our room and after a long few days of traveling, it was truly a blessing in disguise. This was EXCEPTIONAL customer service. My boyfriend and I were so grateful for his help, we stopped by a famous bakery shop and got him some goodies to show our appreciation for his kindness.Yes this place is not The Plaza, it is much better. Hospitality was wonderful, the breakfast was delicious, and Harris was a great example of above and beyond customer service. Thank you Areos Hotel and Harris+staff, we shall return hopefully sooner than later!!
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On my 2 week tour of Greece this is where we started and eventually ended our journey. One thing about Athens I learned is that it looks like a slum, full of graffiti and posters, flyers. This is a non-chain hotel and doesn't look like much from the outside but inside it is great. Incredible front desk staff either at 2pm or at 4am. I think is about 6 floors, if you don't count the '0' floor most European buildings use. Directly across the street from the Metro rail system and just a short four blocks from the National Archeology Museum. Very first rate rooms with all you would expect. Complimentary breakfast which runs longer than posted hours and you can have lunch or dinner as well. The front desk staff can give you simple directions to wherever you want to go. I had forgotten to bring my small 'day-pack' and they told me where to go to find some local shops, where I did find what I was looking for. The best aspect was when I had a bottle of Limon cello I wanted to share shots with the members of out group. I wasn't sure about bring your own drinks to a hotel bar, but the bartender had no problem putting my bottle into their freezer (it need to be ice cold) and even supplied us all and poured it into the 15 shot glasses at no charge or questions. We let him have one too. As I said the rooms are fairly standard for most hotels, but the service, advice, and hospitality put them over the top. Wish I remembered the name of the night time bartender but he is the best.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
