review_body: We stayed in Areos for 3 nights.Check-in was smooth, we got our room straight away.We got a room on the front facing the street so naturally it was a bit noisy from the traffic, but what can you expect in the center of a capital city?We didnt open the windows because we had aircon so it was ok.The room was nice and clean, and for our surprise the shower was massive.I mean it could have fit about 5 people.That was a big good brownie point for the hotel.I can't say much about the room.It was as expected, clean, the size was reasonable and the bed was comfy.The location was ok.Near a metro station, about 5 mins walk, with some coffee shops around.The breakfast was typical hotel breakfast: toast, egg, jam, butter, some fruits, yogurt, muesli, etc. It was fresh and delicious.No complains.The staff is very nice and helpful.One guy recommended a very nice restaurant too as a local and we were very happy with the that found.On the last day we were going to take an early leave (5:30am) but it was not a problem at all.They even prepared a little snack/breakfast just for us.Check-out was smooth too.I would definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: good hotel for somebody who is looking for:1) cheap hotel2) close to centre (using metro the hotel is 10 minutes walking from Victoria station, Victoria station is 2 stops from the centre)3) quick stop/stay and go4) clean hotel
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights while we were in Athens prior to flying to Crete. The hotel is not in a fancy neighborhood by any means, but we felt safe waking between the hotel and Plaka (historic area with wonderful shops and restaurants). We stayed in the suite on the 7th floor and we actually had the entire floor. The balcony wrapped around the room and we could see the Acropolis, too! Definitely not the greatest hotel ever, but we enjoyed our stay. The bath tub/shower in the room was strange as it had more options than any shower we have ever seen (radio, steam, jacuzzi, rainfall, etc), but once we figured out how to operate it, we were happy. We took taxis to and from Athens airport and they have flat rates now, so don't worry about getting ripped off unless you don't pay attention to the new flat rates to Athens from the airport.
hotelName:
5    Areos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well situated within walking distance to great restaurants, market, shopping, and sites!Be sure to go to the rooftop bar/restaurant that overlooks the Acropolis! You can also view a glorious sunset from there too.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights, this hotel is conveniently located, hospitable staff, excellent view from our room and the dining room has a beautiful view of the Acropolis! The service and food was wonderful. The room was nice, large bed, clean and roomy.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights. Although expensive, but all of the hotels were, it is in an excellent location near the Plaka area, and so close to the Acropolis. The room top bar had been refurbished recently and was amazing. The views over the Acropolis and Athens were stunning. It looked a little run down outside in the street with lots of graffiti, but we found this all over Athens, and this location was one of the better ones. The reception was good and all staff were friendly. Rooms were small but very clean and beds were large and comfortable. The bathroom was tiny, shower wasn’t brilliant with a dated shower curtain, and the shower gel/shampoo etc was cheap. The breakfast was included and had so much choice and was very fresh and tasty, served in a lovely breakfast room. All in all a good choice. Close to Syntagma metro for the 40 minute trip to the Airport.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 15 minute walk to the Acropolis and lovely view from the rooftop restaurant/bar so well worth having dinner here in the evening - need to reserve a table . Staff - as you expect in Greece - are very friendly and helpful. The room was very tight and the 2x3 metre mirror opposite the bed - which presumably is to give a sense of depth - is just weird... could create the same effect without going full length. Air con is centrally controlled so very warm in the morning. Still good option for a short stay in Athens right in the heart of the Plaka
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, friendly staff. Rooms were very clean, on the small side, but that is Greece for you. We stayed in a standard double room, double bed, bathroom with shower and toilet, wardrobe with safe, tv, telephone, tea, coffee and kettle also a small bar fridge. We stayed here on our arrival in Greece, then the day before we left for home. Breakfast was very good, cold meats and cheese, cereals, sweet cakes, bacon, eggs etc, tea coffee, juices. Very friendly service by all the staff. The hotel was not far from Parliament, Apollo and the Acropolis, short walk to each of these.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we were 2 friends sharing a room on the 3rd floor - a room with a small balcony.it was quiet, and the balcony was a treat.the room is adequate size for 2 good friends to share.the batheroom room is not sealed so take that in consideration.the service was very welcoming and helpful andthe jewel in the crown is the roof-top restaurant with the perfecr Acropolis roof - great for drinks and dinner - please reaserve.the location is amazing - so it totaly worth the money.the only flaw was that the room was'nt cleaned seriously so we complained and it was fixed immidiately.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were referred to this hotel by another hotelier when he could not meet our request for twin beds in our rooms. The hotel worked hard to get us into our rooms, having just got off a long international flight. To wait for our rooms, we were directly to the rooftop terrace where Alex did a magnificent job hosting us. The ambiance was wonderful, the views incredible and the food amazing. We were directed to a table on a beautiful patio and enjoyed incredible, fresh pizzas. Our trip to Greece began here and it was a great start. The rooms were beautiful and the staff could not have been more helpful. Anything from helping us with local connections, to printing out vouchers -- the staff at this hotel really aimed to please. The hotel is also ideally located. Highly recommend this property!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, the rooftop bar is nice and the breakfast was better than expected. My main complaint is that the air conditioner was not sufficient to cool the room. We mentioned it on the 2nd day of our stay, when we returned late we realized that nothing had been done. We were too tired to change rooms. Opening the window was not an option as we were above some exhaust from a kitchen and the room would stink. Had we been comfortable at night I would have no complaint. AC definitely needs to be upgraded.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice modern hotel with a delicious buffet breakfast. Short walk to all the points of interest in Athens. Beautiful view of Acropolis from a roof top bar. Rooms are a little small but very large beds. We got an amazing price when we booked ahead. Not sure I would pay full price but was a great place to stay.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfection location and was close to everything we wanted to see. The rooftop bar was a great spot to sit and have a cocktail and watch the sunset over the Acropolis. There was so much on offer for breakfast, plentiful and delicious. Our room overlooked the Acropolis which was pretty special. The staff were friendly and always went out of their way to help. Would definitely stay there again. Oh and so reasonably priced too!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A 5 minute walk to the Plaka, 2 mins to the main shopping street with restaurants everywhere plus 15 minutes up to the Acropolis. 5 star location. Roof top restaurant & bar with uninterrupted views of the Acropolis. Good breakfast, helpful staff. We had a room on the 6th floor with a balcony. The bed was comfortable & bathroom good also. If we return to Athens the CHA would be hard to beat for our needs.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We payed 128/per night for this hotel and i regret it.Its in a very good location but thats not enough for such a high rating! I have been to much better hotels with half the price in Athens Center. Very small rooms with a really old air conditioning.No stand for the shower, you need to use your hand and hold it! Smelly halls...Its nothing like the photos, they could of been much better but they arent! The stuff are very friendly.Breakfast is 6/10Too much better options around the area that are much cheaper! For sure not a 4star hotel...
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently visited the hotel with my mom. Every hotel has pros and cons and this hotel too had somePros: 1. Good location2. Beds were comfortableCons:1. Corridors are dirty and smelly2. Rooms are very small3. Bathrooms are very small4. Shampoos/conditioners very bad quality5. Moisturizer is bad and smellyI won’t stay here again!!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right, here it goes. Very unsure with how to rate this hotel whether to put it down as a 3 or 4 stars, so I’ve opted for 4 stars.We turned up to the hotel and the outside it’s opposite a busy food market which is lovely, a nicer sight to see every morning. But the location of the hotel is excellent, a 15-20 minute walk from the acropolis and Plaka and a 5 minute walk from Monastiraki. But the area where it’s located is where all the immigrants live. I’m far from a snob but it’s dirty, dark and full of men leering around, it made me and my family very uneasy walking back here at night, so keep an eye on your pockets.The lobby is nothing spectacular but sometimes simple is better, we went to check in and the man was rather rude behind reception as he didn’t understand much English, but we spoke to a younger lady and she spoke good English and was more friendly. The lifts are tiny, there’s only two of them and could only fit two people in with suitcases and even that’s a tight squeeze.The rooms are very clean, rather modern and spacious. I love that they had air corn and provided toiletries (soap, shampoo, shower gel). The downside to the rooms was that when we book a double room, we expect a double bed and not two single beds pushed together. They have a roof top terrace with tables and chairs, sun beds and a bar. We a splendid view. The view of the acropolis is amazing and you also have a beautiful view of the rest of the city. It’s also open until late (midnight).The breakfast was ample, nothing amazing but it had everything you needed to fill your stomach for a long day ahead of you. A mix between hot food and continental and coffee and juice. The tables are very limited so if you have breakfast try and go as early or as late as you can to ensure you have a space.Overall, the hotel was quite nice. So it’s lovely hotel with clean rooms, a good breakfast and perfect location. It’s worth the money.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a quiet location in the centre of old Athens within a 10 minute walk of the acropolis and two metro stations. We had a view of the Acropolis from our window on the fifth floor and the terrace bar upstairs has a great view as well, although they weren’t particularly welcoming when we went to look when we first arrived. It’s a shame they don’t offer guests a complimentary glass of wine up there to encourage patronage. Instead there is complimentary liqueur in the small clean rooms with good mattresses and hot shower. Reception staff were efficient but not overly friendly. Breakfast was on the lower floor in a big well decorated modern restaurant area, however the food was average. If I could have given 3 1/2 I would have but it’s definitely not s 4 in my opinion.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here the first week of May. It’s a short 7 minute walk to Syntagma metro station on a quiet side street. The area may look seedy on first glance, but it is 100% safe! The hotel room is very basic and small, but that is all we needed as we were out and about all day. The location of the hotel allowed for us to take a break in the room at times before journeying off to explore during the day.You are less than 5 minutes walk from many quality restaurants and shops. Breakfast was very good with many options. Room was very clean during the stay and thermostat was able to be adjusted easily for comfort. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked in for 6 nights accommodation. Room was clean and tidy but a little small. Had 2 suitcases but could only keep one open due to the room size.Amenities were fine and had a large dining room for breakfast l. There was much variety and should cater for most people’s needs.Staff were very courteous and happy to help answer and questions we had.Unfortunately the roof top was being renovated whist we were there and didn’t have a chance to experience the views. I believe it was opening the night after we left. I expect the views would be spectacular.All in all a pleasant stay and would recommend to couples as Location is great with easy access to public transport, shopping etc.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 2 nights based on Athens travel agent recommendation. Location is excellent. Reception area is nice enough, rooms are clean, but hallways are gross (stained, crumbling), and rooms are so basic (nothing on the walls) and need updating. I expect 3 star hotels to be basic, but not dirty and broken. Glass bathroom "door" doesn't allow for any privacy. A/C in one of our rooms was very noisy. Safes in both rooms did not work.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night by default because Expedia had a mix up with our reservation at another hotel (which we were supposed to stay at). Upon arrival, check-in was smooth, quick and efficient. Lobby looked new. Location was good - walking distance to major attractions. The rooftop was also closed for renovations at this time. Elevator was super slow (and stopped working at one point). Our room was quite small and the space was not functional, but the room was clean. The bathroom also had a damp/mildewy smell. Wifi in the hotel room was weak - could only access it in the lobby. Given we were only there for 1 night after a long travel day (and leaving early at 6AM the next day), it was okay to catch some shut eye.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is within walking distance to the Acropolis and staff was friendly to help us with our room accommodation. Rooms are basic, but comfortable with air conditioning. The WiFi was fast, although we didn't always have the best reception from our room. The breakfast buffet had a lot of options. Would recommend this place if you're looking to get the most out of seeing the central Athens area by foot.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel really is central! It is right next to the cathedral and only a short walk to the Acropolis, Ancient Agora, Roman Agora and other sites. And Syntagma Square and Parliament and the National Gardens are an even shorter walk the other way. It's in an really attractive part of the city called Plaka and there are many interesting shops in Apollonos Road itself and many restaurants nearby.The hotel itself is lovely, though it's a shame that the terrace bar was being renovated, and my room was very quiet. There is lots of choice for breakfast.The staff were very helpful and could not have done more to help when I unfortunately lost my wallet.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There’s no insulation at all ... it’s very difficult to get asleep with all those noises, 1. the TV from the next rooms2. The furniture from the upper floor3. You can even hear the toilet pipe from the upper floor.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just 5 min walk from parliament. Clean and comfortable rooms..breakfast options were good and varied.. walking distance also from multiple restaurants and inner centre of Athens. 15 min walk from Acropolis entrance.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked this hotel on reading many reviews on trip advisor and I had no regrets. A 5min walk away from syntagma square and close to all attractions. Very close to Acropolis. Beautiful view from the room. Rooms were small but very well maintained and clean. Breakfast spread was also good. The best is the location
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the most central place to find, very comfortable and cozy hotel, very luxurious breakfast, spacious rooms, roof with balcony overlooking the Acropolis, walking distance to the city center from any direction is about 10 minutes, Comfortably, on the eighth floor there is an amazing view of Athens and the Acropolis !!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was on a short holiday to Athens and stayed here as a central base so could seem the most of the city. It is an excellent location- in walking distance to the Acropolis, main shoping and tourist area an the the main square of the city and metro station . We have a fantastic night view of the Acropolis from the rooftop bar open I think until 11pm. One can take a taxi from the airport at Euro 55 but it is easier to take the very efficient and new metro (euro 10) and a short 7 min walk. from Syntagma Square. There are also buses but it also depends on time of travel . The hotel rooms are very spacious but my room faced inside and saw only some pipes . The room has a good bath , internet and a comfortable bed. The sofa was a bit sunk in possibly by overuse but ok. A nice work table and spacious. The elevator/ lift is VERY small and can accomodate only 3 persons at a time . This is the only negative I saw in the hotel - as it is frequently busty and you need to wait unless yo prefer to climb up by the stairs. Breakfast is on the mezzanine floor and a good spread of hot and cold stuff including eggs to order. But with such lovely variety of greek food as options - you may also want to walk around the area in Plaka and find nice bakeries and small shops if you want explore. I walked through the area right upto to the Acropolis a pleasant 20 minute walk (with a climb) and saw the Acropolis museum ( sunday free) and the Acropolis the high point of my visit. Reception at the Hotel is helpful and directs well on places to see. It was a good base to come back to as the hotel is a central base for travelling everywhere .
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was centrally located and that's the extend of it.we had 3 rooms and 6 og us. With my 87 and 81 year old parents my mother being in a wheelchair it was hard to manouver in the hotel. the Customer service was horrible, front desk personnel all of them had attitudes,we felt like you were bothering them by asking for directions and restaurants recommendations. The rooms were ok, nice views of the Acropolis from the room and the rooftop. WE WILL NOT COME BACK. We rather take our business elsewhere. Also the bottom level had construction being done and the noise started early in the morning.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel. My room was very nice with a view of the Acropolis. The staff at the front desk were unfailingly helpful and friendly. If I return to Athens, which I hope to do, I will stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was adequate, though the double consisted of two pushed-together twin beds. Staff varied in their degree of helpfulness; some of them are a bit cool. Breakfast staff efficient but, again, cool. Breakfast spread quite abundant, and breakfast space rather pleasant. It was cold and rainy during our stay, so we did not visit the rooftop, unfortunately. This is a pretty big hotel, and the elevator is woefully inadequate (holds two small people, without luggage, at a time). It is clear that guests were smoking in their rooms (despite "no smoking" signs) without consequence. But here's the biggie: FOR THE LOVE OF GOD, PUT A REAL DOOR ON THE BATHROOM. There is a sort of swinging, non-latching foggy-glass partition that doesn't even go all the way to the floor. Fine if you're with someone you've been married to for 30 years, but even then, perhaps a little too intimate, if you catch my drift. The bathroom itself is fairly nice, but it needs to be an actually separate room!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to this hotel with friends on vacation. The rooms were great - a decent size and clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. There is a rooftop bar with a lovely views of the Acropolis, perfect for to watch the sunset. The location is great for sightseeing.There is a good choice at breakfast was great. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for one night and found the hotel to be comfortable and well situated. We took the train in from the airport, very easy to do and much less than a taxi. Train station is a 5 minute walk away. The location was very good with many restaurants, shops and sites all within an easy walking distance. The staff were very courteous and friendly, we had asked for a room facing the Acropolis and that is what we got. The view of course was fantastic because of this. We also got to hotel early and they allowed us to check-in with no problems. We booked a Superior double room and it was a fair size, clean and bright with lots of mirrors to make it appear bigger than it was. The bathroom was small but clean and the shower had plenty of hot water. The room was very quiet, no noise issues at all. The only complaint was the elevator, it was the smallest that we’ve seen in our travels, I’m a little claustrophobic so I took the stairs.We had an early flight to Santorini so we didn’t experience the breakfast. We informed the front desk about this the night before and they were kind enough to pack a breakfast for us to go , much appreciated. We tried booking the hotel on the way back but unfortunately there were no rooms available. We stayed at another nearby hotel and it wasn’t anywhere close to what we had experienced at the Central. Overall we were happy to have booked this hotel, we felt we received good value and would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is probably the best hotel we got for a reasonably low price:- location - perfect. 5-15 minutes from everything.- breakfast: really really great. especially for the regular European breakfast. it's defently not continental. meat, cheese, eggs, vegetables, fruits and many more.- rooftop bar: best view in town. in your own hotel.- rooms clean, fine size, with everything you need. quiet, great shower, fridge, coffee and tea set, tv.....- very nice and kind staff.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved Athens and the location of this hotel is super for getting about by foot and train. There is a thriving street and square just 50 meters away with loads of little bars and places to eat. Be warned that the area away from this street felt a little edgy so only walk to the hotel down this street if you are on your own. The hotel was good for 3 stars. Bedrooms cool, spacious for a city hotel and great value. Staff were helpful and welcoming. Lovely and quiet at night and the view from the rooftop is lovely. We took a glass of wine up and had the whole rooftop to ourselves with the historial veiw!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted something central so we could see what we came to see and not spend a lot of time securing transportation. Central Hotel is walking distance to everything. Rooms were clean, comfortable and well appointed. Service was excellent. Breakfast was plentiful! We'd stay here again in Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot imagine that there is a better place to stay in Athens, than this lovely hotel. It has a perfect location-only five miutes walk from Syntagma metro which runs directly from the airport, close to the beautiful area of Plaka and walkable to all the must see sites. Our room had a wonderful view of the Acropolis and was very comfortable, with plenty of storage. It was great to have tea making facilities and a fridge as it meant we could nip back during the afternoon for a rest and a 'cuppa'. The rooftop terrace is gorgeous and we had a delicious meal there one night. Breakfast is also delicious and there is plenty of choice. The staff are friendly and helpful. This hotel is perfect for a visit to Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Central Athens Hotel is perfectly located near the Acropolis, the bustling area of Plaka, and Syntagma Square. We were able to walk to all the sites we wanted to see.Although the room was small, it was exceptionally clean and had a great view of Athens.The rooftop bar can’t be missed. The view is sensational!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an excellent choice for my family. The check-in was quick and the staff so kind.We had 3 rooms. They were not fancy but did the job. Very clean and beds were great. Bathroom was fine. The best part of this hotel is the LOCATION. It is "Central" to walk to almost anything you want to see. You must go to the rooftop. This hotel is very close to the Acropolis. It's a beautiful view during the day but at night, simply astonishing. The rooftop offers food and drinks and was very very good. The staff was excellent. My dream has always been to see Athens and my dream came true. I would stay here again. They offered a free breakfast buffet which was good. Since we left so early in the morning, the provided each of us with a sack lunch when we checked out. What a surprise. Thank you everyone for making our stay so nice.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Central Athens for 3 nights from Sept 22 - 25. We were greeted with a delicious liqueur and Greek Delights. The room had a small balcony ledge where we could open the double doors and have a beautiful view of the Acropolis. The room was very modern and immaculate. The bathroom was small but functional. The only think I didn't love was the bathroom door was a more like a folding closet door lacking a bit of a privacy.The Central Athens is within walking distance to EVERYTHING: Acropolis, Plaka, Monistraki, Syntagma, Thissio, shopping, restaurants. The roof top bar is spectacular and the nighttime view of the Acropolis is stunning.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly in the mix of Athens. A short 15min walk to the Acropolis and 5mins to restaurants/shopping! The rooftop is is AMAZING, a must see at night. Room cleanliness could be better, as the bathroom was musty from poor ventilation. You pay for location, not room quality.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel name says it all: a centrally located hotel in the Plaka district of Athens. Three other couples and ourselves stayed for three days and all agreed it met our travel needs. We could walk to most any place we wanted to see.This is important because traffic in Athens is heavy and the streets are narrow and not well marked. The rooms were small and clean with comfortable beds.The hotel staff was helpful and were ready to answer our questions The daily breakfast was generous and had Greek and American choices. The views from the roof top bar looked great but because of high winds and rain, we were not able to spend much time there .I recommend this great hotel for its location, breakfast and comfort.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only spent one night here but as soon as we arrived we were very happy with our experience. First off, our room was ready early which was such a nice treat after being on a flight for 10 hours. We were also very surprised to find that our room had a view of the Acropolis which we were definitely not expecting. The location is perfect for exploring the major sites in Athens by foot with lots of restaurants and shops close-by. The rooftop bar is a definite must, we watched the sunset while enjoying drinks here and it was just wonderful. One thing to note is that there is only one elevator and it is very small so we usually took the stairs to avoid waiting forever. Aside from that, I would definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't stay here on our recent visit*, but the rooftop bar is always where we start our evenings. We've always been lucky to get a table with an amazing view, but try to arrive before the sunset to pick your spot. Order an appetizer and a glass of wine, then watch the Acropolis magically light up in slow motion as the twilight fades. You're high above the noise of the city with box seats for the dramatic light show. *We stayed in the hotel several years ago and I remember the rooms being very tidy and efficient with a wonderful breakfast.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time here and it was awesome again, front desk helped undo a double booking with Expedia, much appreciated, 40 Euros from the Airport but metro station, 4 blocks away. Watch out for the tourist food hawks they will try to pull you in.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ProCentrally located: 5 min walk to Syntagma Square, 15 min to Acropolis, 10 min to Monastiraki Square5 min to shopping belt Ermou StPlenty of reasonably priced food outlet aroundNice breakfast spreadExcellent view of Acropolis from the rooftop barProvides packed breakfast if checking out earlyQuiet away from trafficConRoom toilet slightly smallMain lobby smells of cigarette smokeLift very small (standard for many hotels in Athens) and only one liftHelpful English speaking staff at receptionOverall a pleasant stay
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in late August for one night when we returned from Meteora and before our departure to the Islands. The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Plaka and in walking distance to the Acropolis. The rooms are remodeled and are very clean and comfortable though a bit too small. This was not an issue for us as we only stayed here for one night. We had to leave at 6AM so we did not get to try the hotel's breakfast but the receptionists were so nice and had the kitchen employees pack for us sandwiches, pastries, and juices. We LOVED the rooftop bar. The view of the acropolis from the rooftop is lovely and it was very convenient to relax at the bar before walking to dinner. There are hundreds of cool restaurants and bars just around the hotel. We found the receptionists attitude and service to be superb. We definitely recommend this hotel and will stay again if and when visiting Athens again
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister, daughter and I stayed here one night while in Athens to see the Acropolis. The positive points are the rooftop bar with a lovely view of the Acropolis, clean room, the nice breakfast & most of the staff. The negatives were the gentleman behind the front desk when we checked in. I don’t know his name but he was very unfriendly and when we asked questions, he gave the impression we were bothering him. We checked in around lunchtime on a Tuesday. Also, the elevator is, well, ridiculously small. Hopefully no one ever gets stuck in that elevator! The room was quite small and the beds were very hard. Glad we were only there for one night. The location is good but didn’t feel like we were in a very nice area of Athens.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for site seeing. All of the main attractions in walking distance.Room was clean and comfortable.Breakfast was pretty good, reasonable selection. Would be better if it had baked beans for the cooked breakfast but they rarely do in Europe.P.s. Would recommend a day/half day trip to Sounion. Public bus is 12.50 EUR return (pay on board). Go to the nearest corner of Syntagma square and turn right a little, bus stop and kiosk with the bus times just there.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The week previous, we had paid more to stay at the awful Athens Cypria hotel a few streets away- please read my review. We then went off to the islands and came back to Athens Central for one night and we were very happy with this hotel. They kindly minded our luggage while we were gone for free. (We just took little backpacks to the islands).Central was clean and although our room was small, it was very adequate for our needs. We were on the 1st floor so could walk up the stairs (elevator very, very slow). Our room had a balcony, which was its saving grace as it made the small room seem a bit more spacious when the doors were open. It was nice to sit on the balcony and watch Athens wake up in the morning. Internet in room was slow.Rooftop bar had a lovely view of the Pantheon. There is also an unheated jacuzzi which I imagine would be nice to come back to in the hot summer months.Breakfast was plentiful and suited us fine.The location is fabulous. We walked from the train station easily. Close by for shopping, eating and drinking. We happened upon some very cool bars in courtyards close to the hotel.Staff were welcoming and efficient. All in all a most positive experience.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a quick stay in the city of Athens. It was close to the Acropolis and all the delicious little taverns around. We walked everywhere and didn’t have a problem. The room is small but it is cozy and we had a nice view of the Acropolis. The rooftop had delicious drinks and the reception staff was friendly .
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel worked well for our one night, two day stay in Athens as it is close to everything (Temple of Zeus, Olympic Stadium, Acropolis, etc). It is also located in the Plaka area which had many restaurants and shops. The room itself was very basic but clean and comfortable. The view from our room and the rooftop terrace was gorgeous.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights while visiting Athens for the first time. We found it to be centrally located to the Plaka which is nice considering this is where all the shopping and restaurants are located. Short walking distance to most major sightseeing or bus tours. The views from the hotel room leave some to be desired while the rooftop patio is great for sunsets and views of the Acropolis during the day or night. While the elevator and rooms are small we found the hotel to be clean and adequate keeping in mind we were there to see the city and not hang out in our room. Staff was all very nice and spoke English.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wanted to give this hotel a 3 stars, as the rooms were small, elevator can only hold 3 people all squeezed up, and they had 1 English channel on tv. AND jacuzzi was coldBUT The service was great, staff at the reception took great care of us. Hotel was clean. The restaurant on the rooftop had great cocktails and a fantastic view. Breakfast in the morning was good too.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights , I was disappointed in our room, it was not that it was small,that it was dark no light , also on ground floor we could not even look out window as there was a small courtyard outside our window where people smoked, and the smell of smoke came in because they left the slide door open into hall, I was more disappointed as when I asked could we be moved and told no that's a standard you paid for.....but I realised later there are many standard ones if I was 1 night I would not care but 4 nights was a lot, good job the roof top terrace was fantastic , the two nights we went there we could not get seats but the lovely Gianni managed to get some outside the second night .we were very happy for that. All in all a great location , central to all of Plaka , easy to walk around. Would go again but not in room 101 .breakfast very good too and room bed clean and comfy
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotels name is most apt, as the hotel is very central in Plaka, easy walking distance to many major attractions, many bars and restaurantsThe check in was fast and efficient (katarinna was excellent), as was the transition to the room. The rooms are smallish but comfortable, the bathrooms with basic amenities were adequate and the beds comfortable.The roof top bar is a major attraction with amazing views of the Acropolis, even if you need to ignore the poor table recommendation from the Maitre de with attitude, as we did.The breakfast is also a major drawcard, really delicious with lots of healthy options.
hotelName:
3    Central Athens Hotel
6    Central Athens Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights in the AD and liked both the location next to Acropolis Museum and a convenient tube station. Very friendly people and owner in the hotel and convenient and clean rooms. Beautiful breakfast terrace with cool view of the Acropolis and very good coffe! Plaka area for going out is around the corner and try the tasty Restaurant Indian Haveli close by in case you want some non-Greek food for a change. The supermarket next door is also a plus.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay!We had a junior sweet with a balcony facing the Acropolis. The truth is that it was too hot to use the balcony... but the room was nice. Very comfortable bed and a great shower. Nice coffee machine in room. Excellent breakfast!!! Many Greek delights. A real great way to start the day. But the best of the best were the marvelous men from the front desk. They were friendly. They were helpful. They were absolutely great!!!! From making my reservation... till our check out. Thank you!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at AD Athens for two nights before joining a cruise. The location was perfect, the view of the Acropolis from the rooftop restaurant was fabulous. The staff were so helpful, making sure we had everything we needed and arranging taxis, would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location. Beautiful, modern room with comfortable bed. Perfect for our short stay in Athens. We loved the rooftop bar and enjoyed having a drink while looking at Acropolis. The staff were exceptionally helpful and let us check out late and booked our taxi for us back to the airport. Highly recommend!!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel, the location is excelente, everything is really really close. The staff service, especially from Angelo was above expectations. The room is big, clean and the rooftop has the most amazing view to the Acropolis.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is in the best location possible in Athens, literally a 4 minute walk to the acropolis and museum, Plaka and about 15 minutes to the Ancient Agora and shopping district of Ermou Street. It is in a lovely area close to pedestrian streets with restaurants. The rooms are very small but relatively modern and the service is excellent especially Angel who was the loveliest and most helpful person. The breakfast is ok but the best part about it is the rooftop bar where you have your breakfast or you can have a drink there in the evening. It has the most beautiful view of the Parthenon. Spectacular!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed this small hotel when we stayed one night on our way to the Greek Islands. Service is very friendly and was trying their best to accommodate our early check-in request. While rooms are not large, they are nicely laid out with modern furnishings. Great central, but quiet location in walking distance of many restaurants, shops and Acropolis. Excellent roof top bar with view of Acropolis. Would be my first pick for another stay in Athens.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s just 3 minutes walking to the entrance of Acropolis. Athen subway is very close to the hotel. The guests can see the night view of Acropolis on the top floor.  The front desk staffs are friendly and attentive.They can provide many good informations of Athen’s sightseeing. Special thanks to Mr. Angelos, a very nice and professional staff when we check in and check out.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a very good spot. It is just down from the Acropolis museum. The hotel is an area full of decent restaurants and fast casual places. Geared for tourists, so not five star dining of course. The Acropolis is just up the hill, an easy walk, and the Athens gardens and Temple of Zeus are down the hill. All worth seeing. The Temple of Hephaestus is about a 15-20 minnute walk through all the tourist shops, restaurants and gelaterias. The temple is in a paid park, but worth the cost (8 euro?) as it is the most preserved of all Greek Temples. The Parliament is also a 15 minute walk but NOT a must see. It is connected to the main shopping street, which is good if that’s what you want. The hotel is relatively new (2 years?) and is a nice boutique. The rooms are perfect - small but normal by European standards. The bathroom is nice and modern. One of the nicest features, beyond it being new and the location, is the rooftop bar and breakfast. Nice view of the Acropolis and Parthenon. I recommend this hotel as a nice “base”. Have fun.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best choice we did was to choose this hotel on our quick holiday in athens. It is right on the acroplis train station, and it's in the middle of the action!Rooms are big enough for 2 with complete toiletries, comfortable bed (even if it's just two joined single beds), and cozy ambience! The rooftopbar/restaurant is small yet perfect for a nice morning breakfast overlooking the acroplis. Staff especially Angelo and the two other men in recption are very helpful and friendly since the time of booking until departure. They are well trained but naturally hospitable. Try also Mani mani restaurant which is 10 mins from hotel. They serve the most amazing Greek food in athens! Thanks to the front desk guys for excellent referral! Definitely we will stay here again if we have the chance to visit athens in the future!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel is right at the foot of the Acropolis, just yards away from the Metro train station and right next to the lively neighborhood on every tourist map, Plaka. What’s more, Angel at the front desk gave us thoughtful tips. When he heard my son liked the Greek myths, he prepared a map pointing out where to see sites dedicated to the various gods in Athens. There’s also a fantastic gyros stand diagonally across from the hotel. They were the best among the three gyros places we visited including the famous Thanasis in Syntagma Square. The room was small but not unusual for Europe. It featured a cool shower with vertical shower heads. Another plus: you can have a great breakfast with views of the Acropolis.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful hotel, tucked into a side street just one block from the Acropolis Metro Station, and within easy walking distance of the side entrance to the Acropolis. Restaurants of many types are easily within walking distance. Our room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast had a suitable variety of food, although none of it was hot or warm. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful, with advice about restaurants, sights to see, transportation, local stores, and any other topic. From the rooftop bar, the Acropolis and Parthenon are easily visible, and especially beautiful at night (see picture, taken one evening while sipping a glass of a local liquor). When we had to leave very early our last day to catch an early flight, since we left before the breakfast was open, they even arranged to have a box breakfast ready for us to take to the airport. I was very pleased with this hotel, and would not hesitate to recommend it to others.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a very nice and charming experince to be there. Very good staff very polite and helpful to us. Food was good also. Walkies are nice and must try. Room was quiet good and with impressive views i like most.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a 36 hour stopover and choose this hotel for the location. I took the metro from the airport which was 18 euros round trip and was an easy way to get there since the metro stop is so close. They were able to check me in early. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms small but clean and modern with a comfortable bed. I found a hop on/hop off bus close to hotel. Breakfast was amazing and the view spectacular. They held my bags after checkout. I also purchased a local sim from the airport for 22 euros and 10 gbs data.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at AD Athens on our first trip to this city. The room was small but quiet, very clean and modern! The staff were extraordinarily friendly and really demonstrated what customer service is all about! The breakfast each morning was hosted by a lovely woman and the meal was delicious! The hotel is located under the Acropolis and there is an amazing view from the little bistro upstairs. The metro is just a few meters away from the front door and there are several wonderful restaurants nearby. This place is a gem! We would certainly go back again!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights here. Akropoli metro entrance only a few steps away from this hotel. Fantastic location. Lots of good food within 2 minutes (try Liondi). Great service, friendly, helpful, front desk ( one of the most helpful was Panos)and breakfast staff. I posted Actual view from rooftop restaurant, very near to akropoli. Highly recommended, will return.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 8 nights over the Christmas Holiday. The hotel is perfectly located across the street from the Acropolis Museum and 100 feet from a subway station. But the thing that makes this hotel a winner is its small size and great staff (especially Donato). Everyone was incredibly nice from making suggestions, and giving directions to arranging day trips for us. I can't say enough nice things about the quality of the rooms and breakfast, etc., but it was the service and the attentiveness to detail that really stand out. One great moment was eating breakfast on the top floor and watching the sun come up over the Acropolis. Excellent!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was booked after reading the TripAdvisor reviews. It’s in a great location- within walking distance to acropolis & other neighborhoods such as Plaka, if you like longer walks. One piece of information which wasn’t easily available online is that the hotel does NOT have parking. If you have a car, then it better be tiny (ex. Smart car) because street parking will be challenging. The hotel is modern. They keep the entry door locked & the front desk person lets you in. Like most European elevators, there’s is tiny. The room we were in was spacious. Bathroom was nice, especially the shower with spa panel. The drainage inside the shower wasn’t the best. Bed & pillows were comfortable. Refrigerator and safe come in handy. Breakfast was impressive for a boutique hotel. Very nice selection with a view of acropolis from the dining area. Anna was there to greet us each morning. Overall, I’d recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at AD Athens last week and were happy with the stay and the rooms. We had two rooms and both were relatively large rooms. The hotel is located right next to the Acropolis Museum and within a 2-3 minute walk from all the tourist attractions. The neighborhood is safe and very vibrant. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They arranged airport transfers for us with a taxi driver who was knowledgeable and equally friendly.One suggestion I have is if they could add a sliding door to the shower. The shower is quite fancy but the enclosure is pretty small and without a door. So, the water tends to splash out easily. This didn't cause much discomfort for us but something for the owners to think about.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having stayed in Athens several times, i had quite a precise idea about what hotel I would like, and accidentally stumbled upon this little gem, which had it all.It has the most perfect location near the main walking street that windles around several historic sites and is close to the Plaka and other lovely streets with a magical atmosphere to hang out in. Metro is practically on the doorstep as well. Also, the hotel and its room are beyond stylish. In spite of the area the hotel is quiet and offers great sleep and relaxation not even mentioning the wonderful breakfast on the rooftop terrace overlooking - what else - the Acropolis. Rooms are clean, and staff is just amazing. Friendly, professional, and with a great knoweldge not only of Athens, but somehow also of what to recommend you personally.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are clean and comfortable, the staff is very cordial, and the location is ideal. This hotel, though fairly small, offered us everything to make our stay in Athens wonderful. There are many nice restaurants within walking distance.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small boutique hotel is in the PERFECT location for seeing the major sites. All are within walking distance and the metro station is steps away. Also right in the middle of many good restaurants and shopping. Welcoming staff with good rooftop breakfast. We stayed in the suite with a wraparound balcony and stunning view of the acropolis. Well worth it.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New boutique hotel located conveniently right outside Acropolis station. Just one min walk to many recommended restaurants on tripadvisor below the hotel, two min walk to the Acropolis museum and three min walk to the Acropolis. Five min walk to Plaka.Despite being in such a bustling place, the hotel is located on a quiet side street, with views of the Acropolis from the hotel’s bar. You can’t beat that! Attentive and friendly hotel staff. Thank you for packing breakfast for us as we had to catch a very early flight. The free upgrade and bottles of wine was a pleasant surprise for us. Room was clean, bathroom was spacious and good toiletries. The breakfast selection is small which consists of mainly cold food like yogurt, fruits, cold cuts and toasts. Hot and cold drinks are self service. Though it doesn’t boast hot breakfast buffet like many hotels, it is good enough. If you don’t like what is offered, there are three to four cafes just below the hotel that you can go to.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay. The staff were all very nice and helpful. It’s just outside the Akropoli metro station and a stone’s throw away from the Acropolis museum and the south entrance to the Acropolis. Breakfast and drinks at the rooftop were great too with views of the Acropolis hill while you dine or have a drink. The rooms are clean and new.In addition, there’s a nice cafe called Froots next door and also a great Italian restaurant nearby.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location and staff were top notch. Very clean room. TV included BBC World News for us news junkies. Mini fridge. Fancy shower nozzle. Amazing breakfast on the 6th floor area with a lovely view of the Parthenon (don't forget to visit up there after dark). The only negatives- the smoke alarm kept going off due to someone smoking in their room. And we couldn't adjust the room temperature .On our second morning there, we had to depart before breakfast was served, so the staff made up breakfast boxes for us with ham & cheese sandwiches, bananas and cookies. So thoughtful (and appreciated).
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved staying here, great location, rooms were great, outstanding staff, extremely friendly and helpful, Angelo on front desk deserves special mention as does Alice, but all the staff were superb !
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has apparently recently refurbished. The rooms & bathroom were clean and modern, the guy that welcomed us at reception spoke English, Spanish and even French..Excellent breakfast, plenty of choices & overlooking the Parthenon...It is that centrally located that we didn't need to use public transport at all, all the important sites are within walking distance Definitely great value for money.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here one night. Super clean room, nice toiletries offered and good shower. The patio where breakfast is served was really nice and came with a spectacular view from the rooftop- also serves as a nice place for a late night drink as it doubles as the bar at nighttime. Staff on arrival and departure were SUPER helpful, which is why I give this place 5 stars. We went to dinner not far from the hotel in the Plaka area- highly recommend this area. This hotel is super walkable to anything you could need. We took taxis to and from the airport, which was the flat rate of 38 Euros (an Athens rule). The drivers will try to up the price when you go to the airport from the city centrer, so be sure to confirm the price before you get in the taxi! For all travelers to Greece, be aware, Greece has unique plumbing and does not allow you to flush toilet paper. Yup, do not flush any toilet paper or else you may back up the plumbing system. This is Greece wide and really not a big deal (same goes for places in Africa) but just be ready for it :) We visited a few Greek islands and it is the same there too. Be respectful and just go with it. Enjoy Greece!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Newly renovated. Great location, 5 minutes from Acropilis entrance and a few steps away from subway station. Staff was very helpful.Very nice breakfast with traditional greek yoghurt at rooftop terrace, with a view of Acropolis.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jet lagged, just arrived in Athens from oz, walked past called into their rooftop bar 1899 -what a spot - amazing view of acropolis gr8 Chardonnay worth a visit! Gr8 way to start a trip to Greece didn’t stay in hotel but looked amazing
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel the night before we came back into Athens after traveling to different area of Greece on a whim. We had previously stayed at a different hotel down the street but wanted to try something new and we were so glad we did! First of all the hotel is so close to the Acropolis station that we kept walking around in circles because it was just that close that it just wasn't believable LOL We arrived 2 hours earlier than check in & it was so great that they could already provide us with a room since we just wanted to rest before starting our adventure in Athens again. The staff is just amazing at this hotel always willing to help & give recommendations!OMG one of the best things about this place is the rooftop terrace/bar!!! We enjoyed breakfast up there & also a night of drinks overlooking the great view of the Acropolis. There are also a lot of other great bars all around the hotel but with such a great view & service why go anywhere else!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just like most other reviewers, we had a great stay at AD Athens. I chose the hotel because of it's ratings and it still exceeded my expectations. The room was large, modern, clean, beautifully appointed. The bed was very comfortable. The breakfast room / bar on the top floor has a stunning direct view of the Parthenon. The staff are absolutely lovely. A special thank you to Panos for warm and friendly hospitality and excellent food recommendations. And, lastly, the hotel is at an unbeatable location, a 3 min walk from the Acropolis Museum and entrance to the Acropolis itself, Temple of Zeus, Plaka district, the Acropolis subway station, and a whole street of restaurants. And even though the hotel is so centrally located, it is quiet and tranquil. A great place to stay!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can not rate this place highly enough!!From the moment we arrived we were welcomed by the warm and friendly staff. This incredibly hospitality actually started from the time we made the booking and I started sending emails to them asking for advice. Once we arrived they offered excellent suggestions about what to do and where to go whilst here (places that we didnt think of going to... Thanks Panos and team) The excellent service of staff extends past reception to the cleaning staff and hospitality staff in the Bar/restaurant. A special thanks must also go to Angelo for extra travel tips for our journey beyond Athens and also for treating us to bubbles on our honeymoon trip! Our room /bathroom was clean and stylish and even coming from Australia where we are use to space, we found the room spacious enough for us.The location of this place was AMAZING! A stones throw from the Acropolis (with a killer view of it from the rooftop bar/restaurant. Right next to a metro station and to the touristy Plaka neighborhood for fantastic food and people watching!I had received very mixed reviews about Athens from friends that have travelled. However the two days that we have spent here we have had a wonderful experience that far exceeded our expectations. AD Luxury Rooms and Suites certainly played a big part in our memorable experience!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location 10/10Service 10/10Room 10/10Value 10/10A really great place to stay!Right outside the Acropolis and a stone throw from the train station and restaurants.The rooms are small but have great air conditioning and the facilities within the room are excellent.The front desk is open 24/7 and they are always willing to help with anything you might need (especially guiding the attractions around Athens).There is a really cool rooftop bar that has a great view of the Parthenon.Would definitely return.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When making our two room reservation back in March two of the main reasons we chose this hotel was the location and the photos of the rooms with a view of the acropolis. When checking in we where told the hotel only had one room with a view and it was taken ☹️. Never any where on hotels.com did it say one room with view. There is a view of the acropolis on the rooftop patio but not the same as a room view. The location is close to the acropolis walking distance and the subway station that was a perk. It does get noisy at night with people walking around and cars since it’s in a busy area. Room was clean and a good size just disappointed about the view.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is opposite the Acropolis museum . It is on the edge of the Plaka district, central for shops, nightlife, restaurants and within walking distance to almost all the the top sights. Very quiet and the staff are brilliant- very helpful and welcoming, and knowledgable about Athens. Getting to the airport on the metro was very easy as the stop is virtually across the road. The rooms are very well appointed and clean. There is a rooftop bar and breakfast area which looks up at the Acopolis. The entrance lobby could be embellished a little with more seating, magazines and tables to make it even more welcoming.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic central location. The young man at Reception went out of his way to help us. He was incredibly friendly with a wealth of knowledge about everything. Very clean rooms and beautiful view of the Acropolis from the rooftop restaurant
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 days in this hotel in April and our best souvenir is the receptionist. He was very helpful with the reservations we had to make for our flight to Santorini, our train Kalambaka and so on. He took also charge of the refund procedure for the sea-jet reservation that was cancelled due to the seamen's strike, Every time we would come back to this hotel after a visit, he would greet us cheerfully and engage in a conversation with us. Besides, he speaks many languages fluently, English, Spanish and French among them. His name is Angel and we still wish he would come and visit us some day.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was 1km walk from most of the main sites and shopping area called Plaka, so no taxis were needed whilst there. Reception was very helpful - thank you Angelo! Rooms are slightly small but for short stay no problem but you can always book a superior room. Breakfast was average but coffee good, beautiful view of Parthenon from rooftop whilst eating breakfast. Check out time was at 12pm so nice and convenient if you want to get more sightseeing done in the morning. Would return!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have visited many places and stayed in many hotels. This hotel was the “best of the best” for customer service. We notified the hotel at booking that my daughter could not eat gluten. Not only did they have gluten-free bread for her to enjoy at breakfast, they also had many other gluten-free products for her, including cookies. The entire breakfast buffet for guests was delicious and contained several Greek specialities. The rooms were beautiful, and the view at breakfast was amazing as there is a fantastic view of the Acropolis. Make sure to see the view in the evening, also. The rooms were very comfortable, clean, and modern-looking. I appreciated the safe in the room, as well as the elevator. Our room did have small steps inside so be careful when you enter (see photo). The location of the hotel was great for visiting sites and there is also a grocery store nearby. I am so glad we stayed at this hotel. The staff was amazing (even letting us enjoy breakfast and check-in very early as we arrived via an overnight ferry from Crete). It is my understanding that the hotel is only a year old. It was remodeled into a hotel from a building next to the new Acropolis museum. I highly recommend this hotel when visiting Athens. This hotel’s staff will make you feel very welcome and comfortable. I wish I could give this hotel more than an excellent rating. It truly is one of our favorite hotels.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at AD Athens for 3 nights -- this hotel surpassed our expectations! The room we had was a bit on the smaller side, but it was neat, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast spread was limited, but good. The rooftop has great views of the Acropolis! What makes this hotel a gem -- the location and its staff. From the moment we checked in to check out, Angelo in particular made sure everything was in order -- he provided excellent tips on sightseeing and local restaurants, made the necessary reservations when needed, and ensured we had breakfast boxes in the morning (we checked out very early to catch the Ferry). The location of the hotel is fantastic -- the major areas and sights are within walking distance. You'd be in Plaka within 5-10mins, Monastiraki within 15-20mins, and the Acropolis in 5 mins. We even walked to Thissio (a nice quaint area on the other side of the Acropolis) for dinner on our last evening in Athens, and that was an easy 15-20min stroll. We would not hesitate to come back to AD Athens. Thank you again Angelo (and friends!)
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the AD Rooms and Suites May 15-17 2018. The location was great, very close the the Acropolis and the accompany metro station, walking distance to the Plaka. Our room was neat and clean. Breakfast was served from the rooftop lounge area and the view was incredible. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. The front desk staff were wonderful with recommendations for tours, restaurants, etc. They were all very accommodating. The rooms were neat and clean. I would stay there again and highly recommend.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at AD Luxury for 2 nights - great experience. Hotel is a new property and very close to Plaka. Within 5 minutes you have access to shops, restaurants, metro and Acropolis. The staff is what made the experience superior. For example, our taxi driver was incorrectly charging us the rate from the airport to the hotel and one of the hotel staff intervened and informed us that it was a flat rate. Really appreciated the help. They also helped us print our boarding passes for our flight, arranged taxis to the airport, provided recommendations for our journey to Crete, arranged early breakfast boxes and recommendations on where to eat. I appreciated the close attention they paid to us! Highly recommend and will definteley stay here next time in Athens.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was perfect, we walked everywhere. The metro to the airport takes 40 mins with one easy change. The roof top terrace for breakfast was very special.The staff were the hotel's greatest asset-they were knowledgable, welcoming & genuine. Shout out to Angelos who gave us a great introduction during check-in, showed us all the places of interest on a map & always greeted us with a smile.The bed was super comfortable & the shower jets were nice & powerful.Check-out at 12pm is very generous.Wi-fi worked well.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent 4 star-hotel with perfect location.Acropolis and the museum is just around the corner and there are a lot of restaurants to choose from in the area. The metro is right outside the hotel. Nice breakfast with view of Acropolis. Very comfortable beds and the rooms looks just like the pictures: very modern and fresh.A little thin-walled so you can hear people in the corridor but that didn't bother us much.Angelos in the reception is very nice and helpful, he speaks 6-7 different languages so you get all the information you need before and during your stay (we called before arrival to ask the taxiprices as a lot of taxidrivers, specially from the airport, tries to charge tourists a lot extra and pretend you didn't pay enough as the quickly change your 50 euro-bill into a smaller change when you loose concentration for a second to check on your bags etc).We highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was great. Clean, breakfast very good but best of all Angelo at the front desk . He was fabulous, helpful, organized airport transportation including packing my breakfast. Angelo helped make the most of my time in Athens.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at AD Athens twice during our trip to Greece for a total of 3 days. We can not say enough about the quality of service and level of hospitality all of the staff showed us during our time at the hotel. We have to make a special mention of the concierge, Angelo; he was so helpful and went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed our stay in Athens. Breakfast was great and the rooms were very clean. Honestly, we couldn’t ask for more.The hotel is located right next to the metro and a few steps from the Acropolis and Plaka. We found that it was extremely easy to get to all the major attractions from this location.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to the acropolis and in front of acropolis museum.Rooms clean and large. Luxurious bathroom.Staff very friendly and helpful.Rich breakfast in terrace in front of the acropolis.Warmly suggested.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for several nights recently and were very pleased with the facilities and service. The room was quite small but totally adequate. The location is outstanding and the service was exemplary. We will definitely come back here if we visit Athens again.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This family owned hotel has 20 rooms which allows the staff to provide exceptional service & high quality accommodations just steps from the Acropolis Museum metro. It was a nice size room with with a fabulous Queen size bed. The staff had a difficult time translating the sizes but the key thing is to ask for the one that has one large mattress vs two twins put together. I believe this is 160 cm. The roof top private bar is for guests only and breakfast is served there. That was an incredible surprise - with both savory mezza items alongside traditional sweets that are such a treat - yogurt & all the toppings!! The younger member of the team, Angeliko was a gem - speaking many languages, researching Athens sites, helping with anything but most of all proving intimate insight to the culture! The hotel is just 7 mo thx o!x so we wish them well!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is unbeatable, right across the Acropolis Metro station, meaning with easy access to most parts of Athens. Most of the places of touristic interest, e.g. Acropolis, Acropolis museum, Plaka district, Thisseio etc, are withing walking distance from the hotel. The rooms are brand new, our bed was very comfortable and the bathroom clean and well appointed. The front desk personnel were friendly, helpful and kind enough to offer us an upgrade to a more spacious room. The breakfast is served at the rooftop cafe, which has an incredible view of Acropolis, but the service is rather indifferent, or I might say it was completely absent. My only objection is for the type of breakfast offered. As a Greek I can assure you that some of the items served do not belong to the Greek breakfast menu, e.g. I don't know many greeks that eat "dolmadakia" (stuffed wine leaves), "siglino", "strapatsada" or "siropiasta sweets" for breakfast. "Feta" is indeed a typical Greek type of cheese, but it is not the most appropriate cheese for breakfast and also orange juice is not a tasteless yellow-colored sweet liquid.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, I must say that the front desk staff is the most welcoming and genuinely pleased to see you of any hotel I've been in for quite a while! So helpful and pleasant and eager to share their city with visitors! That leaves a great first impression! The location is so convenient and perfectly close to the Plaka district for restaurants and shops, without being on a super busy street. You are literally a stone's throw from the Acropolis museum and the metro station, so you can get anywhere you want with ease.For an American audience, you will find the rooms to be a bit small and the bathroom a bit tight. But, this is not the land of the sprawling suburban Holiday Inn - and this is actually a very normal sized European hotel room. It is very newly renovated and well appointed, with a comfortable bed, wood-look tiled floor, ample closet space and a small minibar/fridge. The shower is amazing and the hot water was never ending.Breakfast was also really good- there were stuffed grape leaves, spinach and feta pie, boiled eggs, bread, ham and cheese, honey,jam, butter, and granola for the delicious yogurt (you know, Greek yogurt - except better than US grocery brands and just called yogurt here!). Perhaps one of the nicest elements of breakfast is that you can have it in open air or the roof with a killer view of the Acropolis!Two doors down in one direction is a small grocery to get drinks and snacks and other essentials as needed, and across the street is a souvlaki place that is open late. This hotel also offered great value for cost and I would stay here again another time. I didn't see any of the other hotels that I had considered before booking and arriving and have hotel envy. I was fully pleased with my experience here!
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very recently opened new hotel right next to the Acropolis and Plaka. Simple and modern welcoming reception with Angelo greeting you with a smile and plenty of information. An exclusive view of the Acropolis from the roof top where a delicious Greek breakfast is served and great for a relaxing drink before going to bed for the night. Good sized modern room very nicely set and comfortable. Although room was clean it was obvious that it was hurriedly made up at the last moment and it looked like the floor was only partly washed up at the room entrance which was still wet.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for three nights before flying to Santorini. This was the cheapest of three hotels on this trip, but I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the accommodation and service.The room: we had a two room on the first floor, it had clearly been recently renovated and he decor and fittings were all of a high standard.Staff: All he staff were helpful and friendly, with special mention going to Angel on the front desk, who was a wealth of information and always welcomed us with a huge smile!
