He sorted our airport transfer and breakfast boxes upon leaving for our early morning flight. He’s real asset to the hotel.The location: Fantastic. Very close to he major tourist spots and only a 2 min walk from the Acropolis Museum, which I’d recommend visiting before visiting the Acropolis (an Angel tip!). There’s a variety of nice restaurants nearby and a wine bar on the corner.I’m not one for staying in the same place twice, however if I do visit Athens in future I wouldn’t hesitate to book here again.
hotelName:
7    AD Athens Luxury Rooms and Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly walking distance to the Parthenon/Acropolis. Also near the bus routes for the on/off bus tours.Rooms were quite roomy for "european hotels" and our balcony view of the Acropolis was TRULY worth the extra money.The staff was sooo nice and helpful and made our stay in Greece even better.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a bit uncertain when we were dropped off in the neighborhood down the street, but that quickly dissipated when we found the hotel. Modern, sleek, beautiful glass doors, a welcoming lobby area and super friendly staff. They gave us a brief tour, brought our bags up, and went through our double room's amenities and perks of the hotel. We thanked her, and explored Athens. When we got back however, the cracks in the facade began to show.Pros first: Breakfast is always included, and while not spectacular, it has great service, a good selection of food. Please note, there's no A/C in the lobby (but there is in your room), so it can feel a little stuffy. The bathroom was incredible, beautiful tile work, an open shower area with rain shower, and LED lighted mirror. Most importantly, the neighborhood is incredible, with top restaurants, bars, nightlife and more. The walk to the Acropolis is a bit far (15-20 minutes to the tour area entrances) but besides that we never felt the need to leave the neighborhood.Now the sadder stuff:The reading lights next to the bed? Holding on by (literally) a wire, and were unusable. The TV, which requires two remotes to function, was frustrating. Neither remote worked, we were able to to physically turn the TV on, but the satellite didn't work, the box didn't work, and the TV was a failure. These things can could be ignored, but the most egregious fault can't.The WiFi in room is absolutely terrible, and I don't mean wow this is slow terrible, I mean it just doesn't work. We would have to stand by the door to even try connecting, and forget about using it while on the bed. In 2019, for a hotel ranked in the top 10 on TripAdvisor, this is absolutely unforgivable. There is WiFi in the lobby as I mentioned, Overall, it's a fine hotel, but it is not a top 10 hotel. 3 stars for the friendly service, location, and presentation, but certainly not close to a 5.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff are very friendly and welcoming and they replied our enquiries in details patiently. They recommended us some nice restaurants with local cuisine and guided us the way to tourist spots. Breakfast tastes good with a variety of food. Also, the hotel is in fact just a 5-minute walk from Monastiraki metro station. It is close to many local non-touristy restaurants in Psiri and the shopping area in Monastiraki. Can also walk about 20 minutes to the entrance of Acropolis. Definitely recommend O&B if you visit Athens!
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location-walkable to restaurants, shopping area (flea markets,etc) and to the Acropolis of Athens. It was actually just a few mins from the meeting point of our walking tour. Check-in was quick and staff was friendly. The room was large enough for a family of 4 and was very clean. We did not get a good view from our window but that was not a big deal. While the area looks busy, it was quiet at night in our rooms. Even when we arrived late at night, we felt safe. Breakfast was delicious and filling. Overall, a good hotel to stay in for a family while in Athens.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the outside, the hotel looks rather bland. However, inside is totally diiferent story. If you manage to get the room on the top most floor, it has a view to die for, you won't regreat it. The staff are super, polite and informative. The hotel is tucked away in a little unassuming corner where all the attractions are.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location. We walked everywhere and this neighborhood Psirri was great with reaturants, bars and shop and less touristy than nearby Plaka. Breakfast was wonderful and so was all the staff. My only gripe would be we missed our 1st night due to our flight getting rescheduled and we still were charged for the room that night(although we were comped at the restaurant). The road its on looks a bit seedy with all the graffiti, but i would stay there again over Plaka. Nice rooms as well and the front desk was always helpful.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a taxi from the airport. We were surprised by the massive amounts of graffiti throughout Athens. The hotel itself was top notch - modern, clean, cool, friendly and comfy. We were warmly welcomed and treated to a tasty treat with shots of a clear alcohol - not ouzo. The neighboring buildings were run down. If you faced the Parthenon, all was cool. Lots of antique sellers spilling on to the streets. We walked to the acropolis, marketplaces and restaurants. No problem except some crowded sidewalks. Maria served us discounted drinks at the cool bar and we had a great conversation with her about Greece and the Greek education system. Wonderful breakfast with lots of choices. Ours suite had one medium and two smaller balconies for different views. Helpful front desk too.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel is located just behind the main shopping area near Ancient Agora of Athens site (5minutes). For food and shopping, if this is your first time in Athens, it’s perfect location. We used hotel taxi transfer to and from Athens airport at 40 Euros cash. Much easier and not much difference in terms of price compare to getting a taxi outside. Our room was clean, simple, street view, just what we needed. Breakfast was good. Service was fantastic. We needed to checkout in early morning to catch the early flight to Santorini. Hotel staff offered us a well-packed take away box with juice, water, bread, sandwiches, apples and some cookies. Such thoughtful gestures for the guests who would need to depart early. I’ve never seen any hotel does this before. Thank you so much for the lovely service. Recommend this hotel. The only cons is wifi not very fast.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived here after a late flight from Santorini. The concierge was so helpful in helping us find a good restaurant for dinner and also gave us a welcome snack/drink. It is located in the Psiri disctrict which has lots of restaurants and bard. The room and bathroom were larger than other places we have stayed in Greece. Breakfast had a good selection. Overall, great stay and would come back here again.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was great to stay at this cute hotel in Athens unfortunately we only have an overnight stay and early checkout so couldn't enjoy breakfast but the staff made us a breakfast box to take with us, would stay again! 10/10
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights here after 5 luxurious nights in Santorini. Frankly, I was a little disappointed to be leaving Santorini and entering the hustle and bustle of Athens, but it quickly became clear that this little hotel is a nice oasis in the middle of the city. We were greeted promptly and taken to our clean room with wonderful views -- it was worth the extra money to pay for the Acropolis Petite Suite. The balcony is amazingly large -- you could host 20 people on it comfortably (no joke -- maybe have your wedding here?). The daily breakfast buffet is nice, not amazing, but does the trick. The whole hotel is well maintained, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Be aware that the wifi is really slow -- we had to go to Starbucks to get a fast connection, but for everyday use the wifi is adequate. We would definitely recommend staying here if you want to take in the history in the center of Athens!
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we took a taxi to this hotel I thought maybe we were in the wrong place but this is hidden in plain sight and right in the middle of town only a couple of blocks from the town center and the metro . It is clean, spacious and has a lovely breakfast. I would definitely go back again and recommend it to others. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was the best way to see Athens.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience at this hotel. Upon checkin we were upgraded to a large suite. The room was HUGE! We had a full living room, giant bedroom, and two bathrooms. Also, everything was clean and spotless. We walked out to the large balcony and were shocked, we had a direct view of the Acropolis, right in front of us. The breakfast was great, with many options. The staff overall was very attentive, and very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. If we were to ever come back to Athens again, we would choose to stay at this hotel again!
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located within reach to f&b and less than 10min walk to the monastiraki Square and Station. No lack of food and drinks within walking distance. The hotel room is clean and the size is quite decent. Requested for twin sharing. although the beds were single beds, we weren't that big so it was still comfortable for us. Staff members were very friendly and helpful. Always willing to help if you have queries and request. Stayed for a few nights before heading to Santorini and back to O&B to stay for a few more nights . They kindly, helped to keep our luggage in their store without any charges until our return.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in a great location for all sights. Staff are very informative and pleasant. We stayed 1 night and felt very welcomed. The front desk told us everywhere to go, gave us maps and advised the best order in which to see everything. The Hotel quite basic, but has all you need for a city break or short stay.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arriving from cruise, a little apprehensive with the look of the small street the taxi turned into, but suddenly this very smart hotel frontage appears and we enter into a very smart modern decor,of a very smart boutique hotel. The staff were warm and friendly which also flowed to the restaurant/bar staff. Room very nice with large balcony on the top 3rd floor with good view of the Acropolis. The lift has small capacity for lots of luggage but manageable. Reception staff very helpful on sightseeing tips/advice . The restaurant very pleasant facing the tiny street ,offering good insight into the elderly men and their stalls of bric-a-brac for sale.Lots of graffiti around the place,but no one cares with their view of traditional art?.Would recommend to travellers who prefer the smaller type of hotel,and would have no hesitation in recommending
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a gem, really close to all main tourist attractions. Plenty of places to eat round the corner. Taxis are more than reasonable. Thank you Miltos at the reception for taking time out to explain the area. Breakfast is very good. There is no fear walking day or night around the areaI would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Athens for business or pleasure
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Athens for 10 days meeting up with our son and daughter in law who were over in Athens from New Zealand. We chose the O&B hotel after searching on line based on reviews and it location close to the main. attractions. We arrived at the hotel from the airport by taxi and were greeted by a very friendly receptionist who took time to show us the hotel location in relation to all the main attractions before personally showing us to our room. The room was located on the 2nd floor and very pleasant with a very large bathroom. Shortly after we had settled in our room we were brought some snacks and a glass of Greek liquer. The food at breakfast was very good and the staff all very friendly and attentive. We had one evening meal in the restuarant on a wet evening and that also was very pleasant.It was a very pleasant stay and the staff couldn’t have been more accommodating arranging a hire car for us and providing details of local trips. They printed our boarding cards and stored both ours and our sons luggage.The surrounding area is very quirky being located in the midst of the flea market but this was not dissimilar to other areas of Athens and the local area Pisiri is a very lively area with plenty of bars and restaurants.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at O&B and couldn’t fault the accommodation and the service and would recommend this hotel for a short stay or an extended stay in Athens.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of the hotel is excellent if you are spending a couple of nights in Athens and want to explore the historiaan sites (Acropolis) and find nice reastaurants near hotel. The room was typical European city hotel size (ok for 2persons for 3 nights with only hand baggage). Bathroom had a ’high end design’ style but lacked a bit of functionality. Still, everything worked well and the room and the hotel was clean. WiFi (free) worked fine. The reception staff was very kind in helping us with some connection issues. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. From the first second on we felt very welcome in the hotel. The location is at Psiri, on a side street of Ermou Street that runs from Monastiraki Square. The metro from airport (Blue line) stops at Monastiraki station and you have about 500m-700m walk along Ermou street to the hotel. The neighbourhood might seem ’rough’ with graffiti,etc. and its not the tidiest of streets. However, we did not have or see anything that would have made us feel anyway unsafe. The nearest metro station is Thissio (Green line) about 200m away. You can walk up to one of Acropolis’ gates just going upwards from Thissio station.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay here. It’s close to everything. The breakfast is wonderful! I loved the fresh Greek yogurt with honey and fresh cherries. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. We will def stay here if ever in Athens again.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a jewel in a neighborhood that may look scary at first but it is very friendly and convenient. There is no fear walking day or night around the area. The hotels new facade stands out in the older neighborhood and a good preview of what’s inside.The front desk staff is great with directions, suggestions and tips to make your stay a great experience. A knock on the door minutes after settling into my room brought a sampler of Greek delights complete with a Greek liquor.Clean fresh rooms, great toiletries and breakfast buffet included make it a great place to start your Athens exploration.Less than a five minute walk are great inexpensive restaurants and tons of shopping little plazas with street entertainment and people watching. The restaurant selections are nice and reasonably priced making ‘eating in’ a good alternative if you are too tired from exploring everything there is to offer.I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Athens for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 nights here for a city break. Totally reccomend it.The staff were helpful and friendly. Room was clean and nice with fab big bathroom. Breakfast great. Loved the area it was in. So central and close to everything. Right in heart of flea market land so really interesting. Close to cute street with lovely bars and cafes too. Ignore reviews that say its a dodgy area, it absolutely isn't. Its Greek life and real. If you choose to stay here you will be really happy with your choice, we definetly were.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in a nice eclectic neighborhood. It has great customer service which made for a very lovely stay. Also great comfortable beds and large rooms, my room didn't have a view but very original and unique hotel in everay.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a long weekend in February. Its location is close to the sightseeing spots of Athens. It is also situated very close to the restaurant and bar/night club area. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. After the receptionist showed us to our room, another Staff member showed up with a small tray of finger food and drinks. Those little things that make the service stand out...Breakfast is varied and fresh. Included is the option of ordering breakfast from the kitchen.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can not say enough wonderful things about the staff here at O and B Hotel. They are so kind, accommodating and eager to please the guest. The breakfast is fresh, presented well and tasty. The rooms are perfect for a boutique hotel and the water always hot! What more can you ask for? The location is nice too!
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading many reviews on TA, we chose this hotel. Best decision we made in athens. Like others have said, neighborhood looks a little suspicious because of all the graffiti, but its perfectly safe and actually gives a little local flavor. Location is fantastic, just 15-20 min walk from almost everything you want to see in athens. What really makes the hotel special is the staff. We mostly worked with Miltos and Alexandra and they were both outstanding. They knew us by name, had welcome treats every time we came back, free upgrade to suite, helpful information on sites/how to get around. Breakfast has mostly the same items every day but its very fresh and very good.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a lovely place. Friendly helpful with recommendations for food places etc. Little touches such as remembering it was my birthday and making me a special cake, mezzes when we arrived. Large quiet room . brilliant location for all the sights and the restaurant area just round the corner. Def stay here again. Try it you'll be wowed too.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's not a 5-star hotel, but we enjoyed the stay. Very friendly and helpful front desk, good room, excellent location: 3 minutes walk to Thissio (Green Line M to Piraeus); 10-minutes walk to Monastiraki Square; many restaurants in the area.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a really lovely hotel. It is situated in a great location for both seeing the sights and the centre of the city. Its staff was lovely being both friendly and helpful. Breakfast was terrific and the room comfortable.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Probably one of the best hotels I have stayed in for some time. Comfortable, spacious, a terrace with views of the Acropolis to die for and lovely staff whom were without exception smart, polite and friendly. A few comments have made mention of the fact the hotel is partly in an area that is a little “run down” and this is true, but never threateningly so ... just think of it as local colour. A short walk to some great restaurants and much of the interesting history Will go back for certain
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: room is clean and nice, have kettle in the room, able to get fresh milk, air condition works well, hot water 24/7, prime location in lively neighborhood, lots of taverns,,amazing hotel staff, great breakfast, great location
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A big thank you. This is truly a hidden gem of Athens. So well located every major attraction is a walk away. All the best shopping on your door step. The hotel is spotless warm and welcoming. Feels like home. The staff are truly the amazing. They are just so kind and helpful. Always pleasant. They went over and beyond the call of duty to assist us. It made my Christmas and my holiday. This hotel is truly the real greece in every way. I was literally heart broken to leave. THANK YOU. THANK YOU. THANK YOU TO THE AMAZING STAFF. WHAT A TEAM........
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel is just perfect. It is located in the centre of the Old City. The Acropolis can be viewed from the hotel's alley. The room I got (upgrade) was very large and comfortable by all means. The breakfast was satisfactory. Hotel's staff was very friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel without hesitation.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If i’m to rate things in this hotel from 1 to 5, i’d say:Staff is 6Cleanliness is 5Price is 5Location is 5Internet is 2Breakfast is 4Rooms dimensions 4Toilets dimensions 5But again, i’d like to insist on the STAFFThey’re really 6/5.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another stellar review - I tend to review the places or experiences that were meaningful or exceptional to help my fellow travelers as opposed to reviewing everything.The O&B Hotel was chosen based on location and great reviews; also we're moving away from rentals after re-embracing the boutique hotel experience in London last year. We love the freedom of rentals but when in a new city, having personalized and attentive service from hotel staff is priceless. The O&B Hotel was no exception.We arrived early on a Saturday, stayed three nights, and had three full days in Athens after sailing around the islands for a week. We were still swaying slightly from the boat! The front desk staff was so friendly and accommodating, helping us with our plans for the city and making us comfortable immediately, it was such a gentle re-entry to land and an exciting launch to our stay in Athens. We couldn't wait to go explore... but he insisted on showing us our room first, despite the early hour the room was ready. We had booked a room with a balcony and view of the Acropolis, but he gave us what I think was the second best room - we not only had a view from everywhere in the room but also the generous sized balcony... beautiful! Efcharisto!We also very much appreciated the guidance and help from a detailed plan for our 3 days of exploring - restaurants, places to wander, music, museums, food, gardens, neighbourhoods, everything we wanted to do in this fun city. Just enough, not too much. You probably noticed I didn't rave about all the details of our room, the wonderful breakfast and amenities - they were all excellent. We choose boutique hotels like the O&B for the experience, the staff, surrounding ourselves with a small hotel experience we feel gives us the best people to help us enjoy our travels. They more than delivered and we will return again.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Usually I am not so generous in my comments. By O&B deserves it! My wife and I spend a few days at O&B and enjoyed every moment. Everything is perfect to both of our satisfaction. If you are looking for the heart and diamond of old Athens this the area you should visit; Psiri.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We reserved a room for 4. The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us compared to other reviews I read on tripadvisor on other hotels. There was a king size bed and two twin beds side by side. The entrance was a bit cramped on entry to the room, but then again, we didn't spend much time in the room other than sleep. The room was very clean and modern including the bathroom. We received a nice welcome plate of bruschetta? olives and cucumbers along with a drink(shot?) to our room. Beds were comfy enough. We were all tired from the tourist day that we all slept well anyway. The location was perfect. The hotel was located on a side street but great location. My sister and I are in our late 40's, early 50's and we were able to walk to many sites. The hotel staff routed a walking tour for us and were able to walk to the Acropolis, Hadrian's arch, Zeus temple, Panathenaic stadium, walk through the national garden onto the changing of guard at Parliament, Syntagma Square,Athens cathedral, Plaka then back towards Monastiraki all in one day. We did run out of time to get to Ancient Agora. We opted to read through most of the site markers instead of tour guides which helped us get through all these sites in one day. The hotel is few blocks to Monastiraki. The hotel attendant says the hotel is actually located in Psiri. All the hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. There was enough of a breakfast selection both hot and cold food items. The staff even packed a small snack bag for us as we had an early flight on our departure date. There were plenty of nearby restaurants to choose from all within walking distance. It was a great stay and I would stay here again.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was first class. I would totally recommend this hotel. Excellent service was provided.. Excellent location - ten minute walk from the Acropolis and two minutes from the flea market. Excellent breakfast and lovely rooms.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the opportunity to stay at this hotel for one week. The staff is exceptional! The friendliness and welcoming attitude made our stay that more enjoyable. The daily breakfast provided is great as well. Plenty of breakfast options available. The entire hotel was very clean and comfortable with a contemporary feel and design. The location is perfect for traveling around Athens, as there are two nearby subway stations. Would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to those looking to vacation in the area.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Word of mouth and good reviews are what this boutique hotel depends upon for referrals. just think I was thinking about staying at my usual default - the Hilton. But if you have a short stay in Athens, and do not want to hike a few miles each time you tour the sites, staying close to the action makes sense. The title of this review says it all. Five stars says it all but i'll give a pass to the room which was a little small, with little room for your luggage, no dresser to store things, but otherwise pleasant and comfortable especially the bed. YOU CAN'T GO WRONG ESPECIALLY FOR SHORT 2-3 DAY STAYS IN ATHENS!
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was large with a balcony and view of Acropolis even from the bathroom! Buffet breakfast was very good and all the staff were very friendly and made great recommendations for restaurants. We were able to walk to all historical sites from hotel. We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for one night in September prior to starting a two week sailboat charter, and returned for our last night right after the charter before flying back to US. Such a warm and welcoming hotel, with super friendly staff. Very clean and modern. An oasis in a busy, crowded, hot city. Great location, although the side street is rather drab and the building across the street looks like it has seen better days. But a quiet safe street, not far from the "action." Room was quiet, and on our last night we had a view of the Acropolis from our deck. AC worked well, cheerful and comfortable room.Breakfast was FANTASTIC in their street level dining room. I would absolutely stay here again, and not even bother to look for another hotel in Athens.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: O & B Athens was our first hotel in Greece. They welcomed us and helped us settle in to the city, providing assistance and ideas for sightseeing. When we departed, they were quick to help with our needs. The lobby and breakfast areas were nice.The room was not memorable. To obtain a hotel in Athens of similar quality as I am accustomed to staying, it might have been necessary to spend more.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great rooms, good breakfasts, and very attentive staff. They were the very definition of good hosts. Explained the hotel, how to get around, and made wonderful suggestions for food, drink, and entertainment. Set up taxis for us and gave great directions.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here Friday. Staff was very friendly and went the extra mile to make our stay remembered. Clean room with all the amenities. Worth the visit. They even welcomed us with a snack tray with a shot of uzo. Just across the street from all the shops and restaurants by the Acropolis.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed unfurtunately for one night only due to lack of room for the second night. The hotel is great. All four of us stayed in a suite with view to the Acropolis. Realy great view!. The suite was large with great comfi bed and two toilets. The kids stayed in the living room. We loved the hotel area it is a bit rough but full of atmosphere and life. many restaurants and cool cafes near the hotel. Monasteraki is also 300 meter away.The breakfast is good and the service efficient. We would love to stay here again
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, helpful staff and perfect position for sightseeing as all the major sites are within easy walking distance. Don’t be put off by the locality; parts look very run down but we felt safe enough and there are great restaurants within a couple of minutes walk.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was great for walking to sites and local restaurants/bars. The breakfast was amazing, and staff very nice. The only issue we had was room was very small, so not much room for clothes, and especially suitcases. We had a standard room, so I'm sure an upgrade would have been ok for room. Would definitely recommend or stay again.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel at the end of August. Staff was very welcoming and helpful. The room was nice and clean and very comfortable. Didn’t eat at the hotel since we wanted to eat at some of the local restaurants. The hotel is in a very safe area, it has a eclectic feel which can lead others to think it’s in a run down area. There are many places to eat in the area and the flea market is basically across the street. Would definitely stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an ideal location to visit the main tourist attractions on foot. In addition, there are a number of excellent restaurants in this very pleasant part of the city. The hotel rooms were very modern, clean and comfortable. The staff ato O and B were superb and incredibly helpful.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here during the middle of September & we were very pleased with our stay. Every member of staff were very helpful & should be highly complimented. The hotel is located in walking distance to many good restaurants, shopping areas and tour guide bus stops. It is located on a relatively quiet street but it does seem to be an up and coming area. Would recommend to friends.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in an artistic neighborhood located near very good bars and restaurants. We had a lot of fun enjoying the night life in the area. The area of the hotel has a lot of graffiti, which is actually part of the artistic vibe of the area. The graffiti doesn’t mean it’s a bad area, but rather it’s actually a very good place! We were walking around the area at night around 2 am and felt safe walking together. The room was very comfortable. Like many major cities, hotel rooms are not going to be super spacious, but there was enough room for us to feel comfortable. The bathroom was very spacious and modern. We stayed in their regular room.The only downside to our stay was that the WiFi was barely working properly. It said we were connected, but it was very slow or it just wouldn’t work. But I didn’t go to Athens for WiFi, so I am still overall very happy with the stay.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best places to stay as The hotel is centrally located near monistraki and thessio metro stations, Which links to most part of Athens. Even syntgma is walking distance. The best part is welcoming staff of the hotel, who were willing to go above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. They not only checked us in before scheduled time as we arrived early, but they also offered breakfast and explained about the city and places to see and eat in details. Overall it was a great stay. The breakfast buffet is excellent. They also arrange for transfers as per your request.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we got in to the hotel the service we have received was extra ordinary. The hotel staff is super friendly and helpful, they've not only accommodated all our requests (providing power adapters, arranging taxi rides) but were very welcoming overall.
hotelName:
8    O&B Athens Boutique Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m surprised this hotel still exists in its current shape. The hallways are tacky, the pool is laughably small and the rooms should be bigger for a hotel one mile from the old town. The only redeeming factor is that it’s close to Kolonaki
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing place! Thank you to the whole team for the excellent welcoming and experience. Everything from staff , room, food were exceptional. We certainly plan to return one day! Thank you for the amazing experience!
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Crown Plaza, Athens after I disembarked from a cruise ship.The hotel was very nice, the suite I stayed at was big and very well maintained.The most thing I liked was the friendly and very helpfull receptionist.She explained to us how to use the hope on-hope off bus and suggested some restaurants to us and they were great.I recommend staying at this hotel if you are in Athens.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean room, small fridge/mini bar with room to stow a few personal items away in. Temperature control in room was spot on, quiet halls. 24 hour Gym had 2 treadmills, a stair stepper, an elliptical, recumbent bike, free weights and this giant cable machine I’m not sure how to work. ;)There is a sauna as well.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza is well located and up to the usual standards of the Crowne Plaza IHG chain. Just a 5 minute walk from the metro and 40 minutes to the Acropolis it is also well located albeit in a fairly run-down street.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Am I missing something? This hotel apparently has 8.7 on hotels.com and a 5 star rating!This is what I experienced:1st. Promised parking in their garage, which was the reason I chose the hotel and was important to me when booking as parking in Athens is quite difficult. No parking available when I arrived. No help in finding parking!*The room: straight back to Las Vegas in the 90s! A smell of old smoke or mold or just uncleaned floor to floor carpet that is nauseating and sticks to everything you dare to take out of your bag.Old dark and outdated rooms... not a problem if it was a 3 star hotel maybe. But for 200 EUR/night! Bath was ok.*General impression of half unmotivated staff and old hotel is just really not what you expect for that price.To finish of positively. The location is nice, and the pool on the roof which isn’t bigger than a larger jacuzzi is ok I guess. Never will I stay here again though. In Athens I’ve been in better 3 star hotels for 40 EUR than this.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel we stayed at was easy to get to and from the hotel and it is centrally located so we could walk or take a bus if wanted to get into the heart of the town. The staff are really nice, and we were even upgraded to a nicer room for no extra cost. The rooms come with all the essentials you need, even a lavender spray for your room to help you sleep better. You can request the type of pillows you want before your visit and they are on the bed when you arrive. Very clean and we would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + The room was very clean. reception staff at check in very friendly and helpful. also the breakfast staff, always a smile. good breakfast variations on the buffet. To the centre it´s just about 20 minutes by walking but there is also a train right around the corner of the hotel.- we had an late check out til 2pm, but right at 12am the cleaner cames into the room, even we still had the DND at the door. We told them that reception said we can check out later. The cleaner was telling us we are the last room he has to clean and that it is better for him if we could go right away. That´s absolutely a NO GO. The other minus was the bar staff in the evening. We where going to the bar area and take a seat and nobody came to bring us the menu or take the order. We had to go to the bar directly to get the menu and also again to place our order. Not the kind of service a for star hotel should serve.All in all it is a nice hotel, we felt very well.Jut the staff of housekeeping and bar need little more training.If we ever come back to Athen we will book again with Crowne Plaza.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I agree with most reviews here, the property is old and tired. I was offered club entrance as part of my spire elite status so that might drive my rating up a bit. I can deal with worn carpets and dirt in areas, but the arranged taxi dishonesty pushed me over the edge. I write this review as I head back to the states. The set price between the airport & city center is 38 euro in Athens. Perfect, makes things easy. I had a 5am flight so arranged a set taxi for that hour and requested card payment as I didn’t want to withdraw more euros. I was assured the price would be the same 38 euro... Upon arrival at the airport I was charged 54 euro.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is sold as a 5 star Hotel, but they hotel is quite old, and comparing with other 5 star crowne plaza hotels this one is definitely not at those levels.The location of the Hotel is great since you cna walk (5 minutes walking) to an underground station.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has become my favourite hotel in Athens. Close to metro station to reach airport and of course city centre. Check in was fast, efficient and was acknowledged my IHG status and preferences. As requested had an early check in. Room was clean, with all amenities available. Had room service and the food delicious. All staff there are very friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient for the metro to get into the town centre - or about 40 min walk. Service very good and polite, reception was speedy on arrival. Rooms large and clean - with good selection of teas/coffee and free water. Breakfast very good selection and particularly enjoyed the freshly squeezed orange juice, and the coffee. Ate in the restaurant one lunchtime - had a chicken dish that was very tasty and well worth the visit. Nice bar in the lobby with plenty of open space. Overall very good.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had visited Athens in March 2019 along with my family and stayed one night at Crowne Plaza and enjoyed good hospitality over there We liked the location of hotel which is hardly 5 minutes walking distance from the airport shuttle bus service station called illisia Our room was quite big ,neat and clean . Bathroom is having all branded luxurious type sanitary fittings such as Grohe and working well.We also enjoyed the American style morning breakfast including local made dishes .Since our flight is in the evening we had requested to extend the one hour check out time and management granted to stay extra time .In light of above I would strongly recommend to stay in this hotel .Since I had not used the pool and other facilities I would not like to comment on it .
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staffs are friendly and spoke English. We loved the clean room and beautiful view at our balcony only one floor below the rooftop restaurant. We love the breakfast buffet. There is a gym in the hotel. Only sad thing is the gift shop is not opened. Beside the hotels, there are a few good local Greek restaurants and its walking distance to the Metro. Very safe hotel.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommend. Even though not in city center i would recommend and would stay again. What you expect from an ihg hotel. Rooms clean and neat. Size ok. Breakfast not spectacular but decent. Area quiet. Access to metro
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a very good location close to Hilton area with bars and restaurants within walking distance, but although it was recently renovated it has a very nineties feel to it. For the money you pay you would expect something more. The staff is friendly.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable room and a bathroom so clean and well arranged that you take a bubble bath without a second thought. Crowded breakfast buffet if you choose to take a late breakfast. Very tasty espresso served on demand and smiling faces at the reception desk and in the dining room.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located fairly close to the historic centre of Athens, with a Metro station nearby. I stayed here from 3 to 8 January 2019. It is always good to arrive after a very long flight but before the official check-in time and hear: “We got your email and your room is ready for you.” Not just that but: “you’ve been upgraded.” The welcome fruit basket and the biscuits and chocolate were just what I needed. The welcome drink and snack would have been even more welcome if the Bar (and Reception) had been staffed when I first tried to use the voucher; no problem the second time.In most such hotels, the General Manager is just a signature at the bottom of the welcome letter, but in my room were his full contact details – excellent!Comfort was what I paid for and got: Crowne Plaza hotels deserve their reputation. The staff were invariably courteous and attentive. The man who escorted me to my room was very helpful in explaining how to use the key card and the air conditioning.My room 612 (photo) was spacious and well equipped: a bed so comfortable that it could have contained a family; a generously sized desk; numerous power points. The indications on the switches for DO NOT DISTURB/LAUNDRY/MAKE UP THE ROOM (photo) were particularly clear – a pleasant change from many hotels. There were as usual almost no clear indications of what the light switches controlled; in two cases, I eventually discovered the dimmer switches, one hidden on the floor behind the bedside table. Nightlights may have been there, but I did not find them. Above the bed there was a fire alarm ceiling light. Its constant flashing did nothing to improve my sleep quality. In many other hotels, the fire alarm was located out of eye contact of the sleeping guest. When I reported that the reading lamp (photo) was flickering, it was fixed on the same day.The WiFi was easy to access, with a strong signal, but – although I invariably clicked on “Connect automatically” - I had to log on with the password every I turned on my laptop and mobile, sometimes a slow and frustrating process (one photo – I have many more).A first for me was access to the room safe – with the credit card I used for the deposit and payment. I found this very convenient.The TV had a wide range of channels in several languages, with a lot of sport. The listing in the Guest Directory was pretty accurate. There was no Radio channel, as far as I could ascertain. There was a panoramic window with a view of the Attic Hills (photos). The storage space for luggage and clothes was more than adequate.The bathroom was big enough, with a bath/shower unit (photo) and a generous supply of toiletries, but not enough space around the basin for my own toiletries; there was no non-slip bath mat. The waste bin was a noisy pedal-operated one with a metal lid, the kind that make the guest’s life unnecessarily difficult in some hotels. The desk bin was open-topped.The cleaning staff were unobtrusive and thorough, even discreetly and helpfully tidying away the items I had left in the bathroom.The two bathrobes and pairs of slippers were an added bonus. The tea/coffee-making facilities were excellent, and there was even hot chocolate. The room’s design was fairly modern and tasteful. I tried the breakfast buffet on my last day: it was good but slightly smaller than could be expected from a hotel of this category. There was a refreshingly large proportion of local dishes, instead of the usual predominance of US breakfast items. There was a limited range of soft drinks, relieved by a mechanical juicer, providing fresh orange juice. The service was attentive but not obtrusive.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for four nights in a Club room early in December. The room was a good size, kept very clean and had a balcony which would be really nice in warmer weather. The club lounge had snacks available all day including breakfast pastries, midday sandwiches / rolls plus meat and fish dishes in the evening. There was an extensive choice of both cold and hot food at the breakfast buffet in the restaurant on the ground floor. The hotel is some 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro station and 25 minutes walk from the city centre. The reception staff were really friendly and helpful. Overall was good value, particularly the club rooms.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we must say that the hotel need renovation. The pool area is small and new forniture is needed. We had some misunderstanding with staff in the morning, about seating. The front office was polite and helpful.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is ok for an overnight stay more like a business mans hotel. No atmosphere in hotel or bar area with football on TV screens. Room was basic clean and comfortable. Car parking is a real problem in this area with limited spaces
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great in every way except for the gym. My wife and I stayed in Athens for a long weekend. We stayed here using some IHG points. This is a great property with an excellent location just a five minute walk from a metro station that has a direct line to the airport. Total transit time to and from the airport is about forty minutes. It's just two or three stops from the Greek Parliament, the Parthenon, and all the big tourist attractions in Athens. It's also a short fifteen minute walk from the foot of Mount Lycabettus, the tallest mountain (or more accurately, hill) in Athens, which is a great walk if you enjoy that sort of thing.The only downside is that the gym is rather mediocre - the dumbbells only go up to about 7 kg, and there are no other free weights, no barbells, and limited machines. But beyond that, the rooms are great, with comfortable beds and a good, large bathroom. Great service - they let my wife check in early and check out after me. I was upgraded to a club room since it was the off season, and they also have a nice balcony view too.Also, one note for higher IHG rewards members - here, they let me choose between lounge access or 600 IHG points on check in, since I have Spire Elite status. I chose the lounge, which I would highly recommend. The lounge has some croissants and drinks in the morning, and also has a very large selection of a little over a dozen different liquors at night, all of decent quality (IE Johnny Walker, Smirnoff, etc.). Great if you're looking to have a cheap drink with a friend.Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a place to stay in Athens. I was just looking for a place to use my rewards points while staying in Athens, and this place fit the bill completely.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall the hotel is well maintained and the bed is extremely comfortable, with proper duvets and feather down pillows. Bathroom offers nice Greek toiletries, shaving mirror with its own light & a bidet as well.Some critical points worth mentioning are the ridiculous minibar prices (€12 for a single shot liquor bottle, €5 for a small soft drink bottle) which are too high for a mid-range hotel in Greece, and that housekeeping comes into the room in the morning even when the “do not disturb” light is on. As I checked in at 3:30 in the morning I really wanted to sleep untilcheck-out, but was woken up at 9:30. No apology was given from housekeeping or reception.Regular Crowne Plaza visitors staying in standard rooms will not find the usual CP amenities such as the room/pillow spray. When I asked the housekeeping lady she mentioned these are only available on the executive floors. As an IHG Gold member I was surprised I wasn’t on one of those floors or upgraded to any kind of preferred room such as high floor or view etc. Late check-out request was also denied, only allowed to check out 1pm instead of noon (previous hotel allowed 4pm without any status)Status customers will should not expect any preferred treatment at this property.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ...here's the proof! Well appointed rooms with massive bathrooms, excellent gym and a restaurant to die for. Still, it's the people here that shine, elevating this hotel from a generic brand name to a destination: Vaya, the restaurant captain can suggest the best pairings for food and drinks; Nick at the front desk can answer any question; Constantine at breakfast remembers how you like your coffee - try the traditional pies, they are so good! Also, five minutes ON FOOT from the blue tube line, connecting the airport and the heart of Athens, cash machine in the lobby and a small supermarket three minutes away - all the amenities within reach for a hassle free stay!
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here on a group tour. The hotel is conveniently located, close to metro & gardens. Our room was a good size, nice accommodations, clean & well kept hotel. The only negative I have is the hotel food. The breakfast buffet was fine but the dinners left much to be desired. Most food was cooked to death. I would definitely recommend the hotel but avoid the hotel restaurant.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They still allow smoking in the hotel despite the law changes in 2010. The mix smoking and non-smoking rooms together. If you're going to flout the law then at least put all the smokers who want to kill themselves on the same floor and not kill those of us who want to live a smoke free life. Frankly most places in Athens openly flout the law. The repairs in the rooms need to be done to a much higher standard. It is very disappointing to see that you can't get a job finished to the same standard as the original finish. Repairing tiles and bath sealant is not a hard job and easy to get right ...and easy to get wrong. Cleaning around baths and sinks should be a priority and cleaning products used all the time. This would stop mould and dirt accumulating. Staff are friendly and efficient.baggage storage is in a room next to the front door and anyone can access this as I did when I came to collect my bag. No one there to challenge me!
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are very good: the bed, linen, pillows are pleasant, fresh and very clean. The bathroom is well equipped. I had a shower in the bath tub, which was okay for me. The rooms are quiet.Breakfast is on the roof, which gives a nice view. What I missed here were the healthy alternatives: fruits, oats, muesli, etc were rather limited. Although it is considered a business hotel, I found most of the hotel & breakfast guests were (Chinese and American) tourists. Not an issue, but it is for sure not just a business hotel.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a superior room at 300 euros per night with breakfastm the room was clean but smaller than I would have expected. The bathroom also smaller than expected. Was a platinum ihg member but got no upgrade or anything for it. The breakfast was also not much choice and very few cut fruits available. The rooms were clean and hotel walking distance to conference Megaron
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza Athens City is a business hotel in the heart of Athens. The location is very good not far away from the city center or other attractions.However, the best times of the hotel seem to be over. The style is late 90’s with old carpet and a dedicated smell in each room. It’s not a bad hotel per se just it is old and lacking renovation. For the price of 139€ I definitely expect more.People are friendly and supportive but the location is just average
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A 3-night stay for family. We found the staff friendly and professional, the rooms clean and a good base for our adventures. This is a go-to for many of the flight crews from what I saw, so that always gives me comfort. Tour bus would pick up at this location so convenient in that regard. We had a family of 5 and they accommodated. Excellent view of the Acropolis from the covered rooftop breakfast area, so super duper views and the breakfast was excellent. Would stay again.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room ok, spacious snd practical. Iron and ironing board, nice bathroom, bathtub and shower. Good breakfast even though bacon seems more boiled than fried. Could have more peeled and sliced fruit. A bit inefficient coffee/tea serving. All in all good experience.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms carpet is old but there are lots of good points, at the end of the day you forget about carpet! - Few minutes away from Metro! By Metro you can go to most of the sights...- Front desk is extremely friendly and helpful! - Staffs are very well trained, polite & smiling - breakfast is adequate! - shower tools are nice,good smell ! Looks like from Greek famous company..- Bed is wonderful! Very comfortable and big- Balcony is a treasure! Definitely will come back...
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location near the metro to get into downtown Athens. Really good breakfast and decent-sized rooms for our family of six. We had two connecting rooms, which is a must with our four young kids, for our three night stay. The hotel staff were really helpful and friendly. We really enjoyed relaxing by the pool, which is a good size for central Athens.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Business stay for me. Booking was made by our agents and hadn’t gone through by the time we got to the hotel. However the reception staff were so helpful and did all they could to minimise the delay.The rooms are nice, full bathroom. HDMI ports built into the wall beneath the TV - good idea that.Breakfast is good. Buffet with large variety, even better it is on the 7th floor and the design feels as if you are eating Al Fresco. The bar there is also pleasant in the evening.If you want to eat close by, there is a small Brazilian restaurant just around the corner ‘Kritinos Skitouros’ as well as a very very good tavern next door ‘Kalos Tous’. The latter serves brilliant food, lovely staff and cold beer.If you are unfamiliar with Athens, do your research about the metro underground. There is a link to the airport for €10.This Crowne Plaza is a definite thumbs up.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped in this hotel for 3 nights to visit the Athens before we go on the island for vacation.Convenient localization: close to blue line of metro, walk to Plaka and Acropolis is not a big challenge, Lycabettus mount is also walking distance – I recommend it at night. The breakfast with good selection of food (also local) and the view from the panoramic window of the restaurant makes the breakfast even better.The terrace with small pool good for short break during the day and fantastic for the evening drink.The room is clean. The staff speaks good English breakfast team very helpful . The Receptionists might be more service oriented sometimes.I could recommend it as a safe place for City Break in Athens.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family who were on a short sightseeing trip to Athens and wanted a convenient good value hotel, we were not disappointed. Very friendly staff make you feel welcome as soon as you arrive, the hotel itself has had a makeover and looks top notch both on the common areas and the rooms.Book a “club room” if you can, it’s only a little more and includes breakfast and access to free drinks and snacks. The small hotel pool was a bonus for the kids after a long hot day seeing the sights. I would throughly recommend this hotel !
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convinient hotel, clean rooms and common places and nice breakfast. It is 5 minutes walk to the metro and it has a pool in the rooftop. Deffinitely recommend it. The staff is very helpful and willing to serve,
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although situated in a primarily residential area, the hotel is about 15 minutes walk from the main attractions, like Syntagma Square and the main shopping street, and a little further to Plaka.The rooms are clean, spacious and nice and the staff are only too happy to help. The hotel has a garden bar on the roof which is a lovely sun spot and has a little plunge pool, and a nice area to sun bathe. In August, the terrace is a lovely spot into the early evening.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here one night before a cruise (port is about 20mins away). The hotel feels like it’s located in a residential area, there’s not much to see/do around the hotel.Was a little disappointed that there was a lack of buzz/atmosphere, felt like we were the only ones there until breakfast. We ate in the lobby/bar area by the entrance as no one was in the upstairs restaurant, menu was a bit strange & didn’t enjoy the massively overpriced mini burgers.Our room seemed like it had been recently refurbished; the bathroom had mermaid coloured mosaic tiles which I liked, however the room smelt smoky as though previous occupants had smoked cigarettes which wasn’t very pleasant.Don’t miss the kebab shop which does a thriving trade (great value kebabs & drinks, try the chicken gyros!) Great atmosphere. Turn right out of the hotel, it’s about 3 shops up.On a positive side the hotel has an excellent buffet breakfast; there is an extensive selection, every breakfast item you could wish for!!
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife had enough points for a free night. Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Check in was fast and efficient. Had a room on the second floor. I was surprised at how quiet the room was. Our bed was pretty comfortable. The roof top pool was very nice. There are pool towels upstairs in the restaurant. Room and bathroom were clean and everything was in good working order. Located only a few blocks from the subway which takes you everywhere in Athens.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza Athens is a nice hotel located close to a metro stop in Athens. It is a short metro ride to the historic area of Plaka. This hotel also offers a very nice breakfast buffet including both hot and cold items. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is not even close to worth what you pay and poorly trained rude staff make it terrible. Just up the road from the Hilton and the rate I paid was on average over euro200 a night. The room was small and smelly because it was dirty. I don’t think it was vacuumed while I was there and the carpets did not seem to be cleaned properly ever. The gym was awful - no towels or wipes provided and very limited poorly maintained equipment One mat not cleaned and the bike was broken - simply needed the chain repaired. On the Sunday I arrived I had to beg someone to look at it - finally did and sort of fixed it - broke again on the Monday - only when the manager arrived did anything actually happen or any complaints get addressed. The rest of the staff did nothing but basically lie and say they had tried to call me when they had not - even though I asked for email responses. They tried hard to get me to go somewhere far from reception to complain but the only way you get any action is if you complain at the tiny checkin desk where others are also waiting - otherwise the particularly rude weekend lady just talks on the phone while you wait. I booked an additional night to ensure an early check in - which was then chaos both at reception and breakfast - only sorted out the next day when the manager got involved. Breakfast is tour group style - nothing to order - eggs fried and left to lie there through out service. No working WiFi in breakfast area. This is an embarrassment to crowne plaza although the group doesn’t really seem to care either as I mailed them during the stay and they didn’t respond either Very unfortunate
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights at crowne plaza city centre Athens.Recognised priority club members with welcome letter.Swift check in by courteous staff. Good breakfast selection.. Requested for late check out was granted. As location was central it was easy for tour busses for pick up.Visited Delphi one day full tour and Acroplois. EXCELLENTfull day cruise to islands.of poros , hydra and Aegina.Crowns plaza highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel with wonderful roof top pool and bar. EXCELLENT breakfasts in the mornings - endless items! I enjoyed not being in the overcrowded city center. Good choice for family or business. Clean rooms and nice baths.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two nights at the Crowne Plaza were part of a package tour. The hotel felt very comfortable, including the spacious lobby / lounge area. We ate one dinner here and it was fine. There are a few cafes nearby and we heard good things about one of them. I recommend sticking to wine in the roof top bar, as the cost of an Aperol Spritz was excessive, in my view (and the bartender did not know how to make it).
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service that you almost don't see as it is not in your face. Perfect for the British! Definitely worth checking out the roof terrace. Rooms clean and service excellent. Air conditioning perfect for July
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located behind Hilton hotel 5 min walk to the metro stationThe hotel is on a noisy road can’t open window st nightWhen checked in to my room had to open my window to fresh the room the street noise forced me to close the window after few minutesCheck in was fast and professionalRoom is well equipped for Buisness traveler with working desk with many AC USB and multimedia plugsBed is good but TV size is very small for 4 star hotelFree Wi-Fi but connection speed is slowBath accessories and shower are okBreakfest on the roof floor is good with big variety with bonus of nice view through the windows
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here for 2 nights. It is reasonable with good breakfast and service. It is central, which makes it easier to get around but one can also take the taxi in order to get to certain places if needed.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a truly lovely hotel! On the club floor suite our suite had 2 beautiful beds, wardrobe closet, safe and a superior bathroom!!! The balcony was magnificent with beautiful views! Full breakfast served in the morning upstairs next to the rooftop pool! It’s was very nicely decorated and very convenient for us! Staff was so nice and accommodating!
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, really a few block away from the city center but that’s not all.Very elegant place with a great Restaurant called Ambrosia where we had a very good Greek taste. The roof Restaurant has a great view over the gardens. Pool and fitness center.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, average size rooms and friendly/helpful staff. We spent the majority of time in downtown Athens. We were able to walk to Syntgma square in about 20 minutes but more often took the subway 2 stops (subway is very nice in Athens, would recommend). The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the subway and seemed to be more located in a residential area. We went to the pool to cool down one afternoon...the pool is pretty small and they did have nice lounge chairs but they can fill up quickly. We enjoyed a beer under the umbrellas though. I would recommend the hotel but if you are looking to be right in the mix in the downtown area, then you would want a hotel a little closer.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly welcome, room adequate and reasonably comfortable. Good bathroom amenities and shower pressure (although shower in bath tub a bit 1990s)The stale filter coffee in room was a poor substitute for a Nespresso type machine. It really should be standard at 200e in “Club” room.I paid for breakfast but we slept in so cannot comment. Pool terrace on L7 devoid of atmosphere. Not a place to linger and at 11 e for an espresso and simple oj (in addition to what ai already paid for breakfast x2) probably best avoidedWe followed the advice of the helpful check in lady and dined at the local restaurant opposite. An excellent choice that made up for the dreary hotel experience
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, good rooms and very friendly staff.Downstairs restaurant was closed but roof top restaurant was covering that. Breakfast and dinner served there, however it did feel more like pool bar with plastic chairs and tables, also would need bit of renovation.Breakfast was ok but dinner big disappointment.Lounge very good and good selection of drinks! Worth to take it.Name City Center - ok, but does not feel like city center, 2 metro stop to center is hoewever ok.
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for a long weekend City break. The staff were so friendly and helpful, from when we checked in to helping us get orientated. There is a lovey roof top pool, with a bar a restaurant or the top floor. There are a few sun loungers if you want some down time in the sun. Our room was clean and very modern, and made up each day. It is in a good location for Taxis into the city - if your feeling lazy like us - about €7, but also close to a metro station. I would certainly stay here again if going back to Athens!
hotelName:
9    Crowne Plaza Hotel - Athens City Centre
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a week at this hotel during July.If there was a 4.5 grade, then this is what I would give the hotel. The hotel is great on almost all aspects, other than the location, which reduces it attractiveness slightly.Location1: there is a free shuttle bus to the center; but it is rather infrequent (every hour or so, and stops running a little too early at night). The walk to the Metro station is rather unpleasant. It is not dangerous, but much of the walk is along a busy highway, without a proper pedestrian walkway. This means that you are stuck with the mercy of Taxis, and most of those don't have much mercy; we've taken at least 4 taxi rides each day (with some days more than 4) for a week, and 7 out of 10 rides would be fairly unpleasant or dishonest: overcharge, take the long way around, claim the ride is "fixed price", smoke in the car, etc. (Taxi drivers all over the world try to rip you off, if they can, but it seems that in Athens they try harder.)Location2: the location is not bad; with some patience, the Acropolis museum is only about 15-20 minute walk; it is just not a very pleasant walk. The city center (Syntagma square) is another 15 minute walk from the museum.Location3: The Koukaki neighborhood is across the highway (which means it is about 10 minute walk) is a really nice neighborhood, residential, and also small restaurants and bars. You can walk through this neighborhood up to the Philopappos hill and Monument, which makes a spectacular view of the city and of the whole Acropolis area.The hotel is rather new and very convenient. Everything works almost perfectly. The lifts are a little annoying, because the chip-based cards take a little too long to respond, and the door usually closes before you manage to press the floor button. Even after some practice, it still takes a while to press the button. This is done for security reasons, so it is fine, although a slightly faster, contactless, card, would have provided the same security, with a much simpler experience.The rooms are large and spacious, and the beds are huge and comfortable. The A/C works really well, quiet and effective. The shower/bathroom facilities are just great. The wi-fi also works well.In spite of being a high-ranking loyalty member, we got the room with the depressing view of a deserted building, which looks like it was specially imported from Chernobyl after the nuclear accident. The other side of the corridor has much nicer views, with some rooms even having a line of sight to the Acropolis.A number of airlines use this hotel for their pilots and flight attendants. Breakfast is great. There is a lady that prepares eggs who is probably a Master Chess player; there is hardly any queue; you walk up to her, tell her what sort of eggs you'd like, and go back to your seat; she remembers all the orders, and quickly figures out who belongs to whom in the dining room, and you would often hear her say something like "you can bring this omelet to your brother". She is spectacular and gives the best, most effective, service. The concierge services are wonderful. They are available 24-hours a day, and you can even contact them via e-mail. You can order a car-hire through them, and the car would be delivered to the hotel, and picked up from the hotel. You can book various trips through them. Or ask them for guidance and advice. Always helpful, always excellent service.The food and drinks in the lobby are unreasonably expensive, but I also have to say that they are very (very) good.Security: I spotted numerous security people in the hotel day and night. I'm not sure of the details, but it looked like security is taken very seriously. This is very reassuring.Another issue in the hotel, which I suspect is true for other hotels in Athens, and maybe the whole of Greece, is that the corridors are invariably filled with a smell of cigarette smoke. It seems that some of the guests smoke in the non-smoking rooms, and it doesn't look like smoking regulation is enforced. The rest of the staff, including _everyone_ (check-in counter, cleaning services, taxi porter) are all excellent and provide the best service.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly reception and overall service. Rooms are very spacious and confortable. Beds are great. Bathrooms are large and nice amenities. Breakfast is good with large selection of foods. In general the food was delicious. Well equipped gym. Hotel is well located and there is a shuttle service to Parlament area. Overall it was a great experience.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for business travel. Staff are very hospitable and the room is spacious and has a great setup to work too. The gym and pool are both small, but adequate. Only disappointment was the breakfast, which was €33.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel, good location, number of eating choices, big comfortable rooms with all the modern amenities, we had drinks at the Roof Top Premiere Bar with a great view Parthenon lit up and glowing gold and the Art Lounge
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice property, we really enjoyed our stay , Shuttle bus service was good to move around. Staff and service was good ,rooms are good . Very nice lobby set up. We had a great time in Athens. Must visit.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upgraded to a Deluxe room which was spacious however the bathroom a little outdated bathtub with shower on the wall.. Breakfast was the same on the 2 nights that i stayed there for such a high calibre hotel you think that it would not be the same for the 2 days.. great swimming pool however if you dont have flip flops to wear around the black stone and wooded decking well you nearly have blistered feet and yes its that hot that you can fry bacon an eggs on it ..unfortunately the designer didn't take into account the health and safety of the Guests..
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay at Intercontinental hotels all over the world and have had amazing experiences - I’m still not sure how I feel about this hotel.All staff we interacted with were lovely & helpful but calling room service for breakfast was not as helpful - the lady I spoke with was not very friendly & when i enquired about a missing breakfast item she wasn’t very helpful- it was like I was an intrusion on her time!I am a member but some of my preferences were not in place - fortunately that was rectified as soon as I brought them to attention- i.e 2 single beds instead of the double/queen/king we have listed as preferred - we are a married couple - married over 25 years!Not sure I would stay here again - time will tell. Visiting the Acropolis was our highlight!
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
