review_body: My first stay here in this group of hotels.. it was very good service and it was more then 5stars in my books... a amazing place to have your business meetings..... many tours are done from this hotel ..... 730am sharp...you got to be there...
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Intercontinental Athens was a pleasant surprise. We stayed in a suite on the top floor. The views of the Acropolis were like I have I have never seen the Parthenon before, and I live in Athens. I especially enjoyed the 24 hour gym with nice technogym equipment. Also, the room was newly renovated, super clean and very spacious. The breakfast was very good, especially the small but fluffy pancakes. Clio at customer service was very polite.Cons: the bathroom was very small and dated for a suite, and the room had a lumpy bed and kitsch miniature metal cars in EU countries flag colours on the wall. The ladies at the Club Reception on the 8th floor were not very polite, they looked bored and chatted loudly among themselves annoying the mostly foreign businessmen guests, especially Thetis.Overall, a great city centre hotel for businessmen, families and couples to stay in. A lot of money has been spent on it and it shows. Staff need to be on top of their game to get top marks.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here recently on a family vacation. Staff is outstanding, bellman, front desk were exceptionally helpful. The Club access is the best we’ve experienced in a long time. Food was excellent and service was attentive and exceptionally professional. And the views are amazing.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend stayed in the hotel from the 12th of June till the 18th of June in 2019. We experienced it as luxurious with very helpfull staff. We had a Superior Room which was very spacious and clean. After a long day sightseeing it felt very comfortable returning to the hotel. The hotel is conveniently located in the city. You can easily walk to the city centre or to a near metro station.If you require a little bit more comfort, you can take a free shuttle bus to Syntagma Square and back. Our breakfast buffet was included and consisted of a wide range of fresh fruits, yoghurts, bread, fish, meat, coffee and a whole lot more high quality goodness.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel bar, as per my other review, has a view of the Acropolis and the Parthenon. It's a very nice hotel, looks and feels very new. The breakfast buffet offered a lot of options, as did the lunch buffet. We had a work gala dinner on the first night, which had some great food and plenty of wine and beer. If I was staying myself, however, I would not stay here simply because it was so expensive for basic things. 9.50 Euro for a Coke? Crazy. But if you're looking for a high end experience, I would recommend it.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You should be blushing selling the plastic water bottle with 4,-€ and serving it without even a glass. We have to drink the water in the cafe from the plastic bottle. And the waiters answer was: “You can write a bad review, it doesn’t concern me.”
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful five star hotel in Athens! Twenty minute walk to the Acropolis and plenty of old Athens charm.The breakfast buffet was amazing with a variety of different food and traditional Greek favourites.The service at this hotel was exceptional and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. My husband and I especially loved the restaurant/lounge on the top floor.The bartenders, Chris and George made the best drinks! Exceptional service.Lovely view of the Acropolis too.Beautiful pool area outside to relax by.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel catered more to business groups than vacationers. Not walking distance, but had free hotel shuttle to/from Syntagma. Rooms with views of Lycabettus Hill or Acropolis. Big bathroom. Nice just not quite City Centre.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent stay at this hotel. Near metro, 7mins walk. Nice breakfast buffet spread but always same everyday. The room had a sitting area. We were upgraded to a room with acropolis view. Only problem was, hotel staff like cleaners, keep trying to enter the room. There's no doorbell or do not disturb sign or button.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I read some of the negative reviews here and have to scratch my head and wonder if we stayed at the same hotel. This is not to diminish anyone else's experience or evaluation, only to say that my own stay here was perfect. My wife and I used our IHG Ambassador weekend certificate and really couldn't have been happier. The hotel upgraded us to a fantastic Club Floor suite with a balcony, and Club Floor personnel, from the concierge to the waiters, were all just perfect. We didn't experience any problems during our stay, and the couple of small requests we had were handled immediately and professionally. The location is just OK, and the shuttle service is good enough for what it is. I would recommend this hotel without any reservation.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is difficult to add something new to all reviews of Athenaeum InterContinental. I stayed in this hotel for a week in December 2018 for a conference. My room was large, very comfortable and quiet. The professional services were very good; friendly but not overly pushy. Location: yes the hotel is located a bit far away from Syntagma Square. I walked to and from the hotel several times. Approximately 25 minutes one way. Yes, the path walks in Athens are terrible. I tripped several times. Be careful. Of course, this has nothing to do with the hotel. The shuttle bus goes to the Square every hour. Taxi costs approximately 10 euros. Food: if you do not feel like eating in the hotel, there is a very small caffe in front of the hotel, in addition to a family-run eatery approximately 200 m from the hotel to the right. These establishments will definitively help you to avoid going hungry to bed. A lot of restaurants 12-15 minutes walk from the hotel in the direction of downtown. As I mentioned, be careful when walking. Your best bet is to use an official crossing of the major car artery. In summary: this hotel represents the American standard in Athens. Slightly remote location from the city centre may bring some issues, however.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my sixth year staying at the InterContinental Athenaeum, and the first that I was upgraded to the executive level. The 8th floor executive and service staff are all exceptional - they seemed to know what I needed practically before I knew myself. Given my intensive schedule providing one-on-one coaching services for the MIT Enterprise Forum of Greece accelerator each year, this kind of support and thoughtfulness is extremely helpful. My room was the same style as in previous years - lots of space, great bed, WiFi and Ethernet access, windows that open (a little bit, anyway), good shower. TV is OK though I hate that there is no Sleep option and it's a bit outdated in terms of access to movies and other features... but one does not come to Athens to watch TV! (I am just a terrible sleeper...)In addition to helping to make a challenging business trip more manageable, the views and service in the 8th floor "club" were wonderful (see photos). Food is great in the various restaurants. Unfortunately, it was too cold most days to use the balcony for breakfast but it's great to be able to step out even for a few moments to drink in the view. The location is a bit inconvenient relative to where I work but as the waterfront continues to be developed, I expect the location will be more convenient for many people. However, there is a long line of taxis available at the hotel, public transportation is a short walk away, and there is an on-site garage, so many solutions.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice a week apart, travelling for business and leisure in Greece. Definitely worth booking a Club room as tge view of the Acropolis from Club Lounge is amazing! Great service and really friendly staff made our stay even better. Thanks!
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to declare up front I didn’t enjoy visiting Athens. It’s a dump. Almost every square inch is covered in graffiti, it’s generally pig ugly (except for the historic sites and even these are unkempt) and you can taste the pollution. I won’t be returning, ever. So that might colour my view of everything, so I’ll try to be fair to this hotel. First, the rooms are large, with a sofa and seating area, beds very comfortable and public areas generally clean. Prices horrific, €7.50 for a cappuccino €20 for a club sandwich but that’s probably standard for this type of hotel. Gym is pretty good for a hotel gym, pool rather small and disappointing. There’s a spa but didn’t use it. Didn’t have breakfast included in the rate and didn’t want to spend €30 a head. And there lies the problem .. the hotel sits on a busy dual carriageway that is more like a motorway. Roaring traffic noise all day long and nothing very close by in the way of amenities. The concierge will direct you to three restaurants about 10 mins walk away (Flavour is the best of the three and food was good) but you’ll need to walk along a poorly lit, rubble strewn pavement which feels quite unsafe and pass derelict buildings and seedy sex shops on the way. It’s not pleasant. So if you don’t want to be ripped off by the hotel prices you’ll need to head into Athens. The hotel runs a free bus but only on an hourly basis. If you miss it, you’ll need a taxi or to walk ten minutes along the dual carriageway to the nearest metro station from where you can get quickly and cheaply into Athens. Traffic is pretty bad all the time so the bus trip can take 20-30 minutes any time of day. My recommendation would be to use this hotel if you want good quality accommodation at a reasonable price and don’t mind being outside the city centre. However, unless you’re visiting Athens purely to see the historic sites, I’d advise you to look elsewhere because there is very little about this city to fall in love with.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was quite large; staff was very friendly and helpful when needed; 15 minute walk to the museum or 5 euro taxi ride; breakfast they have is amazing. Only note is parking is a little expensive as I had a rental- 22 euro per day
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a good hotel so you would expect good service but this was excellent. A lovely hotel, great room and service. Only downside is that it’s just outside of the main city and in quite a run down area!
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is reasonably well located from the historical centre, the rooms are spacious and have most of the comforts that can be expected from a five star hotel. The bathrooms are modern, the showers are comfortable and even have a bidet. The free WiFi is effective and the buffet breakfast is great spread and should not be missed.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Huge bedrooms with view on acropolis. Great breakfast with delicious yogourt.bed confortable, staff very nice at the desk and for cleaning also. Large lifts. Bedrooms with a living room (sofa). Coffee and tea for free.A lot of taxis clothe the hotel for driving downtown (6€ !). It was a great journey here.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is slightly dated however the service in the best. The staff is so helpful and ready to assist with whatever you need. We got laundry service in 2 hours for no additionanal charge. Great short free bus ride to center of town. Nice rooms, good food, and amenities. The concierge floor service is very good. housekeeping outstanding.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good hotel, but the location is a bit far from other eating places and shops. but the hotel provides a shuttle bus to the city center so that it can help guests. Hotel staff is very helpful and responds quickly if needed
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If we could have stayed longer in Athens, we would have. Our hotel room was great! Very spacious, clean, comfy bed, and good WiFi. Loved the hotel staff too. The restaurant at the top is a Michelin related restaurant and we really enjoyed it and the view.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perhaps not so central however there is a free shuttle bus to Syntagma and lots of taxis too. The staff from reception to housekeeping to breakfast and the bar staff all professional and helpful and friendly. Rooms are good sizes and nice bathroom toiletries with korres products. Bar in the lobby area lovely and great pianist and lovely drinks. Breakfast is huge so much choice. Lovely property older but really well maintained and renovated.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooftop restaurant and bar were lovely. Typical business-style hotel. Good pool amenity. Local construction in the area of the hotel was distracting, however, the staff handled it well. Nice pool. Currency exchange at hotel was helpful. Make sure to have the concierge call a cab for you (Athens is notorious for haggling cab drivers)
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I visited this for the first two days of our trip in Athens.There are a few highlights that really made this hotel so good.Location very near to city center Transportation from airport or for any where to visit around the center can be easily arranged by hotel and paid at the end of your stay.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stop in Greece, with the first being Zakynthos. This is a nice modern hotel. Clean rooms, nice view. We walked around the area scouting for a restaurant in the evening and found a couple of nice ones. The location of the hotel is good just stay on the main road if you are walking immediately you leave the hotel. Don’t take the small street directly in front of the hotel going into the center of town where the restaurants are. It is a bit sketchy, and the folks there looked rather shady. The main road isn’t really for casual walking immediately you leave the hotel but after 5-6 minutes you are on a proper sidewalk. Would do it again.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of my favourite hotels is the Intercontinental Athenaeum in Athens. It's not because it is especially well located or has a great architectural style, it is because it has fantastic views over the city and especially the Acropolis. Having breakfast in the club lounge looking at the ancient world is fantastic. The hotel is located about a half hour drive from the airport and within walking distance of some of Athens best attractions. The rooms are modern and big as are the bathrooms. The only drawback is a lack of power points in the room especially around the bed. There is a great gym with a pool and a full service Spa, great restaurants and bars in the hotel as well as around the hotel. The club lounge has an excellent offering on both food and drinks with great staff and great service. Overall a great hotel, making it hard to leave and explore the town.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can someone tell me the brand of pillows? We recently stayed here and loved the bedding. I would love to find the same to buy for my home :) Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks in advance for your help.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great experience staying in this hotel. From the Check-in time till Check out, the staff was really polite and friendly. Room was comfortable and the food was really delicious. Hope to be back there soon
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the hotel's lobby. Warm environment and good service! A large number of freshly cooked food. The rib eye steak and lobster with pasta is a must. Salads all freshly made with care and real french fries!!!
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: High level hotel in Athens, close to downtown. Services according to high Intercontinental high standards, but room fares above average.Proper room cleaningless, although i found in the bed a long black hair...Average breakfast.There are other very good hotel even in the neighboors as more reasonable fares.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a loyal customer paying a good amount of money for many years and everything was really good. in my last visit my reservation was made with points -Platinum Ambassador- . upon arrival I found out that breakfast was not included. Then with the confidence of the loyal customer who is also a Platinum Ambassador I said to them that they should for once give the breakfast complimentary. Note that these people know me by my name after all these years and we feel comfortable with each other. I was so sure they wouldn't refuse. And then you see how their attitude change and they were negotiating to give me 50% disc. on breakfast. 6 or 7 people( from clerks to managers) talked to me, making me feel bad about my request. I was so embarrassed by the whole situation that I avoided everyone for the rest of my stay. Told them I was not begging and it was a matter of courtesy towards a good customer to offer it by themselves. An that was my last time with them. For a breakfast they lost a loyal customer and they were rude and proud of it.!! Never trust the smile of a person who has to gain something from you. I found better hotel options and I'm building new relationships for my business trips.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location - just outside the city centre but they have a shuttle that comes and goes every 30 minsFood - great selection in the breakfast buffet, including several choices of Greek yoghurt and Greek pastriesRoom - spacious and good layoutStaff - very helpful
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Facility, club lounge, rooms and customer service were all top notch. Hope to stay there again one day.Only down side is that this hotel is not in the main “hotel” district; however, private and public transportation makes very easy and inexpensive to get to all the must-see attractions.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on business and were not totally blown away. A few non “5 star” things occurred - construction in the room above with drills, hammers, etc very early in the morning with no warning, cigarette smoke blowing in through the air conditioning.. and while they moved us for the noise with just a simple mention of the noise, they were very “is everything okay, is everything okay” every five minutes after that, like they were waiting for us to flip out. It was also VERY expensive to dine in the hotel, $60 for breakfast when a few blocks down the street you can get three times as much food for a third of the cost and we also almost got charged for food from the minibar that we did not use. I also worked from the room a lot during the trip and was trying to relax and get things done in the room, sitting on the balcony in my pjs and it seemed like the phone was ringing or someone was knocking on the door every hour with housekeeping or “a gift from the hotel” (some crackers or something.) Overall it was not an awful experience, just not very relaxing.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the InterContinental Athenaeum for 2 nights on our honeymoon. The hotel held to the InterContinental standard with fine attention to detail, comfortable beds, luxury dining options, and accommodating (if not always the friendliest) staff. However, the location prevents this property from competing with other luxury hotels in Athens. There is a shuttle to and from Syntagma Square but the times aren't always convenient. I would not advise walking as the neighborhood feels less safe the farther you venture from town. We took a cab for less than 5 euro so this didn't make or break our decision to stay.Overall I would recommend the InterContinental Athenaeum if you would like to save a few bucks on luxury accommodations by staying outside the tourist zone.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was there for meeting at lobby bar kafe. Very nice place. Great for busses meeting. Coffee is very good. Service perfect . Price very high 7€ one coffee ! Be there again soon. Christmas time very beautiful entrance !
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greece for a business trip in November 2018. This hotel was very close to the conference venue - fantastically so, in fact - so I stayed here during my trip.I liked this place a lot. The room was spacious, peaceful and with all the facilities I normally like, and although the decor was a little unusual, it added to the character of the place rather than being distracting. Staff at reception were very helpful indeed, although the room staff were rather keen to pop in for various reasons - it's a good idea to have the 'do not disturb' handy.The main downside of this place for me was a different aspect of the location. While it was close to the event, it was also a decent stroll (~30 mins) from the centre of town, where I also had some meetings set up. Not a problem on a dry day, but Athens isn't the most fun city in the world when it's raining. However, there is always going to be a compromise between meetings in different locations! I'd definitely stay here again if I ended up back in this part of town.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is clean and very large, rooms are spacious, comfortable. I was in room 480, view was nothing special, but there are room with view to Acropolis. Bathroom is well equiped, clean, large. Towels are good. Bed is very large and very very pleasant for sleeping. Food is excellent, conference rooms are excellent.WiFi is great.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a view of the Parthenon from my room. The view from the six continents club is amazing. Drinks or dinner on the roof is a must with a fantastic view. The spa provides a great service and friendly staff. The pool is a nice place to hang out. The food is good.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Attending a meeting on week-end it was a rediscovery of this hotel where I had not been for the past 27 years. I was wondering how it would look and what a great surprise as everything there seams to be new or almost. An immaculate bright lobby where the huge Sphere is now stable but otherwise everything is spotless and smiles of staff are all over to make your stay more enjoyable. The Club floor attendance and space with a great terrace overlooking the Parthenon is quiet unique but there again is the impecable friendly service attitude with a touch of distinction that do make you feel welcome.Rooms are large and decorated with clear pastels color schemes that do perfectly reflect lighting and create a lovely atmosphere. The brasserie breakfast is an other positive point offering all what you want and therefore dangerous as you would put weight if you do not control yourself as the display buffet is tempting and colourful in a very nice room with two levels and the pool outside sending a refreshing blue effect of small waves shining on the sun. A perfect stay and week-end of a hotel where every one is well trained and committed to make your stay an unforgettable experience. This for sure can only be if you have an excellent management with sharp eye on the operation and it looks to be the case.Congratulations to the entire hotel to make our week end memorable. W#e shall be back.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hard to beat smiles at every turn with every employee. Large luxury commercial hotel that never fails to deliver. Cafe Zoe buffet a delight at breakfast. Club Lounge has great views of Acropolis. Suites with balconies best.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: well located close to touristic places. brilliant hotel where staff eager to beat your expectations. room large with good quality mattress and bedding.food excellent at every meal. smiles all round. pool sadly closed as temp of 24 considered to cold to have it opened. was 11 C when i left Europe. excellent WiFi coverage in every place of hotel
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 nights in this fabulous hotel. My room was very large, with a very comfortable bed and a view of the Acropolis. I ate in both the gourmet restaurant and the coffee shop and the food was great. The staff are attentive and welcoming. It has easy access to the historic centre, Piraeus and the airport. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there six nights for a conference and was delighted with the services the hotel provided. Breakfast was excellent. Friends who used the spa were impressed. The concierge inside and outside were extremely helpful as were the regular staff at the desk. The terraces overlooking the Acropolis were nothing short of stunning.I would have liked more light in the hotel room. I found the lobby and restaurant decor quite bland. Plants would greatly add to a sense of "life" and warmth. You have the opportunity to create a place of exquisite beauty yet for me there was nothing really special that said "Greece" and "Beauty" except the view of the Acropolis from the terrace. You could do so much more in the lobby area.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What is striking about this hotel is its inside beauty, in contrast with the external dull look of the building: a spacious and luminous lobby, the paintings and sculptures everywhere, an amazing terrace on the 8th floor facing the Acropolis. The room , the service, all are 5 stars!
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious suite with large balcony providing impeccable views of Acropolis. Stayed to celebrate wife's 40th. Firstrate hospitality and facilities as one would expect from Intercontinental. The decor could be a bit modem and room a bit brighter but overall excellent service. Would happily stay again.
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really good. The location is not too central but I was there for a conference. All major sites are within short driving distance. Rooms are clean and the breakfast is very good. I would probably stay in the hotel again since I had no problems
hotelName:
10    InterContinental Athenaeum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Especially during the very hot summer time, there is no better place to stay in Athens than at the Hilton. Its well kept pool is the largest in town, and quite popular with guests after an early morning round of sightseeing. The rooms and bathrooms are modern, breakfast is more than adequate. The staff is friendly, though not always as efficient as it could / should be. We'll be back.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel when i just arrived. The hotel is cozy and clean. It located in a very good neighborhood. Clean and very peaceful area. The pool is great and also the spa facilities are great ! I enjoy my stay here!!!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton Athens is of course a 5 star hotel. But its questionable as to whether its really worth it. Everything is great, room, service, food, etc, but there are definitely better hotels next door that are cheaper.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk recommended The Galaxy restaurant for our family dinner with three children and said it was family friendly. Everything on the menu was over €40 and no children’s menu, which is hardly kid friendly. I ordered the Maki Sushi Combo for €38 and it came with 12 tiny rolls - 8 of which were vegetable or imitation crab CA roll and a minute amount of tuna on the remains four rolls. I could get better in supermarket. Staff was very indignant about my complaint and just took the food away without apology. Then when we went to the pool kids were asked not to jump in or splash???Also, dinner in the other restaurant had a children’s menu but didn’t have half the options and they kept pouring bottles of water for us and then charged €18 for it! Not a friendly atmosphere and certainly not for families!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the Hilton is prime. A short walk to the bus tour, as well as an easy cab ride everywhere. The property itself was impeccable, the room was large and nicely appointed. The pool although very large, was crowded, but rightfully so! Restaurants were excellent, the rooftop was amazing. Service was excellent throughout. We traveled with a group of friends to three different islands, and this was the nicest room. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton had very comfortable beds, spacious rooms, White marble bathrooms with a SOAKING TUB.The BREAKFAST BUFFET was unbelievable! There was even a coffee bar. The barista made me a soy cappuccino. You could order a custom made omelette, and choose hot foods like potatoes, scrambled eggs, spanakopita , etc. or choose cold fruits , yogurts, granola, breads & pastries , and juices. There is also a modern GYM and SPA on site. The Hilton staff is bilingual, and very friendly and helpful. IRENE took my reservations for a massage via email prior to my arrival. She also showed me the locker rooms and where to meet my masseuse. There is also a nice pool and jacuzzi.Another convenient feature is that this Hilton Hotel is about 1 mile from the ACROPOLIS. I would NOT RECOMMEND the ROOFTOP RESTAURANT for dinner. The VIEW of the Acropolis is nice, but can be seen frommany rooftop restaurants in the area.The FOOD at the rooftop restaurant was not very good. I had beef cheeks that had dried tomato sauce on it, with awfultasting gnocchi & sauce. It didn’t even look appealing! My husband had fish with some oily tasting sautéed leafy greens . I cook very good sautéed Swiss Chard and steamed spinach at home. This was NOT yummy Swiss chard or spinach. Have a cocktail and go elsewhere for dinner!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right across the street to the sightseeing hop on/hop off bus. 20 minute walk to Plaka and you will stroll past ruins on your way. You can see the Acropolis from the hotel but it’s not super close. There is a square behind the hotel with good restaurants and cafes. Sizable pool, nice fitness center and the Galaxy Bar on the rooftop is stunning (but crowded and hard to get an outdoor seat).
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really disappointed in this Hilton Hotel. The room was good, but the service was very poor in regards to the ensuring that the room had sufficient toilet and Kleenex tissue. The breakfast buffet was very good, but the waiter/waitress seemed to be indifferent to the customer and were not very attentive. The Hilton Honors 11th floor reception room was below my expectations compared to other Hilton Hotels. The cost for drinks and meals was very expensive compared to outside restaurants and the food quality was not very good.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great roof top, great exec club, nice pool, great location, friendly staff, beautiful view of the acropolis. I would definitely recommend this hotel. We stayed at intercontinental on first part of trip, it was pretty nice, but this is even better.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel and very friendly staff. The rooms were big and clean. Great service. The breakfast buffet is awesome with variety of good quality food. Everything tasted great. The waiters are so courteous and friendly. Front disk and doormen are amazing.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, great hotel. Easy 20 minute walk to Syntagma Square, once you cross the main intersection outside the hotel, you follow the street all the way to the city. Along the way there are a handful of kiosks that we would stop at on our way back for the night to load up on snacks and drinks.Breakfast was convenient and had a good selection: eggs, bacon, hash browns, toasts, fruits, yogurt, etc. You can snag a table out on the balcony and eat with a view of the Parthenon.A downside to this was there wasn't a fridge?? Reading through the brochures, it says that you can purchase a fridge for 10 euros a day. Keep that in mind if you're bringing back any cold foods.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we checked in the lady behind the desk asked if we wanted to upgrade promising a great view. Which ended up be the roof tops of apartments. Additionally when we got to our room it smelled like cigarette smoke and the safe did not work because the battery was dead. After the porter came up and said it would be at the most 10 mins we decided to wait it out. After 40 mins he wasn’t back, went back downstairs got a new room. They gave us two free cocktails in the lounge, we went upstairs and every table outside that had a great view of the acropolis was “reserved” never telling us we need to reserve a table. Would not stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not far from Home Again at the Hilton Athens. A revisited place over and over with the same charm, warmth and magic again and again. A stunning hotel that makes sure to make all guests feel important and welcome.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Odd style of room. I'm currently staying here with a friend and was surprised to see that the bathrooms do not offer privacy from the rest of the room unless an interior curtain is pulled because the wall is glass. My bed is stiff and uncomfortable, and when I asked for my mini fridge to be emptied so that I could have space for some food I had already bought, they refused. This morning I was awoken by loud chatter in the hallway, so even though they may claim their windows are soundproof, their walls and doors are not. If you love smoking, you'll love this hotel. The hallway of my floor (12) smells like cigarette smoke, and the rooftop bar allows smoking – even cigars. A gentleman sitting next to me was essentially blowing cigar smoke in my face while I tried to enjoy the view of the Acropolis over the loud music. So far I have not experienced anything that would make me recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overpriced and overrated for what was delivered. A terrible dining experience. A staff that bordered on condescending. Location is not close to anything. Thank goodness taxi's are inexpensive! You buy the name and it is not worth it!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is first class. No brainer if you are a HiltonHonors member. But even if you’re not, it’s excellent for the extra effort they make....everywhere. Bravo to the staff that left rose petals on our bed when they learned we were celebrating our 25th anniversary here. Incredibly helpful finding restaurants and making reservations. Modern hotel with a rooftop view of Athens and the Acropolis. Izabelle at the front desk always knew our name and exceeded every expectation we could have as a hostess.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at a lot of hotels and resorts, but the Hilton Athens Hotel is at the top of the list. The rooms are very nice (we were on the 12th floor) and the staff was very professional. We had free breakfast (not sure if it is included or because of our status with Hilton), but it was a well payed out (large) buffet. The outside pool is well maintained and enjoyable. The inside pool (next to the gym which was impressive for a hotel) reminded me of a fish aquarium (because a portion of the side of the pool is glass).I cannot say enough about the staff. In a country where customer service seems to not be a priority, Hilton Athens made it so. My hat off to the entire staff and congrats to the management team.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a very good service in general. The breakfast is big, where Chryssa the supervisor awaits always with a smile, very professional and willing to help. Christina also the waiter is very good and lastly Manos in the breakfast main space. Lela from the housekeeping is excellent as well as the gentleman from the dry cleaning (unfortunately I don’t know his name) with the glasses who is also always kind and smiley. Very good personnel.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel rooms are clean and much larger from other hotels in Athens. I had trouble with the safe and help arrived right away. Lobby waa welcoming with friendly helpful staff. Breakfast also has extensive choices.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having stayed here once and being looked after, my second stay was far from that. Being a Diamond guest I was used to having being left with a bottle of wine in the room (albeit with a blank 'welcome back' card ......), however this did not eventuate this time. Upon quering this I was told it would be sent up. It didn't happen after an hour. I went down and queried and was told it would be sent up and to wait by the lift, I did for an hour ......... yet again, nothing. I forgot that I had all the time in the world to wait for things. So I went downstairs and queried it and I was told that it was there. No, it wasn't, I sat there for an hour and waited and watched all traffic coming and going. I really don't like being called a liar. It's a shame that this property would act in such a way and even call such a loyal member of the chain a liar. There's no words for that.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well furnished rooms with decent size bathrooms and we had a view of the acropolis. Dinner on the open air rooftop restaurant was excellent with well cooked, perfectly seasoned and generous portions view over. The acropolis was in front of us for we had a balcony side table and it was even more delightfulA view than than from our room.Centrally locates and within easy reach of all the attractions of Athens
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Athens for a short mini vacation and stayed at the Athens Hilton. It was an outstanding experience. The bed was very comfortable and our view of the Acropolis was great! The variety of restaurants onsite made it easy for my wife and I to get a bite after arriving from our flight. Can’t wait until I save up enough money to visit again.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at this Hilton. The staff were excellent, the Executive Lounge a great place for a sunset, and the Acropolis views from our room were incredible. We received complimentary breakfast boxes when the front desk found out how early we had to leave, which was very nice as well.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My third time at the Athens Hilton and they never disappoint. The front desk is attentive and professional. Although the hotels outside is a little tired looking the inside is is modern and spotless. Rooftop Bar is classy and the service is impeccable. The hotel is an easy walk to all the sites, from Syntagma Square to the Acropolis or Plaka. The X95 from Airport (6eu) as does the Red Line City Sight seeing bus stops right across the street. Ion at the front desk was great with our room, will be back on my return to Athena on a week.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is large and have very friendly staff and services however it is quite far away from the city attractions. It is not an option if you want to be close to the center. On the other hand, the bus stop for Athens City Sightseeing is just cross the road! Ask the concierge for its exact location.The breakfast buffet was having different local and international varieties with great service. The in room dining was great as well.Although I am loyal to Hilton for many years, but next time I visit Athens i will stay where i can reach the city attractions, restaurants, cafes by short walking distance. This hotel could be very highly recommended for buisness travelers rather than first time visiting tourists.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton in Athens was outstanding! Friendly staff, comfortable rooms even fitting 3 adults in a room with 1 King bed (we reserved a rollaway bed). The outdoor pool is a great setup. Every pair of chairs has its own umbrella (no fighting for shade) and table with call button for service. Want a great view of the Acropolis lit up at night? Just go to the rooftop bar and you’ll have one of the best views in town. I’m not one to make a big deal about hotels...as long as it’s clean and I have a place to lay my head at night, I’m happy. But the Hilton Athens is a head above the rest. Can’t go wrong staying here!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: small rooms not well equipped, extremely noisy especially at night and early morning, breakfast quality average, staff very helpful and kind, executive floor quality pretty bad. Swimming pool closed for one day for an event.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time all the stafff were helpful and eager to please lounge was great spa was great too facilities were all clean and lots of things to do, check-in and out was very smooth Haskell free all in all was a great experience
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impressions: a big hotel with cavernous reception area. Check-in was efficient and HH recognised with a King executive room assigned. Room was spacious and comfortable. Hotel’s location isn’t that central but not too bad; we took a taxi to the Acropolis museum (~€4) then walked up to the Parthenon and back to the hotel visiting numerous sites along the way back using the multi-site ticket package. The executive lounge has an expansive view of Athens including the Acropolis and the lounge staff were quite hospitable. Breakfast downstairs was more than adequate and featured a couple of local dishes. Had dinner at the nearby Agora Select, which was very good.Someone else checking out at 04.00 received a breakfast goodie-bag; a nice touch that we didn’t ask for ourselves, as it was far too early for us to eat on the road.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hilton Athens provided the absolute best service! We absolutely loved their lounge. Katerina, Ian and Dimmitris made the service memorable. The hotel was updated and the room was excellent. The location isn't near the archelogical sites, but one can find transportation nearby.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton Athens offers large and comfortable rooms, good service, and s small exterior balcony that is ideal for enjoying a coffee. Breakfasts offer a large selection of foods and drinks. A visit to the rooftop club at night offers a special view of The Acropolis.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you would like to see a video tour of this room, go to my IG: LLTRAVELMEL and click on my Greece Highlights. We had a fantastic stay here in May. We stayed on the executive level (it is worth it), our room was huge and was actually 2 rooms, with 2 BATHROOMS (that is rare). We stay in Hiltons all over the world and this is in the top 3 so far. It was extremely clean as well. The master bathroom was dreamy, all marble, huge tub, amazing shower and sauna. The breakfast buffet was gigantic with tons of options (top 3 as well). It was full of little touches like a lighted face mirror, chocolates on your pillow, huge closets, etc... We also had a view of the Acropolis, granted it was far away but still! The only CON to this is the distance to everything. Even though it's in a great area with stuff all around, you do have to taxi to get to all the main things. Amazing stay. Feel free to ask questions!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked this hotel although I usually stay at smaller ones. The room was very nice. The staff were great. The breakfast was good, but it was the only time the place seemed crowded. We loved the rooftop bar with the view of the Acropolis. When you are not sightseeing the pool is quite nice. I appreciated the extra security of having to use your room key to access floors. I don’t know Athens well, but it seemed that you could walk to a lot of sights or take the subway.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location outside of the National Garden. Everything else including the Acropolis is easily accessible via a brisk and scenic walk. Felt safe and the accommodations were a great value. Plus you get a beautiful view of the Acropolis.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is passable. In 1964 it was said to be the most beautiful hotel in the world. Service is standard for this price and levelRoom extremely noisy due to traffic though that is not the hotels fault. What is the hotel fault is the failure to PROPERLY inform us that the breakfast is not included (they did that) but not that it cost €35 without a prepaid voucher from reception. So one spoon of scrambled eggs and a toast €35. More expensive than Geneva, London, Milan and even Dubai and it’s Athens. There are other 203 hotels in Athens next visit will try something else however expensive it cannot be more than 35 for breakfast.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were worried about being too far away from everything to later find out this was the PERFECT spot. It was a bit of a walk but we are young and able. Everything is top notch and super clean. All of the staff was wonderful and a joy to be around. Some of the best views were from this hotel- couldn't be beat!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An unexpected stay at the Hilton Athens and the staff couldn't have been any more accommodating! When we arrived they were friendly, welcoming, smiling and happy even though it was 2.30am. The staff did their up most to accommodate all of our needs and we're able to lend us phone chargers and travel adapters which we were very greatful for.The rooms are large with beautiful bathrooms, a balcony and a king sized bed which is very comfortable.Breakfast was exceptional, Hilton hotels always seem to have this right. A selection of offerings including local greek cuisine, hot breakfasts, pastries, continental options and options for the health concious. The staff were also very helpful at breakfast. The hotel also has other amenities such as a spa, gym, indoor pool, milos restaurant, tsirou pastry shop, hertz car rental, a gift shop and boutique.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great, great hotel !The structure follow the outstanding standard of the brand Hilton. Nevertheless, what is, in my opinion, a benchmark for the Hilton network is the quality of the people that works in Hilton Athens.They are really outstanding ! Kalimera for all the great people of the Hilton Athens.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. The staffs of the executive lounge are friendly and helpful, but complimentary food, beverages are not that welcoming. Room was clean, but they charge you for the room service something like 8 Euro extra. In overall, it was a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is one of the best in the area. The staff is terrific, immensely helpful, and attentive. The hotel is clean, the rooms are excellent, and the food is fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From a warm welcome as we arrived, to the fabulous and generous support we received throughout our stay, the Hilton provided a well-appointed, and very comfortable stay. Clean, marble-clad baths with rain shower and soaking tub, comfy King-sized bed, and a small balcony with table and chairs looking out to the Acropolis and sea were highlights of the room. Evangelismos AthensMetro train station was a short (5 minute) stroll away. The Athens City Sightseeing tourist bus had a stop just across the street while city buses and taxis were also readily available. Our room faced the city and 2 major streets and the sliding door was no match for the street and construction noise. If a light sleeper, I would inquire if rooms facing East toward the residential area behind the hotel might be quieter. We wish the bathrobes and slippers had been a bit larger, and the room a tad bit quieter, but mostly we wish that we could have stayed much longer... Can’t wait to return sometime very soon!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will start with the good. Hotel is beautiful and has amazing views of the city. Easy to get taxis to and from the airport. It is close to a metro station as well. I liked that the hotel was within walking distance of the Panathenic Stadium, the National Gardens, The Temple of Olympian Zeus, and the Acropolis. Rooms were clean and big for a European hotel. The in-room breakfast option is very nice if you are trying to leave to catch an early flight. I am not referring to room service, but the card hangers on the door.The bad/less than stellar is as follows. It is farther away from the Monstaraki area which has shops, the flea market, and the cities municipal market. It is not within walking distance of the Roman Agora, the Ancient Agora of Athens or the Temple of Hephaestus. All the restaurants within the hotel are very over priced for what you get. I would not eat there if it could be avoided. The pools and gym are not free unless you have certain level of Hilton status. The hotel places a 100€ a night hold on your credit card. 6 nights would be a 600€ hold on the card. This was never mentioned during booking or check in and it took several days to "fall off". There were also random fees on my itemized bill that were never explained.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay of several days, after completing a cruise. The hotel is modern, spacious, and spotlessly clean. The staff were all very friendly and professional. The rooms were beautifully appointed, spacious, and clean. The breakfast buffet was sumptuous. The spa was quite nice, although the indoor pool water was cloudy, compared to the crystal-clear outdoor pool. Location is in the fashionable Kolonaki area, not quite the center of the tourist area. But the Acropolis and Plaka were just a €4 taxi ride away. We would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can we say about the Hilton Athens except they did everything right. We are Hilton Honors members, and used two nights of Honors points for a brief stay on our way to Rome. The hotel welcomed us at the front desk, gave us a key to the elevator to go to the 11th floor Honors lounge for check-in, which was fast and seamless. Our room was on the 12th floor and was very nice. It had a huge bathroom with soaking tub, rain-shower, sink and toilet, an abundance of storage for hanging and folding clothes, a bed that was absolutely top notch in comfort and a beautiful balcony and city view. The air conditioning and all electronics worked well, and the wi-fi (normal) was plenty fast. It gets better.We went downstairs to see the health club and spa. Very impressive! You have to walk two floors below the lobby but the walk is worth it as the spa has just about everything you could want. Indoor swimming pool, hot tub/jacuzzi, a fitness center with actual dumbbells, a smith machine, a variety of pre-core strength machines and a nice selection of cardio equipment. The spa also offers aerobics classes as well as steam and sauna facilities in the changing rooms. Finally, the spa is open until 11pm. Of note, though we did not use it, there is also a very large outdoor swimming pool that also offers plenty of chairs for sunning and an outdoor patio restaurant. This is the way a premium hotel spa should be done. Well done, Hilton!Both mornings we had the buffet breakfast (included in our room) and it was outstanding. Omelette station, a wide selection of hot food, salad, meats, cheeses, yogurts, breads and fruits were all well-laid out and in abundance. They also had a gluten-free section of foods, and offered a nice selection of juices and breakfast pastries. Whatever your palette, you’ll find it here.Staying on the food theme, they also have a chocolate/sweet store in the lobby, and part of their selling point is that many of their items are sugar free. Following a Ketogenic eating style, we were impressed to find almost half of what they sold was made with Stevia (sugar substitute). We sampled a few pieces and the taste was excellent.The hotel is very modern and organized, and presents a very premium feeling from the moment you walk in. The staff was also attentive and helpful, whether it was the attendants in the lounge or the desk staff in helping direct us where to catch the bus. To a person, the service was excellent.Finally, the location of the hotel is convenient if you desire to see the Acropolis and several of the surrounding historical sites. It’s about a 30 minute walk to the Acropolis, which takes you past the Parliament building (with the tomb of the unknown soldier), the temple of Olympian Zeus, and a few shopping areas. There is also convenient access to both bus and subway within 5 - 10 minutes walk from the hotel. In fact, just so you’re aware, figure 40 Euros to take a taxi to the hotel or from the hotel to the airport. We instead took the X95 bus which cost 6 Euros per person and it took us about 45 minutes each way. For dinner, we walked 5 minutes behind the main lobby of the hotel to find a selection of Greek restaurants, one of which is where we had dinner on our last night. The restaurant name is elia taverna, and they serve a plentiful selection of grilled meats at a reasonable price. Oh, and the owner dropped a nice little bonus on us with a complimentary brownie after dinner. Overall, the Hilton Athens was outstanding and we would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to spend a few days in Athens to see the amazing historical sites.Pro’s+ Location to Acropolis, other historical sites and restaurants+ Gym/Fitness Center and Spa+ Breakfast Buffet+ Staff service and attentiveness+ Honors lounge - large and had GREAT views of the Acropolis+ Bed - absolutely comfortable+ Room size and amenities+ Chocolate/sweet shop selection of sugar free items+ Convenience to public transportationCon’s- We did not get an Acropolis view room (seriously, this is nitpicking...)
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights here toward the end of April, 2019. We had a nice room on a high floor with a city view; clean, well appointed and comfortable bed. The hotel is near the center so you can walk to a lot of places, but far enough away from the bustle to make it a nice Lodging option when visiting Athens. It’s also near a good neighborhood for walking around and dining. It is also close to a Metro stop. We had a tasty, well presented breakfast in the downstairs restaurant one morning; offering a wide range of choices. The rooftop bar is lovely & romantic, with a view of the Acropolis and good service. Helpful Concierge services.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even though it was not a perfect stay ( issue with one member of staff in the executive lounge) I recommend this Athens institution .I would judge an establishment by how it deals with customer complaints and this hotel’s management s response was professional and handled well.The hotel is of architectural interest, rooms on one side look on the acropolis and are outstanding, the breakfasts were v good. There is a pool on site and it’s location is excellent. Best of all is the rooftop bar with stunning views.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton was sold a couple of years ago and the new owners need to carry out a major refurbishment as it has become very scruffy, apart from the pool area and the Galaxy Bar. Whereas the staff are excellent, the material of the hotel and its appearance have gone badly downhill. The water feature outside the hotel has been abandoned, the facade is both dirty and needs work, the lobby is devoid of decoration, the lifts have a mind of their own at times and my room needed maintenance.But what the Hilton does not tell you is that, unless you make your booking yourself, and not via a travel agent or a company, you will not receive any Hilton Honors points for your stay!I am a business traveller and just how many tourists or business travellers make their booking themselves? Very few indeed is the answer. So, the only benefit of being on the Hilton Honors award scheme is free wifi - a slow speed connection that all other hotels in this category (and all airbnbs) give you for free!The shower, at least in my room, was not thermostatically controlled so, in the mornings in particular, the water temperature will go from normal to boiling hot to cold in a matter of seconds. Not good for the elderly or those trying to have a romantic stay!Try to book a room as far from the main road in front of the hotel as possible as it is long and straight and the motorbikes will keep you awake at night as they scream past.Altogether very disappointing.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service from the bellmen at the door to the Galaxy bar at the top and everybody in between. We stayed at smaller hotels while in Greece but coming back to the Hilton felt like coming back “home”.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good old Hilton standards but not personalized. A huge lobby that felt cold and very business feeling. Location is in a high end upper class old traditional neighborhood walking distance to many places. Has a nice hair salon, roof top bar, gym and an outdoor pool.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loses one star for the value of money aspect. The hotel itself was to a very high standard - including everything staff, location, view from room, cleanliness - however where I found it lacked was the value for money. Rooms are pricey but dont include complimentary wifi or use of the indoor pool. The indoor pool is excellent but has additional fee to be paid per day. When we were there, it was mid April and the outdoor pool was closed. Would have been nicer if wifi and the use of indoor pool was made complimentary.Other than that, a 5 star
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located and from the welcome crew to the cleaning staff, all were professional and courteous. I like staying there and I like the rooms. Very clean and modern. The lounge was ok and the breakfast was ok but the evening lounge food could have had a bit more substance and variety
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was older & needed an update. A bedside lamp was missing & the room was just plain tired. The most concerning issue was the bathroom. The floor was like a skating rink when wet. Hilton was aware of this & had signs posted & one rubber bathmat furnished but we still had slippage issues. Simply dangerous! The breakfast buffet was very nice but the restaurant for lunch was very expensive. $30.00 for a hamburger????
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel with friendly and helpful staff, fantastic and convenient location. Walking distance from the main center of town and other restaurants etc. We had booked the king olive suite which had executive lounge access. Subway and hop on hop off stops very close to the property.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel was great. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The last cation was great. The cleanliness of the hotel was very good. The hotel has lovely rooms of Athens. It was a pleasure to stay there. I recommend it.
hotelName:
11    Hilton Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience was outstanding from check-in to the room to the food, everything was excellent. The location was walkable to all the experiences we wanted to see in central Athens. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was extremely helpful and nice. They went out of there way to help us find places to eat and gave great information on how to get places. They were accommodating to gluten-free diets in the breakfast. The chef made sure that the food provided was gluten-free and made additional things when options were not gluten-free. The staff was responsive to concerns and friendly. The rooms were nice and clean. The staff made every attempt to make our stay enjoyable.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When planning my solo trip to Greece, I see-sawed between staying in Plaka, Monastiraki, and Psiri because I read these were safe neighborhoods near the key attractions. I even checked the places Rick Steves uses for his tours. So many choices. But in the end, I chose to go with the more modern hotel who could provide me with amenities that would make me comfortable after a long day in the sun (I.e., air conditioner and a great shower).I checked in around 11 a.m., which is early. The front desk checked and had me go to the sixth floor to enjoy a drink on the house. The view was great, but I worried whether the koi fishes boiled under the sun. Hopefully they have access to enough shade and cool water.When the sweet tall guy fetched me, I was told they upgraded me to a junior suite. Yay! I got a view of the Acropolis. Besides the room, which was very comfortable, the fact that the metro is literally seconds outside of the door made walking about Athens a breeze. The metro reminded me of Sweden's metro system - easy and clean. Just use common sense and take precautions against thieves. Read about pick pocketers and/or watch "Scam City" on Netflix to learn ways to better secure your belongings.When I returned from my four day tour, I returned to Wyndham Athens Residence for a night. They told me because of issues caused by the rain the previous days (we had hail, lightning, and rain while traveling to Delphi), I was being given a room at the Wyndham Grand where once again I got a room with a view of the Acropolis. The Grand is more of a plush hotel than the Residence, but I preferred the latter because of the metro entrance and the gyro place right across the street. Sure, the Wyndham Grand is just a hop away and had a more expensive feel to it, but location put the Residence ahead of the mothership.*If you're like me, bring or purchase your own lotion as the hotel provided shampoo, body wash, and conditioner, but no lotion. **If you allow housekeeping to fix up your room, the complimentary water will be replenished along with the two complimentary pods of coffee. ***Everyone at the hotel is super friendly and helpful, although the older housekeeper seems irritated.****Make sure to use the latch on your door or someone may surprise you. I was recovering from my long flight and slept for a few hours the first day I arrived. In the late afternoon, I awoke to someone opening my door. Thank goodness my latch secured my door. I still don't know if it was housekeeping or the girl from the restaurant on the 6th floor since she did ask to check the refrigerator on another day. What for? I have no clue.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I chose this hotel because of the reviews and we weren't disappointed. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The restaurant staff went above and beyond is making sure we had a great breakfast experience. The buffet is extensive and came with the room. The outside of the hotel isn't inviting, but once you get inside, you forget about that. This hotel is located near the Metro and next to a bakery which is opened 24 hours a day. This bakery carries everything from fabulous sweets, to pizza, and a hot bar which changed daily. The prices are cheap and the food was plentiful and good. The Wyndham Residence was very clean and I had a super view of the city. We had access to the Wyndham Grand across the street. This Wyndham has fabulous views of the Acropolis and the city from the rooftop, but the restaurant and bar service was awful. I went to the bar to get a drink and was told I had to let the server take my order. The server never came to our table, so we left. I wouldn't stay there, and realize the Wyndham Residence has much better service .
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's start with the great:The staff was fabulous! From the Front Desk to the Doorman (David) to the restaurant staff they were superb. Housekeeping not so much but the others were top notch!The rooms were large for Europe and the beds and pillows were amazing.Breakfast was very good. Lots of options and nice service. But now the not so great:The rooms are weird. Finish of the rooms were way sub par. Toilet paper roll holder in all 4 of our rooms was lose and didn't hold the paper so it was always falling on the floor. One of out toilet seats was broken when we arrived. They did fix it but how is that acceptable?The closet is behind the door to the room so you have to close the door to the suite to get into the closet. Annoying when you have a suite with an adjoining room and want to keep the doors open. Closets had a full size ironing board in them taking up 1/2 the space. There were about 6 hangers and no shelves. One shelf was broken.The vanity in the restroom was tiny and the sink huge. No room for toiletries. Also no soap dish so the bar soap was in the sink all of the time.Showers had 1/2 walls so the floor was always getting wet. Towel hooks were crooked. Additionally there was glue from the tiles all over everything. Back of the bathroom doors, tiles, mirrors. Any the toilet seat was stained with yellow spots which they said were due to a wrong cleaning chemical but gross nonetheless.All of these are simply annoyances but for the #2 or #3 hotel in Athens it's unacceptable.Also be careful walking in Athens. The metro is super convenient and there are a few decent restaurants just across the street. We liked Mironi and Alexander very much. But be careful walking more than 5 minutes away from the hotel It gets very sketchy, very fast.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time here. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Staff was AMAZING!! I felt ill, and they helped me to get to an amazing clinic to be checked out. Their service was top notch. This hotel is located a step from the train so you are very safe to get to and from the building as you travel Athens. The location is perfect and everything is no more than a 10 minutes trip to get to. Stay here!!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best staff ever. Very friendly and professional. The hotel is great! Next to the metro. I ll be back for sure. Location very convenient. I really loved it and I enjoyed every moment in this hotel thank you guys
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is the best hotel in Europe, exceptional and outstanding service when arrived. Gave great suggestions on what to do while I was here. I would recommend this hotel for anybody wanting to stay in Athens. The receptionist and the customer service were very helpful for any questions needing to be answered.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on the last leg of our honeymoon for a night before flying out out of Athens and had a really nice experience. The staff was incredible - they were friendly, accommodating and very personable, going above and beyond to acknowledge our honeymoon! The room was clean, comfortable and perfect for our quick visit. Their sister property across the street has an awesome rooftop bar with a great view of the Parthenon that is definitely worth checking out.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is friendly but it’s located in not a very nice part of the city, no lobby, breakfast(which was okay, not great) is served at the sixt floor where also the bar is.Street facing rooms are noisy.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice view resteraunt. no1 services here.good location very nice rooms.always first choice. we recommend this hotel to everybody.the bathroom shower is the best ever seen in will be back very soon 非常好，酒店设施很完善。感谢完美的服务非常好，酒店设施很完善非常好，酒店设施很完善非常好，酒店设施很完善非常好，酒店设施很完善。
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Truly, I've never stayed at a major brand hotel where the staff just drops everything to be attentive to you. The people here are friendly and helpful, speak perfect English, and are only too happy to help with selecting attractions, navigating the subway, arranging tours, etc. The breakfasts on the open air deck above the city are not to be missed. I couldn't possibly have asked for more.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and very helpful staff however the room condition is not what I’ve expected from last year renovated hotel. Bathroom had mold, towel handle was not screwed on and lots of long dark hair on the floor.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel staff was very nice and allowed us to extend for late check out. The breakfast was very good and the room is new and modern style. The bed is very comfortable, room is clean and good location. We recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a nice wellcome to the hotel. we were upgraded to a suite withou even asking. the hotel is at a great location. by the metro. nice comfortable rooms, very good breakfast and a very friendly and helpfull staff
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here overnight on our way back to India. The staff is extremely nice and courteous. The check in process was smooth and fast. The room is nice and cozy. Breakfast spread is good. The location is easily accessible.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here to celebrate our wedding anniversary and where blown away by the great customer service. Front desk, you guys are awesome. Special mention to Cristos who was super helpful with any request we had. The rooms are more apartment like than hotel like which we didn’t quite gauge from the pictures, not many soft touches and basic interior but functional. The gym isn’t great, has two running machines which make a lot of noise but you can go across the road to the hotel and use their gym which has exactly the same equipment but just a bit larger and cooler as it’s not as exposed to sunlight. Location wise the hotel is superb and located a true twenty minute walk from all the attractions of Athens. If you’re fine to walk like we were you won’t need the metro unless you’re travelling to or from the airport.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice property. Spotlessly clean, excellent staff. Great rooftop restaurant. Breakfast on the terrace with excensive choice. Magda-hotel manager, restaurant staff, reception provide 100% service with professionalism. Definitely stay again next time in Athens...Radim
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nicely located modern hotel with beautiful rooftop restaurant and extremely friendly staff clean room magdali and costadina provide excellent hospitality! I recommend this place strongly wonderful breakfast
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A weekend in Athens was made extra special by the such lovely hospitality and care by the staff at this hidden gem of a hotel. Nothing I asked was too much and they couldn’t do more to make the stay a beautiful memory. This hotel exceeded all my expectations. Centrally located with a 24hr coffee shop right outside. The front desk staff are the heart of this hotel. They are so so so lovely. Magda, Demitris and all the others. I’m sorry I can’t recollect your names. You are all such lovely hospitable people. Cannot wait to visit again. This hotel has both the quality of a 5 star accompanied by the fantastic staff. There are only very few hotels that win you over by their amazing staff. Thank you all again
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience w/the hotel and staff from arrival to departure! The staff arranged our pick-up from the airport. Our room was upgraded to a junior suite (luck of the draw, I guess). We had a city view room. Several comments rated the city view as a negative, however, it was not an issue w/us at all. We were able to get to sleep each night easily (we also kept the curtains opened, as it was a pleasant view to fall asleep to looking out at the hill). Demetrius and Martha and the entire staff to include the doormen were excellent managers and a tremendous help with assisting us to navigate our daily trips. The staff at the rooftop bar were great as well and what a nice view! Our hotel room was really nice and had USB ports to charge your mobile devices. The location was great, particularly if you don’t mind walking...close to the high points of the city or there are hop on hop off buses that stop in front of the hotel if you prefer not to walk and it’s also very easy to catch a cab right out front. Safe Area!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is one of the best not only in Athens but in Europe the hotel is cozy clean and beautiful decorated the staff in this hotel have something magic they always welcome you with a really friendly smile and always ask if we need anything they give great recommendations to where to go how to go and what to see I really felt like home with my friends in this hotel.thank you all for the unforgettable moments and a wonderful stay !!!!!!!!!!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Wyndam Residence in Athens in May 2019. Great hotel, friendly staff, and not far from the cool toruists sights. I would highly recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Athens. The hotel is near some of the main tourist squares and has great restaurants in the vicinity.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved being here very personalized approach a warm hospitality and friendly staff and can’t resist to come back because of Magda she is awesome she really knows how to handle all guest she really makes everybody,overall it was an excellent experience!thank you all
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience here was superb. The location is excellent, next to the Metro and the Bread Factory (yummy!) The breakfast every morning was excellent, eaten on the roof in the morning sun. Our room (get the suite as it worth a few extra euros) was comfortable and roomy and complete with a microwave & fridge, and a nice, large bathroom. But the staff! From the manager (Magda) to the front desk Personnel (Alexandra and Maria and Constantina) to the bellman (David and Christopher) to those serving breakfast (Vagelis and Aida), we're astounding. They were helpful and courteous and exceeded our expectations in every regard. They made our stay in Athens a trip full of wonderful memories. We high recommend this hotel because of the staff!
