hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are just completing a college graduation vacation with our granddaughter.Our stay at the Wyndham Residence may have been one of our best hotel experiences ever. We travel extensively throughout the year staying 100 plus days a year at hotels everywhere. Never have we been treated better than here.From Maria our nighttime bartender to Vagelis our morning host, the front staff and everyone else, the service has been the best. A special thanks to the General Manager Ms Magda. Her attention to detail and management style is fantastic.We will be back.Greg
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hotel in athens!I visit athens every year and honestly is the best hotel i have ever stay.Great staff,great breakfast,wonderfull room!The most important thing is that tha metro station is outside of the hotel!I will be back soon!Thank you Wyndham Athens Residence❤️
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing staff and amazing service! Magda and Anna were awesome!! We will be back! We read the reviews and we decided to visit this hotel and we are very lucky we did so the hotel it self is beautiful we will recommend this hotel to all of our friends from USA
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When one is holidaying in a city, all you require is a good clean room, good location, and some good breakfast. This hotel provides just that. The hotel and rooms are relatively smaller, but well cleaned and maintained. The staff at the front desk is amazing and friendly, ready to answer all your questions and give great suggestions for places to visit. We particularly had an amazing experience with Anna at the front desk, who was there throughout, and patiently attended to every query.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ALL of the staff are patient, pleasant and HELPFUL.We would certainly recommend this hotel.I had a lot of trouble with my phone, as a community effort the staff stayed helping me ,making lots of calls on my behalf until it was worked out- making my trip more relaxed. The hotel is lovely! Olivia and Darro from Oroville
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very nice though quite a bit of traffic noise, room was great, upper level there was a restaurant and terrace area we enjoyed. Try and get a room in back to avoid traffic noise? The location is okay as near metro and a couple of restaurants and maybe near a hop on hop off stop but not too exciting and a bit shabby especially after dark.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted by the best staff the Wyndham assembled. Anna, Konstantina, Spiros an Alexandra were beyond attentive from the minute we arrived. Our rooms weren’t ready yet but they sent us up to the rooftop lounge to enjoy complimentary drinks and the surprised us with a beautiful sweet treat in celebration of our anniversary. If you ever go to Athens and want to be pampered like royalty, this is the place to stay.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I flew in from South Africa for an extended long weekend. This coincided by chance with Greek Orthodox Easter. We chose this hotel by virtue of its high scoring reviews and proximity to a metro. We were welcome by Anna and Christopher with warmth, smiles and a genuine desire to make us feel welcome and at home. First impressions last. The lobby while small is neat and stylish but this is well overcome by the welcome. Our hotel room was more than adequate. It is modern, stylish and comfortable with all the amenities of a 4/5 star hotel. They went out of their way to make sure we were happy at all times. Our small requests were met with smiles and efficient service. Given the religious time over which we were visiting, the hospitality was even more than we expected. The cultural touches of the traditional bread on welcoming and the candles to help us experience the midnight service (that they advised we attend) would have been something we would have missed out on and are grateful we were able to experience. With changes of shifts, each new team also went out of their way to introduce themselves and ask if we needed anything.Breakfast was wide and varied and I loved the local touches. The views from the outdoor balcony area on the top floor from which to enjoy the morning sun was definitely outshone by the morning service. It was friendly, convivial and the picture definition of warmth.I am a stickler for details. When a hotel gets the basics right and have the right team...you don't have a hotel but a home away from home. Dimitris on our last morning as we took all our baggage down to check out, offered us the chance to use the room to keep our luggage and for us to have a shower before the long journey back. The names I mention above are merely the ones who stood out. But this should no way detract from the team effort it takes to pull of such sterling service. I would HIGHLY recommend a stay here and would gladly return and pay more for this kind of attentive and compassionate service from a young team. The passion is evident.Thank you Wyndham Athens Residence. It is not often that a hotel will stay part of my memory of a holiday. These memories I will cherish. You all are outstanding and should be commended.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the property location was surrounded by city noise, the staff were professional and hospitable. The property was centrally located and the room was perfect...clean, comfortable, spacious and modern. We loved it! Breakfast was tasty and came with a scenic view.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to say a lot.Athens is different from what I imagined.When I walked around the city,I felt very welcome in this hotel,like home.They were very friendly,helpful.I dont think I can' t get from any other city in Europe.Really recommending if you gonna stay in Athens,you have to stay here.Especially with my preferred lovely beautiful Anna,she is amazing!I really wish to say her ""Welcome to Australia"" because she made us feel like home!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really loved our stay here, the hotel is very beautiful and the rooms are amazing. We really loved the Rain shower and very comfortable bed. The atmposphre in this hotel is very warm and very welcoming from all the staff, included the manager Magda, Anna and Konstantina. They did our Best, always with a smile We love you and Will really miss you
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title sums it up. Hotel is well appointed with modern rooms. Very centrally located, walkable distance from some of the attractions. Right next to the metro. And of course very friendly and helpful staff which for me makes all the difference.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is located really close to the city center. Different coffee shops and bakeries are around, so really convenient.The Hotel is brand new, room are big and new modern furniture. Breakfast on the top of the hotel fulfill any wish with a great view of the Acropolis.The staff are super friendly and helpful if needed. Car parking just around the cornerI can fully recommend this Hotel!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommended. Clean and modern rooms with convenient location just next to metro station. And especially the customer service was outstanding througout our 3 night stay. Special thanks to our hostess Anna. Cheers!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I checked in to Wyndham Grand Residence Athens yesterday for 2nights. We booked the hotel because of excellent reviews at Hotel.com and Agoda.Indeed our experience in this hotel so far has exceeded our expectations. First the front desk and the general manager on duty were very supportive and helpful. I was pickpocketed at Metro on our way to the hotel. But the friendly staff of this hotel by going extra miles has helped us to overcome our trauma. Next the restaurant staff are very friendly. Food is simple but nice. The backdrop of Acropolis from far and the cozy environment making the dining experience relaxed and enjoying. (Though improve lighting in the restaurant will make the place even better)The room design is very warm and welcoming. The bed and pillows are comfortable. The amenities in the room also impressive for the price that we paid. The self serviced business centre comes handy for simple printing like the boarding pass. Simple to use and it is free.Last but it least, the location being not that far away to Acropolis has made us easy to walk there without calling cab. In short, we will visit again this hotel if we are back to Athens next time.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First impressions were really bad! It’s on a noisy and busy roundabout, quite a few rough streets very close by, no real lobby just a small corridor. The staff at check in were friendly and helpful.Room was fine (we booked a suite), quite spacious, bed was really comfy, no bath but good shower. Tried to order room service as soon as we arrived but after two phone calls and some confusion we were told there wasn’t really any room service but the kitchen could do some toast- never had this before in a 5* hotel. We decided to walk to the old town- not far, just over 2kms. Within 50 metres of the hotel were some very dodgy looking streets, people clearly high, dirty needle on the pavement and lots of people sleeping rough. We aren’t easily put off and travel a lot but this area was definitely rough and I would not have walked there alone. Put it this way we didn’t walk there when it was dark and the taxis that took us back to the hotel in evening leant over and locked the car doors when we got to these streets!Had a massage at the other Wyndham hotel across the road- it was pretty good, although the ‘spa’ is actually just one treatment room right off the main hotel corridor.Overall, staff were helpful and friendly, rooms are fine but it is nowhere near the standard of a 5* hotel and the area is, in my opinion, rough. If we were to come again to Athens, I would definitely stay in the old town.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and me spent fabulous days at Wyndham Residence during our stay in Athens. Usually I stay with Wyndham for business all over the word due to reliable quality in order not have any undesirable surprises. This time I had a really pleasant surprise with Magda the hotel manager and her team. Perfect quality of accommodation was the expected, familiar and warm atmosphere for vacation was the unexpected gift on top. A small problem with the room (can happen) was immediately answered with an upgrade.Thank you Wyndham team for the great days!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I managed to find this hotel through the Wyndham app and as I am a rewards member I thought why not. I was not disappointed. Situated across the road from its sister hotel the Wyndham Grand it is ideally located for getting around Athens due to the fact that there is a Metro station on the next corner. Depending on which sort of room you get your view will be the statue of Icarus falling, which is to commemorate Greek fallen aviators, or the back of an adjoining hotel. In honesty, I would choose the later as the front can be very noisy with traffic but that is only a minor point. I was here for 2 weeks but if you stay as a tourist it would more than likely not matter. On arrival the staff are 'extremely' helpful and genuinely happy to see you. The rooms are well laid out with all the amenities you require. The roof restaurant/bar is pleasant but there is not a full evening menu however guests are more than welcome to use all the facilities of the Grand. I have actually stayed at this hotel twice now but this is the first time I've had the chance to write a review. Magda, the manager, is infectiously happy and will do everything that she can to ensure that your stay is satisfactory. Will I stay again, a definite yes as Magda was able to sort me out a room for 2 weeks during a busy period. Thank you for that. One last thing to add. The staff who work the bar are amazing. See you again in a couple of weeks.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were modern and the beds were comfortable. We had an issue with the type of room we requested at check in (not the hotels fault) and was soon resolved. The staff were excellent and gave us free breakfast to make up for it. Room was very modern, flat screen TV. Bathroom was lovely and loads of toiletries.All in all the staff in this hotel were fabulous, they couldn’t have done enough for us. They went above and beyond to make our stay one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Excellent !!!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A new hotel with very nice rooms - comfortable bed, quiet, good internet. Great location - metro station right outside the front door (on the same line as the main Syntagma square and Acropolis, both within 10 minutes) and a popular bakery next door. Staff very friendly and accommodating.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location in central Athens in Greece. Close to the red metro line so it's easy to get around the city. Nice friendly staff and lovely, clean room. Great base for first time in Athens, really enjoyed it.I recomend this hotel to everybody
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely spread for breakfast. Magda the Chief and Konstantina were excellent hosts, looking after everyone like their personal guests.great hotel next to metro great rooms with beauful decor we recommend this hotel to everybody and we will defntly be back
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to Athens too early in the morning and I found the hotel I had booked. The rooms were full but Anna the manager very understanding and somehow found me a room. I found her very efficient, smart and helpful and does her duties extrem dexterity with many knowledges.Pleasing personality will attract the customers and make them happg.She is the best receptionist I have ever met wherever I had ever gone.She should definitely be the general manager of the hotel,she is a role model for any girl who will bs following this business.Anna is the reason for anybody to travel in Athens,perfect example of Greek hospitality trend.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel situates in an area feeling like a rough end of town and on a roundabout. Front door to main road is probably 5 metres, hence all traffic noise is very loud in the room. True nightmare for a light sleeper, also all the beeping going into late night triggered even more annoyance. Although traffic and beeping was not the hotel’s fault but in room could have been better, noise in the reception area was noticeably quieter than in guest room. Room is small despite got upgraded to junior suite, cleanliness was good though. Air-con was not doing a good job either. Corridor was way cooler than inside the room. Only other good things are it is close to a metro station and cake shop is next door. Selection of food at the cake shop (also has savoury choices) is larger than breakfast choices at the hotel. Wouldn’t have bothered staying as long as I did if the room booking was changeable.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located downtown Athens with a lot of shops around. The staff is very helpful and professional, friendly a well. The room was well equipped. I only stayed two days but really enjoyed it. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came for a trip with our friends. Awesome location close to everything. Metro and bus tours right outside. Walking distance to all the tourist sites. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice and clean rooms! Highly recommend
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checked in at the Wyndham residence and everything has been a pleasure since the second we walked in! Ana at the front was very friendly and made us feel right at home. Got up to the room and it was beautiful. The overhead shower was very appreciated. The location was perfect. Very close to the metro and only around 10-15 minutes to walk to the acropolis. Definitely staying here the next time we come and would highly recommend Wyndham residence to everyone else!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived and staff was absolutely amazing! Our room was upgraded and Magda was very accommodating. We couldn’t figure out how to close our balcony door, no fault of the property and we were given wine and fruits with this note. Breakfast was delicious! Housekeeping was exceptional everyday. Lounge/dining area overlooks the square. Walking distance to many good and shopping options. This place will not disappoint. We will definitely be back!
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve just spent a week at this hotel and we were really impressed. The hotel is the sister of the Wyndham Grand offering access to a roof top pool and spa. Our room was modern and spacious and cleaned daily. The breakfast was adequate but not extravagant.But the staff are the real stars of the hotel. Access to the main tourist sites by metro is a 2 minute walk from the hotel door.We found the staff to be genuinely warm and friendly ,a real credit to the organisation.We had a wonderful week in Athens and staying at this hotel played a big part in this experience.
hotelName:
12    Wyndham Athens Residence
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Got to spend 2 nts at the Metropolis. Great little gem in the middle of everything. Simple small property right across from the Metropolis Cathedral. We were very pleased with our room. Recently renovated and upgraded. Best bed we had in our 3 wks in Greece, great sleeps. Bathroom all upgraded, loved the spa style shower. We paid a bit more for the Acropolis views, well worth it. They offer a really nice Greek breakfast on the top floor outside terrace for aprox 7euros, well worth it. From the property, you can walk to the Plaka area within 5 minutes. Surrounded by great shopping streets and lots of great restaurants. The metros within 10 mins walk with non stop lines to The port and to the airport. Really enjoyed this little gem of a property, will stay here again
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable, great location close to Plaka and Metro starltion. Airport bus stop x95 is only few minutes away and saves not for paying taxi. Room and bathroom are small like other reviewers say, but not uncomfortable. Great view to acropolis from the roof and breakfast was ok. I would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location close to the main square, shopping district and acropolis. Small basic room, but neat and tidy. Good amenities in room. A little bit of street noise can be heard due to its central location. Nice view of acropolis from the balcony.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was in the right location for easy access to all sites. We were on the third floor with a corner view and balcony. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Bathroom was small but ample enough to shower etc. With regard to the noise, we were not disturbed by it at all. To be honest I only heard the church bells on waking up, no noise from the restaurant next door. Having been out sightseeing all day I was too tired to notice any noise(if there was any) as I went to sleep straight away!The lady on reception (sorry I cannot remember your name) but was so very helpful and friendly. Anything we asked was not trouble and would look up to find out the information we required. We loved our afternoon and evening chats with you every day - I do miss them.Overall a lovely friendly little hotel - thank you for our lovely stay x
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is the key the street is directly opposite Syntagma Square. Walking distance about 10 mins. Ask for a high room with views of Acropolis. Clean, bathroom toiletries fair, overall room small but very clean serviced daily. Staff most helpful. Safe poorly located on floor of robe making it hard to access. Terrace is great for enjoying views with wine and nibbles! Breakfast available €6 but did not try. Noisy at night. Would stay again as excellent value.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the unit itself was very small (even by European standards) and basic it was very clean and offered a great little balcony and super central walking location to all historical areas and Platka. Combine that with a very fair price by Athens standards and you have a winning combination for a 1-2 night stay (though the size of unit and no lobby may create a problem for some over a larger term stay).
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m glad we choose this hotel, it’s location is perfect for sightseeing and to sit on the top floor terrace and have breakfast whilst enjoying the views over to the Acropolis is a truly memorable experience. For 6euros the breakfast is outstanding for such a freshly made meal, it’s a pity they don’t serve dinner as well. From arriving to leaving the hotel staff were helpful with maps and advice. It’s a 10 minute walk to the express airport bus or 10 minutes to the metro. This hotel warrants a third star. As for all of the negative reviews regarding noise you are staying in the city centre of Athens and experiencing the hustle and bustle of the city is all part of the experience. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small and over priced. Well located in the monasteriki area. Good eats all around. Other spots kick butt on this 2Star place. Yes it's clean inside. No it's not worth the price. People screwed up my reservation with one bed for two men that are not Lovers or close buddies. No recourse. No remorse. Short simple and to the point.BestNicholas
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, walk to all the museums, the Acropolis, Plaka, Syntigma, Monistiraki. Very accommodating staff. Friendly, warm and plenty of good advise. This was our second stay and we will stay againWe spent 3 nights on the islands but we kept the room as a home base. The convenience was worth the price! Reserve a room with an Acropolis view and hit the local market for meze on the balcony! The church bells signal the hour and half-hour 24-7. My wife and I found it to be wonderfully charming so it's only an issue if you're a light sleeper and sleeping is your priority.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: That was the perfect location for a short stay in Athens, just on the other side of the Metropolitan Cathedral of Athens, 5 min walk from Syntagma square, really in the middle of everything. Very clean and cozy rooms, super helpful and friendly reception staff. There was no breakfast yet provided in the hotel, due to low season, so the staff pointed to the cafes just round the corner where one could get good breakfast and very good coffee! So every morning we could enjoy coffee with a nice view to the Cathedral and Acropolis from the square or the balcony or the roof top!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutley incredible location. Within walking distance to anywhere even the train station. So easy to get to from the airport. Amazing service. Inder at the front desk is very knowledgeable about the area and helped us kick off our trip and end our trip on a high note. Very clean rooms. We loved it so much we stayed twice during our visit to Greece.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + perfect location + friendly staff+ great pricing + view of acropolis/parthenon + balcony - noisy chapel bell across the road and loud music playing cars passing by although this is not the hotels fault
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we visited Athens and stayed at the metropolis hotel. it's located at the heart of Athens. everything is in very close distance from the hotel. clean and cozy room. also underground parking to the next alley with 18€/24hours
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good staff and the room was very clean. Was told I could pay with my credit card but when it came time to pay the person at the desk clearly wanted us to pay in cash but I insisted I wanted to pay with my card. She tried my three different credit cards and just said "must be a problem with Internet" so we ended up having to pay in cash. Looks like a few people had this same issue in the reviews.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hello fellow traveler, if you stoped to check this property, then you are attracted by the very reasonable price, then you are on a budget, second you might have been attracted by the location of this property. so as a combination of price and location and most other positive reviews this is an excellent deal.i do not understand why others nag about their stay here, about the size of the rooms, and the busy streets and the cathedral bells. and they wrote a review here. if you already know the way to tripadvisor to write a bad review then why you didnt find your way here before booking and read the previous reviews!?anyway , face it. i stayed 6 nights in this hotel for the price equivalent for almost 2 nights in a 4 star hotel in the same area. and equivalent for the price of 1 night stay at a 5 stars hotel.yes the rooms are small, but we lived in my wife and i , both with massive lagguge bags.yes the elevator is tiny but i used up and down all my stay period my wife and i knowing that i am 190 cm tall and weighing 140 KG.yes the streets are busy , you are in a perfect location in the center of a european capital.what do you expect ? go to the maldives.yes the cathedral bell ring once every hour, and three bells on specific times. unless you are a very light sleeper you wont sense the presence of the whole cathedral when you are sleeping after a long day discovering athens on foot.the room on the 3rd floor was so clean and neat, the sheets are new and clean,bathroom is renovated, cool shower sprinklers . rooms gets done everyday i was there in the new year period, cold weather outside, the radiator heater inside does the job perfectly.i booked via hotels.com, when i arrived to the hotel i just gave in my passport, and directly got the key card. i knew that it is a family run hotel, you would see two guys , an elderly man and a woman occupying the front desk within different shifts. they are all so friendly and helpful , always smiling answering your queries and recommending places and routes. they arranged the taxi pickup for my departure to the airport without any extra charge knowing that the trip from and to the airport is fixed 39 euros. the taxi was waiting for me outside.they offer breakfast, but i never tried it, i preferred waking up late and eating some tasety pastries nearby.the location is unbeatable, less than 5 monutes walk to syntagma and around 5 mins to monastiraky. thos are the two main squares in athena area with the metro stations. 10 mins walk to the acropolis. ermou street is just behind the hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A hidden gem, conveniently located in the heart of classic Athens. Rooms small but comfortable. Friendly and very helpful management. Parking in front of the hotel (by prior arrangement). Breakfast view over the Acropolis is stunning. Very affordable rates, especially with direct booking.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the thick of the action in the Plaka, ie convenient but in a noisy part of town, and sleep not helped by the regular church bells across the street. It has no pretensions. Rooms are tiny and the shower is the tiniest I’ve ever been in. But, the staff are very friendly and the rooms are kept clean. If you want space, quiet and some home comforts, this is not the place to be, but reasonable price and ultra convenient it’s great for a short stay.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in November 2018 for 3 nights with my husband. We got a wonderful view of the Acropolis from our room!!! the room was very clean and the shower was nice!!! the staff are very friendly!!! The location of the hotel is amazing for it is a walking distance from everything and we only took a taxi once to visit the National Museum. Other than that, we walked to the Acropolis and all other attractions passing through the plaka. as for the shopping, the shopping street is just behind the hotel and the flea market is just in front of it. Amazing hotel! Highly recommended with great price!!!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was really impressed by the fact how tiny our room was. Unconvenient for 2 people. Though it was clean, warm, with bath amenities but with an unacceptable shower curtain. Also, I found it really annoying that there are few stairs in order to reach the elevator. Still, located in downtown and makes everything easier.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thought we were booking the Electra Metropolis when we booked this hotel in error. And what an error that was! Located on the corner of two of the busiest streets in Athens, this is no more than a dingy conversion of a block of flats. "Reception" is a desk tucked under the staircase and the very small elevator took us to a very dark floor and our awful room, a tiny space with nowhere but the bed to unpack the suitcase on. Describing the furniture as "tired" would be a kind exaggeration, I can only describe it as "exhausted".The "balcony" was a tiny space overlooking the non-stop traffic below with all its noise. Yes, you can see the Acropolis in the distance as well as the Metropolis Cathedral but the problem here is that you have no space in the room from where to admire the view, the balcony is uncomfortable and noisy and the Cathedral bells boom out with mathematical regularity.The bathroom was like a scene from Faulty Towers. When we tried to use the hand towel the holder came clean off the wall and when we tried to close the shower curtain, the metal bar holding the curtain up came crushing down on my head. Instead of due concern, this caused amusement to the man at the reception desk when I reported it to him.We were only there for one night and have no intention to ever return. My biggest concern was that in case of an earthquake there was very little chance of us getting out of this building safely. The noise is continuous and loud and the serious lack of space is utterly frustrating. The other issue we had was that although we had been reassured that the hotel accepts American Express, when we came to paying, the receptionist insisted that our card was not being accepted. We challenged him as we had used it without problems the day before and he became aggressive. He offered to take a cash payment, however, we insisted on paying with our Visa card. Incidentally, our American Express continued to be accepted everywhere else we presented it.I am perplexed by the glowing reviews that others have left, I really am.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My teenage children and I stayed here for 2 nights. It's a great location right in Plaka and walking distance to everything you want to see. It includes a rooftop breakfast with an amazing view of the Parthenon. The rooms and small and basic but all you need as there is so much to do in Athens you won't be spending much time in your room. There is a lot of nightlife in this area so if you want an early night make sure to shut your windows and pump up the ac. The hotel offered me a substantial discount if I paid for the room in cash.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Metropolis for four nights in early September. The rooms were very clean and the beds were so comfortable. Breakfast on the rooftop was excellent and the views amazing! The location was great, close to everything.We had a wonderful stay. Would definitely recommend :))
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is an absolute gem. The view is just fantastic. Fantastic rooms, and the Restaurant could compete with most of the other Restaurants outdoor, even if it was a bit more expensive. Would come again, but longer I hope.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a gem. We stayed for just 1 night in September. We were leaving the next day and just wanted something in the heart of Plaka for souvenir shopping before we left. This hotel has a couple of parking spots out front which is very convenient if you know the Plaka area. If you don't, the Plaka area is a very old part of the city with small roads and not a lot of parking. To say that you found street parking is a feat in and of itself. From checkin to checkout this hotel is great. The people that work at the hotel are amazing. The room is small but has everything you could possibly need. The bed was great and big enough. Quite comfortable and the pillows were as well. The room is clean and the bathroom is a nice size. Small shower but good enough. The hotel is so convenient to everything downtown. The Acropolis view from our room and bed was amazing, especially at night. The breakfast in the morning was great. It had enough to start the day. My husband had eggs and I had cheese, meat and bread. We will definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone who wants to stay in the heart of Plaka. Amazing!!!!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two nights in this hotel was enough for me. Cramped room was tired and thankfully it was only a place to rest though sleep was sorely tested with the church chiming just a across the road - in fairness not the hotel's fault.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in the center of Athens. Short walk to the Metro. Small room and very small bathroom (showers are about 2 ft x 2 ft), but expected in a busy European city. Clean rooms and stunning views of the Acropolis from your room and the rooftop breakfast area. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Based purely on the location, id definitely recommend this if you're on a short stay in Athens.It was ideal for the three nights we were there.The rooms are small, and very basic (the photographs you'll see online are VERY cleverly taken!)Our room had a very small and narrow balcony (with one chair, and a dangerously low hand rail!) but with stunning views of the Acropolis. Strangely though, when we were out there one evening, a window opened and a head popped out. The room next door had a bathroom window that opened onto our balcony. Very bizarre. I must also admit, that i don't think i've ever been in a lift that made me so nervous!It's tiny (you can just about fit 2 people and 2 bags in there) and open on one side, so you can see the walls going past!I only ever used it when i was tired, and preferred the four flights of stairs instead.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this lovey perfect location hotel only for half a day.We wish we stayed our whole vacation here.Run by a family who are so kind and helpful and made us feel at home in the short time we were there.It’s a cute, petit and very well priced hotel with the best view and literally the best location you could ever ask for. Love everything about this hotel!! When we back in Athens again this is my number one choice
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Metropolis for 2 nights end of June 2018. The location was fantastic, close to restaurants in the Plaka. Breakfast was basic but the view was a great way to start the day. The rooms were quite basic but clean. We would come back & stay at the hotel again when we come back to Athens.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place served it’s purpose. It was just a rest stop along the way to the cyclades. We didn’t really expect much from it. The front desk staff was really nice and very helpful with recommending how to spend our only nights in Athens. Luckily it was located very conveniently close to Plaka and to the Monastiraki. The elevator was scary lol. It’s so small and every time I used it I just prayed I wouldn’t get stuck. Honestly, I could touch all four walls of the room by standing in the middle of it. It was so small! We stayed here twice. Both rooms were so small but the first room was smaller. The first room had a small balcony which was nice to go out on to get fresh air. The second room had only a window. The first room had really good AC that was working very well, and it would even work when we left the room. The second room needed the room key in order for it to work. It didn’t work well at all and we were sweating during the night. Overall, like I said, the hotel served it’s purpose. I wasn’t expecting anything more than a 2 - star hotel. We’re thankful for the staff and for helping us out with booking taxis and recommendations.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel is in the best possible location for exploring Athens. We (a family of four) stayed the first 3 nights of our trip here and it was perfect. The rooms are basic but clean. The WiFi worked great. The staff was friendly. We didn’t have breakfast on the roof because there was a fantastic bakery near the hotel. In short we would recommend this little gem and stay again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: II was in Athens for one night and I stayed at the metropolis hotel. This hotel has a spectacular view of the Parthenon and the Duomo, in an area full of restaurants and bar; my room was really clean and overlooking the acropolisGreat hotel for visit Athens
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is IMH neither very spacious nor fancy. But it doesn't need to be when you're in a city where all the life plays out on the street. Our room was small but clean and everything was in shape. Well worth the approx. 90 EUR we spent for it. If you want a place to sleep in the center of Athens: this hotel might be your choice! When you're looking for something to relax and enjoy the cozyness of your room you better look out for something else.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located withing a few minutes walking distance from Syntagma square, Ermou st, Monastiraki and other attractions in the city center - very convenient! A few cafes, supermarket and Chillbox (for frozen yougurt/ice cream lovers) are just across the corner. It's a budget hotel with basic amenities and small rooms, but for me its perfect location, amazing view of the Acropolis from the roof terrace and great staff compensate for it. The staff was very welcoming, helpful and nice - thanks a lot guys, you made our stay with you very pleasant!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little gem of a place was in the heart of restaurants galore and shopping.... just a perfect spot for travelers! Very small place but adequate for our stays, friendly staff and very in touch with the area.... loved it and would stay there again..... Affordable and The Roof op Patio was a very special addition
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location with bare minimum facilitiesIf you want to stay in a location which is nearby to all tourist spots and beautiful plaka street with bare minimum facilities then this is a good option. Rooms and washrooms are two small but from balcony you can see some of famous tourist spots with ease. Hotel provides breakfast but it's chargeable instead super markets are nearby where can get everything for breakfast in very less price.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing beats the location of this hotel! We stayed two nights there. The Syntagma Square is wonderful with lots of restaurants, some within 3 minutes walk. it is within walking distance to many historical sites and shopping areas. The breakfast is simple but with the view of the Acropolis! The rooms are adequate, clean, and functional. If you don't mind the church bell every half hour (we were not bothered by it at all), then it is a perfect place to stay. The elevator is tiny but functional. One has to climb a few steep steps to reach it though. If you book it on their web site you could get 5-10% discount. I think the code is 43 (sorry don't remember it now). We stayed May 26-28.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Metropolis was in the perfect location to be able to easily walk to all the historical sites and shopping. It's a couple minute walk from the many stores in the flea market and food/coffee shops. The view is wonderful, overlooking the Acropolis and a beautiful Cathedral. Staff was welcoming and helpful whenever we had questions. Would highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I stepped out onto the balcony, I practically fell over my own jaw in delight. Almost as big as the room, it looked right up at the Parthenon and right across a green square to the Orthodox Cathedral in range of its bells. Management encouraged me to picnic there! The Metropolis is a two star hotel deserving three stars for value and five stars for its view. My greeting was enthusiastic, in fluent English and helpful. A solo traveler, I had booked the last available room, #51, on the top residential floor. Advertised for a family, it would have been very satisfactory for a couple and child. It was very clean and bright with a queen bed and a single bed in an alcove, but definitely a one-at-a-time bathroom. Gear included a small fridge, hair dryer, safe, and three sets of generic toiletries. Free Wi-Fi. There’s a small TV and an accommodating IKEA style desk. A strong in-wall AC is controlled by remote. Breakfast is spare but inexpensive. There is a lift, but there are also a lot of stairs—up to the front door, up to the elevator, and finally up from the fifth floor to the enclosed rooftop breakfast room. It’s ordinary fare with that extraordinary view. Pluses are the plunging distance to the Plaka, rambling distance to the Acropolis, and a street full of convenience shopping and rows of cafes.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As previous reviewers have said, the hotel is spotless, friendly, with outstanding views on the rooftop. Our travel group had one room that was a double room, being used as a single, and another triple room, being used by my husband and I. Both rooms were very small, and the bathroom, although modern, it was even smaller. We enjoyed the location in Plaka and central to all sights.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very very nice accommodation. Central Athens. Within walking distance of central shopping and restaurants.. near Palaka .. nice rooms.. VERY friendly and accommodating staff... rooftop restaurant with view of Acropolis
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel is on the small side.....the reception area is tiny, the elevator is miniscule, the rooms and bathrooms are also very small but the location is absolutely perfect! The hotel sits between Syntagma Square and Monastiraki Square and is just a few blocks from Plaka, the main shopping area of Athens. The rooftop terrace on the 5th floor overlooks the main cathedral and has a lovely view of Acropolis Hill and the Parthenon. Despite its small size, all of the rooms and common areas of the hotel are spotlessly clean, toiletries and hairdryers are provided, there is a small mini-frig in each room, air conditioning and free wi-fi. The hotel staff is very accommodating and helpful. They will order cabs for you to Piraeus port and the airport and even print your boarding passes. Breakfast is offered on the rooftop terrace for an additional 6 euros but it is very basic and there are numerous restaurants nearby which offer more variety. If you are a light sleeper, be forewarned that the cathedral bells chime on the hour. This didn't bother us because we live in Mexico so we are used to the sound of bells, roosters, barking dogs, etc. But if you on on a budget and want a central location, within walking distance of most Athens attractions, at a reasonable price, you should definitely consider Hotel Metropolis. Credit cards are accepted.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent two nights here last week and we had a great stay. The hotel location was perfect for us. It's located less than a 10 minute walk from two metro stations, about 10-15 minutes from the Acropolis and all the main sights, and there is tons of great eating around Plaka within 5-10 minutes. Spring for the room with the Acropolis view! We had drinks on our 5th floor balcony each night overlooking the cathedral across the street and the illumined Parthenon atop the Acropolis. It was awesome. We had breakfast one morning on the roof which had an amazing view too. The room was definitely not large but I think that's just Athens/Europe for you. Don't worry about it, just sleep here and spend the rest of your time exploring the city. The staff was really helpful and proactive too. They were great for restaurant tips (check out Mnisikleous Street in Plaka aka The Plaka Steps) and they helped us get a cab to the airport at the end of our stay.Summary: Great location, awesome value, really helpful staff, amazing view.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here 1 night. The location is perfect, near Syntagma square and not far away from Metropolis.The room I had was facing the acropolis, but nevertheless, there were some facts that let me down: my room needed to be painted, internet was not working properly even though I tried it in 2 different cellphones and 1 laptop, and I don’t know why, my debit card didn’t work for the first time...
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the Metropolis for my parents and 4 family friends. They were just there for one night so I booked them 2 family rooms (3 beds). They returned raving about the hotel's location, cleanliness, comfort, and breakfast. All 6 people said they would 100% stay there again if they returned to Athens and would definitely recommend! Being the one who booked the rooms, I felt that it was a steal for the price (especially since it included 3 beds in each room). It would be perfect for a group of friends traveling together who needed a break from the hostel experience without breaking the budget.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location and easy to access almost all sites in the Old Athens Town. Good services and nice breakfast. Front desk service is very kind and very good English speaking. Rooms are clear and very calm.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for five nights and enjoyed it. Very convenient location for almost all of the sights--right on the edge of the Plaka across the street from the Metropolis cathedral (the bells of which do chime on every hour, and once on every half-hour, but the noise didn't bother me as much as it did other reviewers). The room was basic but comfortable, with a nice view from the balcony of the cathedral below and of the Acropolis. There was a little miscommunication with our booking through Expedia--they gave us two twin beds instead of one double bed, and the front desk clerk made it feel like it was our fault for having used Expedia. That same clerk also tried to talk us out of taking the bus to Sounio and insisted we hire a private car instead. We didn't take his advice, but for most other information he and the other front desk clerks were helpful and very friendly (and VERY talkative). I'd stay here again, but probably book with them directly to avoid any miscommunication.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hosts, small hotel with small rooms, but a balcony and the clean room makes you forget the size. "Size does not matter!"Excellent location, everything possible on foot, breakfast OK on the rooftop! I'll use it again for overnight stay!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Imagine arriving into Athens and going upstairs for dinner to have the most magnificent view of the Acropolis, lit up in the evening.The dinner in the restaurant was exception. I hate there twice and stayed at the hotel on two occasions.. The rooms are modern, with balconies. The spa is really great to relax in. The meeting rooms and the hotel are full of exposed archaeological sites which are emphasized
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for two nights. They were kind enough to let us check in at 7am. The hotel is super well located, a few minutes to walk to Plaka, Syntagma or Monastiraki. Very nice personnel. Small but very comfortable room. Shower enclosure could improve a little (gets the whole bathroom wet) but that didn't affect at all our stay or opinion on the place. Would definitely stay there again !
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title says all you need to know. This place is noisy, and if you want to sleep at night (or during the day) you should avoid it. Unfortunately I did not, and spent four nights getting maybe 3-4 hours of sleep a night. To begin, it is on a busy street, a street where traffic runs pretty constant until the early morning hours. Next, the rooms are directly underneath an outdoor restaurant, which is routinely busy past midnight, with sounds wafting up to the rooms. Finally, there is a church right across the street with a bell that tolls on the hour and makes a prolonged toll at 7:30 am. Since it is really not practical to get to bed before one or two, that gives you about five yours of sleep. Don't expect a closed window to protect you from the noise: it won't. I should add that the rooms are incredibly, incredibly tiny. And overpriced. The truth is, there are hotel rooms that are much cheaper, bigger, and quieter in the Plaka area, and if you want to enjoy your visit to Athens, you will find one of those.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the Metropolis, hotel is situated walking distance to all the tourist attractions in Athens, like the stadium, houses of parliament, the Acropolis,and museums. There are also plenty of restaurants and shops all close by too. The staff at the Metropolis were all friendly and so helpful, which made our stay in Athens even more enjoyable. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a fantastic choice if your main concern is location. It's an easy walk to many of the touristy destinations and countless cafes, restaurants, shopping etc. There is a great view of the cathedral next door and the Acropolis from the rooftop (and from the balcony of our room as well); breathtaking both by day and night.The room was small and a little cramped for 4 adults, but for the price and location was well worth it - especially if you're not spending much time inside. The bathrooms looked recently updated and the shower was actually roomy and had a rainfall showerhead (not only handheld).The staff is very friendly and willing to help facilitate taxis, ferry tickets, etc and is available 24/7. Check in and out is very easy.One note of advice - there is a very similarly named hotel right up the street, so make sure your taxi brings you to the correct place!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel to spend a few days before our cruise. Great location, affordable prices. Rooms are a little small, but hey! it's Europe. Spectacular view of the Acropolis from the roof top. At night the Acropolis is lit so you can take great pictures.Can wait to go back, I will def stay here again
hotelName:
13    Hotel Metropolis
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are small but nice and clean with everything you need. The rooftop pool is great for relaxing and taking in the view. Staff was friends. Location is very central and safe. I don't know what other reviewers are talking about in regards to the location. I was a single female traveler and had no issues with safety or with the location. Yes there is graffiti but there is graffiti everywhere in Athens. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I will have to start by saying that I truly trusted the Melia brand, having stayed with them elsewhere...but I have to say, this was a horrible experience!! The area isn’t just URBAN, like the management seems to imply - it is blocks away from a seedy, unsafe, druggie-infested part of the city, which other reviewers have mentioned (I wish I have read these reviews before I actually arrived but hey, I trusted the brand!!). SEVERAL cab drivers rolled up the windows driving me and my kids to the hotel advising us that the area wasn’t safe, telling us to not leave to hotel after dark and generally to watch out leaving their car. What we have seen out of the windows looked like a Zombie Apocalypse!! And we come from NYC people!! We were truly spooked, especially the kids. AVOID if you can! The service itself it also spotty. While some people (Kleandra!!) are amazing...the rooms aren’t turned down at night. Some people at our party were lectured that their rooms didn’t come with a free breakfast WHILE eating breakfast? Also, I was held up by John at reception at 2 am to process my credit card for what seems like forever after having already waited for an arriving person for close to an hour. Given I already had a room with them...was it necessary? Anyway...I had a room to stay there for a return trip which I could not cancel so I just blew it off - could NOT fanthom another stay!! Chose to lose $$$$
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked last min. Arrived at 10am and they got us in a room by 10:15, after a refreshing welcome drink. Room was very functional and quiet. Comfy bed, great shower (with massage jets), fluffy towels, 3 sets of curtains to keep the light out, plugs next to bed, no silly flashing lights from aircon, telly or smoke alarm. Not the most modern looking rooms but who gives a monkeys when everything else is so in order. Got a late check out and could use pool and shower up before leaving. Nice rooftop pool but not enough loungers. Maybe 10 loungers and some tables and chairs. Probably 30 people up there at most times. Also, €4 a bit steep for a small Diet Coke!Taxis always waiting outside and 5 mins walk to subway. Overall 10/10 for value and would recommend for a weekend stay.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not a 4 star hotel. It’s a good 3 star at best. We arrived at 7am after long flights to be told that there were no rooms available. We were then offered an upgrade for early check in (everything is an upgrade), From the €28 for WiFi, to the daily water (which wasn’t daily). Breakfasts are not worth €40 a day by the way. The rooms are small, not suitable for anything more than an overnight stay. The shower gels were empty when we arrived and remained so. The spa does not have full time therapists. When they arrived they were late, set up while we were there and gave poor massages; next to a weight room by the way. The spa on the roof pool doesn’t work properly and the food when served up there arrives cold. My guess is kitchens are a few floors down The surrounding area is dilapidated and graffiti ridden. We also upgraded to a late checkout and had phones ringing and cleaners arriving at 12. And then to cap it off their card machine would not accept my card. We left more stressed than when we arrived. If you’re coming for a night, that’s fine. Otherwise there are nicer places in nicer parts of Athens.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greatly enjoyed our stay at the Melia Athens, after similar stays at other Melia properties. Lovely property, central located, manged by friendly staff eager to ensure a great stay ... and stunning Sky Lounge for dinner, drinks or simply a cool, afternoon swim after a long-day of touring.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely welcome to Athens. Staff could not have been kinder, rooms were lovely and clean and quiet. Pool and pool bar just lovely - afternoon music was perfect. Location was not too bad - a little out of the way but cabs are super cheap.I ate one of the best meals I've ever had - just a simple Greek Salad for lunch on the roof - stunning !Just a note about Athens: Bear in mind that coffee shops will not sell tea (hubby doesn't drink coffee) so pack a few tea bags !
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a good location and is clean. The only problem that we had was with the air condition. the room was very warm which did not make for a good nights sleep. The staff was professional and friendly
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel . Friendly and helpful staff . Room was clean and cool . Breakfast was as per expectations . Had diner one night at roof top restaurant and had to wait a bit longer than expected for food . Located close to public transport and city tourist centre in walking distance .City district hotel is located in is not Athens most atractive one
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel were wonderful and tried to be as helpful as possible. However, I felt the maintenance of the room in the way of variety cleaning left a lot to be desired. First impressions are very important when travelling
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, staff and facilities. Lovely roof top pool. Location is good to get to all attractions however quite a run down and not many restaurants near by. We were recommended not to walk around at night time so used taxis in/out of town (only ~€3.5) and there was always a taxi outside the hotel.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Melia hotel is situated in a central of Athens with very easy walking distance to the main attractions. My reasons for the three stars..... safe didn’t work and after we mention at the reception still nothing has been done till the day we left, hair dryer almost exploded when tried to dry my hair (very dangerous), cleaning lady left the windows open so when we came back from a long day to the room it was hot (30 degrees outside). Miniatures of shampoo, body wash and conditioner were half empty. I’m sure there is space for improvement.I like the hotels Melia as I stayed in one in Vienna couple of years ago and was in love with it. Regarding to the previous reviews about the area being unsafe .... my partner and I walked at night every day and didn’t feel in danger. But everyone need to be cautious if they travel abroad. Melia staff are super friendly, hotel is super clean, breakfast area nice and cosy. Thank you for having us.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our last night after touring the islands and before our long flight home. Bit of a hike in the taxi but ok. The highlight was the rooftop pool and bar,complete with a spa. Very clean with great service. We dined there and enjoyed great meals with a stunning night view to the Acropolis.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent roof top swimming pool, bar and restaurant. The view of the Acropolis is stunning by day or night. Location very good. Approx 25 minute walk to Acropolis which for me was perfect. It let you discover the city and more ruins. Staff are brilliant, especially the roof top waitress. She is very attentive but effortlessly efficient.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and the hotel was lovely and clean and great pool area. However the area is NOT SAFE! I was mugged outside the hotel on my second night. When reported to hotel staff and police we were told this was a regular thing and the police told us we were not safe in this area. Please do not walk anywhere at night and use taxis which are not too expensive. Also there were riots between students and police where tear gas was used and could still feel the effects hours after. Riot police were present outside the hotel every day and it was very scary.I'm writing this review to make people we aware as if we had known before we would we never of walked anywhere and probably would of had to go through the horrifying ordeal of being mugged and threatened with metal bars! So please stay safe as the hotel played down the danger for obvious reasons.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel and staff was amazing. Great rooms great rooftop bar/pool. Really nice feel to it. But the area is just disgusting, unsafe, grimey. I knew it was walking distance from everything which I don’t mind exploring ect but I don’t want to explore druggies/ homeless thugs. There was crack heads jumping at you.. people following close by and people taking heroin. Graffiti and rubbish every where. Get a taxi it’s cheap enough don’t be walking around every until you get close to acropolis.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a bit nervous of this hotel upon reading reviews but was pleasantly surprised by our stay in June 2019. We asked for a quite room on a higher level to avoid street noise and had no issues with our room. It was clean and bed was very comfortable, No issues with the AC. Breakfast was perfect with something for everyone. Yes the neighborhood is a bit shady but I felt most of Athens was as well, we walked to and from the main areas of town day and night and never felt truly unsafe. Yes there where sketchy sections but all in all our stay was wonderful, thank you Melia Athens.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights as we were in Athens for a friends wedding. The roof top pool was perfect we thought that was our favourite thing about the hotel. The rooms were spacious and the shower was great. I can't fault the actual hotel and the staff are amazing. However, we were on the first floor and the view of the street isn't nice. The area this hotel is situated in is quite run down/rough and I didn't feel safe. There are a lot of homeless/drug addicts roaming the streets and we were approached numerous times. Saying that taxis are cheap enough to get to the nicer parts of the city or you could walk just avoid the dodgy streets.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had a spacious room, with a comfortable bed, pillow options and a fabulous jet shower. The view from the pool area on the roof is of the Acropolis - albeit through a maze of antennas.The breakfast provided many options and was fresh and tasty. The neighbourhood was a bit confronting, with many homeless and drug users in the squares nearby in the evenings - but when we were moving after dark we just grabbed a taxi which cost us about 10 Euro. We felt safe walking around during the day and it was only a 10-15 minute walk into the heart of the tourist area.The staff were excellent and very helpful, even calling the tour that we had booked previously, to organise a hotel pick up for us.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We head a very pleasant stay at the hotel. Without asking we were upgraded to supreme room, although I am a Melia member, had not expected that. Just one small complain regarding our room, the minibar fridge could have been colder. The service at the hotel was good, we especially enjoyed the rooftop pool area. Good breakfast. Very nice and helpful staff, especially at the reception. I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially during summer time, when you can use the rooftop area.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and helpful staff. They offered to upgrade us for an additional amount so our room would be ready. Not sure it was worth it for internet and 2 free drinks, but room was larger I suppose than we would have had otherwise. The rooftop pool was great but cold water, still eating up there was reasonable. Breakfasts included were good, but service a little slower, still very good options.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent three nights at the Meliá Athens. The hotel itself is pleasant and worthy of its four star status. It has a nice rooftop pool and bar, with views of the Acropolis, and the food and drink at the hotel is nice, if not a little over priced. The staff were friendly and all very efficient and quick to help.The issue is the location. It doesn’t feel particularly safe and is a bit of a walk to the main sights and more pleasant areas to walk around. Taxis are however relatively cheap and easy enough to find. We didn’t feel safe walking around the neighbourhood in the evening. On departure our taxi driver informed us that the hotel is just two blocks from a hospital that issues methadone to addicts on a daily basis. It’s a shame, but because of the location I would strongly advice against staying here and certainly wouldn’t book again.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: problems with bookingstaff wanting prepay inspite of booked "pay at hotel". We had to sent complaint to main office.Breakfast averageNo free water included!! This is Athens were you get free water everywhere, but not in Melia premium room.coakroches in the room.dark and narrow hallwaysrough neigbourhoodway to expensive for what you get.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel following a great experience with the hotel chain in Alicante. Hotel is in walking distance of many of the main attractions, rooms are very clean and comfortable, roof top pool bar is great to relax in on a sunny day though drinks expensive in comparison to other bar prices in the area. Hotel also left a birthday display in my room which was a thoughtful touch. Would definitely recommend - thank you for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Avoid. I understand there are policies in place but god forbid you need to cancel any portion or even reschedule, even a month or more in advance when they can likely rebook the room, they are extremely strict and will not give an inch. No allowance whatsoever. They have every right to run their customer oriented business this way, but realize that my review is not the only one that mentions this, and if you don’t like the accommodations or the area, or you are ill, or have a death in your family, they will not refund, rebook, or modify your reservation in any way.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated in a dodgy area that you better avoid after 20:00 pm. I had a “superior room” but it was really small, making me wonder how does a normal room looks like. The streets around the hotel are with high traffic and even if i was on 6th floor, the noise was really bad.Be very careful with the refund policy of the hotel!! I didn’t pay attention to this and even if i have let them know in advance i have to shorten my stay, i ended up paying 370eur for 2 nights that i had to cancel.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very good value, staff are exceptional (George particularly so). The room was a good standard as was the bathroom and very clean. Breakfast catered for all tastes from cold the hot buffet and the service was very good. Hotel is situated within a reasonable walk of all main attractions.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was good value being a little way out of the tourist areas. It was walkable to all the archaeological sites, restaurants and museums. The added bonus, on top of well thought out rooms (we stayed in a supreme room) was the roof top view of the acropolis from the sky bar and swimming pool in the roof garden.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very central. You can walk to the archeological museum and many shops and restaurants. Front desk is very helpful. Good breakfast. The rooms are nice. Not too big but good. A very good hotel for a stay in Athens.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location is good. Parking available nearby for a good rate (10 euro per day). Hotel is very Nice. The interior is not my style but it was good and clean. As we had our birthday during our stay, we got a cake and birthday wishes. It was very nice. I would definitely come back again!
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location and convince had a price.Interior noise unacceptable, their saving grace...(resulting in extra star)...every staff member were professional, courteous, and helpful. Reservation agent listened to my concerns Convince and location of being next to Athens Airport was the original star.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great breakfast, room clean and nice view on the Acropole from the sky lounge. More important was the staff at the reception who was really helpful and went the extra mile to sort out very big issues we faced with our travel and ID documents.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hotel in the center of Athens which one can recommended. The staff is friendly and efficient, the location is not excellent but very central. The facilities and restaurants are good and the prices for meals and drinks are quite reasonable. TV and Wi-Fi work very well
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Melia Athens on two different occasions. We were impressed both times. Our rooms were comfortable. When the windows were open, we were aware of street noise, but the noise was completely blocked when we closed them. The bed was comfortable. We were within walking distance of a number of markets and the Parthenon and the Metro was close by. While in Athens, my purse was stolen. I cannot fully express my gratitude to the staff, helping me make all the calls necessary to cancel cards and making sure I could find my way around Athens to report the loss and get replacement documents.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel, friendly staff, very nice and spacious room and bathroom, very central to all historical places in Athens. Good cafeteria. Nice resting lobby area. Good shops around the hotel. Ask the staff for restaurant recommendation
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is situated at the intersection of two noisy avenues. If you get a room on the outer side, don’t expect to sleep without earplugs unless if you don’t mind the non-stop noise of buses passing and motorbikes accelerating.When I complained to the staff after my first night, they were not able to change my room because they said I had to pack my things although I was in a hurry to go for a business meeting. That evening, they still didn’t have a solution. When I invited a staff member to come to my room and listen to the noise, he did, and then kindly (very kindly actually) explained to me that the problem was me - that other guests don’t complain and are able to sleep with the noise of buses and motorcycles.This hotel first needs to recognize this massive problem and then renovate or completely change their triple glass isolation windows.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the Melia is ideally situated in the centre of Athens, within easy reach of both Metro and the attractions of the city, I was disappointed by the overall experience of this hotel.On the good side, breakfast was very enjoyable, as you would expect, and the rooms were very comfortable ,and well serviced.On the downside: Our room was noisy, despite double glazed windows and double thickness of curtain. Temperature controls were not easily explained, so hot and uncomfortable or cool and very noisy.The hotel has a bar, apparently, but never saw it open.Drinking water is charged at €3 a bottle from the mini bar. This is the first hotel of this standard where bottled water isn't complementary.WiFi is advertised as free, but on activation this is shown as for 3 days only at login.To sum up, massively overrated.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: +enjoy visiting Melia Athens their rooms and patisseries we've enjoyed while traveling in Greece. They bring such good memories!-internet connection quite slowBut afterallWe particularly love Greek
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Late arrival after missed flight, staff at check in provided us with drinks during check in, and was so helpful with arranging food and taxi. Rooms are great, we received update with jacuzzi, and ate at restaurant, Which was All we needed after so much delay, very friendly staff, very professional, Would love to Come back soon!
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Incredibly clean and comfortable, excellent breakfast. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quiet. About a 5 min walk from the metro station and about a 20 min walk into the city centre.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a lovely 5 night stay at Melia. We were greeted by friendly staff, we arrived late evening and were pointed in the direction of a local restaurant for dinner. Hotel is located a walk away from the main areas but that was fine with us. We didn’t use public transport but would appear to be easily accessible to the hotel. Room was very warm but staff quickly sorted this out by providing a fan. Breakfast was as you’d expect from a hotel, a mix of cooked and continental, fresh fruit etc. Only minor observation is the room could have been slightly cleaner. Dust in some areas, water marks on glass bathroom door from previous occupant. The rooms were cleaned daily though, even on their bank holiday. Unfortunately the roof garden and pool were not open during our stay which was shame as we experienced some lovely weather. The coffee at breakfast, the cafe or room service was very good. Would definitely recommend the hotel and would stay here again. A previous review suggested to book a supreme room, we took the advise - is a good size for 2 people
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice designed hotel in walking distance of Omonia (Metro) and even closer busstations. The staff is extremly kind and helpful, the rooms are very clean and the food and drinks are great. Safety is also very good as you cannot get to the upoer floors without a roomcard.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel to be of a good value for the comfortable service provided. It is in a great and easy to navigate position within Athens city to walk to all the attractions. Staff were all friendly
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought the room was very clean and the breakfasts were varied with healthy options! The location, in my opinion, was convenient to other areas to Athens. The only thing I wished was open was the rooftop bar as I am sure it had great views of Athens at night.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, centrally located. Good breakfast. Fair price. Might be a bit noisy if you have a srteet view room despite triple glass windows. The staff tries their best for your comfort and is really helpful. There is free parking out on the street infront of the hotel reserved for guests, but also paid parking indoors just across the hotel at special price for hotel guests.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
