review_body: Modern 4* Hotel, very clean, staff friendly and very helpful.I booked a Supreme room. It was spacious, very comfortable bed and a lovely bathroom.Buffet Breakfast was fantastic.Location was fine. Easy Walking to attractions and shops.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was quite good however the nebourhoud was quite doggy. I felt uncomfortable walking outside late in the evening. Though the area is rather central.There were not so many places nearby to have a dinner.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Melia Athens desrves the best rating for what a 4* hotel should represent, however it's location could be better. From one point of view there is a small 20min walk to Monasiriaki and Piros (which is good) but on the other hand places you pass by rather put You closer to Mombasa than to EU capital. No window shopping, extremelly dirty streets,... def not a 21 century looking city. I am glad I was there only for 2,5 days.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: NO AIRCON and they explained that at this time of the year, they place the system in heating mode and thus only thing to do was to open the very tiny windows which is VERY NOISY. The weather is not very cold, is only about 15°c.The corridor air conditioning is working properly but not for room - I guess guests don't deserve it.Unless you enjoy hot rooms, avoid this hotel if you want to have good night sleep (we had very hard time to fall asleep).Very stuffy very noisy
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, spacious clean rooms and bathroom. Bed was extremely comfortable and you had the sense that you were alone in the hotel at night (could not hear noise from rooms next door) which is a huge advantage for a hotel
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fabulous hotel if you are looking luxury at a good reasonable price. The location probably isn't 5* but if u come out of the hotel turn right and take the first left that will take u up to the main square where you can catch the metro to anywhere u want to go. Make sure to visit the Palaka area...so quaint and is in the old town, bars and restaurants are fab.There was a lot of army presence at night, we weren't sure what that was all about and we never saw anything bad happen but it does feel like the poorer side of the city. The staff at this hotel are 5*, the breakfast is also 5* and the rooms are 5*. We were a little disappointed that the roof garden was closed, apparently from October until April. I don't think the location would be good at night for people staying on their own or groups of ladies.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a returning guest and had a great time once again. The staff is very nice, the room was comfortable and clean, and location is within walking distance from main city attractions. The level experience room offers a nespresso coffee machine in the room which is a great benefit for coffee loversp
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great value for money, the hotel is lovely, has a rooftop pool and steam and sauna and the staff go above and beyond. Would definitely recommend this hotel.It's not located right in the centre, however it is only a 10 minute walk and is probably cheaper than other hotels in the centre which are not as nice in my opinion. To stay in a hotel of this standard in the centre would cost significantly more.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very well located hotel to visit Athens. Feels like a little bubble to come after a day and relax. The staff is amazing and very friendly. Breakfast was impressive. Shame the roof top was closed at night but the view seemed out of breath.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very enjoyable stay. Comfortable room, excellent bathroom. Good breakfast choice. Orange juice could have been better. Breakfast room a bit dark. Staff friendly and helpful. Would return if in Athens again.
hotelName:
14    Melia Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my worst experience in a hostelI got up in the morning for breakfast and I saw, stuck on the door of the room, a sign that said "sr gallerano, go to the reception" (not even said please) ... once there, both the receptionist and the manager tell me that I should give them 10 euros because, after paying the room, they had given me that extra amount of money. I answered that I had not counted the money and that I had already mixed it in my wallet and that, therefore, I had no way of knowing. the manager, to my surprise (in a accusatory tone) tells me: I'm sorry but we really trust the person who checked you in, so... I never felt so uncomfortable and accused in a hostel, so even without being able to check anything I gave them the money they demanded and obviously the other day I changed my hostel.Really as a guest I was treated very disparagingly.ps: the Nigerian staff that works at the hostel is great and good vibes
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to give it this rating based on the personal cons I experienced. Let me say if it wasn't for these circumstances - it probably would have got 4.5 This review is for Athens Backpackers (not Studio) and for a mixed 6 dormitory bed with shared bathroom.The CONS:1) TOILET PAPER Each floor gets one roll a morning. For 18 beds. Especially as a female, toilet paper is very needed for all our bathroom needs - one roll is not sufficient enough for 18 beds. Yes, we can ask reception - which we did. A friend advised reception and their response was "perhaps the housecleaner hasn't gone in yet." I went down an hour later, advising again that toilet paper was gone. I would assume that multiple people were advising reception of the lack of toilet paper. 2) WIFI. The wifi was not sufficient enough to make a call via skype, facebook without lags / cut outs. It wasn't able to stream, download and if you say wanted to upload a video it'd fail, or you may need to re-upload a photo on IG.3) SCHOOL KIDS. While I was staying, a group of maybe 25 school kids (university) were staying there also. This is fine if a hostel wants to do this - but it disrupts the environment of a hostel, as solo travellers, groups etc - to meet others it essentially takes out experiences you could otherwise have. Not only this, they went on the walking tour and instead of receiving information about Athens I mostly remember just the teachers yelling and repeating incorrect information. It would have been best if they had two walking tours, one for the hostel guests and another with the school groups. We also weren't advised until we'd paid (7 euros) so it wasn't like we could just not do it, it then felt uncomfortable to ask for funds back.THE PROS: They have comfy beds, lockers, high-pressure shower, key cards, amazing location, staff off and on helpful depending who you get, decent free breakfast. As I said, If I stayed in the Studio (apparently have lots of toilet paper) or came at a different time (no school groups) then I'd probably rate it 4.5 stars.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the six people dorm room and got exactly what I paid for. Great value for money and the views from the roof bar is amazing!!! Would definitely recommend it and would stay again here. Keep up the good work guys!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i started traveling all around the world about 3 years ago , I've been to many countries and stayed in many places .Italy is considered a Mediterranean country so i thought i have to visit Greece too.On my first day i checked in and the guy with the hat welcomed me with a big smile ,friendly and gave me a lot of information.I stayed in a dorm with 3 more guys ,the room was clean and spacious.Free breakfast was served at the reception by pit, he also makes good bread fried on eggs .The location is excellent close to most of the archeological sights which can be discovered by the walking tour offered by the hostel.The highlight of this hostel was the rooftop bar which had a really nice view.Although the sound system of the bar was unable to play sounds loudly , the bartender Lucas was very funny and social and his ability to introduce everybody ,helped everyone make new friendships. Interesting stories about the city and funny jokes had everyone sat at the bar! (p.s try the blue lagoon cocktail )
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had such an amazing stay at this hostel. The people are very friendly, speak great English and really give you good recommendations for a great trip. It’s so close to the Akropolis and the city center but still pretty quite during the night. The bathroom maybe needs a little update and also the AC couldn’t reach the back bunk beds but overal the rooms are nice. The rooftop bar is really a must do. The view is amazing. You really meet a lot of people there and you have a guaranteed fun night. I will definitely come back.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t believe I forgot to write a review on this hostel!!! My sister and I had a HORRIBLE Airbnb experience. We wasted 2+ hrs of our time waiting on the host and then waiting for him to be able to unlock the door. So frustrating!! So, we had to figure out somewhere else to stay. This was during ‘spring break’ and lots of travelers and tourists everywhere! We were afraid we weren’t going to be able to find a place. But! Athens backpackers had beds for us!! Made us feel right at home after a frustrating evening and guided us to a restaurant that served us like queens! Amazing stay. Decently priced and a place to stay. If you’re looking for private rooms/luxury, not for you!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed in the mixed dorm with individual beds and no lie this bed was more comfortable than my own bed at home! Great balcony and very comfortable living quarters. I usually stay in the bunkbeds which are also great but I highly recommend this room.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is in such a great location, and at night you can see the Parthenon from the rooftop bar. The staff here are awesome, so helpful and really fun. It is so easy to meet people and make friends here. I really recommend spending the extra few euro for this hostel, it is worth it.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, good neighbourhood, sweetest staff EVER, big room, good cleanance and an amazing acropole view from the rooftop. Nice atmosphere, good breakfast and a great happy hour at the sunset! highly reccomended! <3 <3 <3
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostels excellent, provides everything it pledges and more. Tremendously enjoyed my stay, arrived on my first night from travelling solo with lost baggage and the staff made me feel at ease after getting off to a bad start. Stay goes above and beyond to make people feel welcome, great atmosphere on the rooftop bar with the workers Lucas and Peter. The rooms themselves are always keep clean and beds cosy, highly recommend to everyone travelling Athens.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay here , roof top bar has amazing views . Met lots of other travellers here and had a great time partying with them . Really good location and 24hr reception is definitely a bonus! Would recommend
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was really easy to get to via metro. Breakfast was free which was nice. I was just stopping over for a night and it was exactly what I needed. I liked that my room had a bathroom and second sink attached。Lighting in the room was not great. For a hostel, though, I knew what I was getting and got exactly that - and a relatively nice hostel, at that!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The beds were adequately comfortable; very standard hostel bunks. However, the amenities make this the best place I have stayed while backpacking. The free breakfast is good (amazing jam), cheap drinks at the bar, discount at their restaurant, cheap left luggage, good WiFi, and the rooftop bar and hangout area was amazing (excellent view of the Acropolis, not exaggerated at all). The vibe of the staff was relaxed and very welcoming, and the other guests were friendly and interesting. The only negative thing was that my friends and I booked the same room together and were separated in groups of two into different rooms. It was a great location for seeing the main ancient sites of Athens, and they had recommendations of unique things to do outside of the main sites.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good few days at the hostel. The breakfast is great, the rooftop is gorgeous and even though the bar was not yet serviced, the staff was super friendly to let us go up there anytime by giving us their key.generally, the rooms are fine, some of them have large balconies, everything is quite nicely set up. the location is absolutely amazing and hard to beat! however, the bathroom was unfortunately quite dirty (even for hostel conditions, believe me, i have stayed at a few ;) ) and didn't appear any cleaner the next days either. another unfortunate feature are the very thin walls. you can hear anything from the room next door and also the doors bang loudly when closing. also, the staff could have been just a tiiiiiny bit more cheerful ;)all in all, a great place for max. 2 or 3 nights but not much longer than that ;) the rooftop is amazing though!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is in a great location with all the must see sights within walking distance. There is a metro line nearby and plenty of restaurants to choose from.The free breakfast is ok considering that it's free, l wasn't expecting much. It consists of bread, boiled egg, ham, cheese, tomato, cucumber, feta cheese and a small piece of cake. I actually wasn't disappointed with it.I was a bit disappointed with the tiny bathroom in the 6 bed dorm, after a shower the floor is wet even though there's a shower curtain. There's a little squeegee attached to a long stick that is used to sweep the water into the floor drain. The nice and lovely cleaners clean the bathroom everyday.I would come again because of the good location and great price.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great ubication, you have to take 1 subway from the internation airport (10 euros. - the taxi to the airport is 40 euros). When we arrived at the hostel, they moved us to another hostel near it (Athens Studios) without our knowledge. The rooms are spacious without lockers and you have the space to cook in ther. The bathroom is small and it floods everytime you take a bath. The terrace isn´t open in winter. I 'd go back if i have the chance
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hostel, right next to the Acopolis of Athens, with a rooftop bar of the city around around. The front desk appears to be active 24/7, the staff were freindly and helpful (speaking English as well). The rooms were comfortable, with lockers in them for your stuff. There's plenty of small shops around as well as bars and restaraunts. The only downside was the bathroom, which was a little bit messy, but did not in anyway feel unuseable.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel is easy to reach, not far from acropolis. It has a roof bar to meet other travelers from all over the world. Not far away they have a sports bar with karaoke or to watch football etc.. Small breakfast is included. IMO the staff was nice and helpfull.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was really good! The staff were super friendly and helpful! Rooms were really clean and everywhere was tidy. Free breakfast was decent. The atmosphere was amazing here. Between the pub down the road and the rooftop bar at the hostel it is really easy to meet people! One tip: TAKE THE WALKING TOUR! So good and perfect introduction to Athens!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked two nights at the backpackers and it turned out it was worthbooking.First of all,the staff was really friendly and willing to help at any time,the room was clean and quite.Mornings at the sports bar and nights at the rooftop bar which really made me enjoy my vacation in Athens due to Lucas and joana,funny stories of Athens and great drinks.definetely gonna come again in the near future
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The accommodations here at Athens Backpackers was AMAZING! Additionally, their themed nights helped individuals connect. This is the best service I have EVER received. Lucas was a very attentive bartender, and was awesome with his ability to anticipate the needs of the members! I highly recommend this location!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had made a reservation through Booking.com. When we showed up, booking.com had cancelled our reservation due to an error on the back end, but had sent me a confirmation email not a cancellation one. Being 9pm at night, we were very nervous we would be homeless for the night. But the reception (sorry I have blanked on his name), was so helpful! He booked us in a room at a hotel, for the same price, and gave us free drinks at the bar. I don't know where we would be without his help!P.S. the view from the rooftop bar at night is amazing.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed this hostel, the location is really great! Although elevators are so small, everything else was pretty good. Breakfast was served next door and staff was quite helpful!! The view from the rooftop for Acropolis was awesome too, would definitely recommend and would stay again!!!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great experience here. Had an easy check in and out that was open 24 hours a day, with friendly and helpful staff. Was in a 6 person room. Beds were comfy enough and it wasn't too loud. Would have liked a powerpoint near the bed for my phone but overall it had everything I needed.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay here was awesome Close to all of the main attractions, nice neat aircon!! Rooms Reception ppl are nice and helpful, and my favourite the ROOFTOP bar with Lucas the bar tender is a must friendly and makes great cocktails! Greek bbq by Peter is good and cheap nice people here! And l meet heaps of people from all over the world great spot
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel solo (by motorcycle) and stay in hotels, but sometimes it's nice to meet fellow travelers so this hostel is perfect for that. After all, it's just for a night or 2 stay for me and I don't need 5 star stuff. This hostel is well run and very clean. But the location on a quiet street in the Plaka area is the best part of this accommodation. For 30 euros a night you'd have to go to the Omonia (ugh!) district for a hotel. The Plaka is very safe and full of restaurants (but go to nearby Monasteraki area for cheaper restaurants). I recommend a 3 bed dorm room if you're interested in getting some sleep because the 6 bed dorms have more coming and going at all hours. I stayed in a 6 bed dorm and one inconsiderate individual played with his mobile phone until 2:30am in the morning. The rooftop bar is nice, but very small so get there early if you want a seat. A great spot to meet fellow travelers to share a beer and a story.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, friendly and great roof top bar. Walking tour was good quality and a great way to meet people. A bath mat would've been helpful as the floor got soaked. Also a bit loud at night with everyone going up to the roof top. Other than that I really enjoyed my stay! Would definitely come again.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lucas was an incredible bartender and hooked us up with some great tunes on the rooftop! The hostel is fun, safe and cool! If you are looking for a good time look no further! Also great views of the city and Acropolis!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located down the acropolis close to all touristic atractions.Staff ok but could be more helpfulBar on the roof with nice view on Parthenon.Be careful, rooms in the 5th and 6th floors are very noisy.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the workers at this hostel are so great! it was my friend's birthday and Katya, the bartender, gave her her favorite drink, on the house, at midnight! she really made the experience so much better! thank you so much, Katya!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I originally found this hostel on another site which had great reviews. However, I have to say I wasn't overly impressed and was surprised they have won awards. I tend to only stay at the nicer hostels on my world travels so I was a little shocked when I got here. With that said, there are still some good things associated with this hostel. The good: 1) Great location- It's near the Acropolis,the subway, and many restaurants. It's a popular tourist spot obviously so the restaurants can sometimes pester you to go to their restaurant. If you take a taxi to get to the hostel it can be a little more confusing depending on where your driver drops you off, but the subway would make it super easy to/from the airport. 2)There's a rooftop patio/bar area which is open during the summer months which has a nice backdrop of the Acropolis. It is rather small so don't be fooled by the pictures though. 3)There's a great walking tour setup through the company which is available at their sister property a short walk away. 4)Good size lockers5)The Front desk sells cheap water and beer The bad:1)The rooms weren't nearly as nice as the photos. The photos might have been taking awhile ago and doesn't reflect how the rooms currently look. 2)Not many electrical outlets and the few are in bad spots to utilize 3)Bathroom/shower tends to flood and is very small in the rooms which have it. (not sure on the community ones)4)Free breakfast was very basic and almost not worth wasting your time on. 5)Paying a small fee for towels6)The upstairs common area has a rougher/cumbersome layout. With all that being said, I got the impression there aren't a lot of super nice hostels in the Athens area. This could end up being one of the nicer ones despite the problems.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A must see. roof bar with a stunning view of the acropolis so many hot woman and good looking guys all traveling through athens, easy to mingle and socialist. Recently refurbished, go and have a cold beer during the late afternoon. Fish and chips and the burgers are a must if you pass through athens. The crowed is from all over the world mature and well presented. It's not filled with only backpackers, as many locals as there are visitors. Fun place and lots of happy people. Do not forget to eat the egg bacon bap home made bread that melts in your mouth. Organic eggs and bacon. Wow wow. Sunny side up is the only way to go.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great, affordable, clean accommodation right in the heart of Old Town. Roof bar under the Acropolis is epic and staff super friendly and knowledgable. Cleaner than most hostels I've stayed in Europe. Definitely rate this place!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens Backpackers is a wonderfully located place to stay to see the best of central Athens and all the museums and ruins and nightlife it has to offer. Our room was very clean and warm and so comfortable. Yeah, as everyone says, the breakfast is fresh bread and feta, tomato and cucumber, coffee and tea, but that's pretty much how it is most places. The location can't be beat. The WiFi was good enough though you must log in again pretty much every time you use it. Saves on traffic. So we understand. The staff is quite multilingual and we had zero problems checking in and getting a great rate. We are a couple who travels all the time for business and we would gladly stay here again.Two thumbs up!!!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If your looking for a quiet, reserved hostel this is not for you. If you want a vibrant and lively place where it's easy to make friends, have a beer on the rooftop and watch the sun go down over the acropolis then you found your place. Just around the corner from restaurants and about 5 minutes walk to either the acropolis or the temple of zeus. Metro station two minutes walk away
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: a little pricy but it's a great location. staffs are nice and room is pretty good. bring extra slippers cos the bathroom will become a pool because of clogging, didn't stay for the breakfast though, but the hangout room was nice and easy.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hostel 3 times over the course of 2 weeks solely because of its proximity to the subway lines. Being so close to Acropoli is actually the main selling point of this place. However I don't really think this hostel deserves as much praise as it gets. Mostly because the way they do their pricing is very unpleasant. If you don't book your rooms online then prepare to get a ridiculous rate. But the the thing is, I extended my stay 3 times all on Sundays and got a different price every time. It basically boils down to how nice the person at reception is feeling. The first time I did it I got a rate of €14 because I told them I was going to leave unless it was a good price so I assume they gave me the cheapest available rate to get me to stay. The second Sunday I did it they gave me a room rate of €17.50 and this was asking for a lower price because they initially said it was €19 before I asked them for a cheaper room. I could literally see on their computer screen there were tons of empty beds at the €14 rate but because she didn't want to do the work of changing rooms for me I had to pay the difference. Seriously, charging your guests extra so they convenience You instead of Me is a really big insult. This just led me to extend my stay on the third Sunday online and avoid the reception altogether so I was guaranteed the best price. Facilities are pretty basic for what you're paying for… you'd expect at €20 per night that you'd at least get an ensure bathroom but that's not the case. Be prepared to get your socks wet as well because a single shower will turn the floors into a lake. The kitchen facilities are respectable at least, and wifi is decent outside of the lounge which gets slow quite often for some reason. There's also a roof terrace which is useful for sunny days but the third day in a row they denied us access to the key because "we go up there too often". This hostel has weird ways of doing things it's truly like a bipolar environment when it comes to anything. Breakfast is always the same just a hard boiled egg with bread and vegetables. There's also a computer you can pay to use and printing something costs 10 cents per page which is kinda silly because plenty hostels will just let you print something for free and I only have to pay €11 per night for those ones. But anyways, the one thing I do really appreciate about Athens Backpackers is how easy it is to make new friends and meet people here. This isn't giving the actual place praise though because that totally depends on the type of guests here. If you want to stay here book online every time so you get the best rates because the staff are only helpful when it comes to questions about travel otherwise they're there to nickel and dime you!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From other backpackers hostels that I have visited this wasn't the worst but not the best either. Clean, of course cheap, compaired to what you can find in the centre of Athens, but kind of depressive. No special events or fun.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of hostel is excellent 2 min walk from Acroploi metro station . Staff was friendly and helpful . Rooms are okay poor lighting bathroom gets flooded which was irritating try to get room on higher floor they have balcony . Nice little hangout place next to reception breakfast was okay considering its complimentary . Overall okay place to stay for 2-3 days if you planning to stay longer check out there another property athenes studio new property 5 min walk from athens backpackers
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only stayed here for two nights but I really enjoyed it and felt safe here. The staff were helpful and friendly and the room I stayed in was spacious and clean with an ensuite.This hostel is walking distance from the Acropolis and other attractions, also a 2 min walk from the train station. There are organised events however I didn't attend any of them.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was really lovely. Very clean, with large rooms. The shower does leak onto the floor, but it wasn't really an issue for us. It has a wonderful plated breakfast in the morning with coffee and tea. The wifi was a wee bit slower, but not 90's style. It has a very central location to the Parthenon and some fantastic restaurants. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hostel in Athens for low-but-not-extremely-low-budget solo travelers. Pefrect location (no street noise), large and spacious rooms with comfortable beds and large balconies, great showers, and superb common areas.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only tried out the rooftop terrace. A great budget choice for a beer with a view over the Acropolis. We only visited the rooftop terrace (stayed in another place) but seemed like a nice place to stay as well, with friendly personnel.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can't choose better location, great value for money. Very comfortable beds and not too noisy. The bar at the roof of the building is great! If you travel on your own it's a great way to meet new people.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, clean, friendly stuff, all good! We stayed in a 4 bed dorm with privat bath just for one night but would come back if I need a place to stay in Athens. The rooms and bath are clean with a perfectly working AC. The rooftop bar with the super view of the Acropolis is great to start a fun night out!!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in was easy - though I accidentally turned up to the studios rather than the backpackers, the lady there easily redirected me around the corner. Location was actually fantastic, only a few minutes (barely even that) to the entrance of both the Acropolis (secondary entrance) and the Acropolis museum.Room wasn't anything particularly special, only had I think four/five outlets for six people - not ideal. Shower was fine (though no towel provided!) but lack of a bathmat meant the floor in there was basically always wet. Lockers not quite big enough to fit my bag but plenty big to fit all your important things - you'll need your own lock.Breakfast was tasty but simple (tomato, cucumber, hard boiled egg and bread with oil) with tea and coffee available but almost didn't make it down for the 9:30 AM end time a few days - so early! I also went on the walking tour and despite high hopes it was a bit of a let down. First, it was not free, as I'd expected, especially since our tour guide introduced himself as not legally qualified to run tours. Soon after, we climbed a monstrous hill to follow our guide through a hole in the fence above the Panathenaic Stadium - I'm all for seeing the sights, but I really did think it was going to be legally! We got around to a few different locations in the end, but not without our guide sitting us down to basically lecture at us for at least 20-30 minutes in a few locations. He was hardly focused on just the history too - in the last (very uncomfortable) location, he and one of the people on the tour got into an argument about technology; neither showed any signs of stopping until they were finally cut off by reminding them both that this was supposed to be a tour, not a philosophical debate. Overall - would really not recommend the walking tour, take a different one.The rooftop bar at the backpackers was amazing though - fantastic view of the Acropolis and cheap drinks, made it really easy to meet other backpackers.Overall thoughts on the hostel - great location, good bar, okay rooms and breakfast, not great walking tour.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: Aircon, Location, clean as it could be being old. Cons: Bullied by other guests to turn aircon off and spending my night sweating like a beast even though I booked this hostel on the basis it had aircon. Walking tour wasn't running as advertised. Run down and a bit tatty.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I started my holidays in Athens and as i was travelling alone i decided to stay in a hostel. Athens backpackers seemed to have a great location.After booking i received an e-mail with instructions how to find the hostel in different way of transport, it was very helpful, it was easy to find it this way. Walking distance from the airport bus-stop.The room was clean, the bedsheets too which is not always the case in hostels, the bathroom was ok as well, a lot better than the average. There were only 3 plugs in the room for 6 of us, but we managed pretty well.The location is very good, close to all the main sights: Acropolis, Zeus Temple, Roman Bath, Plaka, etc.The breakfast was the same every day: 2 hard boiled-eggs, some bread, some tomato and cucumber. Not the best. And i didn't have a clean feeling in the kitchen. That was the worst part of it for me.And the best was definately the roof-top bar with Acropolis-view. Magical! They have happy hours every day from 7-8 pm, which is a great opportunity to socialize. You can meet fantastic people from all over the World who you can go out for dinner, or drinks with, or go for sightseeing the next day.The staff is very nice and friendly too!I've had a great time there, thank you!Ps: the pictures were taken with my phone that's why the bad quality
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very helpful friendly staff, and up on the roof top bar you can meet some really cool interesting people, and enjoy an incredible view, fair price and perfect loctation!! Dont hesitate this place is great!
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights on the end of island holiday. Downsides include: no towels, if sharing bathroom ( 1 toilet and shower between 12 people) it always seemed to be wet and dirty from water splashing out of the shower. Breakfast was boiled egg, sliced tomato and cucumber & bread. Tea and coffee available any time of day. Close to the Acropolis, Agora and other sites.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i stayed in the newly opened Studios annex just around the corner. White marble floors, air conditioned spotlessly clean dorm rooms with a mix of male and female young and old, as well as arguably one of the best sites in Athens a minutes walk from the Acropolis metro station and 5 mins walk from the Parthenon which towers over you as you may wine or dine in one of the many local street restaurants or bars in the area. A gem which takes the hostel into a new dimension of comfort and quality and service
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location, Staff helpful and room is quite clean and spacious. Common area was a bit depressing but overall I would certainly recommend this hostel plus it is great value for the money paid. They also help u with cheaper transporation to the airport
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am travelling alone and only managed a few days in this hostel but found it incredibly well located and accommodating. excellent roof top bar (summer only) with amazing views. Also, the hostel is filled with like minded travel enthusiasts both solo and in groups, making it easy to meet new people.
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel is right in the centre of old town, few minutes walk from Acropolis. It has top roof bar with the view of Acropolis - absolutely great feature. The people at the reception were very welcoming and helpful. Staff who served the breakfast was lovely and paying attention to what is needed. The breakfast itself was absolutely delicious.I was in 4bed girls dorm with ensuite bathroom, big lockers (just bring your own padlock or buy one at the reception), comfortable bed and air con (!!!). Wifi was working very good. Hot showers 24/7. Access to bedrooms is secure. You can leave your luggage on the check-out day if you wish to go for a wander. Any valueables can be left at the reception. Highly recommended!!!The only things I was missing - small bedside lamp and more power sockets especially at the top bunk bed level :)))
hotelName:
15    Athens Backpackers
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This attractive Old Town hotel is a few blocks from the busy Monstraki Metro station. The folks at the reception desk spoke English very well, the room was clean, breakfast was extensive and very Greek and the roof-top bar was a pleasant way to spend the evening. At reception, they provided what looked like a clear glass water jug with spigot and small cups. But, as they explained to us, it contained Mastiha, a Greek liqueur made only on Chias Island from the mastic tree. Very tasty and a pleasant surprise! Our next stop was Hydra and we needed to get to the port. The desk arranged a taxi for us - he was right on time, spoke English and got us to the port on time. We highly recommend this excellent hotel.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Awesome breakfast, great view and fabulous rooftop bar. 10/10 will visit again. Handy for the Plaka and acropolis with some excellent tavernas in the square behind
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location wise Hotel Attalos is perfect a couples minutes walk from Monastiraki Square and the countless restaurants in the area around it, around a 15 minute walk to both the acropolis and syntagma Square also which makes it an ideal location for exploring the city.Staff were friendly and helpful as well as the rooms being very clean and the bathroom facilities being decent.Rooftop bar is gorgeous and offers amazing views and is good value as well. We only had the breakfast once but it was plentiful and offered plenty of choice and all tasted good.Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Athens, location is excellent especially for the price of the hotel and rooms and bar are above what you'd expect considering the price also.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Attalos for 3 nights after arriving in Athens. The hotel provides directions on how to reach them by train, which was VERY easy. The hotel is about 3-5 walk from the Monastiraki metro station. From the hotel you can easily explore all of Athens by foot- Monastiraki, Plaka, etc. Breakfast was provided for a fee (we had secured that payment when we made our reservation) and was good and typical (breads, cheeses, meat, yogurt, etc). The room was clean and we had a private bathroom in our room. The only downside was the AC- it worked but was noisy and not very efficient, but it did cool the room down. There is also a roof deck bar with a GREAT view of the Acropolis. Would stay there again and would highly recommend!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Helpful and friendly reception. Very clean. Comfortable beds. Lots of choices at breakfast. Stunning rooftop bar. Overall an excellent choice for central Athens. Just a few minutes walk from the metro stop directly linked to the airport.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with the family for a 2 night flying visit to Athens to take in the main sights including the Acropolis and Museum. The hotel couldn’t be better located for exploring central Athens. The rooms are clean and functional. We weren’t paying 5 star prices and didn’t expect 5 star luxury but everything was very clean and we were very happy with our stay. Pay more if you expect to spend a lot of time in your room but, if like us you are in Athens to see the sights, the room provides a great place to explore.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its a good cheap place in a handy location, I would recommend this only for the roof top terrace... the drinks are a little over priced and you cant take anything you haven't bought there to the terrace, the views are pretty amazing.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights in a quad room. Room was clean and staff excellent. Good breakfast. Great central location. You can walk to any site you want to see in Athens. Great balcony for sitting in the sun or chatting in the evening with beers from the market across the street. Only downside was the room, at some point, was a smoking room and the smell of cigarettes lingered. Not horrible, but was noticeable. Would stay here again
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Efficient air conditioning in the room and excellent free wifi. No tea/coffee-making facilities. No restaurant but there is standard European breakfast at €9 per person. Be warned, there is no bar or refreshments until 4 pm so popping back for lunch is not an option. There is a small computer/TV room with free tea & coffee. However, the water in the flask for tea was only tepid and the 'milk' in the little tubs curdled. All channels on TV are Greek except rwo - BBC World Service and old American crime series. But it's major selling-point is the view of the Parthenon from the roof terrace. Get there after 4pm for drinks and a magnificant view of the Parthenon at as the sun goes down.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel twice on my trip - we went to Mykonos and returned. We had a different room each time and both were nice. The rear room nice and quiet, while the from room was a little nicer but had a little road noise. Both were clean and comfortable and pretty modern. The hotel is about a 2 minute walk from the Monastiraki metro and square where you can find a lot of nice dining. The hotel entrance is easy to miss so I suggest you use google maps to familiarize yourself. The staff was very nice and helpful. There is a grocery store across the street and the rooms had a frig, so if you want cereal for breakfast you are good to go.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent one night at this hotel, but wished we could have been there longer. Their breakfast was one of the best traditional Greek breakfasts that we had during our stay in Greece - and tons of food options. They are unique in that they have the MOST beautiful roof top with an unobstructed view of the Acropolis; especially beautiful at night. They have a bar on the roof top with very reasonably priced drinks (loved the Amstel beer!). Our room was large and very clean; and updated. Shower was a little on the small side; but fine for us. It is only a 20 minute walk to the Acropolis and the Acropolis Museum. The hotel is in the city, so its street is busy, but we heard no road noise. We stored our luggage in the hotel since we got there early in the morning and went to see the sites. The people at the front desk were very charming and helpful. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is dated, but worked well for us. It's in a great location to explore the city, and is very close to a Metro stop that we took to and from the airport. The staff was very nice. Rooms were basic and dated, but we spent most of our time out in the city, so this was fine for us. They were clean and gave us a good home base. We utilized their rooftop bar for a night cap after a long day of exploring. The bar had good prices and a great view of the Acropolis. Our balcony on the 4th floor had a view of the Acropolis if you sat at one side, which was cool.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommended by a Greek friend. Welcoming, family run hotel within walking distance of the Acropolis, 2 blocks from the Flea Market and a multitude of restaurants to choose from. Roof top bar with views of the Acropolis, bar open 4.00pm to 12.mn. Highly recommend this Hotel.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: at first sight it might look like a non descriptive hole in the wall hotel on a very busy athens street. yet this little hotel isn’t so little, great concierge service when you check in . Everyone very helpful in terms of tourist ideas and recommendations, they booked our rental car with ease. The room is comfortable clean and basic. Balcony makes you feel like part of the neighborhood. our cleaner Eva was wonderful in supplying whatever we needed for our room . The rooftop bar is spectacular with amazing views and drinks thanks to Aris, he is great !!! The hotel is a block away from the metro and convenient to the Acropolis and Plaka. it’s great all around. there are cafes on the same block make getting food so easy. love love love this home away from home in Athens.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an excellent hotel in a very convenient location. A short walk to the metro (which gets you to either the port or the airport) The room was clean, the staff helpful and friendly, breakfast was good with lots of selection and the best part - the incredible view of the Parthenon from the rooftop bar.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at Attalos three times. The location is ideal, walking distance to Monistariki, Syntagma square and the Acropolis. And the view from the roof top bar is amazing. The hotel seems to have upgraded some of the rooms but they are still on the small side. It was never a safe area, especially at night but it seems to have deteriorated over the 9 years since we first visited. There are more homeless on the street (some with cell phones which is hilarious). We have never opted for the breakfast, too expensive and there are better choices right nearby. Overall, I love Athens and love that the folks at the hotel remember us from prior visits but if we do make it back to Athens in the future, I will opt for another, safer location
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view from the terrace is an added points to the hotel, bar is located at the roof top so you can enjoy the view with a little Greek wine or beer.Accommodation: When we checked in it was easy and fast. Paid the tax difference up front and they gave us an overview to the room ( lights, keys and all) and they left us alone the whole duration of our stay. Do asked them anything you want- as far a good restaurant, where to go and where not to go and they will tell you. We didn’t have breakfast since we have a early morning excursions. No worries they have a lot of cafe nearby and Everbest( kind of seven eleven for us since it’s everywhere just like in the USA but just all food and coffee with fresh bakery no grocery store) Rooms: It Is basic and clean with all the necessities needed (safety box, in room refrigerator and they give you new bedroom slippers). I just have an issue with the shower curtains- it’s to short that the water goes out and makes the floor in restroom all wet when showering. We were in the 6 floor and we can still hear the people partying and they stay out late! But no worries just close all the window and you won’t hear them. Air condition works really good, I appreciate it a lot since they are having summer weather already. They do have Iron but you need to have the reception sent it to your room or you pick it up. Either way you just have to return it after use.Location: The Best Part!! -40 mints from the airport ( we arranged a car service so I am not sure it the hotel does airport pick up) but you can asked them to get you a cab in the most rediculous times for airport drop off and they will still do it for you- just let them know ahead of time. I know this because we did it at 3:30 am to catch a flight to Santorini. Also know that the charges for evening/dawn pick up is more than the morning/mid day pick up. No Uber or Lyft in Athens or anywhere in Greece.  It’s a 10 min walk from the Acropolis and most of the Tourist attractions and good restaurants. The neighborhood is not very appealing since it is located in a business area but it seem safe. We followed our Car services advice- Just don’t go Left from your hotel. Thanks for the good accomation and keep it up, will definitely come back or recommend you!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff is friendly. Rooms are spotless clean with balconies. Bathrooms have a nice small shower. Hotel is located in "true Athens". 5 mins to a very nice shopping area. Lots of restaurants, even one across the street. Cab service is everywhere. Nice view of the Acropolis from our balcony. I sat outside at night and listened to people playing singing, true neighborhood to get the feel for the city. Beds are comfy. Again, I commend housekeeping for the cleanliness!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Indeed I feared to stay there once again, two years later : my memories were to good to be true and things change so fast nowadays. Elderly US ladies, Dutch team on a wildlife seminars, Asian newly-weds and, yes, quiet early breakfasters. Relief. Sigh. The place was still top-notch and the roof terrace still swinging under the "pantselinos" (Greek full moon). Fresh linen after a rough and most chilly week in Eastern Dodecanese, in moist sheets and tempests, oh, such a treat ! Despite the still narrow reception space and the rather gruff male evening welcome (outbalanced by the beaming cheerful female morning welcome), still smiles, may smiles from floor to floor, such a friendly place to come back to ! Blessings - and don't change anything !
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sadly we only had one night to stay before our island cruise but cannot say enough good things about this little, charming, and damn good value hotel. We arrived (international flights create these situations) hours before check in but the front desk graciously provided a clean, comfortable room and a well needed hot shower before we took our first look at Athens. After a full day and a great dinner - location away from some attractions but close to the Plaka district and great outdoor restaurants. Not sure you can go wrong - scout the menu and get a feel for the atmosphere. For some reason every restaurant we went to in Athens gave us either an unrequested free dessert (amazing) or liquors to end our meal (equally amazing). Back to hotel on the subject of amazing. The view of the Acropolis from the roof is worth the price of admission. Wait until dark and then just enjoy. We actually did our own walking tour the next day and it was disappointing close up so we might suggest the tour first and the night sky later. Breakfast was excellent - sign up when you book you won't regret the decision. We stayed at a more expensive (60% or more) at the end of the stay and though their breakfast was very good not as good ironically. To ,make things even more awesome they held our bags the next day as we did our ancient Athens touring.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite lovely. The roof top bar is a must. Such an amazing views to the city and such a relaxing atmosphere. Breakfast was superb with loads of options. Only downfall for our stay was a particular staff member, who tried to get too cozy with us, and didnt appreciate being told no...
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice stay at this hotel for many reasons! Location: The hotel is located in Monastriaki, walking distance from the metro station (about a 3 minute walk). This was very convenient since that was our main way of getting around the city and there were many wonderful restaurant options at Monastiraki Square. There is a lot of graffiti in this area which made me feel slightly uneasy but as the day went on, I became more comfortable in the area. It seemed rather safe though there is quite a few homeless people on the streets asking for money, which I guess is typical in a city area. Rooms: The room was plain and simple. We were on the first floor with no views and there were no decorations in our room. The bed was very comfortable and the AC worked well. The bathroom was slightly small but exactly what anyone would need. The shower had good pressure and heated water. I did not hear any noise where my room was located. Staff: very friendly and helpful! I hurt my knee during my trip and one of the concierge's always brought me ice to my room to help with my knee. I was very appreciative. Amenities: They have a rooftop bar which is really cool and you have a nice view of the Acropolis! They have a breakfast option but since we were so close to Monastiraki Square, my husband and I figured we would go there to grab breakfast at the many cafes to choose from. Overall, a very good hotel for it's location, comfort, and price!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Attalos is a seven story hotel with a roof bar and garden not far from the Monastaraki Metro station, the Plaka area, and the main historic and archeological sites of Athens. I had arranged my trip so that I had three separate stays totaling 6 nights over a 10 day period, with two side trips in between. I packed a small bag inside my suitcase so that I was able to take the things I needed for the side trips and leave the suitcase with the hotel. Very helpful!I stayed in three different rooms, all quite similar in size and amenities. Even though I was traveling solo, I think that two people could have stayed in the room without too much trouble. Everything worked well in the room, though it took a couple of days' practice to keep the bathroom floor relatively dry when I used the small shower.It's possible to include breakfast in the room rate, which I did. The breakfast is OK, with plenty of choices, but my desire for freshly squeezed orange juice eventually drove me to eat at the excellent Beneth cafe/bakery next door.The roof bar is open until midnight and offers a spectacular view of the Parthenon on the Acropolis. I discovered a laundromat about 3 blocks away, close to Monastaraki, where you can do your own wash or have the attendant do it overnight. That came in handy. There is also an excellent market for fruits and veggies about three blocks north (away from Monastaraki toward Omonia).As you walk along Athinas Street and around the neighborhood, you can see some effects of Greece's decade of economic crisis. There are some homeless people on the sidewalk and lots of graffiti, unfortunate but not dangerous.Would I stay at the Attalos again? Absolutely. It's a good value in an excellent location with a helpful staff.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the attalos hotel in Athens lovely clean well kept hotel staff very friendly and helpful in every way food great was easy to find something for everyone very relaxed room service every day beds were amazing had a great night sleep every night rooftop bar great views and also great prices close to loads of interesting places restaurants and lively markets will defo be staying here again
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a very good central location for Monastaraki and within easy walking distance of the major sites of the city. Despite being on a busy road our room on the third floor was very quiet and we heard no noise. The bed was very comfortable and the room and bathroom looked as if they had recently been done up. It has a roof top bar with amazing views of the Acropolis. Staff were courteous and friendly and were able to give sight seeing advice. We would definitely stay here again if we return to Athens
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in the spring of 2018. It was very good. As we were getting to the hotel by car in the middle of the night, we could see the beautiful backlighted Acropolis from the avenue. It was a nice introduction to the city and to the country itself. The hotel is very well located, close to the main points of Athens, some few meters from Monastiraki. You have to pay attention to get there on foot, as the entrance is not very large and it can be unnoticed as you pass by. Good location for the night and the day. The rooms are simple, but clean and comfortable. The breakfast is very good and well prepared, but we paid it apart from the daily rates and it was not very expensive. We've got a discounted rate, as we booked far in advance and in their website. The staff is very friendly and helpful. When I return to Athens, which surely I want to, I intend to stay here.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a Double or Twin Room with balcony. Location is great, just minutes to Monastiraki. Amenities right at door steps. We had a great view of Acropolis from our balcony. There is even a better view at the roof garden. Room is functional and clean. Shower area very small. Full buffet breakfast served. Good value just for its location, better if you get the view.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a long weekend in Athens having been recommended this hotel by a friend who is a frequent visitors to Athens... what an excellent hotel, perfect for our needs in a central location within walking distance to all the major sites, the staff were friendly and helpful, with good size clean rooms and a decent bathroom with soft towels changed every day, and plenty of hot water. We had a room with a balcony on the 6th floor which had a lovely view of the Acropolis. We very much enjoyed the hotels roof garden bar with its stunning view of the Acropolis, the perfect place for a coffee or drink, and a big thank you to Harri who runs the bar, what a charming, helpful guy who goes above and beyond. We enjoyed the area of Psiri in the evenings which is just behind the hotel, with its tiny back streets, bars and very good tavernas.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was well located a few steps from the subway station and 10 minutes walking from the city center. We stayed in room 702 with a balcony and a view of Acropolis. The rooftop bar was very nice with a great view. The staff was great. The rooms were clean. There was a very big market near by and plenty of places to eat. A nice coffee next door and a pita place across the street. As you enter you can get candies and a drink at the front desk.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly efficient staff, really great location, the bar with view just as good as pictures show,, rooms clean very comfortable and have everything you need - and truly excellent breakfasts! My room had a balcony, also with view of Parthenon. The hotel map of central Athens also exceptionally easy to read! Free coffee in the afternoon, left luggage service on check-out. Fab long weekend thank you
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms very clean. Linens nice. Mattress could be better. We stayed in room 602 with balcony facing street. Acropolis in view. The rooftop deck was nice. Lots of shopping. Food store across the street everything cheap. We bought some wine, beer, olives, cheese, bread, strawberries and chocolate for our evenings on balcony. Very nice staff. Stayed two days before moving on to islands. Photo us view from our balcony.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yet another stay at the Attalos for me, together with friends I had recommended the hotel to. It was a pleasant stay but also lovely to find the hotel rooms had been renovated. They were spotlessly clean as always with good quality linen and soft towels. We had hot water when we wanted it and I had no issue with sleeping. The hotel is conveniently located and the taxi company they recommended for an aiport transfer were friendly and efficient - no arguing about the fare and such other nonsense. The Attalos staff are competent and knowledgeable and I know my friends were happy with our choice. I can still recommend the Attalos and in fact are back in April for another Athens break.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super clean, newly renovated rooms. Very personable and helpful front desk team. Located 150 meters north of Monastiraki Metro station and near tons of cafes. The building is older so the space for the bathroom is a bit tight in some of the rooms, but not overly so. The rooftop bar is nice and it has a great view of the Acropolis, which when lighted at night makes a phenomenal photograph to remember your stay with. I really like this place! I think they are just finishing the renovations, it looks like the 6th floor is still a work in progress as of Feb 2019.The staff really helped out when the ferry taking me to Syros got canceled twice due to gale force winds.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Attalos Hotel as part of a school group booking. The hotel is clean, the breakfast is delicious with a lot of variety, and the staff is amazing!!! My room on the 5th floor had a balcony with a view of the Acropolis and even though it's in the heart of Athens, the room was so quiet. I will definitely be back with my family as this place is in the best central location.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, though a tad dated, served its purpose. For the price and location, it’s a steal- no wonder it’s tough finding availability. Mr Kostas upgraded us to a triple room, since we arrived on Christmas day and we were very pleased with such generous gesture. Room itself is very well maintained and clean. So is the bathroom/toilet.Will we book again? Definitely, if we can find availability!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights ,very smiling helpful reception .nice clean room withe very good towels . Balcony was nice surprise to take that morning sun .Roof terrace was a good view of Acropolis .Excellent location for all walking attractions and main centre of the city.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Attalos Hotel offers the ideal location for exploring the ancient and cultural history of Athens! The view from the rooftop is amazing! Safe, clean, moderately priced and did I mention, the perfect location?!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located with most of the tourist attractions a short walk away. It also has the added benefit of being right by Monastiraki Metro station. We visited in late November. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, the shower was great and the staff were very very helpful indeed. There’s also a great roof terrace with good views of the Acropolis. All in all I’d recommend this place to anyone wanting to be in the heart of Athens.m
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed with our friends for 5 days. We had a wonderful holiday. The hotel is situated so you can walk to Akropolis. The staff are weary friendly and helpful. They have a fantastic rooftop bar with an amazing wiew of the Akropolis. I can truly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel isn't glamorous, but it is very comfortable and clean, the staff are lovely and very helpful, breakfast is good, and the rooftop bar has amazing views. You really can't beat the location either - right in the centre of where you want to be. I would happily stay here again.We were also a large group, and they dealt with our needs well.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a double room with balcony (which, btw, had a pretty awesome view of the Acropolis). Bathroom was smallish but recently renovated with all new fixtures and tiling. Room was quiet at night and we did not hear any noise from the street below. Enjoyed the plentiful breakfast options (included) and wifi connection was flawless. Location is good; heading towards Monastiraki the area felt very safe; heading in the opposite direction perhaps a little less so. Police station is directly across the street so I certainly felt it was a good sign. Staff very very friendly and helpful and there are lots of restaurants and grocers in the immediate area. The hotel has rooftop terrace with a bar (not really any meal service). TIP: If arriving from the airport, the hotel does offer to arrange a taxi for you for a few extra Euro. We didn’t take advantage of the hotels offer on arrival in Athens and experienced an incredibly reckless taxi ride in from the airport. Paid the extra Euro when we were leaving and was extremely happy with the professional driver, spotless taxi and informative conversation.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located within 3-7 mins walking distance to places like Monastiraki Square, Psiri, Ermou. It's also walkable to the Acropolis Museum (about 15 mins). So much so that we could go out in the morning, explore and come back in the afternoon to rest when the sun was very hot, and head back out. There's a supermarket just opposite (about 1 min walk) and plenty of eateries nearby. We opted for breakfast with the room and had no regrets! We're vegetarians but had plenty of options to choose from - dried and fresh fruit, spinach and cheese pies, croissants, Greek yoghurt, cereals, coffee, tea and juices. Rooms were small but clean and staff were friendly and helpful. There's an open area on one of the floors where you have access to computers with internet and printers. Tea and coffee were also available in this room until 4PM. Overall a great experience staying in this hotel, and if ever we come back to Athens, will definitely stay here!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second stay at the Attalos was as good as the first. Great location near Monastiraki. Very short walk to the metro, close to the Parthenon, Plaka and great restaurants and bars (including the famous Bairaktaris!). Clean rooms, friendly helpful staff and a good value breakfast. Possibly the best feature of the hotel is the incredible view from the rooftop bar. One of our favourite hotels anywhere.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location superb for transport , street life and view of the acropolis.Personal service in this small hotel: very helpful staff.Good value: did not tell my wife how little I had paid for such a hotel!
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights and this hotel was perfect! A couple blocks from Monastiraki station means 1 Metro (Blue) from airport and 1 Metro (Green) to Piraeus ferries are just steps away. As is Psirri, for great dining options. Terrific rooftop bar/patio (can buy drinks there or take your own up) with views of Acropolis and sunsets! Arrived prior to check-in and our bags were stored safely while we explored the neighbourhood.Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Attalos Hotel is situated in a great location in Athens... only 5 minute wall to Monistriki Square with the Metro right there, plenty of restaurants, shopping plus quite a number of the main ruins are easily within walking, We also walked to the Acropolis and Museum. We only had one night in this area, and had no concerns about our safety whatsoever. The hotel is basic, but has a bar/lounge on the roof terrace with a great view of the Acropolis. Being from Canada we only had issues trying to recharge our phones.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here twice in October 2018. Rooms are small but comfortable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Very close to all kinds of restaurants/bars etc. Rooftop lounge/bar has a great view of the Acroplios. Good Wi-Fi and a great breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a slightly above average hotel in a great location BUT with very helpful staff and clean rooms. I wouldn't mind staying here again. It is a good hotel for a 1-3 nights stay and the price is reasonable.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel location is perfect, the bed is so comfortable, the breakfast is delicious and the coffee is great, everything is clean. A személyzet kedves, segítőkész, A hotel elhelyezkedése kiválló, az ágy nagyon kényelmes, a reggeli és a kávé nagyon finom, minden tiszta.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The room itself was fine and clean although the bathroom was a little small. The best part about this hotel is the location. It's a short walk to the Metro, the Acropolis and Plaka where there are a number of bars and restaurants. The rooftop bar is also amazing especially at night when the Acroplis is lit up. For short trips this hotel is ideal.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights in late September. As others have noted, the Attalos Hotel is in a great location, a few hundred meters from the bustling Monastiraki square, and only steps away from the metro station. Very close to dozens of outdoor cafes and souvenir shops. Easy walk to Syntagma Square (via Ermou) and to the ancient Agora and accessible to the Acropolis. The rooms are basic, but comfortable. We had a balcony with a view of the Acropolis, which can also be seen in a direct view from the rooftop bar. The breakfast buffet is more than adequate. The service we received from the staff was outstanding. We especially appreciate the help from Yiannis and Paulos, who researched and advised us on the best way to get to the city of Megara to visit a distant cousin. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for five days at the beginning of October. The hotel is quite modest from the outside, but is larger than it looks. Our room was a good size, with high ceilings, and very clean. The bed was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was renovated and had a modern shower and there was lots of hot water. We were travelling with our baby son, and the crib we requested was new and set up waiting for us when we arrived - the hotel also provided a set of towels for him, which was thoughtful of them. The room was large enough to store our pram as well. The sound proofing was not very good, and we could hear quite a bit of noise from the corridor, but on the whole the room was very good. The lifts were small but adequate. The hotel has a rooftop bar, which has panoramic views of the Acropolis and the rest of the city, and is a nice place to relax. The best feature of the hotel is its location. It is easy waking distance to the major archaeological sites, the Plaka, and Syntagma Square, and not very far from the national museums. Staying here made it easy for us to pace ourselves with the baby, visiting one site and then returning to the hotel for lunch before heading out again. I am very pleased with our decision to stay at the Hotel Attalos.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As will have been mentioned before some of the rooms are dated and the bathroom is small, however this did not detract from our stay, which we loved; if you’re happy with these then there will be no negatives here.The location is great being only a minute or two from the metro and Monastraki Centre, no more than 10 minutes from most attractions and restaurants, and only about 20 minutes from the Acropolis.Our room was good with plenty of storage space, bed was firm and comfortable, the air conditioning was excellent and the bathroom was adequate and has been updated. The breakfast was also good with cereal, pastries, cakes, eggs, cheese, meat, fruit, toast etc. don’t think you’d go away hungry.The real bonuses are the rooms’ balcony with great views and of course the rooftop bar, with not only stunning views of the Acropolis but reasonably priced drinks too.I have to mention the staff here, reception staff were extremely helpful and catered for any request we had. The maids keep the rooms and hotel very clean, which is very important.If you’re not expecting a 5 star hotel in what is a 3 star hotel you will not be disappointed here which we fully recommend.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite it's rather inauspicious frontage and reception, this hotel really is a gem! The room was comfortable, with an excellent bed, air-con and TV. The bathroom was newly renovated with a great shower - a rarity in many hotels. The breakfast was OK and reasonably priced. But the real star of the show was the roof top bar, with spectacular views of the Acropolis - and some delicious cocktails! As others have said, tea and coffee making facility in the room would have made this perfect.
hotelName:
16    Attalos Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great area in the tourist district, rooms are clean but small and the breakfast was good. We were on the 6th floor and could hear people dragging furniture around on the roof top bar and then heard people as they left the bar at night coming down the stairs (the elevator is TINY). Not sure if the rooms on other floors are as noisy.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights before going out to the islands and then 1 night when we returned. Both times the room has been good. Quiet. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good, and you can get tea and coffee any time. The rooftop bar is beautiful to go to in the evening and watch the sunset with the Acropolis. The central position to most things is a great bonus.Recommend
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently had to cancel my trip due to unexpected injury that requires surgery. The hotel has been kind enough to allow me a free cancellation. Thank you for helping me redcue my stress. I look forward to my future visit!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to Greece and celebrating a special anniversary arrived around 9:30am after a long flight from Toronto Canada. At that time did not expect a room to be ready but we were very wrong!! Eva at reception stored our luggage and directed us to go to the restaurant for coffee and breakfast with hotels compliments!! On returning after breakfast our room was ready on the 5th floor. A little tight in the elevator but this actually was very much in the character of the hotel and area. Our window in the room looked directly out to the splendid view of the Acropolis. Buffet style breakfast offered a very wide selection of hot/cold items with an excellent choice of Greek meat etc. Eva and Semeli (excuse if name wrong) were exceptional in advising places to visit and directions etc. I should mention that when we first entered the room there was a tray of Greek sweet desserts and a bottle of wine with a card of congratulations on our anniversary. A wonderful warm welcome. The room was quite spacious with closet space. Bathroom very very clean. The entrance area however was a little dark and although there was alight it could be lot brighter.All in all I highly recommend this hotel for it's great service,views,prices and general location within Plaka. We were there for 4 nights from May27-31 2019.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I strayed at this hotel for 2 mights whilst in Athens. The hotel is pretty basic, the service is minimal but the location is terrific. If you can put up with a bit of discomfort this place is located in the heart of Plaka and it's colse (walking distance) to everything you want to see and experience in Athens.
