One more thing: the rooftop offers one of the most magnificent view of the Acropolis, really stunning. It's not my type of hotel but I would stay there again next time for the enormous convenience.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a great location, amazing view of the Acropolis and the staff are great! We had 3 rooms, with one of the rooms we could hear a little bit of noise from outside early in the mornings and our door was a little tricky to open and close sometimes,Other then that our stay was good. Overall it was a good hotel and made it easy for us to explore Athens. Would stay here again!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and close walk to everything. Breakfast buffet is wonderful. Rooftop at night is relaxing and can see the Acropolis unobstructed. Room was clean and accommodated the 3 of us traveling together.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Plaka Hotel to start off our trip to Greece and what a fantastic start! We were greeted with great service, not to mention the hotel was able to accomodate an extra person with only 3 weeks notice! Rooms extremely cleaned and serviced daily, the staff were fantastic in helping us out with anything! Breakfast was good! The location of this hotel is fabulous! Walking distance to the Parthenon, shopping, parliament! We didn’t take transport anywhere! Not to mention the rooftop bar with a stunning view of the Acropolis! The highlight for myself was the “travel buddy” that is found on your room desk. It is a little smart phone loaded with internet, google maps and sightseeing things to do all free and at the click of a button! We took our travel buddy with us when we went exploring and thought it was absolutely fantastic especially since we hadn’t purchased SIM cards yet! The staff are there to go above and beyond in getting you to make the most of you stay! There is a staff member who greets you at breakfast and offers to help you organise your day and helps you with any questions you may have and offers some fantastic advice! Highly recommend the Plaka hotel for anyone coming to Athens!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this hotel was perfect!!! Great staff, location (so close to Syntagma Square, Monastiraki Square, Roman Agora, Anafiotika, Acropolis and Acropolis Museum), breakfast (best breakfast we've had anywhere), rooftop view of the Acropolis and surrounds, very clean room and good internet - I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Athens!!!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed at this wonderful budget hotel in the heart of Plaka in Athens.It included a lovely breakfast and was within walking distance to all the main attractions.Bonus is this lovely hotel has a rooftop bar with a close up view of the acropolis Highly recommend this hotel, staff friendly and they have a luggage storage and will accomodate strange arrival and checkout times.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really loved the charm of this small hotel in the Plaka district. They gave me a small bottle of wine and cold water when I checked in which was very welcome. I have never had to use a hotel's laundry service before but it was done the next day and everything smelled very nice. It was 9 euro for as much as you can stuff in a bag both wash and dry. The rooftop bar is so much fun! I went up there in the morning and at night and it is a very comfortable spot with outdoor couches. The bar is open from 5pm to 11pm. The breakfast has TONS of variety both savory and sweet and I enjoyed it very much. You are just one or two streets over from Adrianou shopping street. I was upgraded to an Acropolis view room.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So many aspects to recommend. Location, breakfast, PR/concierge service and of course the rooftop bar which seems to good to be true but it is. Very pleasant young Barman up there who also deserves mention for his good natural service.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived at the Plaka Hotel and stayed two nights then came back yesterday for three nights.It is so central to everything. The room is only big enough for me although there is a double bed.The breakfast has good variety and enough to keep me going during the day. Staff are very pleasant and helpful.All in all a comfortable central hotel. Recommended
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was very nice. The rooms are small but Athens is a tight place hence the small lift inside. This didn’t affect us at all on our stay. Room was quiet with good air conditioning.The hotel is close to all the main attractions which are comfortably within walking distance. Plenty of good restaurants around the area.Breakfast buffet was really good each morning. Quite a large spread which should satisfy most people. Rooftop view is really nice of Acropolis and the rest of Athens.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are clean very dark rooms, extremely small lift 2 people with luggage only. Staff are very friendly and helpful. No tea or coffee in rooms, only in dining area but the close it at 530pm would of liked a coffee later in the night. Rooms are cleaned too late in the afternoon. Ours wasn't cleaned as we were napping. Great area walking distance to most areas. Buffet breaky ok it filled the spot.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in a room with a partial view of the acropolis. Room wasn't large, but was clean. Staff were efficient and accommodating. Breakfast was good, and they even served a modified version before 6.30 for those with early check out. The position in the Plaka with an easy walk to Monastiriki and the Athenian agora. Acropolis was about 1 km away.Plenty of restaurants in all directions within minutes of the hotel. My only issue was the tiny lift which could only take 2 ppl and luggage at a time. Fortunately that did not affect our checkout, but it could be an issue with groups of people.I'd recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Plaka is SO convenient to so many sights and interesting neighborhoods in central Athens. it seemed virtually everything was a 15-20 minute walk, plus the metro is nearby too.Comfortable, modern rooms, which were very clean and well appointed. Great breakfast, good selection, pleasant room and good service. The rooftop and bar with Acropolis views was amazing. The staff is very efficient and good. We found some to be more welcoming and helpful than others,I would stay again and encourage others to do so.We left our windows open the first night. Be aware there is a church nearby with bells, every hour....
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very central location, for visiting ancient Athens, shopping the old streets and local restaurants. The staff was very helpful and eager to help improve the stay. There is a rooftop bar and seating to enjoy magnificent views of the acropolis. The room was spacious and the beds were comfortable. The only demerit was sound in the halls and adjoining rooms. Although this seems pretty common for mid-priced European. The best part of the hotel was the breakfast buffet. It was by far the best breakfast buffet we have had in all of our European travels.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were fortunate to stay here for an evening prior to leaving to Mykonos in the morning. The room was incredible and the rooftop bar with the view can’t be beat. The staff were very hospitable and accommodating and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here even if it was just for a night. When we come back to visit Greece, and we will come back, we will choose to stay here!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off - you cannot get a better located hotel! Just one road over from the main shopping district and minutes from the Acropolis, Hadrian's Arch, The Temple of Zeus, the Ancient Agora, Syntagma Square and Monastriaki Square. You could not be closer to everything! Was so nice to be able to pop back to the hotel during the day for a break or to drop items off and know you weren't having to do a big detour to do so.We arrived at night, the staff were so welcoming and helpful. We had been upgraded to a Acropolis view room - what a view! We also took a trip up to the rooftop and it is such a spectacular unobstructed view of the Acropolis!The room was a lovely size and very comfortable. There is a small market next door and a supermarket opposite so very handy for getting any items needed for the room. There are plenty of options at breakfast. I am a vegan but still found options I could eat.Highly recommend this hotel - it has everything you need, is comfortable and the location makes it simply the best.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a great acropolis view (if you book it) that I recommend. Also, the views from the roof at night are quite relaxing. The breakfast is good with many options. The staff are extremely nice and helpful, assisting with bookings and options. One woman even talked to us about food and restaurants for about 10 minutes and we really enjoyed it! They offer laundry for 10 euros per bag which is good, it saved us going to the laudromat for probably about the same cost.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a three star hotel with excellent location. Its just a km away from all the famous ancient buildings and sights and walking distance to Monastiraki (fleas markets, lively area with cafes, bars, shops) and Syntagma Square (to see the change of guard that happens every hour).The best services provided by the Hotel which really stands out are :- all rooms come with free handphone and free charges for you to carry and use google maps to explore the city without getting lost. I find it very useful because you can easily lost your way when you wonder in many small alleys and pathways.- cool food and drink are available at all times. You can get something to eat in the hotel any time without charge.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really loved this hotel. The staff were friendly, the location was just brilliant. Walking distance to almost everything. You have access to a sundry shop which is right below, souvenier outlets (tons of them), churches, coffee outlets, shopping district. I would say everything!Room was very clean, house keeping was on time. This hotel was just spot on.!Thank you so much
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was PERFECT ! Amazing staff , location ,lovely breakfast and breathtaking view on Acropol from the roofterrace.They look after the guests to make sure that everything is ok and you feel like home. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED !
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plaka is a great hotel for a short stay in Athens. Good location for walking to good restaurants and shopping. Be sure to ask for a room with a view and away from night life noise. Great breakfast buffet!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great spot for short stay in Athens but make sure you request room with view. The rooms on the street side are noisy. We had 4 rooms and the 2 rooms without acropolis view had lots of noise until midnight. We were all on 4th and 5th floor.Other than that the breakfast had lots of choices and staff pleasant.The rooftop bar view of acropolis can’t be beat!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel as I have booked it many times for my clients (I'm a travel agent) and has heard great things.The rooms are clean, (dispite ONE day one of the cleaners must have been smoking whilst cleaning).The beds are very comfortable and the staff are super helpful. At breakfast, a lady will come around asking how everything is and help with any day tour planning.The 24hr reception is good for those arriving on late flights like us.The highlight was the rooftop bar with stunning views of the Acropolis.The hotel is walking distance to everything!!!!!! Will continue booking my clients to this hotel. Thank you for a great stay.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the middle of the center of teh city: only 20 minutes walking from the entrance to the Acropolis archeolofgical site and the Acropolis Museum.Only 10 minutes by foot to the ancient Greek Agora.The hotel serves breakfast but no lunch neither dinner. No reason to worry, lots of restaurants in 5 minutes walking distance.The metro and bus stop (to go to the airport) on Syntagma square is at only 10 minutes by foot.Nice and clean bedrooms, some with view on the Acropolis, Good breakfast.Very friendly and helpful staff. They give good and accurate information about sightseeing and restaurants.The rooftop bar has a magnificent view over the old city, including the Acropolis. The elevator doesn't go up till the rooftop, just the last floor of bedrooms.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and were pleased with all aspects. The room was comfy and clean with a very good, hot shower; the choice at breakfast was excellent and the staff friendly. We were particularly impressed that a customer services person, Eva, came to speak to people at breakfast time to see if we needed any help or information. She was great!However, the unique selling point of the Hotel is its location: brilliantly situated for access to transport links and many of the classical sights. We had a room with a view of the Acropolis which was magical: my partner got very emotional when she first entered the room and saw it!There was some renovation going on during our stay but a polite note was left in the room, the workmen were very obliging when we walked by but it did mean that occasionally we had to wait a while for the lift.The hotel had been recommended to us by friends and we wouldn't hesitate to do the same.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: More than adequate. Very helpful staff. You can walk to anything in the city worth seeing from here. Be sure and get a room with the view of the Parthenon Certainly lots of hotels with this view but I think this is a great price point.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location, very clean, many options for breakfast, very helpful & professional staff. Bit noisy with the wooden floors. Good sized rooms, modern. Very happy with the choice of staying there..
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in August and our first experience when we got there was realizing my husband had lost his passport between the airport and the hotel (think it was left on the plane) everyone at the Plaka hotel was super amazing and immediately helped us call the US embassy and figure out what we needed to do. We were super jet lagged and frustrated and the front reception was so incredibly helpful to us. We ended up having to stay one more day in Athens to get a passport and the hotel was able to arrange for one more last minute night stay and even was able to keep us in the same room so we didn’t have to move all our luggage. This was a huge relief to a stressful situation and we were able to enjoy Athens. The rooms are basic but very comfortable. Water from the shower got everywhere and one day after the cleaning crew had been there I no longer had a shaving razor. So that was weird haha. But overall our stay was great and you can’t beat the amazing rooftop bar and views of the Acropolis!I am a travel professional in the US and I sent clients to this hotel all the time. Great location, great value, wonderful service and fantastic roof bar!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our 2 night stay. Roof top view is spectacular. Central location brilliant. Rooms clean and quiet. Breakfast was terrific and use of breakfast room all day with free tea coffee etc.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed several days with a group of 6 and really liked the very good location of the hotel. Good breakfast and friendly staff made the stay comfortable. The view from the rooftop is great but we didn't used it a lot as there is so much to do in the vicinity of the hotel.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Plaka Hotel for 3 days. It's a small hotel with an amazing rooftop bar! The most relaxing time of our 11 day trip were the evenings we sat in the comfy bar chairs and admired the view!The rooms were very nice and well cleaned. The staff was extremely helpful. Buffet breakfast was served each morning and the hotel is within walking distance of a LOT of the places we visited. I definitely recommend this place - although the elevator is really, really small.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Plaka Hotel is centrally located. Seriously. If you wanted to, you can walk up to the Acropolis. The view from the rooftop bar and garden is wonderful even on a cold blustery winter's day or night. The breakfast is wonderful! The staff are pretty nice as well! From the hotel, you can walk to the Roman Agora, Ancient Agora, Syntagma Sq and Monastiraki. Ermou (shopping district) is just one street over. Up around Syntagma, you can access Hadrian's Arch and the temple of Zeus. All within walking distance of this little hotel. And downways, towards Monastiraki, Hadrian's library is there. You will not go hungry here as restaurants abound within turns and seconds of this place. But the best... there is an AB grocery store right across. Whatever you had forgotten, get there! Plus some snacks and if lazy... food... The room we were given was pretty nicely appointed. Large in consideration of European standards.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Athens with another couple and stayed at Plaka Hotel over the New Year.The hotel is in an excellent position near lots of restaurants and tavernas, very close to a lot of the ancient sites, and also very close to good Metro links.The amazing Eva gave us good advice and really helped us to make the most of our stay.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The hotel was clean, had great amenities, including generous breakfast, and very helpful staff. Our room was comfortable and quite generously sized for European standards. The view of the acropolis from our room was also great, can't get much closer and awe inspiring than that. We got our room at a rate less than $100CAD a night which is a steal for what it offered, I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 7 nights (4, then 3) here, and it worked out wonderfully for us. Check in was easy. The gentleman at the desk recommended a restaurant to us the first night -- and we went back two more nights! Right down the street '' Kitpo." Just relaxing, outdoor, peaceful and good, reasonable food. Our hotel room was very comfortable -- we only heard one group come in quite late and they were not making an effort to be quiet, so won't blame the hotel. We loved breakfast and the gal, Eva, who wandered around helping guests with their day plans -- really a wonderful service. She also managed to hook us up with other guests who were heading to the same cruise we were getting on -- we shared a hired driver to Piraeus because the taxis were on strike. We walked everywhere from this hotel. It's very centrally located and in the heart of all the happenings. We traveled north one night and they kept our suitcase in storage until we returned. Also a terrific service at no charge. The day we left to travel north, we had to leave the hotel around 7:30. One guest below us complained to the desk that we were being loud. We were surprised since we'd been there 4 nights already and had been getting up even earlier, no problems, but the desk gentleman said not to worry. After we'd had such a terrific stay, we didn't want to leave having caused the hotel any problems, but they were very nice and didn't make us feel badly. We would certainly return to the Plaka Hotel...oh, and the rooftop view is amazing!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for five nights. Nice clean modern room. A bit small but cozy and a nice modern shower and bathroom. TV flat screen and safe. Lovely friendly helpful staff. Very well situated in the heart of Plaka very close to all the major historical sites. Nice breakfast and free tea and coffee all day. Surrounded by restaurants and shops. Five minutes walk to Monastiraki Station. Great value. Thank you
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was perfect for historic sites and shopping. Easy walking distance. The service was outstanding, very attentive. I really enjoyed the cleanliness and setup of the room as well. The rooftop view is excellent.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent place to stay in the shadow of Acropolis. This well located hotel has diligently furnished rooms and the staff is ever smiling and extremely helpful. The roof top view, especially in the night is mesmerizing and one does feel standing in the lap of goddess Athina. The property is walking distance from most of the city attractions and has surrounded by the city hub. A place highly recommended on my list.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a fantastic location-very close to the Acropolis and the bustling Plaka and Monastiraki. The rooftop view of the Acropolis is superb. We enjoyed the view from there while having a drink from the bar there.The staff are very friendly and helpful and well-trained.The room we had was small but clean and quiet. The breakfast was excellent with a great choice, including hot and cold food.There is a beautiful staircase here and 2 computers with a printer if you need this. The front desk staff were particularly helpful and nothing was too big a problem.The value for such a location was the best we experienced in Athens.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed at the Plaka Hotel for three nights last weekend. We were in Athens for the Marathon. The hotel was great - rooms were spacious and had use of a fridge and safe. The bathroom was modern. We were in room 202 and it had a small balcony with a side view of the Acropolis. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast was fabulous - lots of breads, cakes, fruit and yoghurt. Tea and coffee available all day. The staff were incredibly friendly, and even allowed us to keep our room for an extra hour on our last day to await our transfer car. They also arranged for early breakfast on the Sunday morning for the marathon runners. Location is perfect. Near lots of restaurants and 'proper' shops but also very close to tourist shops and bars. There was not much noise (some building works early from next door but only on the Saturday and from about 8am which wasn't too bad). We walked everywhere because the hotel is so centrally located, but it's also near some main metro stations if you need to use them. Athens is beautiful. And the Plaka hotel would be a great choice for your stay. The view from the roof is breathtaking. One thing, our bathroom flooded the first time we used the shower. Didn't the next couple of times so unsure why this was. The showers are cubicles just placed on the floor in the corner of the bathroom, so may just need resealing. It wasn't enough of an inconvenience that I wouldn't return.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the heart of the Plaka yet quiet. Not a large hotel, so be sure to reserve well in advance.Staff was extremely helpful, particularly Eva. She went out of her way - walked a friend to a nearby travel agency - to be helpful.Room was of decent size, well-equipped, clean and comfortable.They provide coffee, tea and biscuits in the breakfast room all day.The included breakfast was quite nice. Everything we needed.Many of the rooms (not ours) and the rooftop bar have a stunning view of the Acropolis. Spend as much time on the rooftop as you can. No need to buy a drink but the view will get better the more you drink.The picture below was taken on the last night of our stay from the rooftop.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reading the previous reviews, I can only add my whole hearted agreement: perfect location in the Plaka, wonderful Rooftop Bar to sip ouzo and view the Acropolis, great breakfast to start the day and Eva, the concierge who gives very helpful travel hints/suggestions to the guests during the breakfast hours, She knows the guests and was a big help in arranging a driver for a group of us to Piraeus on a day when a taxi strike was imminent.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The absolutely best part of this hotel is the rooftop garden/bar overlooking the Acropolis. It was magical to sit up on the comfortable couches at the end of the day, share a drink and experience the sights. Several nights we could also hear nearby live music. I would return to this hotel again specifically for this feature. This hotel is located in a great area. You are right in the heart of Plaka shopping district. There are a few metro stops within a ten minute walk to get you on a variety of lines. All the Athens sights are within a comfortable walking distance. Breakfast was okay. The room can get crowded at peak times, with tables close together. There wasn't a huge variety, but food was good quality. It was fantastic that the breakfast room was open throughout the day for free coffee/hot chocolate and cookies. Our room had a very comfortable bed. Our room was small, but didn't feel crowded. The bathroom only had a shower, but it was a large and comfortable size. Water pressure was the best we experienced during our trip. The staff was hit or miss. Some of the staff acted like we were inconveniencing them by asking simple questions and were very curt with answers. However, others were fantastically helpful and would follow up the next day to see how we'd liked the events we asked for help with. I would definitely return to this hotel on our next visit to Athens, as the rooftop view was the best I saw in Athens.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was in Athens on business last week and stayed in Plaka Hotel. THE perfect location to stay in Athens. So comfortable and quiet. Superb breakfast and lovely staff who couldn't do enough to help. BUT folks! The view from the roof-top bar is breathtaking! I could have stayed there ALL night EVERY night. Perfect view of the acropolis. Magical by day and even more so by night! Hope to return to Athens again VERY soon and I will definitely be staying in Plaka Hotel! Keep up the good work, folks! Ye are doing a great job!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for one night on the 8th November.The hotel is in great location and the staff were so friendly and helpful.The view from the rooftop was just spectacular, and the lady handling the bar service on the rooftop was excellent. You couldn't stay in a better location.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Currently, I am staying in Plaka Hotel Greece. The location is very convenient, it's close to everything, including restaurants, souvenir shops and attractions. Also, the room is including free breakfast, which is simple but lovely. Don't miss out the bar in roof, you can see the most beautiful view of Athens there!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights at The Plaka Hotel in Ocrober 2018. We were so happy that we chose this hotel. The location is excellent. Plaka is right at the foot of the Acropolis and is easy walking to anywhere. The hotel room was very clean and a joy to stay in. We had the Acropolis view right from our hotel window - it was amazing! There is a rooftop lounge/bar where you can sit, relax and enjoy the amazing view. Every morning you are treated to a huge breakfast buffet with everything that you could want - from eggs, bacon, sausage, and breads to yogurt, fruit, and juices. And I can't say enough about the hotel staff, everyone was so friendly and helpful. The cleaning staff greeted us each morning when we saw them, the kitchen staff was friendly. This is just the kind of place where you want to stay. We will be back to Athens, and we will stay at The Plaka again!
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Plaka hotel for 4 nights.It is in the middle of Plaka, very close to train station. Comfortable beds, split system aircon, excellent view from the rooftop gardern/bar. Staff are friendly and breakfast is very good. There is no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms but they are available at reception level for free so you can have a nice capuchino anytime during the day until 5pm with biscuit. Desktop computer with printer can also be used to do your airline checkin etc. Plaka is the most vibrant area in Athens and this hotel is in the middle of it while the rooms are very quite to provide good nights of sleep.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Plaka for five nights in October 2018. We paid for a room with a view of the Acropolis. It was worth it. It is within easy walking distance of Monastiraki Subway station. The room is large enough and the bed is comfortable. In each Tom there is a 'Handy'(a mobile phone preloaded with maps). We found this invaluable in our walks around Athens. The Customer Service Manager greets each guest at breakfast and asks how they may help you. I've stayed at five star hotels which do not give this level of service.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in room 411 on our final 2 days in Athens.Firstly, the staff were wonderful. They are always inquiring about your stay and if they can be of assistance.Great location. So convenient to all the main tourist sites, shops and restaurants.Nice breakfast and a great view of the Acropolis from the rooftop.The room was clean and of a good size. We llove the quiet air conditioning. But a few things about the room need mentioning: the window handle needs repairing and there’s a hole in the bathroom door which was roughly patched up.But overall, it’s a great stay.
hotelName:
17    Plaka Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love voyaging and having a pleasing space to stay all through my escape is a noteworthy assistance for me to capitalize on my development. I visited Greece and stayed in InnAthens, the hotel is wonderful with open staff. I worship the spot, it has been my safehouse when I was in the hotel. It's blessed that the hotel is close various diners, recreational stops and strip malls. I should need to stay in InnAthens next time I visit Greece.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is nice but could be great.Rooms were comfortable in terms of the bed and look quite modern and spacious however were not very practical due to the curtains interfering with the small desk space, the bathroom having a non central mirror so it can only be accessed by one person at a time, not being able to access the cupboard space, fridge, safe or full length mirror whilst the bathroom door is open and there is no kettle or tea bags etc without arranging through reception and handing it back after each use. The mini bar consisted of 2 small bottles of water but only on the first day. Unfortunately breakfast was underwhelming and not something we would recommend.Having said all this the staff were friendly and worked hard to welcome us to the hotel.Overall a reasonable hotel, in great location within the Plaka District and a lovely courtyard to relax in.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here at the beginning of our trip and then in another hotel at the end of our trip. We liked this hotel much better. Our last hotel was one of those fancy luxury hotels which was ok but we liked InnAthens so much better because the people were friendly, the whole experience was much more personal, and it was very comfortable in a great location. They even arranged for a taxi to take us to the port and since it was early, they packed up a breakfast for us to take with us! This hotel felt so much more welcoming and friendly than the generic stay you would get at a chain hotel. If you want a more special memory of where you stay in Athens, pick here. You'll have fonder memory. Did I mention that they also have a great wine bar downstairs?
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In(n)Athens was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff were so wonderful and helpful as well as answered any questions or concerns my family or I had. The rooms were excellent as well! They were very roomy and modern. My family and I booked a room for three and we never once felt smushed together. Also, I cannot gush enough about the food. The complementary breakfasts were better than some of the restaurant breakfasts we had and the mini croissants were to DIE for! The location was great as well. About 15 minutes to the base of the Acropolis, 10 minutes to the Temple of Zeus, and about 7 minutes to the historic Plaka Area (all walking). Honestly, there is nothing bad I could say about this hotel. It fit our needs perfectly and my family and I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in the central part of Athens but doesn't want to break their wallet to do so. 10/10 would stay at In(n)Athens again.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 2 couples visiting Athens for 4 days prior to a cruise around the islands. We booked 2 queen rooms at the InnAthens overlooking the city which is located within a 15-20 minute walk to the Acropolis and ancient historic area of Plaka including Temple of Zeus and the ancient agora. Very clean, comfortable room with a lot of storage and a spacious bathroom. Safety deposit box located in the room and bottled water provided. Included is a fantastic breakfast with fresh fruit, pastries and made to order omelets and you could eat inside or in the outdoor courtyard. The multilingual staff were all very friendly and went our of their way to make us feel welcome. Snacks and sandwiches are available to purchase throughout the day. We had and early morning tour and they provided us with a sack breakfast to take with us. Plenty of other restaurants and shopping within a short walk. We’d definitely go back.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: location is great for central Athens, just right the corner of Syntagma Sq and the metro; the courtyard is great for breakfast, work and lounging; buffet breakfast is varied and plenfiful - no hot dishes, but enough other things to choose from, including fresh fruit, AND you can ask the staff for a proper bar espresso (i.e. you don't have to drink the watered down filter coffee from the counter); 24hr reception (which is great when your late ferry is 3hrs late); good wifi.Cons: I am a light sleeper; our windows (possibly all rooms do?) opened onto the courtyard mentioned above and unfortunately I was awoken both nights by people talking and laughing there at various night hours. Closing the windows and turning the A/C on helps only up to a point, so I'm guessing the windows aren't fully soundproof, and so I needed earplugs. However, traffic is not audible at night.Other: we stayed in a suite for 2,5 nights (given our v. late arrival). It was spacious, but somewhat bare (furniture at a minimum, no decor) and not exactly uninviting, although the Nespresso machine was a plus. As I had to work while my husband was at a conference, I prefered to do so in the courtyard. I was surprised by lack of room service on day one, but attributed that to our later than planned arrival. The room was cleaned after that, although I noticed the bottles of water in the minibar weren't replaced (tap water in Athens is drinkable, but it's not exactly tasty). However, all the staff members we had direct contact with (receptionists x 2, bar/restaurant staff) were helpful and friendly. I might stay in this place again if I needed something functional for central Athens, but not for the atmosphere.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel with a wonderful proximity to the attractions. For me a hotel has 2 purposes; to keep our stuff safe in close proximity to attractions and for a good night sleep. Problem: 1. Rooms facing the city have absolutely no soundproofing. You might as well be sleeping on the balcony because you can hear all the traffic. If you're a city lover and use to it, this won't be a problem.2. The night we decided to stay, they restaurant across the street decided to have an open air concert from 10 PM until 1 AM ON A WEDNESDAY! You can hear every word and every note...so forget sleep. Lovely place but the noise levels in our room were just too much for us. City people will probably have no issues with the noise levels.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful, modern boutique style hotel. Staff was awesome, rooms clean, great breakfast. Bathroom had a great shower. Our room had a private porch as well. Walkable to many great areas around Athens. The wine bar at the entrance is a nice touch! Highly recommended.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very conveniently located near Syntagma Square, but surprisingly quiet and tucked away in the middle of everything. Room was clean but quite small, breakfast was good. Hotel staff were helpful, giving great restaurant recommendations and arranging an early morning taxi to the airport and a breakfast bag to go! Bed was kind of hard. We had an interior room facing the courtyard on a lower level, so kept curtains closed most of the time. For price, would have expected slightly bigger room and/or more luxurious bed.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for four nights before a Mediterranean cruise.Note: I rarely write reviews. And when I do, it’s only when the hotel is really, really good.This hotel is rated very highly on TripAdvisor and, to be honest, I was not expecting it to be as good as the reviews. Well, it’s actually better! Our room, a Junior Suite, was great. Plenty of space. Exceptionally good shower that worked as a shower should. The breakfast was wonderful. It doesn’t get any better than this.Staff: friendly, helpful, happy.Finally, the location: Right in the centre of Athens, round the corner from Syntagma Square. Perfect!I can’t believe anyone would regret booking this hotel.After our cruise, we return to this hotel for a further five nights. Can’t wait!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this contemporary hotel are so friendly and helpful - from booking to checkout nothing was too much trouble. The rooms are spotless and very well appointed with quality toiletries. The location, too, is excellent both for access from the airport and for the fact that you can walk to all major attractions. It is a peaceful spot, and yet still close to town. After a great nights sleep we headed down for the included breakfast. What a treat! A wide variety of cereals, pastries, fresh fruit, juices etc, with the added bonus of barista coffee and hot dishes, all freshly prepared. The presentation of the cooked dishes was outstanding and they were so tasty.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located about 350m away from Syntama Sq and Ermou Street.Bed is comfortable and we got a room facing the inner courtyard which is a nice feature in the hotel. The courtyard is a nice place to wind down after a day's walking within the city. Can be a bit noisy in the morning with breakfast diners though as the windows are not very good in insulating the noise. Would imagine it would be worse if you're facing the road.Breakfast is very good and you can order your breakfast from an ala-carte menu or have the ready made pastries, the latter I must say is above average. Coffee is Nespresso based so is very average. You also have the machine in the room.If this establishment had proper coffee and better sound insulated windows, I would have rated it excellent.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: InnAthens is a very modern boutique hotel decorated in a minimalist style. Very comfortable room and could not fault the cleanliness. There is a lovely central courtyard which some of the rooms overlook. We found all staff polite and helpful.Breakfast was good with a reasonable choice although a larger variety of fruit would have been welcome. Not enough bananas!! Brussels sprouts not a popular breakfast food in the UK!The location is perfect, a literal stone's throw from the Plaka, and easily reached in 10 minutes from Syntagma metro station. If you don't feel like venturing out there is a very good wine bar and restaurant within the hotel.I knock off a star as in a hotel of this quality and price I would expect tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms and daily complimentary drinking water. Apparently kettles are available on request but we were not aware of this until later. We could not get a hot drink in the hotel after 11pm. Despite this we had a great trip and would highly recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As we'd booked a 'de-luxe' room I was expecting something a bit special. True, the bedroom looked quite stylish, but it lacked practicality. Firstly the only flat surface on which to place anything was a tiny triangular area in a corner. There were no drawers, no comfortable chair and, surprisingly, no mirror. The only mirror was in the bathroom with a hairdryer fixed to the wall next to it. It meant my wife and I had to take turns for drying hair, make-up, shaving etc. No space in the bathroom to store dry towels and no rails on which to hang used ones to dry for re-use. The wash basin, a strange assembly of marble off-cuts had a marble slab in the bottom supported on stone nibs, which meant no plug. Washing/shaving had to be done under running water, rather wasteful. On the plus side, the air-con was both silent and very effective, two features which don't necessarily come together.Breakfast was perfectly adequate but nothing special. It would have been nice to have had some artisan baked bread rather than just bog standard brown and white sliced.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a courtyard view room & it was hard to believe we were in the middle of the city it was so quiet. Location is excellent, walkable to most of the sites & transport. Staff were friendly at all times including during breakfast. Plenty of options at breakfast. Rooms are modern & comfortable.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel, very well situated by Syntagma Square and easily accessible from the airport (we took the metro for 10 euros each and it was very easy). The rooms are a decent size and very clean, and there is a complementary buffet breakfast each morning that has a nice selection. It was very easy to walk anywhere we needed once we were there (just 15 mins to Acropolis) and lots to do and see in the neighborhood. However, the reason my review comes down in stars is because of the rudeness of the hotel staff. Nearly every person we interacted with was rude and cold and not hospitable at all. We had one incident in particular where my spouse had ordered something for breakfast that never came. Instead of the server owning up to the fact that he forgot to put the order in, he stood by silently while another server berated my spouse for expecting his food to be ready immediately. The quality of service was very poor, and so even though the hotel is otherwise very nice, I cannot fully recommend staying here.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast had superb quality and variety. Among the best complimentary hotel breakfasts I have had in my travels in numerous countries. Room was also spacious and comfortable with one of the best showers I have every experienced. However, my teen daughter despised the fact that the bathroom doors are transparent, so if you want to not have your body seen you have to undress and dress in the shower itself. (Toilet is in its own room, so you can use that unobserved.) Location was also fine. 10 minute pleasant walk to Acropolis/Acropolis Museum.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: InnAthens is on a small side street right around the corner from Syntagma Square where the guards stand in front of Parliament. Lovely little boutique hotel with a central courtyard cafe and wine bar next to the front entrance. The rooms are surprisingly large and neatly tucked into multiple entrances all around the courtyard, we had no problem at all with our family of four in a room a few steps down off the courtyard. Impressive waterfall shower with great water pressure and plenty of in-room amenities like Nespresso maker, bottled water and room safe. We had a super early morning flight and the concierge was able to pre-book an airport taxi for us for 3:15am and provided complimentary boxed breakfasts for us to take with us. Wish we'd had an opportunity to stay longer, as this was a truly lovely hotel.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, lots of good restaurants within walking distance. Staff are very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a family room for 4 people and didn't have a problem with the size of the room. Bathroom was a little dark but that's no big deal. Very nice bathroom amenities, and breakfast was superb.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked two rooms at this hotel for Wednesday and Thursday, but when we arrived we asked to book two more nights. We were told Saturday was available but Friday was booked. We asked for the female desk clerk to hold Saturday for us and put us in if there was a cancellation for Friday. When we got back to the hotel Thursday afternoon, we checked and there was still no availability on Friday. We found another hotel, and decided to stay two nights there instead of having to move yet again on Saturday. We were told that, since we gave 46 hours notice instead of 48 hours, we would be charged $40. This didn’t feel fair, since they had ample time to rent the room. When I spoke to the same female desk clerk about our situation, she was very rude, asked me for my card, and charged us $40. So the hotel rented the room and took $40 off us. We feel ripped off and would not recommend this hotel to other travelers.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautiful and clean and the location is great. The room and bathroom were both spacious and well designed. Every staff member that I interacted with was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is delicious but I felt that most of the options were from the sugary group fo breakfast foods and I would have liked some less sweet choices. One thing kept me wavering between a 4 and a 5 and that is the temperature of the room. The room got very hot overnight. There was a thermostat in the room but it said the temperature was centrally controlled. With the window open, the temperature was fine but I wanted to keep the shade closed overnight so I had to close the window. At the end of the day I didn't say anything and the hotel would have likely bent over backwards to remedy the situation had a spoken up.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights on a recent holiday in Athens. Firstly the location is superb - only 5 minutes walk from Syntagma Square where the Airport Bus departs from, 15 minutes walk from the Acroplois and super handy for lots of great local restaurants and bars but is still quiet since most of the rooms back onto a courtyard. The staff were friendly and really went the extra mile for us including providing Breakfast Boxes on our last morning since we had an early flight and providing Coffee and Tea service in the evening when I requested it. They also have a same day laundry service which was reasonably priced and efficient. Our room was comfortable and modern with its own balcony overlooking the courtyard. The breakfast in the morning was extensive and tasty with a great communal dining area as well as a mini library/ lounge for relaxing. We were really impressed with the thoughtful extras provided and would highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is smack bang in the middle of town. The central courtyard is very very peaceful especially knowing how crazy busy it is outside.The breakfast is lovely, especially the smoked salmon bagel.As a small boutique hotel it really works. If you want a bar and hot drinks in the room then you will be disappointed.That said overall I would recommend staying
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern, minimalist hotel rightbin the centre of Athens. But you wouldn't think you were as this hotel is so quiet you can't hear the traffic. Walking distance to all the main sights and the Plaka district on your doorstep
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so lucky to find this hotel. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and went out of their way to make sure we had a wonderful stay. The decor is sleek and modern. The room was perfectly clean and spacious. The bathroom lighting was a little challenging to put on makeup or shave but certainly not terrible. The location was perfect - walking distance to the Acropolis and Syntagma square. And the Plaka district is really accessible day and night. We walked everywhere from the hotel. We loved our stay and could not have been more pleased with this hotel. My next trip to Athens will definitely include a stay at InnAthens.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They have a first rate hotel in a great location. The room was spotless and well appointed. My wife loved the bathroom layout and especially the shower!. The breakfast offered daily was simply great. You can't go wrong with these folks!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived here very late after a flight form the UK and using the train straight to tube station 3 blocks away. Our greeting was calm and efficient and we were shown to our room by a really polite and friendly guy. The decor was contemporary and everything beautifully designed, with a mix of natural stone and metal: clean lines and very stylish. Bed wonderfully comfortable and room was quiet so ideal for a city stop. Breakfast delicious and offered a range of fresh foods and yogurt with eggs cooked to order. Would definitely visit again and really enjoyed our stay here: excellent hotel with delightful staff and lovely surroundings. The central courtyard creates an oasis of calm.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a hidden gem! We were so impressed before we even arrived. Filippos answered all our questions via email which helped us make decisions before we got to Athens. The service was AMAZING, great location to all restaurants, shops and various sights. We walked everywhere, including a visit to Agora and Syntagma Square, where we watched the Changing of the Guard and the Acropolis . Breakfast was beyond delicious-freshly cooked to order and so many choices. The rooms were clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. The staff was always helpful too! We enjoyed our stay and would stay here again. Thank you for making our stay perfect.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on Fen 2019. The room was big and beautiful, the location is great- 5 min walk from Syntagna square and from an endless choice of restaurants. All the people in the hotel were super nice! While checking-in, during breakfast (An amazing breakfast!! Very nice buffet and also variety of eggs and pancakes on a special order) and every time we needed something. We will definitely come back!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located for transport, attractions and restaurants. In a busy, noisy city it was great to have a safe place to stay which was very quiet at night, with rooms facing a little courtyard and having a small balcony.Rooms were nicely decorated, clean and breakfast was freshly cooked to order with a choice of other foods to go with it. Staff were always helpful, and we really enjoyed our stay. I will definitely be recommending the hotel to anyone who is staying in Athens!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great choice of hotel for a stay in central Athens. The location is fantastic; a modest walk to most things, and, considering how central it is, extremely quiet. The rooms are clean (and for anyone like me who is bothered by these things, the room smelt nice the moment we walked in), modern and comfortable. They are thoughtfully equipped, for example two types of pillows, one feather, one graduated foam so you can get it just right. The shower was spacious and the jet strong and hot. Nice to see that the staff enforce, very politely, the no smoking in rooms policy - hurrah! Breakfast is included and is generous and varied, and there is a light bites menu available through the day until 11pm. We found this very helpful, arriving on a late evening flight and not wanting to go too far to get a small supper. We sat in the courtyard under the lemon tree and the stars and enjoyed a simple meal there. The courtyard proved to be an inner sanctuary a couple of times; when en route from A to B we just popped back in for a drink and a rest. The staff at InnAthens are excellent - friendly, extremely helpful and very efficient, both during our stay, and indeed in all communications before our arrival. We knew we wanted to book a day trip with a private driver to Delphi and InnAthens kindly arranged everything for us with Opa Tours. Stamatios, our expert driver, was everything you could want - punctual, reliable, so knowledgeable and great company. The ethos at Opa Tours is something special. Yes, highly professional, but beyond that, the company and its staff are truly focussed on providing outstanding customer service. Relationships matter above all, and nothing is too much trouble. Stamatios went above and beyond in everything he did, out of ‘philotomo’, a Greek concept for which there is no easy translation but which here perhaps equates to something like taking a ‘personal pride’ in what you do, doing the best job you can, not least out of self respect. As a result we had the best experience and promptly did a second tour with Stamatios, again arranged through InnAthens, to Sounio and the Temple of Poseidon. What a superb recommendation from the brilliant team at InnAthens! All in all a great stay. Thank you!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So, the hotel is located in a perfect area full of great restaurants and bars,and you can reach all the attractions and must see places by foot.Even the bar restaurant at the entrance of the hotel has very good food and drinks. The only little inconvinience is that if you get a room that faces the street it can be very loud.They should probably invest in better windows with a very good isolation system. Athens is a crazy loud city. But a wonderful one,one of my favourites in the world. Nearly as much or even more than Berlin or Barcelona.That is the only negative point of this hotel.(Windows) Beds are super comfortable, rooms are big enough and showers are great.The breakfast is great,something very important for me too.All in all
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hidden hotel in the middle of Athens. Excellent breakfast and good service and within walking distance of Syntagma subway station. There are also a lot of nice places to eat in around in area
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of inn Athens hotel is in the heart of the center of Athens, in a qiut courtyard. In walk distance from everywhere. Clinliness and breakfast are their priority. The stuff is really very friendly. TOTALLY VALUE FOR MONEY
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor sort of last minute and based on the excellent reviews. It didn’t let us down!! The location is right where you want to be for great food and shopping... all within walking distance. Recently renovated, the rooms are very nice and modern. Breakfast offered a variety of options and was delicious.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located. Just a block from the main Syntagma square in Athens. 30-40 minutes from the airport. A 15-20 minutes walk to the Acropolis through Plaka. Clean , modern rooms. Hospitable staff. Entrance is through a passage way of a restaurant though. Excellent breakfast. A few things made to order.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff was helpful before our stay, answering questions quickly and they were accommodating and friendly while on site as well. The hotel is centrally located, making it easy to walk everywhere from there and also allowing for a quick stop in to get wifi. It is also very, very quiet at night which allowed for a great night of sleep, every night. Breakfast was wonderful every day. The little courtyard was much appreciated as well. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights and had a private terrace room. It was disappointing to find renovations happening right opposite our terrace.The hotel is in a great location and the staff were very helpful.We found the cereal options for breakfast disappointing and the coffee wasn't good - that could just be our taste. The hot food options were very nice, however when everyone turned up at the same the kitchen got slammed and it was a disaster, with people getting the wrong meals or one person being served and the others waiting 20 minutes. Clearly they need either more staff or a better system.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was great choice for our short time in Athens. The hotel sits back in a courtyard off the Main Street so you don’t get the noise of the city but we are in the heart of the city. Very close and within walking distance to everything. Rooms are clean and modern with nice windows and terraces. Rooms are a bit small but common big city size. Breakfast was good and lots of variety. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Lovely courtyard for breakfast and cocktails.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Inn Athens was both comfortable and enjoyable. The staff were friendly and very helpful even providing a map and marking out suggestions for the main sights to see. The room was clean, comfortable bed, hot shower and lovely furnishings. A stand out for us was the breakfast. There was a good variety of choices and also a menu to choose from with I think it was around 9 options from omelettes, bagels and pancakes. All were presented well, fresh and healthy. It was like being at a cafe for breakfast each morning and all included in the room price. The hotel is also well situated and an easy walk to sights, restaurants and shopping.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a beautiful stay at InnAthens. It was very easy to get to from the subway, walking distance to all the things you must see and do and the staff was so helpful.First location is the key! It was easy to get to from any location. It was tucked away behind a very nice wine bar that sits right in front of a beautiful old church. The hotel has a very nice patio garden to sit in the evening and have breakfast in the morning or a cocktail in the evening. We stayed in another hotel 10 days later in the middle of town and it was extremely noisy so you will appreciate the quite atmosphere during the day and evening at InnAthens.Second the staff...all very friendly and on hand 24/7. They are able to give directions and order a taxi if needed at anytime. Third Breakfast was amazing! It was a great way to start the day and kept us satisfired throughout the day. Anything you want is available and you can also order off the menu.Forth is the room. I saved for last only because of our room location we were unable to see any of the other rooms and the locations We apparently had the family room. It was large and roomy but I have a few complaints about the room. One it was below ground level and windows faced the patio. It was also right next to the reception desk with a glass door separating the reception area and the door to the room. It was a little awkward to come out of room and have the office right outside your room in a glass box. It just didn't feel like we had a lot of privacy. If you wanted the curtains open in the room people walking by or on the patio can look right down in your room. I believe the room we stayed in is the only room laid out like this. The other problem was the outlet in our bathroom did not work. We complained but they said it was 110volt and only worked for a electric razor when in fact the outlet itself said 320 volt and a curling iron is the same volts as a electric razor. We did not argue with them we just tried to make it work with our curling irons plugged in the room with no mirror. We used the glass door as a mirror. There was a mirror inside a closet door but the available outlet was too far away to curl your hair. Maybe it's fixed by now. One minor thing it's also really dark in the bathroom.Over all we loved our stay and the location. I would definitely recommend this Boutique hotel. It was quite and location and staff great! We also loved the breakfast!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service and breakfast just amazing! Would highly recommend - we walked everywhere from this great location. The room was HUGE - very comfortable for 3 people. The staff we all very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We LOVED the shower!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: InnAthens is a gem. Centrally located, we were able (and we are in our mid-70s) to walk to every site and museum we wanted to see plus explore various neighborhoods. The staff is extraordinary in terms of knowledge about the best ways to see Athens and for recommendations on restaurants where locals eat from street food to upscale places. Plus lovely garden where you can have breakfast or just relax. Definitely the place to stay!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel for a night stop in Athens. Rooms are spotless, compact and comfortable with a minimalist, modern feel. Staff are extremely helpful and there is a super wine bar/restaurant next door. I highly recommend.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location! Blow dryer mounted on bathroom wall. We had a small fridge in rooom and free breakfast the next morning. Nice outside courtyard area for breakfast or to hang out. Hotel entrance location is different due to the fact you need to walk through a wine bar to arrive at Hotel.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the heart of Athens, close to all major attractions, markets and shopping strips this hotel has it all. The rooms were very comfortable for our family of four. The beds amazing - we had the best sleep! Staff are welcoming and attentive.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: LOCATION, breakfast, LOCATION, staff, LOCATIONCons: None.It's been a long time since I've raved about a hotel. I mean, you're paying the price, so what's there to rave about when your expectations are met? However, I have lots to rave about InnAthens. First and foremost, it is SUCH bang for buck. I'm so amazed at how reasonably priced this place is for where it is located... In the heart of the city, walking distance to many of the major attractions.We will begin with how it's snuggled inside and behind a bar, courtyard, and lemon tree. In spite of being in such a central location, it's still very quiet because it's off of a side street and nestled in between a few other establishments. Very friendly, professional, and helpful staff greet you in the lobby and offer you a beverage. (I had my first coffee in Greece here.)The decor is modern, chic, and minimal. Everything is clean and functional. The bed was comfortable, the pillows didn't smell funky, and the room came with a cute little balcony, equipped with chairs and a small table. Wifi is accessible inside the rooms, and the A/C cools right away upon starting. I have no complaints. (Oh, some water seeped out from under the shower door, but this was not much of an issue.)Breakfast (which is included with your stay) is DELICIOUS. There's a variety of options for your caffeine intake (from espresso, cappuccino to Americano) and a good selection of pastries. I recommend the chocolate-filled croissants. There's also fresh fruits, freshly-squeezed orange juice, and different cereals to choose from. Oh, and if none of that is to your liking, you can choose from a menu and have something hot freshly whipped up from the kitchen. Thumbs up!InnAthens is a short walk into Syntagma Square. We also walked to the Acropolis from the hotel (about 10 minutes). You're also literally across the street from the National Park. I can't stress how central the location is. You're close to endless restaurants (all highly rated on TripAdvisor) and shopping streets. If nothing else, pick InnAthens for its prime location and accessibility to everything.Tips: Grab a SIM card from Vodaphone (a short walk from InnAthens) for the month. It includes local minutes and data for a very reasonable price. (I paid 15 euros.) There's no contract and they automatically cancel your card after the month is up. If needed, you can purchase top-ups within the month.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There really is nothing to fault with this wonderful hotel. The management and members of staff were so welcoming, friendly and helpful during our short stay.The hotel is centrally located, only a short walk from all the major attractions and is conveniently close to Syntagma Square, where we got the X95 bus to and from the airport. The well appointed rooms encircle a lovely peaceful courtyard, which is hermetically sealed by a large glass door from the noise and busy Plaka streets outside.We stayed in a suite, where our bed was incredibly comfortable, even the sofa bed that our daughter slept on.Breakfast was delicious with so many really great vegetarian options on the menu (which is very unusual in Greece!). We also love the fact that it's a non-smoking hotel. We'll definitely be back!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at InnAthens for 5 nights in early August then another 2 nights at the end of August. We cannot speak highly enough of how happy we were with everything about the hotel. The staff were very helpful with any touristy questions we had; the breakfast is very nice and terrific value (it is ridiculous how much most hotels rip you off for breakfast in Australia!); it is well located to Syntagma metro station; the rooms are comfortable and stylish with good aircon; there is a taxi rank just outside; Acropolis, Plaka etc all close by; the courtyard style of the hotel meant we weren’t bothered by noise from the streets and the courtyard is a good place to relax; there is free wifi (albeit a bit slow); and lastly it represents very good value for money.Not sure when we will next be in Athens but we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located, only 10 mins walks to the Acropolis. The hotel itself is in fantastic condition and the rooms modernly decorated. The balcony and inner courtyard are both quiet, lovely spots to eat, drink and read. The included breakfast is outstanding - a wide buffet plus a cooked-to-order menu of sandwiches, bagels, eggs and sweet meals. On my last day, I had to depart for an early flight before breakfast was served and they happily arranged a breakfast box for me to take away. All staff are very attentive and helpful.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed with our kids at the InnAthens for two nights and had a wonderful experience. The Hotel is very well located, walking distance to all the amenities Athens has to offer. The staff is great. Viki helped us with restaurant recommendations and also when I mentioned we were going to Milos next, she gave me a detailed itinerary of her favorite places in Milos. The rooms are great, very modern and large for European standards. We were 4 and fit comfortably. Our room had a view to the lovely courtyard. The breakfast was delicious and they even packed us 4 breakfasts the day we left as we left early. We would stay at the InnAthens if we return to Athens
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed here for 2 quick nights (barely one full day in Athens before jetting to Mykonos) but really enjoyed the hotel. A few things to note:- the staff was pleasant, super helpful and quite attentive. - the location is excellent, a short 15 min walk from the Acropolis and around 5 for the Temple of Olympus Zeus. - rooms were clean and very comfortable One small gesture that shouldn’t go overlooked - we were leaving for our ferry at 6am, before breakfast and they had a bagged breakfast for each of us to take with us. Kept our tired and hungry kids at bay!
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fab. location, walking distance from Syntagma metro station (easy trip from the airport) and in the other direction to the the shops and restaurants of Plaka and down to the Acropolis/Parthenon.Really nice conversion of an old building with a central courtyard. Some rooms with balconies. Helpful staff, good breakfast and reasonably priced - we will definitely come back next time we are in Athens.Taxi rank in the street outside the hotel.When you arrive you walk past the corridor tables of the bistro 'By the Glass' to get to the hotels courtyard and then the entrance to Reception. Oh and 'By the Glass' had lovely wine and food - worth a stop.Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found the hotel through a video showing it's reconstruction. I was impressed and wanted to stay there ever since. Most of the times it was fully booked but I managed to stay there beginning of March 2018 for a couple of days. Really central and convenient location, next door to the Syntagma metro station Friendly and helpful staff. Modern decor, the room was spacious enough and very clean, comfortable beds, soft linens, breakfast is good but can be upgraded, bathroom has good amenities but is a little dark. If you are travelling with small children, use a wheelchair or have weak knees then you should consider staying somewhere else. It's a cute little hotel and I would gladly stay there again.
hotelName:
18    InnAthens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights at Athens Studios. The staff was very helpful for general questions and advice, and available 24/7 so it's no problem if you need to arrive late at night. The location is fantastic - walk to most of the main tourist sights in Athens, and lots of great restaurants are just a block or two away. We were in a suite which was clean and spacious with a full kitchen. The decor leans more to efficient/modern rather than luxurious. Nice full breakfast buffet is included. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay here, staff friendly & helpful, our room clean, modern & spacious with double balcony & you could see acropolis from bedroom balcony. Short walk to markets & Plaka restaurant area. Tours available from the sportsbar at 10am "Athens off the beaten track" & I highly recommend, tour guide is an aussie & just great. Everything just perfect.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 3 stayed here 5 nights in July and the accommodations were perfect. We booked the Deluxe Family Studio for couple, which turned out to have a double bed, two chairs that fold out to single beds and a couch that folds out for two. We could have easily accommodated 3-4 kids, but we’ve just got the one. ;) Breakfast was included everyday, and we were pleasantly surprised to find scrambled eggs, good toast, fresh produce, and strong coffee. The place is loaded with Americans, so English is widely spoken. Take the time to learn “please” and “thank you” anyway. The location could not be better as you’re close to all of the major historical sites, amazing restaurants, and touristy shopping. The only complaint is that it’s a little noisy if there is a big group at the rooftop bar and in the hallways. That’s standard for this type of place. You’ll pay double for absolute quiet (triple?).We’ll definitely stay here for future trips.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I unfortunately booked through the Expedia portal a room, upon arrival at the hotel to check in they tell us that we can not enter because our reservation is for another date, it must be emphasized that I booked the day before and that day 3 hours before I arrived the hotel had charged me. It really was very unpleasant both the reception, the support given to a tourist and step now do not want to return our money. It is important that you consider that the error on the part of the portal is for July month.I do not recommend this hotel at all, one of the most important things in this area is the tourist support and even more when it was an error of the portal.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a not so great experience at a nearby hotel, the Athens Studios redeemed our Athens experience. We booked the 4 person room with two bunk beds for ourselves and two daughters. The beds were comfy, the AC was cold and the room was spacious and super clean. The shower was great too. The staff was beyond helpful and friendly. And the breakfast buffet was wonderful and so unexpected. The location can’t be beat-just two blocks or so from the museum and the acropolis. This is a wonderful place for backpackers and families alike. Cannot recommend highly enough. After paying nearly €200 for a dirty hotel (no lie-we saw cockroaches), the €85 for Athens Studios for a family of four was just wonderful. You won’t regret staying here.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We made a reservation for a Penthouse Mountain View room for 8 nights. We were given room 22. This was a nice room, but we did not have a balcony or a view of the mountain as the buildings across the street were in our way. We did have roof access, and there was an awesome view from here. My only issues with this room, was that the stairs to go to the roof went through the room. When one of the other 2 rooms with access went up there it was very loud in our room. We also were woken up a lot with people on the lower floors trying to access the roof (we think they thought the rooftop bar was there). Perhaps a sign on the door would prevent the constant beeps it was our experience that everyone with a keycard would try about 3 times before giving up. Room was cleaned daily this was satisfactory. Breakfast was good, but could benefit from a hot plate to keep the eggs warm, on a couple of days they were very cold. The location was excellent we were within walking distance of everywhere we wanted to go. We would stay there again.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great, centrally located. We had one night in Athens for sightseeing. This hotel provided an idea spot for laundry breakfast and burgers. There is always a daily walking tour that leaves @ 10:00 a, lead by an Australian. Luggage can be left if you have down time before your flight.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three blocks from the Acropolis. Comfortable bedding. Minimal Bathroom with small phone both size vinyl curtain shower stall and skimpy towels. But think of the price range. It's otherwise safe and convenient. Good Wi-Fi in hotel. Serviceable kitchen with minimal, but probably adequate utensils. Spacious studio apartment sparsely decorated with rather worn furnishings. This hotel is geared towards the backpackers. The photos on the website are NOT accurate. There is no rooftop bar or deck contrary to the online photos. That set up is several blocks away and again nothing like the pictures. But really don't need it you're 3 blocks from the Acropolis for Gods sakes. The hotel is clean ish. The heat works fine. There's ongoing remodeling construction in the hotel. So it can be very noisy late into the evening 10 and 11pm. The front desk is super nice if it's Walter, otherwise it's catch-as-catch-can.
