There are plenty of taxis driving by for the €38 trip to the airport. Do not let the front desk book your taxi, they up charge you for the convenience of them calling their taxi. You don't need it. The restaurant across the street is really really good. You can tell, it's packed all the time. Excellent food. Order the large beans with onion garlic Olive oil. Fried anchovy -- yes anchovy -- it's nothing like the anchovies you're thinking of. These are delicious. The Greek salads fabulous and the staff super nice.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived to hotel around 6 pm on March 22 for two night stay, when we arrived to hotel, the girl at front desk was not smiling at all, we were exited for arriving to Athens for the first time, so we went to see the view from room as our booking was done back in Sept 30, 2018, when we go to the room, we did not had the view of the Acropolis because they gave us room 20 that has not view to acropolis, I went back to the girl and told her, and she told me wait, she went back to a door and spoke to someone and she told me you have room access and I told her no, that is not the room, so she said yes that is your room, I have no way to contact booking.com I could not made calls out or my company will charge me, so I said I will wait until I go back to USA, then the room was 4 adults in that small room, they did not wanted to help me at all. room 21 was the room that I was suppose to get in Penthouse both (20 & 21) and a door to roof access for room 20. (see first pic with one full bed and a two sofa beds, then rest was the room I received on my last night on March 27 room 21, more spacious and bigger with two terrace and acropolis view.I spoke on March 29 with Booking.com and after 5 days the resolution was, they believe the manager from hotel even though I had proof of my emails saying it was acropolis view not ROOF ACCESS room. and booking.com refund me only 29 euros.I will never get a reservation thru Booking.com because they do not help you or back you up event with proof in your hands. MIND YOU: Property did not wanted to help me with nothing in compensation due to their mistake in their part for giving me the wrong room. (see email proof that I booked Acropolis views since Sept 2018.Also the breakfast for this hotel is really suck, it outside the hotel and cold when it gets to your table. Elevator is very very small.Location is great and Clean.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, the apartment was spacious, modern and very good as was the staff, service, price & location of Athens Studios. We had Room 22 on 5th floor - very good view. As one enters there was a sitting/lounging area, then a small efficiency kitchen section, then sleeping area with a king size bed. The tiny bathroom was off to the side which unfortunately could have used a few more inches & been better planned (at 200 lbs I could barely fit on commode as I was wedged between wall & metal rack under sink). Shower had one totally open end & no tray for soap/shampoo. Also, there was no clothes closet or hangers in the apartment. Still, the room, overall, was very nice & came with a very good complimentary hot breakfast. We would stay again..
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms (We had booked suite with panaromic Acropolis view), the neighbourhood, the staff. Everything is fantastic. Loved the experience. If I was ever back to Athens, I will again book Athens Studios. The promt and friendly service of the staff makes the stay easier.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited recently with my wife and friends recently for a city break. We were exceptionally pleased with the apartments and the location couldn’t have been better. The Acropolis site, museums and many other tourist attractions were easily accessible on foot from the apartments (Athens Studios) and found a small but excellent Greek restaurant just opposite the main entrance serving qood quality Greek food. The restaurant was always full of locals which was a good sign and prices were reasonable for the city centre. We all said we wouldn’t hesitate to return to the apartments and found the prices paid were reasonable. My wife and I paid €228 for 4 nights in a large apartment with 2 balconies including breakfast and our friends paid about €150 for a smaller 1 bedroom apartment with 1 balcony which was I would book next time.Breakfast was basic but not unacceptable. The coffee was the only thing we couldn’t tolerate as it was just warm and glad we took our own sachets of instant coffee which was much better using the hot water provided to make your own tea. I have attached a few photographs but not taken any of the separate bedroom which was spacious with a wardrobe.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Office help was always ready to assist in any way. The laundromat was next door. So to was a bar with delicious food which served liquor. The room was relatively quiet in spite of the fact that we were there during a weekend. But I understand it could sometimes get loud, in which case you just went down and joined the party. At 11 o'clock they closed the doors to reduce noise and traffic. The rooms and the kitchen were clean; the contained toiletries and a few dishes. The stove had two burners and there was a small fridge underneath the counter. The first night was pretty bad because my husband snores and we were in one room. We went to the office for help and they gave us two rooms which allowed me to sleep and they didn't charge extra!!! What it lacked in beauty, it gave in comfort, and availability to all main attractions. Beds were single in both rooms; one room had four bunkbeds. I would rather have had a nicer looking room but I'm happy to have stayed there for its easiness to access. The breakfast which came with the room was fairly ok, but the guy behind the counter kept burning the omelets and at one point when I got there they were actually cold. But the hamburger and fries next door at the bar were absolutely delicious.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed for Ten days, and seen the sites , very clean and fresh rooms . we had two rooms,for the family and myself, No trouble with English almost everyone spoke English, and was very helpful with getting taxies and tours..
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located on the edge of the historical city center, but only 2 min away from the actual center and some picturesque neighbourhoods, Athens Studios does what it promises. It was very clean and I specifically liked the minimal decor, as it gave the room even more light and shine. It had exactly what I needed and I would recommend it without a doubt!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and a very nice pairing with the sister hostel they have. Nicely decorated modern rooms and the free breakfast is a must! Check in was quick and easy and I personally appreciated that the staff was willing to help and answer my questions and take an extra step with their suggestions.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located just near the new Acropolis museum (perfect location), the hotel is clean and lively. The staff was very helpful. The area is safe and quiet, provides you every facility, walking to the acropolis and great local restaurants. The bar of hotel was convenient and fun and the rooms very clean- i mean it.. :)Overall experience was awesome.I'll recommend this hotel to all couples and families :-) You wont regret, just be there :-)
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are not picky and location is all that matters - you can stay at Athens studios. We were a group with 4 rooms staying for five days, and in 2 of the rooms there were bed bugs. One person in our group got a very bad rash from this, and the pharmacy were not in doubt about what was the reason. However the staff at the hotel was more interested in blaming us and coming with excuses than actually helping us. They also spoke about us in greek in front of us, too bad they didnt know that one person in our group understood greek. Really unprofessional and rude! The receptionist was also rude and argued with us instead of being nice and understanding of our situation. It cost us a lot of time and energi as we had to clean all of our clothes and luggage. It also cost us money as we had to buy new luggage.The hotel (would rather call it hostel) was fully booked so we couldnt get a new room. The staff removed the bugs and wiped the floors. The cleaning of the hotel is no more than okay. The rooms are dusty and some areas looks mouldy. The toliet in one of the rooms broke down, and as there were no availble rooms we just had to live with that. The day after we got a new room (one day before departure). So, the good things about this place is obviously its location. The breakfast is okay, and the rooms are okay (except the bugs and dust ofc). All in all bugs are obviously a huge negative factor about this place. However the impression could be better with more serviceminded staff. The attitude of several of them were unprofessional and despicable and that is also reflected in the way they answer some of the reviews here at tripadvisor. We felt like we were bothering the staff, and thats a weird feeling when you pay a lot of money to stay somewhere and the staff are suppose to be at your service. It is also destructive for the rest of the staff that is actually trying to do their job. Two tip: ATTITUDE and CLEANESS.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights with our two kids (9 and 4 years). The location is excellent with a few mins walk to the Acropolis and Plaka. There is also many restaurants, launderette, mini marts etc within easy reach. The studio was large, bright and clean. Ours had a queen bed and 2 more foldable beds, small kitchenette and dining table. Ideal for family travel. The toilet was small, basic and could have done with a proper shower cubicle - instead of an open plan which results in the entire floor getting wet. While free wifi was available, it was slow, weak and had a cumbersome process to access it. With all of us carrying multiple devices, this is not ideal.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, the accommodation facility is spread across at least 4 apartment blocks in various stages of decay, you can't walk between them, nothing like the pictures. The advertised roof top bar, is actually elsewhere. I asked reception and got a vague wave of the hand indicating down the street somewhere. The lift to our room was only large enough for 1 person, plus a backpack, seriously, no exaggeration. The "Apartments" weren't very clean, everything saturated in cigarette smoke, so I suppose it wouldn't be a problem for smokers. The shower was tiny and kept flooding, the front door wouldnt lock properly, powerpoints were loose, just generally a dilapidated room. And the "apartment " had no iron or ironing board. The breakfast was super basic and if the bread ran out, it wasn't replenished, so tough luck. One time, I pointed the empty bread basket to staff and was laughed at. Location is quite good, heaps of other places to stay nearby, you may want to give this one a miss.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My reservation here needed to be changed by 1 week and after working with hotels.com who tried multiple times to work it out and a lengthy email exchange from me with the manager, it was finally sorted. When I arrived for my new dates, they had been entered wrong (hotels.com's fault?) and I was told there were no beds but they could send me to Athens Backpackers hostel where I had to 12 euro to "sleep" on a disgusting common area couch. There also don't seem to be any quiet hours as people were up and music playing all night. The bathrooms were disgusting as well and the next morning I asked for my 24 euros back so I could go somewhere else (I paid another 24 when I "checked in" to stay in a dorm for a night). They even told me that I hadn't paid 24 euros even though I had a receipt. I had also already paid through hotels.com so now I have paid twice! They refused to give me my money back and instead I had to upgrade to a studio to get out of there (which meant more money). The studio was fine - it wasn't worth 65 euros. It seems Athens Studios cares more about making money than the comfort of customers and they certainly aren't concerned with doing the right thing for their customers. I have now paid them twice and left two notes for the manager who mysteriously was never around on my visit (even though I was told she would be). I asked her to contact me about refunding some of the money that they made me pay in cash when I arrived. I left my phone number and my email address (even though they already have both) and I've never heard from her. This place is not worth it and they seem to lie about information when asked. I'm very disappointed. The only reason I gave this 2 instead of 1 is because of the location. It is very close to all of the main tourist attractions.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We always book downtown and this is the best central location in Athens! Nice small European hotel with huge suites. we had two balconies and two rooms with fridge and cook top, the best! I love small hotels and we were literally 200 yards form the entrance to the Acropolis. 50 yards to 20 restaurants and at the entrance to the Plaka and hundreds of shops and curios. restaurant beside us and under us, small grocery stores nearby as well.Verrry reasonable prices. Fast internet, safe surroundings, and a nice quaint two person elevator. Oh, if you have luggage, its only you and your luggage. Too much fun in this location, Fantastic roof top restaurant with a view of the Acropolis at night.Excellent directions form the airport on tier site, Walk down to the hotel form the Square, take a cab back up when you leave. loved this place.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a wonderful weekend in our two week trip in Greece as it had a laundromat. The rooms are clean and the breakfast delicious. The bar at night is lively. I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in Athens. The Acropolis is a short walk away and there are many tasty restaurants near by.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 days in this studio, which was well furnished and cosy. The location is perfect for whoever wants to be in the center and close to the main sights of the city.The price is very low but everything was clean and the wifi worked correctly. There is also a luggage storage option, which is nice and safe.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location centre of town. 5 minutes to the acropolis.Great staff so helpful.Clean, tidy, organised.Perfect city break.We booked a studio for 5 on the top floor and had a view of the Acropolis
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in June of 2017 with our then 7 year old. If you don't need all the amenities of a hotel, I would highly recommend staying at Athens Studios, even though this is classified as a hostel. It was a bit noisier at night due to the younger partying crowd, however quiet time seemed to be respected/enforced. Despite the bit of noise all the other benefits made it worth it. The hostel is located within walking distance of the metro and major attractions - The Acropolis, The Acropolis Museum, Temple of Zeus, Hadrian's Arch, etc. The room had everything we needed - private entry, a small kitchenette to prepare our own food, clean modern bathroom, comfortable beds, and a balcony, all for a very reasonable price. The wifi was great and the room was air-conditioned. What more could you ask for?
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed in the most amazing 2 bdrm penthouse suite with a view of the Parthenon that was stunning. The suite was completely modern with floor to ceiling windows, full kitchen, 2 1/2 baths and a private rooftop terrace. The location of the property is minutes from the Acropolis Museum, Plaka and Acropolis so it is extremely convenient for walking to attractions. We arrived early so we were able to leave our luggage in storage until check in time. I would absolutely stay here again next time we are in Athens.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great just 5-8 mins to acropolis and metro etc. the rooms were quite congested but because we stayed only 1 night it wasn’t a major concern. Facility wise it’s okay and due to location there is enough eateries and stuff and syntagama market place is close by and all major attractions are working distance.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is more like a youth hostel than a hotel! Wonder how 4 stars is possible. Very noisy from the streets, not very clean in the bathroom and refridgerator. Really poor breakfast at a cafe besides. You get the coffee from a bar with really unfriendly service.Definitelly not worth the money!Except for the great location in a safe area very close to Acropolis.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the property is extraordinary. The Apartments are very spacious and kitchen is well provided with all necessary cooking ware and serving plates and other required cutlery. But the staff provided for arranging breakfast is not adequate and the eatables are constantly running out. This drawback needs to be looked into to make it even a better place.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Though our apartment was not as pictured, we did not mind. It seemed a bit pricey to us for what we got, but, it is in a very very good location in terms of being right next to the Acropolis Museum/Acropolis, etc. So, I guess that it why it is a bit expensive. Just remember, in terms of one man's trash and another's treasure: it is also very very loud. This is not really the fault of the place but the location. But, it seemed to go for the worst of both worlds: crying babies inside the hotel, and incessent throbbing bass and music and partying outside. One night I had the very first white night of my entire life, which did make sightseeing the next day less than fun. I would advise for those older than, say, 35 who are not singles, to research a place that is quieter. I didn't know present-day Athens all that well when I was making my plans but having been, I would go a bit further out. The metro in Athens is sparkling, lovely, so modern from a U.S. perspective. So, you could be one or two metro stops away from the Acropolis stop and still have a wonderful time. Unless you are looking for the bar scene, I'd advise another place!Also, technically there is a roof deck at the other facility, but, it was all young people and all alcohol fueled. Not a place for families.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After spending a week in Santorini we wanted a place to relax before we fly home. The fotos of the apt are exactly of the apt AND a gracious host Adela was very accommodating to ensure our check in was smooth - also offered to coordinate transportation for us from the port to the apt. The apt provides a very nice welcome basket, clear instructions and suggestions to local market, restaurants and night life, which we were VERY surprise how many options we had, cool vibes in the area. Do not be concerned with the location of the apt building, it is on a side street but literally walking distance to many places in the area. Highly recommend. Thanks Adela!!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable room. Spacious and practical. Has a small fridge and a stove. Shower and toilet is a little cramped. Anyone over 250 lbs will find it a little tight. Reception is exceptional and super helpful. Great English speakers. The best part is the location. 10 min walk from the Acropolis and Plaka. 20 min walk to the parliament and the "presidential guards". Numerous nice small cafes, eateries, and bakeries outside. Free breakfast was really good too. Overall, a great value under $175 per night.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a mixed of hostel and hotel,suites. The place is very central, close to the acropolis and the paka area. The place is clean and has friendly staff. However, the breakfast selection is not that great. It is a good place to stay if you are on a budget.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 3 nights and in the Bunk bedRooms and Bathrooms- Very clean bedsheets and bathroom. Bathroom had toilet rolls and a glass to separate the shower area, that helped the water not to splash everywhere .Balcony and Kitchenette to prepare your dinner and have it outside in the Balcony . Amenities - There are kitchen stuffs available to prepare your own dinner or coffee / tea sashes to have it for free . Location - At the heart of Athens, every archaeological site or museums were less than 5 min of walk. Adjacent to it was fish cafe where we had our breakfast and sports bar for karaoke or grab a beer . There was a seating outside these restaurants and we enjoyed the street view while we had our breakfast. The entire lane had such arrangements therefore i would say that i stayed in an excellent location- LOVELY Staff - Very Helpful .They helped me prioritize my itinerary where to go and what to skip. Security - They were present all the time .Access - 2 min walk from Acropolis station , if you are coming from Airport , then you need to make one transfer at Syntagama square for Acropolis , at the heart of Athens . 50 mins in total .I enjoyed my stay at Athens, met amazing people from all over the world and most importantly had a very good and comfortable time .
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at "Athens Studios". Its name describes exactly the case as it's not a hotel (although there is a very friendly and helpful 24hrs reception) but rather a set of beautiful, clean and equipped studios right in the "heart" of the city. Each studio is fully A/C and it has bedroom(s), private bathroom, kitchen and a small living room with TV. You can have breakfast at the "Fish-Cafe" next to the Reception and we were given complimentary "ouzo" drinks at the nearby bar. But the best thing is the LOCATION. Although it could be a bit noisy (in lower floors), it's literally just a 3 min walk from both the magnificent Acropolis Museum and the metro station that will take you anywhere in the city. You can also use it as the starting (and finishing) point of an amazing walk around the Acropolis Hill and the historic center of Athens (Start early as it will take you the whole day). All in all a great accomodation choice.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved that place where we stayed for a couple of nights with my sister and we felt very welcomed and secure above all. Such an honest and clean place that pays you back especially in terms of location and peace. Mattress was so inviting-loved it. During our lazy-to-explore night we happened to witness a super Karaoke event at the hotel's bar and had so much fun. Very polite and happy-to-help staff. Thumbs up indeed!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: booked in a six people dorm, the room was cosy, good mattress, cleaned every morning, breakfast is simple but filling, reception staff always busy but helpful and smiling- especially Yolanda, she has the best tips about food and the nightlife on a backpackers budget. will definitely stay again!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice comfortable rooms, with a small kitchen, equipped enough to cook a meal or two. They also have a bar and a restaurant downstairs, where you get breakfast which is pretty good. The location is unbeatable and the staff is really friendly.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location for those who want to be in the heart of the city.The hotel very clean and bed very comfortable ,very quiet hotel.The breakfast is nice, nice variety and friendly staff serving. There is always someone at the front desk to answer any questions with a smile. Would recommend!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I spent a couple of nights in that "value for money" and friendly hotel in the historical centre of Athens. Room was really clean. Hotel was literally 2 mins walk from the Acropolis Museum and metro station sth that made our staying very stressless. Fast wi-fi and happy to serve staff.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fully-equipped studio apartments meticulously clean and superbly located in the center of athens.Within the price of the studios breakfast is included.Underneath the studios there is a restaurant and a bar which offers fantastic cocktails.The service is very quick and friendly and all staff speak english.Any information you may need can be obtained from reception which is open 24 hours a day
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, very clean rooms.Easy to find, knowledgeable 24 hour deskThanks guys:)The last time I had been to athens we stayed in omonia, chalk and cheese this place is right by acropolis metro and we walked to everything within 5 min.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a couple of nights and had about a dozen bed bug bites on the second day (see the photo from the room below). Apart from this the hotel isn’t terrible but they need to deal with their bed bug issue.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is quite a nice place to stay in Plaka - temple of Zeus, Acropolis, metro and museum are all within 10 mins walk. The choice for breakfast is not much but complete including bread, eggs, cheese/tomate/ham and drinks. Each room has its own kitchen and bathroom; however, the photos on the site are a bit too ideal - the rooms are not that bright - which is fine. The bed is simple without personal plugs and curtain. At night, prob coz I sleep beside the window, I can hear the noise from their bar downstairs. It is a bit annoying but acceptable tinkling of the room rate.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our studio was very clean, comfortable, with a little kitchen and fridge, cutlery and crockery. The girl at the reception was so sweet, she checked me in 2 and a half hours earlier, cause I was really sleepy and didn't realize check in was at 14:00.Breakfast is amazing. All the staff are really sweet and friendly and helpful.Enjoyed the Karaoke night on Thursday - although after 22:30 enjoyed it from my apartment on the 3rd floor.Metros/bike tour/plaka/acropolis all close by.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Five stars for location and staff. Young people should definitely stay here or the associated backpackers. Families should also consider the Studios an excellent option. We stayed here for the second time (first in 2009). A six night stay was broken in to two stints. The first stint in room 14 = 5 stars. Second stint in room 11 was more like 31/2. Little things can make all the difference, like an airer for clothes to dry (+) or a toilet so close to the shower you have to change your whole procedure to operate successfully (-). Pre arrival support and assistance was outstanding.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The second day, in the evening, a girl from the help desk came into our room and said that she was really really sorry but we had to move to another room because her boss booked our room to a group without telling her (don’t they have a booking system???) Anyway, for the disturb she said we could have one beer for free. We refused it, but didn’t have any choice and we negotiated a refund of 10%. Better than nothing, but moving after you settle really sucks, not worth the little refund I got back, if I could choose.The same girl, after I asked if there was a place still open to buy toothpaste, laugh at me like I was retarded and say that nothing is open at 10pm on Sunday. I thanked for the info, got out and there was a mini market open right beyond the corner where I found the toothpaste.Not that she had to know everything, but say “I’m sorry I don’t know” would have been much more appropriated.The day I checked out I got back to my room at 10:30 (checkout is at 11:00), the cleaners where outside and already removed the old sheets and blanket from my bed, they moved away my clothes and my towel disappeared. When I told them they said they put it in the laundry as they thought it belonged to the hostel. I haven’t seen any other brown towel, anyway after waiting a while I got it back.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, 3 minutes to the bottom of the Acropolis. Many great restaurants surrounding the apartment. Super clean, fresh air balconies are a huge plus. Big rooms, I had a private which included a bathroom. Small bathroom, but overall very accommodating! Definitely would stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always take location and price above all; I plan NOT to be in the hotel !This was as super find; great value compared to other local options. 5 minute walk to the Acropolis south entrance and museum. 2 minute walk to pedestrian mall with a nice assortment of restaurants - the Arcadia across from the metro stop is highly recommended; walk toward the Acropolis museum from the hotel; Arcadia is halfway.The room is very recently refurbed; new bathroom facilities; floors and furniture - so very clean. Also with a small kitchenette, tho we never used it.Breakfast in the AM at the cafe next door; standard offering somewhat limited; but also a menu you can order from.Staff was more than helpful, and there 24 hours.There's a related hostel; Backpackers Studio 2 blocks away, same company. No experience there other than a nice place for an evening drink on the roof terrace wit with a great view of the Acropolis. Highly recommended for touring couples !!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel/hotel is in the middle of Athens. Right in the middle of it all. Its budget friendly and pretty spacious. My boyfriend and I booked a studio, it had 2 sets of bunk beds, a kitchen, bathroom, living room and little deck. This place has the minimum, but it was cleaned, and they would clean the bathroom every night. The facilities below include: a bar, a restaurant and laundry serviceBreakfast is not worth mentioning..The hotel does offer a walking tour with Andrew. This was amazing. We met him downstairs at the bar at 10am. He took us on a tour of Athens off the beaten path. He shared stories of the history of Athens and showed us little things only Greeks would know. This tour lasted for 3.5 hours and it only cost us 7Euro per person. I cannot recommend this place enough because of the tour it offers. Even if you do not stay here, I recommend trying to come to his walking tour.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plenty of positives - great location (walking distance from Acropolis & Plaka), clean & comfortable apartments (bunker beds, storage, kitchenette), good breakfast at Fish Café, laundromat downstairs for those who need it, Athens Sports Bar for drinks & music.....helpful staff as well!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient. Short walking distance to the Acropolis, the Acropolis museum and Acropoli metro station.Lots of good restaurants nearby and a bar with Czech beer on draught.Rooms very clean,basic but containing everything you need for a short stay.Helpful reception staff.Great value.We had a triple room with comfortable beds. Stayed 2 nights.Towels changed daily.Loses a point as the breakfast isn't great A little more effort required to provide more variety.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rented an apartment with two beds, living room, kitchen. Kitchen counters were heavily worn, and the bathroom was so small I couldn't use the toilet without keeping my feet on the side of the shower. Bed was reasonably comfortable. The apartment was right over the sports bar on the first floor and so until the bar closed sleeping was problematic. I was there at the end of high season. The individual beds are inexpensive enough that perhaps the high season pricing works better, but the apartment cost enough (about 100 euro/night) that for a little bit more I'd go elsewhere. There are a lot of hotels near the acropolis.The hotel charges extra to check luggage safely.Note the location is great. Breakfast was very good, and having a washer and dryer available downstairs was a real help.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location within walking distance for everything, the acropolis is like 10 minutes walking, the Syntagma square like 15 minutes, the temple of Zeus. Free breakfast, i didnt have time to check out the bar at the Athens backpackers, but heard it was great. This hostel has everything you need. They dont give you towels, but they give you one for 1 Euro
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is situated perfectly for the tourist. Right near the Acropolis, Museum, Metro Station and Plaka.Our 3 bed room was slightly small and the bathroom could have been better but you are only there to sleep, shower and dress. Rooms were clean and staff friendly and helpful. Would recommend
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - walking distance to most sites. Laundromat downstairs was very handy for catching up on washing. Rooms were clean and quite. i would recommend you do the Athens Walking tour starting from downstairs - gives good introduction to Athens.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens studios has it all. I love this place whenever I'm staying in the heart of Athens. Everything you could want is just a few steps away. Staff is super friendly, and the the overall experience is exactly what you are looking for: clean, budget, centrally located.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated a hop, skip and jump from the Acropolis metro station, the Studios offer visitors a wider range of options, rooms and prices. You can visit all the local historic sites and museums which are a walk away and if you are more adventurous the metro will take you to numerous destinations. You will be met at the Studios by friendly, helpful staff who can assist you to the full. Rooms are great and there is a laundry downstairs, the Athens Sports Bar with cheap drinks and an eatery which provides great food at great prices.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this place. Great value, great location, really unbeatable. Also attached to the best bar in Athens where there's a great vibe, all matches shown and generally terrific craic. Also probably the only place in Greece to enforce the smoking ban!Daniel and Eddie (two aussie brothers) run a really great place which is welcoming and very cool. Highly highly recommend.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed there in early August-peak season and we loved it. Its unbelievably central, right beside everything you need to see in Athens. Its located in the beautiful old city centre neighbourhood of Plaka , right under the the Acropolis hill and beside the Acropolis museum! The staff were brilliant. They couldn't have been more helpful and gave us great pointers on where to go, eat etc.. The studio was was spotless. very modern and clean and there are great facilities on site. We really enjoyed staying here, we walked to everything and the location, staff and super facilities and rooms just meant for us this was a fantastic choice for staying in Athens.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good, clean, safe studio style apartments. Very close to Acropolis, Metro line etc. Handy cafe downstairs for a good morning breakfast/ coffee. Ticks all the boxes this place. Staff were very friendly and helpful too which was nice.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located right in the heart of the city. Walking distance from Acropolis Museum, Acropolis, Metro Station and Bus Station, this is an ideal place to stay.Staff is super friendly and helpful.Have a restaurant and bar downstairs and a lot of restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed here before and loved it so I was so pleased this time around to see it's all been renovated. New beds, sofas, TVS. Everything new! The rooftop bar was great again, they've added new seasonal cocktails. I love that the staff are locals so they told us the newest and coolest cafes and restaurants to visit. 2 mins walk to the Metro and right under Acropolis. We slept 6 people in our apartment, you can't beat that value!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome place. Highly recommend, friendly staff, very comfortable. Great location. Excellent value for money. Had a wonderful stay. Thank you to the kind staff. The rooftop bar was a lot of fun. Got to watch sport and met like minded travellers. Was the perfect place to stay.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Please understand that this "hotel" is really a youth hostel. Do not even look the pictures they have on the internet !!! The Bathroom was filthy and almost broke my foot at night in a broken floor drain. No parking and impossible to find parking on the streets around, (had to circle 10 times and end-up getting a paid garage spot 4-5 blocks away). Slept on a bunk bed and the wife above me. FILTHY, FILTHY bathroom. The TV set was a 20" or smaller. No telephone in the room, when you pick-up the receiver of some kind of hand-set on the wall you can only hear the street noise. Only one night because it was too late to find another place for the night. STAY AWAY !!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed as a transfer night before going home. The rooms are booring, with standard bad bunkbeds. It was a mediocre experience with a not so tasty breakfast closing as early as 9.30. Staff ok and helpful.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: During check-in, we were informed 1 of our rooms was upgraded for free. We were very happy to learn that, but upon entering our rooms, we saw that the room we reserved with 2 single beds was now a room with 1 double bed, which absolutely did not accommodate our needs at all. This room was filthy and did not have a shower curtain. The shower in the upgraded room didn't have a lip framing the bottom, so the water poured out to the bathroom floor. The shower curtain was black on the bottom. A handheld squeegee is provided, so you have to push the water back into the shower area :((( The back of the sofa is repaired by black tape... the apartment was not very clean. Trash cans were not emptied nor did they leave fresh towels for our second day. Our terrace did not have a table with chairs. It was waaaay overpriced. Please note - the rooftop bar with a view of Acropolis is at another property managed by Athens Suites and is a huge disappointment. We were sooo embarrassed to have reserved rooms at this property as we were hosting international guests.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay, close to all the sights. Great rates and helpful staff. We were only there for one night as we were heading to the islands. Rooms were clean and modern. They also have a backpackers hostel down the street for a cheaper dorm stay, with a nice rooftop bar to enjoy the sunset over looking the acropolis. Go to the fish cafe next door for lunch is a must. Close to the metro for access to airport and ferry ports. Worth the stay!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect as well the cleanliness.Do not even think about to take separate apartment (most of the rooms are backpackers rooms) if you are over 195cm, as the bed is a very short, narrow a uncomfortable. The breakfast was the same everyday, nothing special. My nasal spray just "disappeared" from my room. The lady on the desk promissed to inform the hotel management, but no feedback at all. Yet the room was very clean, the furniture is very simple and boring.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We decided to stay here as we were recommended by friends. It is in a good position, being close to a strip of eateries, the metro and you could walk to all the main sites / squares with ease. There is a BBQ and drinks each night at the rooftop of the backpackers close by, which is a good way to meet people and start the evening. Reception girls are helpful and the hotel is safe and secure.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location could hardly be any better, didn't need almost any transport. Also, Margarita in the reseption had the best food advice, and resulted in a great trip.I would definitely visit Athens again, and most likely stay here again
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a couple and our adult son. Stayed in their beautiful penthouse suite. It has a fully equipted kitchen, 2 balconies, living room, bedroom and bath room. Very nicely decorated.The location is perfect : on a quite street with a great bakery and small grocery shop, 5 minutes walking to the Plaka, Acropolis museum and archeilogic park, 5 minutes away from the metro, Museum of Contemporary art and 5 minutes from a street full of good cafe shops and restaurants.The reception team were very helpful with ordering cabs, directions, etc.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is very well located in the heart of the city and very close to the Acropolis Museum and the entrance to the Acropolis. Its a very happening place - there are many restaurants, cafes & shops all around. The hotel has a cafe (Fish Cafe) at the ground floor which is open till 11pm and a bar (Sports Bar). There is also a laundry available at the ground floor. Our penthouse studio at the top floor had view of the Acropolis from the small terrace which also had table and chairs for enjoying drinks and/or meals. The kitchen was adequately equipped for short stay and tea/coffee/sugar sachets were provided. Staff was friendly and check-in & check-out were hassle free and very quick.Only cons: The free breakfast was very basic - only bread, cheese, eggs & tea/coffee and very small space. Had to pay extra for fruits! Also, there were no basic toiletries provided in the apartment and no complimentary water (these are something very basic in all hotels & apartments)
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So impressed with our stay, from start to finish. Help desk staff polite, imformative and helpful (Cat)Great location, so near to the Acropolis Metro and all the sites & facilities you need (laundry & left luggage) and safe. At the time of our stay the Fish Cafe Restaurant provided complimentary breakfast and a 15% discount off of our 1st meal and the Athens Sports Bar has a relaxing hilarious fun vibe. I love the Monday night quiz! My husband and I, as aging backpakers, didn't feel at all out of place. Our room was perfect in every way: clean, well equipped, spacious, comfy bed and a great view. So pleased we found this gem. A big thank you to all the staff.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens Studios are a great place to stay close to the action. You are near everything you need and can easily use public transportation. The rooms we stayed in were private hostel style apartments, thus the name "studios" with small kitchenette area and private bath. The staff is very helpful. Rooms where clean.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you so much for having us. We ended up staying an extra 3 nights to which we were accommodated last minute so that's was fantastic. I want to live here. Really chilled out, amazing location. Will be back!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful place to stay in Athens while traveling Greece! Very clean, modern and spacious room. Staff was very friendly and helpful with accommodation needs and resources for traveling. Bar was great fun with karaoke and trivia nights. Loved the Greek breakfast in mornings and they make a great latte! Thoroughly enjoyed the walking tour of Athens that started from the studios. Will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having just slept in a terrible hotel in Germany, Athens Studios put a smile back on our faces.Pros: The bed was very comfortable, our private studio room had a balcony, the free breakfast was basic but fresh, friendly staff, kitchen and mini fridge in the room was helpful. The location is very good, it's so close to the eateries in Plaka and the Acropolis site. Cons: the bathroom is small and with no screen or curtain for the shower the water goes everywhere. The wifi quality is poor and we often had to give up trying to check Facebook. All in all it was a good place.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The one studio type room I got was spacious compared to the standard size of rooms in the city . Clean and basic and the location was the big plus, a few hundred feet to Acropolis museum ,acropolis metro station and walking distance to Plaka . The bathroom was small and there was a strange smell that greeted me when I came in.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my third trip and my wife's sixth trip to Athens! We were referred to stay there during our first trip in April 2014 by family. Since the first trip we would NEVER stay anywhere else! The wait staff in the "Fish Cafe" are very professional and friendly and the food is prepared to your taste and is superb. The staff at the Sports Bar likewise. The housekeeping staff keep the rooms immaculate and are always around should you need anything from tissue to towels. The rental prices are very reasonable, in fact, unbeatable in our opinions! This facility is run very professionally!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a couple of days for business reasons and loved the service, facilities and staff (who have been so gentle and helpful with all my requests). Really close (literally 2 mins walking distance) to the metro station. Comfortable beds and clean beddings. Would definitely go back if i ever needed to.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hostel based on the reviews but was disappointed to find out that they basically charge you for everything from printing, to storing your bags there if you check in early. Also, I was rudely barged in on around 10am while i was half naked changing to the cleaning staff who persisted asking me if i was leaving (I was not -until the next day - my roommate had just left) they did not leave so I had to ask them to leave so i could get dressed and they left for 10 seconds and then barged back in. My roommate had left his jersey and the cleaners just threw it in the rubbish instead of taking to the front desk in case he came back to claim it. The hostel did not provide any activities - all activities were organised through the adjacent hostel (which was the hostel I thought i had originally booked). The bathroom had no toilet paper and the shower was clogged so i had to stand in gross still water. This then overflowed and was not cleaned up by the next morning so I had to use my only towel (that i also paid for) to clean up the floor. On the plus side, the beds were comfy and it was a convenient location. Probably would not stay again though.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with four friends in June 2016. Upon arriving staff we friendly and helpful, and as we initially went to Athens Backpackers - staff at both hostels were helpful in directing us to the correct hostel. We were expecting a bunk room but when we arrived we had been an apartment as they had space in the hotel - this was a lovely surprise. As a result we had a whole apartment to ourselves - this included a small en suite, a room with four bunk beds in and a large living room and kitchen dining room. This had a small kitchenette, fridge, dining table, sofa and a TV! There was even a balcony. The room was clean and spacious and perfect for our stay. The beds were comfortable and we had a nice little balcony to look out over Athens. Location wise we very close to the Acropolis that was about a 10 minute walk, as well as being very near restaurants, shops, cafes and museums. On our first night we simply walked down the street and ate in one of the first restaurants we went to - that happened to be recommended in the Lonely Planet's Guide to Athens and had very good reviews - however be careful the staff are very pushy and attempted to drag us into all the restaurants we went passed including this one. The hostel is also a 'sister' hostel to the Athens Backpackers. in the evenings we made the 2 minute walk to the other hostel a few streets away to use their rooftop bar - this had a great atmosphere and was a great way to meet new people. It also has an excellent view of the Acropolis which is great to see all lit up at night. The staff at the bar were also really friendly. The lady working behind the bar kept complimenting us and made lovely cocktails!There is also a sports bar next to this hostel that everyone went to after the rooftop bar closed. This bar although a little dingy was fun and also a great way to meet other travelers. Drinks were reasonable and the music was good (albeit sometimes a bit strange.) Breakfast was complimentary and you qued up at the fish bar in between the hostel and sports bar to get this. The food was okay and you were given eggs, bread, olives, feta and a small salad. But for the price you pay this was excellent!All in all we had a good stay at the hostel. It had a fun atmosphere and was full of young people from all over the world, with an excellent location and clean rooms what more can you ask!
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of eight, and booked 2 apartments . The apartments are nice with bunk beds in the bedroom . a small sitting area and a kitchenette with kettle , utencils and crockery. The best part is the location , It is near to Acropolis, Acropolis museum and Syntagma square. There are many cafes nearby. Metro station is just a 5 min walk .Staff is very helping .They also serve a very basic complimentary breakfast comprising of a 1 boiled egg, a bread , salad , feta cheese and 2 olives.overall it was a good stay .
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived on a day when the tiny lift had just been repaired. We were told it was operational and I got in with 2 cases - the door shut and it didn't move- nor did the door open again. There was no emergency button and no phone so I just screamed until someone opened it from the outside. We then proceeded to carry our heavy luggage up 4 flights of stairs (72 steps) to our apartment and we used those stairs for the entire length of our stay just be to safe. On entering our spacious unit we found that management had removed all the a/c remote controls "because it was November".- just not good enough when its still so warm in Athens this year. On check in we were given lots of verbal information but nothing written about breakfast hours and unfortunately we missed the cut off by 25 minutes. On a positive- the beds were comfortable, the apartment was clean and we loved our huge private balcony.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The value for money and location of these apartments make them the ideal place to stay in Athens. We could walk to all the major attractions (10 minutes to The Acropolis) and the area felt safe when we were out at night. An added bonus was the abundance of excellent restaurants close by.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were 3 persons and stayed for 2 nights in a private room. Location is perfect, the room is nice and clean, informative and helpful staff. The hostel includes useful services such as a laundry service and a storage room. However, the breakfast is very small and unsatisfying.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was just as depicted - actually even better as it had a huge porch. Service good with friendly staff in the reception. Location of the apartments was perfect for sightseeing as it's smack in the middle. Also located near good restaurants.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having stayed in many Athens places we thought that, on balance, and accounting for the price that this was a great place to stay. Comfortable without being lavish, friendly and with an outstanding location behind the Acropolis Museum, this was great. We will certainly stay again.
hotelName:
19    Athens Studios
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is very central to the main attractions, plus the Plaka area is very close too. Not only was the hotel clean, but also provided all the necessary facilities in the room for our family (microwave, refrigerator, single stove top, utensils, dish soap, etc....). The staff was very friendly, and provided great recommendations as well, which helped us make the best use of our time and enjoy our stay. Overall, I would highly recommend this place!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location near Acropolis in a very modern, clean and comfortable apartment. People were friendly and everything went very well. Good choice to stay a couple of days with your family. The price level was good and fair.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was great! The staff is very nice and welcoming!! The room was super clean and very up to date. It has a great shower with a lot of water pressure. The location was perfect. We had Such a great time here, would definitely recommend to everyone!!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went with a group of 4 and the apartment had plenty of room for everyone and their suitcases. The room was clean and modern. The location was great and within a 5 minute walk to the Acropolis area. There were great restaurants and shopping within walking distance. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Will definitely be back here again!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful experience at the Acropolis Stay Hotel. Originally we booked this hotel because it was very affordable and had great reviews and were blown away by how clean and modern it was. When we first checked in we were greeted and told to help ourselves to a shot of traditional liquor (our first time trying Ouzo). We had a pretty rough travel into town since our flight was delayed and wanted to the ground running. Literally this place is STEPS away from the south entrance of the acropolis (definitely recommend using that entrance instead of the main one) steps away from Plaka (with all the little stores). It was the perfect home base. We stayed here for two nights and it was incredibly comfortable and had an excellent location. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just checked out of Acropolis Stay after four evenings and have only wonderful memories of our experience. We felt so welcome from the moment we arrived. Acropolis Stay offered an impeccably designed room with state of the art amenities, a wonderful walk to everything location and a quiet haven just steps away from the Plakka neighborhood. There are so many hotels to choose from in Athens and we feel so fortunate that our search led us here. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While the rooms were beautiful, great location and very nice owners......there is a nightclub nest door that blasts music on weeknights 10 pm-1230 am and weekends 10pm-4am. If your a heavy sleeper, this is great otherwise it makes for a vacation with no sleep. Terrible that they are supposed to end at 2 am but have no concern for the community.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 10 adults that booked the Akropolis Stay apartments for our stay in Athens. A family-owned hotel that was modern, clean, and attentive to the needs of the guests.The place is a short walk to major attractions, restaurants, markets. It is ideal for maximizing your visit in Athens as you can return to your hotel to refresh yourself and resume.Ideal for adult travelers.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first night here, a Saturday night after a red eye flight from the US the previous night when we were all badly in need of sleep, we were kept awake from 9pm until 4:30am by the pounding beat and bass from the bar physically located next door. The constant noise was utterly horrendous, coming through the walls, floor and pulsating into the bed and pillows even through ear plugs. We were told by the (very nice) member of staff the next morning that they were not supposed to play music past 2am, but 2am is not much comfort either.Sunday night was (relatively) quieter and only until 12pm, while Monday night was silent. However for the simple fact that Saturday was so appallingly awful, and the primary thing one is paying for when booking a hotel is SLEEP, I cannot recommend this place if you are not also going to be out on the town until late, certainly not with a young family. One expects a certain amount of noise when staying in cities but this was off the charts.Which is all a big shame because the apartment is very nice, the staff are very nice and the location close to the Acropolis is great. Five stars for the place itself, minus three for the next door “Tiki Bar” equals two. Feel bad for the owners saying all this but at the end of the day they are knowingly taking money from paying guests. You can bet that it wasn’t our bad luck to be the first guests to be experiencing this.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very comfortable, friendly hotel very close to the Acropolis, but away from heavy tourist traffic. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and modern. There is no view, but that isn't an issue when you are out siteseeing most of the time. Breakfast can be ordered with room delivery, but we chose to eat out at nearby restaurants, or just make coffee and get pastries from the nearby bakery. We loved that the whole property is smokefree. Even the first floor rooms involve a couple of steos, so be aware. Beverages and cookies are available in the lobby. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it highly.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very enjoyable stay, bed was extremely comfortable, and location is within distance to acropolis, metro station, laundromat, restaurants, and hop on hop off red line bus stop, which is stop no 6.The staff is absolutely amazing, make me feel so welcome, and questions are always answered.Overall if you’re looking for centrally location, and good neighborhood, i highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean, modern and comfortable rooms. The service is awesome and the reception crew is very nice and willing to help with whatever you need. It is in the hear of athens, literally a block from the Acropolis and Plaka. Highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled throughout parts of Europe for eight weeks and stayed at Acropolis Stay for four days. It was the best accommodation experience of the trip, by far! This place is wonderful, from the new and well-appointed rooms, the location (fabulous), the cleanliness, and the staff! No matter whether it was the owners, the Receptionists, or housekeeping, every single person at this hotel deserves praise. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them. Always with a smile.Our room was wonderful, very well-appointed and designed. The bed and pillows were so comfy, which was a blessing after a day of sightseeing this wonderful city. All the sights are within walking distance and there are two metro stations, each only a 5-minute walk from the hotel.If you are looking for a place in Athens with lovely and comfortable rooms, great staff, excellent service, and in a great location, this is the place!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best service available in Athens. Vasillis and the team did a fantastic job on the planning, organizing and took all the stress out of the task. The rooms are superb, modern and super clean. The location is perfect right in the center of Athens and a five minute walk to Acropolis. By far the best hotel I have ever stayed in Athens. If you are looking for a hotel start booking. Five stars
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would highly recommend these apartments. Everything about them is perfect!..Location,helpful Owners and staff,spotless apartment,great bed and shower ,quiet at night. The Acropolis and lovely bars and restaurants close by.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't think of anything to aprove. The room is very clean with a good bed and a great shower. The staff is realy very nice, they give you a warm welcome and advise. The hotel is in walking distance of everything. You can choose one of 9 breakfast, they deliver it at your door and it's great.We highly recommend this hotel!!!!!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 10 weeks in Europe this apartment and the hospitality provided was the clear stand out. As new apartment premium bedding and walking distance to all the must sees. Special mention to Danae on reception for all her sightseeing tips, we ticked all off the list. Re-enforce comments of prior reviewers and without hesitation would stay here on our next visit to Athens.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, super friendly and helpful staff, very large room (with full kitchen)About 5 mins walk to the Acropolis museum and the Plaka, this is an excellent place to stay if you want to see the sights in central Athens. Highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel for its location and its nightly rate. When we arrived in Athens, we learned that our choice was perfect! The location made "classical" Athens completely walkable for us, which made the nightly rate an especially good bargain. The hotel is a short walk to the Acropolis Museum, the Acropolis Metro station (which we needed to get to the Archeological Museum), and the restaurants along the pedestrian way just behind the Museum. The décor was stylish, the housekeeping spotless, the bed firm, and the shower drenching. The staff were totally friendly and so helpful, especially with our later check-in, arranging an airport transfer for us, and helping with our online flight check in. We could not have asked for more perfect accommodations for our three nights in Athens.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Agree with all of the reviews and can vouch for the accuracy of the pictures that people have posted! Would highly recommend to anyone staying in Athens- short or long trip. We stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon trip before heading off to Mykonos and Santorini, and I'll have to admit - this room was nicer than any of the rooms we paid 4x the price for in Mykonos and Santorini lol! It is in the MOST ideal location - walkable to everything near the Acropolis and Plaka restaurants - pretty much right outside your door. Ideal if you are in Athens on a short stay and don't want to waste your time taking long cab rides anywhere. This is really more of a AirBnb type place (10-unit "apartments"), and the people managing it are extremely friendly and take care of their guests. If you book here, note that because it is not a traditional hotel, there is no 24-hour concierge service, and that the management leaves at a certain time. They leave their cell phone numbers in a guide inside the room, but if you have any requests, better to make them when someone is still there.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a night after a long flight, and loved how spacious the room was and melted right into the comfy bed to catch up on sleep! The location was great for a short stay in Athens when you didn't want to spend too much time traveling to get to the main sights. They were super helpful and although they didn't offer breakfast, they let us try some local liquors and there were plenty of places nearby to grab a bite. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very nice, very clean, in the middle of everywhere. The staff were so helpful and so sweet with us. It's a great experience. We stayed for two nights. The room was always cleaned and so organized. They use technology very well for security and organization. I totally encourage people to stay in that hotel. Thanks for having ys
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A short walk away from The Acropolis and Plaka. Receptionist was super helpful in giving us directions.Taxi service (Cattaxi I think it was) was the best I've experienced. Really went the extra mile for us.Would not recommend if you have oversized luggage, because the luggage lift is limited in its dimensions. In terms of food, we tried a place called "God's restaurant" around the corner. The various eateries are pretty aggressive with pulling you in and persuading you to stay. The food there was good, but that whole stretch was packed with restaurants and any of them would probably have been just as good. There's also a 24 hour food place that serves cheap and quick meals along the main road. We grabbed a takeaway at 5am to bring to our ferry.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent hotel in every way. The room was luxurious and the staff polite and helpful. If you ever stay in this hotel, make sure to ask Christiana to tell you a story, it's really worth it. Also it's in the heart of Athens and transportation was pretty easy. 10/10 would visit again.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel right in the city museum centre. Small and boutique. Everything is 5 minute walk from here. The rooms are great and even had a small balcony with the one we had. Not sure if all rooms have the balcony. Hosts are super friendly. Clean and modern with microwave, coffee maker and fridge. Will stay here again! Thanks for everything.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I have just stayed in about 30 hotels . This is number one . The staff were amazing .( thank you for printing my ticket) Love the cookies , water , juice and coffee on arrival . The rooms we the best thought out I have ever been in a hotel . We had a smaller room but we were shown the family rooms . Clean , Everything placed well , An area for everything . We slept so well . Every detail down to the Fair-trade shampoo / Body wash etc was so well thought out . Wish they had a hotel in every city .
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this place, clean and great value. Very generous staff, all very helpful. Would stay here again as perfect for a 3 night stay. Some great restaurants close by, and most importantly great coffee in easy walking distance.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my 2 kids for 3 nights. Nothing but awesome. Having stayed twice before in Athens, I have to say that this is the best place! It's a short walk to the Acropolis and the Plaka. Super quiet unlike the other place I stayed last time in Athens! The room was fully furnished and the housekeeping was superb, replenishing our teas! We had a small kitchenette with a mini fridge and microwave that I found to be super useful with my 2 kids! The bathroom was modern and extremely clean. The late night checkin instructions that I received was spot on and I had no problems. The reception staff are super friendly and helpful. I won't need to look for another place next time I am in Athens! I know where to go now!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just a few min walk away frim the Acropolis Museum, very nice place to walk around. The room we had is very clean and well designed. Thumbs up for the ID designer did a good job in fully utilise the space, making it comfortable and yet looking modern. The staff at reception are very friendly, explaining how to us the luggage elevator. We love staying in Acropolis Stay!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The perfect location when visiting Athens.Everything is within walking distance. The apartment itself is clean, modern and very spacious. The staff are friendly and speak very good english. A delivery breakfast service is also offered at an extra cost but is definitely value for money. A large breakfast portion is delivered to your bedroom door with a variety of choices for your vegan to your meat eater. Two doors up from the apartment is a beautiful bar named 'TIKI bar' the atmosphere is chilled and relaxed, it's the perfect place to stop by for a nightcap before heading back to the apartment. This stay made my visit to Athens a wonderful experience.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Acropolis stay was perfect! A 5 minute stroll to the metro, beautiful restaurants with really great food and lots of shops to browse through. Staff were super friendly and helpful. Rooms were beautiful. Nothing to fault for our stay in this hotel! Make sure you do the hop on hop off bus!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 4 had a wonderful stay. Our family apartment gave us a lot of space while in the room. Great amenities and comfortable beds!! Very modern and clean. Security measures are a high priority! The location is great. Close to Acropolis, Plaka and restaurants!! Very reasonable price too!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with affordable price. Comfy bed and the shower was amazing! Clean and modern rooms. Very close to the main sightseeing and to a metro station (walking distance). Many good restaurants in the area.Staff was very friendly and helpful. We even received a bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon!Would definitely recommend this place!The only thing is that the reception doesn’t work 24/7.. but it wasn’t a problem for us. We needed a taxi early in the morning (around 5:30am) and they scheduled it for us.. When we go back to Athens, we will stay here again, for sure!!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Acropolis Stay I am still here as I write this review as I’m returning.. This hotel was a great find. A small block of rooms in the Plaka area which has the Acropolis (the Parthenon). The rooms are new, modern bathroom, vinyl flooring which I love. Beds are comfy and room cleaned everyday with fresh linen. There was only my husband and I however we opted for the family room, which is larger with a kitchen. It’s at the back of the building so it’s quiet and though you have other buildings for your view they do not encroach on your room. The area is great for the tourist shopping and normal shopping. Vasills the lovely manager was always there to help us in anyway..
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and price. This apartment is very comfortable with modern decor and suited our family of four. Walking distance to all ancient sites from this property. We stayed at the family apartment which had queen + two twin beds.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderfully restful, quiet place to come back to after the bustle of Athens. Friendly staff, spotlessly clean, comfy beds and all the facilities we needed. The shower is amazing. Great for refreshing yourself at the end of a long, hot day on the streets.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can't really go wrong staying here when visiting Athens. For me, it hit all the marks in terms of location, access, style, cleanliness and overall comfort. The hotel is easy walking distance from the Acropoli metro station (use the main entrance on Makrigianni road, then head downhill), which makes getting around town super easy. At the same time, you are a short walk from the Acropolis and Acropolis Museum. You can also walk to nearby Hadrians Arch, the Temple of Olympian Zeus and Filopappou Hill (for a great view over Athens). The modern design studio style apartments (you have a small refrigerator, microwave and dishes) are compact, but spotlessly clean. The owners/managers are also a wealth of local information, but do note that the reception is not open 24 hours. One small drawback is street noise, which is to be expected in the heart of a big city. However, the windows do a very good job of reducing most of the street noise. Overall, a great, modern, convenient place to stay in the heart of Athens.Pro: location, ease of access, modern style, cleanlinessCon: some street noise in area
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the perfect location. It is right by the Acropolis. Metro and bus stops are a two minute walk. Lots of restaurants, shops and travel agencies nearby. The hotel has been newly renovated so all of the facilities are wonderful. Our room was always spotlessly clean. And it is perfect for a long stay since it has a refrigerator and microwave. The brothers who own it and the other employees are over the top helpful with if you have questions or want tips on what to do in Athens and Greece. Street side room can be a little noisy on weekends but Athens is a party town!
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend here a nice week. The stuff is very polite and helpful. The room is big, extremely clean, well equipped. The bath room is very nice. As you see on the pictures the place is new and modern. We did not want to cook but it can be an issue in case anyone every day wants to cook something.The Acropolis Museum is about 200m, the entrance of Acropolis is about 300m to the hotel.I can really recommend it.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having been a victim of the Monarch Airlines crash I had to rearrange flights for a planned trip to Tel Aviv and because the greedy airlines put costs up for direct flights to a ridiculous amount I thought If Im going to spend all that money I may as well look for bargain flights for a stop over for a few days. Never having been to Athens, I was a little apprehensive about these reviews but have to say like all the other travellers before me - I too was suprised at just how good this place is. The rooms were first class and the hotel is within walking distance of everything your need for a short or longer trip. 2 mins walk to tube station and 10 mins walk from the X95 bus from the Airport, and 5 mins from Acropolis , museums and open top tour bus. We Arrived late at night but received very clear and specific instructions about getting the Room Keys and entry which made our experience hassle free, the breakfasts were delivered and were of a very high standard, nutritious and the room was cleaned beautifully ever day. I cannot say enough about the high standards this hotel has and the owner being availble to advise on places to eat and local trips or transport. If Tripadvisor had six stars this would have them!!! Will be definately coming back!Clear instructions , Excellent service, high quality accomodation and close to ammenities. Very comfortable and very clean beds.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on arrival and departure from Greece and was thoroughly surprised. Staff were extremely helpful and the room was modern and super comfortable. We arrived in the morning and our room wasn't ready yet so we were able to clean up a little bit and store our luggage while we wandered. The staff recommended some fantastic restaurants as well which we enjoyed. The location is excellent, in Plaka and a few minutes walk from the acropolis site. Tons of restaurants and little shops nearby.
