I want to point out that we forgot to communicate that we were arriving late to the hotel the second time around and messaged the hotel via booking.com a few hours before we were flying out from the islands. The response was fantastic, i received an email from the hotel, a text and a voicemail indicating how we can get into our room when staff wasn't present. They went above and beyond and it was much appreciated.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new hotel located very close to the Acropolis. The Acropolis subway station is about 100 meters away.I stayed in room 8, which is a superior room. The room was spacious and had a large bathroom, which is hard to find in Athens. All the other hotels I looked at had tiny bathrooms with small showers. This one had a nice walk in shower with a rain shower head and a separate handheld piece. The bed was extremely comfortable. The A/C was very efficient and cooled the room in no time. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes within walking distance.The owners, Vasili and Thanasi (I hope I spelled the names right) are wonderful hosts. Chara, the receptionist, was very welcoming and provided useful information about local dining, shopping and sightseeing.I will definitely stay here again when I return to Athens and I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed staying here. He place is very small (just 9 units) but is is very new and modern. The apartment style room is very nice especially if you are staying for a few days. The room has a lot of space for seating, nice little kitchen and very comfortable bed. Not much of a view because of the location but very centrally located. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed our stay and plan to return to the hotel when we get back from our boat charter.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check in/out was fast and staff are helpfull,room was spacious and tidy,toilet/shower clean with good amnities,we liked the security system for the room door.Hotel location was good for us as it was within walking distance to resturants,taxis and tour buses.Acropolis and acropolis museum is a must see and within distance by taxi.All in all we enjoyed the stay in this hotel.Thanks all
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is new, and my room was perfect for a 1-night stay. I live in Japan and have a high standard of cleanliness. This place exceeded my expectations and the service was excellent. I would have no hesitation to return. Thank you.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Acropolis Stay is a great place for a perfect stay while in Athens. The place combines:*Excellent service*Helpful and friendly staff*Excellent location, near Acropolis metro station and Syggrou Fix Metro Station*Very clean rooms
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at many places in my travels but I have to say that Acropolis Stay is absolutely one of the very best! The location is perfect with restaurants and shops, very clean, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. It was very contemporary/ high tech. They even have elevator lifts for your luggage! It feels like home! I've stayed there on multiple occasions and with each time I received the same outstanding service! In the end if you're not staying at Acropolis Stay while in Athens you are stay at the wrong place.
hotelName:
20    Acropolis Stay
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, modern room with a handy kitchenette. Pleasant garden at the back of the property (but watch the mosquitos later in the day). Staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of decent bars and restaurants nearby and, although not in the centre of town, Athens is pretty compact so it was easy enough to walk to all the sights.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a quick few days of sightseeing in Athens. The host was very nice and we had all that we needed. Slightly small but being an apartment we expected that. Very central and well positioned for all the main attractions.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Late arrival apartments arranged collection from airport. The driver was excellent and helped with check in at the apartments as well as giving excellent advice on the location. Apartments are centrally located with easy walking access to all the sites.There are local bars and restaurants close to the accommodation so saves going into the tourist hotspots at night.The accommodation is adequate and clean and has everything you need.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful experience at Green Apartments. Within walking distance of all major sites in Athens but in a quiet neighborhood with all amenities. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well well equipped. The outdoor space was a relaxing place to look forward to at the end of busy days. The service was friendly and very helpful. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a night. This is a cozy, homely apartment. Great value. Very friendly owner/manager. Suggested attractions and restaurants to visit. Good location. Next door to Olympic stadium. Very good restaurants near by.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely, clean and cosy apartments, very nice décor, close to the city center and the Panathenaic Stadium. There is a beautiful small garden with outdoor furniture; and a lemon tree is definitely a centerpiece of the garden. We stayed there only one night but it was a very pleasant and comfortable stay. Our host John was amazing, very friendly and so helpful! He gave us lots of useful information and tips on local cafes and attractions. Thank you very much for making our first ever stay in Athens so pleasant!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is good; just up the stairs from Olympic Stadium. I mean that literally: there are 8 flights of stairs. It is easy to get to other places from the location. Many good restaurants nearby. The rooms are clean and have good WIFI. Staff was friendly. Would stay again.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is in a nice zone, close to the Stadium and about 2km from the Acropolis. The bed was fine, and it´s a safe place, but the rest is just so tiny. For example the bathroom is very uncomfortable, you have to use stairs to go from the bedroom to the shower and from the shower to the WC. It´s cheap, and to have a good night of sleep is ok, but expect much
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with 2 friends, our apartment had a balcony overlooking the courtyard, clean homely apartment close to popular tourist attractions and we also used hop on tour bus. Staff are more than helpful with a very useful information sheet. Their willingness to help with any query was fantasic. Free use of washing machine was also appreciated. Highly recommended. They will also do airport transfer for about 38 euro.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived here late at night after reception had closed but they had kindly left instructions on how to access our apartment. It was a bit like a game to follow the instructions pinned in various places! :)The apartment itself was very spacious & had everything we needed for the few days we would be staying there. The bed was good & firm and I got a good night's sleep on the first night (which is unusual for me in a new bed). The bathroom was large although the actual shower was a bit of a tight squeeze.The living area was lovely & spacious.Next morning we caught up with the reception staff who were very welcoming & informative & we explored the place more. There is a small shaded courtyard with seating, the laundry & a rather large lemon tree to shade the area! To be honest, I think the tree could be pruned a bit as it dominates the courtyard & affected the light that came into the apartment. Small niggle I know.The position of the apartments is perfect, being in a nice residential area with local bars, shops & restaurants nearby. Its right next to the ancient hippodrome & only about 30 minutes walk to the Acropolis. Just be careful of which way you arrive at the apartments. The most direct route can involve a climb of 75 steps to the street the apartments are on (I counted them!)All in all, it was a relaxing & welcoming place to stay & I would definitely consider booking again when I'm next in Athens.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The services of the Athens Green Apartments started before we even arrived there. They organized a driver to get us from the airport to the hotel very well situated quite near the old Olympic stadium. The reception was very friendly, the nice, clean and quite spacious rooms where introduced to us and we got a good map showing where we were, how to walk to the city center and also where to find some nice restaurants in the neighborhood. Overall, a hotel to warmly recommend!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the two bedroom which was very spacious overall and more than adequate for 4 people. One bedroom is divided from the living area by a partition and that was a bit more cramped but was fine. The neighbourhood is great with loads of restaurants and about a 20 minute walk to major sites. You could walk through the park and avoid the busy roads and keep in the shade.Maria in reception was great and very helpful and welcoming. Perfect introduction to Greece and Athens.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time of staying at Athens Green and we would really recommend it. Very clean, spacious and comfy beds! Off the beaten track, away from the tourists but still in the centre of everything.Before we arrived Athens Green made everything so easy they booked us restaurants and taxis and answered any of my questions instantly. Everything went very smoothly. the local restaurants are amazing and great value and the supermarket is great.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was excellent for a two night stay in Athens. Near a really cool square where the locals hang out with great food. The place gave us an excellent souvlaki place that was unreal. Lots of bars too. Maria sorted us out for the check in and couldn’t have been more helpful. The place provides spacious rooms, a garden, clean and modern bathrooms and comfy bed. Also washing machine facilities. What more could you want?
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: upon arriving to Athens my partner and I were so excited however unfortunately my baggage was lost at the airport. Not only did green apartments help call airports and give incredible advice, but went above and beyond to reassure me and make sure my baggage was safely returned! Gave thorough info on the area, had great recommendations for food and tourist areas nearby. Which we took on multiple occasions.Cutest little room with everything we could possibly need... having had my suitcase lost they even have a washer dryer area which actually saved my life !! I will not forget the kindest we were shown here and it made Athens shine even more than it already did. The gentleman they have picking up from airport etc was super lovely and chatty too!! My partner and I walked everywhere not too far out from everything Athens have to offer.I cannot day a bad word about this place ! I hope we get to return one day ! Thank you again Athens green apartments !
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay in good location ... just behind the Panathenaic Stadium. The apartment is just on the outskirts of the city but just a short walk into Athens. The local restaurants were amazing and so cheap. We couldn't eat all that we ordered and everything was excellent.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our apartment was quirky and odd but loved it. Had quite a job figuring out how the fans and lights worked and did not get why the pull strings on the fans/lights were so short but in the end got it sorted. Had everything we needed. Would NOT recommend for anyone with issue climbing stairs but otherwise fine. No number on our door so no way to say which apartment it was. Did not see anyone at all from staff the whole week we were there, until we booked out and got boarding passes printed which the new lady on desk has to find out how to do, although housekeeping kept us nice and clean. Managed to park car by apartment most nights except when music festival was on at Olympic Stadium! Enjoyed out stay and it was nice and handy for city centre and transport and trips.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The moment we arrived we were welcomed with open arms. Everyone was so helpful and attentive we felt like we were staying in a 5 star hotel. Very close to top sites, near amazing food. They even went above and beyond to make sure we got to our ferry on time at 6am the next day. It was completely stress free and a perfect way to visit and stay in Athens.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fab little apartment we had here. Wanted something reasonably priced but in a good location to central Athens and thats exactly what we got.20 min walk (through beautiful national gardens) and you're at syntagma square and can get to anywhere in the city.Trust the transfer the hotel offers you from the airport. Our driver was lovely and told us about some great places to eat. Only €38 from airport and drops you at the door unlike the airpirt taxis.Some steps up to the apartment building but these can be avoided by going a slightly different way.2 cute little squares nearby for bars and cafes etc. One is busier than the other for cars etc.The apartment itself was bijoux but perfect for us and well equipped. The free laundry available was a god send when travelling.The host was so helpful and cheerful everyday. Really would recommend staying here.Hint: we got the metro back to the airport for €10 per person. Very easy to do (just one line and last stop). Took 40 mins.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very quiet. Bed was quite soft but supportive and good quality. I felt that it was a bit too soft for me, but beds are very much of a personal opinion, and at least I woke up after a long, uninterrupted sleep and with no aches and pains. The room is clean and spacious. Staff speak adequate English. Location is good but it's on the periphery of the area containing the main attractions, so some attractions are far away eg the Archaeological Museum, but others are close.My only serious concern is that the rooms need a room safe, and room numbers on the doors!You can't buy bus tickets nearby but the taxis are very cheap (for taxis go L out of the hotel then L again) to avoid the huge flight of steps when you go R out of the hotel.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was a central location and within walking distance to all of the major sites. Located next to the Olympic Stadium made it easy to give taxi's directions. Taxi's are very very reasonable to all of the major sites from this site. The rooms were immaculate, nice to have an office at the location that was staffed 10-6 daily. The apartments are very spacious. Was nice to be able to watch television in the late evenings in English. The staff was always helpful and let us store our luggage on the last day until our flight time.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this apartment to anyone who comes to Athens for holiday. The person in charge of this apartment is very helpful and friendly too. Before we arrived, she wrote to us whether we need any assistance to get to the apartment and she can make arrangements for transport to take us there. The apartment is very near to the Olympic stadium, acropolis, parliament and parks too. There are very nice restaurants nearby too.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place. Clean suite with a nice balcony. Separate bedroom living room and kitchen which is nice if someone wants to sleep and another wants to do something else. TV Greek channels only but usually you can find a English program with Greek subs. Internet was good enough to live stream Kodi 480P channels with minimum buffering. Parking was difficult but always found a spot. You really don't want a big car in Athens or anywhere else in Greece. Hosts were very nice.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at Athens Green Apartments. We chose the hotel for its location. The staff and amenities were top notch! We will stay here again when we visit Athens. Spacious room, clean and comfortable. Nicely appointed kitchen. Quiet, but very near attractions and easy walk to metro.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is relative easy to find, and it is next to the Panathenaic Stadium. Rooms are clean, and tidy. Full Kitchen facilities provided, if you wish to cook or prepare your own meals. There is a small Supermarket nearby and small eateries in the vicinity.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for just one night but we were really impressed by their hospitality! Christina emailed us days prior to our check-in date and she provided us various ways of getting to the place. Her instructions were very clear cut which made everything very convenient for us. Upon checking in, Christina provided us a map around the vicinity and recommended us places to visit. Athens Green Apartment is right beside the stadium and about 15 min walk from Syntagma metro. We took a taxi from Syntagma station and it was about €8. It is also very close to other tourist spots. The room is very cozy and fully-equipped from basic beddings to kitchen facilities and private bathroom.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Experience of our stay was well above our expectations. Our cruise disembarked in Athens at the end of October 2017. We were a group of 6 and rented 3 rooms of different sizes. All were clean and comfortable, walking distance to to several tourist sites and lots of restaurants in the area. The apartment is nicely decorated and above all, the hotel staff and the owner of the apartment were very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend it to friends and family. Will definitely go back should we visit Athens again.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We rented a 3 bedroom apartment for 2 adults and 3 kids in summer of 2017. The apartment was very clean and spacious. We would have been fine with a smaller unit. There is a grocery store nearby some decent places to eat at walking distance. The view is not that great but you should not book this apartment for that anyways. This is a well managed, clean accommodation from where you can walk a kilometer to metro and then explore Athens. The taxi from the airport will cost you quite a bit. You can rent a car for less than the amount for back and forth trip. On the way out, the nice guys who was managing this property dropped us to a nearby bus stop that has an express route straight to the airport. This is a much cheaper and very convenient option. You should look at this option instead of taxi if you are coming from airport. The manager should be able to give you the route number.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely and confortable apartments. Very quiet street. Right next to the Olympic Stadium (first of the modern days (1896). Close to Central and Plaka. Servie is exceptional. Would never hesitate to go there again or to recommend.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was very good and it was a good thing to have a washing machine at our disposal (even if it is not in the apartement but shared). Having a microwave would really be a +.The apartment was quite well located, not in the centre of Athens but in a quiet place. The receptionist was very kind and helpful. The only 2 "negative" points was that you can hear your neighbours at night (so even if it is located in a quiet place, if you have noisy neighbours, you might have difficult nights) and the cleaning was not well done (and as it is done only once every 2 days, it should be done well) so we had to ask to do it another time, which was done immediately, so it was ok. A part from this, I recommend it.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I ll stay nearer syntagma square next time. We found the area a bit down trodden. It wasnt at all as i expected . The balcony view ? Well look at my pictures !!!.there were a lot of steps around the area and all dark and seedy of a nighttime
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone was super helpful. We were able to be picked up from the airport, they recommaned great resteraunts and sights in the area! It was walking distance to everything but very peaceful and quite. Would defently recommend and return again!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything you need, clean and comfortable with perfect location to all major attraction Athens has to offer. Loved the reliable airport transfers pre arranged by the hotel staff. I would rent from them again. You must try the pizza restaurant the hotel recommends, great food and very friendly service outside the touristic area filled with locals.Thank you
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Christina was extremely helpful and from point of booking was very attentive. Apartment had everything needed. Top tip-bus routes 2,4,11 from syntagma square. Nice amenities nearby, very close to national garden and Panhellenic stadium. Amazing beaches in glyfada an hour on public transport or less by taxi. Would highly recommend for people not afraid to get out and explore Athens.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room with all the necessities. Friendly staff to tell you about the city and help plan your stay. Great pick up service offered from the airport. Location is perfect, we walked to all the sites. We really enjoyed our stay at Athens Green Apartment. I booked through air bnb and they were very quick to reply to all messages. I would highly recommend to other visitors to the city.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice location - central enough without being right in the very very busy Plaka - and a very nicely done space for a family of four. Air-con throughout was very welcome. Lovely people and all very well organised. Would recommend!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice, quite, and convenient, friendly place. We got so much useful information from the staff. It's good for our travel trip. Easy too get help form staff. And nice setup for travel. We got washing machine and dryer. Very nice place.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted at the airport by one of the staff who drove us to the apartment, checkin was a breeze. The apartment we had (2) was stylish, very clean and very comfortable with room to move and thankfully with working air-conditioning. the courtyard and friendly staff (and cat) just topped it off to a great start to our Greek Holiday. Well located, easy walk to major attractions and shops.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic apartment in a quiet street in Athens right behind the Panathenaic Stadium and only 10-15 mins walk from all of the main sites. The walk to the sites takes you through a beautiful park. Staff were so very friendly and couldn't do enough for you.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm, welcoming and very supportive staff made our time in Athens even better than hoped for.The apartments are so close to central Athens yet quiet, peaceful and very comfortable.The courtyard is truly green!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well sited apartment. Very comfortable bed, nice shower and roomy apartment with balcony. Quiet area but still handy to public transport a short walk away.Very helpful and friendly staff.Great selection of great restaurants nearby.A great place t stay. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great apartment building - worth every penny. The flat is spacious, well-furnished, everything works (air con and fan are lovely after a hot day) and is pleasantly modern. The kitchen is well equipped (the complimentary fruit basket is particularly sweet), and the common area has a great laundry room with dryer, perfect for refreshing our clothes in between cities. From the hotel it's a 5-min walk to the first Olympic stadium, 10 to the national gardens and the Temple of the Olympian Zeus, 25-30 min to the acropolis. There's a metro station nearby too, and lots of little restaurants. The hostess is very friendly - sorted out our taxi pick up and gave lots of tips for us to enjoy our stay.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the true highlights of our trip to Europe this summer was our stay at Athens Green Apartments. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like special guests. All staff were very welcoming and friendly. The location is terrific - convenient yet quiet location - a great neighbourhood. Would definitely stay their again!!!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you Athens Green Apartments for making our stay so memorable. The apartment was as pictured, but more importantly your staff were amazing. The recommendations for dining options, sites, etc. were wonderful...and the extra towels (no questions asked!) were very much appreciated.We will definitely be in touch when we visit in the not too distant future.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice big rooms, friendly staff and the hotel is located within walking distance of all the Athen sights, the old town (Plaka) and great shopping opportunities.We were picked up at the airport and driven back to the airport - thank you for this great service.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful - consistently going above and beyond to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. The apartment was spacious and very clean. The location is great - close to local restaurants and only a 30 minute walk to the Acropolis. Only downside is no taxi drivers had heard of the address which at times made it more difficult to get back. Overall fantastic quality rooms and great value for money. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Athens Green Appartments were extremely welcoming to us. Being unfamiliar to Greece and Athens Ms. Christine, the lovely lady at the reception, guided us through a planned and easy route to visit the neighboring attractions. She was very accommodating and was always ready to help us with any query we had.Our room was smaller compared to your average room sizes. I would say about 15m2. This didn't bother us one bit as we were out the whole day. I must highlight that the rooms were clean and comfortable. Thank you Christine. You were a big help!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great location not far from the Olympic stadium and within walking distance to most things. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Apartment had everything we needed and even had a nice balcony over the back courtyard. Had a washer and dryer downstairs for our use. Some local restaurants and markets close by. Would recommend doing the hop on hop off bus to aqaint yourself to Athens, with a bus stop close by. Overall loved our short stay in Athens.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartment and a nicer part of Athens. Don't be put off by graffiti in Google Earth pics, practically all of Athens is covered in it. Nice room, convenient, and reasonably quiet. Staff are first rate. Recommended!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location and neighborhood are great. The staff were very friendly and the map/orientation to the hood were incredibly useful. I think this is the ideal location for exploring Athens as it is convenient for both touristic and non-touristic activities. The Mets hood is really pleasant and non-touristic and a great way to get a slice of real Athens life. The olive oil from Crete was great! Also, the laundry facilities were very helpful. Only negative comment I have is that one time the clean towels in room that were left on our beds by housekeeping were still wet. This was odd. Fortunately, we could put them in the dryer. Otherwise, no problems!
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I looked at the bottom end of hotels near the centre and they looked grotty. I found this place for a reasonable price and booked it. The staff were lovely and helpful. It was 15 minutes walk from the Plaka, We didn't use any public transport the whole visit, There was also good places to eat nearby.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although centrally located the apartments are in a quiet neighborhood next to Panathinaikon Stadion on a dead-end street, which is the reason that it is most probably the only centrally located place in Athens where you can find a parking space almost always.On Friday was the only day we didn’t find a parking place outside the apartments because there is a market on Archimidous Street, which is at the end of Agras. Be careful not to park on Archimidous Street on Friday’s because your car will be blocked and you won't be able to use it till 17:00 in the afternoon that the market is finishing.The apartment was big, clean and well equipped and he people at the reception were extremely friendly and keen to assist us in everything we asked them. Every two days there is a free of charge service, something not always provided when one books apartments or studios in a big city.We traveled as family with 2 children of 4 years old and our overall impression is very good to excellent.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment with a friend and my boyfriend and we were very comfortable. The staff was amazing and very accommodating. I arrived a day later than planned and a day later than my boyfriend. Even though the reservation was in my name, they let him have the apartment so that he wouldn't need to make other arrangements. The location is perfect as well. We were within walking distance to the super market and also the original Olympic stadium and museum. This will definitely be my "go to" place when staying in Athens.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great reception and monitoring by the staff. Unfortunately the room was not in good condition. A will located área.The wather of the shower didn't heat up and leaked from the box to the bathroom floor.
hotelName:
21    Athens Green Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed in a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment for two nights. We appreciated the size of the the place, as we had lots of room, because it also had a big living room / dining room area. There was also ample storage for clothes and luggage. There was even an outdoor private patio. The Persian blinds are a nice touch. The air conditioners were a life saver in the hot city. Had we stayed there longer, we would have appreciated more the full sized refrigerator and freezer and kitchen. The metro was very close and was a necessity in being able to find our way around the city quickly. We all agreed that it was a comfortable stay and would be happy to return there.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed in a two bedroom apartment on a recent trip to Athens. The apartments are beautiful clean and modern. Plenty of space and both bedrooms have en-suites. The metro is 100meters away and is only a few stops to the Acropolis. Plenty of places to eat around the area too. Rooftop pool is lovely for a dip with Acropolis views. Would definitely stay again
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this place almost 3 months ago.Communicated about arrival a few times, so they knew we ware coming. Booking.com says “book now pay later “ so we did not worry .Night before us going to airport they ware trying to charge my card and due to the fact that we ware sleeping 7 hours difference) and couldn’t respond to the bank to approve the transaction - our reservation has been canceled.Of course We did not know that than - first think in the morning we approved the transaction and went to airport peacefully.Long story short - when we arrived to Athens we find out that we have to look for another place ( they probably sold our place for more money because it is a high season in Greece) and still ware trying to charge our card anyway again. We end up at night staying in the scary street with fat rats in the strange place.Stay away from Mosaic , specially if it is your first night in town and you have nowhere to go .
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is fantastic. The rooms are spacious and wonderfully decorated and kitted out. The rooftop pool, albeit unheated and not the biggest is a novel addition and was refreshing and gave wonderful views over the city. There is a gym as well, which looked like it was kitted out with modern equipment. The top thing this place has above all that is the staff. Hector in particular was an absolute gentleman. Really accommodating and helpful. We had a mixup with the agreed transfer pickup when we landed. 4am and no sign so had to just take 2 taxis. When we arrived it turned out the transfer company had gotten our dates wrong. We had an hour watching the sun come up lighting up the Parthenon by the pool, and Hector got the cleaning staff to get our room ready early so we could get in to make up for it. Really great guy. The only downside of Mosaico is that the area directly around it is a little run down, and walking from here to the central area can take you through some run down sections if you are not careful - however that aside there are stops for all the hop on off buses just around the corner and these were excellent to get you into the centre. Luckily as well there are 2 fantastic restaurants just the other side of the roundabout, Alexander the great and Mironi, which made staying in this area worth it. Really fantastic food. Also if you go near Syntagma and are looking for lunch - Vegan beat and Smak were both superb. For a long weekend or city break Mosaico is well worth it.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 5 adults and 3 children aged 13-6 and we stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment on the third floor. The bedrooms were a bit smaller than we expected and all 3 rooms had queen beds instead of the third bedroom having 2 twin beds as listed in the website, but we all made do. There are only 2 bathrooms however so it's best suited for large families who don't mind sharing bathrooms. Speaking of which, some of the fittings in the bathroom were problematic, such as the holder for the phone shower which was loose. They seem to have fixed it on our last day there, but not sure if it was replaced or a short term solution.We stayed for 3 nights, and 2 full days we were out touring Athens and the Peloponnesian region, so in terms of crashing for the night, doing some laundry (washing machine and detergent pods are available in the room) and grabbing quick bites within walking distance, this apartment delivers. For proper meals and shopping however, I'd recommend walking or taking a cab to Plaka or Ermou street respectively.The reception staff were extremely helpful, and when we couldn't figure out the washing machine or Air Conditioning (which is concealed as a painting) they came up to assist. Speaking of the A/C, just point the remote control at a squarish vent which looks like a painting in each of the rooms and the vents will open up. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would come again, maybe we'll luck out and get one of their bigger rooms next time.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here with a friend and it was a great choice. The apartment was beautiful, clean, spacious and the kitchen was well stocked should we have chosen to cook much. We even got an upgrade to our room on arrival which was a lovely surprise. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful. The rooftop terrace was great although it was unfortunately too cold for us to go for a swim. Still, nice to watch the sunset with views of the Acropolis. The apartments are right around the corner from a subway station which was very convenient, although it also wasn't that far a walk into town either. We would definitely come back.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk team at this property is the best I've seen, and I travel a lot. They went above and beyond with tips for restaurants and shopping, lining up airport transportation, etc. It's a small hotel with big, clean rooms. Maid service was amazing. Nice pool and great rooftop views.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and big apartment with good value for your money. There is a pool on top of the hotel with a nice view of the city. The room was very clean and the bathroom was furnished with a tub. The bed was also great.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been there with my family few days. Everything was great. Place clean, near metro station, great location and great view from the swimming pool. Next time I'll probably stay at the same place. Go there !
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you rent an apartment, it is basically like home, just with a way better design & decor.I highly recommend visiting the top floor swimming pool, the view is breath taking & the water is crystal clear!The building has elevator, underground parking (the entrace in the parking lot is very steep, so I recommend an experienced driver to get the car in and out of the parking lot)Our apartment had 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, balcony, A/C in all the rooms, washing machine, drying rack, central heating, all the rooms & bathrooms had a lot of storage space, the bed were very big and confortable. Overall it was very clean. Also, the bedrooms are positioned in a such a way that you do not have to worry about noise.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Athens Mosaico Suites and Apartments is actually one of the best places we have ever stayed in since we have been traveling around the world. We have stayed at numerous five star hotels but seemed to enjoyed our stay at this amazing and convenient apartment. Some of the reasons that we can think of are as follow:1. The staff at the front desk are very friendly. I know this sounds cheesy. However, this is very important to customer service. The young lady that worked on the morning of 14 December was very nice and welcoming. She helped us get settled and provide us with options of what we can do in the area. This is important because were just landed from the airport and really needed good advice.2. The apartment was in immaculate condition. This is an understatement!. The apartment really surpassed our expectations.The rooms were clean with all the amenities needed. We even had a washer, dishwasher, microwave oven and a fully supplied kitchen which was not expected. We had the option to cook if needed with a full size range/oven and mid size refrigerator. The one and half bathroom made a big difference when dealing with a large family of four or more. The very large balcony was soothing and the apartment as a whole was very spacious. We felt safe about the fact that every window had automatic shutters and the garage kept our vehicle safe too.The 24 hour front desk clerk is a must and you done a superb job providing one as well.3. The apartment was conveniently located next to other five star hotels in the area. This is important because we didn't have to walk far to be picked up for our one day cruise which we enjoyed so much. We were located next to convenient stores, restaurants, bars and other shops. We could not ask for more.4. Customer service as a number one priority. Everyone made us feel welcome. We were greeted with smiles and and staff were friendly. We received daily room service with fresh towels and the service really exceeded our expectations. The apartment is out of this world in terms of technology and the internet was fast. You guys really know what you are doing and were appreciated it.A few things to improve on:1. Please keep the pool open always. We currently live in Germany and swimming is a commodity. When on vacation, we want to enjoy the swimming pool. We understand that the pool is under renovation for the better. When finished, it will be heated and will have all the best technologies. However, we want to know this before we book the apartment. This is very important to us as a family.2. The underground parking although is very safe, was a bit hard to access. We had the toughest time getting our vehicle out of your garage due to the steepness of the entrance and exit. This needs to be slightly improve ASAP. On the last day, we ended up having a local guy exit the vehicle out of the steep garage for us. We just didn't feel safe to do it on our own. Please work on this and place safety first.All in all, The apartment was a 9/10 for us. We will visit Athens again and we do plan on staying with you guys. Hopefully next time, the pool renovation project will be finished and we can enjoy the 8th floor after all. We are also looking forward other renovation projects you have planned. The location of the apartment is not the best but definitely not the worst either. We really enjoyed our stay at the Mosaico Suites and Apartments and look forward to seeing you guys again soon.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our minibus driver has trouble finding this hotel because it is in a quiet lane off the main street. When we found it, the bus could not enter the narrow lane due to the cars parked there. So we were dropped off a short distance away to walk to the hotel. We stayed in 2 apartments which were super clean and had modern decor. Each had a fully equipped kitchen with a large fridge and dishwasher. There was also a washing machine. The apartment was cleaned daily and fresh towels also provided daily. The housekeeper even helped put our laundry on the rack when we were out.My only problem was with the Security door knob. The lock was so cumbersome to unlock and we had to call Panos from reception several times to open the door for us.But overall , we enjoyed our stay there.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my husband for past 3 nights. We stayed in a 2 bedroom split level apartment as we found a good late deal.Very stylishly decorated, with apartment consisting of 2 bedrooms (both en suite), main bathroom and combined living room/kitchen/dining room. Also had narrow terrace. Well stocked, new kitchen (dishwasher, washing machine, microwave, oven, fridge freezer, kettle, toaster, coffee machine, pots/pans etc) so easy to cook. Only downside was that there was only 1 couch so tricky if 4 sharing. Would have been nice to have at least one armchair. All rooms had black out blinds and found it quiet in the block, so easy to sleep. Bed was extremely comfortable and there was air con and heating, if needed. Bathrooms stocked with toiletries and even slippers, which was a nice touch.Great location, about 2 minutes walk to nearest Metro stop and great nearby bakery (Bread Factory). My Market supermarket also nearby. Limited car parking available in the basement (although difficult drive out due to steep ramp) and lovely infinity pool on 8th floor. Staff were fantastic, lending us a UK converter and providing recommendations/local news. Would definitely stay here again if in Athens!
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were six of us that stayed in a three-bedroom apartment. It was very clean very roomy included a full kitchen dining room living area and washer and dryer. The location was convenient and walking distance to the Plaka- about 20 minutes. The staff was very nice and helpful. This is a perfect place for a family or a group traveling together. I would definitely stay here again when in Athens. Don’t have a single complaint and I do like the higher end nicer places to stay
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens Mosaico is the finest and superior experience. Staff is very helpful, suites rooms are spacious, and very clean. Cleanliness is speciality of that Hotel. Comfortable beds, well-equiped kitchen, huge terrace and swimming pool with breathtakeing view to Acropolis. This place is 100 meters from metro station Metaxourgeio, walking distance to Omonoia and Station Larissa. Near hotel you can find nice breakfast place - Bread Factory. This place is definitelly worth to stay and experience amazing time in Athens!
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife, our nearly 4 year old son, and I, stayed here for 3 nights, and we throughly enjoyed our stay.We arrived at around 9pm Greek time from the airport by taxi, and were met by a nice, smartly dressed man who checked us in quickly. His English was good, and we asked him about local amenities, and places to eat, as our young son was hungry having come straight from the airport. Nothing was too much trouble, and he ordered us a traditional Greek meal from a local takeaway , that was delivered to the room(!) within 25 minutes (and it was delicious!)The night before leaving, we had to be on the 7:30am ferry from the local port. We asked for his opinion on what time we should order a taxi, and then ordered the taxi through him, all done with minimal fuss and efficiency.RoomsThe decor is ‘upmarket’ and the room we had was extremely spacious and comfortable. The beds were also comfortable, and the room was cleaned daily.We had a two room suite, which suited us perfectly, as our little one had a room all to himself, with a double bed! Both of our rooms had electric shutters so as to keep the sun out, and the room secure (albeit we were 4 floors up!)Balcony.We had a huge balcony, which we ate dinner on 2 of the 3 nights we were there.Air Con.All worked well, and were quiet.WiFi.Worked at 3-5Mps. So if you are editing or uploading be aware. We streamed a movie or two through Netflix and it worked fine, with little to no buffering...The pool.What. A. View! Phenomenal! It is situated on the top floor and is open air. When we used it, it was either empty or had one personal using it. It is quite narrow, and at the time of writing this, it is decorated in small square blue mosaic tiles,several of which are missing. Now for me personally, this did not take the enjoyment out of using the pool, it is just something to note. It is an infinity pool with a railing to stop any ‘accidents’ out of eye line 5 or so feet away from the edge of the pool.It also has a nice corner seated area 15-20 foot away from the pool, so if you do have little ones, you can see them whilst at the play.LocationWe walked into the city centre and it took us 20-25 minutes with a buggy. We cut through the market area of the town, and were in the city centre in no time at all.I found this Hotel/Apartments to be excellent.Views 5/5Staff 5/5Value for money 5/5Amenities 5/5Location 5/5
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments are spacious and clean and the little balconies are nice. The rooftop pool with views of the Acropolis was great. Service is excellent. Centrally located with lots of shops and restaurants at your doorstep. The metro is close as well and you are three stops from the Old Town. Very well priced.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated in a very central part of Athens, this accommodation is a real find.Beautifully decorated throughout, with excellent air-conditioning and extremely modern designed apartments. We had a huge balcony which was great for drinking wine or having a few snacks. We had a 2 bedroom apartment, both having super comfortable beds and crisp linen, lots of storage place for clothes, fabulous electric shutters that made the rooms, if you wanted, a total blackout. The bathrooms were scrupulously clean, amazing shower and fab amenities. We had a great lounge area to watch tv and relax too. Kitchen is extremely contemporary with a huge fridge to fill if you so wish.The pool is just lovely. Great rooftop view, and a little area to relax with a bit of cover from the sun. Unfortunately, we were unlucky enough to be mobbed by a huge family of children, it didn’t matter if we tried to huddle at the other end of the pool, we couldn’t escape them so we just gave up and left them to rampage on. There’s lots of missing mosaics in the pool, it does look like a huge job to fix but it would really give an ultra finish to the pool once done.There’s onsite parking which is very handy. If you are not good at hill starts, you might want to use street parking. I’ve been driving for 18 years, and it really was a test to get out!Ridiculously close to a tube station, it couldn’t have been easier to get around!Lastly the staff were phenomenally kind, helpful, spoke excellent English and never tired of the relentless tourist asking a thousand questions, thank you!Can’t wait to come back!!!!
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartment. REALLY great. 3 bedroom, lounge, 2 bathroom, kitchen, washing machine, balcony, pool. Perfect !!! Centrally located, close by taxi (or walk if you want, I didnt) to Plaka, Monistiraki. Brilliant location. Quiet street, great security. Definitely stay here again. Staff all spoke English and were VERY helpful
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apartments great! New furnished, lot of space, 2 bathrooms, huge balcony. Very clean, good location, even free parking, WiFi. Pool on the roof with stunning view. Very good location, some good restaurants near the apartments. And service - no words, very polite and pleasant.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close by metro as well as hop-on-hop-off bus stop providing great base for exploring athens - not perhaps the nicest neighbourhood, but very convenient. Very nice pool with stunning view of Parthenon at the top floor - nice for a nightcap.Modern working gym with cardio equipment.Friendly staff and big clean nice apartment with internet.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good price/quality balance. Modern furniture. The hairdryer works very well. -No big mirror to check your outfit.The light is horrible.No possibility for sunbathing at the pool because there is a roof above the lounge area.The neighbourhoud is not the best. It’s nearaby the city centre but I wouldn’t wanna walk on the street alone.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These apartments are amazing! So clean and every thing you could wish for provided - and if, for you there is something missing, then just ask! We were greeted by Veronica on our arrival and she was on duty most days during our stay - she is a delight and a great credit to her employer. The apartments are well equipped, spotlessly clean and very contemporary. Literally 2 minutes for the metro station and a 15 minute journey from the Acropolis. Wonderfully situated to holiday or work in Athens. The apartments have a gym and a roof top pool - its not heated so not for the fainthearted in February, but from the roof you get a great view of the city and the Parthenon. There is a street market in the adjacent street on Wednesdays which was a delight for us as tourists. We ate in the pool bar restaurant of the Hotel Stanley on the first night for convenience and had a very acceptable meal in lovely surroundings.The apartments have only been open since November 2017 and I am sure they will be very busy with such standards. I would not hesitate to use them again if I return to Athens.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our apartment - it had EVERYTHING..... Fully equipped kitchen with stow, owen, big refrigerator and freezer, espresso machine, washing machine and iron. Nice living room with flat big screen and table for 4 people. Bedroom had great beds and a small garden infront. The receptions was so helpfull and nice, and helped us with any question we had. We found this apartment because it allowed us to bring a dog without extra charge and we could park for free in the basement under the hotel. There is a pool on the 8.th floor, but unfortunately no sun beds. You can walk to the center in 15 minuts, or take the metro 100 m. from the apartments. It is in the dodge end of Athen, but we only meet nice people. We will definitely be back.
hotelName:
22    Athens Mosaico Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and location of this hotel were excellent. The view and breakfast at the rooftop restaurant are great. Very nice having drinks with Acropolis view at night. Walking distance to many sites and to Plaka
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So close to so many monuments, antiquity, plaka, whatever. Its the centre of town.The hotel is luxurious, very grand. It holds true to its stately old world charm, whilst being a vibrant city hotel. Roof top bar and pool gives you escape from the bustle of the city. The view from the GB roofgarden restaurant is spectacular - the Acropolis is always in full spectacular view. Changing of the guard at the parliament is just across the road - get up early and see the 6am change, we did and we were the only ones apart from the guards there. Rooms are sumptuous but not large. Courtyard view rooms whilst not a special view are quiet with no city noise.Another tip if you're able - we hired Lime Scooters which are scattered everywhere with a base just across the road in the plaza, and used them to go everywhere! They made it much quicker and easier and faster, and fun!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even if you are not a hotel de Grand Bretagne resident, don't hesitate to come and have a drink at the 8th floor roof top. Very good cocktails and sherry brandies (for their lovers), posh service. An amazing sight on the Acropolis and other monuments
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My 2nd visit in Athens but this was very Luxurious & glorious stay Thank you so much to Tzortzia ( pre arrival specialist) she’s very nice and professional. On point on her dealings with her guests. Great assistance from Tzortzia, she emailed to me . What a cordial person. I was instructed to go to the Butler reception in the 6th floor whom I met Erin who checked me in and assisted by the professional butler Grorge they made sure that my dinner reservation at the rooftop lounge was confirmed I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite Thank you it’s a classic and beautiful, elegant and luxurious. I looked up at the 2 beautiful chandeliers. Gold finished bathrooms (2) windows overlooking the courtyard they gave us amenities for my birthday also with nice greeting cards ♥️ I was very grateful to be treated like VIP Thank you! I was totally amazed. Free breakfast at the rooftop lounge overlooking the view of the Acropolis & the Parliament, the Lycabethus . The next day I had spent my time at the Spa. I was toured around by Lola, I really loved the ambiance and the gorgeous elements of the whole property. Beautiful lobby, huge decor details it’s convenient location nearby hop on hop off pick up. Restaurants are available, safe surroundings. As we arrived, so many bellmen available to assist every guests . Intellectual way of catering your luggages was in a different access in order not to congest their entrance & maintain the beautiful atmosphere of the lobby. I was impressed. The elevators are classic. They have a beautiful staircase I am very blessed to experience this luxurious hotel. Thank you very much Tzortzia for your very kind hospitality ♥️Highly recommend this property to everyone.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I first stayed here in 1988 just after finishing college. It had left an indelible mark on me and my wanting to return. The chance presented itself this June as I got to stay for 2 nights. Right off the bat it was a great experience: from the friendly welcome of the porters and bellmen to the amazing upgrade to the butler servir floor. (At no cost)The roof deck has a spectacular view of the acropolis but during the day but most especially as the sunsets. The bar tenders make excellent cocktails and everyone is super friendly. We got a great dinner tip from the concierge - sending us to their favorite afte work Taverna “Ella”. A wonderful spot as well. I would return to this hotel in a New York minute.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started at the Hotel Grande Bretagne at the beginning and end of our Greece trip. We were given a suite upgrade the first time and a smaller upgrade the second. It’s a great location. The décor is certainly historic. It does feel a bit dated but modernization would lose its charm. There is good water pressure. Staff was relatively friendly. Breakfast is had on the roof which has great views of the Acropolis. Breakfast itself was average though lots of options. We skipped it the second day and upon our return visit. The location is central to both Plaka and the Acropolis. It is also next to the parliament building which we understand can lead to demonstrations out front. But we didn’t have to deal with that while there.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is beautiful and elegant. The furnishings are gorgeous. The spa and restaurants were wonderful. I had a great stone massage. Also enjoyed the rooftop pool.The service was prompt and attentive. I would highly recommend this hotel if staying in Athens.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Grande Bretagne is a true classic. The hotel was beautifully decorated, marble in the main areas as well as the rooms was a treat. It is both formal and friendly at the same time and very welcoming. Our two night experience was a delight. Our room was very large for a standard room, plenty of space for 3 of us. Bathroom very clean with fantastic products. Breakfast both mornings was delicious. This meal takes place on the top floor with incredible views of the Acropolis and is a great spot to enjoy your coffee. Athens is very hot this time of year so we toured in the morning and spent the afternoon at the outdoor pool. Pool service was amazing, our lunch was fantastic and they always kept our water glasses filled. The attention to detail is amazing at this gorgeous hotel. One morning I even saw someone dusting the tops of picture frames in the hallways. The concierge team was very helpful booking taxis, tours and making dinner reservations. Location could not have been better. I hope to find another reason to go back to Athens so I can stay here again!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Magic views of Akropolis and authentic Greek cuisine twisted with a modern touch. Liked the Fish filet and the risotto. Very good value for money due to the freshness of the ingredients and the location.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whether you’re here for the first time or you are a frequent visitor the Hotel Grande Brittain is one of the staples in AthensRight across the street from the house of parliament if you’re lucky enough to get a balcony you can watch the unforgettable scene of the changing of the guard at the tomb of the unknown soldierAnd on Sunday mornings at 10 o’clock you can watch the formal changing of the guards as they march through the streets on the way to the tomb of the unknown soldierThis hotel puts you right in the middle of Athens within walking distance of everything including the shopping district in PlakaAgain one of the staples in Athens if you’re going to be here for the first time or you are a regular visitor you won’t want to miss this landmark The staff treat you with impeccable precision and Service you would expect from a five-star hotel anywhere in the worldAnd while here make sure you visit the rooftop garden or you have a beautiful unobstructed view of the acropolis the house of parliament and all of Athens
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the history of this impressive landmark! Coupled with the professionalism of the staff and the small, thoughtful touches by management made this a decadent home away from home. Ask for a room with views of the Acropolis for that extra special experience. Butler service is available.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed two nights at this historic and beautiful hotel. While classic in style, the hotel is fully updated and modern. We got an upgrade to a deluxe room, which was really very nice. Comfortable bed, quiet, wonderful bathroom with separate shower and tub. Premium amenities and fluffy towels. Service is a distinctive mark here. We felt cared and pampered, just like royals...Perfect location in Athens, right across the Parliament building, walking distance (if you don't mind walking about 20 + min.) to the Acropolis, Plaka and major attractions. One block from main shopping area. As it was quite hot, we returned early and went to the pool, on the top floor. Pretty crowded, as it is not too big. The best sunbeds ever! There is a bar and some light lunch options. Don't miss the restaurant with the view to the Acropolis. Outstanding dining experience.We didn't have breakfast at the hotel. We crossed the street over to Paul patisserie.If ever again in Athens, we'll return to Grande Bretagne!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed 2 nights in this amazing hotel. Service, rooms, food and a great location. It is worth the hefty price and I would highly recommend for anyone who visits Athens. And I strongly suggest you splurge on the rooftop restaurant which has a breathtaking view of the Acropolis while enjoying a great meal. If ever in Athens again, I would only stay at this hotel. A true 5 stars.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to the roof garden to cool off during the hot afternoon and had great cocktails and wine with an impressive view. The staff are incredibly attentive and the menu great. We would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An oasis in the heart of Athens! It's hard to say enough good things about this hotel. This is a hotel on a grand scale. It feels a little bit like Hearst Castle inside. Soaring ceilings, gilt furnishings, an elegant lobby, richly appointed rooms, and enormous marble bathrooms. You feel spoiled here. The staff is amazingly solicitous too. We once were asked if we would prefer black linen napkins so that the white linen wouldn't leave lint on our clothes. The location is awesome: right next to the parliament building (where you can see the changing of the guard) and an easy walk to the Parthenon (ten min or so). Now let's talk about the view. This will probably be the thing you remember most about this hotel. It's, in a word, unparalleled. When you walk off that elevator into the dining room on the top floor, your jaw can't help but drop. There is the Parthenon in all its glory, sitting perched on its rocky outcrop, like it's there for your own personal viewing pleasure. Of course it's not, and all the other guests clamber for the tables next to the railing for the best view too. The staff does their best to accommodate, and really, EVERY table in the dining room has an exceptional view. One evening we wanted a reservation to dine at dusk so we could watch the Acropolis light up as night fell (truly magical). The Grand Bretagne could not accommodate us so they got us a reservation at their sister hotel the King George just right next door. It was equally luxurious and the view was just as spectacular (maybe even a little better, if possible). It was a night we’ll remember forever. The daily breakfast buffet was as grand as the hotel itself, with a stunning selection of options. And of course, they were happy to custom prepare anything for you if you were not satisfied by the overabundance of food already in front of you. There was a nice pool with wonderful views of the Aegean and a bar where you could order snacks and drinks. This was a popular spot and it was usually crowded (good luck finding a lounge chair). All in all, 5 stars!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed twice at this hotel with 6 weeks in between my stays. We wanted an acropolis view and extra space so we paid for the Butler floor Acropolis View room type. We were allocated a great room 602, if my recollection is correct, and it was supersized.Breakfast and Dinner on the roof was great on our second stay because it was warm enough to open all the doors - bliss fresh air and an amazing view.On 1 stay there was a tour group at breakfast which was frenzied and unpleasant.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great historic property with tons of atmosphere. This hotel has a wonderful history with many of the original features well preserved and even still in use. Location is perfect. Service is exactly what you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Our room had a small balcony with an Acropolis and Parliament view. We were on one of the Butler floors which gave us a special check in and access to a butler. We haven’t taken advantage of those services yet.The room is a bit on the small side and hard to move around our luggage! I should pack less for sure! Bed comfy good a/ c and nice bath. Breakfast was included and the view from the restaurant was spectacular and a must visit. Harry was fantastic server and took great care of us! Tell him hello from me!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our first trip to Greece and we are celebrating our 35th wedding anniversary, so we wanted to go all out. We selected the Hotel Grande Bretagne for its location, its history, and its grander. Our stay was just what we expected and more. Located in the heart of Athens, we had it all. The roof top restaurant’s views are breathtaking as you look up at the Acropolis and then down to the Parliament. The food, the wine, and the service were 5 star. There is also a roof top pool where you can unwind from a day of touring the many sights of Athens. If you are planning to go to Athens, the GB should be your first choice.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights at this beautiful, classic hotel with updated rooms. It's location is ideal; opposite Synatagma Square and very close to the Greek Parliament, Many restaurants, shops and ancient sites are an easy walk, as is the beautiful National Gardens. Breakfast is served at the rooftop restaurant which has views of the Acropolis. Plenty of space in rooms with a modernized bathroom. Very helpful concierge staff.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrive in style, live in style, eat in style. This Hotel has it all. Wonderful location, rooms with a view, friendly staff and old world charm. The check out was a bit difficult because of prepayment and hefty in house charges but all was handled in the end. There is no better place in A.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First thing everyone said when they heard we were going to Athens was, "Oh, you don't need to spend more than a day there. It's ugly and seedy". That was NOT our experience at all. Interesting, shining city with unimaginable history and rather vibrant. Grand Bretagne is in a great location: easy walking distance to all kinds of activities including Parthenon; gorgeous city park; public transportation; Greek Parliament; embassies; high end shopping; tons of restaurants. The hotel itself is quite grand and staffed with courteous, professional personnel - everyone from front desk staff; concierge; poolside; restaurants; housekeepers. Rooms were well appointed. Bathrooms were large and had both luxury tub and full size shower. We were on the second floor facing the square and had a birdseye view of Parliament's Changing of the Guard. People would line up about a half hour ahead to watch. We had an unobstructed view from Room 210. Rooftop pool is nice size and fun. Full bar includes snack food. Full service restaurant serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Cannot convey the jaw-popping view of Acropolis and Parthenon. If you can't stay at the hotel, do at least check out the rooftop for a drink at very least. Well worth it. And restaurant staff was solicitous, courteous and knowledgeable. Our daughter has a dairy allergy and they were so helpful revising the menu to suit her. Also went to Alexander's Cigar Bar. If you look closely, you notice the netting they have covering the "open air" roof to prevent mishaps with birds. Quite a nice touch, really. Gym well-appointed. Great hotel for families, couples, friends, business. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was totally worthy of star classification. Had room facing courtyard on the 3rd floor and sleeping was a dream. Maid service is outstanding and amenities are amazing. Is breakfast worth 35 Euros - no. Especially if you are not a big breakfast person. Actually, none of the food is worthy of their prices so don’t focus in all meals here. Augment with incredible places near this central location. Ports for cell phones but my adapter didn’t fit “sunken” plugs. Hotel adapter fried my curling iron. if you are on a cruise and want a true 5 star? Then stay here. Being a Marriott member is an added perk! I’ll be back next visit!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I enjoyed 4 nights here and would return again when traveling back to Athens. The rooms were exceptional and comfortable. The service was excellent and prompt. The concierge provided valuable information about local sites and restaurants. It was centrally located with easy walking distance to the main historical sites and shopping district. This was a great hotel to end our final days of our trip.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While many 5 star hotels we’ve been to often ask that famous question “what else can we do to make your stay better?” but often fall short of delivering “5 star service”, GB has amazingly succeeded in every way! I give high praises to the management for delivering flawless 5 star service that seems to always anticipate and exceed my expectations. It is the consistency of every single service staff from maids saying hello each and every time they see you, to the restaurant staff who never let your water glass come close to being empty or an empty butter wrapper to even sit on your dining table for more than a minute and the pool staff to immediately come assist with towels before you even sit down. I commend such exquisite consistent service. Rooms and locations can not be beat. We were here for 5 nights and are Titanium Elite with the BonVoy program. We’ve stayed at the best hotels in the world but by far GB has left an impression that leaves me wondering why are not all 5 star hotels following GB’s lead?
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Given a great amenities, a nice room at 7th floor with butler services and just a floor up GB Restaurant with a great table reserved beforehand (Great Acropolis View). We’re having a good time here now sipping it’s free tea drinks and a lot of delicious cookies served to us and we feel very special with a free expensive champagne waiting for us right now. This is what we call vacation... Highly recommended... Kudos to all the Staff
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful experience! Hotel is located in a great part of town, easy walking distance to everything. Rooms are lovely. Cigar bar was very nice to relax and have a drink after a long day. Outdoor pool is an extra bonus given the heat. Rooftop restaurant is a must, stunning views, terrific food. Staff was very nice and helpful. Highly recommend to stay here!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was one of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed in. The location is superb - walkable to all of the historic sites and near to the charming shops of Plaka, across the street from Syntagma Square which is a lovely little park. From our balcony we could see the Acropolis (and watch it be hit by lightning one of the evenings we were there!) and watch the changing of the guard with their funny shoes at the Parliament. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous. Our room was well appointed, the bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was unbelievable, all in marble and up-to-date yet superbly elegant. The rooftop bar was expensive but where else can you enjoy a cocktail while looking at the Acropolis? Breakfast was served there as well, not included but well worth paying the extra - it was a delicious buffet with everything you would expect along with local favorites. We booked the hotel through our Virtuoso travel agent and received little extras like a complimentary lunch and a small bottle of liqueur in the room, not sure if they do that for everyone. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I had just 2 nights in Athens and we are so glad we chose this hotel. Athens is busy and hot in summer and we wanted a hotel we could escape that when needed. We are also used to staying in the best hotels on our travels and cannot recommend this one highly enough. We chose this hotel for its location and old colonial British design as we are not fans of modern architecture. The service is 5 star and the attention to detail is just amazing. Probably one of the best pool spas we have experienced We extend our thanks to the staff at Hotel Grande Bretagne who have made our stay perfect.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After watching the changing of the guards at the Hellenic Parliament across the street from this hotel, we decided to have a drink at this relaxing rooftop bar. We got lucky with the 2 seats with the best views of the Acropolis. The drinks are pricey but worth the nice setting and the great views. The service was also stellar.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
