review_body: Our stay was perfect. The location is great and the rooftop restaurant providing views of the acropolis that are the best in Athens!!The room was comfortable and well appointed. The staff are very attentive and happy to assist with recommendations and making reservations. I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is to die for, but I’m giving it a 4 star because my room smelled like smoke. The hotel is spectacular and simply beautiful. The staff was kind and service was superb. The rooms were great but I was placed on the 2nd floor room 253 and because the cigar lounge is on this floor my room reaped on smoke through the vents. It was disturbing because I have bad allergies. They said they were full so I had to endure the smoke so for this reason I’m giving them s 4 star. I advised the rep at the front desk when checking out and they still charged me 4 euros for the city tax or something. I thk that wasn’t good customer service because they shouldn’t have charged me for that night stay since I was sick from cigar smoke. Oh well I find other countries don’t treat you like the USA when things are just right. I would stay here again but I wouldn’t dare stay on the 2nd floor. I would request a higher floor. Everything else was spectacular.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very beautiful hotel and one-of-a-kind view of the Acropolis, however, the staff was incredibly stuffy. They won't serve coffee or desert to anyone outside of the hotel, as it's "reserved for guests only". Never heard of that in my life.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Besides being beautiful, the hotel is very centrally located. You can walk almost anywhere you want to go. We ended up on the 6th floor and had a butler to help us with reservations and such. The view from the 8th floor restaurant is spectacular. We only ate there for breakfast and it was good. From our room with a balcony we could see the Acropolis and Parliament to watch the changing of the guard.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: simply amazing. great view, location, food, staff. Everything says luxury about it, Was there on business trip and the business part was excellent organised, the staff very present at all times to meet all our demands
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It seems rather challenging to find truly 5 star experience in this part of the world. This hotel is no exception. The room was ok. clean, specious enough, lovely view and very god bathroom. However the rooftop swimming pool is the worst I have ever seen. Small, overcrowded, terrible service and the food is inedible. The other 2 restaurants had good service, some good and bad dishes, like playing a lottery actually, you never know what you are going to get. The wine selection is limited but acceptable. The view of the rooftop restaurant is mesmerizing, especially at sunset. The location is perfect if you are on the mission to discover the town. I would probably stay again, just skip restaurants next time.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed using Marriott points, and since I am Platinum, we’re upgraded to a suite on the concierge floor. The room was impeccable.I was pickpocketed on the Metro on our way into town, and the hotel staff was extremely helpful in assisting me on this and other matters. In fact, it is the best concierge service we have ever received.The rooftop dining room has an unparalleled view of the Acropolis, and the food was great. Service was of the highest standard.We will absolutely stay here on our next trip to Athens.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has everything - proximity to the most interesting tourist sites, very comfortable and spacious rooms, an amazing staff and a great roof top with perhaps the best views of the Parthenon, Parliament House and the ancient Olympic stadium. The concierge staff is particularly helpful and they were able to find us a great licensed guide at very short notice. The only suggestion I would have is for the rooftop restaurant to have more vegetarian choices.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good hotel, spacious rooms and very friendly staff. The location is superb. The breakfast buffet could be a bit richer in choices but otherwise we enjoyed our stay very much and will definetly come again.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Grande Bretagne combines all of the best things, from a brand new modern hotel and a historic hotel. The finishes and the cleanliness were top notch and the location was right in the heart of anything you’d want to go to. Service was impeccable - quick, helpful, and accommodating. We had mentioned in our booking that we were celebrating our anniversary and were greeted by a bottle of champagne in our room upon arrival. The rooftop restaurant’s breakfast is recommended. Best we had in all of Greece for our week long trip. We also ate at the restaurant for dinner. Once again, we were met with excellent service and they even gave us a special dessert for our anniversary. A huge plus was they gym access. It was spacious and well equipped with dumbbells and all the machines you'd need.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is probably one of the oldest buildings of Athens. The location is perfect even there were demonstratioms and the doors of the hotel were locked for security. Shops are very close and the restraunt on the 8th floor had the perfect view of the city with Acropolis in the background. Our room was small for a family but there are really nice rooms. The style of the hotel is very classic, which i like a lot. I would like to stay there next time but make sure the size of the room.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just stayed at the Grande Bretagne for 2 nights and my stay was just Magnificent!!!Despite being completely full the previous day, I got an early check in at about 10:30am. Using the mobile app I received the notification and was able to jump back to the hotel, refresh and head back out. Room was elegant and super clean. Bed comfortable. And the bath was the perfect size and depth to really enjoy it.Breakfast was fantastic with the amazing view of The Acropolis.But the most important thing is the staff. So many and I can’t really name all of them. But they all knew my name, smiled and offered assistance every step of the way. I would point out Mina, the butler, that resolved a small issue in about two seconds (three other people couldn’t). As well as George, the head butler who was extremely helpful and informative. You can really feel his connection and love to the hotel... Thank you for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for two nights as part of a Costco Greece My Way vacation package.We were in Room 640. Overall, our feeling was that this Hotel was in the top two or three hotels we have ever stayed at arounf the world, it was fantastic!Great location, excellent room, bed and bathroon. Concierge Service on our floor with separate check-in. Fantastic restaurant with the best breakfast buffet we have seen on our travels. Great views of the Acropolis. As for the staff, we got excellent service from Pavlos, our waiter at dinner, what a great employee he is! Also at breakfast, Filippos did a great job! Another super employee.We would highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice hotel with amazing view highly recommend.All the staff was very nice and polite . i love this hotel because of its location. It is very central and you can visit the main monuments by foot .thanks
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn’t stay as hotel guests in this very luxury hotel on Sygmanta place (prices up to 600€ for a night) but visited the rooftop bar of the hotel. There’s no entrance fee, you have an amazing Akropolis view and parliament view but you will pay the price with your drinks. Average price for cocktails, Aperol Spritz etc is 16€ per glass, cheapest drink is a small beer for 8€. But it’s definitely worth it, a must see and do when in Athens.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was booked as part of a pre cruise package and I was delighted with the location as on previous trips we have been a long way from the city centre. The location was perfect, so many places within easy walking distance.We had a deluxe room which was very tastefully decorated and had a lovely bathroom which had a huge shower. Bottled water was provided and there were tea/coffee making facilities, the latter hidden away so we didn’t find them until too late.Breakfast was included and served in the roof top restaurant, buffet style but you could also chose from a menu, there was a good choice. The best part really was the stunning views over the city towards the Acropolis. This would be my first choice on a return visit to Athens. One of those places I was sorry only to be staying one night.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This exquisite city centre five-star establishment is quintessentially English in its approach. The name means Great Britain. Shear luxury in every way possible. I could not find anything I would change and the view from the GB resturant is stunning. Its expensive but what you expect to pay for this standard of service. I didn’t try the Beluga Caviar at 528 euros a portion. Pure perfection.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What could one say for the greatest and most beautiful, classic and elegant hotel in Athens?? If you need a pampering treat, think no more! Just enter Great Britain hotel and don’t walk out! The must do: definitely visit the roof garden for the incredible view and amazing cocktails and absolutely taste the lobster burger in the ground floor restaurant!!!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is in the best location and in a historic building. It is the hotel for diplomats, country heads and anyone who demands the highest standards in city hotels.Rooms are adequate as it is the Gym. What sets it apart though is the excelente service in all departments and the amazing rooftop for breakfast and after dinner drinks with the Parthenon views. Breakfast is one of the best worldwide in quality and variety and Butler service is exquisite. It is a hotel that sets standards
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel was truly as fabulous as ever-and I really appreciated the warm and pleasant welcome that I received. This is a luxury establishment that cares about all guests and takes the time and trouble to check how you are doing. I adored the Junior Suite I was upgraded to (373). I loved the winsome wee touches such as the miniature complimentary bottle of almond liqueur from Kefalonia that was on the sideboard. Room Service was of a great standard and I really recommend the succulent and flavoursome lamb souvlaki.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel on point and was upgrade to a jr,suite , which was beautiful. Personally we loved the hotel and location near plaka. The roof top restaurant for breakfast was great since you can see the Acropolis in the distance. The food was excellent
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This well maintained grande dame of a hotel deserves its ratings. The rooms are pkeasant and comfortable, the staff plentiful, well-trained and helpful. The central location helps but it is the view of the Acropolis from its top floor Terrace restaurant that makes it outstanding. That and the baba au rum dessert.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was out first time in Greece and we only had 2 nights in this wonderful hotel! Our room was beautiful and opened into the courtyard. The restaurant on the 8th floor has a breathtaking view of the Acropolis and we were able to watch the changing of the guard! We had dinner there the first night and lingered long after our meal was finished. The breakfast buffet in the same restaurant was delicious - from the omelets made to order to the lattes. Service was impeccable. Harry was one of our waiters and could not have been nicer. Our room was kept pristine by housekeeping and we wanted for nothing! We walked everywhere...perfect location!After we left, we realized my husband forgot his coat. I contacted the hotel, they found it and are shipping it to our home! WOW! Amazing in every way! Thank you!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maybe the best hotel in the center of Athens. Nearby the metro station and with very easy access. The room was excellent with an amazing view of Syntagma square and The Acropolis. Roof bar is absolutely incredible with choices of many signature cocktails. Staff was very kind and polite. We enjoyed our stay and it’s gonna be our first choice when we came back in Athens.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our food, but it really is the view and the service that made this a great dinner. The sommelier was very helpful for I wanted to have a glass of Greek wine and he brought two wines for me to try.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Grande Bretagne, A Luxury Collection Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens has been a great vacation! Home and Poetry made it so special. Dimitra welcomed us and Natalie was a bonus. As well as Athena. Wonderful hotel in a picture perfect location! When may I come back?!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at 1.30am having had the flight from hell delay from Edinburgh to be met by a lovely looking building with a closed door and a key pad. Naturally tempers were fraying and I couldn't find the booking papers, but the door opened to be met by a friendly face and we were swiftly conveyed to our Junior Suite! The Hotel is immaculate, staff very friendly and helpful. It's in the ideal location at the bottom of the Plaka within very short walking distance of all the major sights. Breakfast on the roof top just sets it off... try the Greek Omelette! Both Continental and hot options, with cereal, bread, yoghurt, fruit,all help yourself. There's a safe and fridge in the room (complimentary bottled water), hairdryer and all the usual toiletries in the bathroom. Never had a problem with the hot water in the shower and the bed was comfortable and air conditioning spot on. This is a lovely boutique hotel, the staff are amazing and having stayed at the Athens Was previously, I know I'd come back to Home and Poetry anytime. The only thing the room lacked was tea and coffee making facilities, but it wouldn't stop me coming back, as the view from the roof top with a Coffee beats the room any day!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot remember staying at a hotel where the staff was so genuinely friendly and accommodating. We had breakfast on the rooftop every day and it was exceptional made better by the view of the Acropolis.The hotel was newly renovated and our room was exactly what we paid for. If we had any complaint it was the shower. Difficult to get warm water but when you did it was great :-) The location was perfect if you want to site to see the old city. Restaurants, the Acropolis, the park all within easy walking distance. We would come back on our next visit!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small and friendly boutique hotel right in the heart of central Athens.Comfortable hotel with nice rooftop bar.Breakfast was okay and plentiful if not amazing and the evening meals were basic but fine. If you’re looking for gourmet food then eat out but for location it’s ideal. Price was slightly high in my opinion but it’s right in the heart of the city so I guess it’s justified. One criticism would be the bathroom shower which was temperamental with no hot water on one occasion but other than that it was all good.Enjoy.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this small boutique style hotel, located in the heart of the Plaka. Metres from Hadrian's Wall and within a short walk of the Acropolis, it ticked all the boxes for us. The room was generous and well equipped, and our bathroom was enormous. Brekky on the roof top terrace was excellent, as was the view of the Acropolis. We loved that everything that you go to Athens for, was within walking distance. We found the staff to be lovely, super friendly, welcoming and full of all the information that the tourist needs.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My recent first time stay at Home and Poetry (fourth visit to Athens) was great. I picked this boutique hotel because of the location, short walk to Acropolis entrance , to numerous shopping stands, cute little tavernas. I like the history behind this building and inside decor. Can not beat delicious, generous breakfast on the rooftop with stunning view of the Acropolis. Such a treat. Thank you ladies working the breakfast area for making our fresh eggs and omelettes from scratch. Separate thank you to the check in team and especially THANOS ! So welcoming, so friendly, trying to make your stay as comfortable as possible. We had a little hick up the first night, and Thanos resolved the matter in the BEST, professional manner i am so grateful Thanos. Many thanks to you. Because of it, i would stay at Home and Poetry again and recommend this cute boutique hotel to others. Very good value for the price (and i stayed in a quite few hotels in close proximity ). Taking this opportunity, i wanted to recommend taverna Saita 5 min walk from the hotel. This was recommended to me by the bartender at Brettos (another MUST in Plaka if you like good ouzo or wine, they have extensive list) and boy did we enjoy. Locals eat there and it’s family owned and operated, that baked Aubergine is out of this world. Felt like at home among the family dinner. And there is cute little Greek Orthodox church right next to taverna.Yamas !
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in really fantastic location, with plenty of restaurants, shops and museums around. The Acropolis museum and entrance to the Acropolis are just around the corner. The staff was very friendly but did not offer any recommendation for restaurants, what we found a bit unusual. Our room was on the 3rd floor and the water pressure in the shower was not very good.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a hotel that bought a bad review for keeping my $200 without even trying to provide a solution. Stay away from them, there are many better hotels with better customer service and more friendly.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this great place lovely family room breakfast on roof terrace with view of the Acropolis freshly cooked breakfast or continental staff most helpful spotless housekeeping,location in Plaka second to none would definitely return
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My parents,daughter & myself stayed in the attic room which was absolutely wonderful. We had such a wonderful stay at this hotel. The location was perfect for visiting all the major points of interest. All the staff we came into contact with were so helpful. We all agreed that we would definitely return
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was spacious. The location is second to none (a quarter mile from the Parthenon). The morning breakfast was tasty and great place to interact with other travelers. I am definitely returning to this incredible hotel!!!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved my stay here! Super friendly and helpful service staff! So eager to serve, helpful and kind! When me and my boyfriend walked past the receptionists room, they ALWAYS acknowledged our presence with a warm greeting! Super satisfied. Very well done and many thanks to Home and Poetry!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a central location in down town Athens this is the place to stay. Rooms are spacious (went for the suite) and very nicely decorated. Rooms are clean too. Staff are super friendly and accommodating. Breakfast is served at the roof top overlooking the Acropolis (amazing!). Breakfast is generous with a lot of variety. I can only highly recommend this place. If you are looking for a very central location in Athens, this is the place to be.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this little hotel!!Very friendly and helpful staff, lovely clean rooms and a great breakfast...An easy walk to many of the great sites in the city and very close to the subway.As a single traveler I felt very safe here.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A newish (April 2017) boutique hotel with a near perfect location, literally on the edge of the Plaka. Our junior suite was beautifully appointed, although a little quirky being over three connected levels. The rooftop Bar/Restaurant with outstanding views of the Acropolis and city is small but like your own personal space. Service is smart, friendly and helpful. A welcome change from the 'Chain Hotels' which lack the individuality of this establishment.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were really nice but too small for three people to sleep in. Lovely location - right in the middle of placa and a 5 minute walk from the Acropolis.-I would recommend not eating here as there are so many authentic Greek restaurants but is nice for a drink -I would recommend 2 rooms for 3 people (need space)-Overall enjoyed expierance but wouldn’t stay for more than 3/4 days.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for three nights at the end of September. The location is great and near the Plaka and getting to surrounding areas by foot. I do not recommend the room I was in which was called "Eggonopoulos" ( a poet-thus the name of the hotel) which is the first room at the top of the stairs as you enter the building. It is loud as folks enter and leave. The street itself is a bit noisy too but manageable for me with ear plugs. It is close to the Plaka but has cars and a fair amount of foot traffic. The WiFi was not great either but not a deal breaker. The breakfast area on the rooftop is small given we got a rainy spell and they could not accommodate seating for all of us trying to leave in the morning for various locations. I am sure it is lovely on the patio if the weather isn't rainy (or windy). The food breakfast was substantial and good. Overall a fine place to stay and FYI there is no gathering place/lobby to meet anyone or sit and visit other than your room or maybe the rooftop area if weather allows.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for a one night stay before flying back to Australia. While it is a pretty hotel in a good location and the staff were generally attentive, the sound proofing is very poor. All night we could hear people going in and out of the front door, walking up and down the stairs and dragging luggage down the wooden floor hallway. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you want a peaceful nights sleep. Overall a bit disappointed really as its not that cheap.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel while in Athens on the 26th of September for a stay on our return trip on the 22nd of October. Three days after booking we found our flight had changed and we would no longer have an overnight in Athens. Three weeks notice. The management while polite were unsympathetic and insist on charging a 100% cancellation fee. No option for a future credit nothing. They are laughing all the way to the bank.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly located at a walking distance to the Acropolis (about 10-15 min walk) However, the roof terrace has a fantastic view of the NE side of the Acropolis. All the great restaurants are also at a 5 -10 min distance walk. If you are staying here, most likely you don't need a car! HERE IS THE "BUT PART" IT is also located at a noisy corner. Our room was at ground level and the misfortune of also having very noisy second floor neighbors. Poor insulation... Soo, ask for rooms on top floors. Suites are large and beautiful. Beds are super comfortable. I particularly enjoyed the delicious complementary breakfast every morning at the roof terrace with the spectacular Acropolis view.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I stayed for one night before leaving Greece. From the check in to drinks with a view of the Acropolis to the location, this hotel was wonderful. Excellent AC, just steps from the Plaka and simply quaint and lovely. I can't recommend this lovely location enough.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found a great deal for Home and Poetry. It was a short stay before we headed to Sifnos, but we were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful it was. The hotel being perfectly located in the heart of the Plaka under the shadows of the Acropolis is magical.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is pure perfection! It’s a small hotel that has everything that a visitor wants, needs and desires. Let’s start with the basics-it’s located in the best area of Athens near everything-museums, historical sights, restaurants and shopping (all only 1 block away) and it’s quiet throughout the day and night. Next, the staff are so kind and helpful with all your needs. Also, the rooms are visually stunning and so clean. Rooms have a safe, a/c works well, blow dryer, phone, WiFi that works, and even slippers. And, they serve a delicious breakfast on the top floor with a view of the Acropolis. What more could you ask for ?! I told you it’s perfect.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed just one night as a go-between stop. The hotel (or is it an inn? A bed and breakfast?) is very newly renovated and is very stylish. The location is excellent and almost in the middle of Plaka. Everything is on walking distance. The rooms are beautiful, in fact the whole place is a gem. The staff is very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was nothing special and is not of the same standard as the rest of this beautiful place. There is room for improvement there. The place has a rooftop terrace with a spectacular view. The highly irritating music (shut it off, please), overpriced wine (7 euro a glass) and the uncomfortable metal chairs are the only minus points to this great place.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I finished our 3-week holiday in Greece spending one more day in Athens before flying back to Hong Kong. We chose this hotel in Plaka. The location of this hotel is so perfect that you can walk to the Acropolis Museum, shops and other interesting places, like the Zeus temple...etc. The room is clean and spacious, the hotel does keep its quaint charm. The staff are also very nice.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed one night in the two bedroom Elytis suite. Beautiful room. Went to the Acropolis early and then back to hotel for lovely breakfast. The terrace bar has a great view of the Acropolis- especially at night when it is lit up. Location to the old town shops and tavernas is great. Already planning a return long weekend with husband to stay here again! Oh and the lady that does the late bar and the breakfasts (superb Greek omelet with feta cheese) is so lovely and friendly.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to enjoy Athens. We had a great time, enjoyed the rooms, the view from the roof breakfast restaurant, and the near by streets and Taverns.Great supportive staff, even when you get in 03:00AM and need help finding a parking place in the Plaka.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great position walking distance to Acropolis, museum, change of guards and shops. Beautiful rooftop view where breakfast is served or to simply sit and watch the sunset. Friendly helpful staff, excellent breakfast. Clean well equipped comfortable rooms.We were a group of 8 and would all definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our experience here! Excellent location with quaint, quality rooms. Very nicely appointed boutique hotel with a rooftop terrace. Far exceeded my expectations (booked day of arrival) and for the price we could not have picked a better hotel. Would definitely stay again when we return. The only thing we would note is that it was slightly noisier than we'd have liked, but did not really disturb us. The location was great too - charming street, right next to many restaurants/shops (touristy area) and walking distance to acropolis. Great bathrooms, comfy bed, great free wifi too. Excellent stay!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is a former mansion which was recently redone as a boutique hotel. The hotel is well situated to explore the Athens historical center and Plaka. Despite the proximity to the tourist sites, the hotel is very quiet. Some rooms are on the small side, but the floors are hardwood, the WiFi works, the beds are nice and there was a refrigerator in our room. The front desk was very helpful. There rooftop lounge offers nice views of the Acropolis.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Home and Poetry on 3 different occasions in April 2018. This is a wonderful boutique hotel, extremely clean and comfortable. It offers a great rooftop cafe for breakfast and nighttime drinks which looks out to the the Acropolis. Very well located in the heart of the Plaka, restaurants,shops and historic sites were close by. Above all was the fabulous,welcoming and helpful staff who assisted us with anything we needed. From restaurant suggestions, transfers, car rental and flight check ins. Our special thanks goes to Thanesis and to Fanis but all the staff here were excellent.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could not be more perfectly located in the historic district with easy access to all the major sights. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our airport transfers were arranged smoothly and luckily they have 24 your check in as our flights were delayed. The included breakfast is delicious - made to order omelettes or egg/bacon with salads and fresh OJ/coffee. The hotel is pretty quiet at night, and is on a little street without tons of traffic. It is family friendly and suited us really well. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Home and poetry hotel was a hotel that was ideally located in Athens, Greece. The Acropolis, La Plaka, Agora,...we're all close by, walking distance. The hotel had a quasi restaurant on the top which was pretty much at the base of the Acroplis. In the morning u could see soldiers raising the Greek flag on top of the Acroplis singing the Creek national anthem. The front desk was excellent in arranging transportation esp to Port Piraeus. Rooms were comfortable and clean.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The people here are so nice. They knew it was our anniversary and brought us wine, the rooms were VERY clean. We had a comfort room, it was a nice size. I lived the location, we did not have to walk far to get to sites and restaurant s and shopping were within feet of us. We had a package shipped to the hotel from Germany and it didn't make it in time, the hotel staff called us and forwarded it to us in the US. The little breakfast place on the roof was great for having tea/coffee, great view. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Athens.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was comfortable, cool and quiet, making it the perfect place to begin our time in Athens. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast on the rooftop overlooking the Acropolis was wonderful.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an adorable little mom and pop operation in a great location. The room was nice and comfortable, the staff was very kind and helpful, and the breakfast was good. It was also quite affordable, so overall a lovely experience.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is friendly. Clean and nice place. We stayed at 2 floors suite. The place is walking distance to Acropolis Museum, shops, restaurants, cafe and metro. We loved that you can see the view of Acropolis every time you go to the rooftop especially when you eat breakfast. Only thing I can think of that needs improvement is the breakfast. They need more selections but it’s okay.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed for 2 nights in Athens and loved the location of this hotel. It is right in the heart of Plaka which has plenty of shopping and restaurants that are a 5 minute walk away. The hotel is clean, modern, with little noise heard from our room. Breakfast is served every morning on the rooftop terrace which has a view of the Acropolis. Would definitely recommend staying here.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Home and Poetry while vacationing in Athens this April. The hotel is beautiful and the location couldn’t be more perfect. It is a minute walk from everything and the hotel has a rooftop terrace with an amazing view of the Acropolis. The staff were exceptional – very friendly and helpful. Would highly recommend!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful time at Home & Poetry. Great hosts, beautiful building with a charming rooftop terrace looking at Akropolis for ( prepared ) breakfast and late drinks. Real recommendation for a pleasant stay in Athens.A few minor comments why not „5“:- thin doors and loud building- no carpets on wooden stairs- windows without sound barrier in city- breakfast goes faster using 2 pans - use the rooftop and sell drinks Thanks for a great time !
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve just had four nights here, sightseeing Athens. First thing to say is that this is a perfect location. Most of the major antiquities are within easy walking distance and being in Plaka and next to Monastiraki means you’ll have also access to many restaurants to suit every pocket. Right, Hôtel staff exceptionally helpful and kind. On our last day one of us was unwell and they allowed us some extra time in the room. There are three floors of rooms with a rooftop dining area. Breakfast is good - rolls, juices, cereals, some fresh produce. Coffee from a machine. And you have a marvellous view of the Acropolis- but you can’t see the Parthenon. The area is open for snacks and drinks of an evening. The rooms are in excellent condition- looking like recently done. Finished to a high standard. Bed firm and suited us. Bathroom a little on the small side but well appointed. Excellent TV that went down well, especially Netflix. Air con quiet and effective. The lift JUST fits three adults in and is petite to say the least. I would rather there was a public lounge area, but there isn’t. All in all would I stay again? Absolutely. Recommended.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Home and Poetry with my 16 year old daughter. It was the perfect location to explore the ancient sights from and the view of the Acropolis from the roof whilst having breakfast was stunning. It has a nice feeling to step out and onto the marble paved streets and markets of Plaka. We stayed in a poetry suite with an outside entrance and it was Wednesday night in Athens so the noises from the street was very loud and we had to sleep with earplugs. The room was very nice though, the bed very comfortable and the staff was super super friendly and helpful. I would definitely like to stay there next time, but maybe ask for a room inside or just remember my earplugs again.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just returned from a lovely stay at this hotel. the location is super and is a plus point if you want to work your way through the cultural sites of Athens. We enjoyed a good breakfast which offered a continental selection and we though the rooms were clean and comfortable. Looking at the pictures there is definitely a range of rooms and we had a rather small one, Kavadias, but it was suitable for our needs. I think the suggestion of a kettle and tea + coffee would be all I would add. Friendly service and you step out and see Hadrian's Arch. Worth a stay if you are looking for an Athens gem.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm so glad I found this lovely hotel! The room is large, clean and very comfortable. Also very pretty. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast is amazing and the location is perfect! Walking distance to Acropolis, Plaka, the Temple of the Olympian Zeus and other attractions. I love how the rooms were named after Greek poets. We stayed in the Kariotakis room. I have a made it a point to look up that poet, thanks to this hotel.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Husband and I had a wonderful experience at Home & Poetry! We came here for an operation that I was having, so I wanted a big cozy "home-like" room, to be comfortable in afterwards. The accomodations and view were very important to me. Perfect location, attentive staff, and comfortable room - Overall, a five star bed & breakfast and super clean. As guests here at this bed & breakfast and, owners of a bed & breakfast in Ibiza, Spain, we feel that there is always room for improvement at every establishment. Egyptian cotton sheets, down-filled comforters/pillows, more television stations (movie ones like HBO, Showtime, Etc..) in Universal languages like English and Spanish, would accommodate guests that are here to rest and relax and that are from somewhere, outside of Greece. The bathroom towels are of high quality and soft - Great to the touch. However, the shower floor is slippery and needs to be fixed to prevent falls. Also, bathrobes would have been nice additions to the rooms. This is an old building with beautifully reconstructed rooms and the prettiest hardwood floors, we have ever seen. So, you can hear people come and go at all hours and we feel that as conscious guests, other guests should be more conscious when entering and exiting the building, at any hour. Maybe bringing soft, indoor slippers for one to wear, while you are inside the building, could be the solution to more of a quiet environment with out the hotel, covering the gorgeous wood floor. That is one of the reasons we chose this place. Also, the guests being made more aware about opening and slamming doors shut - It can be loud for all the rooms. And, please don't walk around with your high heels on in your room - The sound echoes and disturbs other guests in the hotel at all hours. It's rude and inconsiderate and maybe if your level of consciousness is so low, then you should stay at a modern cookie cutter hotel that has carpet, not a boutique vintage Inn with wooden floors and lots of character (the artwork is stunning). As for food, the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. We highly recommend not eating around the hotel either. Tourist food - Poor quality and pricey. We found some good restaurants that were walkable or a 5 Euro taxi ride and so much better quality. Cookoovaya (best Greek salad ever) is one that we really enjoyed. Ask the cook at Home & Poetry, for suggestions - He will lead you to the right restaurant for lunch and dinner. Breakfast here is simple and good - Delicious creamy fresh Greek yogurt, daily baked spinach pie and croissants, and fresh squeezed orange juice...Delicious. Taxis are a bit stinky (smokey) and sketchy (drivers). Make sure the drivers start the meter when you get inside and not charge you a fixed price. The only fixed price is that to the airport which we paid 35 Euros from Home & Poetry - It took us 40 minutes to get there. A+ for this lovely new bed & breakfast in the heart of Athens and we will definitely stay here, the next time we come back to this city. We will also tell our friends and clients to stay here as well - Thank You!! P.S. - Free entrance to Greek ruins the first Sunday of every month. ** Great tip!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have liked to share the positive experience of many of the other reviewers. However, my experience with the hotel was rather disappointing. I therefore can recommend to choose this hotel only if you are 100% sure that you will arrive there as otherwise you could share my unpleasant experience which is in contrast to the quite cosy name of the hotel.The hotel originally requested the full no show fee (price for four nights) although they knew from my mail on the evening of the first night that I will not make it as I missed the plane to Athens due to the late arrival of the feeder train to the airport. No chance to be in Athens also on the next day. Thus, I proposed to postpone the stay by three weeks. For some reason, they insisted that they only learnt on the second day of our stay that I would not come and therefore they considered fully legitimate to claim the full no show fees. Update: After some time consuming and intense discussions (including legal consultancy on my side) the hotel manager finally accepted to refund the difference between the no show fees and the regular cancellation fees in accordance with the booking confirmation. I am traveling a lot and I am still highly irritated by such a commercially driven behaviour.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just great.The manager is very friendly and helpful.The hotel is close to the interesting parts in Athen and just next to the Akropolis.We had a good breakfast on the roof topwith the Akropolis in front of us.Marvellous.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in mid FEB 2018 . What a delightful boutique hotel in the center of the Plaka area . I booked two rooms as were were traveling with my elderly in-laws. Check in was smooth and our rooms ready upon arrival . I called the hotel prior to request rooms be on the same floor and were happy to discover the hotel was obliging. The rooms are named after famous Greek poets , which is quite romantic. The rooms are generously sized , ours had 2 windows that open up , we were on the 3rd floor , rooms overlook surrounding apartments . Enough room to fit our luggage and there is a desk and chair . The staff were wonderful, always willing to assist with their local knowledge. The breakfast is served on the roof top patio which has indoor and outdoor dining .A great view of the Acropolis. A lovely spread of pastries, rolls , cereal, juice , fresh fruit , yogurt as well as boiled eggs.Filter Coffee was sufficient, the will make you Greek coffee is you ask. The lift is quite small , enough for 2 people . Never had to wait too long to use the lift . There is a flight of stairs at the entrance of the hotel. This may not be suitable for elderly with limited mobility.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly a congrats to the responsible of reception; Mr. ThanasisAs a man working more than 25 years in cor. life, I can say that “not easy to find such a person” taking serious what he is doing. Congratulations...An easy and simple hotel in an excellent location. Breakfast room has surprisingly a nice view. Excellent experience in a sunny winter day to drink something there. Summer nights can be also delightful. Thanks to the staff. Regards.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a small property but our room was quite spacious, clean and comfortable. We had drinks and snacks at the rooftop bar in the evening. The wine came out of a box and the snacks were only mediocre so I wouldn't suggests you spend your evening there.The breakfast was good with a variety of dishes, also on the rooftop. The rooftop looks over the back of the acropolis so you can't see the Parthenon, only the hill.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A stunning boutique hotel in the heart of the Plaka. Had some initial problems with the room which the very accommodating staff sorted immediately. Roof top deck for breakfast and evening drinks with an Acropolis view. Close to flea markets, shopping districts, hundreds of restaurants, the Acropolis, Acropolis Museum (literally an 8 minute walk) as well as the open air bus tours. The staff are fantastic and were extremely helpful. We had a memorable stay.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wouldn't call this a spacious hotel, but then you can't really expect such from a hotel of this vintage sitting directly in the middle of one of the most ancient cities on earth. Everything has been retrofitted and renovated to a beautiful finish. The ceilings are high, the vintage windows work well and offer great vies of the neighborhood. Stunning views of the Parthenon from rooftop dining! The breakfast is ok. The only complaint is that everything except for the hard boiled eggs are served cold. However, there is a good selection, the buffet is refreshed regularly and they fresh squeeze the orange juice right in front of you. The coffee and teas are decent. The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The place is immaculately clean. I would rate the walkability score as a 98 or more. Nearly everything you could possibly want as a tourist is within 10 minute walk including shops, dining, souvenirs, historical sights such as the Acropolis, Areopagus, Roman Market, Ancient Market, etc.. Lulu's Bakery is a great local eatery to stop by for lunch (5 minute walk). There is a piazza within a few minutes walk of the hotel which has many restaurants and coffee shops with a relaxing atmosphere. The narrow, winding cobble stone streets are a pleasure to wander through. The only two downsides to this hotel is that there is no place in the rooms to sit and relax as the rooms are not large enough to accommodate the extra furniture and there is no parking. Street parking is a risk for tickets from 8:00am - 9:00pm (after which the municipal police are not patrolling for illegally parked cars.) After 9:00 pm you can park your car basically anywhere it will fit. (Keep in mind, the streets are incredibly narrow. You will have to park all the way against or on the curb and still fold the side mirrors in to avoid being hit by a passing car) Other than that, there are a few public parking lots in the neighborhood that you can get 24 hour parking with in & out accessibility for 15€ / day. (Be waste of scams. Ask for a receipt when you park your car. If you need the police to assist you with a shady business man just dial 100 on any phone and the police will quickly arrived to assist.) All in all, an excellent place to stay. Friendly staff, amazing antique building lovingly restored in a quiet ancient neighborhood the likes of which you can't easily find elsewhere on earth..
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely clean, comfortable room and bed in a beautiful and convenient location of the Plakka neighborhood in Athens. The rooftop terrace has an incredible view of the Acropolis, morning during the wonderful complimentary breakfast and night to enjoy a glass of wine after a busy day exploring some of Athens most historical tourist attractions (all within walking distance). The staff was incredibly hospitable and helpful.
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived (late at night). Nothing too much trouble, room was spotless and as described. Wet room was a bonus - amazing views from rooftop at breakfast and evening. We will definitely return!
hotelName:
24    Home and Poetry
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite, which was perfect for 3 adults. The accommodations were modern and comfortable with a lot of space! Great service! The staff was friendly and helpful. Morning breakfast was lovely, nice not to have to get up and rush out looking for something to eat. The location was very convenient to the plaka and parliment square. Easy to walk to shops and restaurants. Nice to stay in a charming hotel!!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveled here with our 4 boys and couldn't have asked for a more amazing hotel! The staff was friendly and very helpful making food recommendations, the hotel was gorgeous and our room was incredible spacious. We would highly recommend this hotel for families with kids and can't wait to visit again!!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was tying with family and the 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite was perfect for us. the location is very central, it seemed like nearly every place we went was about a 10-15 minute walk. Two things I would note for prospeective visitors, both minor: the second shower (not the master) is very tiny, and the only english language tv we could find was international news (no CNN international). The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful! I would recommend this hotel without hesitation!!!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Athens for 4 days. The boutique hotel was central to Plaka, Monastraki, Psiri, the Parliament and a 10 min walk to the Acropolis museum, 7 minute walk to the Roman and Greek Agoras. It is parallel to the Main Street, Ermou, where the main popular shops are located. However staying just one block outside the Main Street allowed us to easily explore the small boutique shops and small bakeries and cafes.The amenities and lodging were also excellent.The rooms were spacious for all 4 of us, with 2 bedrooms, living area and a kitchenette.There is a supermarket right down the street where we would purchase eggs and cook them every morning and have it with the bread the hotel staff delivered every morning. The coffee machine that is in the room also makes great coffee and espresso.Modesto was extremely considerate and helpful with all our questions and concerns.The hotel definitely made our experience of Athens more memorable on top of all the glorious sites and people we met.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I generally do not take the time to write reviews, but I was so impressed by this hotel, I really wanted to let others know what a great find it is! The rooms are awesome - modern, stylish, and fully controlled by a screen that does the lights, climate control, the blinds (pretty cool, two layers of blinds for extra darkness when sleeping). The location was great - everything we wanted to see in our short stay was in walking distance, and it was a pleasant little spot with nice cafes, restaurants, and a market, in case you want to make use of the kitchen in the room. Breakfast was simple, but it was nice that they served it in the little table in our room. Nice and cozy! When we arrived, they gave us a little tray of snacks and two shots of some strong Greek booze. Nice! My wife and I are from New York City, and we have travelled all over the world. This might have been our favorite hotel, ever.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have just arrived in Santorini after a three night stay at Met34 in Athens. We could not have had a more lovely experience. The rooms are spacious, spotless, comfortable, and well equipped (coffee maker, hairdryer, flat screen TV, fantastic bed/pillows, robe/slippers). Location was ideal, we walked everywhere, in fact covered nearly 25 miles on foot in just 3 days. But what really makes Met34 special is the attention shown to guests by staff. Every request was accommodated, every question answered. Complimentary olive and cheese plate upon arrival, and complimentary gin and tonic from Dimitrius the night before we departed (he makes a delicious one, and we had the pleasure of enjoying his conversation while enjoying his crafted cocktails as a nightcap each evening). Dominic was also wonderful. Highly recommend if a trip to Athens is in your near future.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with great hospitality and excellent location to attractions, shopping, will stay here any time.Great breakfast at the hotel and near by, walking distance to attractions. Room sizes are good and in safe location,
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: MET34 is a great location on a small side street in the Plaka district. There is a ton of things to do steps away from the hotel. Lots of restaurants and cafes. The staff is very welcoming and were careful to show us many spots to consider visiting on our stay. The rooms are beautiful and very high tech with electronic blinds and blackout shades. The fridge in the room was stocked with milk and cold cuts and there was coffee and espresso for us to take advantage of. The small kitchen would be very handy for a couple/family who might want to drop back into the hotel during a day sightseeing for lunch or snacks. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was a good size with a great rainhead shower. The only complaint we had was the street noise which can be very loud if you retire on the early side. We had just come from a cruise and had an early flight in the morning,so that was bothersome. However, if you typically don’t go to bed until after 11 pm or are not bothered by the noise from people in the street below, then the street facing room (#1) will not be a problem for you.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, spacious, small boutique hotel. Sharp looking room with kitchenette and desk - ideal if you are on business. Very helpful staff - both with room questions, finding attractions, and getting around the city. This hotel is located in the middle of a busy tourist/shopping area - definitely where the action is. We also stayed at a hotel close to the New Acropolis Museum. We liked that area better, note, this is not a knock on the hotel. If you want to stay where all the action is, this is a great choice.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beyond 5 stars. I could not fault a single thing with this stay.We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and WOW! It was amazing! Spacious, super clean and all the facilities you could possibly need.From the moment we walked in here the staff were incredible! The service from all the staff was exceptional. Nothing was to hard always happy to help but not in your face. The girls that cleaned our room were amazing! The room was so so so clean every day. They did such a good job - outstanding!The beautiful breakfast delivered to our room each day was just perfect.The location of the Met34 could not be better. Staying here made our vacation so great! Thank you so much everyone at Met34 this is such a beautiful hotel with even better service!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel and their staff made our family and 2 small kids feel totally like we were home. The attention to detail was simply fabulous.They welcomed us with a tray of Greek snacks, drinks and their breakfast baskets were delicious. The family room we got was like a gorgeous apartment home, clean, modern, and extremely spacious with all possible amenities. The staff were so courteous, helpful and hospitable, we simply enjoyed every day of our stay with them. I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with their families. Plus, it’s location is really fantastic, right in the heart of everything.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Boutique hotel near Plaka and pedestrian walkway. A little hard to find. Great room--there are only 7 of them! Good recommendations from the full time desk staff. Big room. HUGE breakfast--even enough for lunch too. Would go back in a second.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel made our trip! The rooms are beautifully decorated, super clean, organised, and very stylish! It is also super well located, right in the middle of the touristic area of Athens, just 15 minutes away walking to the Acropole. The neighbourhood is full of shops, nice and delicious restaurants, and little historical sites. The breakfast is brought to the room every morning and it is delicious. The staff here goes beyond anything you can expect. Usually, Greek people are very nice and warm, but at the hotel they really give new meaning to those words. The front desk person in charge when we arrived, Modesto, was super friendly, kind, patient and always smiling. He even gave us a bunch of tips and made us a list of restaurants and places we could visit. His recommendations were perfect and thanks to him we enjoyed Greek culture as much as we could. The rest of the staff was also incredibly polite, cheerful, friendly, and always smiling which honestly, always made our days! Thank you very much!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading all the good reviews we decided to stay our first 3 nights in Athens here. Since I was paying for the first part of my trip to Athens myself, I spent days reading reviews of every single hotel and am so glad we stayed here! We stayed in the superior grand room. The location is fantastic with a quick walk to Plaka. The room was big and beautiful. The managers were very welcoming. The breakfast basket was a very nice touch. Being that we try not to eat a lot of bread, we ended up passing on the basket the next two days. But definitely did not skip the fresh squeezed orange juice they also bring up to your room!The second half of my trip was for business and my company put me up for my last 2 nights at the Hilton which is a 5 star hotel. Needless to say we were immediately homesick for Met34 as it is way better than those big fancy chain hotels that nickel and dime you. Hated the Hilton even as a Gold member, and loved Met34! Small, intimate, modern, welcoming, great value and fantastic location. We will be back!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed 3 nights at Met34 in mid Jan-19 and everything about our stay exceeded expectations... the room, the amenities, the staff and the location. Everyone we sent photos of our room to could not believe we were staying in Athens. The rooms were well equipped, very spacious, cleaned daily, the included breakfast was delicious and the staff attended to all our requests. The staff were exceptional, giving suggestions on where to dine, what to do/visit, etc. And at the end of our stay, we mistakenly left our passports in the safe. We didn’t realise until we reached Athens Airport. We phoned Met34 and their staff arranged for a taxi service to transport the passports from their hotel to Athens Airport within 35 minutes. Thanks to Met34 staff for turning a stressful situation around for us. We highly recommend Met34 to anyone considering accommodations in the heart of Athens. It’s about 15 minute walking distance to the key historic sites... Acropolis and Olympic Stadium. It’s metres away from Emrou... the main shopping strip in Athens. It’s close by to the Cathedral and Plaka district. Syntagma Square, Parliament House, Monastaraki and Psiri are 5-10 minutes walk. You can’t beat this location!!!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect! Staff members was absolutely polite, friendly and helpful. Rooms was perfect cleaned as the photos seen. The location is in the center of ermou street. I would consider the hotel for 100%.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious, clean and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was generous, and served in the room. The hotel is so central that all the sites are within easy walking distance. The beds were very comfortable, ensuring a fantastic night’s sleep. Great restaurants nearby and the Plaka across the road meant we were spoiled for choice. Perfect for a family with teenagers.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hospitality. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Extremely knowledgeable about the surrounding tourist location & resturants too. Spacious and stylishly decorated room with a wonderful balcony. Convenient location that was in the center of everything that we wanted to see and do. Wonderful breakfast served in the room.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three small complaints are: 1. there is a green light above the door that shines in your face all night---it lights up the entire room; the light may be required by fire codes. 2. The WiFi was a little slow; it took about a minute to upload a photo, whereas at some hotels a photo will upload in a second or two. 3. The air conditioning fan would run for 5 seconds, then be off for 5 seconds, over and over. This was annoying when trying to go to sleep.Our room included a fully equipped kitchen area. The refrigerator contained two liters of milk, two yogurts, a package of sliced cheese and a package of sliced turkey, all complementary. In the morning, they brought two large baskets of breakfast items, including freshly squeezed orange juice.The staff was friendly, helpful, and spoke good English.All in all, it is a very nice hotel and we would stay there again the next time we are in Athens.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: POSITIVE:* Location - Not much else to say on this one. Easily walkable to all the main tourist sites and if you are renting a car it is about a 15 minute walk to the area where are the rental cars companies are located. Has a small hotel/apartment feel and not that big chain atmosphere.* Staff - They were extremely friendly and helpful. When I asked about rental cars they called a couple of different companies for me, arrange our car service, and did about anything else we needed* Rooms - Rooms were very good. We had had a two bedroom suite for our family. Both had large bathrooms and a sitting area. TV's are a bit small and outdated, but I don' think we turned them on when we were there.NEGATIVES:* Can be a bit difficult to get to. Cab drivers didn't seem to know it since it is such a small hotel. If you are going to be driving there with a rental car it may be tough to find/park.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a fantastic weekend, warmly recommended!Enjoyed the architectural style as well.Close to all the major sceneries.But still in an Quiet area/street.Also the small building size make it more cozy as well.The room was big and suitable for a family with four persons without a problem.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Met34 exceeded my expectations in every aspect. The room was so modern with marble bathroom, small balcony, electric blackout shades, kitchenette, coffee/espresso machine, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, safe, wet sink, stove, dining table and so on. The location in the Plaka is excellent. Petraki street is parallel to Ermou the main pedestrian street, so you are close to all the action with wine bars/cafes, bakery, etc....but on a quiet street. Just a 15 minute walk to the Acropolis Museum and just a few minutes to the major squares of the area. The staff at the Met34 are just excellent. Breakfast is served in your room at the time you choose and the front desk staff are very helpful for arranging taxis and giving excellent advice on restaurants, etc. Bravo Met34!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small, boutique hotel is basically walking distance to just about everything! You are spoilt for choice for cafes, restaurants, shops, not to mention historic sights which can also be reached on foot.Modern decor in our apartment, heaps of space, very clean.....delightful. Even had a small balcony.Despite being so central we found it to be quiet and did not have a problem with noise.Staff were very helpful and friendly and frankly.....we totally recommend this lovely hotel if you travel to Athens!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here last week for our half term holiday. We all loved it! Brilliant to have two separate bedrooms and bathrooms, a small lounge and a small kitchen - and we used all the space between the 4 of us. Breakfast was fab - lots of continental offerings delivered to the room whenever you want it. Very centrally located and easy to walk to all central Athens attractions within about 20 mins. Very high spec - lots of leather, wooden floors and Wi-fi... plus lots of gadgets (lighting, blinds, air-con) - and great comfy beds! The only thing that let us down was the TV/tech... the hotel makes a deal of ‘international tv channels and latest technology’ - but our boys (11 & 10) were very disappointed... no kids TV in English - and no way to hook apple devices up to the TVs, to run mirroring. Despite that, the customer service was so amazing, we still had to give this 5/5 - we will definitely go back again (next time though, taking an Apple TV, Chromecast or Amazon stick!).
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel and excellent staff. They were really attentive and the rooms were well appointed. Check in was a breeze and our family of 4 with two small kids were very comfortable. Breakfast was great in the morning (delivered to the room). The hotel is walking distance everywhere in Athens and easily reachable from the airport by bus (6 euros) or by metro (10 euros). When you walk out of the door there are tons of restaurants and shops. I wouldn't even consider another hotel in Athens.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A rare gem. A small hotel with great staff. In the middle of Athens. Walking distance to all sites. Very nice interior! The breakfast that they leave in your room in the morning is mostly bread and cereal. If you need eggs you walk 50 meters to the Grocery store.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First and foremost...I left a money clip with cash in the room when I checked out. We checked our bags for a few hours before heading to the airport. When I returned for our luggage the desk clerk handed me an envelope with all my money in it. You can be assured these are good people operating the hotel.Other matters...We were in Room 1. It faces the street. It can be a bit noisy but was quiet by 11 p.m. You may wish to request an inner room. The roomsare modern and clean. It is high tech (lights, blinds, climate all on one panel) and less tech savvy folks may take some time to figure it out. In room Continental breakfast was very good with fresh orange juice, a variety of breads, etc, cereal, yogurt and fruit. Staff was friendly and helpful. The location is very good...near the main shopping street, minutes from the parliament (changing of the guard at the memorial for unknown soldiers), and 15 minute or less walk to Acropolis, Hadrian's Arch and the Ancient Agora...also plenty of restaurants within a few minutes walk.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff. Breakfast brought to your room. No hot foods mostly breads And whole fruit. And Yogurt. Fully equipped kitchen Don’t book a room on the street I had room 1. It was noisy Seemed a bit expensive but good location
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have so many good things to say about this hotel. I'm so glad I booked it. From the time I booked our stay through tripadvisor until the time we checked out, I felt like I was truly a valued customer. The staff members are extremely friendly, attentive, helpful, and I honestly felt like I was being constantly being catered to! I wish all hotels could be like this one :) we arrived very early in the morning (2 am) and the kind gentleman at the front desk was friendly and polite. He walked us up to our room and showed us around. Every single staff member was helpful. The room itself was BEAUTIFUL. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom is luxurious, and the in-room amenities are very clean. They even had the sofa bed ready for us! This meant a lot to us because we just arrived from our long overnight flight and our children were exhausted. The location felt safe and it's not too busy. Thank you, MET34!!!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We missed our flight and lost a night here. We ( party of 8) came in after being up since 4 am right after 11:00 am hungry and tired. We were given 2 spectacular rooms. The beds were heaven, the showers ceiling rain shower head felt like a warm hug. The kitchen was granite, we had our own wifi network, a large living room was inviting and spacious and we just wanted to rest when the concierge, brought in a large breakfast for all of us. That completely changed our mood and we went out to tackle Athens. We were at the center of everything! We were walking distance to the ruins, close to great restaurants, and shopping. The host gave us directions to everything. The service was not only professional but felt like home. We had a fight the next day and he packed us breakfast to go for us so we had something to eat on the way to the airport at 5:00 am. What was even better is I believe they refunded the money for the night we missed. I didn't even ask for this but was so thankful because I had to buy a hotel room for the 8 of us near the airport so it offset that expense. I had lost so much money not to mention missing that flight, so this really made me so grateful. I highly recommend this hotel. They made our 24 hours there the best it could possibly be.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 80-100 nights per year in hotels, so it's rare that I'm truly wowed by a property. This was WOW. The warm and genuine front desk greeting was followed by one pleasant surprise after another, including a welcome drink and snack delivered to my room. MET34 in Athens surpasses expectations. Centrally located within walking distance to everywhere, this small hotel features large, spacious rooms, full kitchen facilities and a complimentary breakfast delivered to your room which could feed you for a full day. Five stars all the way and my highest recommendation for your next stay in Athens.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff very friendly The room was clean The location was amazing Everything was perfectThe staff answered all my questions I love this hotel and I will be back again in my next holiday to Athens Thank you so much
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely boutique hotel with all amenities. Walking distance to many major tourist sites. Around the corner from shopping district as well. But the best thing about Met34 is the staff. They are wonderful. And I cannot thank Iria enough. She welcomed us warmly and provided us with great assistance during our short stay in Athens (and provided a really sweet extra touch as it was my wife’s birthday while we were there). Breakfast delivered to room in the morning and a seperate breakfast box was organised for an early travelller, as they had a plane to catch. We are a family of 4 adults and the 2br suite with small balcony was roomy and very comfortable. I heartily recommend Met34
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We normally stay at a different hotel when visiting Athens. This time around that hotel was not available, so we reluctantly booked Met34. We are so happy we did! Met34 will now be our go to hotel in Athens. The hotel is in the most perfect central location - within walking distance to Ermou, Syntagma, Plaka, Monastiraki and the Acropolis. We loved our room (the Metropolis Suite) which was large, comfortable and clean. My one very small complaint is the electronic blinds - it took a while to figure out how to tilt the blinds open, and it also took forever to open/close them. Other than that, everything was perfect.Thank you to the staff for all your kind help and recommendations. We will definitely be staying here in the future.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel is great for families. The accommodations are modern, new, and spotless. You get a 5 star experience of a high-end chain with excellent service from the staff. Breakfast delivered to your room each morning. The hotel is close to restaurants, flea market, and the Acropolis. I'd definitely book again when I return.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located within walking distance to everything you need in Athens, and the staff is wonderful. I would Highly recommend the hotel to anyone who wants to be right in the middle of everything.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was extremely impressed by this hotel. The Hotel was in an excellent location near Syntagma Square and cafes and restaurants. It is about 3 minutes walk from the Plakka district. The rooms were very quiet. The room facilities were of a high standard and the staff at the hotel exceptionally helpful and professional at all times. I had asked them to order a wheelchair which they organised. They offered to provide my choice of transport from and to the airport which I found to be very helpful. I had a 2 bedroom suite and it was extremely comfortable. There is an area with a bar if you wanted a drink and an area to relax.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 5 and we could not have picked a better hotel for our 2 night stay in Athens! This hotel is new and very modern with all of the room amenities you could ask for. The location of the hotel is right behind one of the main pedestrian shopping streets with plenty of cafes, restaurants, shops and grocery stores. It is also in walking distance to all of the main attractions that you will want to visit. The staff were super helpful and very kind to us during our stay. They provided us with a lovely breakfast in our room at the time of our choosing, which made it really efficient to get on with our days of touring! We loved having a small kitchen and 2 very modern bathrooms...plenty of space! Also, the welcome drinks and snacks were very sweet upon our arrival. They also helped us with directions, giving us a detailed map when we arrived. You can't go wrong with your choice of this hotel!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On our family vacation to Santorini we needed a stopover on our journey...Athens being the most obvious we then went in search of a great hotel. Both my wife and I separately found Met 34 online.
