Once we booked we were welcomed into the most wonderful experience I’ve had with a hotel .From the moment you arrive you soon discover how helpful the staff are..I’d already experienced this with their very informative emails back and forth after my bookings..nothing was a problem.Hotel is located next to Plaka so our early morning arrival was pretty exciting and you discover all the fabulous cafes and restaurants in the street the hotel is on...every where you look there’s a supermarket..a hairdressers and 3 cafes next to hotel. ..all within walking distance as are the ancient ruins .The next big surprise we’re the rooms..like a little cozy apartment ..lovely bathroom and kitchen with a well stocked fridge and onto the beds..absolutely the best I’ve ever slept in..all my family agreed ..just so comfortable ....then there’s the little balcony which you feel like you are on a movie set..that James Bond or Jason Bourne have stayed here once.. really cool street sounds but also very quiet ...I awoke early and sat out there for an hour taking it all in..then you discover the wonderful shower and the beautiful bathroom .we were woken with a big smile and a beautiful continental breakfast ..same great vibes from the staff...10 stars would not be enough to compliment this great hotel experience in Athens..one of the best I’ve ever had ..because the staff and rooms are just brilliant ..bravo to the owners..the world needs more boutique experiences like this ...wish we had more time there .
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in their smallest room, which was only small by their own standards. It was large, airy, beautifully furnished and equipped with almost everything one would need for an exceptional stay. The hotel is only a 10 minute or so walk from the Acropolis....buy tickets on line so you won't be in the line for an hour in the heat waiting to buy your ticket there!! There are restaurants nearby, shopping is only one street over. There is a building under renovation across and down a bit from the hotel, but the windows and doors (spacious letting in loads of light) soundproofed what was going on outside. The air conditioning is excellent, so you won't have cold air blowing on you all night, yet the room is adequately cooled down, a good design. We were treated to shot glasses of liquor and a small snack on our return mid-afternoon, a very nice touch. We loved the coffee machine in the room, as well as the continental breakfast. I would just state that the room does need a kitchen towel, or serviettes of some kind. The internet worked. The bed was comfortable. I am not a fan of their pillows, so having perhaps one other type might be an idea, but that is a very small detail. Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night before we caught the long flight home to Sydney. What a location! Right behind the ermou shopping strip and a block from Plaka. We stayed with two children (6 and 3), my husband and my mum and the two bed apartment was spacious and well appointed. I didn’t realise a continental breakfast was included and it was so plentiful and delicious. There was also heaps of cheese and yoghurt in the fridge. But the Neiman attraction was the staff. They were SO lovely and accommodating and went out of their way to help us. Would love to stay again.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is wonderful! They were helpful before we even arrived and the service just got better upon arrival. They helped us map out activities, restaurants, best places for ice cream and places to have a nice drink. This was so wonderful because whatever neighborhood we found ourselves in we always knew a good place to go for whatever we needed. We were a family of four with 2 teenagers and we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. This room was lovely and spacious and was perfect for our family. The location was excellent. We really loved that breakfast was delivered each morning. Everything was in walking distance, restaurants, sights, shopping. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful hotel and very helpful.We asked for nescafe and it was bought up straight away.My daughter is gluten problems so they bought her bread from the bakery.In a great position. would use then again
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I see why everyone likes this hotel so much. It's a small, comfortable hotel with great service and modern, tasteful rooms. It's in the center of everything, just a 12-minute walk from the Acropolis and a 5-minute walk from the parliament building and steps from all the shops and restaurants, but still quiet and retreat-like.The hotel also arranged for someone to pick us up from the airport and take us to the port the next day, both of which were punctual and seamless.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family recently stayed 4 nights at the Met 34. The location is superb. Staff are great and very helpful . The maids in particular did a terrific job serving us breakfast and keeping thing clean.We are a family of 6 and our 4 kids are all under 12. The hotel is a great set up for families. We will stay there again
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 days in Athens and chose the Met 34 hotel. It is a newer boutique hotel well situated a block from Ermou street (main pedestrian street). It's less than 5 minuts from Syntagma Square (& Metro station) and about 10 minutes from the Athens Flea Market and 15 minutes from the Ancient Agora, Hadrian's Library and about 20 minutes from the entrance to the slopes of the Acropolis.We had a 2 bedroom unit that had 2 bathrooms (both with showers). All the furniture was modern and new, including the controls from lights, blinds, A/C). There was a desk area, kitchen with a stove, dishwasher, fridge. The master was huge and had a balcony that had two chairs to look at the street traffic.Breakfast was included which was served in room at a time of our choosing up until 11:00 or 11:30am. The front desk spoke perfect English and replied to emails efficiently. There are excellent restaurants on the same block--the best was the Athiinaikon-- just next door and Tazza + Ergon to the right. The only tricky thing is finding the hotel using Google maps or Uber. The hotel is located on 9 Petraki but Google Maps + Uber drop you off on the backside of hotel on Mitropoleus Street and you need to walk around the block to the front. The easiest drop off is in front of the Athiaikon Restaurant which runs between Petraki and Mitropoleus streets. There is a large taxi queue half a block away on Mitropoleus street in front of the Electra Metroplis Hotel. Taxi service (yellow cab) is a flat rate of 38 euros to/from Athens International Airport.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay couldn’t have been better. The service and accommodations were impeccable. We loved the in-room breakfast and the convenient location. With the small number of rooms at the hotel, we truly felt pampered. Thanks to everyone at MET34! We’ll be back.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was great. If you stay there have them arrange transfers. We used another from the booking website where we booked the hotel. The vehicle could not go down the narrow streets and we had to walk with luggage from a cruise and three teens about 1.5 blocks over cobblestone streets. That was my error not the hotel. Great location, plenty of sights near by, with restaurants, pedestrian mall half block away with lots of activity , and Plaka a few to couple blocks.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small hotel has contemporary rooms with air conditioning and great tall showers. The staff is very helpful. Breakfast is brought to your room and the fresh orange juice is like liquid oranges. Breakfast includes milk, breads, croissants, nuts, cheese, ham, yogurt, jams, honey, granola and corn flakes. There is an espresso/coffee machine in the room which is a little hard to work but makes good coffee. It's easy to walk to all city center locations from this hotel.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Met34 offers stylish luxury in the city center of Athens. We stayed with our two kids in a two bedroom suite and loved it.If feels more like a luxury apartment with a concierge than a hotel. Breakfast is a basket they deliver to your room. Our suite had a kitchen including fridge, dishwasher, microwave,..The rooms are of high quality with robotica that is at times confusing but nice once you figure it out.The location is great. In a quiet street and 100 m away from Klapa, the area with small streets full of shops and restaurants.You are about 2 km away from the Acropolis museum and entrance and it is a very nice walk through Plaka to get there.The hotel staff was very nice and accommodating. As we left early the last day they served breakfast is takeaway boxes, a nice touch.Met34 is a nice choice if you look for a full service suite in a toplocation in Athens.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly located one street away from the main shopping street and city center which makes it very convenient. And the perfect thing is as soon as you step through the front door, you are in an elegant marble floored hotel. Our room was very clean with extremely comfortable beds. The bathroom was modern, new and clean.Breakfast is brought to your room at the time of your choosing and the front desk is 24/7 and very helpful with restaurant suggestions and coordinating tours.The area has a number of great coffee houses and restaurants within steps of the hotel. It also was an easy 20 min leisurely walk to the Parthenon.I recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel. The services is very helpful. Room is spacious and clean. The location is great.Minus point: the breakfast need to be improved and if there is a bath tub it will be great for our kid.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the most wonderful experience here at Met34. The Staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming from start to finish. They welcomed us on arrival with a traditional ouzzo shots and Greek nibblies in our room. They also contacted us via email to make sure if we required our airport transfers. They were just so lovely cant say it enough. The rooms were spacious and clean, modern. Breakfast brought to your rooms every morning. Was fantastic. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. The location of Met34 is in the heart of Athens its just 10mins from the landmarks. 2min walk to the main strip pf shops. What more can you ask. Huge thank you to the staff at Met34 who made our honeymoon so wonderful!!!Xxx
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I LOVE Met 34. First of all, the front desk people were extremely helpful and hospitable. They greeted us every morning with huge smiles and gave us detailed information of where to go and how to get there during our stay. I also really liked that they took care of all travel throughout our stay, from arranging transportation form the hotel to a taxi to pick us up from dinner. The rooms themselves are clean and modern, literally no complaints. Finally, it is the perfect location! It is walking distance from The Parliament, The Acropolis, and the Athens Flea Market. It is a quiet off street in the heart of everything, so you get the best of both worlds where you have a safe and secluded area but you are also extremely close to all the action.
hotelName:
25    MET34 Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in the middle of Plaka, is shops, bars, restaurants and walking distance from most sites. On a square, 10 mins easy walk from Metro station Monastiraki (metro from the airport is usually direct). Old building, beautifully converted into an elegant B&B: small, beautifully appointed rooms and bathrooms en suite; communal kitchen a few steps from your room where you can help yourself to breakfast; tea, coffee, fruit, cookies are available at any time. Rooms airconditioned, overlooking the square and its many restaurants & bars but very quiet. A 'walk-up' with a few stairs and staff are usually available to help with luggage; they are helpful, speak perfect English and offer useful tips. There is a lovely roof-top outdoor cinema (turn left out the door and its in front of you) - often films in original; there are 2 evening showings, book in advance to save the endless queue and perhaps being turned away. There is a bar with food at the back of the cinema. A brilliant location if you are spending a time in Athens - we couldn't fault it!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a single room with a view of the Acropolis. Everything is well-appointed and decorated. A nice breakfast is included. The highlight may be its staff. I had to leave in early morning and the night clerk escorted me to a tour bus pick up spot, dragging my bags, because it was on his way home. That's service above and beyond anything I expected.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights in the deluxe quadruple room which had two connecting bedrooms and one bathroom. Worked well for 3 adults. It’s on the first floor near the check in desk. Location of hotel is fantastic, it’s on an intersection of two pedestrian roads in Plaka. Short walk to all of the major Athens and very close to restaurants and cafes. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were only in Athens on a stopover to see Plaka and the Acropolis so the location was brilliant. When we arrived Pantalish (apologies if spelling is incorrect) was very polite and helpful and insisted on carrying our bags to the first floor. The room was very well presented with a lovely balcony overlooking the square - a very pleasant place to eat breakfast and have pre dinner drinks watching people go about their business.The breakfast provided was fresh with options including fruit, yogurt, cereal, toast, deli meats and cheese. Some of the negative reviews mentioned street noise but it is an old (beautifully presented) building in a tourist area and some noise should have been expected. We found that the noise didn't go on too late and in the mornings there was no noise at all. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here, made even more pleasant by all the accomodating staff, and would recommend it to others.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend and I were visiting Greece for what I’d call a practice honeymoon. I chose the Palladian specifically for the suite with the great view of the Acropolis. Our view (see photos) matched the website’s promises. The room was clean and comfy, and they left a bottle of champagne in our room for our first night. Having the little kitchenette shared across the hotel with free drinks, breakfast and always replenished cookies is a nice touch. And the service was great, especially how they checked us back in after our trip out to the islands was done in by weather. There were a few negatives, but they were minor to me. The coffee machines in the kitchenette kept getting jammed. The stairs up to our room would be a challenge for those in I’ll health or feeling the effects of a night out. And some desk staff were more proactive in their hospitality than others. The location was great, perfect for a touristy stay. Though be prepared to dodge restaurateurs trying to coax you into their places every time you come back to your room.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights. Hotel is small but lovely. Staff is incredibly nice and helpful. It is located on a square with a half-dozen restaurants and a wine bar, all just outside your door. It is in the Plaka tourist area. The Acropolis is short walk away through lots of eateries and shops. Tips: - There are no lifts, so not a good choice for mobility impaired. - The balconies are small but don’t let it go to waste!- The staff can offer advice, carry luggage to and from your room, and arrange a taxi for you. - Check out Cine Paris, an open-air rooftop movie theater a few steps from the hotel. The view of the Acropolis is unmatched from the roof is unmatched.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1.5 nights (we arrived from the airport at 3am one night). The staff were all beautiful and had no issues with us arriving so late. They were waiting for us and carried our bags upstairs for us (there’s about 60 to the room and they’re quite steep - so bare that in mind if you struggle as there is no lift!) This hotel feels more like a B&B. The rooms are cosy but have super comfy beds and good aircon. We stayed in the base room with no balcony next to the kitchen, it was a little noisy at times but nothing that woke us up. It’s a fantastic location close to the sites and restaurants. We went to Stamatopoulos for dinner (less than a 5 min walk) which I would also highly recommend, beautiful setting, live music every night and the food was fantastic. Best lunch and coffee is across the square at Pantheon. We really enjoyed our stay at Palladian Home, it’s great value for money.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfectly situated in the Plaka neighborhood. When we arrived, the two people who welcomed us were extremely gracious and wanted to do anything to satisfy us. We arrived a little early and our room wasn’t yet ready so they stored our luggage. The hotel has a keypad entry so it is pretty safe. It is right off a lively street lined with shops, restaurants and coffee shops. I was a little worried about noise from the streets but it didn’t bother me at all. We were in the Aphrodite room, which is adjacent to the kitchen area. Be sure you are able to go up stairs as there is no elevator. The room came with a large bottle of water and a bottle of wine, which we gave to the guests next door. The room provides the basic essentials and is adequate, nothing luxurious. If there is one thing a little negative, I would say the sound from the kitchen was a little disturbing. The stay included breakfast but it was self serve with trays to bring food to your room - no room to eat there. The food was simple - fresh breads and cakes, cheeses, meat, cucumbers and coffee/tea. After eating, you bring back your tray with dishes and put them in the sink. And the kitchen was available 24/7 for coffee, fruit and snacks. Got a bit noisy at times. And when the staff came early in the morning to clean and prepare, the clanking sound was was pretty loud. For those away from the kitchen it’s a convenience, for those next to it, it got a bit noisy. We did mention it to the staff and they were extremely apologetic. The next night it was a bit better. However that little inconvenience was lost to the place and people who work there. All the shops, restaurants and archeological sites are within a short walking distance. No need for a car, which we didn’t rent until we left Athens. (Also, by the way, we rented from Hertz, which had a very convenient office less than a 10 minute walk from the hotel). The staff helped us arrange for taxis and recommend restaurants. Very nice. I would stay there again but ask for a room away from the kitchen.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was really friendly!The hotel is small, but very cozy.Located in the center of Athens,near Acropolis, within walking distance of almost everything!!! A really good choice that will most certainly leave you satisfied
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time I come here and this stay was even better than the first one. Value for price the best in Plaka. A nice bottle of wine on the house was waiting in the room. Excellent view, location, delicious breakfast table and top bathroom amenities and service. Can't ask for more.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visit a different European city every winter and this year was Athens. I wasn't overly impressed with Athens although the Greeks we met were all friendly. Very busy and throngs of people (and this is off-season) and riddled with graffiti. About 10% is artistic and the other 90% just plain ugly. Also many dilapidated buildings. The historic buildings and museums are very interesting and that saved the trip from being a complete disappointment. The other thing that saved it was our choice of staying at the Palladian Home Guest House. It is in a great location in the Pallaka district with loads of nice little shops, cafes and restaurants and near to the Acropolis. Beware that every shop keeper and restaurant owner will pester you to come and sample either their good food or their cheap prices! The young staff were lovely and couldn't have been more helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The ensuite bathroom was tiny. I struggled and I am not a big person but everything worked and was functional. There was street noise at nights but not so much that it kept us awake and after a couple of nights we got used to it. A continental breakfast was laid out in the kitchen with sufficient to give you a good start to the day. Cereal, breads and croissants, cheeses and hams, juices, teas and coffee. If I went back to Athens I would stay again at the Palladian Home but I don't every see us going back to Athens. Sorry!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were considering Airbnb for our first trip to Athens, but uncertainty about neighborhoods and possible lack of heat in February promoted us to look at other options. Well, there is no hesitating in saying Palladian Home is where we are staying when we come again!!! It has the personal and historic features we look for in lodging and it is in the IDEAL location, within easy walking distance of The Acropolis & Museum, Hadrian’s Arch, many restaurants and shops, Syntagma Square (10mins) and the Central Market (15 mins). Bed was super comfortable and we loved our balcony with a view of The Acropolis. I cannot say enough about the friendly and helpful service we got from the staff at the tiny front desk....helping us with cab service, walking directions and translation. The dinner we had at the restaurant, Evita (sp?) right on the corner next to the Palladian Home entrance turned out to be one of the best meals we had in Greece....and to think we hesitated because it was so close!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the middle of the Plaka, on a pedestrian-only street. Close to everything, so very easy to tour Athens. Staff is very helpful and friendly. There is no elevator in the building, but staff will carry bags up stairs for you. Because you are in the middle of the tourist district, the rooms were quite noisy from street noise. Breakfast is simple and adequate, you go to the kitchen and get breakfast, bring it back to your room. Not the most luxurious stay in Athens, but certainly average and adequate.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a small boutique hotel with less than 20 rooms in a heritage building. The location is THE best you can ask for in Athens with everything less than 15 min walk. The neighbourhood has a great buzz. The rooms have the comfort of a 3.5 star hotel. We stayed in the deluxe room which is quite spacious. There was view of Acropolis on the left side of the balcony. The kids were in the std room which is smallish ( less than 20 sqm). The nights can be a bit noisy if you are a light sleeper due to the location. Overall a very pleasent experience.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Palladian Home last week for 5 days and thoroughly enjoyed it. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful and check in was fast and easy. Our room was on the first floor (really the second in Europe). We were glad for that as there is no elevator and it’s a spiral staircase up. The desk staff grabbed the suitcases and carried them for us. The room is a bit spare but serves its purpose - the bed was large and comfortable. There is a desk and a freestanding closet with a small fridge inside. The hotel provides free bottled water. The room and bathroom were immaculate. The small kitchen, which was next to our room was always stocked with fruit and cookies. Every morning, the staff put out thick yogurt, deli meats, cheese and pastries. One could go into the kitchen at any time and make a coffee. Since the hotel is in the Plaka, there are restaurants within 50ft of the front door. The evening shopping was vibrant. We walked to the Acropolis in about 10 minutes. We would stay again in a heartbeat and will hopefully get the chance again. This is not the kind of hotel for those who like full on luxury but what a great place for a nice, relaxed vacation.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Do not stay in this hotel under any circunstance. I have traveled the whole world and have stayed in many hotels, but I had never seen the horrible service that I received in this place. If you don't want to waste your money, don't make business with this hotel.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent two nights at the Palladian home and we loved it. Comfortable clean room with a nice balcony overlooking the square. Perfect location in the heart of the historic district of Plaka, near restaurant and a few blocks from the Acropolis. Very friendly staff that makes you feel home. The hotel has an open kitchen for guests with coffee, tea and snacks available at any time. I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in second floor suite with balcony view of Acropolis. Very clean & safe area. Just walk out your door & all the main attractions are within walking distance. Staff was excellent & handled our taxi reservations from & to airport efficiently. Loved eating our breakfast every morning on our balcony & watching people below. Had no problem with noise in or outside of hotel. Would stay again & recommend to others.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly people and extremely helpful. The only trouble I did find was being able to turn in my key the following morning when I left very early, at about 4am. Otherwise it was a perfect location and when I return to Athens I will stay here again. Very good location as everything is in walking distance that I wandered to.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reception staff was very friendly But my suit was in the 3rd floor and they didn't have elevator The floor was noisy when you walkWe can hear The street and the next roomThe door handle for the bathroom came off when i try to open it The room really creepy i didn't feel good The 2 stars rating just for the reception
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Charming old mansion converted to a boutique hotel. Location is excellent for walking to all of the popular attractions in Athens. Nice quiet pedestrian street with all kinds of dining options right out the front door. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay thete again.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great boutique hotel in central Plaka area it is in a fantastic location to get everywhere... right out the front door there are numerous restaurants all the shopping is a 1 minute walk away - Acropolis is a 10 min walk. We stayed one night then went to Hydra for a few days they kept our bags until we returned and stayed another few days. The rooms are clean and comfortable. We stayed in the Deluxe suite and the comfort room. The staff are attentive helpful - truly fantasticGoing to Athens do yourself a favor stay at Palladian Home.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean hotel. I gave them a 5* review as the service was great however the hotel is not really my taste. It is a very small hotel with only several rooms and more of a converted apartment building or town home. It is very nice and right in the Plaka which makes everything extremely convenient. We got a room with a balcony overlooking the street however the view was somewhat lack luster. The room itself was clean and adequate however VERY small. If you like larger hotel rooms this won't be it. It had very high ceilings though which made it no so claustrophobic. There is complimentary breakfast at something like a communal kitchen. It was fine for us however if you are looking for a higher end service this is not it. The hotel staff (basically 2 different people at the small tiny front desk) was really friendly. We found that all over Greece where we stayed people we especially hospitable.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been meaning to write this review for sometime now, having to create an account to leave one it got pushed back through laziness, poor form me, the same could certainly not be said about the staff here, there wasn't anything they could have done more to make our stay feel any more personal, relaxed and human. The building and location alone full of charm and mystery are enough of a reason to stay, that being said I have never experienced anything quite like the treatment we received from the staff here, truly exceptional.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our room which was exactly the room we expected to get when we booked. Nicolette greeted us like old friends. This is a small boutique hotel in the Plaka. We love that it is all pedestrian so no car noise. Yes, there are restaurants and shops and a great gelato place right across the way but all of that is part of the atmosphere of being in the middle of old Athens with tourists and the bustle of a community. Loved it. We spent most of our time in the room sitting on the balcony watching the people come and go while we read books and drank wine or coffee. In the room when we closed the balcony doors we could barely here a thing. We were in the “Harmony” suite with a view of the Acropolis. Incidentally, it has a huge bathroom.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our honeymoon for five nights. The hotel is in Plaka surrounded by restaurants and shops and within walking distance of all of the main city sights. We stayed in the suite with a balcony overlooking the Acropolis for the first four nights. The room was spacious and the complimentary bottle of wine was very much appreciated, especially as we arrived late and this meant we could really enjoy the balcony as soon as we arrived. On our final night we stayed in the cheapest double room which was very small but this was reflected in the price. The rooms were very clean and comfortable although nothing really special, the balcony really made it for us! We also didn’t sleep well due to noise from the other guests coming in and out and making breakfast at the end of the hall. My husband also woke up when the restaurants below emptied their bins at 2am every night, although I managed to sleep through this! The breakfast was self-service which was very convenient both when in a hurry and if you want a lie-in. The food was fine although I feel it could be of a better quality. The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful, they carried our luggage up two flights of stairs (there is no lift). On the whole we had a good stay and would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place has a B&B feel (it's really not like a hotel: it feels like you are staying in someone's home: which has a lot of character).Location: an exact 9 min walk from Syntagma Sq Metro; couldn't be better: Situated right on PLAKA Square; walking distance to Acropolis (15-20 mins), Roman Agora (7 min) , Ancient Agora (10 min), monastiraki Sq (10 min) and Psirri and Gaza neighborhoods (30 min): this location couldn't be better. Note: not all rooms face the acropolis so dont be fooled into thinking you will be seeing the hill from every room.Rooms: they have tiny cute balconies to sit outside attached to the room, spacious room, v. clean, comfy, wonderful bedding and A/C; quiet and low noise (despite being in the middle of Plaka Sq- which is a highly touristy LOUD location): the rooms facing the back have ZERO noise issue. we slept beautifully w/o any noise issues. Bathroom: very nice toiletries, clean B/R, however tiny shower, so be prepared for very cramped B/R.Breakfast: this is basic (think bread, jam, honey, croissant, Danish pastry, OJ, fruit, greek yoghurt, cake, cookies, cold cereal/milk) but the communal kitchen always has available coffee, tea, water, fruit and cookies, this snack availability 24/7 makes up for the basic breakfast. the convenience of 24/7 kitchen access is superb.Note: there is no elevator in this building so it wont be a problem for light traveller to lug their stuff up the stairs.Overall: I would stay here again: the super-central location, walking distance to all Ancient Athens Sites, uber cleanliness, wonderful helpful staff, 24/7 coffee/tea/snacks in communal kitchen and convenience of being inside Plaka Sq plus the feel of staying in someone's home rather than a commercial touristy hotel is what is very charming about this place. Its good value for money.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well what can i say other than rerfection!we have never been to greece before!the hotel is very clean and comfortable!the breakfast was amazing , everything you would need for a morning start.the staff extremely welcoming and friendly!it's a neoclassical building and the decor is beautiful!the best nights sleep in huge bed.everything you need is close.we cannot wait to go back! Thanks for everything!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Palladian Home in July and we got greatly surprised.They are in such a great location with affordable price. Very comfy bed and the shower was amazing.We loved the decoration and the room was very clean. Very close to the main sightseeing and to a metro station. The staff was very friendly and polite. We even received a bottle of wine to celebrate our honeymoon!Would definitely recommend this place. When we go back to Athens, we will stay here again for sure.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this room because of its balcony and location. I love a room with a balcony next to my bed. It does do the magic effect. The hotel is located right on the Plaka where you can easily get back to your hotel after all sightseeing, shopping and dinner at your doorsteps! There are two more reasons I shall recommend this hotel to everyone on vacation. 1) After more than 10 hours' flight from Hong Kong to Singapore, and then from Singapore to Athens, we desperately needed a shower before going out for sightseeing. The hotel tried very hard to make the room available for me to early check in. Thank you very much.2) The staff are so nice and helpful. The receptionist showed me a map and explained to me where to go clearly. Thanks, we had a good holiday! =)
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not a typical hotel; however was very nice. Location is amazing - steps to everything and my room was facing the park, I had a drink in the balcony at evening time and enjoyed looking at little restaurants and people going in and out The young girl and the two guys who work at the front desk are so helpful accommodating and friendly. The hotel does not have an elevator but the young guys help you with your luggage Rooms are small (understandable for the location) but well maintained, very clean and the bed is really comfortable There is not a breakfast area, there are small kitchens in each floor and you can take the stuff and eat breakfast in your room. Kitchens are open 24 hr for coffee, water and fruit. The selection in the morning was not that large and that is the only criticism I have Overall, I would definitely stay in this hotel if I go back to Athens
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Palladian Home was a wonderful experience for us. This was the first stop on our Honeymoon and we stayed for 4 days before touring Greece. This is one of the best locations in Athens and is located right in the heart of the historic Plaka neighborhood. We literally walked to everything and the Acropolis, Ancient Agora, Roman Agora, Hadrians Gate, Temple of Olympian Zeus, and multiple museums (just to name a few) are within minutes of the front door. Being in the heart of the Plaka you are completely pedestrian friendly and are surrounded by traditional restaurants and shops. We always felt safe. The staff was beyond friendly and eager to help. It would have been difficult for us to navigate from the airport and they arranged all transportation for us. We loved being here and were sad to leave but feel that we made friends at this hotel. It was a very romantic getaway for us. I would suggest staying here if you want to see historic Athens. Thanks, Ryan
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want everything at your finger-tips, this is the hotel! Everything is right there, or close by! The staff was absolutely wonderful! Ensure you ask for them to arrange for a driver to bring you to and from the airport to the hotel. Taxi drivers may have a hard time finding the hotel and drop you off 2 blocks away. The rooms are large, great accommodations with balconies. There is a small self-serve kitchen area for breakfast in the morning. We will definitely return to this hotel. It is absolutely in a great location and the beds were very comfortably. The air conditioning worked very well. We had 2 rooms which was ideal with our family. The staff goes above and beyond and SO friendly and eager to help! LOVED this hotel!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are so helpful and friendly. No elevator so stairs can be challenging if you are travelling with person with mobility restrictions. They are super helpful in bringing your bags down. This is first rate all the way, clearly the hotel takes pride in the quality of their service. The price is very affordable especially considering the location. I don't feel the need to return to athens, considering I spent. Adecent amount of time in the city. But if I ever find myself spending the night I. This city, I will most definitely be ok this hotel.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a review for the Standard Single Room with ViewFor anyone visiting Athens I can strongly recommend the location of this hotel, it is very close to all the popular tourist sites all within walking distance.My room was small which is to be expected for a single room but the clear view across to the Acropolis was exceptional.The hotel including my room was tastefully decorated and the staff very welcoming.My only issue was that the door to the room did not block out the sound from the corridor, the sound of voices and footsteps woke me several times during the night. If this wasn’t the case I would have definitely given 5 stars.My ratings scale.....5 Star - flawless, exceeded expectations, would highly recommend 4 Star - very pleasant stay, met expectations, would recommend 3 Star - didn’t meet expectations, wouldn’t recommend 2 Star - had a unpleasant stay and experience, wouldn’t recommend 1 Star - Ruined my holiday, avoid at all costs.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Palladian Home is truly a hidden gem in the middle of the Plaka. If you don't know it's there, you will likely walk right past it! Situated within walking distance to just about everything, the location could not be better. The room was spacious and clean, and the staff was lovely. There was a simple breakfast available each morning, and coffee and tea all day long. Great restaurants and shops surround Palladian Home, but once you walk through the doors, you are immediately transported from the hustle and bustle of the Plaka to a place of serenity and charm. During our 4-night stay, I often found myself saying, "when we get home" or "we'll head home after dinner." Palladian Home provided such a comfortable and warm place to stay, that it truly felt like home!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel!! The location is absolutely perfect, we walked everywhere and didn't have to take transportation once. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and arranged pickup and drop off for us. Our hotel room was beautiful and very clean. It had a lovely balcony that was nice to sit on at night and watch everything going on the square. Highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are on the fourth night of a five night stay at this charming hotel. Our room is on the top floor with a view of the Acropolis from our balcony. The staff here are amazing, so friendly and helpful. They will happily do anything for you without hesitation. The room is spacious and bright with an excellent bathroom with the best shower we have had in Europe. The bed is heavenly, too. There is a communal breakfast kitchen where you gather what you want for breakfast from an array of fresh breads,pastries, croissants, fruits, wonderful Greek youghurt, cold meats and cheeses and a variety of teas and coffees. We have eaten breakfast every morning on our balcony, watching the sun over the Acropolis and the stirrings in the street below. There are numerous excellent restaurants within a hundred metres, you are spoiled for choice. The Plaka district is certainly the place to be in Athens, close to the major sights and full of interesting shops in this oldest part of Athens. You will be walking over millenniums of history.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for a night in our last leg of our vacation, big family with plenty of luggages. We requested hotel to help arrange mini van. Hotel told us van cannot enter this area, but dont worry, driver will drop us off, and guide us to the hotel and help with the luggage. To our surprise, we were literally dropped off on the road side and driver left after we tipped him. It took us half an hour to find the hotel.Hotel is clean and nice. Night time service was excellent, all our baggage was portered up to our rooms. Rooms were deceivingly small, but fair for the price we paid. It is located in front of a beautiful court yard. Stay was pleasant. And if it were not for what happened next, i would have given this property a 4 star rating. The next day, we had an afternoon flight. Again transport was arranged by the hotel. We checked out and paid for everything including the transport. We were instructed to wait for the driver at the hotel. The driver was 30m late. When we kept asking the front desk, we were only told dont worry he will be here soon. Our flight is @ 1900 and it was already 1600. So i demanded the reception to ask the car company again. The message was that car was stuck in traffic, but it is now located where they dropped us off the day before.We rushed there with all our luggages only to be met with an empty street and no van. We went back to the hotel, to ask for the hotel to call again.... 5min he said! For precautionary measures, i asked for the number of the driver and rushed back to the pick up location. When i arrived, again no car. I called the driver’s number. He didnt speak english. I passed the phone to a restaurant waiter standing next to me. But i was told that the car is waiting about 1.5km away, a complicated set of directions was given to me. I looked at my watch and it was already 1730. I took the decision to call for a cab and was fortunate enough to catch my flight. What angered me was when i called the hotel to explain the situation and requested for my transport refund. I was told that it cannot be refunded! The hotel said that the car company has been doing business with them for a long time... etc etc. It may have been a miscommunication, it may be a scam. Judge for yourself... travelers beware.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice hotel in the center of town, help is helpful and super nice. The rooms is just larger than the bed, our luggage was a little cramped, but we didn't mind, the room was spotless clean, building was quiet and small kischen on the floor for coffee and cake.Don't bring a lot of luggage, it is a walk up.. other than that, I would stay there in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say! Location is perfect , short walk to everything minutes to Acropolis , temple of Zeus , Athens flea market and a little longer to Mount Lycabettus. Massimo Dutti , Zara Mango etc are all nearby :) . We had suite 305 with view of Acropolis . We are fit but It is 46 steps up the second floors , so it is quiet . First class room and amenities ( no safe in our room) . My wife left at 5 am with 24 hours concierge / porter service . Special personal taxi arranged at all hours . They even arranged a taxi pickup service for my son who is staying nearby at a different hotel !! The king bed the best bed we had for the last 3 weeks abroad . Thank you team Palladian for a wonder stay. I hope to come back again one day !!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Palladian Home end of April for 6 nights. Nick and the staff went above and beyond to answer questions, provide suggestions, take care of any problems. From making recommendations of restaurants and shops, giving directions to stave off uncessary walking and getting lost, to assisting with itinerary on the other islands I was going to visit, persevering in helping me change an arrival date when my ferry was cancelled, they were very helpful - always patient and always with a smile. My room, which was comfortable and spacious, was on the second floor, had a small balcony which overlooked a pretty square in the Plaka. The stairs were not a problem and I enjoyed my view. On each floor is a small kitchen where a continental breakfast was served which I took to my room and enjoyed on the balcony - a lovely way to start the day. I certainly appreciated that coffee, tea, fruit, cookies, were available at all times in the kitchen area. Breakfast was fine and only my suggestion would be to offer some delicious Greek pastries and rolls and fresh squeezed orange juice from those incredibly wonderful Greek oranges.Highly recommended
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We so loved our stay at the Palladian Home. It’s close enough to walk from the metro station in Syntagma, although fairly tricky to find. The position of the hotel is ideal- right in the heart of Plaka with the square of lovely restaurants right down below. Everything is so incredibly close and we walked all around Plaka, the street markets, the Acropolis, national Gardens, Anafiotika, Hadrian’s Arch etc etc with no trouble whatsoever! We found the two gentlemen at the front so friendly and helpful- they organized our taxi to the port the next morning too, and the room was perfect for us- very clean, and we loved the lively vibe from the restaurants down below (we didn’t find noise to be an issue in the slightest at night). We also loved the self service kitchen that was stocked with coffee, biscuits, fruit, bread and cereal, which you could help yourself to at any time. This really came in handy as we had to leave really early to catch our ferry the next morning and so we could still eat something before we left :) we highly recommend the Palladian home! Thank you for everything!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my partner for 1 night as a stopover and we were not disappointed at all. This is a boutique hotel, so expectations are that the dimensions are going to be small, however no matter as you're not in Athens to sit in your room. The room and bathroom are very comfortable, everything was clean and there was complementary water too. Wi-fi was a bit slow (again though, not here to sit on the internet), but definitely not a deal-breaker. Also no outside news which was niceThe metro is about 5-10 minute walk away, very easy to get to and The Acropolis (which is right next to the metro) and Temple of Zeus is about the same distance, although in different directions.I'd recommend this hotel and would stay here again as the location is perfect.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at Palladian Home just as they were opening last June. What a find. We had spent a few nights at a nearby hotel at the start of our trip and found this hotel for the stays that bookended our visit to Hydra. It was clean, the beds were comfortable and the location could not have been better for visiting the tourist areas of Athens. The staff arranged our transfer to the port for the ferry to Hydra and the restaurants and shops of Greece were just a few steps outside our door. We have been to a few outstanding hotels in our travels, but are always traveling on a teacher's budget. Palladian Home was worth every penny we spent.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I loved this little place. Our room overlooked the Plaka. We had a balcony and we loved sitting out there and taking it all in. The staff were very accommodating. They gave us a bottle of wine to celebrate our wedding anniversary. And the next day another as our room was late getting made up - not that it really bothered us. We thought it might be noisy but we could not hear anything from the Plaka when we went to bed. The Acropolis is within walking distance as are many other attractions such as the original Olympic Stadium and the Changing of the Guard at Syntagma Square. There are many restaurants and tourist shops in the Plaka area. They provide a very adequate continental breakfast which we would take back to our room and eat on the balcony. Very comfortable bed. Very clean
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our last night in Athens. The hotel is in a wonderful location and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Very clean room with windows that opened to allow us to enjoy the great view. We truly enjoyed our stay and will be back!!
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time in Athens and I'm really satisfied with the service that this place offered me. Staff was always ready to help us in many different ways including trips, sightseeing and gastro-advise but most importantly they have shown us how to move safely around the city.The staff is very friendly and talkative, always ready to make your day be only better :)The localization of the Palladian is just stunning and despite the hustle and bustle on the street during the night our room seemed to be soundproof so we could easy sleep in silence :)
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Smack dab in the middle of everything and just off main Plaka shopping street, Adrianou. Greek restaurants and gelato cafes mere steps away. Friendly, helpful staff. With no space for creating a dining area, you can grab a basic (but sufficient) breakfast and eat in your room. Our room overlooked outside restaurants below on a Saturday night and experienced no noise concerns. You won't go wrong with this hotel.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Palladian Home and would stay there again. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are attractively furnished and very clean. There is no elevator but the staff was quick to carry luggage up and down the stairs. The location is convenient to the Acropolis and other sights. Everything is walking distance from the hotel.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely little hotel in a fantastic location.Easily walk to all the main attractions of Athens.Staff are very polite and really helpful,nothing is too much of a problem for them.Our room was nice with a decent size comfortable bed.The only issue was that the bathroom was unexceptionably small.The breakfast room was nice with cereal, bread,meats, cheese and fruit each morning. Tea and coffee with cookies were also available all day.The hotel is set on a small square which can get slightly noisy later at night.Would stay again even with the small bathroom and slight noise issue.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greated warmly by friendly staff insisting to take our luggage up to the third floor. We also received a nice Italian bottle of wine and large bottle of water as our welcome gift. We had one of the larger rooms with balcony and view of Akropolis which made the experience extra special. Room was supper clean with comfortable bed, nice and crisp linen, and nice touch of disposable sleepers. Shared kitchen was equipped with generous amount of coffee/tea and cookies throughout the day. Breakfast included cold cut meat, cheeses, bread, variety of pastries, and fruits (both fresh and dried).  Property is close to tourist attractions and public transportation which is also a major plus. However, if you are a light sleeper this proximity to restaurants/bars, could be a problem at night. Additionally, as charming as the building is with its hard wood floors and tall ceilings, noise can be echoed from other units doors opening/closing in the hallway or during breakfast prep in the morning. Honestly though, for us overall this place had more charm than any minor issues that could bother us. Therefore, we would certainly recommend staying at this property during your stay in Athens. Happy Travels.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice new hotel in the middle of Plaka. Though our room face a square with lots of restaurants, we had a pleasant night’s sleep - though during high season you might have night time noise from the square below. But it was very nice to sit on the balcony watching life goes by below and have a nighttime drink. The room was well-equipped, with an excellent big double bed. Very tastefully decorated throughout. The breakfast presented in the self-serve kitchen was sufficient with a good selection of different breads, spreads and sweets. The staff was excellent throughout and we had them arrange transport to and from the airport. They did charge a couple of euros more, but the driver collects you in the airport and assists with luggage at the hotel.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nick has established the Palladian Home as a wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Plaka. Only open since June of 2017, they continue to make improvements based on resident suggestions. When we booked there was no mention of included breakfast, which was established prior to our arrival; and they were expanding the food options as we left. Nick and the entire staff were extremely helpful and courteous and we couldn’t have asked for more. This hotel is in an excellent area for venturing into many city districts. We have traveled many places and stayed at some very high end hotels and we have never received better service. They went out of their way to meet any request we had. Thank you again for such a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
26    Palladian Home
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel well located enabling easy walk to most places of interest. Comfortable beds, housekeeping were especially great.The rooftop restaurant may seem initially expensive by local standards but the quality of food and service is exceptional and the views of the Acropolis second to none. Breakfast was a little hectic, best to try and sit away from the buffet on the window side as far back as possible where it is much quieter but this depends on availability.They will make cappuccino for you if you ask otherwise the coffee was poor. But all these are small things compared with all the positives/
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view is amazing, service is good. The menu was a little bit more expensive than it should be. We had the fish. For that price it should be unforgettable. It was just good. But I believe in the end, we paid the fish with the view of parthenon. I would visit again but I would prefer a least expensive plate. Something to worth it.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location. Just a few blocks from the Placa and within walking distance of other popular sites including the local market for a cultural experience. The room was very clean and nice with a spacious bathroom. The breakfast was amazing with lots of different options, including pastries, fresh fruit, eggs, and anything else you could want. The staff was fantastic and graciously answered all our questions about the city. The hotel pool and bar were also wonderful with a view of the Acropolis. We traveled with 13 people, including several children, and we all enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Electra Palace in Athens in late May. Athens was the first stop on our Greece vacation. This hotel was a great place to begin. The rooftop bar has stunning views of the city and the Acropolis. There is also a nice pool on the rooftop. The hotel location was excellent. It is very close to Plaka, which has very nice shops and restaurants. It is also walking distance to the Acropolis. The rooms are beautiful and the cost is reasonable. The staff were fabulous and went out of their way to assist us during our stay. There is also a delicious breakfast buffet every morning with many great options for everyone.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very centrally located. We were Eiting 10-15 minute walk to shopping, Agorra, the Acropolis, Parliament, etc. Not once did we need to take the metro or a cab. Our room was small but adequate. Overall the room seemed cleaned but the bathroom area could’ve been cleaner. There was some mildew in the shower area. Taking a shower was a bit awkward since the floor would get soaking wet so using the hand held shower was best. The buffet breakfast seemed extensive but it wasn’t very good. The eggs were cold, potatoes dry and the bacon sitting in grease. You were better off having cereal or breads. If you enjoy a light breakfast you should be fine but if you want a heavy hot breakfast you may not find what you are looking for. Overall the hotel was good. It’s location was worth every penny.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Electra Palace ResortGreat Location!! Right in Plaka near shopping, restaurants, close to the Acropolis. Perfect location to everything. Hotel is very nice. Pool on the roof with a bar and restaurant. Watched the sunset from there. The pool is small with limited chairs. We went up there late afternoon. We did find chairs but it was very tight area. We were fine with it. We did not eat dinner here but did have drinks. Breakfast was included in our room rate and was very good. You had a choice to eat outside or inside. They had the typical breakfast foods and you could make your own waffles. The bell boys were very friendly. They helped my husband to find the pharmacy to get me medicine for conjunctivitis I would easily stay here again since the location and the hotel is so nice and perfect
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dimitris, the fantastic youngest driver for Nicholas, has been our driver for 3 trips. Full day (Argolis), 1/2 day (Cape Sounio), and to the Flying Cat Ferry (Spetses). Fun, informative, with smooth safe driving. Ask for him!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my dream hotel, even better this year than when I went 20 years ago. They even managed to put all three grandchildren in the same room. Every thing on site is perfect, and the Plaka spreads itself around you. The concierge had good suggestions, and the staff was ever ready to help.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 6th or 7th visit to this hotel . Always spotlessly clean with very friendly and welcoming staff. Great views of the acropolis from the rooftop pool. Easy walk into Plaka with a great selection of shops and tavernas. The only down size is that they close the pool at 7 pm when the sun is still on it and the temperature is more bearable. There were lots of people still using when they started putting the railings round. Also there only 12 sun beds for a very large hotel . They could fit more round the pool. Other than that we had another fantastic stay and will definitely return.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great location near the Parthenon with plenty of restaurants near by. the pool and bar look out at the Parthenon. the staff were very helpful the rooms really comfortable. the pool bar is a great place to have a cold drink and watch the sunset with the parthenon in view.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in a suite with a great view of the Acropolis from the balcony. The hotel also has a great view from the roof top pool and restaurant and bar areas. Very nice, well appointed and spacious suite. Great service from the hotel staff and nice morning breakfast. Very close walking distance to Plaka and the Acropolis. Very nice overall.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were delighted with this hotel. A stylish and peaceful haven in the busy Plaka area. It is well located and we walked everywhere during our 4 night stay. The rooms and facilities were excellent, we particularly enjoyed the rooftop pool and café and would like to thank Constantin and his team for providing the 5 of us with numerous Capuccinos. We would all definitely return.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the Electra Palace many times. The location and elegance of this hotel is wonderful. The rooms are lovely and the junior suite gives you extra room for longer stays. The breakfast is good but not the best for a 5 Star hotel. Compared to other 5 Star hotels in Greece it's not a unique experience but adequate. The service staff in the restaurant and houskekeeping are very nice and friendly. We found this year that the reception staff weren't as friendly as past years. Very unusual for Greek hotels. We still give this hotel a 5 star rating and will be back next year!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generally almost everything was ok: Great location, Nice Loby, Friendly staff, Cleanliness, ComfortNothing was really bad. However, for the price we paid and our expectations based on reviews, we were a bit disappointed. Room size was rather small based on our former experience in 5 stars hotels. A coffee machine was missing in the room. The lighting in the room was inadequate. Wall coating needs replacement or at least a refreshment. Size of bathroom was ok, and toiletry was rich. However It was uncomfortable: When the door was open it was uncomfortable to stand at the sink, The location of the toilet is not optimal, It's hard to shower in the bathtub without wetting the floor next to it.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were here only one night on our way to our next stop, but enjoyed the amenities of this modern-feeling hotel in a central location. We were able to walk to the Acropolis and enjoyed the rooftop restaurant overlooking same. Dinner was delicious and the view outstanding. Staff were helpful and even talked us back to the hotel by phone when we got turned around on the side streets. Highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t really give the hotel a bad rating because I didn’t get to stay there. Our flight to Athens was overbooked and we were bumped from the flight. I called Expedia right away so they could notify the hotel of our dilemma. Electra Palace denied the cancellation and any refund. This was totally out of our control and quite frankly very unfair.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three days while exploring Athens. All staff were amazing from the front desk to the housekeeping and breakfast area. The rooms though were quite compact which made it difficult at times to open your suitcases easily. Also limited PowerPoints in the room. Breakfast was very nice and plenty of choices. It is an older style hotel but it is well maintained and kept in an elegant style.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel. But you do not feel that you are in a 5 stars hotel. The service ok; rooms very clean; no great views as they say; breakfast normal and the waitress during breakfast do not give you a smile; the roof restaurant, nothing out of this world, there are better and cheaper restaurants around.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife, son, and I stayed at the Electra Palace Hotel last week. What a lovely hotel! Service was outstanding and breakfast was much better than one would expect at a buffet. Great pool but perhaps a bit small and with not enough loungers. Did have an EXCEPTIONAL view of the Parathion. Walk-able for most all significant Athens sites. Service at the front desk was outstanding. Room bed was very comfy and the shower was great. Could use a bit more room in the dresser or another place to put clothes. Breakfast is the only meal we ate here and both the pool bar as well as the breakfast are top rate. Employees were very kind and got us off and running to our early morning ferry in great speed. Good drinks at the rooftop bar and pool area. Water was pretty cold in the pool could use to be heated in the early season. All in all a very very good to outstanding hotel. If you can swing it get one of the higher up rooms with a balcony and view of the Acropolis.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband I stay at the Electra Palace for three nights in May 2019. The location is fantastic and the service was great. Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The air conditioning worked very well. No complaints. The breakfast was wonderful. The view of the Acropolis from our balcony and the pool/bar area was spectacular! Our favorite thing to do after a long day of site seeing was to have a drink by the pool and gaze at the Acropolis while watching the sunset. I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned after spending a week in Athens staying at this lovely hotel. The location was central to where we wanted to be and we felt safe. Many restaurants and bars were close by and there was the added bonus of the fantastic view of the Acropolis from the roof top pool and restaurant. The staff could not do enough for us especially Nickos who always had a lovely smile and a willingness to assist in answering any questions we had of needed.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend this hotel to stay in Athens. Amazing views from the roof bar. Location was excellent as we were.able to walk to all major sites. The staff are friendly and helpful. Thorougky enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here one night on our way back home from Athens and visits to Mykonos and Santorini as part of a Costco vacation package. Excellent location and view of the Acropolis from the Rooftop restaurant.I'd like to comment on the Captain of the restaurant, Kiriakos, who gave us amazing service and view of the sites. We were preparing to go out to eat but had a coupon for a free drink at the pool bar and went up, and thast's when we met Kiriakos, what a gentleman he is, thanks very much to you and to Spiros for making our last night in Athens an excellent one!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very happy with this hotel! The location is very convenient to several tourist attractions and shopping. The rooms are very nice. The breakfast is fantastic. The service I experienced from the hotel staff was top-notch. The rooftop restaurant has good food as well. You cannot go wrong by staying here.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accomodation; helpful staff; reasonably priced, great location. Outstanding breakfast. Would recommend the rooftop restaurant with great view of the Acropolis at night. Convenient to Adrianou St market
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We initially looked at staying at the Hotel Grande Bretagne, but the Electra Palace was much less expensive and closer to the Acropolis and closer to the Plaka area of restaurants and shops. Our room on the top floor had amazing views of the Acropolis and was cool and comfortable. The rate included a good breakfast, and fruit/wine delivered daily. Staff were all pleasant and helpful. If we ever return to Athens, we would stay here again!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at Electra Palace Hotel was great. The breakfast offerings/ options were plentiful, the shower was nice, and my bed was so comfortable. Electra Palace is so conveniently located to many tourist attractions, the metro, shopping, and dining. I am so glad I chose this hotel for my vacation stay.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights. I left incredibly impressed with the hotel. The location is very central. Roof top pool, bar and restaurant have incredible view of the Acropolis. The rooms were clean and very functional. The staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was excellent The breakfast was very good. However, I didn’t feel it was a 5 star hotel. The room was tiny. The Bathroom was tiny with no tub and small shower. Felt like 3 star hotel The gym was really bad with one treadmill, one elliptical, one bench, one machine that has everything but was not working and very few light weights. WiFi was bad Swimming pool was smallHere are some pictures of my stay
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location right in the heart of the Plaka area. No more than 10 mins walk from most of the tourist attractions and bars/restaurants.Hotel is beautiful and the breakfast is substantial - my son particularly enjoyed the waffle machine! We didn't eat at the hotel in the evenings but the menu looked good and reasonably priced.I am an Electra Rewards member and my only slight negative was that this wasn't recognised on check in. When I mentioned it later (we were very tired at checkin due to late flight so I didn't register at first!) the staff member was apologetic and said there were 2 records set up for me for some reason. He then gave me a voucher for a welcome drink to be used at any time during our stay. As one of the benefits is room allocation however, I do wonder if we would have had a better view or room away from the lift if all had gone smoothly.The outdoor pool is a bonus - amazing view - but as we went in April it wasn't really warm enough to use comfortably so we used the indoor pool which was also very nice, if a bit warm!We would stay here again if visiting Athens, and I would definitely recommend it to friends/family. Just the niggle with Electra rewards preventing me from giving 5 stars.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful view from the roof terrace but food quite basic for the price. I expected something much better from a hotel of this caliber. Also renovation was taking place in the pool area so the noise was disturbing
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I had the pleasure of spending four nights in this splendid hotel.The service and friendly nature of the staff only help to complement what is in my opinion a superb hotel. The double room was as expected, small but not that it became a problem for two people to negotiate, the bathroom offering a bath/shower and the usual products, bathrobe and slippers. We enjoyed our visit to the indoor pool and jacuzzi, but did not partake in the use of the gym or spa facilities. During our stay we never actually ate at the restaurant on the fifth floor, but going through it gives you access to a veranda and outdoor pool and of course a spectacular view of the Acropolis. This hotel is in a great location for sightseeing, shopping, and for all types of restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel and would most definitely return.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to Athens for work and didn’t plan to stay in the Electra Palace but when my second night’s reservation didn’t work out I moved here on recommendation of a colleague - she’s Greek and clearly knows what she’s talking about! I was so impressed with this hotel. Great location close to lots of little boutiques, restaurants and all of the major sights. I was lucky enough to get upgraded to a suite with Acropolis views which was well, just WOW! Thanks to the staff for that amazing surprise. But that aside this is a lovely hotel, beautifully decorated (smells great when you walk into the lobby!) and the staff are all really friendly. It’s not cheap but you definitely get what you pay for. I stayed at another hotel downtown after this and it was no where near as good. If I come back to Athens I’d definitely pick the Electra Palace.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent 5 nights at the Electra Palace Athens. Excellent accommodation, great location, super friendly staff. Great spa facilities. A bit too early for the outdoor pool to be open but there is an indoor pool and spa that was perfect for relaxing in after busy days exploring the city. Dora was an excellent therapist who was very professional and provided a great massage and relaxing facial. Look out for the daily offers. All staff at the hotel were friendly and went out of their way to help. Room was good, plenty of hot water, fluffy towels and nice bathroom products. Would recommend.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited this place a while ago in case of a buisness trip. Hotel i think is quiet costly. Overall experince was average not much bad also nott so much fascinating. One can find more experincing places there.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely warm welcome to this lovely, centrally located hotel. Check in was simple with George and we were soon in our room which was fresh, clean and well appointed. House keeping was impeccable and it was good to see that the hotel has a 'green' approach to linen and towels. We used the spa everyday which was a great way to wind down after lots of walking around the city and the spa manager was so professional and friendly. The roof top bar had amazing views of the city and especially the Acropolis - it was a shame that tis had really yet to open for the summer season. Breakfast was buffet style and the choice was endless. Only negative comment is about the bar in the reception area on the ground floor - the service was terrible most of the time and on two occasions we walked out without having been served which was a shame as otherwise this would have been a 5 star review
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed the good location. All local sights and many restaurants closeby. Good rooms (we chose two separate beds) and wonderful breakfast buffet. Consierge was very helpful. Highly recommended!!!!!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The EP is the best hotel in Athens because it is a beautiful venue, large comfortable rooms, friendly & helpful staff, and close to everything: Adrianou shopping, Greek Orthodox Church headquarters and supply merchants, In the Plaka and near all ancient attractions, restaurants, shopping and transportation to airport, cruise port, subway. plus wonderful food and breakfast included with your room....upstairs on the roof garden if the weather permits. Pay extra for an "acropolis view" room and you will not regret it: Walk everywhere saves taxi fares. You get a room with a balcony and can enjoy he view 24 hours a day. If you book well in advance you can get the same room for half the regular price and below the neighbors. Restaurant is very modern cuisine with prices to match. Worth it for a one-time splurge. the Greek Orthodox Metropolitan dines there.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
