review_body: Can’t speak more highly of this hotel. it is close to the hustle and noise of Syntagma Sq but far enough away to be an oasis of calm. Staff, rooms, food and public area are top rate. Our room provided an excellent view of the acropolis,Value for money very good in my opinion.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Electra Palace is a 5 star Hotel and this rating is due to the public areas and dining. The room itself was small but clean and modern. The breakfast dining area was excellent with a good selection. The alternative rooftop restaurant offers incredible views of the Acropolis and quality food. Pool are was also very good and popular with the children. a good place to stay.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel, quietly located away from the hussle & bussle but yet only a few minutes walk away from everything. syntagma sq, Ermou shopping area, monastiraki, plaka etc. Located in a quiet location this is a great hotel to relax and enjoy Athens. Breakfast was fantastic, with a huge range of variety of fresh cooked food, they even had a waffle machine to make your own fresh waffles. The bar is a great area but lacked life, maybe the grumpy old man serving has something to do with it. I’ve stayed at both the other 2 Electra hotels close by, but this seems to be the most quietist.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good time in Athens at this hotel. Location is great, walking distance to so much. Staff were friendly and courteous, the spa massage (from an Italian lady- forgot her name) was great. Would stay again if I was to visit the city once more.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We(a group of 6) stayed at the Electra Palace Hotel for 3 nights just back this evening 6/3/2019 Having enjoyed beautiful rooms with views of the Acropolis in a fabulous hotel where the staff were amazing,they were efficient,friendly,and helpful.The hotel is situated in a central position to visit many special sites especially The Acropolis.The breakfast was full of choices all delicious.On our 1st night we ate in The Roof Top restaurant what a view!!Thefood in this restaurant was delightful we all loved our meal and again great service from the staff,we would strongly recommend this restaurant.Thank you to all the staff for a lovely hotel and dining experience.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the breakfast at the hotel , it had alot of varieties , the rooms are okay , the location is very good and very close to the shopping street, the staff were very helpfull and nice , yes i would stay there again !
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stately, with the air of an era long gone, the Electra Palace Athens is hospitable and aristocratic it welcomes for you in the heart of the city. The view from the dining area over the acropolis is utterly fantastic. Classical in its architecture and design, blending beautifully with the noble historical buildings of the Plaka area. The staff are friendly, welcoming and extremely helpful. We purchased tickets from the hotel for the Red tour bus these tickets were valid for two days and allowed us to get on off at numerous points of interests throughout the city. Cited within the interesting Plaks area the hotel could not be in a better position, i would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My teenage kids and I enjoyed this hotel. Location was perfect for walking to all the main sites, shopping , and restaurants. It was quiet at night ,and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The views from the rooftop restaurant and pool are stunning. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel before heading out and this saved a lot of time and there were plenty of options. ( waffles, eggs, fruit).
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great - our room (tiny but very comfortable), location, front desk staff, and the complimentary breakfast. Would definitely stay there again. Best part of my stay was my massage at the spa with Dimitra. Possibly the best massage I have ever had - so good that I booked a second one the next day. (I'm actually writing this 8 months after my stay so I hope she is still there).
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three of us stayed in the hotel from Friday 8th - Monday 11th February 2019. We arrived on the Friday evening at around 9pm and were immediately impressed by how attentive the staff were. Check in was quick, thorough and in addition, as a member of the Electra loyalty scheme I was granted access to the premier wifi and given a voucher for two free drinks at the hotel bar. I shared a twin room with a friend (room 518) which was perfect for our stay. The room had all the facilities you would expect in a hotel of this quality. The beds were comfortable and everything was spotlessly clean. The room was serviced well and the turn down service left a very welcome chocolate on our beds each night- thanks!Our room looked out onto adjoining buildings but we didn't go to Athens to look out of the hotel window. Having said that. we were only a few feet away from the entrance to the rooftop terrace which overlooks the Acropolis. Great for enjoying the February sunshine on the Sunday afternoon. The rooftop pool is closed till April, but the indoor pool is open and when I went for my swim on Sunday at 1.30pm I was the only person in it - bliss!The hotel is set away from the main streets but is in a great location for all the major sights of Athens. We found it very easy to walk to all of these to enjoy the most of Athens. I made breakfast on two of our three days there. On offer was everything you could expect, both hot and cold as well as a low fat counter of foods for those watching the calories! Great and tasty choices. Thanks to all at the hotel for a very enjoyable stay and I will definitely choose to stay with you again in the future. Anyone reading this should too!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful hotel. It is located superbly in the Plaka, very near to lots of shops, restaurants, and historical sights. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and efficient. We paid for a superior room with Acropolis view, and it was well worth it. We had a wonderful balcony to sit in the sun, and take in the views. The room was well appointed and comfortable. The hotel restaurant was fabulous--great service, interesting food and incredible views of the Acropolis. This was February so we didn't use the rooftop pool but what a bonus! For breakfast, there was plenty of choice and it was good quality. The decor throughout the hotel was lovely. On many trips, one uses the hotel to sleep, but we actually spent quite a bit of time hanging out there -- in the garden, in the bar (where we had a snack one evening because we were too tired to go out) and in our room -- by choice because the atmosphere was so comfortable and welcoming.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived today at this 5 star hotel with expectation of a 5 star accommodation. So 1st, the room is so small that the bed is a fullsize US size , not even a queen, and less than 2.5 ft from the closet door no room for luggage comfortably so I had to leave luggage stand up position by the entry door. The shower is a small corner boxI was given a room on 4th floor facing NOTHING. I like to open my window or curtains, as I don’t like to wake up in darkness, however , my window faces 2 buildings with windows looking at mine within 20 ft away at most.So call it as you like, but that is not a 5 star room or accommodation . This of Ibis. I stayed at lower rating hotels in Athens with larger rooms and better view.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Electra is at the top of the Plaka, making it easy for us to explore that section of Athens without hiring transportation. The rooms were recently renovated, and it really showed. Clean, streamlined, modern - and QUIET. Amazing since we were facing such a busy street, but the glass door was solid! Service was excellent, the rooftop restaurant charming with a delicious and varied European-style breakfast and views of the Acropolis on one side, and the city sprawl and mountains on the other.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A really nice place with a good location - near local handicraft/leather shopping, as the rooftop has a great view of the acropolis. Food is excellent, rooms are clean and offer varied views. A nice blend of old and new in a great location. I would gladly stay again on my next trip!
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great place to have a meal on the rooftop and have a swim in the pool. The view is spectacular, The breakfast menu is huge. The hotel entrance is grand. The room was very clean, However, our double bed was two single beds combined,
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed in this hotel for only 2 nights during our 3 days visit in Athens. We really, really liked this hotel! Although the room wasn't large, it was on par with a luxury hotel, very clean and loaded with all the amenities. The location is the best anyone can get. A quite street but still right in the center and walking distance to all the most important locations. The service was great, I especially really liked the concierge who helped us few times with excellent recommendations.
hotelName:
27    Electra Palace Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel- great location, near restaurants, shopping and of course, the Acropolis. The staff was helpful and attentive, room was spacious and clean, amenities wonderful. Bonus to have coffee and fridge in room. Thank you for the welcome gift!!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Ava Hotel in the Plaka neighborhood of athens. The staff were so very friendly and helpful, and the room comfy and clean. We had a suite with a terrace from which we could view Hadrian's Arch and a part of the Acropolis. We were able to walk to many places easily. The kitchen was perfect for chilling our wine and having fresh fruits and other snacks on hand. The bed was quite comfortable. We would recommend this hotel without pause.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel because of it’s location & were very pleased with the accommodations & service. With taxes & fees it was around $400/night, which is comparable to other nice hotels in major cities. Hadrian’s Arch & the Temple of Zeus are basically outside the door. It is less than 5 min walk to the Acropolis & 2 minutes from tourist shopping. The National Gardens, Panhellenic stadium, & Parliament are with 15 minutes of walking. They kindly arranged our transportation from the airport & delivered sparkling wine when we arrived. It would be nice if a light breakfast could be added to the room earlier than the main breakfast (not included), as tours start earlier than breakfast begins in Athens. This neighborhood is very crowded, but not loud. Rooms were quiet large & nicely decorated.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If it’s your first time to Athens, like it was for us, Ava hotel is perfectly positioned in the Plaka area. It’s right at the beginning of Lysikratous street facing Hadrian’s Arch. The Acropolis is a couple of streets behind and Syntagma Square is a 10 min walk. As is Monastiraki. Unbeatable location! We visited in the peak visitor season (July) and peak of the summer temperatures too. Luckily as our flight from London landed in the afternoon, the room was available immediately (check in time is 2:30pm). The chilled white they comped on our arrival was a wonderful relief in the heat of Athens. We were a family of three - 2 adults and a teenager so we took a room with an additional bed. There was a basic kitchenette in the room and a little balcony. Everything was clean and welcoming and met all our needs, without appearing too basic. The bathroom was well stocked with supplies, hairdryer etc. The bathroom door didn’t lock initially but we obtained a key. Breakfast was tasty and more than adequate although not the huge global spread that fancier hotels provide - two kinds of eggs, toast, baked goods, a choice of cold cuts / sausages, grilled veggies, salad, Greek yoghurt and cheeses, and fruits, juices, coffee and tea. The staff here are wonderful, going out of their way to help out and to advise. From adapters to reservations to early morning packed breakfasts, they handled every sort of request. If you’re looking for a place that is conveniently located for all sightseeing I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and it was perfect for my aunt and I. We had a huge balcony that looked out at the acropolis. It was so nice to sit out there at night and gaze on its beauty. The staff was amazing and they arranged a great walking tour of everything with Bobbie. We had wine waiting in our room when we arrived, we had a kitchen and the bathroom had a beautiful painted ceiling. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was great every morning. We were spoiled here in the heart of everything in our penthouse room. We had a great stay and if you are thinking of staying here; do it! You won’t regret it.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the AVA Hotel! The staff was very kind, helpful, and accommodating. They welcomed us in even when we arrived early. From restaurant recommendations to assisting with a medical crisis, the AVA staff was absolutely wonderful.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel’s location could not be better. It is less than a one minute walk to Hadrian’s Arch and the Temple of Zeus. It is also close to the Acropolis, which could be seen from the balcony of our room. The staff was friendly and tried to help us in any way we needed. They ordered a taxi for an early morning airport transfer, printed out our next flight’s boarding passes, and helped book a tour of the acropolis for us. They also have a good selection of books and movies (movies upon request) in the lobby. We were given champagne the day we checked in. The bathrooms were especially modern and clean, along with the entire room. Definitely a great hotel I would recommend!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Athens was the last stop on my wife's 75th Birthday Tour (also called the No Regrets Tour) where we went back to old favorites. We'd been to Athens twice before but wanted to do it properly.The Ava Hotel was the perfect solution for us. The Executive Suite is roomy (559 sq ft), modern, exceptionally clean, and has a balcony that has Hardian's Arch (and the Temple of Zeus) out one side and the Acropolis out the other.The facilities are great, but the people are better. They were always on top of making our vacation run the way we wanted it to. Great attitudes, big smiles, and great information.The Executive Suite has a full kitchen and a workspace just inside the door, and a dining bar with seating for four. It then goes into a sizable living room and an equally spacious bedroom. And then, of course, the balcony. The balcony does not have furniture on it. but we found that the chairs by the bar would fit just fine...The bathroom has a nice rain forest shower and two sinks. In the ceiling was a large circular painting. Very pretty.Breakfast is served daily. It's pretty well rounded, mostly buffet, but they will cook eggs to order. I'd didn't push beyond that... They do not serve dinner, but you can order from room service. We did that one night, waited over an hour (they warned us), and saw the food delivery guy drop off our food. Thankfully, it was still warm.We asked them to arrange airport transfers and a private guide for us. They arranged for a young lady named Helen to take us to the Acropolis. My wife had taken a bad fall earlier in the vacation (but kept motoring on) so we were a little slow. There is an elevator that goes to the top and is available only for disabled people with a letter from their doctor and prior approval. Somehow, Helen managed to get us on. Thanks again, Helen!!We thought that the location was exceptional. As I may have mentioned before ;-)) Hadrian's Arch is a block in one direction, and in the other direction is the base of the Acropolis. Two blocks up is a pedestrian zone with an incredible collection of stores and restaurants and people. Mixed in the obligatory T-Shirt shops are leather stores, high end clothing, many types of food - including gelato!!!, outdoor cafes, and small parks. All in all, a great time at a great hotel in a fantastic location!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The AVA is centrally located within walking distance of all the major sites in Athens. Rooms are comfortable and quiet and the staff is excellent. We have never been disappointed and have highly recommended The AVA to friends visiting Athens.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb stay with in prime location, awesome room with comfortable bed and excellent staff. I would highly recommend staying at this property and plan to stay here whenever I do return to Athens. Two thumbs up
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance to everything, Plaka, Acropolis, National Garden, Syntagma Square, Hadrian's Arch, countless choices of great restaurants, rooftop bars, etc. Hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. Stayed in a suite with a view of the Acropolis. Street was pretty busy with foot traffic and some vehicles, but the room was nicely quiet. Actually left this hotel to go Santorini and Mykonos, and returned for a day prior to return to the US. Staff recognized us and welcomed us back. In fact, one of the cute staff recognized me and my wife walking down a nearby street and greeted us like we knew her for years -- so sweet :-)
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One block from the Plaka that is loaded with shops and restaurants. Rooms are large and very well furnished. Staff is super nice. You will be able to walk to Acropolis. You will be hard pressed to find any better or better location.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night to start our Greece trip. The location was great, we were able to walk right out and be in the center of the Plaka. The rooms were modern, spacious and clean. I only wish we had a nicer view on the balcony (ours was the back of the hotel). Would definitely stay again
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in a great location, easy walking distance to many restaurants and tourist attractions. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, willing to give recommendations for dining or tours. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. Excellent morning breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: O quarto é incrível e com ótimo tamanho, tendo uma cozinha com mini geladeira vazia e um frigobar. Há fogão e pia. A localização é perfeita, dentro de plaka sem ser em local barulhento. O Staff é muito educado e solícito.////The room is amazing, really good size and with a mini kitchen. The location is perfect, inside Plaka but without being in a noisy place. The front desk staff, especially the two guys in afternoon/late night are very friendly and helpfull.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s difficult to find any fault with our 5-night stay at the Ava Hotel.Our executive suite (room 101) was more like a small apartment than a hotel room, with a separate living area and bedroom. As well as a comfortable sitting area, there was a fully equipped kitchenette and a bathroom with both a bath with shower and a separate shower cubicle. Everything was spotlessly clean. The breakfast was generously varied for a hotel that has only 9 rooms (we think) and consisted of slightly different pastries, fruit, cheese, breads and eggs every day, all set out very nicely with the same attentive service. The staff were all a delight, giving a warm welcome and being eager to help whenever they could. Vassia was a particular star and she always managed to appear genuinely happy to see us whenever we came in!For anyone in Athens on a sight-seeing trip, the location was perfect, with Hadrian’s Arch at one end of the short street and the base of the Acropolis at the other. If we ever return to Athens, the Ava will be our first choice.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ava Hotel in the Plaka district of Athens is a beautiful hotel. Our room was actually a small suite with a kitchenette. The room was spacious and very pretty, especially the bathroom. It appears to have been updated not long ago. Very convenient to the Acropolis and good restaurants. They also provide a big breakfast (extra charge) if you desire. I didn’t have it but my family raved about it. Loved this place.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great room, enjoyed very friendly staff, and had a great location near Hadrian’s gate. Breakfasts were very good in a nice environment. I highly recommend AVA to anyone looking to enjoy the Plaka and the Acropolis.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at AVA Hotel & Suites in Athens in April, 2019. I rarely write a review but sometimes a hotel is so outstanding that I feel compelled to do so. AVA Hotel is definitely that type of outstanding place! I can honestly say that there is not one negative aspect to this hotel! The location is perfect if you wish to visit all of the ancient sites in Athens. All of the top sites are within walking distance of the hotel (5-10 minutes walk at the most). The hotel is located in the Plaka District which is very safe to walk around and has many wonderful restaurants also within walking distance. Plus, the hotel is located on a small side-street which is very quiet. You will not hear road traffic in your room! The suites at the AVA are beautifully designed and quite large. There is plenty of room to relax both inside or on your balcony. The views are magical both during the day and at night! Housekeeping does an excellent job and the rooms are spotlessly clean. Thank you to the housekeeping staff! A breakfast is served in the common area near the lobby each morning and has wonderful Greek favorites along with eggs and other dishes which can be served free to you. The Greek yogurt with honey and Greek salad were our favorites along with some Greek pastries made fresh each morning from a sweet and kind woman from the kitchen staff. The best part of the hotel is that every person on staff was as kind, caring, and helpful as possible. They always went out of their way to get us answers to questions, offered advice on restaurants and things to do, made reservations.....but always with a smile and cheerful response. Whenever we arrived back at the hotel we were greeted with a genuine smile and a question about how our day was going. Everyone made us feel like we were friends and we would like to especially thank Vassia, Andreea, Lambrini, and Stravos for their kind help. Thank you to everyone at AVA Hotel & Suites for making our stay in Greece such a wonderful experience! Next time we visit Athens we will definitely stay here. If you stay at this hotel you will not be disappointed!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved staying at the AVA Hotel & Suites. Our taxi driver commented when he dropped us off from the airport that we had the perfect location and he was right!We had a view out one side of our balcony of the Acropolis, the other side features Hadrian’s Arch and the Temple of Zeus. We could walk two blocks and be in the midst of the Plaka pedestrian streets with all the shopping and restaurants and yet close our window to our hotel room and not hear anything from outside. The executive suite set up was ideal for a family of four with a king size bed for the parents and the kids had a single and a double to fight over in the living room. The bathroom was big and clean; and the kitchenette meant we could go out to get breakfast and eat it in our room rather than pay the 15 euro pp for the hotel breakfast.Lamprini at the front desk was like having a private concierge - she arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport and several dinner reservations.We highly recommend AVA to anyone visiting Athens to see the major sights!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our third stay. There is nothing to fault at this small, friendly, perfectly located hotel. Our suite is lovely with everything to make our stay comfortable. Our sweeping terrace right under the acropolis is breathtaking. The staff at the hotel is what makes it so special. Welcoming, experienced, and knowledgeable. They could not be nicer. For us, there is no other hotel to stay when in Athens. ( And we have tried a number of them)
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super friendly and helpful staff. Our room was immaculate and very comfortable. Well placed too. Look right from the front door you see the Acropolis. Look left Hadrian’s Arch is 50 metres away. From what I could see Plaka appeared to be one of the nicer areas although Athens generally seems to be plagued by pickpockets. Recommend you do not use backpacks and exercise care at all times. No reflection on the Ava Hotel which was a perfect base. The surrounding restaurants and bars were all super friendly if a bit over pushy to get you to in the door. They all do it so we just decided to go with the flow.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly, I am surprised by the high number of excellent reviews. It may just be that I have had the experience of staying in several other hotels in Athens, and for the price (almost $300 USD!), I found this hotel to be far below my expectations. It was the most expensive and yet the most average hotel I have stayed at in Athens. The location is excellent, but the customer service is sub-par, the beds and pillows are not particularly comfortable, the towels are old and stiff and the room (especially the bathroom) is fairly out-dated. The website is beautiful--boasting luxurious suites and a roof top view of the acropolis. Neither of which is the case. We "splurged" on a one night stay here subsequent to our sailing trip and were deeply disappointed. I would recommend looking elsewhere.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying at Ava Athens and we would highly recommend staying here to anyone who wants the perfect location for the Parthenon, the Museum, the shops and the restaurants. The front office staff was incredibly nice and helpful (thank you Magda, Andreea and everyone), we could say thanks enough. We will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have recently returned from Athens after a 3 night stay in this hotel, On arrival we were upgraded to an executive suite which was more than adequate to our needs with a separate bedroom and sitting room, There was a separate wall mounted TV in both rooms and although we didn't use it much an area for food preparation with a sink, two hobs and a microwave/oven. There was a small fridge in the room ideal for storing soft drinks, fruit or cold meats and cheese for making a sandwich should you not have the inclination to eat in a restaurant.The hotel serves a breakfast with the possibility to have eggs sausage and bacon with the usual continental breakfast of cold meats, cheeses, rolls toast and jam. The choice is adequate but is not as vast as is found in the larger 5 star luxury hotels, This was not a problem for my wife and I or I would imagine the vast majority of guests.The hotel does not serve lunch or dinner but there a number of restaurants 5 minutes walk away with facilities to cook or make sandwiches in the room should you wish not to eat out twice a day and are staying for a more extended period than the short break we took.Staff were friendly and eager and able to give advice regarding local shopping and sightseeing. Service overall was excellent and the rooms and hotel lobby and breakfast room scrupulously clean.There is a small room adjacent to the lobby with a computer and printer where I was able to print out my boarding card prior to my flight back to the UK.The hotel is centrally placed in Plaka within walking distance of The Acropolis, The Acropolis Museum, The Temple of Zeus, Panathenaic Stadium, and The Parliament Building at Syntagma Square, all of which we were able to visit in one day. Plaka itself has a myriad of souvenir shops, restaurants, bars, and ice cream parlours although there are also a number of bakeries, grocery stores, and shops used by the locals dotted around if you care to look.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a sightseer in Athens the AVA Hotel is very nice. Our room was good for an extended stay having a separate bedroom as well as a kitchenette and a desk. The location makes walking to most of the major Athen's sights easy. The staff were great.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a suite. It was immaculate. The bathroom had beautiful tiles and an amazing painted ceiling. It had a fridge and a hob, but no microwave. We asked for one and it was provided straight away with no fuss. The staff were very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is perfectly situated in a Plaka, has clean modern rooms, well trained and friendly staff, a breakfast buffet, room service menu, well-insulated Windows thst do not allow the Plaka noise to come in, and excellent heating/air conditioning.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband is an excellent Internet researcher, carefully reading customers’ reviews...and so he found Ava Hotel. Talk about the greatest surprise one can ever have!!! This hotel is in the PERFECT location in Plaka, between the Hadrian Arch and the Acropolis. Most of the tourist attractions that you want to see in Athens are close to the hotel, saving you taxi money. And, as if that were not enough, the rooms are suites, that is, you have a living room, kitchenette with eating counter, a nice and modern bathroom, and a nice and spacious bedroom. (Our suite was an executive suite, 52 sq.mt. The regular rooms are basic suites of 32 sq.mt.) All very pleasant, modern, and clean. I could not believe my eyes when I opened the door to our room.The hotel is small (called a boutique hotel) and one would never expect it to be so great. But great it was, including the very friendly, informative, and professional staff. We did not partake of the daily breakfast offered by the hotel for an additional $15/day. Due to its great location, the hotel is surrounded by a myriad of restaurants and eating establishments, a few open as early as 6:00 a.m., and for a lesser price, you can enjoy a great breakfast. Ask the staff for dinner recommendations as Plaka is full of great little restaurants. Also close by are rental car companies.I will be a returning customer the next time I visit Athens. My husband and I highly recommend it to you.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the AVA for the last 2 nights in Greece. Booked a basic suite but were upgraded to a Grand Suite Fantastic room with everything including the kitchen sink. Separate lounge room, kitchen, very spacious bedroom and large bathroom. Spotless, comfortable and a short walk from shopping and Acropolis. The staff were very professional and friendly and happy to help you with information if needed. This is a boutique hotel that is centrally located in Plaka and a short walk to the Olympic Stadium & Acropolis and across the road from Hadrian's Arch and the Temple of Zeus. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby.We stayed on Level 3 with a view of the Acropolis. A HUGE balcony with outdoor dining and sitting area. Very little street noise was evident during our stay. The lift is very small (old and quirky but just right for the hotel) but if you are fit the stairs offer an alternative in busy periods. Breakfast was satisfactory with the food catering for most tastes. There is no restaurant in the hotel but with so many restaurants just outside the hotel there is plenty of choice for lunch & dinner. This is a bustling little area with plenty to see and do and a relatively short walk to the Acropolis, the flea market and the main tourist shopping area. We would stay there again without hesitation.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent several nights of our honeymoon here in an executive suite. Everyone was wonderfully helpful. The room exceeded our expectations for the location/price. We will definitely be coming back if we find ourselves back in Athens. Thank you.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stated her while my wife came to run the Original Olympic marathon course in Athens. We also went to see the Acropolis, Agora, and many other of the ancient ruins in Athens. Breakfast was included and was very good and the staff were excellent with customer service for whatever you needed from transportation, places to eat, and local ancient sites. I would stay here again if I came back.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the Ava Hotel. The location is perfect for the main sights and in a nice area of Athens. The rooms are well appointed, clean, and well-maintained. The staff were very helpful and thoughtful - in particular a big thank you to Lambrini, Maria, and Vasia. Breakfast was good with a reasonable choice - particularly given it is a relatively small hotel. It will certainly be our first choice for when we next return to Athens.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with an adult child, the question was to get 2 $200 rooms or 1 for $350-$400. Going for the triple was excellent. We had a suite that suited us perfectly. The foldout couch was comfortable, without the notorious bar showing through the mattress. Bathroom had a tub & separate shower. Kitchen had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee pot.The front desk folks were great...very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Note: if you rent a car, there are parking lots a few blocks away that are separate from the hotel, but they can help you find them.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is perfectly located for a vacation. Very friendly & accommodating management and staff. Plenty of restaurants within a short walk and all the significant historical sites. We recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Ava 5 nights in early Oct. It is the perfect hotel to use as a home base for day trips in the city of Athens and to the surrounding countryside (Corinth Canal, Myceanea, Mystros). It is located between Hadrian's Arch and The Acropolis. If you have an executive room, as our travel companions did, you'll have a view of both. Our room had a "city view" which was really the back of other apartments but fine as we were really on in our room a limited amount of time. The room was clean, bed was very comfortable and space was large enough for the 2 of us and lots of luggage. It was nice to have the kitchen to make tea, coffee and warm up leftovers from the fabulous local Plaka restaurants. Don't miss Psaras for an incredible view and dinner. Also Athena Bistro, both recommended by the hotel. Hotel staff was very accommodating and warmly welcomed us. Nice assortment of breakfast foods from eggs and bacon to cold cuts and cheeses, yogurt, oatmeal, waffles, juices, cold cereal, rolls and pastries.Our only complaint would be that we needed a blanket not just a sheet and thin bed spread.All 4 in our party would highly recommend the Ava.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the street you look one way and see Hedrian's Gate and in the other direction you see the Acropolis. How great is that! Staff was very attentive and the property was lovely. Buffet breakfast was very good. Room was spacious with a small kitchenette.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, great, helpful staff, clean, spacious rooms. Staff was fantastic helping us get around, see the sights and at at the very best restaurants. Having a full kitchen was great. Bed was comfortable.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently spent four nights at this hotel and completely fell in love with it. The room (including a living room, kitchenette, bathroom and bedroom) were nicely and comfortably decorated with a touch of whimsy - LOVED the tromp l'oeil skylight in the bathroom which was so much fun. When on my balcony I could see the Temple of Zeus on one side and the Acropolis on the other.The staff were kind and anxious to please. Breakfast was excellent - a mix of American favorites, Continental choices (i.e. cold cuts, cheese, etc) and Greek flavors.Despite being in the Plaka area, it was quiet.Will definitely return.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the hotel in October. The staff are very friendly and helpful in providing directions, restaurant suggestions and transfer help. The hotel has a pretty nice DVD library that is free of charge. As others have said, having the breakfast included is nice, and the food quality is good, but limited. If your rate does not include breakfast, I wouldn't recommend paying extra for it, as there are lots of cafe's/restaurants around the hotel. The hotel location is great for sightseeing! It is located in the La Plaka area of Athens, which is the historical section of the city, so it's a great home base for shops/restaurants and seeing the historical sights. The rooms themselves are large, spacious and comfortable, however they feel a bit dated, especially the bathroom. There was a kitcheonette with working stove in the room, so was nice to have, even though we didn't use it. All the pictures of this hotel are for people that paid for the Acropolis view. The city view is not glamorous at all, it's actually more of a wall view. If staying at this hotel, make sure you pay for the Acropolis view. While the hotel website gives the perception that there is a rooftop lunge, there really isn't so be careful of having this expectation. There are many restaurants and lounges within a 1 block radius that offer a nice rooftop view of the acropolis though.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights in one of the Executive suites. The suite is huge! There's a separate bedroom with king size bed, desk, closet, safe.The living room has a couch, coffee table, and a couple of chairs.There's a kitchenette, with frig, sink, cooktop, and a bar seating area for 2.There's also a large desk area as soon as you enter the room.The bathroom is also large - very luxe - lots of marble, cool lighting with a mural ceiling.And then there's a small outdoor balcony - one direction you look onto the Acropolis, and the other direction you look onto Hadrian's gate.Good wifi throughout the hotel.The breakfast buffet is OK - a bunch of choices, but it all seemed meh.The location is great - right on the edge of the Plaka - so it was perfect for wandering around, and there's a ton of restaurants within walking distance.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Perfect for exploring ancient Athens, the Plaka district and Anafiotika. Almost all the historical sites are a stone's throw away, which was very convenient and time-saving. We bought a 2-day city sightseeing bus ticket and actually ended up using it just once..why wait for the bus if you can walk?The staff are all very friendly and helpful. Our suite was very comfortable and clean, with a huge terrasse with an amazing view of the Acropolis on one side and Hadrians Arch on the other. Leaving our room every morning wasn't easy and going back at the end of the day was something we looked forward to :)Highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, kudos to Trip Advisor...I booked a bucket list vacation here based on Trip Advisor reviews, and once again it was a home run. This is an outstanding Boutique Hotel in the Plaka area of Athens. Plaka is part of the old town with narrow streets, sidewalk cafes, and within walking distance to the Acropolis. The staff is wonderful—friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is worth the price. Fresh squeezed orange juice, fresh fruit, eggs to order. The room was comfortable and clean with a kitchenette. I highly recommend this place and will stay here again if I come back to Athens.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is spot on, an easy walk to most historical sites including the fantastic Acropolis museum, the Plaka district shops and a wide variety of restaurants. The staff are super friendly, big shout out to Lambrini, the bubbly little gem that made our stay that much more enjoyable. Our room was fantastic, although the shower was more on the upper end of the warm scale and needed to be a tad hotter. The view was non-existent but we were welcomed with two small bottles of bubbly on arrival. A very enjoyable three night stay, would love be to come back.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly helpful staff. Room is decorated very nice, cute little kitchen, big bedroom with sofa and roomy bathroom. It is located downtown Athens, as soon as you walk out it is walking distance to everything. No need for taxi.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and 3 children (ages 5,3 and 1) just recently visited the Ava and had a wonderful experience!!! For starters, I had some difficulty finding a hotel that would accommodate the size of our family, and one that allowed young children. The Ava was honestly a perfect choice!! We stayed in the Executive Suite which had a king size bed in a bedroom with doors that closed, and included a pack and playfor my 1 year old. Then the living room had a pull out couch and a chair that turned into a single bed. The space was perfect for our family and I would HIGHLY recommend it for families. We had a great view of the temple of Zeus and the Parthenon from our balcony off of the living room, a large bathroom and small kitchenette area. The location was also ideal as we were right in the middle of Plaka with access to tons of restaurants and shops. And down the block we were able to get the hop on hop off bus to see the city sites. We really had a wonderful experience and I would 100% stay at the Ava again.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the AVA Hotel was great. We stayed in one of their beautiful suites with a large balcony/porch overlooking the city and the Acropolis. The location was very convenient to the Plaka, with many restaurants and shopping. The AVA is also convenient to the historical sites. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We highly recommend the AVA Hotel.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: small, high calibre hotel with wonderful people..special thanks to the day reception girls for their warm interest, hospitality and letting us to spend some hours before our late evening flight departs..rooms are in good size, super clean, quiet..hotel is a bit expensive side but you get what you paid for until last cents..
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable large suite with a kitchenette within walking distance of everything you want in Athens. Pleasant English speaking staff who are there to assist you. Views are limited, but sights are close. You can see the Acropolis wall but not the Parthenon.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled with a family of four and had a suite. Our experience with the room and staff was amazing. The location is walking distance from all the sights, shopping and restaurants. We would highly recommend anyone going to this hotel.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying here and would definately stay again.The location of the hotel is great,walking distance to the heart of Plaka and historical monuments.Staff were very friendly and helpful.The rooms were clean and spacious.Good value for money.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is simply the best hotel to stay in when in Athens!I first visited in July 2016 with my mother and then returned two years later with my husband.You simply cannot beat the location and the staff.I will be in Athens for a conference in 2023 and this is where I will stay (it’s walking distance from the conference centre)Private transport can be organised through the hotel from the airport and the Athens experience is a must for a dinner voucher, sparkling wine on arrival and tickets to Acropolis and museum.You will have a fantastic trip at a very reasonable price too.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I spent four nights here this month. We picked the hotel for its large rooms and the ease of access to key historical sites. It’s located on a one-way alley not far from the Acropolis and the bustling Plaka area. The rooms are spacious - ask for 302, which has a substantial balcony with great views of the Acropolis and is a large two rooms with a kitchenette and practical bathroom. The bedroom was well appointed, as was the living cum dining room (with a comfortable pull out couch). A buffet breakfast was included, providing an assortment of Greek and traditional items and we were able to custom order expresso machine coffees and our egg orders. The highlight here is the staff, ever helpful and always welcoming. A special call out to Andreas, Labrini, Marius and Vassia, who made our experience so delightful.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was at a great location. The fridge did not work in our room and the glasses were not clean. The shuttle service is very expensive and not included. Staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was quiet and comfortable otherwise.
hotelName:
28    AVA Hotel Athens
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an amazing time at this lovely hotel. George one of the Grooms was amazingly helpful. He gave us incredible recommendations for food, helped us find a store we were looking for and told us great places in Crete to visit.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For our first stop in Greece, we chose the Electra Metropolis, and I'm happy we did. The staff were amazing, and incredibly responsive. The hotel was extremely well located, which made it easy to explore the city. My travel agent had alerted the hotel that it was a special trip, as it was my wife's birthday, and when we arrived back to our room after a short walk, there was an amazing chocolate cake and champagne waiting for us! The front desk was eager to help me with some printing needs, and I'd be happy to stay here again, and for a longer time.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Athens,in summer, you want a pool and the Electra’s pool, whilst small, does the trick. The bedrooms are a good size (for standard classics) allowing two people to be the room very comfortably. Bathrooms are spacious too. If you want a view of the Acropolis then breakfast, bar and pool deliver.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights, very happy about (almost) everything. Quite a pleasant surprise.LocationVery close to Syntagma Square, 3-5min walk. Many Athens tours have pick up at the hotel or at nearby hotels within 3-5min walk. Lots of restaurants and shops, pharmacy around the hotel. We walked to The Temple Zeus one morning, only 10min away. You can also walk to The Acropolis Museum in about 10min and explore the interesting neighbourhood there. ServiceVery impressed by the staff: they really tried very hard to go out of their way to help us with everything1. Airport pick upWe emailed the hotel asking for airport pick up. They charge about 49 euro. Our driver was waiting for us around mid night at the airport with our name sign. Felt very secure with our professional, English speaking driver. Much better than jumping into a random taxi around mid night2. Staff onsiteThe hotel room key did not work well (the very few “complain” I have for the hotel). Whenever I came down to re-cut the key, the front desk always sent someone up with me to make sure the new key would work. The new key did not work in one of those trips, the bell boy offered to run down to the lobby to get another new new key for me. Although the key situation was a bit annoying, the attitude of everyone trying very hard to help made this more “livable”I was up early one night due to jet lag. Went downstairs to read in the lobby. After a while, the front deck staff asked if I would like some coffee. He then asked the service staff to make fresh coffee for me, free of charge, at very early hours in the morning (before 5am)! 3. RoomWe had 2 adjacent rooms for our party. The room is not fancy but very clean, functioned well. Size is more than adequate for up to 2 people each room. Shower is clean, AC worked really well. We were here during a heat wave, on our last day, there was a power blackout in the entire neighbourhood. The light was on but AC and elevator stopped working. The hotel offered to send bell boy to our room on the 9th floor to help with luggage (luckily the power came back before we checked out). 4. Rooftop restaurant/barThe outside patio of the rooftop restaurant faces The Acropolis. It has a direct view of sunset, but not sunrise (The Acropolis is on the west of the hotel). Breakfast has many selections, nothing fancy but more than enough to choose from. It’s included in our booking. Dinner at the restaurant Ned reservation due to the popular view. But the bar next door accepts walk in. Definitely worth having a drink there before sunsetToursWe did not rent our own car. Instead we booked tours through Viator. Athens is HOT during the summer. We tried to avoid being out there whole day especially mid day. We did the half day Athens tour in the morning, with The Acropolis Museum pass. From 8:30am-1:30pm. You can get to the Acropolis earlier if you go on your own but it’s nice to have a guide telling the history of the city. Expect A LOT of people at The Acropolis, A LOT!! But you can not leave Athens without seeing the Acropolis, so it’s worth it. Make sure to take your sunscreen and water. We then took a MUCH needed break in our cool room in the afternoon. We joined a sunset Cape Sounion and Temple of Poseidon tour from 4:30pm-10:30pm. Highly recommend this tour. It’s magical to watch sunset at the Temple of Poseidon.We debated between Olympia vs Delphi, decided to go to Delphi. Olympia might be too much for a day tour from Athens. It was such a hot day that it was very difficult to enjoy anything. The tour was from 8:30am - 7:30pm. If you have to see something outside Athens, this is one of the options. Be aware it can be REALLY hot in Delphi. Our tour guide told us it’s typical for the Greeks to have lunch around 2:30pm. It took us +3 hours to get to Delphi, just before noon (with coffee and restroom break at a really nice coffee house). We toured the Temple of Apollo, the Stadium and the museum. We had lunch at Taverna Vakchos. It was recommended by Rick Steve’s Greece. Food was reasonably priced, service was fast, can be friendlier but the view is stunning!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 5 nights, the service was exceptional, the rooms were fantastic and the rooftop pool and bar has the most amazing views of Athens. Breakfast was excellent. The only suggestion for improvement is to be more attentive around the pool area, as it took some time to order anything around that area. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again when I return to Greece.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly positioned, clean, well kept, friendly staff, great restaurant on the rooftop. No hotel is perfect, but this one exceeded my expectations. Little glitches here and there, like stuck Brazilian shower, or maybe high prices in the restaurant (take only the main course!) but everything is forgotten with a spectacular view of the Acropolis at the sunset.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights; celebrated our wedding anniversary on the last night. The location is excellent. Views of the Acropolis from the rooftop restaurant are amazing. The staff was friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First thing first... the views of the Acropolis both during the day and at night from the rooftop are unreal. This is what, in my opinion, this hotel has as the best feature. The breakfast is very abundant with plenty of different choices. Well worth it having breakfast included in your room rate. The service from all staff is outstanding and no request is difficult. Lastly, the location is great and very central to everything to do and see in Athens.The rooms are very nice, spacious, clean and well appointed. No views from the room but that was not a problem at all for us.The rooftop pool is pleasant but very small and it is difficult to get a place to lounge. The indoor pool/spa area is nice but not very relaxing with noisy young children splashing screaming and squealing.I would stay in this hotel again without hesitation.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Held a full day conference there, and things went perfect: conference room, acoustics, coffee breaks. Lunch was a buffet, space somehow limited, but delicious bites. After the conference we went to the roof bar for a homemade spicy limonade (delicious) and for some pictures with the Partenon. Great position for tourists!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I went to the rooftop to enjoy a drink there and the staff was extremely rude in for where they sat us. Their poor service made us just walk out. Hotel was clean and nicely presented but I wouldn't spend a penny here now after the rooftop encounter.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just came back from a weekend stay in Athens concluding our two-week journey around Greece. This hotel is amazing. It's centrally located, just steps away from Syntagma Square and Parliament. The hotel is extremely quiet. You can be assured a good night sleep. The rooftop restaurant is amazing, reasonably priced, with quality food and quality wine. Everyone at the hotel is polite and gracious. The rooms are large, beautiful and clean. I highly recommend, but book early. Word is getting out on how fabulous this hotel is. In future, I will not stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I are on a two week holiday in Athens. We arrived back early from our week of sailing around the islands, we stayed at the Electra. What a beautiful hotel in the heart of Athens. The staff was very friendly, the room super comfortable, and the roof top dining with a view of the Acropolis is just special.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel. Everything was exceptional, service is amazing, food was good, room was very comfortable and the view on the Acropolis and the city is breathtaking. Location is also perfect as it is right next to the plaka and less than 15 minutes walk to the Acropolis. Great stay!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Electra hotels has added a brand new hotel in Athens, very very centrally located.This is as luxurious as the Electra Plaka and equally central as the Electra at Ermou str/ Syntagma sq.The multistorried previously Ministry of Education and Relious Affairs has been fully renovated and impresses with its vast lobby and classy decoration. It even brands a centuries old church right outside the main entrance (the enormous building has engulfed the tiny church and was previously criticized for that).Top floor restaurant and bar offers stunning views of the Acropolis.The only minus is that the nearest metro stations are several hundred meters away and not so easily accessed with luggage; even taxis struggle in the one-way labyrinth of down-town Athens and take an extra 5-10 mins to get out of it.It is however a very popular addition in the upscale segment and therefore often fully booked or very pricey.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Electra Metropolis is a good hotel with nice amenities and views of the Acropolis. The service is not consistent as mentioned by another reviewer before, which brings down my overall rating for this fine hotel.The hotel is definitely high-class with clean rooms, good amenities and free breakfasts. The rooms are spacious and well-maintained. The bathrooms are well-stocked with toiletries and the shower heads were fantastic. The hotel is located in a prime area on a street full of nice restaurants and close to the Plaka and Syntagma Square. The Acropolis and the Agora are all within a mile of the hotel and easily walkable. The rooftop restaurant has great views of the Acropolis and serves free breakfast with lots of choices (waffles, pancakes, bread, eggs, meat, juices, yogurt, pudding, fresh fruits and many more). The outdoor swimming pool was big and uncrowded most of the time.The biggest issue I had with the hotel was the service. Some of the staff at the reception and in the restaurant weren’t necessarily the friendliest while a few others were friendly and helpful. I wouldn’t call the service at the hotel the worst, but it definitely can be improved to be worthy of a top echelon hotel.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is beautiful. Very well located. Nice rooms. The service however is erratic, they have someone come and check on how your check in was which is awesome but on the other hand it almost feels like you are imposing on staff if you ask a question at the reception. The rooftop is just beautiful but then again service is poor. The staff will avoid eye contact. They won’t come ask you if you need another drink or anything....... maybe I am spoilt by service one is used to in the US. They have a long way to go on service ...... but beautiful hotel indeed.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Im not sure how this hotel rates so highly and for the price it is even worse - its very overpriced for a dated property. This review comes from the perspective of staying in four hotels in Athens including this one across a 2 month period.We had a bad experience from the moment we booked through checkin and our entire stay. Our room looked strait into someone elses apartment which didnt help (and so would anyone staying on most floors given the surrounding buildings except the highest ones), but also he staff werent the greatest and the room was dated, breakfast was average and generally it just wasnt a good place to stay.I strongly suggest looking at other properties - we stayed at the Perianth Hotel and Hotel Blend before and after our stay at the Electra and they were far superior. Again not sure how it rates well and i feel let down that i followed the reviews of others. I wouldn't recommend to anyone - even if the rooms were cheap.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the few trips that I traveled alone. This hotel is perfectly situated and in walking distance of Syntagma Square, where tour pick-up and drop-off usually are. The Hellenic Parliament, Roman Agora, Arch of Hadrian, Acropolis, Temple of Olympian Zeus are all within 10-minute walk. The rooms are clean. The buffet breakfast has a good variety and is generous. Would stay here if in Athens again.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this lovely hotel while visiting Athens a couple of weeks ago. The facilities are modern and clean. The hotel's most stunning feature is the rooftop restaurant with a clear view of the Acropolis. Food selections and services at the restaurant are excellent! To top it off, the hotel is within walking distance to Syntagma Square and the Plaka! We were so fortunate to return to the hotel to spend one more night before leaving Athens.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved everything about this hotel! First of all, it is new, modern, and nicely appointed. The location is great! Very close to Syntagma Square, Plaka district, great shopping, restaurants and major sites in Athens. Our room on the 9th floor was spacious, with nice amenities, had comfortable beds and a great rain head shower. The lighting was good as well. I am an Electra Rewards member and a small gift and sparkling water was delivered to our room. We also received complimentary drinks and snacks at the rooftop bar. Nice touch! The staff provided excellent customer service and were friendly. The restaurant and bar on the 10th floor had amazing views of the Acropolis! The buffet breakfast had a nice selection of foods with stellar views. Highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel rooms are great and the view on the roof of the Acropolis is amazing. The location was perfect for us, and close enough to walk to the Kosher restaurant. The rooms were clean and spacious. Loved the pool!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its really amazing and has many facilities and many kinds of therapy I really like there service, the therapist Maria is amazing lady and she is so kind and respectful and she is so professional in massage she's so sweet to and know's how to treat and respect the guest I really like her and she's the right person in the right place. Just not to forget Johanna to she the receptionist and she so sweet and kind to make you very clear about the place I really like Maria and Johanna and wish them all the best in there jobs and in there life. And at last and not least I like to thank them for the kindness and treatment they treat guest with.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Deciding to visit Athens chose the Electra Metropolis Hotel. It has a central location, the images were impressive so we booked a superior room for our week in Greece. From the moment we checked in, everything was perfect! The hotel is modern yet grand (but not too much so) our room was lovely, spacious & immaculate. Everyone of the staff was helpful, polite and eager to please to make our stay more enjoyable. Breakfast had everything you could want but seeing no poached eggs, asked if I could have some and they were delivered to the table a couple of minutes later. We ate in the hotel restaurant a few times. It has fab views, the menu was excellent, so was the wine, and the service was just right. Attentive but not standing over us or constantly refilling our glasses. We enjoyed our evening dinners and couldn’t find any fault at all! A fantastic experience and, should we ever return, we will return to the Electra Metropolis - full marks for everyone. Thank you.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived in the evening and got stunned by the view of Acropolis from the roof top. Very close to metro and restaurants, shops and attractions. Had a very nice room, however the television did not function for the first night. Wifi did not work well either. Still, enjoyed the stay (didn't have time for tv or wifi - explored the city instead), the breakfast, the great room and the location. Would stay again. But. It is expensive and I've visited similar hotels for better prices.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can't beat the location, view from the roof top, breakfast, and modern design. Everyone was helpful and even comp'd us a few drinks when we arrived before check in and the room was not yet ready. Would stay there again for sure.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Electra Metropolis located just 230 metres from Syntagma Square (city centre) at 15 Mitropoleos, Athens exudes contemporary elegance and understated style. It promises an experience of discreet luxury infused with a retro-chić aesthetic and a 1960s feel. On the 10th floor, the Metropolis roof garden serves breakfast, lunch and dinner based on modern fusion Greek cuisine. The hotel Offers 216 rooms including classic, superior, executive, deluxe, suites and Acropolis view suites. Rooms and suites are modern with hints of a traditional ode to Greece. The team are warm, friendly, engaging and professional. Customer service is at the forefront and centre of everything they do. The hotel and hospitality has exceeded our expectations. I would certainly rate the Electra Metropolis as a ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️service experience and a great place to stay when in Athens.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful, modern hotel with very friendly, accommodating staff. A super warm greeting upon arrival and upgraded us to a superior room so we could be right next to our family. Lovely pool & delicious breakfast buffet. Within walking distance to Acropolis & great restaurants.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unfortunately, there are significant legal loopholes allowing hotels and airlines to refuse to honor "mistake" fares despite the fact that they routinely play games with published rates in order to manipulate business. However, responsible operations generally honor posted rates, especially after a confirmation is issued, and even the less scrupulous generally cancel "mistake" reservations quickly. I just received a cancellation from the Electra over a month after I received the initial confirmation for a prepaid rate. I would highly recommend not booking this hotel, as you cannot assume the booking will be honored!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall horrible stay. Our room was so small the luggage wouldn’t fit, we asked to pay for an upgrade they said the hotel was fully booked though on Booking.com all sorts of rooms were available. The shower was broken, nothing was done and water pressure was awful, our coffee mugs were replaced by dirty ones. On the last day we had to leave at 6.15am and we asked if could have just some fruit for breakfast, which starts at 6.30 am and again staff was unhelpful. The worst part is that we were in our honeymoon and there were so many opportunities for them to show a five star service and on ALL opportunities they failed. It was extremely disappointing and it totally spoiled our good vibes. Oh, they didn’t even meet our minimum expectations so definitely don’t stay here if you are expecting special treatment as honeymooners.On the bright side location is great and the view from the restaurant is breathtaking.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a hotel that I was quite happy with. The location is great and it was easy to get around everywhere. Tons of restaurants, cafes, shopping areas and historical landmarks are nearby.The view of the Acropolis from the restaurant, both day and night is incredible. Its the type of view that you can never get sick of. I had my breakfast there in the mornings and drinks during the evening. The drink menu is pretty good. The rooms are spacious and cleaned well. It was a quite comfortable stay. The overall decor of the hotel was pretty cool and trendy, without overdoing it.The spa was just ok. But to be honest, I'm a spa snob. So it takes an awful lot to get a solid 2 thumbs up for a spa from me.The staff were great! When I checked in, I realized that I left my phone in the car that picked me up from the airport. They went thru great lengths to get in touch with the driver to return my phone. I booked my transfer thru Electra, and I must say they use an excellent car transportation company too. Whenever I was passing in the lobby, the staff were always pleasant, either remembering me by name or welcoming me with a big smile. This is the type of service I look for in hotels. Had a very pleasant stay and would stay there again.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was ideal for walking around the city and the view from the hotel rooftop was stunning but beyond that, there was nothing else redeemable about my experience here. Without exaggeration, this was the absolute worst customer service in a hotel I’ve ever experienced. Upon check in, there was confusion about my guest’s name being on the reservation despite me being the one who made the booking with my credit card and presenting ID on check in. The front desk clerk refused to check me in until I removed my guest’s name from the reservation on booking.com (even though I explained that she wasn’t flying in for another 2 days) and he refused to help me do this, telling me I needed to go online on my phone right there to do it. After I did this, he then told me my room would be ready in 30 minutes (which was fine since I was arriving before the 2 pm check in) and he told me to have a seat and that he would let me know when the room was ready. I waited 30 minutes and when no one came to get me, I went to the front desk and found him standing around just chatting with his colleagues. He looked up at me and said “oh yes, you’re room is ready”. He had clearly forgotten I was waiting to be notified. I’d just gotten off a transatlantic flight. I was tired and anxious to get settled. He never offered a simple apology for forgetting about me. I would've been able to overlook this rocky start however there was an even bigger transgression regarding my friend's luggage when she arrived 2 days later. Her luggage was unfortunately delayed and had to be delivered to the hotel. The female staff member that she spoke with at the front desk assured my guest it would be accepted by staff when it got there and even copied her luggage tag receipts to be sure that she had all the correct information. Imagine our surprise when the delivery service called us while we were at dinner and said that the hotel told them that my friend checked out of the hotel two days prior and was now at a new hotel! Clearly this story made no sense so she called the hotel who admitted they sent it away mistakenly but had already rearranged for it to be delivered again later that evening (at this point it was after 9 pm). When we got back from dinner, we went to the front desk to see what was going on. The first man we spoke with told us it was sent away because the luggage being delivered wasn’t the correct bag and that it was the bag of someone with the same last name but a different first name. He told us that no one from the hotel ever told the delivery service that my friend had checked out already and they didn’t know why the delivery service would say that, essentially accusing them of lying to us. That story made even less sense than the original story we were told so we asked to speak with the night manager, Pavlos. Pavlos then told us that there was no confusion over the name on the bag (completely contradicting what the other staff member told us only minutes earlier) but that the bag was sent away because “well her name wasn’t on the reservation so we sent them away”. Nevermind the fact that her name WAS on the reservation upon check in two days prior and was only removed after I was told I HAD to remove it in order for me to check in. Pavlos told us that removing a guest name wasn’t policy, now implying that I was lying. He said even if I had been told to remove her name from the original reservation, her name wasn’t on the reservation currently and they couldn’t be expected to check through the paperwork to find her luggage tag receipt that was left at the desk because they were “too busy”. He actually told us that it was too much of a bother to check the paperwork that their staff asked for in the first place to confirm that the bag being delivered was correct. Throughout this entire exchange, Pavlos only apologized after about 10 minutes, but only after I pointed out that he still had not, in fact, offered us an apology for the error and such an extreme inconvenience. Unbelievably, I had to make him offer an apology but he freely told us numerous times throughout our exchange that the hotel was not at fault and that it was both the delivery service’s fault and also our fault for not having her name on the reservation. At one point while I was speaking to him, he rudely interrupted me to ask when I would be checking out! I felt incredibly dismissed and felt as though he was telling me that he was tired of speaking with us. My friend’s bag, which was expected around 6:30 pm, didn’t get delivered to our room until 6 am, just two hours before we needed to check out for a flight to Mykonos! Completely outrageous. The staff from my check in experience to the missing bag fiasco was completely disinterested in any sort of warmth or hospitality and when a mistake clearly on the part of the hotel occurred, we were lied to and told numerous stories, blamed for the mistake and told repeatedly that the hotel was not at fault. The attitude that came across from the staff was very much “this is a tourist area, so you need us, not the other way around”. This was a terrible start to our vacation, and my birthday which was part of the reason for the trip, and completely marred by impression of Athens. I cannot believe that one of the most expensive hotels in the city would have such cold, apathetic staff working there. To be absolutely clear, this was my first and last experience with an Electra property and I will never patronize one again.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here twice in the past year and are very impressed with this hotel. The location, breakfast, rooms, and views are all amazing! I highly recommend this hotel is you are visiting Athens ❤️ We always eat at the rooftop restaurant - the food is fantastic and the view of the Acropolis is perfection!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient locationNew hotel with modern amenitiesSpectacular rooftop with view of the Acropolis for all mealsBreakfast options included with excellent serviceBathrooms with all possible amenitiesExcellent sound proofing from noisy street
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, excellent breakfast . The cafe at the top of the hotel offers a beautiful view of the Acropolis. The location of the hotel is the best, a small waliking distance of the main attractions, you can go anywhere on foot!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough great things about the Electra Metropolis. The location is ideal, it is right in the middle of the city with dining, shopping and tours nearby. You couldn’t ask for a better location. The hotel is unbelievably beautiful and clean with an amazing view of the Acropolis. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and will satisfy even the pickiest palette.Last but definitely not least is the magnificent staff. A hotel could have all of the great things mentioned above but without a superb staff it would mean nothing. The personnel was always, welcoming, warm, and eager to help. Even when I asked for another room, not only did they provide it for me, but when I arrived in the new room I was met with a bottle of wine and delicious pastries compliments of the manager, George Spyropoulos. I have never been to a hotel that treats their guests as well as they do at Electra Metropolis and I have stayed at top hotels around the world, the Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons, etc. and the Electra Metropolis is hands down the best! I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Athens.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a perfect location, right in the middle of major attractions, shopping and dining. The room is very spacious, clean and quiet.
