It also comes with plenty electrical plugs and a small safe. Beds are very comfortable too. The dining room and bar are on the 10th floor, with a spectacular and panoramic view of the Acropolis. Make sure you go up there both during day time and at night to see the view. Breakfast has a good selection and the service was very friendly and attractive. Overall it was a great stay and I would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Electra Metropolis for 2 nights. Our check-in was great, the staff was so friendly and helpful - they even sent a bottle of champagne and cake up to our room as a treat! The room was very nice and typical euro hotel size room. The bed was very comfortable. Location for the hotel was key and best part, you could walk anywhere. The buffet breakfast was okay. Lots of options, but nothing special. It was free so that is why we used it and the views from the roof are amazing! Would recommend based on location and very safe, clean hotel. But we did find it a bit expensive for what we wanted to spend.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We simply loved our stay here. It couldn’t have been more perfect location wise. Hospitality was felt from the minute our car door was opened and we were received warmly. Special mention to George- he was fabulous as we chatted about the Easter traditions in Greece. We loved our chat with him.So many great eateries nearby don’t miss Ergon House for meals - 1 min walk away. Rooms were spacious lovely indoor n outdoor pool, sauna, steam, gym and spa. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. My only grizzle would be the lack of pressure in the shower...use the rain shower option for a better shower experience.I did have to call thrice to get an extra blanket but other than that everything was superb. Breakfast was fabulous with a good showcase of Greek specialities- loved the spanakopita and the fresh orange juice brought to the table with the view of Acropolis. Good enough options for Europe (comparing to similar stars hotel in Asia buffet would be more).I would recommend this hotel highly. You will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our two night stay here. Close to all the sights, a lovely modern hotel with a fabulous roof top bar and restaurant with amazing views to the acropolis. We enjoyed our morning breakfasts here. Service was good and the room was fine.The hotel organised a private guide for us for the acropolis and the museum and she was very good.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly this is an excellent place to stay to visit Athens, right in the centre and the hotel is of a very good standard.A few glitches that would not expect in this type of hotel.We had an Acropolis suite on 9th floor and whilst suite was nice enough and stunning view from large comfortable balcony:- our room (929) had the bar/restaurant above it and there was a lot of noise as people moved tables and chairs on floor above - we were woken every night after midnight and at 6 am - which was more annoying since this will have been staff setting up for breakfast - perhaps other Acropolis suites do not have such a bad problem - but avoid room 929- the large double bed was in fact two singles made up separately- requested earl grey teabags and blanket - got English breakfast and another duvet- had problem with "nice table" promised at rooftop restaurant - which turned out to be a cramped table, by the serving area, and a private business conference (loud) dinner - in fact probably worst table in restaurant - but this was resolved quickly by restaurant manager- bar service a bit variable - mainly caused by strict demarcation between which staff can only do refilling water, which can take orders, which are managers, greeters, barmen..But overall I would recommend and would stay again - but not in 929.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 nights with my family Had a large room which was very acceptable for our needs. Beds are comfortable Bathroom is very big and spacious However I had to ask twice to clean our room and the elevators are a nightmare Breakfast on the 10th floor looking at the Acropolis is spectacular
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Electra Metropolis what can I say ? A most wonderful Hotel right in the old part of Athens "Plaka" with a view of the Acropolis .. Two swimming pools, we used the indoor one on a day that it rained ... Breakfast with a view of the Acropolis .. The staff so wonderful and helpful .. Our room a superior just lovely and so much storage .. a lovely bath room and I requested a walk in shower and that is what we got .. The twin beds so comfortable with sheets changed every day and they were of such good quality ... Thank you Electra Metropolis ...
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing experience staying at this hotel for 5 days. We traveled to Athens with our 4 year old and we were initially worried because we thought she would get bored. Our little one enjoyed Athens especially because of the attentive staff who made sure to greet her every morning with a smile and make her feel at home. The views from this hotel our breathtaking and we enjoyed waking up every morning to eat breakfast and admire the view of the Acropolis. Our room was spacious enough for a family of three and room service came twice a day and always stocked our room with items. Breakfast was good and suitable for us since we were up early thanks to our child, however keep in mind they close at buffet at 10 am which is early for some. We spent our days shopping and eating at the restaurants which are all walking distance. We always felt safe but keep in mind when traveling anywhere to take precautions. What we enjoyed most as a family was the heated pool and spa.Also, the staff here is so friendly and gave us useful information since we were interested in going to Santorini for a day and arranged a taxi. If your planning to stay here with your family and enjoy your vacation I would highly recommend this hotel. It’s in an excellent location and for a reasonable price and quality you cannot ask for more. Thank you again for making my husbands birthday special and giving my daughter her own Electra metropolis teddy bear
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I organised a company event in this hotel begining of April. From the first email until the last second, everything was just perfect. The team at Electra are very kind and make sure everything is prepared prefectly. We got all the rooms, meeting room, coffee breaks, lunch, etc. exactly as described. A special thanks to Stavrini who organised everything for us. She was very kind and so helpful.The location is great - a quick walk to anywhere. Food was delicious and the rooms were big.I recommend this hotel if you come as a tourist, for business or for a group event.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just off Syndagma, this is in an excellent location. Rooms very comfortable and quite spacious for a town centre hotel. Lovely decor throughout and a magnificent rooftop restaurant. Dinner there was very good and breakfast outstanding.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the pleasure of spending 4 nights at this fabulous hotel. Great locationMost accommodating staff, always with a smile and went the exta mile to help at all timesExcellent breakfast. Very comfortable roomThank you !
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is very convenient in the middle of the old streets and next to the Syntagma square... walk a bit and you will find the nice park!The rooms are renovated and very large comparing to European standard, super comfortable beds! bathroom was also large. The hotel staff were very professional and helpful... check-in / out went smoothly... the breakfast at the 10th floor is just perfect with an amazing view. We tried the spa and the ladies were very good and professional. You really cant ask for more!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideally located next to Syntagma, Monastiraki and placket. Gorgeous breakfast/dinner or drinks view of the Parthenon. Amazingly large rooms for downtown Athens. Great and friendly staff. I would definitely stay here again. My only issue was that I wish they promoted more of an eco policy as far as recycling, composting and water conservation.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having breakfast each morning and drinks each evening on the rooftop is the highlight of this hotel. Simply stunning views of the city and its offerings. The rooms are excellent as well with no complaints but the rooftop is the reason to book this hotel. The location is extremely walkable, we never even needed a taxi except to go to the airport. Highly recommended and looking forward to coming back!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just so superb and located close to everything. The welcoming staff were amazing and the views from the hotel were amazing. Do yourself a favour and get a room with a view totally worth it!!Couldn’t recommend more!!  I loved how the hotel staff remembered you and welcomed you back to the hotel!!10/10 for me!!
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third time at the hotel and it gets better every time. The hotel is very convenient and central to the city. It was busy but coped well with my early morning arrival and late night departure. The rooms are well set up for the business traveller. Plenty of light. Small balcony and can open windows for fresh air. Reliable internet. The desk chair was too low so the hotel arranged an adjustable office chair for me to be able to work in the room. The bathroom is well appointed, modern and functional. The housekeeping staff are invariably polite and thorough. Overall, I find the staff consistently demonstrates that nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast continues to be outstanding and the Acropolis views superb. Congratulations.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fastest team I’ve ever seen!Amazing guys in front desk,especially Pavlos are helping. Storage is so secure and a smiling bellboys welcome you.For sure it’s one of the best hotels in Europe which I stayed in.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here previously and it has been great but this visit was mildly disastrous. I am working overseas and my husband made the booking for a romantic catchup. He emailed it to me but when I arrived 7 hours before he flew in, the reception clerk would not let me in the room, despite clear documentation of the payment and the booking until my husband verified it. I explained he was in the air but they shrugged and said there was nothing they could do, so my long awaited shower was still hours away...Finally when he arrived I was allowed into the room. The balcony door lock was broken so a man with a drill arrived and pulled it apart to repair it. Then the toilet wouldn’t stop flushing and maintenance came again but the fix only lasted for a few hours and it’s now not flushing at all. Normally I’d ask for an upgrade, complain etc but you know what? I’m just going to leave, never come back and warn others that this hotel is not what it used to be.
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location was excellent, staff were friendly (touchingly they remembered it was our anniversary and prepared us a pleasant surprise!!), breakfast was delicious and plus you get to enjoy this incredible view of the acropolis while enjoying your meal. thank you for the hospitality :)
hotelName:
29    Electra Metropolis Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was perfect for our short stay in Athens before heading to the islands. I wish we had stayed another night! Family room was spacious and accommodating for our jet-lagged family of 4. Bathroom was modern and well stocked. Breakfast and lobby were the real stars of this property! The location was perfect for walking to Plaka and Acropolis. Thanks for a great stay!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at 18 micon str. Michael and Elani were so helpful when we needed directions or general questions answered. Breakfast each day was delicious with a wide selection of items. Hotel immaculate and all staff very nice. Loved, loved the location as all sites were in walking distance. Many great restaurants close by...Bandiera! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a night with 3 teenagers and it was a perfect little place in a great location. The hotel was in the back streets surrounded by cafes and restaurants so the location was excellent. This would be good to stay for an extended time also and I recommend it highly. The hotel was clean and the buffet breakfast was nice and I recommend it
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is well located with easy access to all the main sites. Staff are friendly and helpful. We liked the breakfast, especially the fresh orange juice. Our room was clean and modern. Free water bottles are provided daily: great.Only 2 difficulties. Our room card malfunctioned several times and would not let us in. It was easily sorted because staff were around. It would not have been pleasant to come back late at night to find that you cannot get back into your hotel! Also the sound insulation is not as good as it should be. Lots of noise from both the hallway and outside the hotel is audible. Ear plugs are provided.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great area. Near restaurants and shops. Staff was super friendly and helpful and always available. Rooms are great with everything you’d need. Cosy breakfast area with a lovely breakfast. Good stay in Athens.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had very good communication with the concierge while booking and before our stay. They arranged for a cab to pick us up at the airport, as we were getting in at midnight. Turned out we were delayed getting out of the airport by over an hour because our luggage was in San Francisco and we had to fill out a claim. I called the hotel, and he immediately called the cab company to tell them to wait for us.When we got to the hotel, we were welcomed warmly and checked into our room. The following evening, around 11 pm, the concierge knocked on our door and delivered our luggage, which had been brought around by airline personnel.The breakfasts were fresh and tasty.The location was perfect for us: walking distance to the Acropolis, Acropolis Museum and Plaka District, as well as all the historical sites in between.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great neighbourhood to stay in - very young and modern with lots of great restaurants, shops and bars nearby. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was room 9 on the second floor - great size with plenty of room for suitcases. Bathroom was a little small and shower door leaks a little but that was our only downside. Staff very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2nights. This place requires some consideration before booking. Positives: the room is spacious and clean with pleasant decor. Conveniently located to restaurants, bars, metro station & Acropolis. Free water and Nespresso machine are handy. Negatives: we had very early mornings, the hotel lady told us the day before she would pre pack us breakfast as b’fast starts 7:30am. She did not communicate where she would leave the package. Whether it would be brought to our room, left in the b’fast section or reception. Next morning, b’fast couldn’t be found in any of those locations. When raised with the hotel lady next day. She vehemently maintained she left it in the b’fast section. When she heard me say to my partner I’d speak to her manager. We found her come to our room with a bottle of wine as consolation. We also arrived in the evening to an unlocked room with the door open. Nothing was missing however, makes you wonder how careless the cleaning staff are !? The safe in our room was locked to begin with and to operate it required speaking to the staff. We were not keen. On the final morning of checkout there was definitely a b’fast pack. Guess they try to rectify issues.Generally don’t bother reviewing sub par stays. But the above are facts from our stay.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 18 Micon Street is just amazing!! I visited Athens with my best friend and from very start they made our stay so comfortable and memorable that I want to come back here again!! This place combines service and comfort to its best ! A place where there is a great coffee machine , plain water and waterwith mint & cucumbers, tasty cookies at the finger tips of the hotel guests any time of day and night, a huge fridge with goodies again for hotel guests on top of the coffee and bottle of water placed in your room everyday! We stayed in the urban jetted tub room,which was just at its best! Spacious room with all modern amenities. Breakfast was tasty though similar continental items but I loved it. Staff are just amazing and super friendly and they provide genuine service as they listen to you which impressed me so much ! They even pack delicious breakfast in case you are leaving earlier than breakfast time! You can get island hopping tour or any other tour booked from the hotel which was convinient as well Location is brilliant as it's Athens downtown, 5 mins from Monsteraki square where you will have market, metro access and meeting point for all 3 hop on and hop off bus!!Definitely visit the Mary Poppins themed cocktail and dessert cafe 'The Knook', as for food you will be very spoilt for choicbut definitely indulge in Greek Souvlaki and Lamb Gyros if we eat meat!! recommend this place to everyone!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 4 night stay at Micon St was a pleasure. We split our time between two rooms, the loft which had a view of the acropolis and a double room. We enjoyed the view from the balcony of the loft but be warned, there is a spiral staircase from the elevator to the actual sleeping area where the loft is located. It was a bit of a problem moving our luggage through the narrow spiral staircase. If you have any disability this is not the room for you. Other than this one surprise, we loved everything about the hotel. The rooms are thoughtful with modern decor, extremely clean, welcoming and in a great location. We were able to walk to the acropolis, monastraki Square, the plaka district and many restaurants and shopping stores within a few minutes. Michael greeted us upon arrival and was a pleasure. He offered some tips and arranged transportation to the airport. Breakfast is included and located in the main lobby which was designed to feel like a living room. So thoughtful and cute. The lobby is my favorite part of the hotel. The decor is warm and welcoming and makes you feel right at home. I highly recommend 18 Micon St and plan to return soon!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel at the last minute via Expedia when our flight to Rhodes was diverted to Athens due to bad weather. It absolutely saved us. The hotel was quirky and the shower head was broken but the room was otherwise perfect. Loved the balcony. The location is brilliant and the staff was great. They even left our breakfast packed in a paper bag as we had an early departure this following morning. Will definitely book this hotel when we return to Athens.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: charming place, close to metro and plaka. excellent breakfast with lots of choices, friendly, helpful staff ... when we checked in we were offered something to drink, an overview of the services and made welcome. second day we were given directions to the changing of the guard and the post office to get stamps for postcards. we stayed in the penthouse - great view of the acropolis. be mindful of its spiral staircase right next to the bed. close to everything. lots of excellent restaurants close by.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel was awesome! In a quaint, bohemian neighborhood full of charm, good eats, near Monostraki Square, walking distance to all the sights. We were in Greece for two weeks and unfortunately only stayed here our last night, but we would have loved to have made it our home base! The hotel was thoughtfully done ( after comparing to other hotels we stayed in which were also nice) , but this had amenities that were well thought out. Great layouts of rooms, great breakfast, amazing decor, and showers and lockers for luggage available for late check out! The staff was friendly and accommodating. We stayed at other boutique hotels in town that were fine, but found that the rooms here were much bigger and the bathroom layout much better and priced the same! If I were to go to Athens again or know someone who was, this is definitely where I would stay! Athens is a great city, to someone going there for the first time , don’t be put off by the amount of graffiti ... to Americans it may associated with seedier neighborhoods but in Athens, it is just part of the city and the more you walk around , you actually consider it somewhat charming! 18 Micon Street is in such an area of graffiti but it’s awesome!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern spacious hotel rooms with fantastic breakfast buffet. Excellent service. Team made up take away breakfast bags for our early morning tour departures. Young man took extra care to pack nut friendly breakfast items for our young daughter. Hotel in popular area, easy to walk to attractions. Appreciated the lift as the family room was on fourth floor.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Each room in the hotel is a different experience. The staff here is lovely and the breakfast was very tasty. It is a boutique hotel so the costs are a little higher but not at all unreasonable. I would recommend this place to anyone. Also it is right in the heart of a trendy neighborhood for walking, dining, nightlife, etc.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked for the first level room with hot tube. we arived at 19 am . the two ladies in the front desk were so kind ,invited us to have breakfast till our room was ready. In the next day our children visited us and they booked an aparmtment by airb&b -they let them to leave teir suitcases in our room until their apartment was ready. along all our stay the employees in the front desk were very kind and helped us in everything we asked. the room was spacious ,very comfy bed . modern designed,and very clean. We ate twice in the "Mythos" restaurant which located in the next side of the hotel. they served high quality greeck food in decent prices. dont miss these hotel &restaurant it made our stay so enjoyable.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room - 10/10Staff - 10/10Location - 10/10Food - 10/10Located in the heart of Athens made our 2 days stay quite memorable. Got welcome gift wine and local food as complimentary was an amazing surprise at the beginning of our honeymoon.Many good places to visit were very closeby like Acropolis, Monastry Sq etc only at walking distance.Would definitely recommend to my friends who are planning to visit Greece in June-July.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights at 18 Micon Street before flying to Santorini. We booked the Acropolis view suite at 4th floor and the balcony was stunning. The room was very spacious with aromatic peachy scent. The design was modernistic and exceptionally clean.The staff couldn't be more heartwarming and helpful. They let us stay at the "Decompression Lounge" after check out for Netflix and showering, even letting us to store our luggage for 4 days because we'd be coming back to Athens after Santorini.There was a brunette sweet lady and a black-haired boy (with cool earring) at reception and they offered us tremendous help. So sorry I didn't ask for their names :( But my mom and I had the most pleasant stay in Athens because of 18 Micon Street Hotel. We hope they'd enjoy our little gift before leaving Greece and we shall be returning to this hotel next time in Athens :^)
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at 18 Micon Street. I stayed in two different rooms and they both were very nicely decorated, the beds and pillows really comfortable, nice good quality toiletries, towels, etc. The room at the top floor has the added bonus of a balcony (not very useful in December though) and proper total-blackout blinds (should be compulsory in every establishment in my opinion).The staff is extremely helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them: they really are an amazing group of people and most of them speak flawless English too.The breakfast was really good, all fresh products: not much in terms of hot items, but a good choice of savoury and sweet (the apple and cinnamon cake was delicious). Great choice of cereals, nuts, dry and fresh fruit. They also had complimentary tea and coffee during the day as well as very nice biscuits fresh from the bakery.The location is great too, although it looks quite rundown during the day, it really comes alive at night with plenty of good restaurants and bars all nicely lit up. It's also walking distance to all the main sights in Athens: we only needed to use the metro once to go to the Archeological Museum.The only things I didn't like are the sinks, which are located outside the bathrooms and the noise at night, but the hotel provides foam earplug (they don't work for me, but I always carry my own silicon ones).
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel seems to be newly remodeled or at least well-maintained. Our room is bright enough and relatively clean. I like the nice touches they have on the room, like free Nespresso drink and placing some local sweets on our desk. Everything in our room is spacious, including the shower area. For guests' convenience, they located the sink outside the bathroom. The hotel staff are very helpful. Convenient location...few minutes of easy walk to the ancient Agora and other Athens' attractions.Just know that:1) The hotel itself does not have graffiti on its property. However, its neighbors are full of graffitis making me a little concerned about safety when we first checked in. However, I noticed graffitis seem to be all over most of Athens, so maybe the hotel's location is not really too bad. 2) We are next to a bar which was noisy even after past 2am. On our second night, I realized I should have closed the windows--this lessened the noise.3) Although the room was decorated very nicely, the room is bare bones. There are only 4 hooks on our wall to hang our clothes--there is no closet for our clothesOverall, I would choose to come back to this hotel.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed on a 2 bed family suite over may half term.The room was beautiful, quirky, clean and comfortable. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in.Breakfast was stunning with so much choice of fresh delicious local produce. The kids loved making their own orange juice with fresh oranges.The location was perfect and the choice of restaurant on the door step was great.The staff were all friendly especially to the kids. They loved coming home after a long day and seeing what snacks and treats had been left in the glass jars every evening.We would love to come back without the kids to take advantage of the suite on the top floor.The blackout blinds were amazing and we all slept like logs.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights here prior to a cruise. The hotel is very modern with a great lobby/breakfast area.The rooms are all different. Ours was small but nicely decorated and had a large balcony with two lounge chairs and a small table. Unfortunately we could not use it because of the hurricane. The bed was very comfortable, the shower was good. Everything is small and minimal. It could use a few more spots to put things - like drawers/shelves/table tops, however there was space for all our luggage.The staff are very friendly and helpful.The location is great, just a short walk from all the attractions but just far enough so that it’s quiet. There was a great little family restaurant just down the street. The walk to the Acropolis was about 15-20 minutes. Short walk to Montisiriki square.Breakfast was good with lots of choice. Lots of pasties, hard boiled eggs, yogurt and fruit, toast. No hot options.Despite the bad weather, we enjoyed our stay and highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is modern and urban, with great decor and airy spaces, friendly staff. Very convenient to the metro, boutique shopping, acropolis, and the lovely restaurants of Psyrri. Our room was located on the street side, directly across from a popular restaurant, which, unfortunately, played loud Greek music on outdoor speakers until 1 a.m. - plus the crowd noise of the restaurant. A poor night’s sleep for our last night in Greece. I’ll pick a less hip hotel next time for a more restful stay.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: our cruise finished in athens we are in our seventies but the hotel made us feel like teenagers with there groovy decor fantastic rooms and above all great staff close to the parlament and all that athens has to offer
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for our honeymoon in the standard room. First off the service is amazing, all of the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. The breakfast is amazing we left will full bellies everyday! The rooms are cleaner than clean which matters particularly for people like me as I am a germaphobe! The bed was so comfy and the location is amazing. It's in such a hip part of town near amazing restaurants and cafes which we ran out of time to explore! It's also walking distance from all the major tourist sites and the metro. The decor of the hotel is very beautiful and well thought out. Overall had an incredible stay here and I will only ever stay at this hotel if I return to Athens. It has definitely set the bar for me in many ways!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel ticks all the boxes for a great trip to Athens - very charming location near lively bars and restaurants. The room was very comfy and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We loved our terrace room and the free infused water in reception
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recomend this hotel. Right in the heart of Psiri, really great location. And the hotel is very luxuries and chic. You will enjoy your stay. Very clean, beautiful, helpful stuff. Parking is available for 10 Euro per day.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is awesome, service and staff are fantastic and so helpful, breakfast is great, rooms are clean and beds extremely comfortable. Nothing us too much trouble if you ask, location is close to everything sites, shops and restaurants, highly recommend this if your staying in beautiful Athens!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a cozy place. Perfectly situated in a great spot near taverns, night life, shopping street and sightseeing. Everything is walking distance.Great staff, such cute breakfast. Awesome room with lovely modern decor. Will definitely return.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in a funky little area surrounded by amazing restaurants, bars and graffitied alleyways, 18 Micon St is a great place to lay your head for 1 or 5 nights!Rooms are clean, modern and beds are comfy!Breakfast is also delicious!Highly recommend
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is an excellent choice for your stay in Athens. The location is near Monastiraki and close to public transportation and walking distance to the tourist attractions, restaurants, and shops. This hotel was also one of the cleanest I have ever seen, my feet were not dirty after walking barefoot on the floor. The staff is super friendly and willing to help out any way that they can. If you tell the staff ahead of time that you need to leave the hotel before breakfast starts, they will give you a bagged breakfast of fruit, bread, and water to make sure you are energized for the day ahead. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We knew we had made the right decision about our accommodation in Athens the minute we walked through the door. A great location close to all the sites. We had plenty of recommendations from the very helpful staff - Restaurants, shopping, sightseeing etc. The room was very comfortable. Gorgeous decor and linens. By far the most convenient aspect was the ‘handy’ device which we could take with us around the city to help navigate and research what we wanted to do. Also I must mention that the breakfast was stunning. You really felt like you were dining in someone’s home. A great mid-priced option for Athens.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last summer was our first stay at 18 Micon Street and we loved it so much that we returned with our entire wedding party this summer. Everyone was blown away by the decor, the breakfast, and the staff. Rooms are clean, beds are comfortable. Neighborhood is loud but that is to be expected anywhere in central Athens. Great location that is easy to walk to all attractions, so many bars and restaurants directly outside of front door. The staff sent our laundry out for us and left us a bottle of wine to celebrate our marriage - I highly recommend!!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quaint. Great service. Great location and awesome breakfast. This hotel is in the middle of a very popular area with good food and is right next to the acropolis (20 min walk). Staff was very nice. Very good views of the city!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently stayed two nights in this hotel and were quite happy with our overall stay. Location is great, right in the middle of the restaurant district, service was also very good and the room was very clean and add a nice balcony with two lounge chairs and a small bistro set. Only reason why we are not giving this hotel five stars is for two reasons: one is the fact that the room was quite small and the other is that the pillows were simply not comfortable. In hindsight I should have asked for a new pillow for our 2nd night. You should also know that we could hear music from our room coming from down on the street till about 1AM both nights. Not a deal breaker, it wasn’t very loud club music but rather traditional Greek music, but still good to know. We liked this hotel very much.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here on July 17-19 2018. My overall experience was very good and I would consider returning for another stay. I am a Greek-American with a home in Western Greece. I spend one or two nights in Athens every summer before flying back to the States and I have stayed at many different Athens hotels over the years. I am fairly familiar with the area and I speak Greek, which influences, to some degree, my thoughts about this property. However, my review is based upon my own experiences at 18 Micon as well as my observations of staff interactions with tourists. 1. Great location. I love the Monasteraki area and this property borders it. You can reach Monasteraki by foot in a matter of minutes. If you have a car, there is a small parking lot on Miconos about 30 meters from the hotel (10 euros per night parking fee).There is also a small restaurant on Miconos St. just before the parking with excellent and reasonably priced Greek food (it is not a tourist restaurant and only locals were there when we visited). The restaurant is literally a minute away by foot!2. The hotel property is a former warehouse which was converted to a hotel in 2017. The rooms have a modern industrial feel. They are simple, yet well-appointed, and immaculately clean. However, I did not like that the double sinks in my room were located outside the bathroom (which was huge with an immense shower stall). Also, there was no closet to hang clothes and store shoes, suitcases etc.3. My room was on the second floor (Room #8) and it faced Miconos Street. It was a bit noisy later at night from two restaurants around the corner on Aesop. The hotel's interior walls are not well insulated and if noise is a factor you may hear the restaurant patrons below and other guests returning late at night to their rooms. The noise was not bad, though, and it did not prevent me from sleeping comfortably. If you don't want to hear noise from Athenian nightlife, stay outside the bustling city nieghborhoods! 4. The breakfast was very good and it is served in the large and comfortable reception area on the first floor. There was an excellent selection of spanakopita (tasted home-made), meats and cheeses, fresh fruit, yogurt with a choice of toppings, hard-boiled eggs, coffee and juices, etc. Coffee, cold water and cookies/candies are available in this area all day and this is a nice place to relax, read or wait for friends.5. The staff is extraordinary and each demonstrated the hospitality for which the Greeks are famous! I cannot say enough about their friendliness, graciousness and desire to help in every way possible. Friends came to meet me for day out and upon their arrival, we were treated like guests in a private home.......a warm welcome, complimentary liqueurs, wine and cookies (it was my birthday) and a feel like I was entertaining in my own home. 6. Others here have positively reported on the smart phone provided with each room that you can use for free international calls and tourist information. We had trouble using it (it may just have been us and not the phone). It did not present a problem because we have Greek cell phones and tried it as a novelty).7. As for pricing/room cost there are less costly rooms available in equally good locations. But, the rooms will not be as "new" and the breakfast, parking etc not so great. Moreover, I doubt you will find a staff like folks at 18 Micon Street.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there for 2 days and my overall experience was great.The hotel is near the city center.Very clean room and very kind personel but the best part was the artistic design that gave a feeling of stylish wellness.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is only trumped by the amazing decor, amenities, and immaculate room. The bed is big and comfy, the industrial-chic layout and vibe were great. A special place because anyone from a hipster to a classy grandma would feel at home. Very comfy and spacious room. The service is also top notch, Yannis is particular made us feel so welcome. The breakfast is amazing with something for everyone but also some authentic greek eats. The late checkout and luggage storage is perfect for those with later flights. Such a pleasant surprise and would love to stay here again.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The junior suite was perfect for 2 adults and a small child. We loved this hotel. The location is great and the hotel has a very chill and welcoming vibe. The breakfast was very high quality. The fruit salad was especially awesome. Huge American-sized king bed. Excellent air conditioning. My only suggestion is that the local information provided needs improvement. For a small and intimate hotel, it should be easier to get local info and recommendations. When we arrived off an international overnight flight, we didn’t get a clear recommendation of where to get an early lunch. Also, I emailed in advance for information about visiting the Parthenon and I received information about visiting the Acropolis Museum, which turns out is a separate ticket from the Parthenon. The hotel should have prepared tips about visiting the Parthenon.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wouldn’t hesitate to book here again. So incredibly clean, lovely rooms and a welcoming breakfast each day. The team here are all very pleasant and really helpful; they even contacted me to arrange airport transfer rather than me have to ask them. Thank you all at 18 Micon Street.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a very contemporary lovely hotel very close to Play a and the Acropolis.This was our second stay in this hotel.Very clean and modern with good choice of breakfast and excellent facilities . The staff are very helpful and friendly. Kyroula made us so welcome and she was so helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is very nice in great location. Its close to all a tourist needs but out of the way of crowds. Great service. Provide you with a phone for your stay, which was handy as we dont have international plan. One negative thing, some windows face restaurants and it can get very noisy till 1am. So if you go to sleep early, need to be aware.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a shame to rate this hotel as a three but there are some unavoidable downsides.The upsides are the service which is so good, there team are so friendly and nothing is too much trouble. The Hotel decor is excellent, from the trendy lobby to the fantastically comfortable beds, the interiors are considered and highly designed; very cool. Each room has a handheld device that you can take with you that helps you with anything you need in Athens and enables you to make free calls. It's a nice idea but not really needed for anyone with a smartphone.The rooms are spacious and have a nicely stocked minibar though ours wasn't cold, I'm sure this was an exception. The coffee machine was Nespresso and complimentary water was included. location is central Athens and within walking distance of metro and buses, a positive in many respects but ...Now the negatives. The locations whilst being central is a little back street for my liking and my partner said she wouldn't recommend it to a single woman travelling alone. It is also next door to what could be described as a slum (picture from balcony attached).The hotels has noise coming from the street but it's a city hotel and you'll get this anywhere. However the noise from inside the hotel is what sets it apart, the floors are not well insulated and you can hear people going to the toilet above you, the wall seem very thin and the water system seems to scream at you everytime someone in a nearby room turns on a tap.The breakfast is basic with no hot breakfast to speak of, it's served in a communal kitchen/ lobby area which is very nice and as a cold breakfast it is acceptable. Freshly squeezed (Yourself) orange juice is a nice touch and the coffee is fantastic.There is no bar though there is a restaurant next door that will bring drinks to your room or the lobby.There is storage for bags when you are not in the hotel and lockers for valuable which is a good touch.There is a lift though there are some steps so not perfectly accessible for those in a wheelchair.On the whole I'm afraid I wouldn't recommend this hotel, though this is no reflection on its team and indeed the concept and design. Location, building and communal features is what means this is just not quite what it could have been.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived here and were pleasantly greeted by the staff at the reception area. Promptly given our keys to the room and notified us that there wouldn’t be any staff on site after 11pm until the morning. This was not a huge concern. However, we noticed that when we were trying to close the window there were some issues getting it to sit right to lock and close. We did our best to close it. Unfortunately, we didn’t realize that the window was defective, so we heard A LOT of outside noise for several hours (at least until 2am). This was surprising for a Sunday night, there was loud music playing from the restaurant adjacent to the hotel and later what I could assume were stray dogs barking at everything that passed by. It made it quite difficult to sleep after a long flight. However, I digress- the room was otherwise clean and we were able to adjust the temperature that suited our needs. The downside however, the sink is outside the bathroom and there is no true counter space on the existing sink. This leaves no place for you to leave toiletries or clothes when it’s time to shower. On one of the mornings while showering, the protective cover of one of the vents fell off and onto the floor. Luckily no one was on the toilet, otherwise that could’ve been a problem. We notified the staff about this and it was promptly fixed. The breakfast buffet has a few options, but if you’re not interested in the things they have you can certainly go elsewhere. While we only stayed at Micon 18 for two nights, they were both equally restless as the noise did not subside throughout the middle of the night. It was quite surprising as the street tends to be on the quieter side during the day. Despite the window being repaired, the rooms are not properly soundproof as you can hear noise both in the hallways (elevator and room doors) and outdoors. The staff was very accommodating and nice throughout our stay and were fluent in English, which made communication very easy. While the hotel is centrally located to everything, the downside is that the crowds gravitate to this area as well.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The decor and imaginative use of space at this hotel alone make it a worthy choice. However, the hospitality of the owners and their staff put it over the top. Delicious goodies out at all times in the lobby made me feel like I'm visiting a family member. Good, honest opinions about local restaurants and reasonably priced (for Athens) parking close by were perfect. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in the hotel twice in the first week of April because of intervening tours, the hotel was so good in storing the bags for us whilst we were away. The hotel is on a side street behind Monastiraki Square, once found, it is easy to get around to various sights. The reception and the rooms are of modern design, though rooms are not particularly big. Breakfast came with the room and is of very high quality. We were there for the hotel's first anniversary and a party was organized, all the guests were invited for drinks and presented with souvenir, a very nice gesture. All staff are friendly and helpful, and Lorena rocks!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights at 18 Micon Str. hotel. A fantastic boutique hotel that has been open for one year. The rooms are nicely furnished and in great condition. The lobby is spacious with comfortable chairs and couches looking out on to the picturesque street. Each morning there was a very nice buffet breakfast consisting of juice, cheese, meats, yogurt, nuts, cereals, breads, fruit, coffee, etc. All fresh and delicious! The self serve kitchen in the lobby is open and available to guests all day should you wish to have a cup of coffee or tea.The hotel is centrally located. All the major sights are just a few minutes walking distance. Multiple nice restaurants are just right out the front door!As noted above, the hotel is new, so it was no surprise that the room was modern, well decorated and spotless. Nice large bathroom. Our room (although not all) had a nice outside balcony with chairs and a table. Plenty of outlets but none dedicated for USB so bring an adapter. WiFi was very strong in the rooms and throughout the hotel.Lockers are available which was great as we took an overnight trip to Delphi and need to store some of our luggage before we returned. The staff is superb. Can not say enough nice things about them. They treated us as family throughout our entire stay and made us feel at home the moment we walked in. Last week was the hotels first anniversary. Management threw a nice little party and included all the guests in the festivities. We were unaware of the party (our fault) but they even waited for us to come back from our overnight trip before they began! Small thoughtful gifts were given to everyone, even our two kids.Each room also comes with a cell phone "type" of device. I didn't figure out all the functions (I THINK you can put your own cell phone number in and make calls/texts - we didn't use this function) but it was extremely helpful as it had Google Maps/GPS to help you navigate the maze of small streets in Athens looking for sites and restaurants. If we ever go back to Athens, 18 Micon Str. will be where we stay!
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had such a great time staying here!the room was beautiful! the bathroom was amazing with the best shower ever. the staff was the best staff that we have ever encountered before. they reached out to us about transportation and was so helpful about everything else. this is a great boutique hotel in a great location! the one drawback was it was noisy at night from the nearby cafes
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice hotel. small and quiet. at the center of the town, close to every where, the markets, the parks, rain station, all the interesting places in Athens. sympathic staff. good breakfast. cleaned rooms and comfortable
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A well located hotel, plenty of cafes, bars and restaurants nearby. also walking distance to many sights (or if you don't feel like the walk there's a metro station just around the corner too). Only a short walk to the busy Syntagma square.staff were lovely, we even received a bottle of wine as a gift on valentines day, which was a very sweet surprise! breakfast was the usual sort of thing; cereal, bread, fruit, greek yogurt, cold meat/cheese, boiled eggs etc. it was fine though, always plenty there and never felt rushed to finish even when it came to the end of the breakfast time. Our room was a good size, but it was facing the street, which got pretty loud at night since the local places stayed open late, but it didn't bother us, it was mostly music so we didn't mind. I found the pillows impossible to sleep on, simply as they were so big/high. I'm used to soft thin ones so I just couldn't get comfortable, my partner had no problem with them though so it's just one of those things. the free bottle of water each day was useful and the in-room coffee machine was nice.I have to say though the coffee machine used during breakfast isn't very professional. It's a small one meant for use in your home, it can only do a couple cups before it needs to be refilled and reheat, it really needs an upgrade to avoid people queuing every morning. Overall it was a perfect hotel for our needs and we enjoyed our stay :)
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel, everything is brand new. Very spacious room, the best is the bed.Breakfast is great, you feel at home making your own breakfast with nature orange juice, coffee, toasts...You have free internet in the hotel and they even provide you with a mobile which you can use unlimited data outside of the hotel. That is amazing you can use google maps or search anything in an Android mobile super convenient. And the best without any extra charge.Another thing I really liked it is the staff, they are super friendly and helpful. Perfect location in a very busy area so it can be noise if you are looking for 24h silence.Overall, I think I made a good decision when I booked this hotel.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family, two adults and two children, spent a week at 18 Micon street and loved every minute of it. Firstly, this is a small boutique hotel so you won't find a 50 metre pool or pancake station at breakfast but what we received was wonderful boutique hotel service. The ladies on the front desk were incredibly helpful and very good with the kid's. They gave us really useful travel advice and even provided a packed breakfast as we left early for a day trip. This is the type of service that will ensure we come back. We stayed in a two bedroom family room with a balcony which was ideal for us. The hotel is very well designed with lovely modern interior decoration. The hotel is also set in the heart of everything and so we could easily walk everywhere. The breakfast, which is kitchen counter style, was delicious and that style of eating suited us well.The kids, like the adults loved staying here and we will stay here again.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a big room for three and we was surprised by the cool interior. The bad thing was the ventilation or lack of ventilation. Even the shower had no ventilation that made it very humid and a small smell off mould in the shower. Having the window open was a option but it came with noise from the street. The toilet that was separated from the shower had a fan that was also noisy. Breakfast was good and we had a warm welcome.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A cute hotel in a good location,3 minutes walk from Monastiraki or Psiri area.The room was spacious, and clean.Bed was excellent!Staff is very friendly and helpful.Breakfast could be better. Wifi friendly.
hotelName:
30    18 Micon Str.
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was great! The hotel is in a very quiet area but only a 5 minute walk to the red and blue open-top tourist bus-stops and around a 10 minute walk to the Acropolis museum and a few more minutes to other main attractions and an amazing array of restaurants. The communal areas are really stylish and the rooms modern, clean and well furnished with free safe/WiFi and air-con. Rooms are cleaned daily and the air-con left on whilst you are out - great to return to on hot days! Staff are friendly and helpful. There is a wide selection for breakfast (including scrambled eggs and continental style bacon and sausages). The pool is small but perfectly formed. Most of the balconies overlook the inner courtyard/pool area but a few higher rooms seem to have lovely city views so it may be worth asking for one when you book The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there is a small bar area and the roof terrace has a stunning view of the Acropolis and the city and you can take drinks up with you (there is a lift). Overall a great place to stay.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was great; we were on 5th floor and had nice view of balcony of acropolis and greenery. Great airconditioning, very relaxing and slept well! Breakfast was good and has gluten free options. Location central and great restaurants nearby (Gargaretta, Attika and on street around the corner with local options. Safe and nice neighborhood. Staff was super friendly and helpful. Pool was perfect; shade in afternoon which we appreciated. No bar scene.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a night which is quite close the the Acropolis within few minutes of walking distance. Overall a nice hotel with good service and customer friendly. Would surely recommend to others for a short stay.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Staff very helpful, good spot for short term. Very small rooms but sufficient. Good breakfast included. In walking distance to the acropolis and we could see it from our balcony. Nice restaurants nearby
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was well located and ultra clean. Brekky was lovely. A couple of things to look out for include no ironing board available anywhere in the hotel.Where I feel embarrassed by my own lack of ‘smarts’ was when it came to organising a taxi to Piraeus. I asked Antony to organise a taxi and he said it would be 20 euros. I agreed even though all other internet information suggested 13 -15 euros.The driver was very nice but at the end of the trip he announced it would be 25 euros with his mobile phone positioned nicely over the meter. So in the end I paid double. Obviously I nice little kick back for Antony was involved.So nice hotel, but don’t book a thing from the concierge!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff who cannot do enough for you, just so helpful!location is a few minutes from EVERYTHING!part way up philopappou hill which is worth an explore for the views! Breakfast is brilliant!They will book tours for you!Clean rooms!views of the Acropolis!Back to the location being part way up philopappou hill - when you arrive, I suggest coming via Acropolis station, Sygrou fix may be closer but if you have suitcases you need to walk up philopappou hill to get to the hotel - you have been warned! STAY HERE - brilliant hotel
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and had a very enjoyable time. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the Acropolis, The Plaka and other attractions . The room was nice and the staff was exceptionally helpful with any needs or requests. The breakfast was excellent! My one and only complaint is the bathroom in room 606. In order to get to the toilet you have to walk through the shower...strange arrangement?
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an enjoyable stay at the Acropolis Hill Hotel, good position and close to the Parthenon and the pedestrian walkway to the Plaka District.We enjoyed looking at the Parthenon from our balcony and also the roof top.Thank you to Sofia the manager for making us feel welcome, we enjoyed our stay and hope to return soon.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights. Just got home. It's a very simple, perfectly formed hotel. Not fussy, but excellent style and design. We had a very nice welcome, then took ourselves to our room (602). From the balcony to the right you could see the Acropolis/Parthenon, to the left you could (in the distance) see the sea. Room was very clean (just been cleaned, and even the inside of the drawers were damp from being wiped). A very nice room, with just enough space (but you had to sort of side-ways shuffle at the end of the bed for fear of knocking the TV off the wall). There were 3 of us in the room and the layout was fine. Enough storage/lights/sockets. There was a fridge (with nothing in it). There were also no details of anything in the room (no folder for room service, trips, etc). Breakfast (on the 1st floor) was absolutely fine. Certainly enough. If you are after a full English or table service, then this is not the place for you, but the pastries, yogurt, toast, cereals, cheese/salami etc were more than enough (there is a small area for hot food - scrambled eggs, mini sausages, bacon, beans) - a good selection. Food seemed to be replenished quickly when it ran low and you could eat as much as you wanted. We were out most of each day, but our room was cleaned perfectly every day. All the people working there seemed very friendly and helpful. As our room was facing the road, there was a little traffic noise, and we were opposite the lift, so a little corridor noise, but nothing too annoying - and we had fab views. Great air-con! Really can't fault anything. Now, if I was to make anything better... I would add a kettle and tea/coffee making facilities to the room, fill the fridge in the room with drinks (hotel makes more money) and have a folder in the room explaining how to order drinks (if you can) from your room or the 5th floor roof terrace and advice about trips and sight seeing and when the hotel pool is open. But that's it. It's a great little hotel, in a quiet location, but walkable to everything you'll want to see. Almost perfect. Highly recommend. Thank you for having us.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel near the Acropolis. Rooms are a bit small. There is a fridge and a TV but not a kettle. The hotel is on a hill but even for someone as lazy as me, it's ok. Helpful to walk back after a large meal. The rooms including the bathrooms are spotlessly clean. The breakfast buffet has a wide choice and really nice. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly. Excellent place to stay.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Room was cleaned and cozy. There were a lot of free toiletries (in case you forgot to bring them ). Breakfast was great. There are many choices including some Greek pastries. The location was very convenient. It took about 5 mins to walk to the Acropolis and a further 10 mins to walk to the main shopping district etc. There are lots of bars, cafe and restaurant to choose from. They are just down the slope. Theres also a pool but seeing it's still a little chilly, we gave that a miss. Thank you for a lovely stay!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got home from Athens and had to post my thoughts on our stay. Arrived quite late after a delayed flight and were checked in quickly and given an orientation of the hotel layout by the receptionist. Arrived in our room and found that it looked exactly as expected, sleek, modern and clean and even had an extra bed! Bathroom was modern and clean and the shower was huge, we even had an unexpected balcony. The beds were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was very good, huge selection and attentive staff to refill anything. Breakfast room was downstairs and next to the pool and had lots of tables. I only ever saw it about a third full. Roof terrace is not to be missed as the view over the city is stunning. Room was missing a kettle but did have a fridge. Location was extremely quiet and our room overlooked a courtyard (of sorts) and the back of a residential building. Felt very safe walking around the nearby streets. Location was good, it is away from the main hotel district and the old town and attractions, but it is a 10 minute walk to everywhere you’ll want to be. Overall, highly recommended, the staff were lovely and nothing was ever too much trouble for them. I’d definitely come back if I was in the city again.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in December 2018 as a Christmas treat to each other. hotel is very clean, rooms good size with everything in that you would need and quiet too. Staff are very friendly and helpful always greet you with a smile, we quizzed them several times with directions places to see etc. Breakfast has a very good selection, more than enough to fuel you for a full days excursions. Only criticism I would say here is at times the eggs and bacon in the ban marie were cold. This could be remedied by asking staff to microwave for you! Location is excellent. Close enough to take in local restaurants and bars. But away from noisy hustle and bustle. You can also easily walk to many of the main attractions from this hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good spot within walking distance of many attractions. Friendly staff and good buffet breakfast. There was a slightly see-through door on the bathroom/toilet and for a small room this was a bit weird. Otherwise the room was adequate. The pool would be good for summer. From the roof you get a good view of the Acropolis.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay at Acropolis Hill Hotel! The hotel is situated in a very good part of Athens. It's close to everything - and only a 10 min walk to Acropolis - but still not in a touristy area. It's very safe and charming, and there are lots of places to eat nearby.My room felt fresh and new, the balcony was amazing, cleaning was perfect, and breakfast was great too. The cleaning women and the woman, Voula, at the reception were really sweet. Only thing is that the name of the hotel doesn't lie. It really is situated at the top of a hill. So it's a bit of a climb (though a short one!) getting there. But again - the position at the hill is what gives you the great view! I'd definitely go back!Bonus info: Things you must see in Athens: The Temple of the Olympic ZeusPanathenaic Stadium (where the first modern Olympics were held)AcropolisAreopagos (the hill next to Acropolis)All things are in walking distance from the hotel :-)
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here coming in from a tour in country and then coming back from an island so our stay was short but the staff was very good. Our room was quiet and the sight of the Acropolis from the outdoor patio is lovely! Neighborhood was good to walk in evening and we were close to restaurants.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to leave at 3am. They put together a breakfast before we left.Nice rooftop patio, didn’t try the pool it was toooooo cold. You can walk into town. The street was quiet at nightFinding parking was a bit of a challenge but we managed.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was literally the best experience with a hotel we have ever had. Our stay in Greece started as a nightmare as we did our first night at the Dorian inn... do not stay there it is the most ghetto place we could have picked in Athens. Super horrible experience. Haris saves our honeymoon by helping us get a room at Acropolis Hill. This place has it all, great breakfast, location, rooms, views and hands down the best service I’ve ever had. Will definitely come back!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Acroplis Hill Hotel is located in a quiet residential area yet is only a ten minute walk from the Acropolis and Plaka areas. That said, as the name suggests, it is at the top of a hill, so it is a trek ! Rooms are compact but cleaned to a high standard. Safe (at no extra cost), refridgerator, hairdryer, air conditioning and wall mounted LCD TV are all included. The compact bathroom is a wet room so a little unusable once you've had a shower but not a big issue. All rooms feature a balcony. Ours looked directly down into the hotel pool (which was still open when we visited in October, with towels available from reception).Breakfast is served on the lower floor overlooking the pool. Help yourself to a good range of cereal, pastries, fruit, and hot drinks. Bacon and scrambled eggs were also available.There is a bar on the reception level, but you can take your drink to the rooftop seating area for a good view of the Acropolis and cityscape.All in all, I was happy with my choice of this hotel and am happy to recommend as a comfortable and convenient base from which to visit the main sights of Athens.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four days. This hotel is located near the Acropolis and Acropolis Museum; the Acropolis parking lot is also where the on/off bus stops which made this very convenient since we paid for two-day passes. We were also near the Dionysos Zonars restaurant and Strofi's restaurant (which is recommended by many travel guides); both restaurants had wonderful views of the Acropolis. This hotel is far from the commercial downtown Athens area so perhaps not everyone would like the location. The room was small but clean and had a balcony. There is a fantastic view of the Acropolis from the rooftop garden. Excellent breakfasts. My only complaint was the short walk from the hotel to the Acropolis area. While only 10 minutes, the walk was difficult. The sidewalks vary from 4 ft to 1 ft; sometimes the sidewalk disappeared; taxis and cars park on the sidewalk too so often we were walking in the two-lane street constantly listening for oncoming cars. Despite this annoyance, I was still glad we stayed here.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Acropolis Hill Hotel in January.It's a very nice feeling when you enter the room and it's just like in the pictures, if not better. Large, comfortable rooms with comfortable beds. Bathroom with a welcome set of shampoo, balsam and shower gel. Television and WIFI worked, we did not use it much tho. Coffee maker and small fridge in the room. The view from the balcony was amazing - Acropolis Hill looks beautiful at night.The reception was very helpful, we arrived at night, the receptionist took good care about us, gave us the map of Athens, showed us "must see" points, told us about the best ticket prices and where to buy them.Breakfast was served in the restaurant - continental breakfast, where everyone can find something for themselves. The feta cheese was delicious;) The hotel has an outdoor pool, but we did not use it - it was too cold.Metro station near the hotel, 5 minutes walk, but to get to the hotel you have to climb a bit;) Great location - Acropolis hill was 5 minutes walk, flea market was a 2 minute walk, restaurants, grocery stores, everything within 5-10 minutes walk.I would highly recommend.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a standard room with my 2 children aged 9 and 11. It was VERY tight. The bathrooms are also pokey so we didn’t want to spend much time at all in the room. You get a lovely view of the Acropolis from the balcony of the room which is also tiny. The staff are helpful but not particularly friendly. The reception/lounge area and pool area are not very inviting so don’t book this hotel if you want accommodation with a nice ambience. There are no coffee/tea making facilities in the room so when I wanted a cup of tea, I had to order it in the reception area and drink it there (where there was no one else) once brought to me by a waiter. The location of the hotel is fantastic, walking distance to many sites and other tourist attractions. It’s is in a residential area so much quieter and pleasant than in the middle of the CBD. It served the purpose of being a good base for a 2-day sightseeing trip to Athens but the hotel was in no way a highlight of our trip.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I moved into this hotel on the 3/09/18 and was immediately struck with the compact size of the room and other hotel facilities. It was located in the prime tourist area and considering this the hotel has made very good use of the space making me feel quite comfortable. They served a very decent and well planned breakfast but they have no room service ; however any food I wanted I could order from the reception who had pictures of the food items making it easy for one to chose and the meals were delivered quite promptly. In fact the front desk persons were very cooperative and had all the time to answer my questions. The only thing I felt short was the swimming pool which could have been expanded a bit in length to allow a better workout. I left the Hotel after 2 days with very happy and positive memories,,,,I thanked my son for having chosen this place for me.This hotel is ideal for tourists to see the Parthenon, Museum, Plaka area, livliest markets , bistros and cafes, cabs and a nice area to also walk around..
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel in the heart of Athens is as good as a Hilton can be. Stayed there for 4 nights cause of a business trip. Hilton hotels are always trustworthy and especially this one! also great for getting fast by foot to tourist attractions as I've heard.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this through BA holidays and were not disappointed. It is a budget hotel so but the location is superb, close to the Acropolis, lots of very reasonably priced restaurants and the metro. Staff very helpful. Nice pool for relaxing by when the sun just gets too hot for sightseeing! Ask for a room with a view over the Acropolis when booking. Wonderful.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. Couple and teenager in one roomClean, comfortable hotel. 5 minutes walk to Acropolis hill. 10 minute walk to Plaka area for lovely restaurantsNice breakfast. Staff very helpful The room was quite small bit adequate for 2 nights stay
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at the start of our Greece trip and then again on our last night in Greece. The rooms are modern but not large but were sufficient for our short stay, however, I must say one room we had the shower and toilet/sink all open. I did not like this at all. The bathroom floor and toilet would get soaked whenever someone showered and the lighting was very dim .... difficult to groom yourself . The hotel is nice and clean with pleasant staff. The breakfast was good and we enjoyed the view from the terrace on our first night in Greece. The location is very good ... short walking to Acropolis and Plaka. Agree with another reviewer saying the taxi drivers do not know where the hotel is but they all found the directions on google maps.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Modern boutique hotel, friendly staff.We stayed for 3 nights this week and was so central. 5 minute flat walk to the Acropolis, turn left it tight and end up in the new or old Plaka restaurant / shopping markets. 15 minute walk to the Parliameng house where the guards change over on the hour, then turn around and be in the hustle and bustle of Athens central shopping!Taxi from airport was 38 Euros. Tip - taxis only take cash.We then hit a taxi at the end of our stay to the port for a ferry which was 20 Euro.Hotel is very clean, secure they have 24 your manned reception, and buffet breakfast is reasonable.Would recommend to stay here if Athens is your main reason for ring here!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked the hotel, as the service was nice, the rooms clean, and it had a pool and balconies. The location is a bit difficult to communicate. No taxi drivers recognized the name or address, but showing the location on Google Maps ended up working well. They also advertise laundry services for 10 euros, but each day I inquired, they had no availability. My room had two twin beds pushed together to make a full/queen, but they were not super plush. The bathroom was clean, modern, and had a glass shower. The hotel is an easy walk to restaurants, cafes, and obviously the Acropolis, and overall, I would recommend it.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent one night in Athens on our way home from Santorini and this was the perfect stay! It is a great location - a short walk to the Acropolis and many restaurants and cafes. The room was small, but that really didn't matter to us as we spent very little time there. It was super clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They held our bags for us for the afternoon after we checked out so that we could go out exploring before we had to leave for the airport. They also arranged a taxi for us to be picked up which was super nice. The Acropolis view from the shared patio space was great! Such a lovely place. We would definitely recommend the Acropolis Hill - it was affordable, clean and just what we needed for one night in Athens!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at Acropolis Hill Hotel. Well located with friendly staff. Rooms vary in size but are comfortable. Buffet breakfast is great. At a good price point the hotel represents value and is worth considering.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Minutes away from the Acropolis and Parthenon. Pláka is about a 10-15 minute walk away. The room we had was small but clean. But there were adjacent rooms that provided more space. No gym but the pool was very nice. Breakfast started at 7 and had a good selection. A small selection is available in the early morning hours for those leaving early for flights or tours. Hotel staff was courteous and had plenty of information about the area.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable. Appears to have been renovated recently. Located on flank of Filopappos Hill adjacent to the Acropolis; has outside balcony with view of the Parthenon, or on opposite side of building a large terrace/patio with view of the city.
