Large lobby with lounge area and bar. Pleasant, helpful staff. Excellent buffet breakfast. Good neighborhood of cafes and shops in short walking distance (downhill). Walkable to Acropolis Museum, the interesting neighborhood on east flank of Acropolis, and the Parthenon. Day trip to Delphi, with guide, can be arranged by hotel.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location for the Acropolis, less good for the rest of tourist Athens, but it's close to the metro so that shouldn't matter too much. The air conditioning unfortunately allows the noise of adjacent plumbing into the rooms. Breakfast was good, although the cooked options were a bit sparse.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is simply not worth the £150 per night that they charge. The bedroom was OK but small and was not cleaned after the first night. The "private balcony" is standing room only. The public areas are run down and tired with stained carpets. The pool is small and sandwiched between tall buildings -- the hotel photographs avoid showing that. There is no atmosphere; it doesn't even have a real bar with a relaxed seating area and the sun terrace has just three metal tables with chairs, no loungers and no shade. No one would want to sit up there , despite the good view of the Acropolis. I'm sure the place makes lots of money for the woners but it's a rip-off for the traveller.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is up a relatively steep hill but close to the Acropolis with a wonderful view of the Acropolis which makes it a choice location and in a residential area away from the main hustle and bustle of downtown Athens. Room was small with the bathroom separated from the bedroom with an ill fitting glass door but immaculately clean. Would recommend asking for a room on a high floor and overlooking the Acropolis. Continental breakfast was excellent.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I travel a lot but I’ve rarely seen so much dirt on the room floor as it was in this hotel. Think nobody cleand it up in weeks. Also if you have the room on the street there will be lots of noise. Never again.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and clean hotel. Perfect for us! Location is in the center between metro stations Acropolis and Siggrou Fix. We preferred to walk from Acropolis metro station because of the beautiful road with view to the acropolis and it's slight slope (less steep) to the hotel. The hotel materials and finishing feel luxious and the shower was comfortable. Our room was on the road side but the road is not noisy, and we could see the acropolis hill. Cleaning was good. People at the reception were very helpful and the reservation lady as well when we booked! We definitely will come back to this hotel when we visit Athens again.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel room is nice with really lovely toiletries. The breakfast was nice with really yummy spinach pastries. However, it was the same items everyday so could do with variety. The reception staff were very helpful especially Haris.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a fantastic location. Minutes away from the Parthenon and other top attractions. Clean rooms and fantastic staff( special thanks to Haris for all his help with directions and recommendations of places to eat). I stayed in room 508 which had beautiful panoramic views of the city. Good breakfast with a variety of hot and cold options to choose from ( the freshly baked Apple cake is a MUST try!).
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was part of a package so wasn't expecting much but pleasantly surprised Room was fab enough space for two with s cute little balcony Bed was awesome and probably the best sleep ever in a hotelBreakfast was a let down which is why it doesn't get 5 ratingOverall if visiting Athens again would consider staying here
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Acropolis Hill Hotel Athens next to Syngrou-Fix station on the Metro's red line is an exceptionally good in the form of comfort, style and stay.The hotel is located on Mouson Street up the hill from Syngrou Fix station. Once you arrive at station (Metro card €9 for 5 days plus €10 for the airport transfer via Syntagma Square) you'll walk up Drakou towards and turn right up the steps of Mark. Mpotsari and turn right onto Mouson Street (take a breath) and you'll be greeted by the front automated doors of the hotel reception areaThe reception staff were professional, always with a smile and always there to help and support with queries and questions - for that, I cannot thank them enough. I stayed in room 601 on the top floor and a lovely view of the Parthenon on the Acropolis - wow what a view! On the 6th and 5th floor are patios with ample space to bathe in the sun and admire the Acropolis Hill in comfort.You are a mere 5 to 10 minute walk to the Parthenon from the hotel. Once you're out of the main entrance of the hotel, turn right and walk along the road and around the left turn towards the Acropolis Hill. You'll be greeted with the parking lot where buses and coaches drop touristsoff for the Parthenon. Here, you can navigate to the north and south gates of the Acropolis. I would advise that you get to the ticket booth of the Parthenon around 7.45am during the off season November to March at €10 reduced entry price. I had 45 minutes on the Acropolis plateau where the Parthenon sits. The Vista is epic!Back to the room and stay at the hotel. The room was suitably large with storage and safe with a refrigerator. The AC works very well! The balcony is a good size and an amazing view of the Parthenon and at night, just see!The bathroom is small but we'll equipped. A walk-in shower is good. The bed was adequate, but can be better. The bedside cabinets are well placed with sockets and lights for your devices.I had breakfast included with my stay. The continental set up is great! The associates setting up the food and beverages are excellent. The food was of good quality and plentiful. You're faced with a view of the hotels swimming pool. The lay out is spacious, but gets busy between 8am and.9am. I had breakfast at 7am. I believe breakfast is served from 6am, but do check with reception.I will definitely stay here again as access to sites are within walking distance. You can walk to Thissio within 20 minutes and Syntagma Square within 20 to 30 minutes. There are buses and.trams nearby, but I didn't try these modes of transport.Do stay here.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room has the view of Acropolis and the bed is sooo comfortable! We slept good during our 2 night stay and although our room is facing the main road it wasn’t loud and didn’t hear any noise. Very close to everything and the view of Acropolis at night is amazing! The ladies at the front desk are very friendly and spoke good English! Will definitely recommend this place!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival the warm, friendly reception you get here is amazing. All reception staff were helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. The room was lovely with a beautiful view. The rooftop terrace amazing. The breakfast also amazing!! Swimming pool, not in February, it would be nice in the height of summer to cool off though. Great location too :)
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great surprise this place was, do close to the main locations on Athens.Walking distance to the Acropolis, the Acropolis museum, Plaka and do much more.Beautiful rooftop terrace with perfect view is the Acropolis.Hotel is clean, modern, very friendly and definitely worth staying here.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location for visiting the main historical sites. A great choice of restaurants in walking distance in the Plaka and Psirri districts. Our room (601) was narrow and modern. Bathroom and shower excellent. Very good buffet breakfast. Staff very helpful.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a super hotel in an excellent location and fantastic value too. Our bedroom 408 was so quiet you could sleep with the door to the balcony wide open and there was no noise at night. Small bedroom and bathroom but very clean and very comfy bed. Efficient free wifi. Breakfast included in the rate and is really good. The pool looked very clean and is about 12 meters long I guess, had it been a bit warmer (it's unheated) I would have used it! Lovely staff. Altogether a great option, I would recommend it highly.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A small hotel but very clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly, and the breakfast is good. The hotel is literally 5 min walk from Acropolis and is located on a quite road. The best thing about this hotel was that our balcony had a view of acropolis, and a roof terrace. The roof terrace has an amazing view of the Acropolis and the city. It was a perfect place to chill with a glass of wine after a day out. I would be happy to stay there again.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great clean place to escape the Athens sun. The location was great if you are in shape to walk up the hill. It is next to a park with great views of the Parthenon which can also be seen from the roof. Down the hill, it is an easy walk to the subway (to the airport). There is also a great breakfast here (the photo I took was just one plate and does not do it justice).
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Few minutes walk to Acropolis with restaurants around the corner. Decent breakfast right next top pool, which is very refreshing pool when super hot. Also outside patio with tables overlooking the city and Acropolis. Careful with room choice as lower one seemed to smell. It we asked to switch and higher floor were better with a view.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is phenomenal, it is tucked into a residential area just a short walk from major attractions and restaurants. The breakfast is plentiful and in our experience the room was pretty quiet. The balcony was too small to be of use, but it is likely you'll be out catching the sights most of the time anyway.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little boutique hotel, spacious room and modern bathroom and good value. Swimming pool is a nice and unexpected treat too. Its a bit of a walk to the city's attractions and transport but if you like an unassuming hotel with great service and facilities this hotel fits the bill. Great little bars and restaurants about 15 mins walk away, another 10 mins and you're at the new Acropolis Museum, Hardrians Arch and Temple of Zeus.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Caught this offer very last-minute. The hotel is located in a great surrounding which makes it quite convenient to transportation, lunch spots or just a stroll nearby. Well the ladders to climb when carrying luggages might be a point to concern. By the way very helpful staffs are here.
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a really enjoyable stay in the Acropolis Hill Hotel. It started with a really warm welcome from Haris on the evening we arrived. He helped us to get a room on the front of the hotel with a balcony that had a fantastic view of the Acropolis Hill and the Pantheon in one direction and the sea in the other direction. We could not have asked more from the wonderful team in the hotel, great service and they made us feel really valued when ever me made a request. Our room was clean, luxurious and the bed was really comfortable. The roof terrace has an amazing view of Athens. The breakfast was delicious and there was an excellent range of items to give us a great start to some long and memorable days in Athens. We loved our stay in Greece, Athens and the Acropolis Hill Hotel, the Greek people were lovely and we can't wait to return to this hotel. Thank you!
hotelName:
31    Acropolis Hill Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
